items.title: DELAY but no repay Avanti West Coast trains
items.review_text:
I missed the 14.25 Avanti West Coast train from Oxenholme to London (on 15thApril2024) by 2 minutes because of a serious road accident and traffic pile up on the rout to Oxenholme. 
Fortunately there was another train due at 15.25 so I could still make it back to London in time for my musical performance in London.
As my ticket was an advance one with specific train marked I had to purchase another ticket which cost more then the return tickets I had previously purchased,
The 15.25 train was delayed by 38 -40 minutes and then further delayed en route to London and did not get to London until 19.15 (more than an hour after scheduled  journey time. .I missed my performance start time arriving at the venue 45minutes late.
I was informed that I could get a repayment because of delay but have just now given up trying to get a code to register on the designated  Avanti website.It seems like it is not possible to register as described.

items.title: I am a 70 year old lady who had to sit…
items.review_text: I am a 70 year old lady who had to sit on the floor near a foul smelling toilet on my journey to Wigan from Euston as there were no seats available. For this privalage I was charged over £50 one way. I have complained to Aventi West Coast but I am very unhappy with their response which was basically tough cookie

items.title: Pathetic service, no care for customers
items.review_text:
Paid £128 fare for Coventry to Euston (return). The return ticket was for 19.10 today "advance single" journey. I was done with my work early, so asked if I could board 18.10 - firmly denied and asked to wait an hour for 19.10. 
Boarding for 19.10 kept getting delayed till finally cancelled at 19.30. Only to be told to board the next train at 19.40, seat reservation no longer valid. So, my question is if boarding earlier train (like for like) wasn't allowed, how come later train is okay? No respect for customer's time? Pathetic service!

items.title: Miserable stranding trip from a miserably degraded company.
items.review_text:
Broken down train with safety issues. London to Edinburgh. Pushed the time out again and again but did not commit to saying further connections would be missed. 
Poor comms. Unsecured Wi-Fi. Window seals broken and rattling. 
Little or no staff representation in person during the 6+ hour trip - had to ask for info. Bit of attitude when asking them questions about procedure when they inevitably strand me. Their trains are faulty and move at a snails pace and wait for a ridiculous amount of time in every station. A miserable trip from a miserable company. Privatise them or just liquidate their business. Garbage.

items.title: Reserved Seat and WiFi problems.
items.review_text:
Reserved a seat from Telford to London Euston. Only needed to go as far as Birmingham. Luckily today the seat was empty, maybe it due to being around 7am, but usually occupied. None of the digital displays above the seat were switched on though, nor any cards put out for reserved seats, it maybe early morning commute but you still get these problems of seats being taken, especially window and table seats. I don't blame the staff on the train, blame the company as a whole.

The WiFi which they boast is excellent and free was terrible and free. Signed up, connected and nothing worked, constant loading and whirring. It may work at other times of the day, but on a morning train full of people using laptops, phones and other comms devices, it was just permanently loading, had to resort to using Web when near a built up area or pulled in a station, draft something offline and save then send in a short window when connected to my own 4G. Luckily I have an unlimited amount, but for some on limited GB of dated, it must be awful!

I didn't see any staff present, again I don't blame them, probably got 1 poor person having to try and get up and down a train and deal with the doors too.

Next week I am getting the Mega Bus to Bristol from the West Mids, under £10 to get there and under again to get back, think it's around £16 return, no stops, so like a train, if I wanted to get the train, it was avanti for the first quarter, it was the cost of the whole journey for the first leg! with multiple stops.

Rail is bad and this company is falling behind, their only saving grace? They are better than Arriva who had the line beforehand!

items.title: Travelling from Edinburgh Waverley to…
items.review_text: Travelling from Edinburgh Waverley to Birmingham New Street. The staff were wonderful, very considerate. A special mention to Stuart and Meena who were absolutely fantastic. Very friendly, helpful and chatty which put the cherry on top of an already great day. They really are a credit to the team! Simply thank you :)

items.title: Although the train ran a bit late
items.review_text:
Although the train ran a bit late, can I just thank to the team and all passengers that helped my wife when she fell ill half way home,
It restored my faith in humanity.!

items.title: Nationalisation of trains must happen
items.review_text: Pathetic service, in fact non existent service. No trains running when I need to travel as they have been cancelled. Booked tickets now worthless. They know there is a current issue about to happen but they don't try and minimise the disruption to their customers. NOT FIT FOR PURPOSE.

items.title: Even goods trains reaches on time.
items.review_text: The worst train company ever in the UK with all delays and cancellations. Today my train got delayed like 30 min and It never comes on time and not at all a reliable option. When u idiot guys can't provide better service then u guys are not supposed to do strikes. You guys always make the passenger journey so miserable. And your stupid tickets are high than any other company without any service. Even goods trains reach on time to destination.

items.title: Awful experience
items.review_text:
Avanti West coast cancelled the 9:37 train from Nuneaton two hours before it was supposed to leave the midlands, apparently this was due to more trains than normal requiring repair. This meant I could not get to a lunch date in time in London. 
Avanti West coast not only let me down by not running the train, I also lost the non refundable £110 I paid for the pre booked meal.

items.title: Appalling service from an appalling…
items.review_text:
Appalling service from an appalling company, not only do they cancel and delay most of their services for 'shortage of staff' or no driver !!!!!!!!

I booked a peak time ticket, the connection was delayed so was missed, asked on of their staff if I was ok to travel still, said yes. GOt on the train from Crewe to London, was checked by a rude inspector who said my ticket was invalid and was charged another £142 for a single - yes £142 from Crewe to London. When I started to ask for assistance the response 'Not my Problem, pay or you can get off and be met with Police'

I paid £111 for a return ticket in the beginning, would have been cheaper to fly via Barcelona than travel 3 hours by train. Raised the issue with them online, was told the same thing, 'its my fault'

Shocking, avoid this company at all costs and try and travel via other means. I have never complained about a company as most of the time I cannot be bothered but these people are awful and they do not deserve to be in charge of a company

items.title: Useless doesn’t even come close…
items.review_text: I’m writing this review to channel my anger. I can’t believe I have to give Avanti even one star, they really don’t deserve it. In six months not one single train I’ve travelled on between Norfolk, London or Lancaster has ever been on time. Most have been cancelled last minute leaving me stranded at night in places I’m not familiar with. Do Avanti care? Of course they don’t…

items.title: Animals are transported in better conditions...
items.review_text: As others have said I would give no stars if it was an option. Journey between Preston and London delayed by about two hours. Trains were being cancelled and so the service was stupidly crowded. I will be applying for the derisory compensation, would prefer the trains ran on time.

items.title: This is the worst train company I have…
items.review_text: This is the worst train company I have ever travelled with. Cancellations and delays are normal and each single time I travelled with them I had a minimum of 2 hours delay. It’s disgusting as they don’t care of people’s time. Also, communication about delays and arrival time is non existing making you feel trapped into your journey.

items.title: Chris !!!!!!!!
items.review_text: Chris is an amazing man who helped me walk my dog through the carriages of the train for me amazing service 5 star ***** and id like to thank Josh for first helping onto the train with my bags and suitcase as u couldnt carry both outstanding staff JOSH !!!!!! AND SERVICE THROUGHOUT THE TRAINN!!!!!!

items.title: £250 to stand like sardines in a tin…
items.review_text: £250 to stand like sardines in a tin for 2 hours and be an hour late. I’m disabled and stood up in pain for hours without a seat or room to move. 8 people in a vestibule and train packed all the way down the aisle's. I quit my last job because the commute was consistently terrible and untenable. The service keeps getting worse and somehow even more expensive.

items.title: Sardines have more space in a tin than…
items.review_text:
Sardines have more space in a tin than Avanti passengers, paying an arm and a leg for appalling service, delays, cancellations, computer glitches and insufficient capacity on their trains. 
Highly recommend talking to your local ticket desk for better and more affordable options. I did! Good luck and time to say goodbye to Avanti rip-off

items.title: Cattle Trains For People - Crammed in No Charging Points or Tables.
items.review_text: It has been a while since I traveled by train to London and I remembered why I drive! This is the first time by Avanti. OMG what a shock! The trains are crammed with  uncomfortable, narrow seats with little leg room. The one I had did not have a window save for a tiny portion of the one in front. I had a backward facing seat which makes me nauseous and no view. There are no charge points, no tables, the flip up was too small for a laptop. The train was smelly, particularly near the loos and the smell permeated the entire train carriage. This is the national trainline and why this contract was given to Avanti is a mystery unless it is corruption in government as one review suggests. This train 'service' represents the UK. Imagine the impression it gives to visitors to the UK? It's like a third world travel experience! Bring back Virgin Trains please.

items.title: Give me all my money back and a proper service
items.review_text: Why? Why? Every time I travel on Avanti the trains are delayed or cancelled. Live in Chester. Commute to London. Invariably delayed and like today, spend hours at Crewe, stuck. I wish their MD had to travel this line. Absolutely fed up up with cancellations and delays. Clearly Avanti think we are a third world economy and it’s all ok. I want all my money back!!!

items.title: Welcome to the world of Avanti
items.review_text:
Welcome to the world of Avanti – Britain’s worst performing train operator! The worst element of yet another formerly iconic British institution now gone to the dogs, thanks to greed, inefficiency and incompetence. No interest whatsoever in providing a decent, well-managed service for the public, and utterly clueless about customer relations. With 83% of Trustpilot ratings being one star, and not a single comment from the company in response, as far as I can see  – that tells us everything we want to know about this outfit. The owners living in far off parts of Scotland and Italy, with the gall to call themselves FirstGroup and Trenitalia! They should hang their heads in shame, and lose their contract as a so-called train operator. However, in fact, their contract has even been extended.

My gripe, though, on this occasion is not with the trains themselves, but their refund procedure. I know it wasn’t their fault that we never actually had the pleasure of using their trains. We booked online tickets from North Wales to London and back for the Easter week. Then the nasty unions declared yet another strike, so we couldn’t travel by train. Getting a full refund for the outward journey on Friday from Trainline was simple and efficient. However, the return trip on Sunday had been booked through Avanti’s own website, which decreed that I should be charged £10 per ticket for requesting refunds – a nice little extra money-maker for Avanti for doing absolutely nothing. It may be true that Sunday was not actually a strike day (Friday, Saturday and Monday were, so we knew Sunday would be disrupted, too, as last year), but if we were not able to go on the outward journey, how could we be expected to travel on the return journey, and why should we have to pay any fee at all for requesting a refund for the return journey?  Naturally, there was no place on the Avanti online refund service to allow us to explain this. Then, to rub it in, several days later (when I had already received my partial refund) I got another email to remind me of my upcoming journey! And then, after the day of the intended journey, yet another email asked me to rate my experience of the journey – but with no box in which to write any comment! Totally idiotic, totally inefficient, totally unfit for purpose.

items.title: 1st class Connor (book ref 10468083)
items.review_text: Personal customer service today to agree a refund as we were no longer able to travel due to our friends receiving a 5 x cancer diagnosis. Original contact was 14 March and for those previous touch points I was disappointed, very much process before customer. It would have been better to have it solved at first touch there and then, but today with Connor who delivered no fuss help today was first class. Thank you Connor real moment of truth for treating customers with care when needed (book ref 10468083)

items.title: Cancelled cancelled cancelled!
items.review_text: Booked 6:33am Easton to Liverpool - cancelled, waited for next one-also cancelled. Had to get Packed Manchester train to Crewe and then Liverpool. No seats on Manchester train so stood the whole way along with other elderly women. Coming back 2 Days later train full again, no seats, toilet floor full of excrement that had obviously been there a long time. Can’t rely on booking seats anymore as they usually remove all the bookings, it’s very scary experience for vulnerable people of parents with children. When is the government going to do something about it?  Virgin were 100 times better than this.

items.title: Poor service
items.review_text:
Poor service , expensive ticket , no wifi , suddenly delayed or cancelled 

Worst train company ever.   Virgin trains were much better

items.title: Once again train delayed dreadful…
items.review_text: Once again train delayed dreadful service. 90% of my journeys have been delayed. Over the last 2 years think I'll stick to driving

items.title: Train Manager Tom is the man !
items.review_text: First ever trip on Avanti Westcoast - this was from Preston to Motherwell. Comfortable seating although I wish I had been able to select my own seat and see preassigned seats. Great legroom but the tilting Pendolino made me and other passengers feel sick. Not happy to see pets onboard. My 5 Stars go exclusively to Train Manager Tom who was polite,professional,well groomed,friendly and exceptionally courteous. I hope I have him every time I travel with AWC Trains !

items.title: Power sockets, seats, free coaches
items.review_text: OK seats, happy about free coaches with available seats, was going to put 4 stars until the power sockets didnt work

items.title: If I could do 0 stars I would
items.review_text: If I could do 0 stars I would! They are rude and inconsiderate. If you seem like an inconvenience to them they will just charge you with money. There have been many times when I have missed my change because they would not let me through despite having the ticket. There have been many times when I had to get a later train because the one before was cancelled therefore had to pay further cost for the one I had to get instead and would not allow a refund. The tickets are overpriced, the train is dirty, there are so many delays and cancellations and the customer service is appalling. There have been multiple times where I have actually been shouted at rather than politely talking as well as being interrupted with “that’s £18 please” constantly as I was trying to understand why I had to pay a further cost despite already paying for a ticket and would not allow me to use my railcard?? If I could never get this train service again I would!

items.title: Day In The Life of a Train Mis-manager
items.review_text: Four reserved seats Birmingham NS - Stafford. On boarding our seats were occupied and the occupants advised us that all reservations had been cancelled due to service disruption. In previous similar situations the Train Manager cancelled the reservation displays throughout the train however the reservations were still clearly showing throughout the train and there was no announcement from the train manager throughout the journey even though passengers who boarded prior to Birmingham were clearly aware of the problem.

items.title: Corrupt government is why we must suffer Avanti
items.review_text: Avanti west coast train cancelled at Haymarket due to strikes on journey to England. Return journey train from Warrington to Haymarket train cancelled but no idea why. The only reason Avanti has a contract is, in my opinion, due to someone in government who is corrupt and getting a handsome backhander. Use the train save the environment say the adverts well maybe someone needs to do their homework and find out why plenty of people don't use the trains. You cannot rely on an Avanti train to get you anywhere. Use the car or bus or bike or walk anything but an Avanti train.

items.title: The worst train company ever to run our…
items.review_text: The worst train company ever to run our UK railways. An utter disgrace and the fact the government awarded them another 9 year contract makes them equally incompetent.

items.title: How this outfit are still in post is…
items.review_text:
How this outfit are still in post is one of the great mysteries in life. 

Cancellations with no notice,  shortage of train crew, sour faced staff and dirty overcrowded carriages. 

Utterly shambolic service from top to bottom.

items.title: Upgraded on train to Premium economy…
items.review_text:
Upgraded on train to Premium economy outward and return journey as not able to pre book…even though an email was sent offering as such, what’s all that about?
Only to find no WiFi available on outward journey and no power sockets on return!!
Left wondering what I actually paid, apart from a bigger seat?

items.title: Had to give a star and that one is…
items.review_text: Had to give a star and that one is undeserved. Not my first journey with them either,as usual disgraceful.

items.title: I spend just as much time claiming…
items.review_text: I spend just as much time claiming money back through delay repay as i do booking tickets, trains rarely on time, over priced, easter train tickets from bham to london been raised £30 per ticket with the added bonus of track works been scheduled. Really dont know how they are still operating

items.title: From Chorley to London Euston
items.review_text:
From Chorley to London Euston, they were 2, 1 at 15:01/15:15 which apparently there is a difference, I have asked in Chorley and been told I can take any of them with my ticket. 
They once in an officer was checking tickets then informed that I must pay an excess fee of £7.60 because I took the wrong one, I’ve explained that it’s not what I was told, he didn’t give a shi… and said that I must pay now or go back then be charged £120, I’ve paid the £7.60 but it hurt me a lot to he ignored that way! And it wasn’t about money but principles. If I’ll have a chance I’d never take trains with Avanti West Coast even if it will cost me double!

items.title: 1st class Glasgow to Manchester
items.review_text:
I boarded the 530am from Glasgow central to Manchester and wasn’t holding my breath. The last experience from Birmingham New Street to Central was late and the platform announcements had everyone running from pillar to post like headless chickens. This time it ran like a precision clock. 

I travelled 1st class - same as before- but what a different experience. What really made it was the staff. Breakfast had a great choice and I was even given the opportunity of having a freshly fried egg, scrambled or poached. I couldn’t believe my ears I went for the fried, and it was perfect. The train manager made sure that my connection at Preston was on time and checked out the platform to leave on and offered alternatives in case it was late. It was not. I got to Manchester in time for work and was rested and ready to go.

items.title: Such a disgusting service!!!
items.review_text:
Such a disgusting service!!!

The lady on this train (7.17 am from Birmingham to London) seems being held captured within last 2 decades without giving her a chance to talk.

She nearly didn't stop mumbling over the system! So annoying!

items.title: Could government take some action…
items.review_text: Could government take some action against this train company please. Booked ticket from Crewe to London morning 6:32 train cancelled so thought of going in 6:55 train cancelled. This company is not fit purpose, bring back virgin

items.title: No complaints here!
items.review_text:
Despite all the negative reviews on here, I have to say that I travelled with Avanti West Coast yesterday; I am not a frequent train user so had no idea what to expect.
All I can say from my experience was that the trains were on time, clean, comfortable. The staff I had interactions with were pleasant and polite. The fare I paid was very reasonable.
I was a happy traveller!
No complaints here.

items.title: Rip-off company that doesn't care for customers
items.review_text: Travelled to London on Saturday 24 Feb but even before I had my breakfast received a message saying my return train had been cancelled. I made alternative arrangements for the return journey (at my own cost) and then sought a refund from Avanti - guess what? They won't pay due to "insufficient information". I had already given them the ticket details (including a scanned copy of the ticket). They can easily check the train timetable to see that it didn't run. Absolute fraudulent rip-off

items.title: Expensive and awful wifi for a four…
items.review_text: Expensive and awful wifi for a four hour trip.

items.title: Train cancelled, denied boarding earlier train on return
items.review_text: My train to London Euston was cancelled this morning with no advance warning and only found out when I arrived at the station in Warrington. Had to wait an hour for the next one. When returning from London Euston this afternoon I arrived 1 hour early as my last meeting was cancelled and was hoping to get home my family early, I was told by the staff checking tickets that I can't board an earlier train even though it wasn't full and it was off-peak at 2.30pm instead of my scheduled 3.30pm ticket and I was refused entry. If this is what Avanti consider good customer service I think you better think again! Of course they have a monopoly on the train services on the west coast so I've no other option than to travel on their rubbish services that are nearly always late!

items.title: smelly
items.review_text: Expensive ticket, carriage with toilet smells of poo, other carriages smell of wee, no wifi, no plug sockets, carriges aren't properly cleaned and there is graffiti all over the windows

items.title: Totally unreliable
items.review_text: Totally unreliable. Train from London tomorrow cancelled at short notice - again!!! Travel to London once a year and same thing happened last year. Now lost seat bookings and will have to scramble for seats on next available train. Why do we put up with this shambles of a company!!! Bring back Virgin.

items.title: Avanti Cancelled my train and refused refund
items.review_text: Bought a ridiculously priced single to London, Avanti cancelled the train and then told me that my ticket was non transferable and non refundable - how is that fair or legal!  So I didn't get to London and paid £74 for the the privilege!

items.title: Avanti - usual rubbish
items.review_text: Avanti - my god how this service has gone utterly rubbish. It used to be a pleasure to travel 1st class with Virgin. Cheerful staff, clean and comfy trains that were always on time, reasonable fares. How did we get here ? the government should hang their head in shame at the utter contempt that passengers are treated. I am just shouting in the air here as no one who matters cares. Crap, bring back Virgin

items.title: If your planning going from…
items.review_text: If your planning going from anywhere in the north to anywhere in the south, just drive or arrange alternative transport. On the journey to Manchester we had to transfer and experience massive over booking with no seats. On the return journey, we had to get a rail replacement service from a bus on a Saturday, but only for part of the journey, we then had to arrange a private service to finish the journey as avanti was incapable. The Train service has unfortunately gone quite downhill in the last few years. Unless you don't mind being 2 hrs late in short!

items.title: Won't payout for their delay
items.review_text:
The Avanti train was delayed for over an hour on the final part of my husband's journey, from London to Warrington. They keep refusing the delay repay claim and I'm having to appeal.
Awful! Just accept the liability lies with you and repay what you are due to.

items.title: another appalling journey on Avanti…
items.review_text: another appalling journey on Avanti last night getting back to London from Birmingham International - Both the 18.33 we were booked on and then 19.33 Train from Birmingham International were cancelled. Arrived back late. They are being paid shedloads by the tax payer and were awarded an extended contact last year so that they can now offer us years more appalling and unreliable service.  How do they get away with it !

items.title: Club Avanti
items.review_text: A big shout out to Rabiah, who works within the Club Avanti department. Rabiah has consistently delivered outstanding customer service, her response times are very efficient indeed. Well played Rabiah & my thanks again. All the best, Jim.

items.title: Excellent service on Glasgow to London trip
items.review_text: Travelled from Glasgow central to London Euston on 23rd Feb. We found the staff to be helpful and friendly. Especially Janice who advised us on upgrading to Standard Premium which we did at a cost of £30 each.  Very comfortable and spacious seats. Will definitely chose that option again. Can't fault  our experience.

items.title: Just travelled on Avanti West Coast…
items.review_text: Just travelled on Avanti West Coast between Preston and Stafford, in the first class. Very impressed by your catering staff member Ryan. He greeted me at the door, hurried to whisk away a used coffee cup from a previous occupant before I sat down, quickly offered me a hot drink and snack. When I finished my drink he asked if I wanted a refill. He was friendly, attentive and polite. He is only a young man so I imagine not very experienced. He has obviously taken his training on board.

items.title: saved me a fortune on fuel and got there faster than I could drive!
items.review_text:
I travelled to Warrington on an Avanti train yesterday morning. It was the first time travelling by train in about 20 years! I bought my ticket the previous afternoon for £24 one way. Unbelievable value. The train was on time, clean, comfortable and punctual, and the staff were friendly.
I only ever read the trains nowadays are crap, which, if you're a commuter, might be valid, but my experience today was excellent, and you saved me a fortune on fuel and got there faster than I could drive!
Well done 👌

items.title: I’ve used trains all over the world
items.review_text: I’ve used trains all over the world, from the UK, Italy, Mexico and Argentina - and without any exaggeration Avanti is the most utterly shambolic train company I’ve ever experienced. I really am unable to express in words the depths of incompetence this company displays on a daily basis. Just utterly unreliable, overcrowded, aggressive staff, facilities that rarely work, Wi-Fi that is practically unusable, and excessively overpriced. Buying a horse would be more reliable and quicker than this shambles. It is staggering that a horse, basically a medieval system of transport, is better than Avanti. The company needs to be shut down.

items.title: All trains cancelled after 10pm as standard
items.review_text:
Cancelled multiple trains so that anyone going from Birmingham Airport or the NEC after 10pm on a 15k gig night were stuck at the train station.

They don't care. This is what happens when you privatise public services.

items.title: Crammed like cattle | lazy sods
items.review_text:
We’re absolutely rammed in like cattle. Not at all humane. Two major inter-city trains cancelled so 3>1 train. Excuse: lack of available staff. 

If I could get to Euston for the scheduled train why couldn’t they?

Incompetent management, lack of any care, or/ lazy workshy staff. 

Usual “if I could give zero I would”.

items.title: Overpriced, overheated, rammed. Starting with the bottle neck to get on…
items.review_text: Starting with the bottle neck to get on at Euston, staff turning away those who had the wrong type of tickets even though it was a physical impossibility. My seat reservation? Forget it - couldn't even get on the carriage. Standing in an overheated compartment with no plugs in sight, Internet that doesn't work sweating like a shallot and probably smelling like I've been dead for 2 weeks. I wouldn't bother writing a review except every time I've got avanti it has been like this, and I live in the southeast - the bar isn't exactly high - as i write a lady had just fainted. And the price!!!

items.title: Appalling Customer Service
items.review_text:
This company's customer service is some of the worst I've experienced.  It seems that buying a first class ticket doesn't warrant anymore than lip service to the experience.
1) the food and beverage selection is dreadful, and that is if they have enough of it on the train in the first place.  And the old adage of a cheap wine being like paint stripper is true in this case, the stuff they serve is dreadful.
2) Don't try and change the time of your ticket, that apparently is too much for them.  It's okay though to buy new tickets without getting a refund.  This by the way to move the time from 3pm to an earlier midday train.  I know from experience that the train will not be anywhere near full.  One could speculate that their arcane rules around tickets is merely to coerce more cash out of people's changing circumstances.
What can I say "Avanti West Coast - the company that makes you want to go by car"

items.title: Disgusting service Sheffield to London
items.review_text: Disgusting service Sheffield to London. Shoved on a train like cattle. Couldn’t sit in our reserved seats despite the fact my mum is disabled and unable to stand for long periods of time. Asked to get off the train and wait for the next one and a vile member of staff wouldn’t let us get off as it was too much of an inconvenience to get the ramp back out to let us off. Also petrified my baby would get injured as we had to stand cramped up against the doors with people squashing us. Sent a complaint had no reply. Won’t ever use the company again will drive next time so so much for encouraging people to use public transport

items.title: Regular traveller to London ignoring…
items.review_text:
Regular traveller to London ignoring the strikes which is not Avanti fault but national issue.

My issue is the total lack of temperature control on trains and its being going on for at least 6 months.

I caught 1.45 today to Euston and yet again the train was a hot house 27 degrees and no temp controls.

Asked guard told its a fleet issue " they are working on it and there is nothing they can do " 

Water or communication would be good start and update on status of problem ie diagnostic and time line to repair.

I am asthmatic and found journey unbearable almost simply not good enough.

items.title: Consistently Poor
items.review_text: Trains cancelled, subsequent ones late, plug sockets not working, coffee machine not working in onboard shop and can only take cash. Avanti must be good at doing something else because they can’t run trains.

items.title: I  booked as a disabled person to…
items.review_text: I was booked as a disabled person to travel on the 1233 from London Euston to Manchester piccadilly. When l got to Euston Station, the person in the booking hall in Birmingham had told me it was the 1133 but had booked us on put in caragae with no disabled toilet working and the train was moving as l am wheelchair bound the man opend the toilet there was poo and footing wee all over the floor and told me to pee on top it stank .plus when got to Manchester the whole train smells. And then could not find anyone to help me off and no ramp took 29 minutes to get me off will never travel with this train line again nightmare.

items.title: The train looks dirty and tired
items.review_text: The train looks dirty and tired. Dreadful staff who don’t care. Over crowded, people sat on cases in the aisles, causing blockages. No ticket checking so anyone could get on without paying. Over priced Bring back Virgin. Avsnti need to go

items.title: Travelling from Euston to Glasgow
items.review_text:
Travelling from Euston to Glasgow, 8th Feb 2024.
Train delayed by 40 mins. First class ticket. No service train declassified. Not told this until we set off. Apparently first class is complimentary so no compensation due because I had a seat. 5 hours on a packed train, no water nothing, buffet car even out of service for entire journey. So thoroughly miserable journey for £206. £42 refund only for the delay, Because I had a seat. Standard class for the same train was £78 with exactly the same service. Plus a traveller with standard ticket sat with myself and received the same refund of £42.
So if you fancy treating yourself don’t. 
Awful journey for double the price. 
Colleagues treated differently with the same claim. They received a refund of £135 in total.
Flights easier next time I think.

items.title: I was travelling on the 08.40 Euston…
items.review_text:
I was travelling on the 08.40 Euston -Edinburgh service last Monday 19-02-24 . I've never travelled on a Pendolino before & was only on this service as Kings cross was out of service for a few days.
It was only 10 minutes or so into the Journey & the heat in Coach F was unbearable ( Seat 28) I ended up with just my T shirt on &  I  was still very warm.
The heater fan would cut out & 20-30 seconds later it would cut in again. Fortunately I had 2 1litre bottles of water with me but these were gone 2-3 hrs into the journey. I hope this was a fault with the coach  & not standard for a Pendolino.
I was grateful when i got off at Haymarket into the fresh air & even better when I got on the LNER Azuma to finish my journey to Montrose, Much more comfortable & not as stifling !!!
A very poor show AWC.

items.title: Mainly the worst service
items.review_text:
Once again paid a fortune for a ticket and once again train delays. Tried to get a seat but no seats for a 2 hour journey sitting by the toilet. 
Wow what a truly amazing experience.
This is second time in 6 weeks and unfortunately they are the only service from Euston and Manchester. 
Trying to get a refund is pretty much impossible.

items.title: Upped their game recently - tickets still shocking
items.review_text:
Been travelling Crewe to Euston once a week for over a year now on Avanti West Coast.
The First Class service has been garbage , although the staff have always been consistently very good, the food has been appalling in both choice and availability.
They've seemingly upped their game with the  catering and number of crew and the most recent trip was actually quite nice. 
However , it's still diabolically expensive and a flight to a European city is cheaper than a train ticket from Crewe to Euston, which is frankly ridiculous.

items.title: What a shambolic mess this outfit…
items.review_text:
What a shambolic mess this outfit masquerading as a train company is. 
From Euston yesterday afternoon, three trains to the North West cancelled on the bounce...... their excuse this time was 'lack of staff'.... and that's it!!

The management must be embarrassed by their incompetence, mustn't they?
The question is, why did they have their contract extended?

items.title: Totally ignore your request
items.review_text:
Why bother offering people a choice of seating when you totally ignore their request? Asked for a forward facing window seat in a quiet zone. Got a backward facing seat with no window next to a table of 4 children. 
Unbelievable and now I will stick with London Northwestern which is much cheaper and you get to choose where you sit on board..

items.title: Third world service at first world prices
items.review_text: 28 minutes late, power not working at our table, £168 return ticket. 9 cars when there should have been 11. Too crowded to attempto get refreshments. Staff stressed and overrun, reservations abandoned. Carriage boiling. Euston was a frightening crush.  Trains are better in India. British public infrastructure and services after Brexit and 13 years of Conservative rule in a nutshell.

items.title: Worst railway service I have…
items.review_text: Worst railway service I have encountered.  Avanti West Coast first class service is appalling! Didn’t see any staff after boarding the train.  No food or drink offered.  The bathrooms were filthy dirty.  Spoke to Avanti customer service - totally not interested.  Very disappointing.

items.title: I had the misfortune of travelling with…
items.review_text:
I had the misfortune of travelling with Avanti recently from London to Carlisle, but I'm seriously considering walking next time. This is the worst company I've ever had the misfortune of having to deal with.

Just thoroughly unpleasant to travel on and to deal with. Their carriages stink of chemical toilets because the air inlets were designed too close to the toilet waste outlet vent (this is a know fact), so you can quite literally go and do your business and then bask in the glow of its smell (and that of your fellow passenger excrement) for the remainder of your journey. It is not healthy, my wife felt quite ill from the smell. For this privilege, we forked out the best part of £300.

I requested a refund due to strikes, assuming it would be paid without issues. I've since been chasing the repayment for nearly seven months and have been informed 'I've requested the payment too late' because they 'can't find my request on their system'. They now expect me to provide screengrabs as proof of something that happened seven months ago.

items.title: Impressed
items.review_text: I just like to say thank you to Avante West Coast for my recent trip to London. All run exceptionally smoothly the train wasn’t overcrowded it was a really lovely train clean quiet just a wonderful experience thank you.

items.title: Shambles, avoid!
items.review_text: Currently sitting at Euston on a dirty train waiting for a late departure 10 minutes after the scheduled time. This was due to waiting for a driver, who was sauntering down the platform towards the cab with zero urgency after the scheduled departure time. Usually I go out of my way to avoid this company, shambles!

items.title: If possible I wont even put one star
items.review_text: If possible I wont even put one star. The worst ever train service I have seen. Every single time they made me miss my connection train , leaving me stranded for hours. I hate them.

items.title: God I hate this company
items.review_text:
God I hate this company. Virgin Trains were doing fine until the govt decided that they would give consumers the "best value for money" and award the franchise to Avanti. It felt like a lie at the time and true to form the tory scumbags gave the running of the West Coast Train Line to the most incompetent operator they could find and rewarded them for failure when they inevitably f***ed it all up, paying them £17m in 2022 even though they performed worse than any other operator in the UK that year.
NEVER trust a Tory govt again. The sooner we get rid of them and Avanti the better 🤬

items.title: What a shambles
items.review_text:
What a shambles 
Booked first class kitchen not working again
Had try walk through seven coaches for a microwaved sandwich.
Don’t bother booking first class or to be sure just drive
3 trains this year 2 cancelled and now this.
They need to be held to account for not providing a service they charge for!

items.title: Train strikes at the last minute!
items.review_text: Waited months to book travel to London, tickets usually come on sale approx 2-3months in advance . Booked and paid only to be notified two weeks before travel that train strikes are taking place and no direct trains back out of London . Having to rush around to find parking at the last minute ! Surely strikes are planned well in advance not two weeks before! Never had any issues with virgin trains but since they got took over with Avanti west always some issue!!

items.title: Appalling Service
items.review_text: Massively overcrowded journey down to London on Friday night from Preston then delayed massively overcrowded journey back on Sunday. Tried to claim on the Avanti website for the delay which informed me the 10.46 departure on Sunday from Euston to Preston did not exist. Hopeless... they make the reclaim process impossible.

items.title: Stifling hot carriage, no power at the sockets
items.review_text:
Journey out from Euston to Manchester: power didn’t work in the carriage, one of the main reasons I bought a premium ticket so I could work on the way. Spoke to the train manager who said he’d reported it two days earlier and it still hadn’t been fixed. However, kindly offered me a free seat in first class. 

Journey back to London, the carriage was unbearably hot, stifling and like a sauna. Spoke to the train manager and nothing was done about it. Only respite was when we stopped on the way and people got off or on and the doors opened!! 

Come back Virgin Trains, the service was a thousand times better and the crew always happy and helpful.

items.title: Shut it down and fine them
items.review_text: Disgusting,woeful excuse of a train operator. There should be a minus option for reviews,to which extent this pitiful excuse for a company would be given minus A billion. Always late 20+ minutes or cancelled last minute, filthy trains stinking of sewerage. We the public complained about Virgin but they were A* compared to this shambles. I recommended boycotting this company but what’s the point you won’t be able to get on the train anyways as it will be cancelled. Abysmal excuse of an operation.

items.title: Catching the 11.15 Manchester Pucc to…
items.review_text: Catching the 11.15 Manchester Picc to London. Paid £103 for the ticket. No plug sockets in sight. Old Virgin trains had them on every seat. Crowded, dirty and the overhead speakers are ear achingly loud. The female staff member is using every opportunity to get on the mic to chastise the passengers for having bags on seats and is threatening to charge extra for a bag on a seat. It just isn’t a pleasant, relaxing ride. Apparently card machine not working in shop so need to use phone to book online but won’t bother as saving phone battery. The service has severely decreased since a change of operator. Sorry but I would prefer to drive next time.

items.title: Came into London today on an open…
items.review_text:
Came into London today on an open return. Last train back is usually 11pm. 
Arrived by tube to Euston at 8.30pm to find that ALL trains are cancelled going North. 
So we are stranded, likely with thousands of others who travelled for the Rugby. Shame on you. Scumbags.

items.title: No information given to passengers and bad customer service
items.review_text: So the tracks are blocked and therefore there are lots of delays and cancellations. The issue is that no information is given on when the train might leave, how long delays will be, what trains are actually cancelled and so on. Plus, staff can be rude und unprofessional in my experience.

items.title: Wish I could give it Zero stars
items.review_text: Wish I could give it Zero stars. I travel once a month from London Euston to Birmingham New Street since 1999. Regular delays or cancellations. I say bring back Virgin Trains!

items.title: Birmingham - Euston line a disaster
items.review_text: I have to use Avanti for the Birmingham to Euston line regularly. Once upon a time when run by Virgin this was easy and generally pleasant travels. Nowadays, I reckon at least 1 in every 4 journeys are cancelled completely, with several others being delayed. I’ve used delay repay so many times now it’s unbelievable. My saving Grace is that my company expense these, but my word it’s shocking.

items.title: If I could give less than 1 star I…
items.review_text: If I could give less than 1 star I would, trains constantly cancel, can't remember the last time I got to London from Birmingham without it being awful. Why allow people to buy tickets for trains you've got no intention of running. Clearly understaffed and don't care

items.title: I actually have not much words I'm so…
items.review_text: I actually have not much words I'm so frustrated by the constant rubbish of united Kingdom false narrative of never being united. Every train this year I've got on is delay or prior was cancelled. The worst city due to foolish people voting tory are eedioooots happy.? Why are charging me a mad price for the service that n3ver works. Fuc this rubbish

items.title: Poor show at Birmingham new street
items.review_text: Poor show at Birmingham new street, guy giving advice was clueless.. steering to buses that weren’t there  . London Nottwest saves the day

items.title: Travelled from Crewe to Edinburgh
items.review_text:
Travelled from Crewe to Edinburgh, went first class, our pre booked seats were taken so had to split the party up, we had 1 small beer, small plate of cheese and olives with a couple of crackers, no teas and coffees offered and saw no staff for majority of three and a quarter hours. 
I wouldn’t bother booking first class again!!!

items.title: Deserves Zero Stars
items.review_text:
There should be an option to award zero stars because that is what this train operator deserves.
I submitted a Delay/Repay claim for a journey that was 45 minutes late.  Expected arrival time 10:19 in Manchester, actual arrival time 11:00.
Claim was unsuccessful as Avanti stated the train arrived at 10:30.  I think I would know given that I was on the train and subsequently late for a business meeting.
Absolutely appalling customer service!

items.title: I'll be driving next time!
items.review_text: It is nice to travel on the train rather than drive, especially for longer journeys. But when Avanti are able to cancel trains and offer no compensation, not even a refund of the ticket, it is beyond a joke. Especially as they are propped up by tax payers money. This weekend we had: A train cancelled. A train that abandoned us 1.5 hrs from our destination and offered us no refund. And the only train that completed its journey arrived 25 mins late and they're offering £8 in compensation. What a joke.

items.title: Very Poor Customer Service
items.review_text: Had to travel to Walsall on 15th December. Received a text prompt from Avanti stating to go to concourse at 17:51, when I got there, ALL TRAINS WERE CANCELLED. Tried to get to speak to staff, and when I finally did, was rude and unhelpful just told me to go to Paddington and get Chiltern train to Birmingham. I've since logged a delay Repay registration, and it is still in progress. This train service should be offered to a company who have staff committed to good service. In this day and age when companies go brankupt quite easy, I would not be suprpised if this one does. Their rating is so poor

items.title: Train from London Eauston to Preston
items.review_text:
Train from London Eauston to Preston, direct train. I have come into this train by mistake, meant to go to Milton Keynes. I have realized this during the journey that it doesn't stop anywhere. My husband went to ask for advise and we were lucky to speak to Neil who kindly arranged emergency stop for us and another person who also was there by mistake. Neil has helped us a lot while he had to deal woth problematical and rude passanger same time. 
Really good service, Neil is a professional employee who represents the avanti rails very well.

items.title: Bring back Virgin!
items.review_text:
Terrible Service

Since Virgin Trains became Avanti, the prices have shot up and the service has gone down. My main issue is not with the individuals that work there, I'm sure they're doing the best with what they're given, but it's now impossible to speak to someone when you have an issue. 

The AI chat bot is useless and just regurgitates what's on the website, and emails are also just generic templates that take days to get back to you. Absolutely useless when you need help on the day. 

The trains themselves have become extremely overpriced when Virgin used to be somewhat reasonable, and yet you get less for your money. I used to get first class tickets for less than I'm getting standard premium ones and you get nothing with that. 

Also Club Avanti is a good idea, but the execution is awful, only way to access if via the emails in your inbox, no way on the website to view membership and rewards. With emails things can easily get lost so it becomes pointless and not worth even having.

Please bring back real humans to speak to via chat or phone call!!

items.title: AVANTI WORST COAST
items.review_text: Another day ruined by Worst Coast trains. Got the Brum to Glasgow train, only for it to be aborted at Carlisle, citing flooding ahead. No plan B likes bussing us North. Why did they take us this far North when they knew of the problems when we departed the Midlands. Even the train manageress said it was the worst company she had worked for.

items.title: On time
items.review_text:
On time,  clean and tidy. Euston - Liverpool return all went smoothly. 
Three things not so good; firstly there is very little space ( cramped legs for tall people) secondly, very hard uncomfortable seats and thirdly it was extraordinarily hot (which was both uncomfortable and felt unhealthy ,one person actually fainted). Surely it can’t be that hard to regulate the temperature?
Overall much easier than driving , especially after a big night out .

items.title: Seat Reservation- A Joke
items.review_text: My biggest problem with AWC trains is their inability to ensure that people who have reserved their seats get them. In my experience, almost every time, I have to remind the person sitting in my seat that it is reserved. Of-coarse there are folks who would decline to move and Avanti staff wouldn’t help in this situation. This is pure extortion to pay for a seat and then travel standing!

items.title: Complicated and Irritating Purchase
items.review_text:
They could not have made it any more irritating to purchase tickets from them. 

I specified particular times. Avanti randomly selected different times, so I had to redo the search. 

Avanti demanded I login, so I did, and they reset my purchase journey so I had to start from the beginning. 

I finally got to the purchase point, and the only option was e-tickets, which you aren't allowed to print out, so if my phone loses signal or runs out of battery I guess I just have to buy another ticket. 

This is all pretty poor given the extortionate prices they charge.

items.title: Profoundly miserable experience
items.review_text:
Of course, the trains are sickeningly expensive. Today, I hear the train has CCTV in every seat and staff are wearing HD recording body-cams. The announcer cheerfully tells us that an upgrade will be £99.50, and that if we have the wrong ticket to London we will be charged £199.50. And *remember* the Trainline App works differently because it splits fares so we have to make sure this train is going via the right stops, or we will be charged £199.50. Staff wave me on to the wrong train, luckily I spot it and change platforms. Fortunately, my carriage is empty, presumably because the service is unusable, other than by people who have no other option. 

An awful police-state vibe.

items.title: Both legs of a return trip cancelled by Avanti.
items.review_text:
My wife recently made the rail journey from Scotland to Crew and back. On the trip down, the Edinburgh to Crew leg was cancelled by Avanti West Coast. On the way back, the Crew to Edinburgh leg terminated at Preston, also by Avanti West Coast.
This is a trip we make a few times a year. We would much prefer to go by rail rather than drive, but as long as this hopeless company run this line we will regrettably choose to drive.

items.title: I've used Avanti for a few years now
items.review_text: I've used Avanti for a few years now. Due to work, I've had little choice. Poorly, if at all, ventilated trains. As uncomfortable in winter as it is in summer in that regard. When travelling between England and Scotland, I'd say almost half of my journeys involve a complete stand still at some point as we 'wait for a driver to arrive'. This happens with the kind of frequency that rules out technical faults or even sloppiness. I think it's a circumstance they knowingly undertake on a regular basis, rather than fix the wider service or resolve manning issues. Customers are clearly an afterthought. Storage is often an issue also, regardless of whether or not the carriage is actually full passenger wise. I.e. overhead racks barely offer any height to luggage, compared with say, LNER trains. This results in the 'large item' storage at the carriage ends being filled with what I would consider to be medium sized bags and cases. That's all for now.

items.title: Just an  appalling train service
items.review_text: Just an  appalling train service ! Travelled with my 7 old granddaughter today and from Warrington to Edinburgh. Had booked seats but train absolutely packed so no way to get to our seats ! Eventually went to standard premium to get a seat. Train manager ( use that term loosely) said we need to either pay or fight through the carriages to get to our seat. So I paid !! Off to get the form filled for compensation. Oh and also 20 minutes late. Remember you always have the option to fly or drive but please don’t go anywhere near Avanti , without doubt the most pathetic, zero service company I have ever come across

items.title: Worst Train Operator Ever
items.review_text: Why do I have to give a Star?   This train operator has to be the worst ever.  I purchased first class travel paying £250 with a senior rail card for the privilege.   My outbound journey on 21st January was declassified, no first class service provided.  My return journey was also declassified.  Again no service provided apart from a small bottle of water and a packet of crisps given to every passenger.   The Avanti First Class Lounge at Euston was of a similar low standard.  Not one urinal in the men’s toilet was in working order, no catering provision in the lounge apart from a can of Pepsi Max.  It’s obvious to me that the fat cats at Avanti don’t use their own service as I’m sure if they did they wouldn’t accept this third class standard.   Who was the bright spark that removed the franchise from Virgin?  We in the northwest deserve better.  Avanti need to go, but until then we are forced to continue to use their sub standard cattle truck service.

items.title: Turn the heating down
items.review_text: 20/03/24 17.30 train from euston to lancaster. Coach F. Turn the heating down its like a sticky carbon monoxide hole in there.

items.title: My wife and I travelled from London to…
items.review_text: My partner and I travelled from London to Glasgow on first class. It was certainly not! We were on a two seat berth and it seemed like standard class with a table welded in. I am tall and my legs were cramped in a metalwork structure. Bizarre.  Food was awful. Bacon sandwich was dried out toast with a bit of thin overcooked bacon. Staff seem to try to do their best but when everyone is telling them how bad it is that must be demoralising. Just seems to be symptomatic of busted broken rip off Britain. Awful service at a ridiculous price.

items.title: Absolute waste of space company
items.review_text: Absolute waste of space company. Obvious, they don't even have customer support responding to the horrendous reviews flooding in for this poorly managed rip off company - says it all.

items.title: Disgusting Company
items.review_text:
Disgusting Company. travelled to London today on the 13.30 from Crewe to Euston to meet my Disabled Child and her carer in London for a hospital appointment at Great Ormond Street. Train delayed for 80 minutes at Rugby, hospital appointment had to me cancelled. Had booked return tickets for 8pm as the hospital list would have taken a while. Rang Avanti, asked if they could put me on an earlier train. They wanted 231 pounds for one adult and a child to go from euston to crewe. - no apology for the delay, not offer of any refund.

ended up paying. 

That train was delayed and ended up getting on the 18.33 to Manchester instead which while the same train to Manchester at 17.33 hadn't been announced. 

300 pounds spent to miss a hospital appointment and stand around in a station with an unwell disabled child. Avanti's attitude - couldn't care less. 

This company is every thing that is wrong with this country - and you strike because you want more money
 - SHAME ON YOU 😂😂😂😂

items.title: Delayed and dysfunctional
items.review_text: Broken WiFi, no power from the sockets, train delayed 30 minutes without any explanation.

items.title: Avanti mess up and couldn't care less.
items.review_text:
My train to Penrith from Euston was cancelled today with 5 minutes notice. Signal problems. Other trains were still going through. So presumably a capacity problem. However, no explanation or apology why our train. So far so bad.

Went to the Avanti desk at Euston, and the lady we spoke to couldn't care less about the massive disruption to us. No guarantee other trains wouldn't cancel, no apology, no sympathy. The trains after ours would be both delayed and rammed, if they went at all.

So we moved the booking to tomorrow and that cost us money... after all we could perhaps have stood all the way to Penrith. In addition the train on the way to London was an overbooked zoo. 

They need to lose the franchise.

items.title: Terrible trains, awful service.
items.review_text:
Trains are constantly overcrowded and poorly maintained. Toilets often out of order, carriages filthy, etc. 

Today arrived for my train from Euston to Coventry. Staff were stood there at the gate on their phones doing nothing 10 mins before departure. Ticket time, booking confirmation, etc all very clearly states 13:40 yet at 13:34 they would not let me through. When I said I needed to get on that train, which was 15m away, and could very easily do so in the next 6 minutes they still refused. 

Useless, rude, lazy, degenerate people. With so many out of work in the UK right now, it is baffling that even the simplest of jobs find such unimaginably incapable candidates. You could automate the process and it would be infinitely better than dealing with such people.

Complete disappointment, now need to book a new train or wait around for hours in decrepit Euston station for the next train.

items.title: Train from Chester to Holyhead…
items.review_text: Train from Chester to Holyhead cancelled. No reason on National  Rail given if it is a shortage of crew due to staff sickness it is time the management take a grip of the situation. This is a train service. A service for the travelling public.

items.title: Absolute garbage
items.review_text:
The fact that this company is still running is a miracle. 

Today again all trains cancelled after 6 pm thankfully I got a alert (not from them or national rail mind you) so decided to take the one that was running earlier thinking I might just get to London early. But no apparently it is national rails fault for the only train left of a Sunday going into London Euston to run over 2 hrs late. What a f-ing joke of a company.

Once again not power and WiFi but par for the course and I took a power bank this time. But the ac where again not running and they cranked up the heating then closed the food shop so no one could get water and with the train again being the last one for pretty much every one after 6 you can imagine how packed the train was. 

The so called compensation for delayed service is no longer something that I and I guess most travellers who have no other choice of transport are unfamiliar with


Oh as usual no staff onboard and facilitieseither broken or occupiedbyothers who needed to find somewhere to sit or stand

items.title: Impossible to claim for a delayed train…
items.review_text: Impossible to claim for a delayed train journey. We were delayed by more than 2 hours, so went to the website to claim back what we are owed, the process is so difficult, the upload your ticket function does not work and basically AWC do not want to make it possible for you to reclaim. It's no wonder most people don't claim for delays it is impossible to do it, and no help is provided. I get delayed trains, it happens but this company will not you pay back for delays. Appalling company, I hope they lose the franchise.

items.title: Another poor show from Avanti…
items.review_text: Avanti had cancelled a train from Liverpool to London on match day, and had probably overbooked the one I was on, which was standing room only. I only discovered that they hadn't given me allocated seats when boarding. We crawled back to London. Not sure why. Something always goes wrong with Avanti.

items.title: I got verbally abused by a train…
items.review_text: I got verbally abused by a train manager called russ on the service between London and Liverpool this evening. His words where it’s my choice to be pregnant and basically my problem if I have a seat or not. He was patronising and rude and very unreasonable. DO NOT USE THIS SERVICE

items.title: Lazy Train Drivers!
items.review_text: Im making this review! BECAUSE of this Driver who decided to become LAZY! Basically I had to take 3 trains to London so that I can watch an Arsenal game at the Emirates Stadium! But the 1st train we took was cancelled due to a random guy getting struck by a train(I dont blame the driver for that)! But I have to blame the 2nd driver for being such lazy, They said that for people going to London has to get out of the train and take another, Like whats the point. The drivers are completley lazy just to take you to where you wanna go! Then the 3rd one got us late to watch the match as we missed the 1st half! Complete Bad experience this!

items.title: What I've come to expect from Avanti
items.review_text:
15:35 Avanti West Coast service from Glasgow Central. Boarded a busy-ish train with a suitcase and two smaller carry cases, with concerns about finding a seat where I can keep visibility of my cases throughout the journey. On coach C, two staff unloading boxes for the shop witnessing my bemusememt were quick to inform where luggage couldn't be stored, without offering helpful directions as to feasible alternatives. "Try up there or further down the carriage". Only after making a comment to another passenger about the unhelpfulness was there some attempt to seek out space for the luggage. 

Pretty much what I've come to expect from Avanti - a negative reactive response rather than proactive service. See customers struggling? Tell them what they can't do rather than help to find solutions.

items.title: Avanti Customer service, "NOT HER PROBLEM" £105 single to Manchester 7.13am (Sat) empty train after they cancelled my 8.13am
items.review_text: Received an email from Avanti informing me my 8.13am Saturday morning train to Manchester was cancelled at 10 pm. My option was to take a train earlier or one later with the next 4 trains after 8.13am also cancelled. Decided to not risk so got to Euston at 6.45am in plenty time for the 7.13am. Went to booking office and was told I cant get on this train unless I paid another £94.00 (2X£47). Why because it wasn't the one early but the second one. When I questioned and said this doesn't make sense as the train will no doubt have lots of empty seats.. And this was what i was told.. NOT MY PROBLEM I ONLY WORK FOR AVANTI AND ITS THEIR POLICY NOT MINE. SO EITHER PAY THE DIFFERENCE OR LEAVE THE QUEUE AND WAIT FOR  7.53AM. So as Taxpayers we subsided the Train company's coppers for a service that is not fit for purpose and they continue to treat us like the Avanti customer service person who told me that IT WAS NOT HER PROBLEM  Avanti cancelled (apparently no drivers) and pay double the fare for an empty train .. I wont be getting on an Avanti train again, I'll be taking the car

items.title: Peak time cancellation. Again..
items.review_text: Peak time, 17:10 service from Euston to Birmingham, cancelled at short notice. We weren't given that day's version of a pathetic excuse on this occasion, we were just herded onto an already crowded train. Many were standing.   We then, eventually, crawled into Birmingham New St predictably late.  Only redeeming feature was we were in one of the refurbished trains. Again, Avanti clueless as to the meaning of delivering a customer focussed service.

items.title: Complete shambles
items.review_text: Complete shambles. Our train cancelled and had to catch the next train 2 hrs later from Edinburgh. We were first class and they would not allow rebooking out seats, so we had to hope for a seat. Lucky we got a seat but had to move a few times on the journey to Rugby. Over 2 hours late so we did a delay repay claim. Still waiting for a refund it's been over 2 months constant phoning and emailing them. Also the train going out to Edinburgh also cancelled but lucky we rushed to get packed to catch earlier train...big rush very stressed and of course can't claim on this journey as we were early. The booking system was not working either on the way home so imagine the shambles. Lucky we were first class and a few seats empty, in cattle class it would have been fun.Got to be the worst train company going, how they got the contract amazes me

items.title: Train cancelled: staff unconcerned and unhelpful
items.review_text: Arrived to catch a pre-booked train to from Euston to Oxenholme at 18:30 this evening, which was cancelled without warning and with no reason given. The Avanti staff at Euston were unapologetic and said the only course of action we could take was to wait for the next train an hour later. This train had no seats available. We were given the contact details to complain to Avanti but no other assistance at all. Gave up and went home, having to cancel our plans for the weekend. Virgin provided a reasonable and reliable train service: Avanti has not done so since they took over and our journeys are routinely delayed and sometimes cancelled. As a frequent user of the West Coast Mainline, the only reason that I travel with Avanti is that there is no alternative.

items.title: Travelling from Glasgow to Havant
items.review_text: Travelling from Glasgow to Havant. First train was delayed by 37 minutes, which I was reimbursed for, although my reserved seat was suspended & the train was overcrowded. But I caught a second train, which wasn’t the one I should have due to the previous delay. I was informed I shouldn’t have caught it, as my ticket didn’t allow me to do so, although an Avanti train! I spent that near 3 hour journey standing in a corridor by the doors. At one point being informed that there was setting 6 carriages back. I had a suitcase. The train was heavily overcrowded so their answer was that I ‘left my suitcase & pick it up later’! I have complained through the correct channels & got no intelligent response! Fortunately I don’t use trains very often, & I’m glad of it as this situation is so frequent when I do. Disgusting company!!!

items.title: I would give 0 if it were possible
items.review_text:
I would give 0 if it were possible. Boarded the 9.43 train from Lime street today.  Paid £200 to travel and pre booked seats. Reservations were not loaded on the train and it was mayhem. We sat in our carriage but in different seats as ours had been taken. Halfway through the journey a tall ticket lady with glasses approached my teenage daughter accusing her of not paying to reserve and saying someone wanted their seats. My daughter spent the rest of the journey upset on the floor in between carriages as she was so humiliated. This employee has the people skills of Vladimir Putin and likes to Lord it over passengers with the iota of power she possesses. I’ll be asking for a refund and guess what…both seats remained empty for the rest of the journey. 
I would rather walk to Liverpool through quicksand than use this train service again. Your #bekind message should extend to your own staff too.

items.title: If I could give 0 stars I would
items.review_text:
If I could give 0 stars I would. 

Avanti west coast, please tell me how it is acceptable for two of your train managers on my train to have bad attitudes and manners? 
I understand that you can’t keep suitcases in the isle, but I’m sorry, maybe if you didn’t shove people on your trains like cattle maybe there would be space to put our luggage. 
The train is completely packed and there’s even a young lady who has had to sit on the floor because there is no space for her..
All for profit and not much else really. Shouldn’t have got your contract extended to run west coast services. You are an abomination of a company and you need stopped, also doesn’t help that you cancel trains for no reason. Stop going on strike as you all get paid more than most, especially those who work in the care sector and retail. 

Laughing stock of all train companies.

items.title: I Got the 07.02 from Runcorn to Euston…
items.review_text:
I Got the 07.02 from Runcorn to Euston I bought my ticket 5 mins before departure 1st class single £170,00 upon boarding tannoy announced the shop was closed due to staff shortages as the tickets got checked the lady informed me there was no service in 1st class due to staff shortages it turned out she and the driver where the only avanti staff on the train ???  1st ly Surely there has got to be a health and safety issue there . 2 nd why did the train company sell a full price first class ticket 5 mins before a train that had no 1st class service arrived ?? Avanti west coast trains are shambolic and are selling customers tickets at full price when knowing they are unable to provide the service and ultimately safety that should be their 1st priority in my eyes the company is running illegally !! 
Unfortunately there is no other line servicing this route direct 
And they know it so in the old British way we must bend over assume the position and take it up the jacksy

items.title: Thank you for helping my Mum
items.review_text:
I would like to say thank you to Avanti West Coast for looking after my Mum so well today. I normally drive her home to Birmingham when she stays in London with me. But unfortunately yesterday my car broke down and I couldn't get it fixed before I go back to work tomorrow. 

So at very short notice I booked a train ticket for my Mum and booked assistance for her (she's 86 with osteoperosis, bad knees and anxiety).

When we arrived at Euston's assistance lounge we were taken directly to the train. During her journey the train manager came and checked on her a number of times and when she disembarked at Sandwell & Dudley the assistance worked seamlessly at disembarkation - seeing my Mum into the main lobby where her cab driver was waiting.

Sadly, I don't expect good service very much anymore from any organisation but today it worked and I'm grateful.

items.title: Cannot even book a ticket online
items.review_text: Cannot even book a ticket online. They move the prices around constantly. Change train times. Declassify tickets last minute and let hoards of people on a train with or without ANY class of ticket. Absolute garbage.

items.title: Never pay delayed claims
items.review_text: Was delaywd by an hour and a half coming back from Manchester. Applied for the delay refund and was told they wouldn’t honour it as they claim the train was delay by 7 mins. They put the wrong date and time on the claim. Rubbish service and don’t honour their late train payment policy.

items.title: Bad overall service.
items.review_text:
On a good day Avanti runs on time, on a bad day you’re in trouble. 
I travel on a regular basis for work, at least once a week between London and Manchester. I can never get my seat and someone is usually sat in it and onboard staff doesn’t even help. Shop on board staff is untrained, they don’t even know how to use the till! 
Staff are rude, constant cancellations at least once a week due to lack of crew. Prices are going up and they have no train drivers!? Train some willing people from scratch! 
Constant delays. Just appalling service in general.

items.title: Hate Criminal and Accomplices
items.review_text: I was profiled by 4 staff, delayed as usual by 6 hours, and subjected to an unprovoked hate crime by an Avanti train manager. Other customers and the Buffet Manager witnessed this criminal abuse and were appalled. Avanti Customer Relations covered up this crime and destroyed the CCTV evidence. I have reported them for Assisting an Offender and Obstructing Justice. I am disgusted and traumatized.

items.title: Bought a booked-train only deal to go…
items.review_text: Bought a booked-train only deal to go to London from Birmingham. Booked seats on outbound journey were double-booked. Fortunately there were some other seats however the poor family in "our" seats were clearly embarrassed at proving their right to sit there. Train manager said this was a regular issue and we should complain. We will, and not her fault: felt sorry for her dealing with it. Return train was cancelled and we had to cram on to an earlier service and stand all the way. Yes, there was strike action however the tickets were bought and booked the previous day when the action was already timetabled-in. The cost of this route is extortionate for the misery endured. Take my advice: NEVER travel on the Avanti route if you have a choice. Birmingham to London is much better via Chiltern: takes longer, but costs half as much and never messes you around to this extent. Learnt my lesson: I won't do this again. Others beware.

items.title: A mess of a company
items.review_text: I've never had a good experience with avanti - trains always cancelled or delayed especially coming down from carlise to euston but unfortunately its the only way i can get down south. Avoid if possible.

items.title: NEVER TRUST THIS COMPANY BUNCH OF…
items.review_text: NEVER TRUST THIS COMPANY BUNCH OF SCAMMERS, BOOKED A TRAIN TICKET 2 MONTHS AHEAD OF TIME AND WHEN IT CAME TO IT THE REALLY SMART PEOPLE WENT ON STRIKE AND WE ARE NOT ALLOWED ANY REFUND WHAT SO EVER HAHAHAHA SCAMSSSS USE ANYONE BUT THIS

items.title: Trains late again and despite booking…
items.review_text: Trains late again and despite booking first class reserved seats dangerously overcrowded and sitting on floor. No food or drink served but could go buy from kiosk even though paid for it already. They are poor at best

items.title: Consistently poor service
items.review_text: The trains themselves are actually pretty nice, good lighting, sufficient leg space, nice head rests that offer some privacy. However the trains are regularly delayed resulting in ongoing misery for passengers. Also the temperature is far too hot leading to an uncomfortable journey

items.title: Backwards service
items.review_text: Train cancelled on my last trip. Train cancelled again today. No coffees available on trip to London and no coffees available on the alternative non cancelled train on way back. Between strikes and third world service why do we put with this crap?

items.title: Cancels trains at the drop of a hat. Useless
items.review_text: This company excels at just one thing - getting one star reviews. They are totally useless - the last three times I have attempted to travel with them the train has been cancelled.

items.title: Smells so so bad
items.review_text: Smells so so bad.  Travelled after visiting a family member on an NHS ward where everyone had stomach problems and this train smelt worse.

items.title: Didn't realise how bad Avanti were!
items.review_text:
Firstly train delayed but not too bad but as we were on a train ( first time in years) my husband and I are nealy 80 and I have mobility problems, 50 miles from our destination and they announced it would be terminating at Preston. No announcemants as to what happened next we were stranded. Fortunatly my son in law was tracking the train and got a train from Penrith to preston to assist us we eventually arrived tired and stressed 2 hours after our supposed arrival.
If this wasn't enough the return train, 3 days later was totally cancelled so we had to arrange another overnight stay. At 4.00am we received a text saying it look as though we might be lucky to get a train at 8.15 that morning which we did.  Now all of this was bad but the Delay team apptly named ...should be customer avoidance team having missed the fact our train was cancelled and mearly focused on our delay leaving MK, The form  was a nightmare as when completed it would,t go through so I had to phtop copy everthing and send to customer services, will say at this point customer service was very good and did try hard to help. Perhaps they should be transfered to delay team.
Would I travel again on a train? which I might add was soley as my husband will not drive long distances because of our ages, but never again. Will await the out come so watch this space! I.m definitly not letting this go.

items.title: Avanti Strike Back! At the Working Class
items.review_text:
Jobsworths. I’m not sure what they’re paying gate staff for this level of Orwellian policing, but whatever it is they’ve sucked all empathy from their staff. 

My railcard had recently expired unbeknownst to me. Now I know you need it good and ready, but mistakes happen due to the old condition known as ‘being a human being’.

I had ten minutes till my train departed. Admittedly, it was a cheap fair for a 2 hour train to Lancaster at just £140 one way!
