Part of me thinks the gate staff enjoyed telling I had 5 minutes to purchase a new one. Unfortunately I probably validated his behaviour after that, by as he put it, ‘cussing’. No **** Sherlock you just ruined someone’s day for a company that, no doubt like all big corporate bodies these days, doesn’t frankly care you exist.

Moral of the story is, if you’re going to act like a policing bellpiece, at least get paid enough for it and show up on the picket lines.

Avanti toss pot.

(For comparison, whenever I’ve had issues in the past, whether on my part of the rail company, I’ve been with GWR, who are staffed by (for the most part) normal human beings with normal human feelings).

items.title: Sat in 1st class (🤣🤣🤣🤣) from Liverpool…
items.review_text:
Sat in 1st class (🤣🤣🤣🤣) from Liverpool to Euston, as I write this. No 'Chef' = no food. Those sat in premium are getting a better service......IF they have cash! Yep, even the card reader doesn't work! So, this is 1st class service? Wow! How are AWC in business? Come back Virgin, all is forgiven.
This will be the last. I'll drive or fly (flying may take a couple of hours longer, but its cheaper and a far better service!) before using this service again.
A 'bigger seat' does not make it a 1st class service.
AWFUL.

items.title: On a trip from west Midlands to Glasgow…
items.review_text:
On a trip from west Midlands to Glasgow train was rerouted and delayed. We had to travel to other stations to connect to Glasgow train. There were last minute platform changes then I realised on Glasgow train that I'd left holdall somewhere. Spoke to guard and he rang 2 stations where I might have left it. Holdall was found and I can collect it next week. Station even sent guard photo to confirm it was my holdall.
Excellent customer service. I had a rucksack and other bag too as we had our dogs stuff in these 
Guard on avanti train.was so helpful so he and station involved deserve this 5 star review. 
We also got free tea, coffee and water on Glasgow train. Everyone got this because they had been unable to stock buffet car.
Rerouting was because storm brought down trees and electrical wires which was no one's fault

items.title: This would be ZERO if it was possible…
items.review_text:
This would be ZERO if it was possible to give this company one.
I'm not the only person affected by this service cancelling trains and I certainly do appreciate that there is a national dispute going on, but at 70 with a very painful leg, I'm now sat on the floor by the public loo.
I won't mention what I've paid for this priviledge and not forgetting my taxes which contribute towards the 10s of millions of ££ in subside per month.
So the next time I come to London, I will drive, because it is appallingto have to be suffering the agony am currently experiencing.
And now for those who have had to double up on this service have been told that the original reservation stand, so at each stop, the musical chairs begin all over again.
AND THIS IS RAIL TRAVEL IN THE UK IN THE 21st CENTURY.
WHAT A JOY.
And finally my connecting service is also cancelled.
If the 20.49hrs train does run I will finally be home after a journey sat on the floor of the train, then nearly a 90 minute wait before hopefully getting home at 21.20hrs.
I could have travelled the length of France in the 7 hours it's taken me to travel 240 miles.
RIDICULOUS.

items.title: DO NOT WAIST YOUR MONEY AND PAY FIRST…
items.review_text:
DO NOT WAIST YOUR MONEY AND PAY FIRST CLASS. They do not have staff or food and drink. APPARENTLY THIS IS COMPLIMENTARY IF THEY HAVE ANY FOOD AND DRINK. Don’t believe their menu it’s all a lie to get you to pay first class!!!! I complained and now have to go to ombudsman. This is a reply I got from a member of staff. 

have added a link below to our website which states the food and drink in First Class is complimentary and not paid for as part of your ticket. You will see on this page it also states that all items on our menu are subject to availability

They should tell you this when you book. Awful company. Didn’t even sit us together first class and there was loads of seats free next to each other and said available very strange. If more people complain to ombudsman then they will have to rethink their lies into getting you to book.

items.title: Another frustrating day on Avanti West…
items.review_text:
Another frustrating day on Avanti West Coast.
When will the UK Government require a half decent and reliable rail service between Manchester and London, with frequent enough trains ?

items.title: Thank you to the most lovely conductor…
items.review_text: Thank you to the most lovely conductor who went above and beyond helping me and another lady with our tickets on the 15.02 to Holyhead on Monday 18th December. Good to see kindness is still there with people.

items.title: What a load of C—-P  almost every time…
items.review_text: What a load of C—-P  almost every time I go to Manchester Airport the train is cancelled . Useless in considerate badly managed company .

items.title: Don’t travel with Avanti if you don’t have to
items.review_text:
I was belittled and marginalized by Avanti staff after they refused me entry on a first class ticket from Euston to Wolverhampton at the barrier gate after they stated that my ticket had been cancelled . I was forced to purchase another set of return tickets they said if I wanted to travel on that train.
It transpired that Avanti had issued me the incorrect ticket and sent me the correct ticket 15 minutes after the train departure time whilst I was on the train.
I complained about this and they replied that it was my fault because I used the wrong ticket . I complained again and they basically said tough they do not compensate for stress as they refunded me for unused tickets.
Whilst travelling back to London from Wolverhampton I had hardly sat in my seat when a lady pushing a trolley asked me if I had a first class ticket bearing in mind other passengers who boarded the train were not asked that same question.Two minutes late she came back and asked where I was travelling to. Not given me no reason for these questions, A this point I will add that I am black senior citizen. 
This is my experience with Avanti unfortunately I was unable to give them zero rating

items.title: Constant cancellations and WiFi is useless!
items.review_text: Constant cancellations. Worst WiFi I’ve ever used. When travelling with kids having no WiFi is a nightmare. Trains themselves are not bad quality.

items.title: Awful service
items.review_text: Awful service, dirty trains, really expensive overpriced tickets. If you want to have a terrible travel experience then use Avanti.

items.title: Shambolic is normal for Avanti
items.review_text: This is the worst service possible at the highest financial cost. Really poor value for money. I used to enjoy travelling by train to London down the west coast, Avanti have ruined that. Trains are dirty and it is a lottery in relation to whether they run on time or are cancelled. In any other walk of life the CEO would be sacked, but Avanti seem immune from accountability or sanction. I have to use this service regularly and every time without exception I am left disappointed. Yesterday I took a train from London, which was delayed by 40 minutes after mine was cancelled. The train was then cancelled from Wolverhampton after it had left London, leaving hundreds of people to squeeze onto already busy alternate services. Had to get off, get another train to Stafford and a further train from Stafford to Wigan. Journey time in total was 4 hours, when it should have been 2 hours. I really hope the goverment takes some action against Avanti, it is needed now, disgustingly expensive, no care for customers and barely provide a service. I expect there to be problems now when travelling with Avanti, which says everything. Fly, drive or walk if you can, will be far less stressful and probably quicker. Bring back Virgin.

items.title: Utter rubbish
items.review_text: Utter rubbish.  Was badly treated again by this waste of a train service.  Cancelled at short notice - allegedly because of a lack of drivers.  So no trains to Manchester for an hour.  Was told by avanti staff to go to Preston and then travel back to Manchester.  Bad attitude as well. Then the chaos when people can't find seats.  at least it save Avanti money!  Whilst the rest of us suffer with day care costs.

items.title: Had to get avanti trains for a while…
items.review_text:
Had to get avanti trains for a while now due to work. The trains are often canceled and when they do run the seating is often over booked. The carriages are newish but really dirty. 

The avanti staff themselves always seam really sad or just rude. Who knows why. Hopefully they go bust soon.

items.title: Pay for first class and get third class…
items.review_text: Pay for first class and get third class service. No food or drink offered for 3 hours of the journey. Stewardess was too busy on her phone to bother doing anything.

items.title: First train of the day (20 minutes late)
items.review_text: How can your first train to Holyhead (0720) from Rhyl be 20 minutes late? Absolute joke. Has made me late to my job. Might as well have gotten the transport for wales train which would’ve showed up on time and saved the hassle of being here early. What an embarrassment of a company.

items.title: Smelt odd - nice staff
items.review_text: Poor. Late, crowded, smelt funny, overall bad experience. Staff were very friendly though.

items.title: Cancelled my train the night before for…
items.review_text: Cancelled my train the night before for a 5.30am departure,  had to wait for the next one which was 50 mins late and then after waiting all this time no hot drinks available on board  ... awful service

items.title: The whole experience is a shambles!
items.review_text:
The whole experience is a shambles!

In the last 3 months, I've made 4 return trips to London from Warrington. In those 4 trips, I've had 4 trains with reserved seats cancelled. I haven't previously looked to claim a refund but after may last trip where both the outward and return trains were cancelled I decided to do it. I found out that to claim a refund, you have to post the tickets back to them, but unfortunately, I left the outbound ones in the hotel room (my mistake). So today, I went back to Warrington Station to try and get the tickets reprinted. Apparently they can't do it so I asked what my options were. She said there was nothing she could do. Zero help, zero empathy. If Amazon cancel an order that you've placed with them, they automatically refund you. Avanti ask that you send the tickets back to prove you was affected despite them having evidence of your seat being booked and the train being cancelled. I used to travel to London once per month for 2 years with Virgin, not once did I have a train cancelled. This franchise is a joke. Shareholders received £13.5m pay out last year despite customer complaints being 10 times the national average (business live report), it's time to re-nationalise the rail network, £13.5m reinvested in the customer experience would go a long way.

items.title: Piece of sh!t company
items.review_text: Piece of sh!t company. Delays every single time you ride with them f_cking up all your plans. Missed every connection because of them. Every other train company manages to do fine without 1.5 hr delays

items.title: This review is not just for todays…
items.review_text: This review is not just for todays journey but every journey in the last 6 months. I haven’t had a single one arrive on time or not cancelled. Never have enough staff or staff not on time as if that’s excuse. Miss virgin running it so much.

items.title: Terrible company
items.review_text:
I bought my train ticket directly on the Avanti app. I tried to change the ticket to travel on a different day. The app would not let me into my account. I tried to change password 5 times. I called Avanti. The first person I spoke to Leon, told me to buy a new ticket on the app and then claim a refund. I went back into the app but it would not let me buy a new ticket without going into my account. The account I couldn't access. 
I called back and got a more helpful customer service lady, Sarah. She said she could change my ticket but when she realised I had a premium ticket, she said she couldn't change that type of ticket. She suggested my best option was to get a ticket at the station on the day! Having spent an hour between the two calls and trying to purchase a new ticket through Avanti, only to fail repeatedly,  I ended up buying a new ticket through Trainline. Dealing with Avanti is a terrible experience.I've repeatedly been re-imbursed from Avanti due to the trains never running on time or cancelled. I see that the company is just awful in every department. I do feel sorry for the customer service people, though. They must deal with complaints all day long.

items.title: Avanti's Euston Ticket Office: an experience to leave you breathless
items.review_text:
I had the misfortune of having to use Avanti West Coast trains today and I really wished hadn't or that there was a competitor.
Buying a ticket these days should be a simple quick affair but Euston ticket office is a throw back to 1970's Britain a decade when nothing worked.
I needed a ticket for immediate travel and made the mistake of thinking the ticket office would be the best place to get it.  The queue at 10.05 had stretched through the whole of the ticket hall (which uses a snake system) and then as the queue was getting longer, three of the 5 counters closed.  This was already after a number of us had been queueing for over 20 minutes or more adding so much time to purchase a ticket.  Do remember that the ticket machines are programmed only to sell the most popular tickets and not the cheapest tickets which even the UK Parliament have also complained about
To add further insult, a member of Avanti staff then decides its fully acceptable to queue jump a customer from somewhere else on the station and doesn't even have the common decency to say for example 'sorry folks I need to help this customer' but instead keeps his back to us and makes everyone else who had patiently queued up suffer even further delay in buying their ticket.
When I got to the counter - I asked why did they close three counters when there was a massive queue, the answer I got was 'we've got our breaks to take'.  I wonder if in a properly customer oriented company this would be acceptable, as any sensible company would deal with the queue or let one person at a time takes a break not three at once, but it seems the staff at Euston ticket office think this is acceptable behaviour.
I asked to speak to a duty Manager to complain but I was told we've not got one and there hasn't been one here for ages.  The lack of anybody in Avanti at Euston taking ownership or being accountable is to me a clear two finger salute to their customers.
So if you want a taste of the UK from the 1970's then enjoy the ticket purchasing experience at Euston.  You will only do it once, I can assure you...

items.title: Well
items.review_text:
If you want delays, awful
Wifi, bad food and a train that hasn’t been cleaned in a decade at a price that royally takes the Micheal. Then welcome to Avanti West Coast, they’ll make all your dreams come true.

items.title: Outstanding Customer Service
items.review_text: Outstanding Customer Service! On a recent trip to Edinburgh we arrived at the station to grab a bite to eat before the journey home only to find that due to an electrical fault pretty much ALL trains were cancelled! Every other train company were advising people to either taxi to Glasgow or stay overnight and try again the next day. However, AWC customers were directed to join a queue on platform 2 and await further information. The staff were doing their upmost to speak to all of the worried people stranded in Edinburgh. We were given the option to wait in this queue or find alternative accomodation / travel. So we waited with a couple of hundred others. Staff kept updating us and quickly moved anyone with children to a seperate queue and an onward journey. One member of staff walked the queue and promised us all we would get home and to bear with them. We assumed we would be put on a coach and maybe taken part way / to another train station. What we did not expect was for AWC to put us in a taxi with instructions for the driver to take us home... we shared a taxi with 3 others who were headed back to Birmingham / Dudley and all of us were taken home, not to a train station or loaded into a coach for 7/8 hours! AND to top it off we were refunded for the return journey!!!! Am actually amazed. Outstanding customer service. Thank you to AWC. Great job. Would definately recommend.

items.title: Expensive and poor service
items.review_text: Expensive, always late and mainly on strike! Something needs sorting with west coast mainline, it is shocking...

items.title: Absolute shower of s h i t of a train operator, who needs stripped of their franchise
items.review_text:
We travel four times a year and I cannot ever remember when Avanti ran the service when the trains were running on time or when our train was not cancelled. My heart goes out to anyone who is unfortunate enough to need to use your train service on a regular basis. The seat reservation service is a joke with either the reservation screens not working or them not showing that the seats are reserved and from which station. 

Our return journey from London Euston to Carlisle was the 30 November. We turned up at Euston station only to see that our 5:30pm train had been cancelled due to no train staff (utterly f u c k i n g pathetic excuse when they know well in advance the staff numbers) and the next train which would bypass Birmingham was the 6:30pm train out of London Euston. This train was late and did not leave London Euston until 6:48pm. 

This train was absolutely rammed, people standing in the coaches, people standing and blocking the vestibule areas on the train with luggage. Surely this is a safely concern which should not be allowed to happen. Your train service resembles something you would see in a third world country and you are an embarrassment to the UK travelling public. 

I have a loathing of Avanti that you could not measure. You are by far the worst train operator in the UK and I hope the time when you lose the franchise is imminent as you treat your customers like s h i t. And also to add the recently agreed pay rise, then I think the service should improve 100 percent before any pay rises are given!

Bring back Virgin trains, although not perfect, they were light years ahead of the shower of s h i t of a train operator called Avanti.

items.title: Appalling
items.review_text: In the past two weeks, I've travelled with Avanti twice and twice been delayed. It is now a certainty that you are going to be let down, not that you might be.

items.title: Its not my job gang
items.review_text: I hope no one has to call these people with a problem - classic call one number get another number to call - no one wants to do anything - 5th number i have been passed today - the 6th number they offered was the 1st completing the full loop.

items.title: Not even the 1 star is deserved by this…
items.review_text: Not even the 1 star is deserved by this horrible service which causes misery to passengers over and over again. Never again.

items.title: If you enjoy being abandoned in Crewe…
items.review_text: If you enjoy being abandoned in Crewe in the freezing cold on a Saturday night. These are the guys for you.

items.title: No refund provided
items.review_text:
Arrived at Euston 22:10, all trains were cancelled/delayed until further notice (although not the fault of the train operators), including my one at 22:30. I waited until 23:00 and decided to get the Overground to Watford Junction as there was no sign/indication that any trains were going to operate again any time soon - was probably only a matter of time before my train was cancelled too. I then got an Uber from there which took 1 hour. Before this, a member of station staff at watford junction told everyone who had made the same journey that they could request a refund from the individual train operators for the inconvenience caused. The day after I requested a refund for the Uber journey only from Avanti West Coast, in which they asked me to provide information on three separate occasions. It was only after the third time of providing receipts/information that they told me they couldn't provide a refund as the train was only delayed, not cancelled. It might as well have been cancelled as I had waited a considerable amount of time already, especially at that time of night, and there was no indication at all about when the next train would be. What did they expect everyone to do in that situation? I could have waited until midnight and then all the trains could have got cancelled for all I know - what would I have done then?
Extremely disappointed by this, as well as the constantly terrible service by AWC.

items.title: Delay repay !!!!!!
items.review_text:
Delay repay !!!!!!
Put a claim in weeks ago still no money sent email to chase still no reply why offer it when you don’t pay it

items.title: Do not blame AWC for appaling level of…
items.review_text: Do not blame AWC for appaling level of performance, it was the Tories who took the franchise away from Virgin who were doing an excellent job, Westminster must be held accountable.

items.title: Avanti West Coast gave me incorrect…
items.review_text: Avanti West Coast gave me incorrect information regarding my train connection leaving my baby and I stranded and having to buy an expensive taxi ride home with no car seat. After months trying to complain about this and Avanti blaming every single other train operator I have still been unsuccessful in obtaining an apology, refund or compensation.

items.title: Great service by Jenny
items.review_text: Jenny was friendly, polite and helpful as she served me. She is a real credit to her company. Thank you Jenny for being a bright moment in my day.

items.title: Avanti west coast
items.review_text: Avanti west coast is the best!!!! Bathroom was clean 🧼 smooth go the London euston wasn’t cancel

items.title: Abysmal Service
items.review_text: It does not surprise me to see that Avanti West Coast has such a poor review status. On the 25th November my wife and myself booked First Class same day return to London from Lancaster to meet up with my Sister for her 50th Birthday. The journey to London was lack lustre for First Class, the carriage separation doors were broken so every time the train stopped the carriage became freezing cold when the external doors opened. The return journey was harrowing! The trains before and after our scheduled train had been cancelled by Avanti and all customers from these trains were told just to get on to our train, it was packed beyond safe standards and the duty of care for the individuals was none existent. My wife and I who had paid £504 for the whole journey found ourselves without a seat and had to debate with those how had taken them from the previous cancelled train. The carriage was full of returning football supporters who were disruptive and threatening towards my wife and myself. There was a disabled individual also in the carriage with his children who also received abuse. When the train got to its final station Preston it was like a mass migration trying to get to the connecting train which again was filled beyond capacity.  My wife and I decided to get a taxi home as the experience on the last train was traumatic. We contacted Avanti who after some debate agreed to refund the taxi and the for part of the First Class fee. I am a Army Veteran who has a veterans discount card, Avanti only refunded me for the First Class to Standard which they said was £25 per person. I did a price check prior to purchasing the First Class tickets. For standard tickets with Veterans Discount was £174, First Class £504. So if you do the maths it’s more than £25 per person. I will never travel with this company again and I have also informed my company to boycott them. I regularly travel to London and Aberdeen for work from Lancaster. I will find alternate transport! I am still taking it to the Rail Ombudsman, just waiting for the 40 days to elapse!

items.title: Prices
items.review_text: Prices are a joke, monopoly, but don't expect any less from UK services :)

items.title: Great journey
items.review_text: Everything worked, train was on time, on-board displays told me things I needed to know…

items.title: Rubbish expensive train
items.review_text: Really, really poor train service:train arranged backwards so messing up platform announcements; running late; air-con broken; shop out of most stock; seat reservations malfunctioning

items.title: Shambles again and again
items.review_text:
After waiting a year for my concert at the Wembley ovo and booking the Hilton on the 12th of December to get a email at 1am to say my train with selected reserved seats is cancelled for 7am so I then got no sleep and left early to go to Edinburgh waverley managed to get a train to Carlisle and then another to London euston station...  got there and just before my concert started another another email to say the return is cancelled the same (even though others on the same route to the same destination was all fine) so that made me not enjoy my planned gig and worry again... so up very early went to euston to discover I would have a 6 hour wait about the station until the train they wanted to put me on as it says in the details a earlier or later train than your cancelled actual time this wasn't clear on the email... so after all that time freezing in euston station the train left the station late and was packed and barely any seats and  no charging point so my phone is by now out of power.... just a shambles the train was then further delayed on route so I arrived at Carlisle late and had a 50min to wait in the cold at -1°c having missed the link and having to wait on the next...
Yeah I'm getting a refund, but the reality is what about the cold, stress, worry and inconvenience? Yes as a so called valued customer this is how much we care about your experience and stress £0.00 !!

Sorry doesn't mean a thing when you spoiled everything and left me ill and exhausted and as I was informed by a avanti staff member that the trains get cancelled if they are low costomer numbers so to save money and to squeeze customers onto other trains and to buy higher price tickets as they are put in a desperate position and then get ripped off. 
Shove the apology it changes nothing !!
I'm utterly disgusted, what a experience  !!!
Shambolic  !!!

items.title: This is the worst train service I’ve…
items.review_text: This is the worst train service I’ve taken. I’ve taken train in 11 different countries.

items.title: Really good service
items.review_text: On time leaving. Good info about weather related delays. Really cheery and good service. Better than Virgin.

items.title: No better than Virgin
items.review_text: No better than Virgin, train grossly overloaded, mad hot and late, totally disappointed.

items.title: Unprofessional Customer Service
items.review_text: I’m appalled at the treatment I have experienced through their customer service advisors who refuse to answer why their inspector sold me an incorrect ticket on a delayed train therefore they refuse to payout any delay compensation, I was also made to buy this additional ticket after missing my intended train due to their earlier disruptions….. further they refuse to put me through to a trained manager, but instead tell me to go to the Ombudsman, what a disgrace this company is!

items.title: A merry christmas
items.review_text: travelled with avanti on 19th december from glasgow to london euston by standard premium and was very happy with my experience .the return journey on 21st december by 1st class return was totally the opposite .trains had been cancelled due to overhead cable damage at watford and at one point euston station was closed to all new travellers entering the station ,to the credit of avanti staff kept posting updates the best they could before eventually train arriving 3 hours late and all seats declassified  which ment we lost or reserved  seats in 1st class and travelled in standard class instead  so no big hard ship as avanti got us ALL home , The avanti staff at euston station and on the train were great and would like to thank them all and wish them a merry christmas

items.title: Do not give Avanti your money
items.review_text: 1. Stay away from Avanti 2. Don't go to their customer service as they cannot help... Terrible customer service and business practices. We asked to switch trains at London Euston's Avanti customer service because my partner was sick and wanted to go home earlier, and they asked to see our tickets, which required us to activate them. I knew that we booked a single train without switches and asked if this was ok as it did say the refund was invalid after activation. They said it was ok, but this invalidated the refund for switching trains, and then they looked at the tickets and said they couldn't be switched... They clearly do not care about our time or money. Their customer service was less helpful than doing nothing, and they have no power to change anything, the online systems are all you get.

items.title: A Pleasant Surprise
items.review_text: I recently travelled (with some trepidation after seeing reviews on here) from Wolverhampton to Edinburgh and returned the next day. The train from Wolverhampton was on time, seat reservations worked, the onboard shop was fully stocked and the train arrived on time in Edinburgh. The return from Edinburgh, the train was at the platform 20 minutes before departure as the journey started in Edinburgh, again seat resevations worked, the on board shop was open and fully stocked and the train arrived in Wolvewrhampton on time

items.title: Terrible service on a rotten train
items.review_text:
Train was delayed as the driver was late getting to the train. Rubbish left everywhere. 
All but one toilet worked. Honestly how Avanti got the contract for the rail service is shocking.

items.title: Beware when buying a 1st class ticket.
items.review_text:
Beware when buying a 1st class ticket.
What you are guaranteed to get over standard class is a table, more leg room and a power socket.
Food, hot drinks, soft drinks, alcoholic drinks and snack are "Comlimentary" if there is a problem with, staff, electrics or something else, you will have paid over £100 for very little.
Avanti West coast could not run a raffle. Paying for a first class ticket is akin to buying a lottery ticket, as very little is guaranteed.

items.title: Liverpool Lime St to London Euston
items.review_text: There appear to be a number of negative reviews. My experience as a one off overnight  return from London Euston to Liverpool Lime Street was a very positive experience. Both outbound and return trains departed and arrived on time - staff were helpful and polite. The return journey on the 8th November from Liverpool Lime St departing at 11.43hrs was clean and onboard staff very polite. Cassius who were in the buffet car was extremely helpful and a true asset to the company, a rarity these days. Of course I realise this service is out of peak hours but still a very comfortable journey.

items.title: Time to nationalise its working for…
items.review_text:
Time to nationalise its working for LNER!!  As a regular traveller on both lines.

 LNER cost to change an advance ticket at the desk £10.  With Avanti it's £30.90!      
LNER delay repay paid within a few days.
AVANTI within a few weeks
LNER train guards checking tickets offering FREE upgrades to FIRST class on your birthday or if you are a regular traveller as a thank you.
AVANTI not a chance!
LNER plug sockets always work
AVANTI never - always have to speak to the guard to reset the plugs.
LNER train standing room only - we got offered crisps sandwiches and drinks as an apology
AVANTI nothing
LNER.  5 pound free for opening an account and 2% back on every ticket you buy
AVANTI - you guessed it... nothing!
Well done LNER ...  Avanti take note this is what a half decent train operator looks like

items.title: Always late
items.review_text: Always late

items.title: disrespectful ticket man
items.review_text: When boarding the 11:56 service from Glasgow Central to London Euston, the ticket inspector man with the long gray/white beard, the thick glasses and the distinctively southern accent was heard disrespectfully talking to people and abusing his authority.

items.title: Avanti insists on paper tickets to refund tickets for late trains
items.review_text:
Caught a train from Birmingham to Euston on Sunday 29 October; arrived over an hour late. Avanti West Coast have a delay repay scheme, but insist on you producing the actual paper ticket rather than proof of purchase from TheTrainline.com. 

Avanti insisting on the paper copy in an age of electronic reservations and receipts is just a way to wriggle out of its obligations. Well overdue for renationalisation.

items.title: I would do less than one star as they…
items.review_text: I would do less than one star as they changed the price as I was purchasing the ticket. No offer of a refund if the difference and no customer focused response, awful customer service.

items.title: shockingly bad
items.review_text: shocking - every train is late delayed and dirty - cannot believe they have been awarded a 9 year contract - why ? Corruption????

items.title: Gets worse every time
items.review_text:
Gets worse every time. The trains are often cancelled or late (nearly always). Plug sockets and Wi-Fi often don’t work, and increasingly the trains are dirty. 
Just give up and do something else as train operation is not something you are competent to do. 
Overpriced rubbish.

items.title: A millions times better in 1st class…
items.review_text:
A millions times better in 1sr class than the East Coast line service.

Good food & service, lounges at the station were excellent & staff good.

items.title: INHUMANE
items.review_text: It seems like it’s pointless writing a negative review, given that they have been consistent and the company continues to be abhorrent. Train from Euston to Glasgow was cancelled. I contacted Avanti Coast who assured me that there would be available sets on the next train. No chance. People sitting in corridors and on the floor. This is inhumane. Do not use this train company.

items.title: Train cancellation
items.review_text:
Train cancellation - what a joke - why didn't I drive!!

So from a booked, confirmed seat to standing the whole way with people pushing past constantly.

So glad that HS2 was cancelled + why provide a modern, high speed service that all first world countries have or have had for decades.

items.title: DON'T select Avanti West Coast if you can
items.review_text: I live in Milton Keynes and need to be in London every 2 weeks, I will take 8:17 am Avanti West Coast train from MK to London Euston.  I understand the train may be delay or cancelled due to different reasons, however, when I try to claim for the delay or cancel, Avanti is the most difficult train company I can get full refund.  I have a situation that their train cancelled so I need to buy another ticket to London, the orginal ticket price was £23.1 but when I submit my claim to them, Avanti only compensate me for £11.55, so it will potentially incrase my travel cost if I select Avanti service.  I did sent for appeal and told them they cancelled the train but they insist only compensate me for half of the ticket price.  What's the worst train company and they should be able to earn a lot of money from this way.

items.title: Rip off.
items.review_text: Trains between Euston and Line street are overcrowded. Wifi doesn’t work, was barely able to write this review. Trains are dirty. Standard fare (if you need to be in London for work at 9am) is 340 quid return which is ludicrous. Absolutely terrible firm.

items.title: Another late evening thanks to Avanti
items.review_text: I don't think I ever managed to get a return train that wasn't late or cancelled. Appalling service.

items.title: Coventry to Birmingham New Street
items.review_text:
Travelled Coventry - Birmingham New Street return.  Used Assisted Passenger Services due to wheelchair and ramp for embarking needed.  Excellent service, pleasant and helpful people.
Cannot fault anyone.  Train lovely and clean too.
Pleasant experience

items.title: Honestly just drive instead
items.review_text: This train service literally could not be worse. Trains are dangerously overcrowded, you can't even make it to the carriage because there are so many people. It feels like every journey is delayed either turning up late or taking 20 mins longer to arrive than stated. I paid for first class and there was no chance of even getting to my seat. Train travel is supposed to be the future of travel yet the train operators in the UK couldn't run a bath let alone a functioning service.

items.title: Staff shortages
items.review_text: Train from Euston to Liverpool with no mention of any issues until on train .Then told train would terminate at crewe and we'd have to get a slower train to Liverpool adding over half an hour to journey.  Reason given was staff shortages AGAIN . Advised compensation was available, surely its not compensation but a refund as the contract was not fulfilled in getting  me to Liverpool ? Its a shambles and yet on the basis of ongoing shocking performance they've been given a 9 year contract extension! The answer should be that in addition to refunding the fare there should be a compensation payment as well?  They might then get their act together

items.title: Overcrowded trains from London to…
items.review_text: Overcrowded trains from London to Manchester. No extra coaches to deal with the excess service

items.title: Unreliable company
items.review_text: Have never been able to leave London Euston on time. Trains are constantly delayed and cancelled, with little support offered from staff and the company. For example, my train today was originally delayed, once we boarded the train there was an announcement letting us know the train would terminate half way through the journey, this information had not been provided to us until we were on the train. Unacceptable. Overall a super unreliable company that should not be allowed to operate trains.

items.title: Direct trains cancelled because of…
items.review_text: Direct trains cancelled because of floods. Fair does. But then return direct train cancelled five days later with no explanation and no floods.

items.title: A suprising positive review for Avanti
items.review_text: I find myself giving Avanti positive review which is surprising. My return journey was Birmingham to London Euston and the trains were on time, seat reservations were working and the train was as clean as it could be. The ticket prices were reasonable too. My return journey I was in a refurbished carriage which was quite refreshing. I hope Avanti keep it up.

items.title: The website is a scam
items.review_text: The website is a scam at best. Try filling out a request to get a partial claim for a delayed trip. They advertise compensation for more than 15 minute delayed trip and make it impossible to fill out the claim. If it sounds like a scam, it’s a scam. The duck is quacking.

items.title: Avanti Advance Ticket Fare Price Increases
items.review_text: I use Avanti to commute from Lichfield to London. Since Avanti took over from Virgin, advance ticket prices have doubled. I can no longer afford to travel to work each day. Can Lichfield even be considered a viable place to live if you work in London with return peak-time fares over £65+? The reliability of the service is poor as well. Something needs to be done before this gets any worse.

items.title: Catch the train daily and it never ever…
items.review_text: Catch the train daily and it never ever arrives on time causing missed connection, rushing and elongated working days. The toilets are dirty, the air conditioned leaks through the roof, smell of fumes through the air flow, the buffet carriage doesn’t accept card payments or serve hot drinks most days, not enough plug sockets, only thing that’s good is the staff, monthly season ticket all for the price of a full spec Range Rover … bargain !

items.title: Ghastly!
items.review_text: Had a 10 hour journey to get from London to Glasgow on the outbound leg. Today on return leg an hour late departing. It's not just the delays which are awful. It's the way they are so constantly unreliable and don't bother to communicate with customers. No updates. Staff don't know anything. And they're often so grumpy and hostile. Not surprising maybe working for this company. When we did get on our late running service today, no buffet facilities from Glasgow to Preston. Just awful management. Almost every time I travel with Avanti it's the same. Why would they want to improve their dismal record when the government fund them to run an incompetent service badly and pay compensation for their miserable useless service. No pride in what they do. No customer care. No respect for their service users. Dreary, dreadful and disgraceful.

items.title: We were on platform 4 at Stockport…
items.review_text: We were on platform 4 at Stockport train station looking to get a train to Manchester and we asked a worker a question he ignored us the first time and the second time responded excuse me I am dispatching a train however all he was doing was holding up a sign and blowing a whistle he then refused to help us even after he had “dispatched the train “

items.title: What is wrong with this company
items.review_text: Every single train out of London delayed significantly. This has lead to me missing my final connection and now needing to get a 50 min taxi at my own expense. The excuse given was ‘the driver needed a break’ so why have all the services been delayed?

items.title: Reliably unreliable
items.review_text:
Never in all my travels have I encountered a train line so pathetically unreliable. Completely incapable of being on time. Will cause you to miss change overs. Would be far more reliable if shut down completely. Both companies in charge deserve to be sued to debt and death. 
Have literally, over multiple journeys, not had a single good experience with them. Would gladly give them huge minus ratings if possible.

items.title: 21/10/23 0730 train London to Glasgow…
items.review_text: 21/10/23 0730 train London to Glasgow did not run past Preston. No clear explanation as to why. Had reserved and paid for a first class seat but actual seat turned out to be Standard Premium, eventually sat in unreserved first carriage. Train staff very good but clearly disillusioned by having to apologise for lousy management. Have used Avanti several times in recent years and each trip is slightly worse than it’s predecessor Why this apology for a service company is still running trains is beyond me. British Airways is becoming better value.

items.title: Trains cancelled coming down to London
items.review_text:
Trains cancelled coming down to London. Trains cancelled coming back from London 4 days later. No communication, and to get a refund you have to go around the houses and post your tickets back.

Train was overcrowded as a result, me and my pregnant wife had to stand with our case for nearly 4 hours.

The staff on the ground were very helpful despite everything, they deserve better.

Totally unacceptable, whole bloody thing needs nationalising.

items.title: Probably the worst train service ever
items.review_text: Probably the worst train service ever. Travelled back from London Euston on Friday - Managed to get on the Liverpool train and changed at Crewe. People stood up, toilets not working - you are happy to take full fares even though your service is shocking. Sort your trains out.

items.title: Bad if you have luggage
items.review_text:
I paid for a seat near the luggage racks only to not get to use them. I would have gotten there sooner to use the luggage racks but they did not give the platform number until the very last minute. My luggage ended up being stored by the doors. My seat was also being used by someone else.

I'm visiting on holiday and will never use this company again after my holiday is over.

items.title: Another bad review I am afraid
items.review_text: Another bad review I am afraid - trying to get help for a gentleman with a disability leaving Stockport station and heading for Euston was impossible - even worse was the staff said they would ensure this gentleman found his seat. Only later found out that this gentleman had to stand for the entire journey which was also delayed for over an hour en route. Unreliable uninterested and uncaring is not acceptable.

items.title: The worst train company that history has created
items.review_text:
The worst train company that history has created
You truly understand  the quality of Virgin customer service  and virgin train 

I traveled on 18/10/2023 from Birmingham to Wolverhampton with the most inhuman and disgusting train manager with no empathy no apology pure racism. Anyway cheap price with can only except this type of poor customer service

items.title: Travel with avanti
items.review_text:
Travel on 20.10.23 with a group of friends, age range 50 to late 70's.
Going to Glasgow. Initial delay followed by a catalogue of delays arriving 4 hours later in Carlisle. No onward travel, no access to staff, no support for disabled friends, no support for young students or individuals with English as a second language. Vast groups of travellers basically dumped despite being paying customers.  A cleaner advised some older travellers to sit in train as weather cold and no one available to help with mobility or luggage. As a service we pay for it was totally abysmal. Unable to ask about travel or purchase of tickets as office closed.
Taxis hay day as they ramped up prices for ongoing travel like vultures.
Not a good day for trains, taxis or vulnerable individuals, totally disgraceful.
Fortunately Scotrail had an alternative for some. An extra 2.5 hrs travel around the borders to reach Glasgow central.

items.title: I know avanti can't help the weather.
items.review_text:
I know avanti can't help the weather.
However. When a crisis hits such as three trains cancelled in carlisle and numerous staff who had been milling around vanished apart from one on platform one who was doing his best.
The ticket centre staff member who said it was the end of her shift and pulled the shutter down. No coaches or taxis provided unless for avanti staff only.
Just a complete lack of care, empathy or customer care.up until now I was in favour of supporting staff in the ticket offices. Now, I don't think they would be any use or even care on the platform.
Now having a long diversion on a scotrail train to Glasgow.
All I have seen is an abandonment of hundreds of passengers with no regard for passenger welfare.
I hope all the staff at Carlisle station are proud of their valiant efforts (NOT) in a crisis.
I sincerely hope you lose the franchise soon!!!
YOU LEFT VULNERABLE PASSENGERS TO FEND FOR THEMSELVES. YOU SHOULD BE ASHAMED OF YOUR SELVES!!!@@

items.title: Rude staff
items.review_text: All other doors were out of service so accidentally I and my wife have entered in to the first class coach, the staff was very rude and disrespectful he rudely was asking me to leave the first class coach, I was explaining that there is no way to go to standard class but he was just rude and ignorant, I felt embarrassed in front of my wife

items.title: Over an hour late and No information
items.review_text: Our first leg of the journey was cancelled. But we managed to catch another train to get to Preston station to catch our 20:01 train to London Euston. The train is late and there is no explanation or announcement. Then it disappears from the departure board. When we ask staff they say it will come but not sure when. At 20:34 the departure board shows our train again and says "delayed" the app says it will come at 20:30 (in the past) no information untill about 20:55 when a train rolls in. When we ask staff if this is our train they say yes. No announcement was made and the train eventually left at about 21:05. If they could've just estimated at any point when the train might come we could've got a coffee or gone to the toilet or just felt safe that we would be able to get home. Why can't they tell us anything? Do they care so little?

items.title: Stale smelling trains
items.review_text: Every now an again I travel from Warrington to London and back and the service is always good. However on the past 2 occasions the carriages have smelled really stale and awful. Please can you give your trains a good clean, especially the carpets as this must be where the smell is coming from. Even the food carriage was awful,  I went to buy a sandwich and was put off eating by the smell.

items.title: The absolute worst Company for service
items.review_text: The absolute worst Company for service, I travel to London once a week for business. In the last 4 weeks, 3 times they had no ice…. This morning they didn’t have a chef and I paid £235, I feel sorry for the staff let down by a senior management team who hide from the ability to be messaged direct. Being the CEO of a Company you front up when the service is not acceptable. The fact these people are allowed to continue running an alleged service speaks volumes about the state of our Country, all politicians noses on the trough giving their mates work. Last one out turn off the lighst

items.title: travelled motherwell to blackburn manky…
items.review_text: travelled motherwell to blackburn manky train somrone sitting in my seat rattling train contacted customer service waste of time

items.title: On Saturday 7th October the weather in…
items.review_text: On Saturday 7th October the weather in Scotland was really bad and all trains were cancelled. I was trying to get to Manchester from Glasgow central station with my husband and 2 autistic children. I would like to send my sincere thank you to a man who works for a Avanti west his name was Barry there was also another girl who helped us tremendously, unfortunately I never caught her name. They arranged for us to sit in a lounge until the train pulled in then got us all seated together. I can’t thank you enough! You are both such a credit to your company!  You have no idea how much you helped a very stressed out journey turn into something fabulous. Thank you Barry and your female colleague.

items.title: First class seats
items.review_text:
Travelled first class to London.
Wonderful journey, and staff brilliant could not fault anything

items.title: Usual terrible travel to London from the north…
items.review_text:
Usual travel to London from the north West - expensive, delayed and poor communication

Also they don't automatically process refunds so you need to go through a long process to get anything back for the delay.

items.title: Train to Edinburgh cancelled again
items.review_text: Train to Edinburgh cancelled again, three hours sat on the floor no explanation absolutely appalling, Get Branson back and get rid of these imbeciles

items.title: I’m not even on my train yet
items.review_text: I’m not even on my train yet!  Booked my ticket with a few earlier connections for Euston to Manchester.  Arrive at 09.25 but booked on the 09.53 so I assume I’ll just get on the 09.33 as I’m there and the ticket system has allowed too much time - but oh no - no unless I pay Avanti another £20 on top of the £60 I’ve already paid? WHY oh WHY when it’s your connection planning.  This is why I hate getting trains in the UK - there’s just no flexibility.

items.title: Train Cancelled
items.review_text: Train cancelled within 24 hours of travel. Had to reschedule plans to catch an earlier train, fortunately could use same ticket but the train was overcrowded and of course I had no seat. Spent the entire journey sat on the luggage shelf.

items.title: Credit where credit is due
items.review_text: Credit where credit is due! I was in the 9.30am from London to Glasgow today when there was a medical emergency in my carriage. Credit to the staff on board who worked quickly and calmly ensuring the passenger had the best care they could find from other passengers who were doctors and nurses, arranging an emergency stop at crew where paramedics could take over!

items.title: Please bring back Virgin
items.review_text: Train to London cancelled due to strike, so we had to drive. Two stars instead of just one, as the refund was prompt.

items.title: Train was cancelled and poor service.
items.review_text: Train was cancelled and poor service.

items.title: Travelling from Crewe to Glasgow
items.review_text:
Travelling from Crewe to Glasgow. After the strike and 24 hour delay I boarded the 10.08 service to Glasgow Central it was an old train very uncomfortable orange seats dirty, no catering service.overcrowded. 
 We arrive Preston are told none of the toilets are working so we were transferred to another train to continue our journey. I was glad it was a newer train better decor and new seats however these seats were so hard and uncomfortable much like low cost airline seats. Is this really the best Avanti can offer the level of service does not reflect the high fares. 
I would also add the coach was noisy terrible rattling. Surely in 2023 we can travel by train in quiet trains

items.title: If I’m being quite honest
items.review_text:
If I’m being quite honest, this train service was utterly atrocious. Got stuck in Edinburgh and had to make the choice between getting a 17 hour bus ride home or staying overnight, we opted to to stay as It would literally be quicker to walk home to North Wales from Scotland rather than take the bus. When we got on the train this morning, we made it as far as Preston before the train got terminated (deserving of a Nobel Prize when you consider how bad British transport services are) even though the journey was awful, it was made up for by the wonderful train manager who I believe was called Derek, who remained enthusiastic despite probably being stressed out of his mind- hope he has a beer when he gets home, he deserves it. What a legend. But long story short do not get on an Avanti West Coast Train unless you want to spend days of your life in deep thought as to why you’ve made this horrendous decision, perhaps consider riding thousands of miles via unicycle instead as it would probably be more efficient and much cheaper- final shout out to Derek, but pls Rishi can you fund some trains now not being funny but I’ve had enough. 
Xoxo Jaime

items.title: Cancelled, delayed & overcrowded
items.review_text: Cancelled, overcrowded and overpriced trains. I take Avanti West Coast train from Rugby to London just 2 days a week for my work. Every week there is either a delay or cancelled train which causes overcrowding. This means I have to stand for 53 minutes before I get to work in the mornings or after work. Worst thing is I am paying about £42 a day for a train ticket for a 53 minute journey (this is with a railcard). This is when I take the off peak train. Would cost be above £60 if I could take the train I wanted to. I wake up at 6:30am and get home at 8:15pm everyday I go into work. Usually even later with the delays. This is by far the worst train company I’ve ever used.

items.title: First class rip off - don’t waste your money…
items.review_text: Booked a first class return ticket from Wolverhampton to London for a birthday treat. First train cancelled - an omen for the day to come. Looked forward to the free food, delivered to your seat. Don’t waste your money. Going was ok though nothing special but coming back there was no food, drink or table service. What exactly are you paying a premium for? Never again. All part of the rip-off London experience I guess. Don’t bother.

items.title: Light touch to Anti-Social behaviour
items.review_text: I don't understand why an abusive and potentially violent man was allowed to roam about our carriage on his own terms? An announcement was made over the tannoy about his anti-social behaviour, but he was not restrained in any way. I had the misfortune to be in the same carriage as the individual concerned on the journey between Warrington and Stafford (Edinburgh Waverley to London Euston 18:52 service). Let me tell you that it was extremely unnerving seeing a man repeatedly headbut a toilet door, ask people for drugs, swear profusely and prevent other travellers from walking down the aisle. I am amazed and thankful that nobody was hurt. What I can't get my head around is why he was simply left to his own devices? Is it company policy to allow anti-social behaviour on trains to occur unabated? A new light touch approach? I assume (and hope) the individual was arrested at Stafford station as there was a police presence. What I can't understand is why nothing was actioned on the train to keep myself and other travellers safe?

items.title: Absolutely a joke service
items.review_text: Absolutely a joke service, I'm sick of cancelation and delays. Then they have nerve to advertise their horrible services on TV and online! Their management should be jailed

items.title: Staff wonderful but trains look dirty…
items.review_text: Staff wonderful but trains look dirty and it’s bloody hot and uncomfortable . For the price from Glasgow . Poor . Are we in the 21st century . Uncomfortable

items.title: Train broken down!!!
items.review_text: Train broken down from London to Birmingham! Completely ruining my plans for the evenings which they obviously couldn't care about. Spent an hour trying to reset the system which had no effect and only now are the getting a train to drag us to Rugby!!! What an absolute joke of service. Shambles

items.title: No seat and rude staff
items.review_text: There was no seat for me on the train, I walked the entire length of it with a suitcase, backpack and handbag and I had to stand by the toilet from Euston to Liverpool. Staff were rude and unhelpful. The app is useless, I couldn’t reserve a seat as I had a printed ticket. Just ridiculous. I will do my best to not use Avanti West Coast ever again. I’d rather have a longer journey!

items.title: 5 stars for member of staff.
items.review_text:
I wasn't sure how to leave direct feedback on the avanti website, so this will have to be the next best thing! 

Myself and children used the avanti service recently and had family pleasant journey. 

When we arrived at Birmingham International we were running late and in a huge panic and stress. We were greeted by the only available member of staff " denver? " in all my years of using transport, I've never received the level of customer service from an individual! What a genuinely caring and knowledgeable member bee of staff. Thankyou again denver you really really reassured myself and children. I hope this reaches you.

items.title: They hold your money for 30 days for no reason!
items.review_text:
Attempted two bookings worth £426 each , and they held the money. I contacted CS and they said that the payment was ringfenced and that the money would be refunded within the next 30 days!! 

This means that the website doesn't work, they take our money and then we just have to sit and wait and try to book the train through a different channel.

items.title: NEVER USE AVANTI
items.review_text: We were 5 minutes early for our train and they RFUSED to let me and my CRYING child on a train before it even left.NEVER USE THEM

items.title: Send in the clowns
items.review_text: Driver was late for the train, now being turned back to our place of departure… Absolute clown show.

items.title: Dreadful trains with dirty seats
items.review_text: Dreadful trains with dirty seats, rude staff especially ticket staff at Euston who shouted rather than helped. Worst of all there are no other choices if you have to travel from Preston or Manchester! One star is much too generous but no other option!

items.title: Arrogant staff!
items.review_text: Your staff (the ones who check tickets) are so arrogant and unprofessional. They act as if people are crossing into another country's borders! They feel like they have so much power, as if they get to decide whether to let me in or not! Absolutely disgusting! Humble yourselves because one day a machine will replace you all!

items.title: Standing room only on a 2h train to…
items.review_text: Standing room only on a 2h train to London.  Awesome.   Carriage was hot as hell even in October.

items.title: Departments blaming each others
items.review_text:
At station they told me that the refund for a train strike had to be done online.


Online they told me it had to be done at train station.

I lost time, some 8 emails back and forth. 4 journeys back to the original station.and the money for the ticket.


Ref: AWC-CR-2054575 (this is only one of the 8 reference tickets I was given

items.title: Cancelled train
items.review_text: Cancelled train,  no ones available to assist. Absolutely terrible

items.title: Avanti just begging to lose the franchise.
items.review_text:
22 minutes ago
NEW
Staff are beyond awful. Obnoxious and unhelpful.
Tonight’s Avanti disaster was a signal problem which cancelled or severely delayed several trains leaving passengers stranded without an idea of how they were getting home for hours.
I very calmly and politely spoke to one of the staff on the platform at Lancaster and asked him advice on how to continue my journey.
He was very dismissive and short with me, as I had seen him be with the woman before, and he just blamed the passengers for overcrowding trains.
I said that the passengers were only concerned about getting home, because trains kept being delayed over and over before being cancelled last minute so I wasn’t surprised that people were piling on and said that it’s not their fault. The guy just walked off with a smirk on his face.
I’m sorry but I work in customer service and, it’s tough, I get it! I’ve had people complain to me about things that were beyond my control over and over again and I have never walked off on them like this before. I wasn’t even having a go at him. I just simply said it’s not right to blame passengers.
Not a good ambassador for your company at all.

items.title: Forced to buy another ticket because my…
items.review_text:
Forced to buy another ticket because my return ticket wouldn't work even though it was showing on my app, apparently due to a system fault, £90.  Otherwise they weren't letting me on the train. I couldn't get home, not ideal when 20 weeks pregnant!! Not only this but I was shouted at my an Avanti ticket checker at Euston, so unprofessional and I don't need this abuse.
I am now having to wait for a cheque as 'compensation' of the value of the ticket, this should be a refund, ridiculous! But apparently its on a different payment system, how can a company be so fractioned?!!  How would someone that is on the breadline afford to do this and then to wait.  Really disappointed

items.title: Transport Secretary rewards Avanti’s appalling service!
items.review_text:
Journeys on Avanti continue to be unreliable and allowance always has to be made for trains being cancelled/delayed when booking a train. Avanti are STILL citing shortage of staff as one of their many excuses. Services are then overcrowded as a result (sometimes dangerously so), wifi doesn’t work properly on the trains, catering is often inadequate and payments can’t always be made by card because of the wifi, the website doesn’t operate efficiently, seat reservations are absent on the overhead screens causing chaos. The list goes on! Worse is when you discover on arrival at Euston that the Glasgow train will be starting at Preston. I use this service very frequently and am sick to death of it. We’re being encouraged to use public transport to get us off the roads but what incentive is there? 
Have just read today that the Transport Secretary, in his infinite wisdom, has extended Avanti’s franchise contract by a further 3 years because of their improvement. Words totally fail me and clearly he doesn’t have to endure the shambolic service provided by this totally inept company. This is the 21st century for God’s sake but it might as well be the 18th.

items.title: Avoid Avanti if you take your health and safety seriously.
items.review_text: The most apalling service and very, very serious and dangerous safety implications. Avoid Avanti West Coast at all costs if you have regard for personal safety.

items.title: Got on the Avanti West Coast Service…
items.review_text:
Got on the Avanti West Coast Service from Edinburgh to Preston @ 10:58. I was anxious about how the service was going to be like.  I was in first class all the journey and what a pleasure the service was. 

I’ll like to thank Joanne for a 120% service from the first second I step onto the train till the last second. She walked up and down constantly (not sure what her step count would be, but probably pretty high) every time she passed a passenger, Joanne greeted everyone with a smile. Even when she had to help with an elderly gentleman with the toilet buttons. 

Also the service was spot on from the timing of arrival and departure. 
Reading through the other reviews I couldn’t match this service to anyone’s experience. They must have had a bad day or got out the wrong side of the bed. 

Thankyou 10:58 team from Haymarket for a fantastic faultless service.

items.title: Cancelled train from London Euston to…
items.review_text: Cancelled train from London Euston to Edinburgh on Friday 22.09.23, instead telling us that the train will be terminating at Preston due to short staff, no notice given, a nightmare journey home for us.

items.title: Very poor customer service
items.review_text:
Very poor customer service. 
Paid for a first class upgrade - no food or drink offered for first part of journey. 
Was told at Crewe by a very surly and disinterested train manager that they were short staffed and food would be available  after Preston. No one appeared after that, no staff made any announcements. No service of any sort all the way to Glasgow.
Contacted customer arrived while didn’t apologise, didn’t read my complaint as they answered a completely different point. 
Lazy. Indifferent service - worst I have experienced in many years of rail travel.  Avoid if you can but as they have a monopoly on this route, they don’t care about customers or how poor their service and staff are.

items.title: Hundreds of passengers abandoned at Preston
items.review_text:
18:30 Train from Eus to Glasgow cancelled. Utter chaos at the station!
No tannoy at Eus explaining tickets remain valid, refused seat reservations on next train
They then board us all on the 19:30 to then tell us there are issues north of Preston. At 18:30 the east coast route could have been an option!
But their incompetence doesn’t stop there. Two hours into the journey they decide to take a count of passengers proceeding north, to then get us to Preston at 11pm and tell us there’s no onward travel. Train drivers have worked their hours and staff hadn’t the common sense or foresight to arrange buses.
Several hundred folk now left abandoned on trains!
No refreshments offered, train is hot and crowded.
Absolute disgrace and Avanti you really fail to get the most basic things right.

items.title: Awful service and difficult for people with a disability. You should be ashamed!!
items.review_text:
booking a direct train from Chester to London is important due to disability and difficulty in changing trains. Last minute cancellation, no assistance provided, caused me to rush around the best I could to try and find a replacement train causing undue stress and physical pain. Their answer to my complaint was to use the pre arranged disability help!! how can I pre book it if its cancelled minutes before the train is due!!!
Disgraceful service.

items.title: Honestly, terrible
items.review_text: Honestly, terrible! I don't think I have had a single journey in the last two years that hasn't be cancelled or disrupted in some way. The trains are hot, overcrowded and dirty. Terrible service with an expensive price tage. Avoid, avoid, avoid

items.title: Poor
items.review_text: Seats reserved with trainline not reserved. Inadequate luggage storage for long distance journey. WiFi poor. No staff presence.

items.title: Poor and expensive service
items.review_text:
For the past three years I’ve needed to travel up and down the country with Avanti every 2-3 weeks. It’s generally a terrible service, very poor compared to the previous Virgin trains. 
Tickets are expensive: there is poor availability for any deals and sometimes tickets are only available a few days in advance, which makes it difficult to plan.  Delays are frequent and over half of my journeys are delayed enough to claim compensation. There are many other problems - the Wi-Fi is often not available/patchy, plug sockets not working, coffee machine is broken, food/drinks not available, dirty toilets. (Today we have all of these problems, plus delays). 
Some of the staff are quite nice - that is the only positive thing I can find to say about this company. 
I look forward to the day they lose the franchise - wish I could give them a minus score!

items.title: Train full up with people standing…
items.review_text: Train full up with people standing everywhere on the train. Half the train is first class and the ticket inspector wouldn’t let us stand in between the first class doors and standard. Also first class was empty while people in standard couldn’t move

items.title: How the hell does an any permitted…
items.review_text:
How the hell does an any permitted route ticket when using the app to book and it selects group saver for you to help you save money.

Only to find there are only two routes and Avanti won’t allow this ticket.

Is this a scam or just bad miss selling

items.title: Antiquated delay repay service in…
items.review_text: Antiquated delay repay service in comparison with LNER who send you an unprompted e-mail immediately confirming they are refunding all or part of the fare without you having even to make a claim. Avanti require you to register specifically for automated delay repay that still takes three days to process, or you must submit a claim and they will let you know in three weeks. Meanwhile they sit on the payment they get from Network Rail to whom the delay was attributed.

items.title: A gamble
items.review_text: Cancelled train due to no staff, that and the strikes which cancelled my return journey. Cannot trust the rail network, how can we ever give up cars with this nonsense.

items.title: Ever more expensive for same useless service
items.review_text:
Here we go again with Avanti. I've just booked to go down to London for a weekend, which is circa 7 weeks away. I booked the outbound fare as soon as it came out over a week ago, have been hanging around for the return ticket to be released as it is engineering-work affected. Turns out that despite being this far out, it is only £6 more to fly back (staggeringly - cheaper had I flown at a different time), so that's what I'll be doing. 

Circa £75 for a (very) advanced return, it can't have been that much more than that for an on the day off peak fare when Virgin had it. You could certainly get a return for significantly less when booked at the earliest opportunity. The fact Avanti have just had the contract significantly extended beggars belief - driving is now a better option if I'm going with the family, and these sort of prices will simply be out of reach for low income families.

I have noted that there is now a £20 "Superfare" if you are very flexible what time you travel. Superfare at risk of not being available during engineering works according to the FAQ's so I couldn't afford to hold on and have to extend my mortgage for a not-quite-so-advanced fare nearer the time if the "Superfare" was unavailable. Additionally, if I go with family then the Superfare FAQ's state "little ones need a Superfare ticket too at the same price as an adult". So would I have to pay £40 each way for a 3 year old and 1 year old who would otherwise have travelled for free - completely removing any benefit (also no guarantee of being in the same carriage, ahhhh that's ok I'll just stick the baby at the other end of the train should I)? Or are the FAQ's just woefully inadequate? The mind boggles.

items.title: Thank you to the Avanti staff!
items.review_text: I just left my jacket on the Glasgow bound train. The Avanti staff at Preston were so helpful. Jess went above and beyond to communicate with staff members at other stations and was able to have my jacket returned safely to me only half an hour later by having it brought back on another train. Every Avanti member of staff I interacted with was so understanding and helpful so I felt like I had to give some recognition!! :)

items.title: If I could rate this company minus…
items.review_text: If I could rate this company minus stars I would, biggest load of freeloading rail company c***s out there. To make matters worse they still pay inordinate dividends to shareholders year after year despite horrific service. Symbolic of the wider issues of privately run railways, nationalise now.

items.title: Why is it ALWAYS so hot on these…
items.review_text:
Why is it ALWAYS so hot on these trains??? Every single god damn time. It feels like they are pumping straight lava through the radiators!!

If I wanted to be a rotisserie chicken I'd have gone to M & S

items.title: Website is awful
items.review_text: Website is awful, took a payment twice and couldn’t process. Payments are held for several days before being returned. Better to book through another train company or train line.

items.title: This train servcie is always delayed or…
items.review_text:
This train servcie is always delayed or cancel last minute.Could not even get refunds as customer servcie is appaling.the government must scrap this company.hopeless service and company.they are making huge profit by delaying and cancelling and we cant even get refunds in time.the deadline is 28 days which if you miss you lose all your money.
on 21.8,they cancelled euston train due to technical fault.I had to take a taxi to airport which cost me 4 times the ticket.on so many occasions they delay the train service as their staff are late or having a lay in. at home.

items.title: Running late, BUT…
items.review_text: Very pleased with service from Avanti staff tonight. Would have been stuck halfway down the country if not. Despite trains running late they were able to hold my connecting service (when connecting from another provider) as well as staff at Warrington Bank Quay staying late to keep the station open to let passengers off the train. Very grateful and well done Avanti.

items.title: West midlands trains are expensive
items.review_text:
West midlands railways trains are a dreadful service  expensive and pretty much useless  one facility we expect for our money is free wifi and phone charging points which are everywhere yet .. guess what they are switched off 
We complained to the ticket manager yet he just said if we are not happy put a complaint in...so here it is ..we know all this lazy man has to do is tell the driver to switch it on..but he couldn't be bothered. Avanti trains are so much better, more expensive but better service and quality.

items.title: The staff on the train Nick the…
items.review_text: The staff on the train Nick the assistant service manager was brilliant on the route from North Wales to London.

items.title: Quite possibly the worst website and…
items.review_text: Quite possibly the worst website and app experience I've ever had

items.title: Good
items.review_text:
My experience with Avanti if you exclude the unfathomably bad seats on the refurbished trains has been nothing but positive. Train was always on time and got there very quickly. 
They are very expensive, however. Carrying a bike isn't as big a problem as, say, Crosscountry, even if you take into account the mandatory reservations. 
The ex-Virgin non-refurbished sets are by far the most comfortable trains on the entire UK network. The refurbished sets have seats which I find much less comfortable than even Thameslink's seats! It is rather inexplicable why companies do this.

items.title: Shocking customer service at Carlisle…
items.review_text: Shocking customer service at Carlisle from a 'team leader' with an 'avanti' uniform. He won't be smirking when customers abandon his overpriced and unreliable Avanti franchise and he gets made redundant because people would literally rather walk than use this parasitic company.

items.title: The train was on time
items.review_text: The train was on time. It was clean and was very busy. The refreshment bar was expensive but OK. The seat was the most uncomfortable thing I have ever come across making resting impossible. Ergonomically horrible! Overall uncomfortable but not too bad!

items.title: First Class was First Class!
items.review_text: Came home to Glasgow from Manchester this evening. First class was absolutely first class! Very clean and comfortable with excellent service, very tasty food a very well stocked bar! Worth the money and a different league to first class on Transpennine express who were awful. Worth every penny Avanti! Excellent service.

items.title: Thank you and well done to AVANTI!
items.review_text:
I needed a return journey from Stockport to London. Timings weren’t a priority for me so I took advantage of reduced prices on trains after 11.00.
I have a Senior Railcard. I reserved a seat in Standard Premium.
My train to London was delayed by 30 minutes, no bother to me, I was meeting my son for dinner so no problem.
My return journey set off promptly but lost time during the journey, only 5 minutes late arriving at Stockport.
Checking my email during the journey, Avanti had posted me an email apologising for the original delay and offered me a refund of £18.84
In total I have paid just over £62 for a First Class Return Ticket.
Oh and I got a free coffee because I have Avanti Silver Card Membership 
1. It’s the BARGAIN OF THE YEAR
2. Well done Avanti on great communication 
3. The trains are clean and very comfortable 
Thank you Avanti, I know you have critics but I’m not one of them. 
Brilliant service.

items.title: Hideous Experience: Upgraded to sit surrounded by loud staff slagging off passengers
items.review_text: Upgraded to Standard Premium only to be surrounded by excitable staff travelling to other locations - but in uniform. Very animated conversations about dumb customers and generally talking shop. It was like the staff break out room! I mentioned this to the manager while he checked my tickets, but instead of doing anything, he later joined in with the mayhem. Clearly they were entitled and I was in the wrong!  I was pretty much surrounded for the best part of two hours. I contacted customer resolutions who sent back the usual scripted responses with the usual gaslighting phrases.
