I ask for the complaint to be escalated but instead the same person repeated the same response and added the ludicrous suggestion 'I could have called the British Transport Police'. When the complaint was escalated I was assured it would not happen again. No partial refund or compensation because the staff were the problem. Basically, it was just my bad luck to have been stuck with them. So now the Standard Premium upgrade is apparently a lottery.  Quite how it can be so much more expensive yet worse than Virgin Trains is a mystery. Loathsome company.

items.title: Weekend trip to Liverpool
items.review_text: Myself and my husband recently had a no nonsense no problems, all on time, air conditioned journey to and from Euston to Lime Street Liverpool. Journey was approx 2 hours 2 minutes both ways. We did take our own lunch on board, so had no need to seek out the food that was on offer on the train. We had weekend cases which fitted in the overhead rack perfectly. There are plug sockets and a little useful pull out table. Booked our tickets on line about a month before. Overall it was a good journey for us.

items.title: AVOID AT ALL COSTS
items.review_text:
AVOID AT ALL COSTS! 
I used the ticket  machine in London Euston to buy a ticket for Wigan but the machine didn't print any ticket I got charged for it, when I asked 2 member of staffs, they said, in the rudest way possible, that it already happened before and I will get a refund in 2 working days but I didn't get any refund! So I lost my £72.20!

items.title: Service level below total bottom.
items.review_text: After buying a ticket on the Avanti West Coast website, the effect is that I do not have a ticket and I do not have the money that they took for the ticket. No contact, no existing forms of contact. They should be banned from selling anything, scammers

items.title: Hard to see how it could be worse
items.review_text: Hard to see how it could be worse, our seat had no window for a trip through the lakes, the air con didnt work so hot through out the train and the train stunk of toilets , add to this the tilting train effect and its the reason why i havent used avanti / virgin for decades , Cant see i ever would again. Designed as a torture device rather than a mode of travel. For delay repay keep copies and go via the rail ombudsman when their automated system refuses to pay or work.

items.title: Overpriced, delays and cancellations
items.review_text: Bring back Virgin Trains! I use the west coast often to visit Manchester. Cancellations, lack of drivers, poor onboard service, strikes, delays and TOTALLY OVERPRICED. Are we subsidising Italian train services by extortionate UK prices? Undervalued staff who are demoralised and it shows. The last 2 journeys no onboard cafe due to “health and safety” No hot water basically. Premium economy? Pointless! Carriages are empty. I have no confidence in purchasing as the disruptions are ongoing.

items.title: Awful
items.review_text: Awful, I had a reserved seat, it was taken and the train was full, I was very lucky someone got up for me..

items.title: I wouldn't put aventi out with a…
items.review_text: I wouldn't put aventi out with a cricket bat if they were on fire. we're stuck at Liverpool Queensway waiting for a coach to take us home to Crewe due to an incident on the line. we've been waiting over 45 minutes for a coach that looks like it'll never get here, station staff have NO information to give that's worth a monkey. screw you Avanti , I know what the incident is supposed to be, you should have contingency plane that WORKS.

items.title: STRIKE REFUND DELAY
items.review_text: Requested refund due to strike action over 10 working days ago. STILL awaiting payment.

items.title: 3 times Charges left account with no ticket
items.review_text:
THREE different times I’ve been charged and no ticket given. Been told it will return after up to two weeks. This isn’t the case.  I’ve had to phone my bank and tell them. Halifax were reluctant to cancel the transaction as this has happened three time now.
Customer service told me it only happens to a small amount of customers. My ticket costs around £110 upwards so I just need to buy another ticket - most of the time I don’t have the money for another ticket.

The one star review is for not sorting this IT issue out in three months the customer service is generally ok and well meaning .

items.title: I placed an order for standard tickets…
items.review_text: I placed an order for standard tickets (cheapest available), reserved seats and authorised payment via banking app with no issue, but the Avanti App displays the processing icon for 20mins without response. I checked my banking App and £0.01 had been requested, but not the full fare and No order. The order did not go through and when I attempted again, NO seats available!!! I have had to pay £51 for premium seats and that order went through perfectly and immediately… feels like I have been robbed!!

items.title: This company is a thief
items.review_text:
This company is a thief. Sells tickets knowing that they are on strike that day and then refuse to give a refund.
Shame on you Avanti.

items.title: Improve the dismal food menu
items.review_text:
Always aim to travel first class from Manchester to London. Friendly and excellent service on train today.
The one star is really about the poor food available - I have been vegetarian since 1971 and the food options remain limited. Cheese toasties ran out halfway through coach j - vegan cauliflower rice salad is a dismal excuse for food. 2 choices available for meat eaters - no cheese and biscuits or alternative sandwichs on the menu - unless I paid out more from the onboard shop. 11.15am from Manchester. Regular first travellers to London.

items.title: Accused me of lying about the length of…
items.review_text: Accused me of lying about the length of delay for train that I was on and are not paying the appropriate compensation. Just another addition to the long list of terrible dealings I’ve had with this company. Avoid using them if you can.

items.title: AVOID IF YOU VALUE YOUR HEALTH…
items.review_text:
Only gave 1 star because they don't have a zero option. Although the star goes to the train staff, they deserve a medal.
They cancelled one train London to Glasgow and put all the passengers on an already full train, so no seats. Air conditioning packed in so people were almost passing out.  Couldn't move out of the carriage as too many people blocking the passageway and doors.  At one point we were standing in the 'bendy' bit joining the carriages.  They then proceeded to stop and let more passengers on at various points!!!  Eventually gave us a new train at Preston and guess what - SAME NUMBER OF CARRIAGES- so standing all the way to Carlisle.  And when you complain and tell them you will never use them again they send you an email saying this is acceptable because if the train is too full it cuts out and won't move, and here's a code for 25% off your next trip!!!!! If you value your health please please please give Avanti a miss

items.title: Avanti West Coast is really a good…
items.review_text: Avanti West Coast is really a good service. They might be delayed that might be because of overhead wire damage which isn't their fault. People might say its over crowded so is every other train company when it gets too many passengers aka the London underground sometimes? And their refurbished pendilinos absolutely look great and luxury with a comfy seat. Wth sockets at every seat.

items.title: Bring back Virgin Trains
items.review_text: I booked a first class return from London to Manchester costing me, £240. I get on the train and they don’t offer the service due to staff shortage, What a rip-off. Honestly Virgin Trains were a lot better ￼

items.title: Smelly carriage, cramped and discomfort
items.review_text: Smelly carriage. Train carpets are filthy. AC in the train was at very low temperature and there were only two outlets of AC air that was blown-in therefore if you’re underneath it you’d be certainly falling ill. Cramped seating arrangements with very little leg space both in front and sideways with the person next to you. Very little luggage space therefore people were carrying luggage with them in carriages which resulted in very little walking room and discomfort in moving about where people carrying hot drink had accidents. Logistical issues when you want to upgrade in the same train. All in all the standards are in shambles.

items.title: Great service by Nadine Preece at…
items.review_text: Great service by Nadine Preece at avanti, she was absolutely amazing with her customer service. Many thanks for looking after me :).

items.title: Avoid if possible
items.review_text: Set off around twenty minutes late. Barely standing room on train. Two hours to be able to sit on the floor, three to get a seat. Smelly carriages. Do only if no feasible alternative.

items.title: Shout out to Shannon
items.review_text: Shannon was a massive help and really reassured us with a professional manner, patience and understanding.

items.title: Euston
items.review_text: 26 minutes late from London Euston. Train was an old diesel Voyager, windows absolutely filthy and you could hardly see out, rubber seals cut and torn, hadn't been cleaned for weeks. Table sticky and damaged and this was in First Class.

items.title: Appalling. Just Appalling.
items.review_text:
9 hours late into Euston. Signal failure at Carstairs was not AWC's fault, everything else was. 7 hours in a line at Glasgow. No information given. Train Manager was in the 4th dimension. Train terminates at Crewe. No information given. 1.5 hours in Crewe. Unhelpful staff, no information, and customer service I can't rate low enough.

DO. NOT. TRAVEL. ON. AVANTI. WEST. COAST.

items.title: Ticket >£300 for delays on a disgusting train
items.review_text: On the train now from London Euston to Liverpool lime street. Train in a dirty shambolic state with tables appearing to have never been cleaned, torn seats, most of the loos out of order and smelling really bad. The whole thing is like a breeding ground for disease. Also, train running an hour late and this is on top of delays to the journey to London. Ticket price? Over £300. Absolutely disgraceful

items.title: hard to claim compensation
items.review_text: The original train was cancelled due to a fault. So we switched to another train , making us nealy an hour late. Had such a hard time filling ot the compensation form. So much information required. It has to easier.

items.title: If I could give Zero star ⭐️ I would but…
items.review_text:
If I could give Zero star ⭐️ I would but unfortunately it’s not an option. 
I had to use the Avanti train from Coventry to Birmingham new street back in November 2022 however my complaint is still ongoing but until now it hasn’t been resolved even when I contacted the Rail Ombudsman. My account issue was with the service over all, the number of passengers on board, no seats available at all, passengers are standing in the aisles also sitting on the floor everywhere even between the carriages where no one supposed to sit or even stand there for the health and safety reasons. Unfortunately even the health and safety was not considered by them both ways. 
When we arrived Coventry I went straight to the member of staff who was standing by the platform to tell him and inform him with the situation on board but unfortunately he did not care at all even when I mentioned that the health and safety procedures were not there so he looked at me then replied; “Stay at home and don’t go out to use our trains”

I was in shock to hear that from a member of staff of Avanti train by the way his name was Gabriel. 

In conclusion;
Very poor service 
No professionalism
Rude staff 
Breach of health and safety

items.title: Avanti defrauded me…
items.review_text: I booked return tickets for standard premium due to disability. Return journey was automatically booked as standard. Online app offered me free upgrade but app was down and had to contact customer services. Was told to rebook premium standard and they would refund me fully and on return call to get the refund the idiot I spoke to just wouldn’t listen and refunded half so I ended up paying more for my free upgrade. This is fraud.

items.title: Ticket inspector noticed i was on the…
items.review_text:
Ticket inspector noticed i was on the 11:55 from manchester piccadilly to euston, I should of been in the , 11:35, i got this train as directed by the staff on the platform, genuine mistake and not really my mistake, I was charged £10 per ticket x 4 so £40, when i challenged it she said she'd increase it to £200, she had also just charged 2 other customers £190 each for their mistakes.

Seems she could of really let it slide with no consequence but obviously loves her job and power.

how people like this sleep at night is amazing

items.title: Amazing
items.review_text: I Love the trains

items.title: Not only is the first class lounge no…
items.review_text: Not only is the first class lounge no longer operating at Runcorn, after a long trip in Glasgow why am I surprised the lounge here is not open either🤬 You pay your money and get 💩 dreadful again, poor,poor,poor!

items.title: Absolutely awful
items.review_text: Absolutely awful. Avanti are criminals for ruining a public infrastructure in this way.

items.title: Total garbage
items.review_text: The Avanti West Coast website is an instrument of torture developed in the seventh circle of hell. I wouldn't wish it on my worst enemy.

items.title: Train itself was ok but the buffet bar…
items.review_text: Train itself was ok but the buffet bar needs upgrading. There's not much selection... I was only going 1hr so a sandwich is ok, but I would hate to have to go all the way to Glasgow with just a sandwich...

items.title: Awful staff
items.review_text:
Awful staff, rude & miserable.

I think they try to minimise how many drinks/nibbles you have in first class. 
I won’t be travelling by train again, I don’t want to be served by people like this again (lady with long grey plaited hair and tall ginger partly bald guy).   Change your staff.
£412 first class tickets.. rip off

items.title: Just travelled on a avanti train from…
items.review_text: Just travelled on a avanti train from London euston to birmingham . I was charged twice  £15 upgrade to standard premium two seperate payments of £15 . I am one person and have my reciept.

items.title: Who's in charge of this terrible train company?
items.review_text: Once again train is delayed from Euston to preston.where again we miss our connection. The 1830 train from Euston to Preston last night had no food onboard toilet didn't work.& No air conditioning.it was overcrowded with only 9 coaches in stead of 11 awful service.

items.title: Be warned when buying a first class ticket
items.review_text:
Be warned when buying a first class ticket with Avanti West Coast, I bought a first class ticket at £130.00, the standard class ticket for the same day was £76.00   
(that's a difference of £54.00)
Avanti West Coast declassified my first class ticket to a standard class ticket on the day of travel. Applied for a refund for my first class ticket and got a refund of only  £33.00. That's £21 less than the price a standard ticket would have cost me.

items.title: The worst service I've experienced in…
items.review_text:
The worst service I've experienced in my 60 years.
Mum died suddenly so we decided to go to the Hypodrome in Birmingham as a treat.
Booked Avanti WC 1st class for 2.
Arrived at station.... Train cancelled that morning, no contact.
So we went on the 1 hour later train.
Warrington bank que to Birmingham, not a chance!
So he's the quick sum up....
Warrington Bank Quay > Crewe change train >diverted Alsager >put on the wring train by avanti platform assistant >cross country train, no 1st class and had to pay £34 > Train delayed due to broken down train in the same track > Brimington arrival 1425 hrs, left at 1130 hrs, arrived at Hypodrome at 1445, missed the play by nearly 1 hour so we didn't bother..... Stuck in Birmingham until 1800 hrs for our return
On board no 1st class service
The whole day was a joke
I've complained but they clised the complaint.... Why?. I'll never know.
Complained and opened the case again, that was April and still no response, we're in August now.
The whole package cost was £288,we has NO 1st class throughout the journey.. DO NOT BOTHER, The contact number hangs up too!

items.title: An appalling service, hopeless conservative governments
items.review_text: An appalling service, trains cancelled with very little notice. Very expensive, door entering carriage b broken so people in the carriage had to keep letting people in, what a safety hazard! Of course they are still using the old virgin  stock, the seats must be the most uncomfortable ever designed for the long London to Manchester route. Cost £ 212 return for less then standard comfort. This is the result of privatised monopolies allowed to make huge profit out of the UK public without delivering reasonable services. How can business people commute on this basis? The 14 years of poor quality Conservative governments are to blame.

items.title: Why did you replace Virgin with Avanti?!
items.review_text: It isn’t often I feel compelled to leave a review on here however I now feel the need, what the government were thinking from a customer service perspective in replacing Virgin with Avanti is mind boggling… Cancellation and delays happening far too often, guess I’m unlucky, today had train cancelled and delayed all part of the norm… However 1st class, no power points working in carriage ask member of staff and get told sorry you will need to speak to train manager as that is his department, leading to my main issue despite delays quality of service and food/drinks was always spot on with Virgin and seriously lacking these days with Avanti which I guess is linked to best priced service on government decision vs. customer service… lessons to be learnt!

items.title: I'm reluctant to give even one star to…
items.review_text:
I'm reluctant to give even one star to this'clown like' train operator.
In late July of 2023I had cause to complaint to avanti west coast trains (I think they may outsource their received complaints to another complaint handlig company?)
I complained about a member of their platform access barrier staff at Birmingham New Street station. Virgin staff no longer operate the barriers there.
I had a reply from avanti west coast who suggested I refer the referred thematter to network rail, avanti claimed, they - network rail, man the barriers at this train station in Birmingham.
Its avanti staff who man the barriers at thst rail station and their uniforms and ID badge that confirm they man the barriers there.
So, avanti have no idea that their staff man the barriers at Birmingham New Steet station? Rubbish! Seems to me any excuse by avanti want to bypass complaints and/or ignore complaints.
What a rubbish train operator indeed. I've quit fully using avanti train services here on.

I've had to complain about staff at Birmingham New Street station previously. Too many rude staff, clueless staff, etc. This rail station isnt too great at the best of times, I've found, especially since its reopening after modernisation was carried out there a few years ago.
I asked one member of network rails staff where the platform escalators were, recently, his reply was 'I'm not sure'! This train station along with avanti staff and some network rail staff there needs serious reform in my opinion. Bit of a hole there.

items.title: The seat reservation system did not work
items.review_text: The seat reservation system did not work

items.title: Terrible
items.review_text: Terrible. From the timing to the delays to the near cancellation to the arrival. I arrived an hour late. How disgusting of the company.

items.title: Soaked with stale water and they don’t care
items.review_text: Leaky air con unit was pouring stale water over the passengers for a three hour journey and the best the Customer Resolutions Advisor could do was say ‘it’ll be fixed for future journeys’ and refused any refunds

items.title: I'm giving 4 stars - couldn't be more shocked!
items.review_text: I'm in shock - I usually award 1 star.  Avanti have made my journeys a misery from their first taking over, to the point where I only travel with them if I must. And I've complained many times. I travelled Liverpool to London and back last Friday and Monday.  To my amazement, for the very first time, both trains were on time (the outward arrived at Euston 4 minutes early!).  The carriages had undergone a makeover, new(?) dark blue upholstery, clean, comfortable, an in seat plug in and charger, electronic information board, aircon working and just the right temperature.  The shop was open (I never use it, mind).  The staff on the train and at Liverpool were visible and pleasant but not so much at Euston.  I still have a few grouches - the crazy price of the ticket, and the inevitable moron in the quiet coach who insists on gabbing on their mobile throughout the journey.  Sit in another coach, why can't you?  Also the usual scrum boarding at Euston.  Announcing the platform just 7 minutes before departure is too late for anyone who's not a trained sprinter, and keeping the ticket gates shut so that everyone has to get their phones out or push through paper tickets that don't open the gates adds to the mayhem.

items.title: Doesn't like Welsh people
items.review_text:
I thought the government gave avanti a six months contract renewal if they resumed direct trains to north wales? So why are there no direct trains to north wales? Virgin had 3-5 a day. The journey took 3.05. Fast train with avanti  is 3.40 and that's with one change. Most require two (Crewe and Chester).  Changes are tight. So tight that my elderly parents won't risk it. You have forced my eight five year okd father to drive the distance! I don't know how anyone with mobility issues can even travel between north wales and london by train. And what about the poor sods who have luggage and want to get the train to Holyhead to catch a ferry to Ireland.
Remove the franchise. 
Welsh people - lobby your Mp!!!!

items.title: I'm here to write a very bad review but…
items.review_text:
I'm here to write a very bad review but after reading all this negative reviews and the service is still s**t what is the point!!! HONESTLY!!!
so on Tuesday 1st August 2023 I went Manchester for an job interview at the prison, due to rushing i left my charger in London, I wasn't allowed bring my phone in the prison so I could asked them to charge it. After finishing my interview I wasn't left kind of stranded and no phone!! My interview finished at 5pm so walked about 40mins before I found a pub which the manager was so lovely she called me an taxi, when I entered the taxi the time was 6:38pm which means I've missed my train for 6:06pm due to issues beyond my control!!! After I got to the station I explained this to one of the workers who was quite sympathetic due to the ordeal I've faced but he apologise because he doesn't work for Avanti he then point me in the direction and said just explained to them what you've told me, they should have procedures for situations like this.
After speaking with Avanti worker she told me it is my responsibility to make sure my phone is charged and that she cannot help me and I need to spend an extra £73 to get to London, mind you I've already spent £103 for a returned trip!! Like I know I missed my train and believed me if I knew where I was I wouldn't have missed it!! They didn't put non of this into consideration i cried and I pleaded that I had no more money to pay £73 for the tkt they then started ignoring me!! The other workers fell so bad and pulled me to one side and said buy yourself a tkt to Stockport which is £2.75 and just board the train and come off im London! I did this then they start treating me like criminal telling they need to see tkt or I won't be allowed to board the train!! Thats when the guy at the information desk called the manager and he was able to get me on a train to Crew and frome Crew to London!! I won't be home until about 1am so I've been left stranded by AVANTI WEST COAST and would of still be stranded if it wasn't for Northern Rail. Avanti west coast is beyond disgusting the thought of them taking my money is actually mind boggling!! Why take the customers money if you can't help your customers in time of need!! I'll NEVER use this service again I rather drive the 4hrs drive before this disgusting company gets another penny out of me!!! Something needs to be done or you A-HOLES need to stop operating because your customer service is beyond abysmal.

items.title: Tried to book train tickets 8 days ago…
items.review_text: Tried to book train tickets 8 days ago money come out of account as pending 8 days later money still not been paid back . Tried to book another journey for September and same thing happened again ,spoke to someone in customer services and got told it can take up to 28 days to be refunded. Avanti west coast shame on you for the services you provide a total shambles , a complete bunch of muppets.

items.title: Awful service..
items.review_text: Awful service... abysmal. Cancelled trains, overcrowded trains, late and delayed trains. Expensive, poor service.

items.title: 18.15 train from Manchester on…
items.review_text:
18.15 train from Manchester on 19thJuly23 2 hours journey. Didn't start until 19.16 Crowded train. Swapped for another train in Milton Keynes. Arrived in London around midnight so no connection. Absolute rubbish service and company. 
Feel for people forced to take employment with this company. Stay clear of them. They are terrible.

items.title: Absolute joke of a service
items.review_text: Absolute joke of a service. Tickets booked with seat numbers. Train arrives 5 minutes late with no carriage letters so nobody knows where to go. Different staff directing to different places. Seats not reserved. Spent the first half an hour standing in a corridor during a free for all.

items.title: Ticket cost increase as their system is broken !!!
items.review_text:
trying to book tickets for 2 trips I have … right through to payment - that’s then declined , though the money is in my account 

Called Avanti , they blamed my bank.. 
my bank ring fenced 2 payments so i had to wait and then my tickets were £20 more expensive for my London journey

Cut to this week and exactly the same again only now my tickets are £50 more expensive… they declined payment 3 times 
called Avanti and they admit they are having issues with their system 

so still not able to book my Edinburgh trip and the costs are going up! 

Never had major issues before but i’m frustrated .. 

and Club Avanti … what a joke 
I’ve travelled a lot and still waiting for that gold member free ticket promised on Club Avanti frequent traveller offer 

Give it back to VIRGIN it was half the price and a much better service

items.title: I travelled from Euston Station…
items.review_text: I travelled from Euston Station onThursday 27th July with my daughter and my grandaughter. (age 19 months). We had missed our 17:43 train to Liverpool Lime street and were quite stressed because we had the baby to look after. A young Avanti employee, who was stationed at the Information Desk, named, Molish (?) helped us so much. He ensured that we boarded the next train available and stayed with us and helped us to board early so that we could be comfortable in the carriage.  Because of his kindness, we will definitely be travelling with Avanti again. Can't thank him enough as it was the first trip for us with my grandaughter.

items.title: This company is beyond trash.
items.review_text: This company is beyond trash. I wish I could give zero stars. Yet again my train with them is delayed by 30 minutes and, consequently, I will miss my last bus and will have to walk home through a very dangerous area. And you are not supposed to get frustrated, angry and abusive. And these useless, uncaring morons are frequently on strike for more money. I wouldn't pay them in brass washers. Utterly useless. One of their staff once told me, after complaining about yet another cancelled service, to "get a car if you don't like it."

items.title: Virgin rules OK
items.review_text: Initially my train was 45 mins late even though it had only travelled 90 miles from Edinburgh to Penrith. I couldn't buy a ticket at the ticket office on the Avanti-run Station and had to wait to be approached by a mobile ticket seller on the platform, also the automatic ticket machine couldn't recognise my destination station. Once on the train it was overcrowded and filthy and when I attempted to purchase a snack from the onboard shop I was very rudely told by the attendant that it was cash only as his card machine wasn't working  and if I didn't have cash it was my fault for not anticipating that situation. The seats smelled of sweat.

items.title: We’re to start… s### service can’t get…
items.review_text: We’re to start… s@@@ service can’t get you to your destination on time made sure to leave a long enough time period between trains (40mins) due to avanti doing what they do best that 40mins wait had now turned to 5 and it takes 10 mins to walk from one station to the other so guess I’ll be missing my connecting train….. and your all striking for extra money when you can’t even do the job in the first place

items.title: Disgusting customer service
items.review_text: Absolutely disgusting treatment of my 15 yr old granddaughter this morning at Coventry station.   She was prevented from catching her train by a jobsworth who told her she shouldn't be travelling alone and if her mother cared about her she would have been there to put her on the train. My granddaughter's parents have both passed away so the remark was hurtful and caused her severe upset. When my granddaughter phoned me in tears I spoke to the member of staff on the phone. She said I should be thanking her as she had a duty of care to my granddaughter to make sure she was safe as she was too young to be travelling alone. The last time I checked,  it is not illegal for a 15 year old to travel on the train alone.  She eventually allowed her to board a train,  but as she was late, she missed her connection at Liverpool Street, so in actual fact she put my granddaughter at risk. I have raised a complaint with Avanti and will be taking the matter further.

items.title: Im a regular traveller with avanti.
items.review_text:
Im a regular traveller with avanti.

I traveled from london euston to stockport on the 16.53 train.

The train was really busy as there had been a couple of cancelations earlier.

Our train manager CHARLENE was fantastic.
(A scottish lady)

She was so lovely/profesional and helpful to everybody making sure people got a seat to travel.

I cant rate her highly enough..

items.title: Seat reservation nonsense
items.review_text: Why do AWC pretend that you can reserve your seat? Travelled twice in last month from WBQ - EUS and reserved a seat in quiet carriage A. On both occasions seat found to occupied by another passenger who has the same seat reserved......

items.title: Customer Service absolutely useless
items.review_text: Absolutely useless customer service. They don't want telephone complaints. They ignore criticism. I called and listened to reams of announcements. Pressed number. Phone went dead. Tried again? About 15 minute wait. No Thankyou. Automatic ticket machines are difficult to use. Far too low. Touch screen does not work with my fingers. Tried three machines. Had to kneel on floor as machines are designed for short people only. None of the machines would work with my fingers on touchscreen. Once again had to get staff help. Absolutely hate travelling this way. If ticket offices shut God help anyone with an issue. Try calling them. A total waste of time. I would give them zero stars if possible. Station staff very helpful. Unlike the management at the top.

items.title: Avanti are much improved since covid
items.review_text: Avanti are much improved since covid. Last 4 trips (Warrington - Penrith, Crewe - London, Crewe - Bham, Wilmslow - London), have all been pretty smooth. Any delays have been no more than 10 mins, i find the staff quite helpful. All these trips were off-peak, in the week (weekends look much less reliable). The newest trains are always much better with loads of chargers - toilets alway smell and wifi is flaky, but overall it beats driving. Great value if you can be flexible.

items.title: The train manager/young lady who checks…
items.review_text: The train manager/young lady who checks the tickets on the 10.58 from Haymarket to Euston,see her every Tuesday,a delightful lady,a credit to Avanti train service.

items.title: When will the Gods deliver us from this woeful company?
items.review_text:
Sing, Goddess, of Avanti's obstinate grasp,
Stern and unyielding, that cost commuters
Immeasurable distress, propelled countless souls
Into the realm of frustration and despair,
Their spirits left to wilt under inflexible ordinances,
As the insatiable lust for profit increased.
Begin with the conflict between Avanti—
The rail overlord—and humble travellers.
Which of the immortals set these two
At each other's throats?

Avanti,
Child of capitalism and bureaucracy, was affronted
By the commuter. The traveller had been wronged
By rigid ticket rules, thus the company
Struck the commuting camp with indignation,
And the travellers were seething with it.

The commuter,
Came before the metallic fortress of Avanti,
Bearing the ticket for his intended journey,
Displaying Avanti's corporate insignia.
He made a formal plea
To the entire railway system, but especially
The executives, those who steer Avanti's course:
"Executives of Avanti and train operators all:
May Lord Chronos, master of time, grant you abundance,
And a reliable network. But grant me my journey,
And accept this ticket out of respect for the commuter, the lifeblood of your service."

A murmur rippled through the masses:
"Respect the traveller, and honour the ticket."

But Avanti was not pleased,
And scorned the commuter with a harsh edict:
"Don't let me ever catch you, traveller, on these rails again,
Changing plans now or seeking flexibility from me.
The company's rules and regulations won't save you this time.
The ticket is set, and your emails will rot in my inbox
Before I let you use an Advance Single ticket on a different train, even though you were delayed into Euston by another train company.
Now clear out of here before you make me angry!"

The traveller was fearful and did as he was told.
He moved in silence along the bustling platform,
And when he had moved a distance, the commuter
Prayed to Lord Chronos, the supreme watcher of time:
"Hear me, Lord of Eternity, Master of the temporal realm,
Guardian of time,
If ever I have contributed to your servants Avanti with fares of gold and silver —
Answer my prayer:
Let Avanti pay for my tears with your intervention!"

Lord Chronos heard his appeal and stirred his powers,
Pulsing with justice,
The echoes of grievances rattling in his ears
As the righteous lord moved like a storm across the nation.
He alighted upon the tracks and let loose a decree.
He targeted the failing services first, and then the rigid policies,
And then directed his lightening-tipped wrath at the corporation
And struck until the fires of change sparked across the rails.

items.title: Trains from London to Manchester are…
items.review_text: Trains from London to Manchester are consistently delayed or cancelled despite the tickets now frequently costing over £100. How is this acceptable? It disgusts me that it is cheaper to fly to Manchester. How can there be any consideration for the environment when this is the case?

items.title: Train departure not advertised, then charged £70 for a new ticket
items.review_text:
I had an advance ticket for a train from London Euston to Manchester Piccadily. When I arrived at Euston in time for the train, it wasn't listed on the departure board. I asked a customer service representative, who said that there was a delay, they weren't sure what was happening and I should await further details on the departure boards. 

I waited, watching the departure boards, listening for announcements and frequently refreshing the National Rail app. The journey wasn't listed on the departure boards and it was just listed as 'Delayed' with no further details on the app. Eventually, the app suddenly changed the status to 'Departed 18 minutes late'. No platform had been displayed or announced.

I went straight to the ticket office and was informed that the train had in fact left. They said that my advance ticket would no longer be valid, so I had to pay £70 for a new one. 

It is completely unacceptable to run late trains, not advertise their departure, then charge exorbitant fees for people to get onto subsequent trains. I have no idea what else I could have done in order to get on this train and avoid a £70 additional fair.

items.title: Train assist team
items.review_text: Disabled relative travelling from Lime St Liverpool to Euston earlier today - the assistance team and those in information were amazing but in particular Ian and Sophie were extremely helpful, professional, respectful and polite - am assuming that your staff in Euston will be likewise when he arrives there at approx 2pm - just a great service which means so much to disabled people as well as their relatives.

items.title: Absolute sh!t
items.review_text: Absolute sh!t. Booked a 2 night break  away in Edinburgh and then they cancel the train less than an hour before we set off.

items.title: Shocking company
items.review_text:
Shocking company, so unbelievably bad. Trains full to capacity, pre booked seats not assigned once onboard, dirty smelly toilets. 

They charge astronomical fares a massive increase over what Virgin used to charge, why oh why did the Gov give the franchise to this dreadful train operator, Virgin trains were so much better. 

This is just a mess, awful. If Sadiq Kahn wants ULEZ then at least first fix the transport issue with the trains or we'll just keep driving to avoid this dreadful company that has the audacity to call itself a train company.

items.title: Absolutely disgusting
items.review_text:
Absolutely disgusting! I'm not even complaining about the train that my 11 year old son described as "dirty and smelly", I'm complaining about the car parking at Wigan North Western train station. There is barely any room to park on the 'drop off' site where you are allowed 20 minutes wait time. Wanting to arrive early to collect my son, I had no other option and so parked on the multi storey car park owned and operated by Avanti. The entry system seems to be deliberately confusing as they have 2 ticket machines, one for free parking up to 20 minutes or one for longer. As I was close to the 20 minutes I chose the 2nd machine for longer and read £4:50 on the VERY long notice attached to both machines... you can't possibly read it all as there's usually someone behind you acting impatient, plus you end up blocking a busy road if there's more than 2 cars there. 
The train arrived late (of course) and after collecting my son and walking back to the car, I'd parked a total of 38 minutes. I put my ticket in the payment machine and was asked to pay £12:50!! I and several other parents had no option but to pay it so we could get our cars out, but I e-mailed Avanti West Coast to complain. The response I received back was not only an obvious copy and paste, it didn't address a single point I'd raised! It seems you either park for 20 minutes for free, or you're charged a full day. they have no other option for 1hr etc... which I would have happily paid.
REPLY FROM AVANTI
"Thank you for contacting Avanti West Coast regarding our car park charges.
While we’ve invested a lot in our car parks, the daily parking rates at our stations had stayed the same for years. So we felt that a review of this was needed. To bring us in line with the tariffs of nearby car parks and to increase the capacity available for customers, we decided to change our pricing structure.
The current charges reflect the considerable investments that we’ve made in our parking facilities to improve them, including adding hundreds of car parking spaces at our busiest stations.
Because of the increase in non-rail users at our car parks, both monthly and three-monthly car park tickets are now only available to rail passengers. And our annual passes are also considerably cheaper for rail travellers than for non-rail users. You can find out more about parking at our stations on our website. We’ll pass on your views to our Car Parks Manager so they can use them as part of their next review.
Thank you for contacting Avanti West Coast.
Yours sincerely,
Caitlan
Customer Resolutions Advisor
Avanti West Coast"

They may as well have told me to go stick my head in a bucket. I'll be avoiding Avanti at all costs in future.

items.title: Never had a train that wasn’t delayed…
items.review_text: Never had a train that wasn’t delayed or cancelled. Awful company should not be given contracts.

items.title: Worst train company ever
items.review_text: Worst train company ever! Not only is train delayed, had to pay additional £25 to get another train, there's no card machine working so I've had to go without food and water for 4 hrs, 5 by the time I get to my destination! Oh and to claim a refund I've got to post my tickets to you? Why great! Now ive got to waste more time and money! Terrible service in more ways than one!

items.title: Jesus Christ
items.review_text: Jesus Christ,  2 train changes now (at least) instead of the usual straight through journey. Train is dirty. Staff member collecting tickets was pleasant though and at least train left on time

items.title: Poor , as ever
items.review_text:
Booked a return to Manchester. The outgoing train was fine, a newer train, clean and bright with a friendly female train manager although the seats are still rock hard and uncomfortable. 
The return journey couldn’t have been more different. Old virgin rolling stock , filthy , stale and stuffy carriage. Makes you feel that you need to clean your clothes and luggage when you get off the train. 
What made it worse, which wasn’t  Avanti’s fault was a couple getting on at Crewe absolutely stinking of skunk weed. Made the whole carriage stink. Terrible wifi access too. Really hate that I have no choice when trying to get to Manchester responsibly by using a train to lower my carbon footprint.

items.title: Rude, unhelpful and unpleasant staff
items.review_text:
This morning I encountered the most unhelpful and unpleasant employee, working for Avanti West Coast at the ticketing barrier at Birmingham New Street Station. Thanks to the rudeness and uncooperative manner of staff working for Avanti West Coast, who lack the ability to use their own personal judgement and discretion, I was held up at New Street Station and not only missed my connecting train but also missed out on an important job interview that could have made a vital difference to my family of young children during the cost of living crisis.

I arrived at New Street at 9:10am this morning; having purchased an Anytime Day return ticket almost an hour before setting off on my journey via the trainline app using PayPal. But there were issues with the Trainline app that prevented me from downloading my tickets. So I was unable to use the QR scanner at the ticket barriers. I explained the issue I was having with the app to the lady at the barrier, I showed her emails with my ticket confirmation and the PayPal receipt as proof of purchase. I asked if she could swipe me through the barriers so I could catch my second connecting train departing at 9.15am to University of Birmingham because I had a job interview. She refused to assist me despite seeing all the proof I had shown her. She even accused me of having not purchased the train ticket until I arrived at the barriers hence the reason I was having issues downloading them in the app. I told her this was not the case and explained that I had also experienced a similar issue with my first train at Birmingham Moor Street Station that morning. But the gentleman at Moor Street (who works for a different company) used his discretion and swiped me through the ticket barriers because he accepted the email confirmation I had shown him. The Avanti employee insisted I purchase a new return ticket from the ticketing office, where I spoke to another lady who bluntly informed me that issues with the Trainline app is not their concern. She stated that both herself and ticket barrier staff at New Street do not work for Trainline and they couldn't assist me further unless I bought new tickets for my journey otherwise I couldn't travel. Both employees showed an absolute disregard for customer services, making my experience today utterly horrendous. Shame on you Avanti for employinh staff who lack human empathy.

items.title: Avanti West fails again
items.review_text: Avanti West fails again.  I wanted to book return tickets to Dovercourt for myself and partner using 2 together card.  The price shown on Avanti was over £60.00.  I went to Trainline and booked the same journey and times for £38.00.  Unbelievable.  Not the first time this has happened either

items.title: recently had to travel the length of Britian with 3 different companies.. AVANTI were superb
items.review_text:
recently had to travel the length of the UK on 3 different companies.. Avanti were by far the best, By far
If you can afford to pay a little bit extra for first class upgrade.... do it.. you wont regret the extra space and quiet atmosphere.. it certainly helped me reach my destination feeling relaxed... have to say my trip has ruined me to train  travel as i likely wont find anything better.. certainly converted me to them and will be looking to book Avanti when I can over the other options.... brilliant

items.title: Fabulous staff at Stoke-on-Trent Train Station…
items.review_text:
The staff at Stoke-on-Trent station are sooo helpful and friendly. I know there are issues with trains, delays, etc but I just wanted to acknowledge my experience of regularly frequenting Stoke station. 
Thanks to all for your professionalism and helpful attitude towards what can be a tough job with awkward angry customers.

items.title: Awful is not strong enough
items.review_text: Oh my goodness, what do I say? If I could give zero stars I certainly would! Once again a terrible journey from Liverpool to London. First Class Lounge closed (again), fares increased by up to 150% from Virgin prices. I used to travel twice a week with Virgin and they were far, far better. How on earth Avanti keeps hold of the franchise boggles me. Bring back Sir Richard. Please!

items.title: My colleagues and I chose this service…
items.review_text: My colleagues and I chose this service from London to Glasgow for a meeting. The journey is over four hours and a half and the internet is very very bad. I though I’d do some work on the way but I couldn’t. The aircon is so cold that me and my colleagues got ill. No advice on how to change the temperature. I don’t think I will use this service again.

items.title: Avanti West Coast doesn't disappoint!
items.review_text:
Great trip, on time, looked after by staff!!
Birthday holiday trip to Paris, last step - after Eurostar - was a late Avanti from Euston to Lime Street, Liverpool. Kate provided reassurance (train manager), John provided HOT food - unlikle another service I'd been on that day. and Richard who takes order and provides drinks/food at the table, was just brilliant! He seemed to appear just as I needed something. Very pleasant man too!

items.title: Terrible website. Refunds are made difficult and slow
items.review_text:
Terrible website. Terrible customer service 
No contact phone or email on website .
They announced free refunds for those who bought tickets for strike days but when you try to dop it online there is no option to do it for Advance tickets. As an alternative they tell you to use a form but that requires you to attach a ticket photo, which you don't have. This looks like deliberately making it nigh impossible to claim your rights. 

Update- customer care staff had not been told the requirement for photos had been lifted for strike affected tickets, and they processed a refund, This hasnt arrived within the promised 5 working days. They say they cannot speed it up. Funny that - my cancelled hotel could refund me within 24 hours 

Avoid them at all cost - book on another wesbite. If you can travel down the East Coast - EMR have been excellent.

Avanti should lose their franchise - Many of us miss Virgin.

items.title: Expensive, dirty, outdated, and crap service
items.review_text: Avanti double booked my ticket with another lady and I struggled to find a seat, being moved multiple times which was humiliating, despite us both having seat reservations. No staff around to help sort it out either. Ended up stuffed in a corner and the customer service team essentially told me to get over it, as I had technically found a seat. I booked in May. Unacceptable.

items.title: Absolutely awful
items.review_text: Absolutely awful! Booked and paid for my tickets 326 pound and didn’t receive no tickets been no help at all to try get my money back so have had to rebook with a different company offer zero support and Their app just takes the money! Very bad experience

items.title: Clearly no investment
items.review_text:
Clearly no investment and cut to the bone services.

Train cleaning isn't nearly good enough, the onboard services barely work. The wifi is so bad, the shop closed as the member of staff couldn't get a signal enough for the card machine to work!

Oh, and seat reservations? They managed to *triple book* some seats. Leading to absolute chaos in some carriages. 

Terrible, terrible company. I feel so sorry for the staff.

items.title: Avanti West Coast are absolutely…
items.review_text: Avanti West Coast are absolutely appalling and looking at Trust Pilot I see I am not alone.  Your staff are great but as a company you are dreadful and it is very clear you don't care about your customers, it is almost impossible to buy tickets.  I have an account but on the numerous times I use delay/repay I have to create another account/passwork and then the next time I try to book tickets your website tells me the password is invalid.  You are a disgrace and clearly just care about your shareholders.  The trains are dirty, you never have enough food/drink in the buffet car and half the time you don't even have hot water.  If I didn't have to use Avanti to travel up to see my old Dad I never would. Shoddy, inept and thoroughly unpleasant travels with you.

items.title: Trainline / Avanti possibly the worst…
items.review_text: Trainline / Avanti possibly the worst train suppliers are of all time! Off peak sold by Trainline great for travel to London but utterly useless for return....even though if you check both T&C's no mention of return times. Pathetic....

items.title: 3rd world service at 1st world prices
items.review_text: Paid for a reserved seat on the 1647 from Birmingham New Street to Euston, the train that arrived was apparently 5 cars as opposed to the normal 10 - as a result my reservation was invalidated and had to endure the journey to London in blistering heat stood in the vestibule. This is truly a third world train company operating in the first world. Utter shambles from start to finish - I'd have been better off clinging to the roof

items.title: Used passenger assistance
items.review_text: Used passenger assistance as one user in our party uses an electric wheelchair.  Service at Carlisle and Glasgow was brilliant. Ramps provided and disabled place with table provided.  Thank you so much you made the journey straight forward and enjoyable.

items.title: Avanti Train - aweful inside!
items.review_text:
Avanti - your trains look nice and new on the outside with the plastic name on the side but inside, oh dear!
Grotty interior, past it, not clean, not pleasing to look at and just not fit for purpose! 
Nice outer but please, get the internals revamped, seriously! I really was pleased to leave the train!

items.title: Still unsatisfactory service by Avanti West Coast
items.review_text:
I gave up on travelling by Avanti West Coast over a year ago, after experiencing cancellations on almost every train I had booked, and the consequent delays, stress, and loss of booked seats. I thought they might have improved, so tried again yesterday. The journey from Birmingham to London was fine: fast, on time.
The return journey was not so fine. We had booked seats in carriage H; there was no carriage H. (Not the first time I've encountered that issue with Avanti.) We were able to find seats, apart from each other, in another crammed carriage (several passengers had to stand). The train was half an hour late leaving Euston, because the train driver had not turned up. We sweltered in a packed carriage for all this time; no driver, therefore no air-conditioning until he or she arrived. The train arrived in Birmingham half an hour late. We were at least reminded that we were entitled to claim compensation.
I shall continue to avoid Avanti in future.

items.title: Definitely recommend. 100% customer service
items.review_text: Definitely recommend best customer service every. Staff member will go through exter mile to get you from point A to b

items.title: This is by far the worst train servis Avanti means forward but their interpretation is BACWARD
items.review_text: This is by far the worst train operating company in England A 2 hour trip from London to Runcorntook over 4 hours changing trains several times and platforms numerous times because the Guards kept ept getting etting mixed messages from control A absolute shambles This was by far the worst organisation for running trains shoud stick tomaking Pizzas

items.title: British rail travel is a joke
items.review_text: Yet another overcrowded, hot and late service from Avanti

items.title: i wish i could give 0 stars
items.review_text: i wish i could give 0 stars. this company is awful. double booked seats and had 3 of us sitting in a 2 seater squashed together to avoid standing for 3.5 hours as there was also a delay. then our next train the same happened, double booked seats, and we had to stand for an hour. this is unacceptable and totally unorganised. and the wifi is pish.

items.title: Serious breach of health and safety and customer welfare.
items.review_text: Boarded train at Stafford. Announcement saying one carriage was closed due to the air conditioning not working. Within 5 mins of being on train there was NO air conditioning in any carriage. It was 28+ outside and 35+ on train: no announcements, no explanation, no water, no apology and no seats - at least 60+ people having to stand. No staff to be heard or seen. Appallingly and will be taking this further as a serious breach of customer welfare and health and safety.

items.title: AVANTI  customer service is Top class.
items.review_text: I just want to put it here how amazing their phone customer service is. Amazing timing and all staff encountered was friendly, polite and knowledgeable of their product and how to deal with my enquiries.  The best customer service team I have been in contact with. 👌 👌👌👌👌

items.title: Beware of this company!!
items.review_text: Travelled from Edinburgh to London Euston. Train 2 hrs delayed. Website impossible to handle, ref number on paper ticket illegible. Not sure which number it is , anyhow. Tried to print the delay repay form: Printer only prints part of it (printer is fine, I use it every day.). Calling you is impossible, I get sent from one place to another and no-one answers. BEWARE OF THIS COMPANY!

items.title: LIARS-THIEVES-OBFUSCATORS!!
items.review_text:
trash experience, they hide behind twisted and made up apparent laws (data protection) which isn't relevant to the issue at hand, and they do this in order to cower away from dealing with the issue, and facing like a normal person would do. they are extremely rude, and hang up the phone abruptly on you, and the same goes for their managers (i would have thought a manager would have better manners than that!!)
1) they will obfuscate, beat-around-the-bush, hem and haw, and do anything they can to get out of admitting their wrongdoing,
2) and paying up if need be.
Just beware!!

items.title: Excellent service for cycle travel
items.review_text: I recently travelled from Crewe to Edinburgh (19/06) and returned (21/06). I travelled with my bike and the service was exemplary. Staff on both journeys were extremely helpful

items.title: Rock bottom customer experience
items.review_text: One hour 53 mins late on a two hour 10 mins journey. Severe overcrowding. Poor communication. What there was, was misinformed. Staff that didn't seem to give two hoots. Rock bottom customer experience.

items.title: Awful company
items.review_text: Paid £88 not one seat available from Nuneaton to oxenholme, shambles of a company, bring back virgin, much better company

items.title: Thank you Katie
items.review_text: After a weary wait in the rain, we were overjoyed to board the 2057 from Lancaster to Glasgow Central and were immediately greeted by a welcoming staff especially Katie. Katie was enthusiastic to provide the upmost service, completely professional and extremely pleasant. Thank you very much Katie for making the experience, I wish more people were like her.

items.title: I am an International Business Man…
items.review_text:
I am an International Business Man Traveller.  I have visited England and then Wales each time on three visits in the last 18 months.  it is RARE I would write a review such as this.
My experience has been that I have found Avanti to verge on 'Business Dishonesty' on each train trip I have booked with them in the following way.
The latest June 2023 was from Euston to Crewe.  Two trains were due to leave, the first for Glasgow via Crewe and the 2nd for Bangor via Crewe. [My trip].
12 hours before the trip Avanti canceled my booked service and merged ALL the passengers onto the 1st Glasgow train via Crewe.  
1] I overhead 'stressed' staff complaining that Avanti had also left the train at 9 carriages and DID NOT increase it to 11 carriages
2] People were left without their booked seats and sitting in the carriage door entrances as a result - a serious health and safety issue.
This was the first part of the trip, I will not bother relaying the 2nd part equally as bad.
I personally recognize packing carriages as a 'Revenue Grab' as I had the same experience on my previous 2nd trip with my Avanti booking last year in 2022.
It clearly stands out to me now, as a standard 'unprincipled business practice', to pack trains to maximise Revenue, which in turn 'unconscionably' does not deliver the COMFORTABLE SERVICE the Passengers had paid for in good faith and can reasonably expect.
I ask the question - How often does Avanti do this?  Weekly?  This question should be answered officially by a government regulator.
In short the business should be ASHAMED.

items.title: Train from Euston to Glasgow uncleabed, again.
items.review_text: Train from Euston to Glasgow central 1430 20 June was filthy. Tables still with remnants of crisps, drink stains and crumbs.

items.title: &362 for a 1 hour and 50 min journey in…
items.review_text:
&362 for a 1 hour and 50 min journey in first class is a disgrace. 

The food served was absolutely disgusting. 

Bring back Virgin please

items.title: apalling
items.review_text: apalling ! trying to do delay repay for a train that went nowhere yesterday while we sat on it at Crewe for 30mins until 500 people are then sent to fend for themselves on already over booked trains.Avanti had the cheek to say my appeal is refused as i could have got on a train while i was still sat on the 16.32 waiting for the thing to depart.their process page to appeal is proving a real headache to manouvre through -think thats a further ploy to stop having to take responsibility

items.title: Son pissed on his pants
items.review_text: Delayed by 10 minutes just because of some faulty door. Absolute shambles!!!😡

items.title: Avanti West Coast
items.review_text:
Avanti West Coast - so our jouney back, Yesterday we had to pay - but booking error meant that our seats were taken. You'd expect an apology, please have an upgrade. Avanti wanted £30 for the priviledge of this disruption. Really??
Well the journey back. 
A very hot day  and no air conditioning, asked, - told cant fix it. People standing up and down the train, so cant move about. Its dirty - really needs a deep clean. 
I cannot believe how different the service is to when I last came up on Virgin. No alternative place to sit - temperature rising - with more people cramming on board. 
How did Avanti get the contract -

items.title: Criminal that they oversell tickets on…
items.review_text: Criminal that they oversell tickets on every service and there are never seats available. Whoever in government is allowing this practice needs to be voted out. Write to your representative. £37.50 for a 35 minute journey on a Sunday is pure ripoff

items.title: I'm not sure why reviewers are unhappy.
items.review_text: I'm not too sure what other reviewers are so unhappy about. Personally, I think Avanti are one of the best train operators currently operational in the UK. I travel daily between Birmingham New St. and Coventry. Accordingly, I either end up on a Crosscountry, London Northwestern or Avanti train. Crosscountry are usually late, the trains are packed and dirty and you seldom get a seat. On Crosscountry the toilets are often dirty and smelly. In comparison, Avanti trains are clean, of comfortable temperature and always have plenty of available seats. They usually run punctually and much of their rolling stock is brand new. They also have a buffet car with vegan options which is great for me. When I had to write to them, they emailed me back a day or two later - not weeks or months later like other operators. Ultimately I get on whichever train comes first, but I'm certainly happy on the occasions this is an Avanti service.

items.title: not sure why so many bad reviews for…
items.review_text: not sure why so many bad reviews for avanti, i have never really seen many problems with the condition of the train, myself and my girlfriend were travelling on the avanti west coast from new street to preston, a few weeks ago, unfortunately the train was delayed and late getting to preston by just over 2 hours (no not great) however thanks to the help of miles and sam on twitter feed, we ended up with a full refund of £95.70, and the money was back in my bank account in a few days, and i find this hard to fault,in fact i hope its delayed next time lol, the trains go slightly too fast for a nervous passenger like me, so if they could be slowed down to around 75 mph would be much appreciated, LOL

items.title: Broken A/C & Awful Customer Service
items.review_text:
I travelled from Euston to Manchester last Friday (9th June) for just shy of £60! I could've booked a return flight to Europe for less. 

It was 29 degrees outside and the A/C on my carriage was broken - It was absolutely unbearable. The train set off 10 mins late and after 45 mins of travel a member of staff came round to give out warm water which I saw them take down from the luggage rack on our carriage. Obviously they were aware the A/C was broken, but still decided to let everyone board the carriage. 

I thought it would be the same story on every carriage, but moved to another where the A/C was on full blast, only I had to sit on the floor as there were no seats free. 

I complained to customer service but apparently I'm not entitled to a refund because the ticket has been used! That is shocking customer service. In fact, it's some of the worst I've experienced in a long time. 

If I could leave a 0 star review I would. I won't ever travel with AWC again and neither should you!

items.title: Beyond terrible
items.review_text: Terrible experience on more than one occasion. Trains never run on time and are always delayed. Don’t waste your money with Avanti West Coast!!!! Go with London North Western and you will get there quicker!!! Absolute rubbish service through and through! Bring back Virgin Trains any day!!!!

items.title: Awful customer service. Terrible experience.
items.review_text:
Me and my partner were travelling back from Paris on Saturday 27th May. We made it back to London and headed to Euston to board our train, which was departing at 9:40 pm to find the station and platform entrance rammed with Coventry fans from the championship play off. Whilst waiting to get onto the platform we heard MULTIPLE fans laughing and commenting on how they DIDN'T have train tickets and were planning to just jump on the train. A few minutes later they announce the service has been cancelled, only ten minutes later to admit that it's actually that the train is full. Me and my partner has seat reservations and spoke to someone explaining that someone would be in the seats that we'd booked and how that's fair to which no one helped. Avanti have clearly either sold more tickets then there were seats OR have allowed people with no tickets to board, meaning paying customers haven't been able to use their tickets. We ended up having to repurchase tickets from Marleybone to Birmingham Moor Street. We emailed Avanti about all of this providing the evidence of purchase ect. to which they tried to tell us we needed to go through trainline, eventhough trainline had already emailed us the following day telling to contact avanti about compensation, so they're obviously just trying to shift the blame. Me and my partner asked for a refund for our unused tickets and asked them to reimburse the tickets we had to buy due to their mistakes with the original trains. They sent multiple emails asking for all the evidence just to turn around and tell us that because we used the tickets we couldn't have them reimbursed. Yes. We did in fact have to buy MORE tickets to USE them to get home so I'm not really sure how that makes any sense. 

Constantly shifting the blame. Refusing to take any responsibility.

items.title: Unbelievably awful service from Avanti West Coast
items.review_text:
Unbelievably awful service from Avanti West Coast.
I had arranged a week in North Wales and, having a broken bone in my hand, and being in my eighties I decided to treat myself to a First Class seat to/from Holyhead/Euston.  What a waste of money.  First Euston called the train ten minutes before departure it was a long walk to the platform and a long walk down the platform to first class.  With minutes to spare I asked a member of Avanti staff to help me with my luggage.  She refused.  Having got on to the train, after about 20 minutes, I was offered a cup of coffee and some water.  That was the last I saw of the lady on my four hour journey.  No food, no drink. Nothing.  There was apparently a ‘shop’ on board.  I have no idea what that is all about, but having paid such a lot of money for my seat I sat there expecting service – none came.  With a broken hand I could not possibly carry food and drink down a moving train.   The return journey was only marginally better.  The guard came to see me and told me there would be no service between Holyhead and Crew.  Thankfully he saw my hand in a splint and kindly offered to fetch a cup of coffee.  Then nothing until a member of the catering staff got on the train at Crewe when I did manage to get some cheese and biscuits and a glass of wine.  DO NOT book yourself First Class with Avanti West Coast – you won’t get any first class treatment.  
I wrote to the MD – his assistant offered me 50% off my next journey as compensation.  They gave me a long spiel on how to get that 50% off.  It was a bit beyond me and I have no intention of using Avanti West Coast again.  After spending £163.00 on my return ticket I asked if they could not just pay be some compensation.  I was offered £10.00!  I turned it down as an ‘unbelievable’ gesture.
As one person has written – you would be better off in a tuk tuk with 20 chickens rather than use Avanti.

items.title: Luggage on your lap, anyone?
items.review_text: Good trains, comfortable seats, services on time. BUT... where are you meant to store your luggage?? For a service between Glasgow and London there was a shocking lack of luggage space. Two tiny compartments, each big enough for maybe 4 suitcases, one at each end of a carriage with around 60 seats... You do the math! So be ready to sit with your suitcase on your lap if you travel on Avanti West Coast!

items.title: Horrible from start to finish!
items.review_text:
Horrible from start to finish!! 
Urge ppl not to use this company 
Staff totally useless and of no help what so ever !
Left stranded overnight in London and told just stay and try get on another train tommorow!
Bring back virgin!!!!!!

items.title: Rubbish Avanti West Coast
items.review_text: Would be appropriate to give it zero or negative star rating if possible. Cancelled service, suggested alternative was over an hour late , train staff and trainline promised 100% refund however the Avanti claim process may not even return 50%...

items.title: dreadful experience
items.review_text: dreadful experience, over 45 minutes late, absolutely boiling in the carriage and toilets are filthy, I expect a full refund for this disgraceful service.

items.title: I would give a zero rating if I could…
items.review_text: I would give a zero rating if I could worst train company in the country by far never on time always severe delays should not have contract renewed again staff are no better

items.title: Dirty smelly train in need of a deep…
items.review_text: Dirty smelly train in need of a deep clean, toilets hand dryer doesn't work, 2 carriages overheating then the ac turned on in  so high its cold in the other carriages. Also some seats not in use as the train is leaking, don't know what from as the weather is dry.

items.title: Excellent serviceThank You
items.review_text: Excellent service, staff at Preston Station really helpful!

items.title: Just stay away from this Trainline…
items.review_text: Just stay away from this Trainline unless u wanna be late everywhere and spend most of ur time trying to get refunds

items.title: Avanti is the worst train company in…
items.review_text:
Avanti is the worst train company in the UK, probably in the world, including developing countries. It would probably be a quicker and more pleasant experience to travel from London to Manchester in a tuk tuk with 20 chickens.

My sister tried to get a train today at 13:47, which should have arrived in Manchester at just before 4pm. Instead, it did not depart until 3pm and did not arrive back in Manchester until after about 6:30pm. She was travelling with her 6 month old baby so it was an even more stressful experience.
She was charged £25 for the “privilege” of sitting in “standard premium” even though the train was very busy and ridiculously late.
When Virgin ran the trains it was a pleasant, reliable and affordable service. Nowadays, booking a ticket to Manchester with Avanti is like playing Russian Roulette as you never know if the train will be cancelled and therefore whether you have to cancel plans with family. If the service does go ahead, you pay an absolute fortune for a not particularly pleasant experience, with some trains so busy that people are forced to sit on their suitcases by the toilets. My brother in law lives in Manchester but has to travel to London for work regularly. Unfortunately, he has to rely on Avanti trains, meaning he is frequently late for work and important meetings. This is unsustainable. The service is so unreliable that he is considering looking for a new job.

The price has gone up through the roof despite the service being such a joke.
When I go to see my family in Manchester I usually drive these days as I can’t count on the trains anymore. Avanti needs to relinquish the contract for the West Coast Mainline - it wasn’t prepared to take it on and hasn’t coped. When you speak to staff, they agree that Avanti is an abysmal company and aren’t happy with their experience either.

items.title: Kamir of Passenger Assistance is a SUPERSTAR!
items.review_text:
I wish to commend to you a young man, Kamir, who made a huge difference to a lady's life today.  
The lady in question has been a patient at the Royal Orthopaedic Hospital, Birmingham. She was discharged today and needed Passenger Assistance for a solo journey back to her home in Lincoln 
Kamir could not have been more helpful. He organised Passenger Assistance for every step of the whole train journey from Birmingham New St via Nottingham to Lincoln and I feel this young man should have the praise he deserves.

items.title: Poor train company
items.review_text: The website doesn’t function well. I gave up and booked with Trainline. I’ve travelled from Manchester Piccadilly to Euston and back 3 times in the last couple of months and not one of the trains has been on time. On one occasion I had to stand up from Nuneaton - (several passengers are usually standing for the whole journey.) On another occasion the electric toilet door opened whilst I was using the toilet! And the stampede to get on the trains from Euston is incredibly  dangerous - they don’t release the platform number until the train is about to depart so you have to run to catch the train or try and get a seat! Two stars are firstly for the train staff who, despite the obvious problems with Avanti, I’ve always found to be helpful. Secondly the train managers do keep passengers informed about delays and thirdly at least the trains run frequently between Manchester and London. Try and avoid busier trains and your journey will be a lot more pleasant.

items.title: Warrington Bank Quay Station Rude Staff
items.review_text: Warrington Bank Quay Station. Exceptionally rude platform staff. Brings down the whole start to a journey. I was asking a simole question when two trains had become reversed in arrival times. Also very confusing!

items.title: Online service pre-booking is so poor
items.review_text:
Online service pre-booking is so poor. 
If anything goes wrong, they charge you, malfunctions on the website, they charge you and of course,  no one available to help. And the big plan is to get out of your cars and use the trains  Why would we with service like this. Not using online anymore, would rather buy from the ticket office and see a real person on the day.

items.title: Re customer service…exceptional
items.review_text:
Re customer service Thursday 1st June 2023.
I was really pleased and happy to have support on and off platform Rhyl/Crewe on the 3:50 service.
As a disabled traveller getting on trains during school holidays is frankly a nightmare. I was greeted at Rhyl station and asked for assistance, which I was given despite not having a reservation the train manager helped me to the seat and contacted Crewe Station where I was to be met and helped from the train. The TM who unfortunately I didn't take the name couldn't do enough for me. Avanti West Coast gets a bad rap, unfairly in my opinion I will make a effort to travel more on my disabled railcard as I now know that help is their if required l so I'd like to thank the station staff at Rhyl/Crewe and the station manager on board that day for making a stressful journey, as easy as it could possibly be.
Jim Wootton
Disabled passenger

items.title: Incompetence on another level
items.review_text: Well, here we are again at London euston and the train is now about half an hour late…as there is no train driver. Well, if you need to have one indication of the sheer incompetence of Avanti company management - if you can call it this - is the fact that they can’t even get the most basic things right. Why they still have the franchise is obviously not performance related…

items.title: Great service
items.review_text: Travelled from Wigan to London and back over the weekend, Trains where on time at each occasion, reasonably priced, clean and tidy. Very impressed with the service. Booked online so tickets were easy to get etc.

items.title: Always delayed and always late
items.review_text: Always delayed and always late.  How people maintain respect for these people is beyond real. Diabolical service as usual.

items.title: On app that I bought ticket delay repay…
items.review_text: On app that I bought ticket delay repay doesn’t do anything. Wasted my time and said after a week to apply with the company that ran the service. I didn’t pay money to them. This is potentially illegal

items.title: Complete rubbish of a service
items.review_text: Complete rubbish of a service. Went from London to Blackpool and what should had been a 4 hour journey straight through to Blackpool ended up being a 6 hour journey changing at Preston over some stupid excuse. Travelling back we had to change at Preston again where the train was running late and was coming in on platform 4 and right at the last minute was told it had changed to platform 6 which gave us literally seconds to run to other platform as train was coming in and there were no seats and I had to stand all the way back to Euston. Same happened last year. Why is this train service still allowed to run? They pay back so much compensation it's a wonder they have not gone bust.

items.title: Zero star service
items.review_text: Zero star service. Recent articles to say shareholder profits / dividends have increased again. There should be a criminal investigation into how this was allowed to happen and continue

items.title: Cancelled Trains with No Compensation
items.review_text: There have been so many cancelled trains where I have filed for delay and replay and they said I wasn't eligible. They are stealing your money. Customer service is poor and extremely rude/

items.title: Overpriced, WC’s disgusting, terrible service
items.review_text:
Overpriced, one manual WC working but  disgusting. The other working one had no water to wash your hands. Was so much better when Virgin ran the line.
As if it couldn’t get any better, on the return journey - cash only at the buffet (who carries it??) and the tannoy announcement got the destination wrong. Used the WC - now found the water works, there’s soap but ah no, too much to ask for a working hand dryer so exited with wet hands. 
And those that run our national embarrassment of a rail service are due to go on strike - yet again. Honestly - a joke.

items.title: Why is this company allowed to operate
items.review_text:
Why is this company allowed to operate? It is a monopoly position and knows it can get away with appalling service. The website is dreadful. It witholds information until you have paid for a ticket.
Yet again, I have to travel with no seat reservation, not ideal for somebody in their 70s.
It does not deserve even one star.

items.title: If I could give less than 1 star I…
items.review_text: If I could give less than 1 star I would!!! Shocking service and basically daylight robbery.
