I had a ticket booked on a train from Euston and I was refused entry due to over crowding. Not a problem I understand but it then cost me double to get home. I requested a refund and was told I would receive £1!!!!! As they were charging me a £20 admin fee! Disgusting customer service. There were at least another 100 people saying they had tickets too! So Avanti won again!!!

items.title: I’d rather tread in my dogs bottom bombs.
items.review_text:
Sometimes less is more when you need to describe your experience. 

Spending upwards of £2,000 per month with Avanti and every element from booking to travelling is abysmal. 

From top to bottom I’d sack the lot.

items.title: Mixed bag of experience
items.review_text:
Day return from Crewe to Birmingham in first class, 2 journeys, 2 different experiences!

Carriage was empty on the journey out, no attendant so went to the onboard shop. The first class carriage must have been the old one as it was worn and not very luxurious. The man in the shop was really good and explained why there wasn’t any table service onboard and offered meal deal. 

Return journey was a totally different experience. Sat on our seat and the attendant asked us what we wanted to drink and if we wanted anything to eat. We ordered coffee and told the attendant we will have anything as long as it was vegetarian. We got coffee but no sugar (in the end didn’t get the sugar) The attendant bought 2 plates of food and slammed it in front of us, it had salami, pepperoni and ham on the plate. I reiterated that we were vegetarian and we can’t have the food she bought over and said it doesn’t matter, we didn’t need food. The attendant stood there, staring at us for a good 30 seconds, huffed and just walked away, it was like she wanted to hit us lol I’ve never had someone stare at you in anger when you’ve been so polite.
The attendant changed at Wolverhampton station and we had a different person and it was totally different service. The attendant bought drinks over, biscuits, chocolates and kept on asking us if we wanted anything else. It went from the worst service to having the best service. 

The carriage on the return journey was a refurbished one and it was really nice to see modern features like wireless charging and more comfy seats

items.title: No aircon, no water offered, no 1st class service
items.review_text:
In standard class there was no aircon in the carriage in today's extreme heat, no water was offered. Not enough seats. No support in dealing with drunk alcohol consuming, vaping, football supporters Avanti staff turned a blind eye and were nowhere to be seen. No First Class Service on my First class return journey and was told we had to fetch our own food and drink from seven carriages away. 
Absolutely appalling Avanti. The whole experience cost me £125!! Next time I will drive.

items.title: Worst train
items.review_text: Worst train. No space for wheelchairs or Pushchairs and then the driver starts complaining that we need to move away from the door and go and sit down. How we meant to sit down when a pushchair won't fit near the seats. I had to stand throughout the whole 3hr journey 😒

items.title: The onboard wifi and services app isnt…
items.review_text: The onboard wifi and services app isnt working.ive had to keep my suitcase in the isle.cant orddr any food or drink.its not up to standards we have in australia.or anywhere near the standards of europe and yoir paying premium prices.ill take a bus next time.

items.title: Possibility one of the worst train companies
items.review_text: Since Avanti took over the west coast train service they have consistently failed to deliver anything coming close to a decent service, they should have their franchise removed immediately and the directors fined. I’ve never had a good journey with them, constantly late or cancelled, no buffet car and serious overpriced. Best avoided

items.title: AVOID if you can - Poor trains and even worse website - possibly illegal request for medical proof -
items.review_text: Awful.  Friday - 2 hour journey took 5 hours (Birmingham-Lancaster).  Monday - trying to get refund on (different) ticket.  Site seems designed to steer you away from it (gives instructions to use "My bookings" but no option there.  Then the AI bot appears - worse than useless - at one point it asks "Are you satisfied with my answer" I say "No" - it says "sorry, I do not recognise that response".  Finally, via google, manage to find a different refund form, try to put in the details but it keeps saying "please use proper characters" (i.e., no allowing brackets, or any cut and paste) - the response I have had from them is to provide "medical proof" of reason for non-travel (there seems to be no legal basis for that request and no other train ticket provider has ever asked it- I will be taking matters up with the Rail Ombudsman - they do seem to be being wilfully obstructive in giving refund -

items.title: Why are the toilets always disgusting?
items.review_text: Disgusting! Why are Avanti West Coast train toilets always disgusting. Pay less to your shareholders and improve services onboard your trains

items.title: Why I  won’t be using Avanti coast…
items.review_text: Why I  won’t be using Avanti coast again. Their response to overpacked trains for 2.5 Journey, and broken AC where the heat was turned on the train during one of the hottest days

items.title: Can't reserve/pick a seat anymore on website
items.review_text: Can't even reserve a seat anymore on Avanti website, let alone pick a seat. And the App doesn't work. Terrible, just terrible.

items.title: 0 star should be appropriate review…
items.review_text: 0 star should be appropriate review score. This broken company just won’t refund any delays properly, it cancels trains if they delayed 15 mins more and doesn’t bother doing proper refunds, criminal! 5-10 mins delay announced but turned out to be 20mins late, and for gods sake it left finally. Try to avoid their service and use London northwestern if possible.

items.title: wow, what a joke this company is.
items.review_text:
wow, this company is an absolute joke. i spend hours on it trying to book seats and it behaves differently every time. When I do finally get a ticket I always miss my connection because of delays and have to pay for a taxi. I can not longer work on the train as I can't book table seats, so i either have to take an extra day or 2 on my journey or travel late at night, when i don't want to. 

I've complained so many times to them when they've asked for feedback and they've not replied once.

items.title: Utterly incompetent
items.review_text: Utterly incompetent

items.title: We used the Euston to Lancaster service…
items.review_text: We used the Euston to Lancaster service on 18th May and everything was good. The on board were friendly and although the meal was poor by European standards we were offered drinks and top ups. Overall v good for England

items.title: Just had another 2 day trip Glasgow to…
items.review_text: Just had another 2 day trip Glasgow to London and excellent service.  We weren't allocated seats together going down but a quick message  through twitter and it was sorted.  No delays,train clean and quiet.   Any staff encountered were pleasant.  Use Avanti every time we go to london and no complaints.

items.title: Avanti  compensation website for Delay…
items.review_text:
Avanti compensation website for Delay repay is so difficult to complete , perhaps intentionally that it’s no point trying, especially for an older person. 
Phone contact and Help is just automated and hangs up. 
Ridiculous train provider and very bad customer service.

items.title: Dreadful Customer Service
items.review_text: My train ticket today doesn't work at barriers - faulty mag strip - and I've got to use the underground in London. Grinning customer service agent at Piccadilly said they can't replace faulty tickets. Absolutely appalling customer service. Train itself mostly empty. Return train was in a sorry state in bad need of a deep clean. Fingers crossed their franchise is removed soon but unfortunately the same smiling but useless agents will change uniforms and carry on being as unhelpful as possible. There and back the ignorance of this company meant I had to call assistance at 16 automated barriers that didn't work. I'll drive next time.

items.title: Delay Refunds
items.review_text: The train I was travelling on was delayed by an hour arriving in Carlisle which was due to an incident at Rugby. Since then I have been trying to obtrain a refund but have found it impossible to get onto the delay refund website page - I keep being told that I will be sent a verification number but nothing happens and I have now been locked out of my account. A rubbish service

items.title: Quite zone
items.review_text: I travelled in the Avanti west-cost train today at 19:42 from London Euston to crew and I was the only passenger in the quiet zone compartment. While I was watching a film on my phone,  one of the Avanti West Coast staff came and told me that I can’t watch a film in the quiet compartment of the train because it is a quiet zone and he really got angry and shouted ( even the compartment is quite zone but how come he shout at me in the quite zone) . I felt his behaviour is threatening.

items.title: Our Train from Euston was scheduled to…
items.review_text:
Our Train from Euston was scheduled to depart at 9.48am. We had arrived at the platform just after 9.46am and were told that gates close 2min before departure. Not only were we met with unfriendly staff but also no where on our ticket was this rule stated. In essence this rule makes the train a 9.46am train. 

We are unhappy with the service provided by Avanti

items.title: Terrible everything!
items.review_text: Terrible seats, rude staff, no competency, no discipline in schedule! Wifi not working .

items.title: Constantly cancelling train services…
items.review_text: Constantly cancelling train services from Glasgow to London on a weekly basis, everytime i show up for my train its cancelled. Dire excuses, driver not turned up. Always making me late for work, shocking disgusting company. They need to lose this contract pronto!!

items.title: Selfish behaviour
items.review_text: I bought tickets for family to attend the eurovision in liverpool only to find the trains are on strike AGAIN. I don't know what you are trying to achieve but you have definitely lost the support of many people due to this selfish behaviour. Yes everybody wants more money and better working conditions etc but you have cost honest working people a lot of money due to selfish act.

items.title: Rebecca has been so helpful
items.review_text: Rebecca has been so helpful. Im not really used to public transport as i drive often and i missed my train by ten minutes. Shes been so accommodating and helpful. She turned my bad day into a good day. Thank you so much! Olaniyan xx

items.title: Worst rail operator
items.review_text:
Worst rail operator - should lose franchise!
Last time I used website to buy ticket, they took money but said transaction failed. Eventually got refund, their excuse was that my account had not transition properly from Virgin. Closed account to set up new one. After several months am still unable to open new account as email address was 'recently' used for account.

items.title: Very bad experience got tickets been…
items.review_text: Very bad experience got tickets been checked by rude guy stopped by worse woman who stopped us again like we're trying to get into train for free. I felt like a cheater. To the management of staff who had a shift at 21.55PM on 08.05.23 on Euston London do something with this disgusting workers

items.title: We want to praise NATALIE at Penrith…
items.review_text: We want to praise NATALIE at Penrith station for her professionalism, care, understanding, knowledge and support. Truly wonderful to see as we visit tour great country by train. Please pass along our thanks again!!

items.title: Awful booked my off peak return which I…
items.review_text: Awful booked my off peak return which I was surprised about as they normally don’t have timetable 2 weeks in advance and the lo amd behold I have no seat reservation number. When I called Avanti they had no clue they said it may be m site there is a strike 4 days later 😡

items.title: There are no other words than Truly Appalling
items.review_text:
How this company even got off the ground in the first place amazes me.

I used their own app to try and buy 4 tickets to London. After clicking pay, the app returned to the ticket selection page with no tickets provided. I did however find my bank account has been charged for them…

There’s no way of speaking to someone about this - after finding the only option is to leave a message on their website, I have finally (two days later) got a message back saying, essentially, they can do nothing and advising me to take it up with my bank if the payment changes from pending to taken…

Truly appalling service - if there is or was any way to avoid arriva trains I would and will in the future…

items.title: First class North Wales…
items.review_text: I frequently travel between Rhyl and Chester by train. The services are provided by Transpirt for Wales and Avanti West Coast. Most Tfw trains are standard class only and tend to be full as are the standard class coaches on Avanti. For a while now I have travelled 1st class on Avanti. The extra cost over standard is approximately £10 for a return ticket. For the extra £5 each way I get a comfortable seat in a superior coach, free food and drink of my choice and no crowding. Recently the at seat service has been withdrawn, this means that I have to go to the buffet myself, but on producing my 1st class ticket, I make my free choice of the food and drink available. The removal of the at seat service is the reason I gsve inly 4 stars.

items.title: Wayne at Stafford was amazing and made…
items.review_text: Wayne at Stafford was amazing and made sure myself and my friends were on the right train back to Sandwell and Dudley.

items.title: Poor Online and Telephone service from Avanti.
items.review_text:
I tried several times to purchase two tickets online and then to customer service by phone. Avanti software for booking online was poor, and would not allocate two seats next to each. In addition, Avanti's poor software consistently refused two of my credit cards. 
I wasted several hours trying to make this booking. 
I then made a 10-minute car journey to my local station
at Hexham. The Hexham Station ticket office gave me the two tickets within about 5 minutes.

items.title: Gone downhill!
items.review_text:
Awful! I travelled to London recently and paid for 1st class on a booked train. The train was over an hour late (others weren’t!) and then when I got on board was told there was no food or drink as the crew were getting off. 

On my return I was again told there would be no food or hot drinks! I feel like they are happy to take my money and then don’t provide a service…. And then for the delayed train they get out of paying the ‘delay repay’!

Not good Avanti! Please sort your service out and provide value for money!

items.title: I was a fool to risk them…
items.review_text: Total trash. Cancelled train left me stuck in London. First class ticket but you just have to hope you’re not sitting on your bag outside the toilet for hours and hours. These guys reputation is very well earned. I didn’t listen, I chanced it, I was a fool. Go by any other means.

items.title: Complete crap service and not able to respond
items.review_text: Complete crap service. Short staffed and not able to respond to a severe train disruption that made me and lots of passengers get out somewhere between Coventry and Birmingham. As I was on my way to Wales that really messed it all up. Total bulshit as these days traveling by train in the UK. Oh, and then they want us to be more eco friendly and travel by train. I will ask for the full reimbursement of this journey, you morons.

items.title: App Charged Me Three Times!!! Stolen £150
items.review_text: Their app is completely useless and has a different problem every time I use it. This time, I was trying to move a ticket to a different date, but the payment failed twice (after clicking confirm I was taken back to the first payment page). On the third attempt, I finally received confirmation of the change. When I looked at my bank statement, I found out that three payments of £74 had been taken

items.title: Abysmal…and I’m actually in a good mood as I write this!
items.review_text:
Abysmal. Not much more worth saying, really. 
1) Awful, borderline evil prices designed to prioritise only the top 30% of our society. 
2) Terrible on board service. Don’t expect to be treated like a human being on board. Unless you’re very wealthy, you’ll be crammed on and treated like a criminal if you sit in the wrong seat or get a train 15 mins out from the one you paid for. 
3) The bare minimum features for travellers, such as WiFi, don’t work. WiFi just doesn’t work whatsoever. Don’t even bother. 
4) Terrible, overpriced food. As if you’re not spending enough.
5) Unreliable services that often don’t run on time.
6) I could add another 7 or 8 of these, but I’ll stop. 

The crux of this demonstrates that Avanti West Coast is a simply diabolical service. A visual representation of the years of damage done to this country by this inadequate, profit-driven government. The rest of Europe, many with nationalised services, offer affordable, effective but thrill-free services for their people. Avanti, and other British-based train companies, wrap a pile of steaming faeces in a damp packaging labelled ‘luxury’ and expect us to fall for it. Whoever runs the company should go to bed ashamed of themselves every night. You’re a bad person.

items.title: No direct train from London Euston to…
items.review_text: No direct train from London Euston to Liverpool Lime street at the weekend. A direct Virgin service used to take 2 hours 10 minutes. Now it takes over three hours and there are no saver tickets available. How did this shambles of a train company manage to keep their franchise. It's disgusting. Get rid of avanti.

items.title: Best of a bad bunch
items.review_text: Trains are generally comfortable but admin processes are bureaucratic with poor user experience & communication. Difficult to claim compensation. Avoid if you can, but better than Scotrail and Transpeninne.

items.title: A simply dreadful service
items.review_text: A simply dreadful service. If your idea of a good train service is a company that makes excuse after excuse about why their latest train hasn’t shown up, then this is the service for you. The individual staff members were informative and did their best to deal with the failures of their business, but it’s clear the higher ups do not care as long as they get their ridiculous fare fees. Disgraceful as per, Avanti.

items.title: Jo - Super lady :)
items.review_text:
I would just like to say a massive thank you to Jo who was looking after the first class leg of the journey from London to Euston on the 21.49 train on Sunday 23/04/23.

It could not have been easy as it was the last train home after the FA cup semi final and was very busy but Jo was super polite and super friendly and managed to somehow look after everyone with a smile, despite it being so late.

If only there were more people in the world like Jo. Thank you very much, a credit to your company!

items.title: First time traveling to London with…
items.review_text:
First time traveling to London with Avanti since the service changed from virgin. 
Booked two seats they were not together. 
Sat in the seat it was like sitting on ply wood, really uncomfortable, stunk and the carpet on the chair was the cheap horrible itch type.
A huge downgrade from the virgin trains.

items.title: Very expensive
items.review_text:
Very expensive! Scotland or Paris is cheaper! Use a car. 
Hope soon this company is disappear!

items.title: Absolutely disgusted with the service
items.review_text: Absolutely disgusted with the service. Booked the tickets using the Avanti App to attend a family funeral, wanted to go by train so as to avoid any added stress. On the morning of the funeral went to Nuneaton Station to retrieve the tickets, keyed in the booking reference code, did not recognise it, tried again, again had the same problem. Spoke to the very unhelpful and rude lady behind the counter who tried the code but it did not work for her, she said that it was not her problem that I needed to speak to Avanti, went outside to try and speak to someone, lines were not open. I then went inside and said to my partner that I would ask for a refund for the original tickets and we would purchase new ones, I was advised that it would cost £190.00, I stated that we had a railcard, she said that we could not use this before 9.30 as per the terms and conditions, although Avanti let me book the tickets using the app, we were then advised that it would cost £300.00. We were therefore left with no alternative but to drive, adding to the cost that we had already incurred with having to put petrol in the car, this is what we wanted to avoid the stress of driving, this is why we chose the train in the first place. I requested a refund of £125.20 on 27th March 2023 and after much toing and throwing, I am still waiting for a refund. The customer service is shocking, the complaints procedure is even worse. I will think twice of ever booking with Avanti again.

items.title: I was issued with two complimantary…
items.review_text: I was issued with two complimantary first class vouchers in august 2022 valid for a year. I used those vouchers to book an upcoming journey in May. My partner was admitted to hospital most recently and so is unlikely to be able to travel. I contacted Avanti west coast on 20th explaining the situation. The following day I was issued with new complimentary first class vouchers valid for 12 months. Great service and no quibble!

items.title: Late to leave Euston,(20 April at 1833)…
items.review_text: Late to leave Euston,(20 April at 1833) - missed my connection at Crewe and rude staff! It really is time Avanti were sacked - possibly the best advert for renationalisation ever!

items.title: Tactical Avanti membership ploy....no intention of giving a discount
items.review_text:
I became an Avanti member yesterday morning as they advertised that you would get a 10% discount on your first booking. I had received a notification telling me that advance tickets had been released for a journey I was taking so I was keen to get it booked, however, wanted to wait for the discount code to come through. 
It got to 9 pm last night and I had still not received my code or acknowledgment that I had joined. I did not want to miss the tickets so I booked them.
Today around 10 am, I received an email with a discount code. This angered me as I had already booked. While I understand that I could have waited, I have waited for things like this in the past and when I have gone to book the tickets have gone or gone up in price. I could not risk that in this situation.
I have just called Avanti and spoken to Hayley. While she had lots of information for me, it was not helpful at all. She offered to cancel my booking so that I could re-book it with the code. I asked her to check that the price was the same. Surprise surprise, it had gone up by £12. Therefore, If I were to cancel and re-book I would actually end up paying more.
This really angers me. I believe that this is tactical and they have no intention of giving customers any discount. Hayley also went on to mention, that the Avanti Club membership is nothing to do with them, so actually if there was an issue with the code they couldn't help. I replied with the basic facts that the membership is offered on the Avanti website. How the business is split up is no concern for me, as a customer it is just another opportunity for a company such as this to collect data under false pretenses. Shame on you. This train had better be on time and running otherwise an unpleasant review will be coming this way.

items.title: The train manager and her assistant…
items.review_text: The train manager and her assistant were brilliant polite and helpful today 20/4/23 from Manchester Piccadilly to London Euston on 10.30 am service. Professional attitude and I can go on and on. Well done the 2 ladies. From retired SWT STAFF

items.title: Excellent customer service from Treon
items.review_text: Customer service was great, spoke to very nice gentleman think name was Treon and he could not do enough to help me. Very happy customer.

items.title: What a tin pot company
items.review_text:
What a tin pot company! I will never book tickets with Avanti West Coast again, I'll go back to trainline.
I booked tickets to London for tomorrow, just 2 weeks ago, and I booked the only type of ticket their website offered, which was "advanced", I upgraded to standard premium, for extra legroom, at a cost of £50 each way. I have tested positive for covid today so don't want to travel and infect everyone on the train. I clicked on the "refund" link but got into a loop where there was no option to request a refund. Instead, I had to fill in a form, and I received a reply that they won't refund any of the ticket price at all, because I booked an "advanced" ticket, to save money... 

This was the only ticket they offered me, and the price now is no different from what I paid, I didn't save any money by booking a specific ticket. They're not offering to refund me the £100 I paid for standard premium either. I've asked them would they prefer that I travel instead and infect all of their other customers, they've just hidden behind some deeply hidden terms and conditions which state that certain ticket types are non-refundable. 

What a surprise, by the way, the link on their email to complain to the ombudsman has an error in it so it doesn't work, you have to go around the houses to put in a complaint!

At this point I will also say, don't bother traveling first class with this tin pot company, either. 

I traveled first class with them a few weeks back, and on the outward journey there was no service, because apparently, they didn't have staff, so if I wanted anything I had to walk all the way from the front to the rear of the 11 coach train, to get it from the shop myself. 

The return journey was fine, as they had staff, and the service was great, nice staff. When you consider that the extra cost of first class is about £130, though, and the extra cost to sit in the same seats just without the service (standard premium) is £50, it means paying £80 for a grilled toastie and a gin & tonic. Nice gin & tonic though to be fair ;-), and they did bring me a top-up.

While I'm ranting ;-), on the return journey above, quite a few people came onto the first class coach and were confused, as they'd paid for premium standard and there didn't appear to be any head rest covers to specify premium standard. I overheard a conversation where a customer was told that there was no premium standard option on this train, as it was the first offpeak train that evening, they were doing an experiment with not offering premium standard on that journey.  

The customer obviously didn't feel this was fair, and asked how they were supposed to know not to get on this train, and he was told that he should have noticed, before boarding the train, that there were no standard premium headrest covers ;-).

Again, tin pot company, avoid.

items.title: We came back from London Euston last…
items.review_text:
We came back from London Euston last week.  Unfortunately missed the train by a few minutes 😪 
 It was on time. As we rushed in we spoke to with an Avanti member of staff on the platform.  His name was Josh and he was so understanding and helpful. He sorted out our dilemma without any fuss. We got the next train, which ironically was 15 minutes late. I hope Avanti will recognise Josh's good work. We will definitely use Avanti service in the future.

items.title: I would avoid where possible
items.review_text: Staff actively take pleasure in identifying problems with your ticket rather than trying to help you complete your journey. Not very effective company staffed by ‘computer says no’ people.

items.title: Awful!
items.review_text: Awful!! Tried to book a ticket now FIVE times on app and online…each time I put payment card number in all I get is oops something went wrong! Have tried debit and credit cards all to no avail. These people need stripping of their licence…bring back Virgin!!!!

items.title: Euston need more Adam’s  at there station
items.review_text: Euston to Runcorn, Adam the ticket guard at Euston station is a great fella he’s so  polite & very helpful he’s helped us out on 2 occasions now, Euston you need more guards like Adam.

items.title: F**king rubbish service
items.review_text: F**king rubbish service. Nothing to add. Just one comment, you are as awful as bullsh1t

items.title: DONT USE THE APP - issue with payment system
items.review_text: An issue with the app payment system meant that I was charged nearly £500! The call centre team member, adnan, was less than helpful and his resolution was to raise a complaint for me - thanks adnan, I thought I was doing this by talking to you. Their resolution offer was that someone would look into it in 48 hours and refund would be expected in 10 days. Absolute disgrace

items.title: Smelly carriages like lavatory
items.review_text: Smelly carriages like lavatory, seat upholstery is grubby virgin red, booking not showing on digital screen above seat, no plug sockets.

items.title: Such a shame…
items.review_text: Every time we have used Avanti West coast since they took over Virgin, we have had a problem. Double booked seats, broken train, endless delays. Companies are allowed to make mistakes, but when rail travel is the clear solution to road congestion, and hence bridging a gap over the North-South divide and handling CO₂ emissions, I find it such a shame that a poorly run company is making it so difficult to get into London by train. I hope for the future that these reliability issues can be resolved so that travelling by train to London can be, once again, an enjoyable experience. Please note that all Avanti employees I have encountered have been very helpful and pleasant, it appears that solely the management and funding are to blame.

items.title: I was travelling alone with an advance…
items.review_text: I was travelling alone from Euston to Glasgow  with an advance ticket,I had fallen ill on my trip so on my return journey I asked at the avanti desk which had 3 employees standing at it, if could go on the train a hour before mine was due as I was ill and alone,I needed home quick,one seat was all i needed,i was told only if i bought another ticket, from one of the employees possibly the train driver as he looked like the driver who was on the train i got took on to earlier by assistance, and the driver has to change his carriage end at a diversion so walked through the train to get to other end, I do know the rule regarding advance tickets but under the circumstances you would think they would make an exception,I had to go into the assistance waiting room,while there two other women who had someone with them came in ill and told the assistant they had been given permission by a different rail company to travel earlier on their advance ticket,poor show from avanti.

items.title: First Class Failure
items.review_text:
I have been travelling between Birmingham International and London Euston since 2006, for the last 10 years self funded as I am self employed, rather than company expensed.

For the last 3 years I have been travelling by car since the impacts of COVID, having previously used monthly season tickets with Virgin, and later Avanti, including zone 1-6 pass as I work near Wandsworth Town (2 further connections and a walk). These are not cheap.

I decided last week to attempt to use public transport again to reduce the impact of my personal carbon footprint using the car. This cost me close to £300 as I decided to encourage myself back onto the train, for the first time in my life I would travel first class. The morning journey was an absolute delight. I thought, this is definitely worth it. Then came the afternoon…the 17:16 from London Euston didn’t have any first class service, which I’m assuming is a regular thing as nobody seemed to make much of a fuss. I had been looking forward all day to a luxury journey home with table service in which I thought this is definitely good value for money. Now, I am left without a clear way to reclaim my refund as it wasn’t delayed, but I didn’t get what I paid for. The car journey costs me £70 in fuel, and £20 in parking….so in effect I feel as though I have paid almost £200 for a sandwich and coffee.

To add further insult to injury, the onboard shop was only accepting cash…which I never carry as also since COVID, cash isn’t really circulating anymore, so I am now facing a journey with no option to eat anything after planning to eat on the train.

I’m so disappointed and feel like I am better off sticking with the car journey and a sainsburys meal deal as the refund isn’t going to be easy to obtain and it’s now more stressful than the drive would have been.

items.title: Terrible customer service and policies
items.review_text:
I have been complaining to Avanti customer service since Nov 2022 to no avail.
My train was cancelling due to a train strike however despite an email from Avanti stating I could have a fee free refund I only received an e-voucher.
I was informed the e-voucher is easy to use however when I tried to use it there is no function to enter this as a payment method.
After several emails of complaint and a number of calls to the helpline I have finally been informed that I am unable to use an e-voucher if I use a railcardas I have to put the e-voucher in the discount box. Why? The e-voucher was a refund for a cancelled train so why am I being penalised by having to pay a third more for my ticket in order to use my e-voucher despite me paying for the railcard? The company has an appalling reputation and equally appalling customer service and corrupt policies.

items.title: The new face of Avanti ?
items.review_text:
The new face of Avanti ?
Changing at Crewe for Manchester ( today tues 11th ) I suddenly realised the return bit of my ticket was not showing on my phone, I am not great at this sort of thing but knew it was there somewhere, I asked a young lady from avanti who was stood on platform 6 if there was a help desk ,the lovely Laura ( I think ) said she would help me and she did ,for a good 10 minutes and she did indeed find my ticket . I say all this because I’ve not been a fan  of avanti the last few years but praise where it’s due ,this young woman was a credit to you . Well done Laura you were a star 👏👏👏

items.title: Didn't travel
items.review_text: Didn't travel, sent tickets by post for refund, also emailed them copies of tickets they wouldn't refund until I can provide a picture of tickets cut. Which I couldn't provide as I had already sent them to the station.

items.title: It is becoming worse every time I use…
items.review_text: It is becoming worse every time I use this train service. I recommend avoiding it at all costs. The journey from London to Manchester took me 9 hours, and I am not exaggerating.

items.title: Had an Excellent journey with partner to Watford Junction
items.review_text: Had an Excellent journey with partner

items.title: Karen is lovely asked politely for me…
items.review_text:
Karen is lovely asked politely for me to stop vaping. Very polite lady and deserves a pay rise. 
Only respectful worker.

items.title: Overpriced Because There Is No Competition On The West Coast Mainline
items.review_text:
I contacted Avanti West Coast regarding seat reservations being duplicated. I had a reservation from Birmingham International to Lancaster and when I got in at Birmingham International the seat was supposedly reserved from Euston until further, but nobody was present so I got the seat meant for me. The Reservation from Euston showed until about Stafford, so if whoever had reserved it got on, I wouldn’t have had the seat from Birmingham International.

There have been occasions where other passengers have resided in the seat reserved for me and told me it is reserved for them, so I don’t know if it is true or they are liars who can’t be bothered to get out of the seat. With all these problems, Avanti needs to get the reservation system sorted out before there is a punch up.

I was acknowledged by Avanti saying they will be in touch within a few days, that was seven weeks ago and I haven’t heard anything more from them.

With their overpriced advanced purchase tickets they can get stuffed. I shall avoid paying their ripoff prices by driving so far and getting regional rail rovers instead. I can drive to Crewe and get an extended West Midlands Day Ranger to explore the West Midlands, but the journey to and from Crewe which is a fraction of what the journey around the West Midlands will be is twice the price of the day ranger. I shall drive to Crewe and enjoy my tour of the West Midlands. I’m not prepared to be ripped off by Avanti West Coast.

items.title: Absolutely terrible customer service
items.review_text: Absolutely terrible customer service. I can’t believe the way I was spoken and treated at the station of Birmingham airport, a place where people tend to be stressed enough about their flights, let alone have someone from Avanti shout at you and give you attitude. 0% understanding and helpfulness. Extremely badly done eyeliner woman, I really hope you get fired, although going by the reviews below this might just be Avanti’s style. I will certainly avoid dealing with this company at all costs after that.

items.title: Absolutely dreadful
items.review_text: Absolutely dreadful. I usually get the train between London and Manchester which costs around 40-60 pounds but today it was over £100. At a peak time such as 5pm too this seemed like such a scam. For £100 I could travel to a different country. For £100 I’d expect great service but instead I was sat on stained and highly uncomfortable chairs, with no wifi so I wasn’t able to order any food or water for the duration of my journey and on top of that there were barely any charging ports. This isn’t the first time I’ve been disappointed by AVANTI west coast. In October I was stuck on the train for 10 hours with only a refund offered as compensation. AVOID AVANTI WEST COAST AT ALL COST

items.title: Incredibly unreliable
items.review_text: Incredibly unreliable, with very frequent substantial delays.

items.title: Disgusting refund policy
items.review_text: Disgusting refund policy! I made a mistake whilst booking my train ticket of booking an open return on the wrong date, I tried to Amend the outgoing date and it charged me £10 to do this. I checked the ticket and saw it had changed the wrong station so I called the helpline straightaway to get it sorted. The lady was nice but I was on the phone for over half an hour. They were happy to refund the ticket so I could rebook but claimed I would be charged for the refund plus the amendment! How can they justify charging me an admin fee twice for a human error! Also one of the errors was on their side from the app! I persisted and demanded an explanation as to why I was being charged twice, and got told it’s policy?! What policy? The operator wasn’t able to help me and couldn’t find a manager on site…….so now I’m £83.10 short and don’t have a ticket to travel!!! I have asked to speak to the manager and waiting to hear back! Ticket prices are already extortionate for the port service Avanti offer- trains always delayed, train drivers not turning up…..

items.title: Internet is BISMAL
items.review_text: Internet is BISMAL

items.title: Nationalise the west coast main line
items.review_text:
Avanti are an absolute sham of a company. Designed purely to extract profit at the expense of customer service. Trains prices have doubled in the space of a few years and the number of trains that actually leave on time, if at all, has fallen off a cliff. Nationalise the west coast mainline and get rid of these grubby charlatans.
All said, there are some stellar staff working on the trains themselves and they deserve medals.

items.title: Most uncomfortable train Ive ever been…
items.review_text: Most uncomfortable train Ive ever been on. Seats are rock hard and feel cheap. Virgin were much better.

items.title: Fantastic Customer Service this morning...
items.review_text:
A spot of bother overnight and this morning with gremlins in the Avanti website and app not allowing me to book 3 x First Class tickets (with Disability Railcards) Glasgow to London Euston.
But, and it's an important "but", contacted Customer Service and the assistant couldn't have been more helpful. She promised to call me back as soon as the Internet was up and running (I'm always a little cynical when I'm "promised" a callback- but I needn't have worried) within a hour I was called, the booking was made and at a terrific price. Thank you Avanti West Coast, we are looking forward to our First Class journey from Glasgow to London in June.

items.title: Train always delayed - appalling service
items.review_text:
During peak hours from Manchester they delay the train on purpose by 15-20 mins probably to let the northern train depart so as to reduce the  passengers they carry.

Seen this happen many times and they say they were waiting for the driver which is nonsense.

Cant their drivers read their timetables and be on time if thats the case.
I cant turn up 20 mins late to my job. why can they? And they get a raise.

Funny how this govt renews their contract for such appalling service.

items.title: Appalling VFM
items.review_text:
Extortionate cost of return to London from Shrewsbury via Crewe. Went first class anticipating probs getting seat. Expected high level of at-seat service given the £186 cost .. but nothing offered. On return train was late and I was alone in first class..waited for service, no show again..went to shop / bar and was able to get what I wanted on showing ticket. No announcement of this. Not surprised 1st class empty!
Just dreadful overpriced rip-off experience.

items.title: Avanti run an appalling service
items.review_text: Avanti run an appalling service. It's not the staff on the train but the systems in place. The trains are always completely rammed due to cancelling trains, seat reservations don't come up above so causes a lot of stress and conflict between the public. The cost is disgusting for a cramped dirty old train. The shop never accepts card machines. Also the wifi is terrible. Sort yourselves out Avanti or move on.

items.title: Fab friendly and helpful staff
items.review_text: I can honestly say I have had no issues at all and all the staff are helpful and friendly. I commute weekly.

items.title: shameful disgusting service or rather lack off it
items.review_text: given the run around disabled person had a fall dislocated her right shoulder,can't do the tube due to panic attacks,so had to get a taxi back from a funeral,&missed my connections refused a refund said it'd the train line as I bought my original ticket through them!then I had to pay£35 extra retired,disabled no sympathy or compassion very unhelpful

items.title: Wow.....
items.review_text: Wow...... what more can I say...... what a surprise...... The train from Euston to Manchester is scheduled to depart at 21:33, but the conductor is running late:)) What??? Oh my god, with this joke I went to my manager....:))) if the driver for trains in this company can be late, what can I expect more? Thank you for this experience

items.title: Not a very reliable transportation option!
items.review_text: Wir wollen am 1.4.23 mit Avanti West von Manchester nach London fahren. Eigentlich eine einfache Task. Aber mit Avanti ist das so eher eine Art Vabanque Spiel. Sie schalten den Tag einfach nicht frei. Mal wird an dem Tag gestreikt. Dann bekommst du eine Mail von Avanti, dass nun nicht mehr gestreikt wird. Aber der 1.4. wird trotzdem nicht freigeschaltet. Forget it, wir haben jetzt den Bus gebucht, der braucht zwar länger, kostet aber viel weniger. Und Avanti soll einfach den Betrieb wieder aufnehmen, wenn die Mitarbeiter wieder Lust auf's Arbeiten haben - dann aber ohne uns, wir haben fertig mit dem Unternehmen!

items.title: Awful- can not even blame strikes…
items.review_text: Awful- can not even blame strikes anymore, just incompetence

items.title: Just awful.
items.review_text: Preston to Euston. The screens suddenly show it’s cancelled despite the ‘live tracker’ on the Trainline app telling me it’s still on time.  A panicked enquiry at the desk tells me it is still running. The surly desk clerk looking suitably disinterested and unapologetic at the confusion. Then the tannoy announces that it is cancelled due to a points failure.  A further visit to the desk tells me it’s still running. The screens then tell me it’s running but from a different platform. I eventually get on board. Soon after Wigan, the shop is shut because there is no running water. The service is late getting into Euston making my connection very rushed. Conclusion - no one uses the train because the service is dreadful. Because no one uses them there is less revenue for investment. Lack of investment means it is run on a shoestring which makes the service poor. Circular argument. And then they go on strike wanting more money…

items.title: Absolutely disappointing!!
items.review_text:
Absolutely disappointing!!! Train is loud like a tractor is this really 2023 or 1845 😆 
vibrations like riding on horse !!! What a joke!!!! 
Also no internet zero!!! 
I will take plane next time!!! £100 for this is a JOKE and JOKE again

items.title: I cannot buy tickets for a trip I am…
items.review_text:
I cannot buy tickets for a trip I am planning in 7 weeks time.
With virgin I would have bought them 12 weeks in advance without any issue and a good day out would've been had.
We can't plan without train tix, so it won't happen.

items.title: Complete lack of service….stuck in the past!!
items.review_text: Booked a ticket Brighton to Liverpool return. Lost my return ticket and was forced to pay £92 for a new ticket. All because of a piece of paper. Thanks for the complete lack of any service whatsoever all because of a little piece of paper. UK 2023….truly pathetic. Never will I book with you again!!!!

items.title: Awful journey
items.review_text: Train to Liverpool cancelled in Crewe stranding customers with no replacement service or bus

items.title: Have been trying to book a ticket for a…
items.review_text: Have been trying to book a ticket for a long trip in April for weeks! Despite it saying the tickets have been released I can’t proceed on their website or the app. I am a single mum without a car. All I want to do is take my 2 year old son to visit his grandparents. Bring back Virgin!!!

items.title: What an absolute joke
items.review_text: What an absolute joke. I will never use rail travel again for the last year or so I've missed so many social events, family events. This company is still advertising book in advance get the best deal, you book and get close to the date to find out there's a strike that day. So my last social event was supposed to be 1st april. And guess what train line announced a couple of weeks before , train strikes that day. I rather travel by an organised mini bus for my friends and i and now train journeys are a thing if the past. 👎👎👎👎 national rail . they don't even offer refunds for railcard owners that can't even use their cards that they have paid good money for. Rail travel is just a joke and a laughing stock to the nation

items.title: Stuck on rammed train no driver at Euston
items.review_text: I’m on the 1553 Tuesday 14th March Avanti train at Euston for Manchester Piccadilly.  The train is rammed and announcement given by guard that they are looking for a driver. 20 mins  later still not departed, Awful service

items.title: Timetables? Nah...
items.review_text: Train companies code of conduct says they should have train timetables published at least 12 weeks in advance. These jokers don't care - routinely having days with no bookable trains less than a month in advance, and not even on strike days. Just take a quick look at April weekends at the moment (London-Holyhead). So unreliable. Need stripping of the franchise ASAP.

items.title: Train was fast
items.review_text: Train was fast

items.title: Well here we are its the 10th of March…
items.review_text: Well here we are its the 10th of March and I still can't book an Avanti ticket from London to Preston on the 1st of April. Yes 21 days he's much too far in advance for a vantage to cope with. I am disabled. This train booking must be made before I can make on the bookings such as hotel rooms and event bookings. I have already missed event and one holiday because by the time I got my tickets the rooms my wanted got booked and another occasion Juventus kits sold out. There is absolutely no way but this outfit should be giving any more extensions to their contract. They should be replaced forthwith with the company that can deliver a sensible timetable

items.title: appalling service
items.review_text:
I am a commuter between Birmingham and Euston and loved my commute when this was operated by Virgin. However, since it has been taken over by Avanti it has been a nightmare - the staff at the station (Euston) are rude and will do anything not to assist passengers when issues arise - I had a ticket seller who literally avoided eye contact with me and the other person in front of me while making us wait for over 5 minutes while joking with a colleague. When asked for name to make a complaint ran away to office without paying any attention to us. We were stunned. 

Another seller sent us to the ticket machines instead. 
I have started avoiding Avanti - the alternative journey with LNR is slightly longer but oh so much more pleasant and reliable. I just change at Rugby and can get to Birmingham in 1 hr 30 min instead of 1 hr 15 min. It's absolutely worth it. Can't wait until Avanti is stripped of its contract. Please write to your MP.

items.title: Travelled from Stockport to Euston…
items.review_text: Travelled from Stockport to Euston today on the 05.15am to 7.30am train in first class (J 33). Brilliant experience, on time, great service and fantastic staff. Out of the blue I got motion sickness, they brought me water, ginger ale and gave me some advice on how to manage it - all really useful and made a big difference. Thank you to the train staff for looking after me - a credit to your organisation. Many thanks Jacque

items.title: Today 08th Mar 2023 l was attended to…
items.review_text: Today 08th Mar 2023 l was attended to by a Mr Khan. I want to say he was so pleasant ,full of good manners and made my journey so pleasurable. I am a wheel chair user and he went over and beyond to make your company  proud.  Please  recruit more Mr Khans to make avanti grow from strength  to strength  and have more satisfied  customers

items.title: Disgraceful experience today
items.review_text: Disgraceful experience today! Train was delayed by more than two hours and because of that we been 2min late for next train. So because of that I and my 6 year old son was waiting 3 hours for our next train. Also taking in account my son been already in train station for 2 hours, because of previous delay. So total he been 5 hours in station and my 3h journey ended up in 7.5h journey without staff offering any other alternative ways of commute.  Very disappointing experience!

items.title: I'm delighted with my experience
items.review_text: Travelled with AWC from Euston to Birmingham and back. OK, I went first class, but I was very impressed. Train clean and tidy, staff pleasant, helpful and competent, journey swift and on time, food really nice. I travel a lot, but not much by train (usually suffer Southern if I do) so this was an absolute revelation. It felt as though people had really tried and I wish to acknowledge that. Update - as it happens, I need to do a similar journey shortly. Chosen to book AWC again.

items.title: Very unreliable and very expensive
items.review_text: Very unreliable and very expensive

items.title: They can get it right!
items.review_text: I know that they have let some people down, but I have to say Avanti was fine for my journey today from Birmingham to London. Train clean and warm and on time.

items.title: Disgraceful company. Waiting for 5 months for Delay Repay Payment
items.review_text: Disgraceful company. I have been waiting since the 5th November 2022 for my delay repay payment, it is now 1st March 2023. I have been chasing up every week or 2 weeks. I will be taking them to court or going through mediation services.

items.title: Why so hot
items.review_text: Why so hot! What temperature are you going for…… nuclear?…….. for goodness sake

items.title: Unbelievable
items.review_text: So today there was a loud banging coming from an electrical cabinet in my coach. Reported it to numerous on board staff who were very dismissive. Told me to move and that it wasn’t that bad. Unbelievable.

items.title: Beggars Belief!!…
items.review_text: I've just tried to book a return journey from London to the north, for next week, on Trainline. Nothing available, says "tickets coming soon"!! When is this ongoing nightmare with Avanti West Coast going to end?

items.title: I’d just like to say on my trip today…
items.review_text: I’d just like to say on my trip today from Carlisle to Watford was made a pleasure by the conductor who I’ll name only in the hope of company recognition. Erin showed great humility to two young some what vulnerable customers in a helpful and  compassionate way to assist them on their journey. What a credit to the company. Lovely to see.

items.title: Excellent service
items.review_text:
Dear sir or Madam 

I would like to take the time to write a compliment about one of your staff that work in New Street Station selling travel tickets . 

I haven’t bought a ticket in years and Rebecca was exemplary . She talked me through the available options and I settled on a monthly travel pass . 
Rebecca was very kind and patient as I have anxiety and extremely professional she had great product knowledge and listened to me . 
Rebecca us a credit to your company and she actually made my evening as I went home with a spring in my step because she made me feel valued which is very rare these days . 
Can you please let Rebecca know the great service she gave me and can you thank her personally for her good work and genuine care for her customers who are travelling through the stations. 😊

items.title: SHAMEFUL LIARS/APPALLING SERVICE
items.review_text:
Absolutely shameful liars, booked 14.41 1st class Preston to Glasgow. 2 trains earlier that day cancelled. Passengers from eatlier trains put on ours. Train then declassified with no food being served. Only bottled water. Overcrowded, overheated, noisy, luggage strewn everywhere -tripping hazard. I personally had minimal breakfast at 09.30 that day and arrived Glasgow 45 mins late at 17.45 with no food for 8 hours & unable to take medications. When claiming through customer service email,  they said that a standard ticket was £5.80 less, than 1st class, when clearly stated when booked on website was £35! So would only qualify for £5 refund, nstead of at least £35. They should be refunding full money, like Virgin used to do. Have claimed through delay/repay & requested refund goes to children's charity, see if they scam that too? 😡 
Bring back Virgin

items.title: Truly awful company
items.review_text: Truly awful company - trains overcrowded , half seat reserved and people stood all in the isles - only an hour to Euston

items.title: Late, no toilets, no power
items.review_text:
- Train left and arrived late. 
- Every toilet on a train from london to manchester was out of order.
- Every plug socket on our table didn't work.

So we desperately needed the toilet and phone ran out of battery.

Looking forward to the 8% price increase in March 👍

items.title: Totally appalling
items.review_text: Totally appalling, disgusting toilets, disinterested staff, poor selection of food. Unbelievable how they retain the franchise

items.title: Daily misery
items.review_text: Being part of my daily commute they continue to make my life hell. They are unquestionably garbage. But what do expect they are after all run by First . I should image to poor staff were once happy Virgin Employees

items.title: Treated myself to first class after a…
items.review_text: Treated myself to first class after a few days walking in the lakes , one drink served in 3hrs on the train , total waste of money , only 3 people in first class carriage,  I now know why.

items.title: 2023 or 1983
items.review_text: 2023 or 1983 ? still making you print tickets at the station unlike other train companies where you just zap a code. Printed 22 tickets for 1 family return journey!

items.title: My trip was a bfreeze
items.review_text: I appreciate that some people have had really bad experiences with Avanti but I just wanted to say that today I went to London for a flying visit to see a customer and everything was really good. All of the staff I encountered were really helpful and pleasant, especially the lady at the barrier when my phone would not allow me to 'view tickets' so I couldn't get through the barrier at Euston. I suffer from anxiety and unexpectedly found my trip was a breeze.

items.title: Avanti, the worst in Britain
items.review_text:
Avanti is presently considered the worst rail franchise in Britain by a long way. 

Cancellations around the 20% mark.

My train from Shrewsbury to London is certainly much, much higher. I've had one on-time journey since I began this weekly commute in Nov 22. My train (specifically the Birmingham to Shrewsbury part) is cancelled about 75% of the time.

This is not viable for passengers. I now have to look at driving instead of public transport. 

Avanti, you are destroying British rail.

items.title: don't book 1st class
items.review_text: we traveled conwy to Birmingham in first class, there was no table service throughout the return journey when I conplained I was told that it was a complimentary service so no compensation so what's the point of booking first class it an absolute joke

items.title: Awful customer service and worse rail service!
items.review_text: I booked tickets for my wife and children (7&9) to travel to London on a Saturday morning. I reserved seats and requested a table, I even entered the ages of the children when placing the booking. Avanti then allocated 3 random seats at different points of the carriage, this was not discovered until they got on the train. After contacting avanti and requesting copies of their young passenger policies and an answer as to why they think it is acceptable to seat young children away from their parent/guardian, I have not been provided with any of the information requested and have been fobbed off by their disappointing customer care team.

items.title: My train was delayed by over 60 minutes - Refund commitment is false.
items.review_text: My train was delayed by over 60 minutes. They informed me that I may be due a refund given their over 15 minute refund procedure. After applying for refund they claimed I only had a 5 minute delay, that there was an alternative train option, there was not. The only Avanti option was to get the train on time an hour later. Then after appealing the decision they produced bogus alternatives. This has been very stressful. Their refund procedure is deeply unfair, looks good on paper but they fail both on customer service and duty of candour.

items.title: WEBSITE IS A DISGRACE
items.review_text:
WEBSITE IS A DISGRACE. NOT FIT FOR PURPOSE
The whole process is a nightmare. Even their Call Centre admit this.  Who on earth is in charge of it? 
 Tried to book a parking spot and it took over an hour! Finally made a booking and it churned out 5 pieces of A4 paper when all I wanted was my ticket. And there is no way of speaking with anyone.  Why should it be such a painful experience to do ANYTHING in connection with Avanti?  Bring back Richard Branson.

items.title: Outrageous and unsafe service
items.review_text: Outrageous service. Train was delayed for half an hour. When it finally arrived to the station and we got on it, they had sold too many tickets. Result: we (and several other people) ended up having to do the whole journey (Manchester-London) standing up. No compensation has been offered. After what happened in Ohio I don’t think showing this little respect for safety in railway services is appropriate. Very disappointed with this company

items.title: Shockingly bad company
items.review_text: Shockingly bad company. Cancelled return journey London-manchester with less than 48hrs notice. Call centre in India tried to fleece me for an extra £94 to change to next train which I was later advised I could travel on for no extra fee. Unfortunately the driver for the rescheduled train failed to appear, which was communicated very poorly at Euston. Train absolutely rammed so spent first 40 minutes sat on the floor of a filthy train. Avanti staff at Euston and on the train totally disinterested. Avanti are not a fit and proper company to run this service.Unfortunately our politicians appear not to have the balls/ability to affectively address this matter. Next visit will be in the car and any support I may have had for the staff pay claim is well gone. Awful, Awful service.

items.title: Overall fairly good service however the…
items.review_text: Overall fairly good service however the customer services staff at London Euston were unhelpful, had a couldn’t care less attitude and obviously were not there to help their customers.

items.title: This should be zero stars however that option is not available
items.review_text: I'm in full agreement with every other 1 star review here.  The service this company provides is shocking, which is there after followed up by the horrific customer resolutions team who provide no actual resolution.  My experience involved a last minute cancellation, of which when I arrived at the station the train was ready waiting at the platform before being driven out with no issues. So clearly there was a readily available train with driver, so why the need for a cancellation I do not know. I'm curious as to if Avanti even run trains anymore as having read other reviews I note cancellations seem to be a regular occurrence.  I was then left to endure a bus replacement service for a now 7 hour journey.  The original train journey paid for should only have been 3 and a half hours.  Furthermore they had not even bothered to provide soap or toilet paper in the on board facilities.  Having been a regular user of the west coast mainline when virgin had the contract, I suffered no issues and had only enjoyable experiences.  Avanti however is a terrible experience.

items.title: Appalling
items.review_text: Appalling. Should be a zero. Service was cancelled. Issued a delay repay request which was declined. Instead of having the two seats that I'd reserved and paid for on Avanti's quick service, we had no choice but to stand up for over two hours on an alternative network. The fact that I have a receipt for the costs of the tickets and a receipt stating the date and details of the journey, the specific train and the specific seats that I had booked this wasn't sufficient detail for a successful claim. Joke.

items.title: No, no, no!
items.review_text: No, no, no!  21st century travel with too few charging sockets on a train.  Not acceptable.  Dirty, smelly, old.  With limited foot space.  Awful lighting.  Lumo all the way!!

items.title: Delay Repay .. No Issues…Great Service
items.review_text:
Fortunately booked via the Avanti App
Delay repay through the app
Very annoying as booked 2 hours before travelling… checked and running… arrived at station….Train cancelled … needed to travel on a later service
Return delayed by 25 mins due to a tech issue
Claimed through Delay Repay
Lots of detail and uploading copy tickets etc
But efficient and evidently automated
Received refunds for delay on outbound  (100%!refund) and inbound ( 25% refund) within a week of travel
Should not need to claim, but having at least Avanti got it right!

items.title: Shockingly bad service! Reliably unreliable.
items.review_text:
Shockingly bad service!
I use A WC trains weekly for long distance travel. 
Never has the train been on time on my journeys. 
Never has the WiFi worked. 
Never have I been able to ascertain consistent mobile coverage.
Never has the pos till worked for cards payments first time.
Thankfully the staff are lovely (nearly always).
If the train was at least on time, all of the above could may be viewed as luxuries, despite us being deep into the 21st century and the company advertising that it provides these things.
This company is reliably bad.

items.title: Orderd a simple coffee to my seat as…
items.review_text: Orderd a simple coffee to my seat as the sticker on the seat say order was cancel as in the text say they dont have the item lol it is a coffee for love of god

items.title: Dreadful
items.review_text: Dreadful, trains cancelled, delayed, no information provided. Incompetent, woeful, downright embarrassing. Bring back Virgin.

items.title: Worst train operator ever
items.review_text:
This is the worst train operator ever. If there was a 0 star rating they would qualify. 

Not only was the service cancelled and despite us applying for a refund in advance of the service time of departure they say we don’t qualify. 

This company should take a serious look at themselves and consider if passenger would travel with them if there was an alternative.

Shocking.

I future I will drive.

items.title: Really fast and reliable service
items.review_text: Really fast and reliable service. Comfortable and the staff were welcoming

items.title: lost access to my account once again
items.review_text: 14/02/2023. One more disapointment with a substandard company. I paid for a ticket to go from liverpool to London this week end. When I tried to access my account to download the ticket early this morning, oh surprise I was once again locked out of my account. this is the 4th time this happens and the access resume on itself 24h to a few days later, when they are done working on their website I guess. I tried all the options they provide including resetting the password for which they should send a link to my email within a few minutes... 40 minutes later still no email. That company is a shamble.

items.title: Although I have experienced delays and…
items.review_text: Although I have experienced delays and cancellations with Avanti, the staff I have interacted with at the ticket barriers and on the trains have always been very friendly and helpful. The most recent example was on the 8th February on the 16:30 London Euston to Glasgow Central train. A kind employee let me through the barriers (unfortunately I have forgotten his name). Stephen then helped me with the problem and even went out his way to talk to the train manager on my behalf. I was very grateful.

items.title: Train from Macclesfield to Piccadilly…
items.review_text: Train from Macclesfield to Piccadilly delayed by 50 mins. Train home delayed by 1hour !! It is totally Unacceptable!! I will think again before booking Avanti West.

items.title: Poor experience
items.review_text:
I booked the train 2 weeks in advance. 

My 9 hour flight arrived at Gatwick 30 mins early, and got through arrivals alot quicker than i thought, and I ended up being 2 hours early to catch my train from london euston.

By this point I have been awake 20 hours and have another 5 hours travelling so I went to the desk to see if I can pay to change to the earlier train. But I got a rude assistant that said "your plane was 3 hours early?? Iv never heard of that happening! Well if you want to get on the earlier train then that will be £180" (I never even said my plane was 3 hours early??)

I said I would leave it and wait, and he looked at me all smugly as if to say..yeah thought so. 

I would of happily paid up to £66 (which was the cost of my whole journey) but not £180!

So I waited, and looked at the early train which was empty! And waited my 2 hours. Then... my train was an hour late and I missed all my connections.

So now they owe me money for my train being delayed! (Which I probably won't see going by other reviews)

Not sure what this business model is but everyone was in a lose lose situation here.

items.title: On the Euston to Liverpool today The…
items.review_text: On the Euston to Liverpool today The service and the team on board Have been amazing. Great menu as well.

items.title: First time using Avanti and 5 stars from me
items.review_text: Amazing trip from Carlisle to London, My train was on time leaving Carlisle and was very quiet, in fact I had half a carriage to myself until Warrington when it got very slightly busier. Arrived in London 20 minutes late but no fault of Avanti as it was engineering works approaching London. A very comfortable and relaxing journey overall

items.title: Bid for a Seatfrog upgrade to first…
items.review_text: Bid for a Seatfrog upgrade to first class and won the upgrade, all fine. This was Liverpool to Euston, £70 for two people. Avanti show their first class as a first class service with good seats, great service and the video shows a great choice of food and beverages. Got onto the train, unfriendly coach attendant, only one choice, poor quality bacon sandwich, cheap bread and bacon (have pic if anybody wants it to evidence). Carriage filled with non first class, who all got offered the service until the ticket collector came along and told them they were in the wrong carriage. Then offered drinks tea or coffee, no other offer and asked for another coffee (Mocha), no just the cheapest tea or coffee. Firstly complained to Seatfrog, they were helpful and understanding but could do nothing and need to speak to Avanti. Avanti just use the terms and conditions that nothing is guaranteed or may not be available. The only thing is it’s a shame their promotional film does not show the lowest of their service standards, as they think this is acceptable. Unfortunately this level of service is a complete rip off for an upgrade and they should be ashamed hiding behind terms and conditions. More staff training as to what the service level should be would help too. Thanks for you response, I did think as you were the agent that was paid for this service that you had some responsibility for the service you offer, even if supplied by a third party. I have paid by credit card and if you think the service given was not as you expect then should I claim via them?

items.title: New timetable /ongoing ticket pricing is a farce
items.review_text:
I have been using this mainline service on a regular basis from Lancaster to London or to Crewe for over 15 years now. Could someone who monitors this company /the regulator please look very carefully at the new advanced timetable just issued. Lancaster has a severely reduced direct service to London or Crewe with lengthier journey times or more changes the norm and is a forlorn distance from the service provided before. 
To add to this, I cannot find any reduced pricing for a  Lancaster to Crewe/Crewe/LAN journey no matter how far you search in the future. A train company cannot just pick and choose which train fares to reduce or just ignore. Th cost of the journey above is almost triple the costs of what Virgin used to offer on advanced pricing. 
At the very least the gov’t needs to put this key mainline service franchise back out to tender. This would at least allow for other companies to offer their thoughts and business model to the table. There are things in life that are difficult to resolve but this is not one of them and the service provided in terms of train performance and pricing needs to be brought back to some level of decency. It is truly out of control for everyday customers who have no other alternatives but to use the car and pollute the environment further.  Please could somebody just look into the new timetable/pricing issue as a matter of urgency as am at my wits end with this "cowboy" company!

items.title: Preston staff
items.review_text: Lovely lady at Preston showed me where to stand for the unreserved coach when I was just checking my ticket was OK. Thanks.

items.title: The staff on my avanti WC train have…
items.review_text: The staff on my avanti WC train have rescued me! lending me a charger for my phone and a friendly Chat whilst it charged... thank you dann!

items.title: Absolute joke
items.review_text: Absolute joke. Need I say more??

items.title: Train was cancelled
items.review_text:
Train was cancelled. No explanation was given. Missed my meeting. 
Sat reluctantly on board the next service in an overheated, overcrowded carriage. 
My advice to others is to avoid this service provider like the plague.

items.title: At Euston (last train to Birmingham) I…
items.review_text:
At Euston (last train to Birmingham) I got to the train just as the staff closed the barriers (I was surprised as there was still 8 minutes until the train departed) but I'll take in on the chin as I was running late. When I asked one of the Avanti staff (Mark) if I could go through they said no and thought it was funny for some reason like they were playing a little game with their colleagues.

To my absolute dismay the same guy - Mark - subsequently let two young ladies through the barrier, I stood there in disbelief. When I asked how come they are allowed through he commented, "because they are prettier than you!" (I'm a man in my 40s). So thanks a lot Mark (skinny guy with grey hair at Euston) what a total creep! Can someone at Avanti please explain this behaviour please?

items.title: SO MANY Avanti Trains Delayed or Cancelled 😡
items.review_text: Is it just coincidence that each time I intend to travel with Avanti,  my planned train is either cancelled or severely delayed 😭

items.title: Worst train company in the UK
items.review_text:
So fed up if Avanti service. A few weeks ago 5 of us missed an advanced train by 2 mins due to unexpected roadworks holding up our taxi. They refused to let us on the next one and charged us £500 for new tickets. No compassion for the fact we had zero control over the roadworks or delays. 

Today at Euston waiting for a train to Rugby. First two are delayed but third with Avanti due to depart on time. They won’t allow tickets to be used because it’s a different rail operator. Just want money for a new ticket. Again no compassion for their customers - just want the money, always. They tried to liken it to using a flight ticket for a different airline, which let’s face it is really not the same as trying to get a train from Euston to Rugby!

Not to mention the number of times their trains are delayed or cancelled… probably one of the most, if not the most, unreliable in the country!

items.title: Absolute joke of a company
items.review_text:
Absolute joke of a company, heading to a conference in Manchester, able to book tickets to get there in a Wednesday but not able to book my return ticket on a Saturday. Just not willing to wait until 3 days before my trip so have booked the return with cross country to Basingstoke and will be picked up by car. 
Not a good way to run a business

items.title: Delay reply doesn't work
items.review_text:
Delay reply doesn't work. The automatic repayment stopped working a while back. My train was cancelled and my claim was repeatedly rejected blaming a train company I didn't even use.

Also, I claimed a refund for my cancelled (Strike) ticket months ago. No comms.

items.title: Avanti Are Awful.
items.review_text:
I booked, paid for and journey from Crewe to London with reserved seats. When we got on the train, we found someone sitting in our seat. I informed them of this situation, but it turns out they had also booked that seat? Then a member of staff came onto the teleprompter to inform all passengers the train had been declassified and TWO other trains worth of passengers had been moved onto the train. So we ended up have a 2.3 hour journey STANDING. 

It gets better though, the same staff member stated that anyone who has booked a ticket with a seat WILL receive a FULL REFUND. (Some saving grace I guess). NOPE. I reported the refund request immediately to the head office, who apologised and said they would look into it. I have just received an email from them stating that on their records it doesnt show and delays or declassification of any trains.

I will be seeking legal advice on this Avanti West. You provide a masterclass in poor service. Shambles of a company.

BRING BACK VIRGIN.

Useless morons

items.title: It is by far the worst company I had to…
items.review_text:
It is by far the worst company I had to deal with. I had train tickets pre-bought for strike dates. I asked for my options, they took this to mean I want a 'voucher' and cancelled my tickets.
I told them I don't want vouchers (and pretty sure it is messed up that they cancelled my tickets without my consent) and somehow this conversation took 3 weeks to resolve with them agreeing to refund me to my bank account.
I bought my tickets on 1 October 2022. Strikes were announced ay the end of October 2022. I called them asking what to do with my tickets on 5 December 2022. They agreed to the refund on 21st of December.
On 23rd they notified me that it could take up to 10 working days for the refund to reach me.
Today is 31st January. I don't have refund, and I only get one-sentence emails once a week to my follow-ups. 
Today it got to a point where their social media account started replying passive aggresively to my tweets.
I hate this company, and I don't know what kind of miracle still holds them in place.

items.title: I was supposed to get to Glasgow…
items.review_text: I was supposed to get to Glasgow Central at 2300 and arrived at 0135. They would not compensate me for delay repay. That service is a con.

items.title: Avanti west cost £10 fee charge for lost/forgotten items
items.review_text: There is now a £10 fee for return of lost items. I was so shocked when this was announced following telling people to make sure they have their belongings!! What if someone is having a very bad day and doesn't have £10 and mistakenly forgot her/his phone and needs it. Greedy snakes!

items.title: The most awful service
items.review_text: The most awful service. My train was cancelled and I am new to this system. I tried catching the next train and because I had a “split save” ticket I had t buy a whole new ticket..and sit on the floor because there were no seats. It cost me £75 to travel return from Coventry to London and sit on the floor with a very mean Avanti staff member

items.title: Don't trust Avanti Delay Repay
items.review_text: Train was 95 mins late. Told by several members of staff that Avanti would compensate passengers. Filled in the form correctly. Computer said no.
