items.title: Liars rude and unhelpful
items.review_text: This review is based on my own experience and true facts. I’ve contacted the managing director office of Avanti and have had a complaint outstanding for months. I’ve spent so much time with Avanti west coast managing directors office. This is the worst rail company ever they lie and they deceive people. They charge customers very high rail fares and give you a poor service how is this right? At one point, a staff member decided that they will look into my complaint and find a resolution and offer compensation which in the end they denied and didn’t offer anything. The lady never replied and she ignored my emails. After a couple of months I get a reply from another colleague who says his previous colleague is not available and working somewhere else in the department which was untrue and a lie. Because a week later that same lady emailed me? I told you they are all liars. This is what happens at managing directors office of Avanti West Coast Trains. There is no customer service. They’ve been rude with me on the telephone and as a long-standing customer, which does not even count. They charge the public so much money but when things go wrong they don’t care and the worst they lie. If you can lie to people, it will come back to you as well. It is the public who are paying you all in Avanti otherwise you would not have a job. Maybe that day will also happen, This is the worst British rail company and should be abolished. The uk government need to take ownership for there failures in dealing with scam company’s like Avanti west coast and control the country otherwise it is only going to get worse, and deal with poor companies who treat the public in this way and lie and scam us that is the truth.

items.title: Had to stand from Crewe to Euston …
items.review_text: Had to stand from Crewe to Euston  having bought a direct train ticket and seat reservation from North Wales to London. The Liverpool train which I had to board was dangerously overcrowded as a result of several cancelled trains. There was no room to move as all the aisles were packed.

items.title: First class service offering appalling
items.review_text:
A first class return for me now costs over £400.  10 years ago it was closer to £150.
For this exorbitant price I get a large seat.  The breakfast is awful - pale and tasteless.  The dinner options laughable (toasted sandwich or cheese & biscuits or salad ) remembering this is the main meal for travellers boarding at 6pm and not getting home until 10pm.  Tonight I will be 1.5hours late getting home because of a slow running service resulting in a missed connection at Crewe.  And the First Class lounge at Crewe closes at 5pm!
You are driving the railway industry into the ground.

items.title: It will be a great day when Avanti lose their contract
items.review_text:
In the last 5 months 8 of my trains (out of 11) have been cancelled, delayed before setting off, or held up on the journey - today we were sat for 1.5 hours, leaving many angry passengers who had got the first train to London for various meetings etc - all missed due to Avanti's inept service. 
I would avoid like the plague if there was another service from Cumbria to London. 
If it isn't striking, it's lack of staff, "congestion", or "signal errors". 
Not good enough - the government needs to step in and GET RID!

items.title: Delay is their moto
items.review_text:
Much delays.
They will cut your throat if you arrived within 2 minutes before departure. You have yo be there more than 2 min ahead, otherwise, they would not allowed you on board. Very punctual but only for this point, they never arrive in time. At least 20 minutes delay. If you have alternative, just avoid them. Nasty railway company.

items.title: Can't get any worse
items.review_text: I have been using Avanti between Liverpool-London weekly for over a year and I can say this has drastically and negatively impacted my life and mental health. Would give minus score if I could.And the time wasted unnecessarily ...Only 2 trains I took left and arrive on time, the rest is utter shambles of train cancellations, delays of a minimum of 30 minutes average and up to 1hour 30 or 2 hours, strikes, double booked seats, frustrated or abusive passengers that are fighting for seats ... Trains are dirty, smelly, overcrowded, seat reservation is optional and not applied,  no advance tickets or timetables ever available, le excuses, no staff on board the train to address safety or passenger issues. They can't even announce engineering works a week before making it impossible for anyone commuting for work to make alternative plans. Then they charge you rip off prices for journeys with multiple changes and no seat guarantee. Sometimes tickets are released only 2 or 3 days before my journey. I had to stay in hotels rather than commuting daily because it has become so mentally and physically draining. Financially I have lost hundreds of pounds because they don't even sell tickets at the best rate weeks in advance. Off peak is a rip off £98, can't afford peak times of travel. Delay repay gives you pennies back, when any trip should come with free counselling session or complimentary alcohol to recover from the ordeal. Government is clearly willing passengers to suffer and stay home, and collapse the North West. There is no reasonable explanation why these crooks are still in business. I wish I could take them to court and claim back the hundreds of pounds and time wasted for nothing.

items.title: How crap is Avanti.
items.review_text:
I got notification yesterday for tickets from Penrith to Euston for early March. There was only 1 train available for outward travel but the time was fine but not as early as I wanted. The train coming back was for 22 00 and would take 8 hours to get back - no other trains were available.  How crap is a company that cannot publish a regular timetable - I had been checking since December. I am now travelling from Newcastle to King's Cross had plenty of choice for both trains and was over £60 cheaper. I now have a 2 hour car journey rather than 30 minutes.
I would like to leave a 0 star rating.

items.title: Treating passengers differently??
items.review_text: They stopped people from boarding the train at Euston station. Few people gathered around the gate trying to get in (the train is still thrre) but for some reason the staff let 2 people in but mot the rest. We were all at the gate but why those were the only 2 people that can get on? I’m sure there’s a reason behind but it feels unfair.

items.title: Absolute Disgrace
items.review_text: If there was an option for less than one star I would have chosen it. How the government hasn't taken away their franchise is beyond me.

items.title: Shameless
items.review_text: Shameless! The rating of this company says it all. Constant delays, strikes, cancellations and awful customer service it’s hard to see any bright future. I cancelled my ticket that I paid for £10.80, the cancellation fee was £10. If this isn’t criminal that I don’t know what is. Shame on you! I’ll be driving from now on.

items.title: Colder on train than outside
items.review_text: On a train today, 3.13 from london Euston to Manchester Piccadilly,  there is snow outside.  Inside the train,  the heating is NOT on,  but the aircon is!!!,  it's freezing people sat here with coats on.   I spoke to train manager,  very helpful and nice man,  but he said there was nothing he could do!,  there have been no messages to passengers regarding the lack of heating.

items.title: The trains never ever run on time
items.review_text: The trains never ever run on time. Absolutely shambolic service. Shameful

items.title: Where do I start...
items.review_text:
Where do I start? Consistently delayed and cancelled trains with little or no notice and information provided. I travel to London on a weekly basis and don't think I've been on time for both legs of my journey since I started doing it 7 months ago.
They don't release tickets until right at the last minute with no communication as to why, and then when they are released you can't access the website or app because it crashes. 
How these people are allowed to run the West Coast Mainline is beyond me.

items.title: Can I just have one trip where I don’t write a crap review
items.review_text:
Sh*te. 20.29 Euston to Preston cancelled at the last minute. Some crap excuse. Obviously to save money and squeeze us on the 21.10. That was then delayed. Train manager apologising for the whole trip. Screwed up people for Warrington as it didn’t stop there. More apologies. Don’t want apologies. For once just want the train I booked to be on time. 

P*ssed off of Preston.

items.title: Never seen such a bs nonsense horrible…
items.review_text: Never seen such a bs nonsense horrible f*up services of these a**h***. More than 80% of the journeys I have taken has either been delayed or canceled. Go get some fu***ng lessons on managing public transport system from developing countries like India.

items.title: Train from London to Piccadilly delayed…
items.review_text:
Train from London to Piccadilly delayed due to incident, no problem there as understood out of Avantis control 

My complaint is about the huge man at ticket office, as went to get a coffee, when I returned my train wasn’t showing on departure board 

He was the rudest man I’ve ever encountered and should not be dealing with customers, I was in tears

All I wanted to know was what had happened to my train

Bring back Virgin, never had any complaints or problems with them and their staff knock spots off Avanti

items.title: Still unable to book and trains this…
items.review_text:
Still unable to book and trains this weekend, 3 days before is ridiculous.  I know there is engineering works but the affect of these must be known by now.
Get you act together.
Bring back Virgin

items.title: Can't book a train from London to…
items.review_text: Can't book a train from London to Liverpool this weekend and have been trying since before Christmas. They have gone straight from 'unavailable to buy' to 'sold out' without actually becoming available - not even for a specific time but for the whole day. If I could give no stars I would. This is not a service.

items.title: Cancelled trains over my last 3 London…
items.review_text:
Cancelled trains over my last 3 London trips hardly any notice, dirty trains and prices up so much compared to virgin
What a shambles

items.title: Good service on the whole.
items.review_text:
I use Avanti West Coast between London and Liverpool. In 16 journeys over the last year, only one train was late and that was by only 8 minutes.
The staff are always helpful and try their best to help.

Don't believe all the negative comments about Avanti West Coast, on the whole, the service is good.

items.title: Delayed, compensating me is a myth
items.review_text: Train was delayed by nearly 45 mins, was told I would be compensated but my accounts magically won’t link. Zero support recieved.awful company.

items.title: Great Customer Support Staff
items.review_text: I travel this line often and I am disabled, even with the issues due to the industrial action the staff that are customer assistance are 5 star. Polite, friendly, helpful and informative. Without these great people my journey would be a nightmare. The abuse they get is uncalled for and unacceptable, when will people realise that you get treated well if you just use a bit of curtesy and understanding. As far as I am concerned they are great and have always done their best for me.

items.title: Train from Glasgow to Stafford…
items.review_text: Train from Glasgow to Stafford cancelled on 30/12/2022 (fair enough but no replacement coach). Had to book a hotel overnight then announced on 31/12/2022 still no trains or replacement coaches! So my wife had to drive 265 miles to pick me up and when trying to claim compensation for hotel and fuel Avante blamed Scotrail as they were operating the train which I would have taken to Glasgow to connect with their train, which was also cancelled, so I took a taxi as at that point Avanti trains were still advertised as running! Shambles of a company who don’t deserve the contract

items.title: I’m unable to book return ticket to…
items.review_text: I’m unable to book return ticket to Manchester for next weekend as the return tickets haven’t been released yet!!! My journey is 7 days away and my 84 year old Mum who needs care is very worried about it. I would give zero stars but that’s not an option. Why have the government extended the Avanti contract!?

items.title: Excellent journey from Lancaster to…
items.review_text: Excellent journey from Lancaster to Euston today. Train lovely and warm and comfortable very nice staff. Could not fault anything.

items.title: No point of booking a seat
items.review_text: No point of booking a seat. This company is like a brothel. Seats get used without any organisation.  Never again!

items.title: 1st class, rude staff
items.review_text: Train journey from Watford junction to Birmingham new street last night (12/1/23) travelling 1st class and the lady staff member on board was so rude and unhelpful. Can see why they struggle to get a pay rise. Need some training for the staff or find staff that care. Won't use again. Awful service

items.title: Ignorant and rude
items.review_text:
Ignorant and rude. People skills, nil.
Unfortunately my mobile lost power 10 mins before departure. Result, no evidence of my ticket.
Agreed, my fault.
However, the point of this post is to do with the way in which I was dealt with.
Having explained my predicament to an Avanti employee about not being able to evidence my ticket, the manner in which he spoke to me was totally unacceptable.
Rude would be an gross understatement.
This individual should immediately be reprimanded. No chance of that though.
11.33 train from Euston to Manchester for any individual from Avanti customer care to research.
Yours,
Disappointed, from the land of reason and good manners.

items.title: I’d have been better walking up the M6…
items.review_text: I’d have been better walking up the M6 and M74 to get to Glasgow central . It would have been quicker !!! Awful service.. I’ll go back to driving up in future this lot need to lose their license that are total useless…

items.title: An Awful and Terrible Compant
items.review_text:
Just an awful service. Always late. No apologies or reasons given. At least 10 people on my train (including myself) missed connecting trains because of them.

The staff don’t want to seem to listen to complaints either.

Hand this over to a decent company.

items.title: cancellation of services
items.review_text: I've awarded three stars because I got all my money back for both cancelled services on a return trip Wilmslow to London Euston. This meant I was an hour and a half late arriving outbound and 5 hours late on return trip. The outward delay was apparently due to staff shortage (not strike) and return due to closure of line near Watford ?  The worst bit was having to navigate home via Kings Cross, Leeds, Manchester Victoria to Manchester Piccadilly, then on to Wilmslow - standing room only all the way !

items.title: Avanti west coast
items.review_text:
Not a good service, advance bookings are exactly double the cost of ScotRail, there is always a £10.00 admin fee when trying to change a booking, end up paying more than you would if you bought an anytime ticket.
Govt has put Avanti on short term contracts until they drastically improve the service. I can see why, the service is terrible.

items.title: Delay Repay is a joke
items.review_text: Delay Repay is a joke. The system doesn't find the journey, won't accept the manually input one. If you don't want people to claim compensation, make it difficult to claim... That's the rule it appears.

items.title: Just plain awful
items.review_text:
33 minutes late, didn’t bother to give the flimsiest excuse as to why (they’re hopeless and they know it). Said they were coming on one platform when in fact they came on a completely different one: 

Gangways cramped, very little luggage space, intercoms are a staticky mess and to top it all off, they flatly ignored my repeat requests for the late compensation.

Hang your heads in shame. Do the decent thing and hand the contract to a company that gives a damn.

items.title: Great advertisement for the Automotive and Coach Industries
items.review_text: Avanti convinced me I cannot rely on WCML train services anymore. I used to use Virgin West Coast twice a week in first class on a 150 mile return intercity service. First Class price was quadrupled last year to make it unaffordable. Now they have stopped offering first class, only offering Standard Premium without any refreshments for the old price of first class. They do not even check whether people have upgraded and the carriages are often too hot and smell of urine. It seems they are purposely pushing people away from travelling, especially business travellers. Will not be back until they are replaced by a new operator or renationalised.

items.title: Shambolic
items.review_text: The standard of companies operating at the moment in the UK must be the worst ever. Sky and Deliveroo are 2 of the most frustrating customer services teams but Avanti win hands down. My train is cancelled to London from Preston so I've been told I can get on the next train but cannot book a seat. Its first come first served for a 2hr 30 journey for a seat. Several trains have been cancelled that morning so there are potentially hundreds of people allowed to travel on the train. The Indian call centre have told me to turn up on the day and the platform staff will do their best. My return train has been moved also and I'm currently arriving in London 3 hours late (If I can get on it) Utter utter shambles of a company.

items.title: In August I travelled to London only…
items.review_text:
Lets be clear here nothing is going to change with this shambolic business when our own government is still paying them dividends for a third world service.
In August I travelled to London only for a strike to happen so in order not to get stuck I had to cancel my hotel and book a flight to get home so I had lost £140 for my hotel and paid £137 for a flight , Avanti have refused to refund me for this cost due to their industrial action.
My point dont bother using this scam company they are a disgrace and when you try and talk with someone which you cannot as they only do it via email you get a different person each time and have to explain it all again , there like there service is shambolic.

items.title: Always late (if not cancelled)
items.review_text: Always late (if not cancelled), always dirty. Ticket prices have gone up, quality of service - down.

items.title: Extremely rude experience with an…
items.review_text: Extremely rude experience with an Avanti ticket inspector named Olga in Euston in November. I was on a call to a colleague who's recently experienced a bereavement and is extremely upset, as I was approaching I showed the ticket inspector my ticket (valid any time single), she said "excuse me can you please end your call or I'm not scanning this ticket," I asked my colleague to hold on a second and then tried to politely show her the ticket. Olga then send "no you need to end the call completely and show me respect" I said "I've put the call on hold and am showing you a valid ticket, I'm not sure what the problem is and why you can't scan it; she then said "I'm not serving you go to the other inspector," the other inspector then scanned the ticket while his colleague got aggressive (a white male with a rainbow lanyard) and said 'youre not getting on this train you will need to wait for the next", the man who scanned my ticket said "no let him pass he has a valid ticket. This experience was very upsetting and I did not see why I was being told I'm not allowed to put my call on hold and must "hang up" when I'm showing a valid ticket very clearly. It felt like they were being very passive aggressive, the service in London Euston is consistently rude especially from Avanti staff - I'd recommend talking to the transpennnine express staff up north who are consistently courteous and go above and beyond to support customers.

items.title: Another shambolic journey with what can…
items.review_text:
Another shambolic journey with what can only be described as an insult to the travelling public.
Train to Chester cancelled. The return late.
Attempt at compensation refused "because there was no train at this time". NO there wasn't....because you CANCELLED it!!!! This will continue whilst the government keeps handing them our taxes to pay the bonuses of their incompetent management.

items.title: Thumbs up.
items.review_text: Train cancelled - which was unfortunate and spoiled my New Year’s Eve plans - but I received a personalised email in response to my enquiry and received a full refund within 24 hours. Brilliant customer service.

items.title: utter mayhem
items.review_text: utter mayhem, from booking to travelling, and then to claim a refund just took me 30 mins, i could tell you the whole story but its same as the rest on here, I think they are just a very poorly run company, that can't recruit due to being a bad employer, so all service levels are rock bottom. The sooner AWC are removed the better for us the users the experience will be, surely it can't be much longer.

items.title: Bit of a shambles on the London to…
items.review_text:
Bit of a shambles on the London to Manchester route since Avanti took over from Virgin. As a regular traveller on this service, Ive seen it go downhill with fewer and more crowded trains than previously, a high level of cancellations, fewer direct trains and much higher fares. Give them some competition on this route - then they might pull their socks up and provide an improved service.
2 stars are for the long suffering staff, who are polite at least

items.title: Filthy train
items.review_text: Travelled yesterday to London. Paid over 100 for ticket. Train filthy with sick on floor. No one taking any control. Disgusting service time for Avanti to go

items.title: What a disgrace!
items.review_text: What a disgrace!! Trains cancelled,jam packed red hot trains that do run that surely must be a serious safety issue.miserable unmotivated staff.this company epitomises the disgrace of privatisation.I bet there fat cat CEO doesn't use his company's services!!!!

items.title: Diabolical
items.review_text: Consistently the worst train service in the country. An utter embarrassment to modern rail. Trains are routinely delayed, with little to no information given. Services are overcrowded, overpriced and understaffed. It’s precisely what you get when a business is allowed to operate without competition - even then, they’re in danger of finishing second in a one-horse race. An utter, utter joke.

items.title: The worst train service with the heighest price.
items.review_text:
It was a good service when virgin was managing it. 
Had to travel to work from Coventry to London and in a month my cost escalated by 400 pounds due to late trians and I ended up using taxis to get to work on time from Euston.

Eventually stopped buying thoer montly pass and started using my car. Its a bit tyring but still much better than getting back home at 8 pm daily due to delayed or cancelled  trains.

items.title: This is not feel good travel
items.review_text: This is not feel good travel. I had 32 ferrero rochers and  I was not feeling good while traveling.

items.title: Lousy Service
items.review_text: Trains was late, there was no service in First Class and when I complained they refused to provided a partial refund for not providing part of the advertised service. All in all a lousy service.

items.title: London Euston staff - abuse of power
items.review_text:
London Euston staff deliberately bullying and denying access to platform ahead of strike.

21:32 I was held at the Platform5 gate, denied boarding. the attendant claimed the “app is not loading” whilst locking the doors. I had over 6 minutes left to board and the train which departed at 21:40.
 How is this normal behaviou at London Euston?! 

 I have been RUNNING for the past 40minutes to catch this train only to be told by your employee that “in life you must accept losing”. 

The emotional intelligence of the london euston staff needs reviewing, it’s almost christmas eve for everyone and we’re really struggling to get to our families, they should not have the ability to deliberately slow us down only to later claim we’ve missed boarding, this is simply bullying and abuse of power, they see a couple running to catch the train, they lock the door and claim their app isn’t loading. GREAT STAFF @AVANTI. 


Really it was only just one person, the rest of the staff were bystanders who eventually took his side but probably would not have acted the way this person did.

items.title: Too frightened to travel
items.review_text: I like to book in advance. No tickets were on offer for weeks! Then I managed to find a day when tickets were available and booked from London Euston to Manchester Piccadilly on 22nd December. As I was travelling up to London I received a message that my train my cancelled. Arrived at Euston, station was packed, no trains on the board. Forced my way through to a train person who told me to get earlier train but the two prior trains were also cancelled so 3 lots of travellers would have to go in one train. I am elderly and was worried and frightened about being crushed so gave up taking the train completely. and had to find an alternative mode of travel. This is not the first time my train has been cancelled or I can't book. iAvanti are not fit for purpose. Get a new train operator!

items.title: Never have I ever experienced such bad…
items.review_text: Never have I ever experienced such bad service. Even their delay repay takes aged to work and crashes a lot expectingnyounto refill details in

items.title: Excellent Customer Service
items.review_text: A West Avanti staff member lady Monique was just amazing. Our 18.13 train to Manchester was cancelled and because we have 3 small children she went above and beyond to help us onto the next available train. Great customer service from Monique and a huge credit to West Avanti.

items.title: DON'T DESERVE A PAY RISE!!!
items.review_text:
Avanti have got to be the worst train operator going.

Supposed to get the 11:43 train up to Liverpool from Euston.  Trains cancelled "signalling issues" apparently, that old chestnut. 

Went to the avanti cust service desk who's only resolution was to give me a refund. I said I did order online but the lady said on this occasion can honour a refund but I declined as really wanted to see family. I was a little embarrassed (I should not have been) as I teared up due to the fact I may not see my family who I have not seen for nearly 3 years.  Made to feel silly as no sympathy or compassion from that member of staff.  I had to walk away.  

I went to check in with assisted travel who's staff where far more better than avanti.  Very reassuring and sympathetic as well.  Time was getting on and one hr turned in to two and I was becoming a little upset again.  I went to avanti just to see what was going on.  In my opinion avanti staff should have went round to their customers with updates but instead just hid away.

Second customer service person was so smug and made me very angry.  Could not give me any info and o asked if I could have a refund to which he said no as I bought online.  I told him what his colleague said and he was like no no no no no no.  So I asked what he could do to help me.  He shrugged and was like "nothing we can do".  I asked if I could book for the next day.  "Stikes" he said.  I knew this already but they were running a reduced service and were selling tickets online. "That's of we can get the staff" he said.  So avanti had times and charging people when there is no guarantee of travel.  That is disgrace.  He was so smug I felt like giving him down the banks but these people would have come out "we don't tolerate abuse" card.  We'll us customers should not tolerate poor service.  

I was about to give up the ghost. So calmed down a tad and went to the assisted travel to thank them and then just go back home.  The guy asked which train I was after and said Liverpool.  To my delight he said there is a train for Liverpool where just waiting.  Why avanti could not tell me.  So sat for about 10 mins and then got taken down to platform and eventually went at 3pm.

Just so disappointed and disgusted at avanti.  Also I was in the silent coach where u supposed to not use your mobiles but in this instance I felt like that should have been uplifted.  This poor girl was on her phone calling loved ones to reassure them she was coming. She was speaking low and not disturbing anyone, at the time just me and her before another couple got on.  And this avanti employee barks at her for using he phone. Now he did disturbed me as he was the one making all the noise.

Have done a delay repay but not holding my breath on that one.

What really rubbed salt in the wound was an announcement saying we could upgrade to standard premium for £25.   Like really avanti? Should be upgrading for free really. 

So bad.  Gonna take the national express bus next time.  Yes takes 5 and half hrs but would rather do that than use avanti again.

items.title: Thanks for keeping us going!
items.review_text: To the helpful colleague on counter 9 in Euston on the evening of Wednesday the 21st, sorry for the way I behaved, not giving you the respect I should have  - you were just trying to do your job and were very helpful in rerouting my ticket. Thanks for keeping us going!

items.title: Bunch of immoral parasitesWhat a thoroughly miserable bunch of…
items.review_text: What a thoroughly miserable bunch of parasites you are. My daughter and son in law bought "first class" return tickets from Stafford to london for my granddaughters 8th Birthday to ensure they were seated together let's face it having travelled on your trains previously to describe any part of your service as first class is stretching into the realms of fantasy!! But then you cancel their returning train and although first class had ample vacant seats you kicked them out making them sit in standard, I say sit but my son in law had to stand, you should never be anywhere near a customer service based company my only hope is your company folds and you are left bankrupt of money as you already are of compassion and morals, I will not forget how you have ruined my granddaughters birthday memories and will ensure I spread the word far and wide!!! The worst company I have ever had to review

items.title: Rude and nasty train manager
items.review_text:
I was refused access to the train at Glasgow Central by 'Liz' the train manager.  I didn't have my ticket to hand at Glasgow Central. I offered to show it to her once I had boarded the train as the train was soon due to leave. She refused to look at it onboard. 
I imagine the safety and security of a train is compromised if a train manager refuses to patrol the train carriages.

Liz was rude and difficult, without a shred of respect or compassion for her customer's situations, and lazy, given the fact she couldn't be bothered to look at my ticket on board. 

I watched the train leave the concourse and was an hour late for my work that morning. 

I am a regular Avanti customer and I'd say about 60% of the time the services are delayed, given my experience with Liz, the such poor performance of the service is inevitable.

items.title: Please remove their contract!!!!!!worst train company in Europe
items.review_text: Please remove their contract!!!!!!

items.title: Quite possibly the least comfortable…
items.review_text: Quite possibly the least comfortable train in Scotland! Can’t even charge a phone. Trains shouldn’t be running to London but straight to the scrap heap.

items.title: The UKs worst/ corrupt train operator
items.review_text: Everything about Avanti West coast is a mess. Trains are ALWAYS delayed, ALWAYS cancelled and a complete waste of time. Its that bad that I travel with Avanti about three times a year and they can’t even get those journeys right. All they do is cancel trains which were never running in the first place which makes the original service rammed with passengers. I was in Euston catching the 20:53 service which ended up leaving an hour late, along with a cancellation and every other train being delayed. Can’t understand how they can’t just run the trains correctly. It gets to the point where a refund isn’t enough, please remove this company and bring back Virgin who actually did a decent job of running the trains.

items.title: Two trains cancelled at short notice
items.review_text: Two trains cancelled at short notice, exorbitant fares, treating customers and staff with disdain whilst the government continues giving their directors and shareholders huge payouts. Encore.

items.title: Just reading that Avanti received £6M…
items.review_text: Just reading that Avanti received £6M plus in bonuses! My daughter travels home from London maybe once a month. On each occasion it turns into the most stressful and unpleasant experiences. I’d say each journey involves cancellations, delays and on occasion a 2 to 3 hour journey sat on the floor. Why in this day and age are “customers” forced to spend their journey sat on the floor. Avanti are an absolute disgrace, but unfortunately my daughter has no choice if she wants to get home by train. This country is done for.

items.title: I would give 0 stars if I could
items.review_text:
Train from Euston to Glasgow cancelled last minute. Only found out once I reached Euston. 
Next train to leave for Glasgow was packed with many people standing for over half the journey. 
Journey was long and arduous taking over six and a half hours. Missed the last connecting train to my destination and had to spend the night in Glasgow. Had to purchase another ticket the next day to get to my destination. 
Overall a horrible experience. I was compelled to write this review because I am absolutely disgusted that they’ve just been handed 6.5m of our tax money in bonuses. What a farce.

items.title: If possible I would give a -10 rating.
items.review_text: I’ve reviewed Avanti West Coast before. But they have now reached new levels of not only incompetence but what I describe as a ‘Rugby League’ hand off. I’ve been waiting over 3 months for a refund. They say a refund has been made BUT it does not appear in my Credit card or Bank a/c. I’ve asked three times for details of the transaction. Those details have not been provided. Different explanations constantly given and they are in filibuster mode. Perhaps they think I’ll give up on £451 - I won’t .

items.title: I made a booking with them to reach…
items.review_text:
I made a booking with them to reach Birmingham Airport on their fast train.
The train got delayed for 90 minutes!!! There was hardly any information coming on the platform and that delayed meant I lost a full holiday.
They will refund me the train ticket only.
Thank for ruining my holiday! Avoid.

items.title: If I could give 0 stars I would
items.review_text:
If I could give 0 stars I would. This is my first time using Avanti West Coast and it will most definitely be my last. 2 trains cancelled- meaning we struggled to get home from Glasgow to Northampton. On the way up on Friday 9th December our train was canclled due to a fatality. Whilst I appreciate that certain circumstances can not be prevented the advice and customer service we were provided with was absolutely shocking. No announcement was made that our train had been cancelled or why it had been cancelled and if it weren't for my partner checking we would have been stranded in Rugby and would have missed all other trains headed up to Glasgow. When I inquired about what to do I was essentially spoken to like I should know everything about trains. The staff were rude and rushed us over to another platform and suggested we were meant to know our trains had been cancelledll
ed and then changed. Additionally on the way back to Rugby on the 12th December our 8am train was cancelled and we were forced to get an indirect train so we could get home.

items.title: A surprisingly helpful staff member
items.review_text:
I wanted write about a surprisingly pleasant travel experience, finally - instead of always writing about negative customer experiences. I travel several times a year, and most of that time, I need to spend a few hours on Avanti trains, because it's often significantly cheaper to fly from London, instead of Scottish airports, which are closer to my English home.

First my negative experiences with Avanti:
Since Avanti's pricing is a significant portion of my trans-Atlantic travel, I normally buy a fixed-train, advance ticket, leaving hours between flight and train. What I'd really like is cheaper off-peak ticket pricing:  For example, I'm not allowed to take a train that is almost empty, but have to wait a couple hours at a cold train station (Euston) to take a crowded train, the one I booked in advance. Off-peak travel is a reasonable offering, for those who have the flexibility - it's offered by Avanti, but is still relatively expensive, my Avanti experience is some of the most expensive parts of all my travel around the world. British rail services should really be an English pride of the world, but now seems a backwater compared to other services.

All the slamming finished, I'm going to write a positive review, mostly because of a generous, helpful staff member at the Euston service counter, after being rejected by the platform control staff for a train I was supposed to be allowed to board. Avanti rescheduled my train (earlier), keeping my booking on that one, but stating in an email that I'd be allowed on the train before or after, if that was more convenient, but couldn't keep my seat assignment. Seemed a reasonable response to the situation.

When I am rejected on that earlier train, the platform staff tell me that since there's another train that's been recently added to their schedule, and it's closer to my train's original departure time, the "train before" is now the one that I originally purchased (and still have the seat assignment). But I've adjusted my schedule for the original "earlier" train, the one I identified when I received the original email, just a couple days before.

The platform "boss" said no, too, so I asked who I could escalate this issue to - with less than 10 minutes boarding time left, I needed to go to the ticket counter. I've had bad/bullying experiences there in the past, so I contemplated just waiting, but decided to try. Fortunately, that queue was short and the woman took pity on my freezing, weary self, and wrote/printed a note saying I was allowed on that train. I made it on with a minute to spare!

So, while my Avanti West Coast experiences are usually frustrating and unpleasant (1-star rated, for many facets), I can say, at least for this trip, I was pleasantly surprised by the kind actions of one helpful soul.  Also, I'm grateful for the mediocre, but free, WiFi service, as I usually haven't updated my local SIM account, so it gives me basic communication until I'm settled again.

items.title: After a shocking day at heathrow…
items.review_text:
After a shocking day at heathrow airport airport after cancelling we had to stay overnight and we had we took the decision to get a train to get home 
Airport staff where most of the time unhelpful did not really care a lot of confusion and upset people but thanks to avanti we go home but I gave 4 star because it was delayed and the the information screens where confusing

items.title: Awful
items.review_text: Cancelled trains back to back and then the train we eventually got was BOILING HOT. So uncomfortable

items.title: Staff on the train are ridiculous
items.review_text: Customer service on the train is beyond pathetic. Woman told me that due to issue with their booking some passenger got a 1st class reservation. Then said it's because this train is different. Said we can sit anywhere that's available. When a guy came to question this I got told to move to standard even though my reservation is for first class train due to their error and when I said the woman said we can sit anywhere that's available he called her in and she looked lost trying to lie her way through she meant anywhere standard. Well that's not what you said when I asked. They messed up bookings and then had the audacity to move us around even though I paid booking fee for this pathetic service to have a reserved seat. Will avoid them from now on. Coach K is first call in any train so saying "this is a different train" is a lame excuse. Avoid them at all cost, staff are c*nts, unprofessional. They made the error by giving out 1st class reserved seats to a lot of people and then attempted to charge all of those passengers "extra" for first class even though it was their mistake. How much more pathetic can you get hoently

items.title: Didn't think anyone could be worse than…
items.review_text:
Didn't think anyone could be worse than Virgin, but here we are. Cancelling train after train, and the ones that do run are late and overcrowded.

Avanti sum up everything that is wrong with the failed privatised railway.

items.title: worse train operator i have ever been on.
items.review_text: transpeni train didn't go all the way to Glasgow from manchester as intended and had to switch to this dreadful service instead in Carlise. It wasn't by choice, either. So I and a few passengers with our first class tickets about an hour and a half outside Glasgow remember who are tired at this point. Go on the train to first class, but 10 mins into the journey, are told those with transpeni first class tickets to move to standard premium instead, so we have to grab our stuff and move down. cause an hour and 30 mins to the end of our journey really makes all the difference. But it gets better. Then the train stops about 30 mins outside Glasgow for a driver changeover. yes, that's right, we were delayed by 10 mins for a change outside of Glasgow. Why not do it at the end of the journey like a regular train operator? of course, that would be too sensible.

items.title: Just a downright disgraceful company
items.review_text: Just a downright disgraceful company. Terrible customer service: incorrect advice given meant invalid tickets were purchased and detached/unresponsive Customer Resolutions Advisors meant refund possible was impossible! Deliberately set up in a convoluted way to try as hard as possible to retain any revenue. Will be raising a complaint with the Ombudsman!

items.title: Scammers
items.review_text: Crap Service. Already had return tickets to leave London. Apparently they were the wrong tickets for the train. My ticket on my phone worked and opened the gate but my friend's didn't so I TRIED to pass the phone over the gate to give to my friend as I had both our tickets on there. The staff member 'Bex' tried to snatch my phone out of my hand and then made us pay an extra £80 to get on the last train home. I have now found out that we should of paid £24 extra to get on the last train home. This train service is horrible and even when I emailed the customer service 'Natalie' (pencil pusher) said that it was right to make us pay £80 to get home. And no one is gonna sort out the so called staff for trying to take my personal property Avanti West Coast sort yourselves out!!!!

items.title: Efficient and on time oh and warm!
items.review_text: I travelled today with Aventi west coast from Euston to Preston and can only speak highly of the service. It was on time and efficient and the train was lovely and warm on a freezing cold day. Well done! No complaints from me.

items.title: Disgusting service absolutely abysmal…
items.review_text: Disgusting service absolutely abysmal sick to absolute death of their hideous service. Staff are a joke too they all need to be fired, drivers dont even turn up to drive the train. WHY THE HELL HAS THE GOVERNMENT EVEN GRANTED THIS VILE SERVICE A CONTRACT TO RUN THEIR TRAINS?

items.title: 8th Dec Travelling from Euston to WBQ…
items.review_text:
8th Dec Travelling from Euston to WBQ on 16:56.
Carraige absolutely roasting and no-one able to fix it.
Wi-Fi non existent/very very poor at best making it impossible to do any work
First class (I was in stnd class) had no table service food/drink due to staff shortage
No information as to progress / running late and therefore had to guess what time I'd arrive and arrange a lift home from the station
Overall very very poor and not the first time I've experienced these issues on Avanti over the past couple of months. Get it sorted or get the government to cancel the contract!!! People are returning to their cars!!!

items.title: Just not the same level of service anymore
items.review_text: I’ve been travelling on this line for well over a decade. It was fine when it was ran by Virgin, not perfect but fine. I have had no end of problem with Avanti West Coast. Booking is simple, the website is easy to use and you can book with them via third party sites also. If you’re delayed the delay repay is quite simple also. It’s when your train is cancelled/changed that the problems begin. I’ve given 3 stars as I did get my money back for all of my cancelled journeys in the end. I did however have to email constantly and chase in order to get that money. I now use London Northwestern, slower but reliable and cheaper.

items.title: Shambolic company
items.review_text: Travelling from Runcorn to London this morning. Train delayed by 30 mins because they couldn’t rustle up a crew in time. Shambolic - entirely within the company’s control. Please give the franchise back to Virgin!

items.title: Absolutely agree with others.
items.review_text: Absolutely agree with others.? But the staff are amazing. The only reason this company is surviving is because of the staff. Experience was dreadful

items.title: Another week and another round of…
items.review_text: Another week and another round of delays and cancellations. The 7.03 from Wrexham to Chester has been cancelled so many times I'm surprised it is even on the time table any more. Add that cancellation to the 30min+ delay on the Chester to Euston service and it amazes me that Avanti still have the franchise. Every train I have taken this year has been delayed - bring back Virgin please!

items.title: Appalling Avanti West Coast - I do not expect anything else.
items.review_text: If I could down vote to 0 stars I would. I travel regularly (every 2 or 3 weeks) between london and stockport. Mum is not well, and I work fulltime so its stressful enough travelling. However Avanti are the worst company I have ever had the misfortune to use. Appalling.  Consistently delayed or cancelled. And for what? A journey that costs 100 pounds for which you are standing much of the time. I travelled to stockport Friday 2nd December and arrived at Euston to see that all promised journeys cancelled. I'm travelling back now via Leeds to kings cross as again the service cancelled. If this were a one off that would be forgivable. It's not. 2 weeks ago we rerouted via Birmingham and I stood up for 4.5 hours. Similar experiences for previous journeys in recent history. Having spent around 2000 pounds this year - possibly more in trying to get to get connections due to delays - how can you honestly justify this absolutely s*** service. The staff on the ground seem lovely but does not make up for this crap s*** excuse of a train service. Would love to hear back and know how these reprobates might try and justify their existence. Btw. My current reroute via the LNER service from Leeds also has better and cheaper food.

items.title: Over an hour late to destination but Avanti refused to provide a refund
items.review_text:
I booked an early train but due to part of the overhead line being damaged we were told trains wouldn't be stopping for the three stops around the damage. It was recommended that we should continue past the overhead damage and then catch the train on the southbound line and could apply for a refund using the Avanti delay repay. 
Firstly, the Avanti delay repay is incredibly difficult if you haven't booked through Avanti, The form is too tiny to attach anything and the A4 page is meant to be folded into an envelope to be sent. When I contacted Avanti to state that the form wasn't usable, they asked for the details. I sent the relevant details on and they said there was insufficient information to provide me a refund. 
I'd avoid booking with Avanti if at all possible. It really shouldn't be this difficult to request a refund to which you are entitled.

items.title: today 7th december 10am service
items.review_text: today 7th december , manchester to london , simple journey youd think , left manchester then to be told only going milton keynes , no buses as back up no nothing , now in a jam on the m1 in a cab , costing a small fortune , going to sue the hell out of Avanti for this disgusting service , please avoid at all costs , my daughter with me and 6 months pregnant , really dont need this terrible crap .

items.title: Absolute shambles.......worst service…
items.review_text:
Absolute shambles.......worst service ever.
Not a patch on Virgin.
The service and staff are terrible 😑

items.title: Bring back Virgin
items.review_text:
Bring back Virgin. My two most recent journeys:
First Class with a booked seat form Euston to Birmingham- The train was overflowing and everybody was siting anywhere and standing in the corridors. The conductor was never to be seen so I stood.
Second Journey New Street to Manchester Airport via Wilmslow- The Birmingham Wilmslow sector was with AWC. When I got to the station, the train did not exist. It wasn't cancelled - it never existed. Apparently, it was a timetabling mistake! I just got another train (not AWC) and managed to get my flight on time but it was very stressful. When I complained and asked for a refund they essentially said "Not our problem take it up with the Trainline who you bought your ticket from".
Never had any problems like this with Virgin.

items.title: First Class 14-20 London Euston to…
items.review_text: First Class 14-20 London Euston to Manchester Picadilly 05/12/22 .No food whatsoever??? Announced no hot food but didn’t offer any nibbles etc with any drink yet lots of announcements that food on sale in economy class! Such a poor service!

items.title: Absolutely shocking
items.review_text: Absolutely shocking. Yet again rammed train Tamworth to Euston - and train over 30 mins delayed ( this has happened 7 out of 8 last journeys ) I used to get the new street to Euston train with Virgin but now only 1 an hour instead of 3. Shambles totally - in addition trains often cancelled the night before

items.title: Very poor service
items.review_text:
Really very dissatisfied the last 5-6 times I’ve unfortunately been forced to use this service between London and Birmingham. Trains are seriously overcrowded (due to the service being reduced from 3 trains an hour to only 1?!) and seat reservations are a joke (either the carriage doesn’t exist, the train is so delayed it is declassified or the displays on the train themselves don’t work). The whole experience is wholly unpleasant. 

Would strongly hope that Avanti’s contract for the west coast mainline is not renewed

items.title: So hot and uncomfortable
items.review_text: I get this train frequently and I have never had a comfortable journey. The train is always extremely hot where all passengers are packed and uncomfortable, to the point where I had to change outfit before travelling to work. Awful experience.

items.title: Shop in the train is cash only due to…
items.review_text:
Shop in the train is cash only due to issues with the card machine - this happened numerous times on my journey from Glasgow down to London Euston, why can Avanti not just fix them! Who carries cash these days! 

Also pay your staff a lot better so that we have less cancellations per day!!!

items.title: Absolutely disgusting
items.review_text: Absolutely disgusting. Priority seat book due to being pregnant with difficulties . Get on the train only to realise my seat no is no there due to train not having a G coach l. Try to explained my condition with an attendant on the train and I was just told sorry for not having enough coach. So I traveled from Birmingham Mew Street to London Euston standing and in pain.I will be contacting Avanti soon

items.title: Train canceled midway through journey.
items.review_text: Getting a train from Wolverhampton to Edinburgh. The train got as far as Preston before it was cancelled due to a lack of drivers. We were told to disembark the train before it was promptly removed from the platform, presumably by a driver. It's no wonder these companies can't pay their staff an appropriate wage when they can't even run the basic service that is expected of them.

items.title: Do not trust this company!!
items.review_text: The last two occasions I have travelled from London Euston to Warrington have been a complete joke. First time they cancelled the 8.30pm train due to staff shortages, and today they simply cancelled the train with no reason given. Which is a big problem 200 miles from home. How this company is allowed to operate a rail franchise is totally beyond me. I've used the same Warrington to London route for nearly 20 years and never experienced anything like it. Do no trust this company to get you anywhere on time!!!

items.title: Absolutely awful company
items.review_text: Absolutely awful company, no point in reserving seats as they double book the same seats. Trains become overcrowded and they pack you into the train like sardines. I have never had a good experience with Avanti trains. Virgin were way better, you could book your seats in advance and would never be full or crowded. Avanti have ruined the service.

items.title: AWFUL
items.review_text: Cancels trains with absolutely no notice. Was at the train station and had to get a train which got me to my destination an hour and half later, absolute joke of a service! AWFUL!!

items.title: Absolute sh**show.
items.review_text:
Absolute sh**show.
Trains don't just get cancelled everyday, they disappear off the schedule overnight with no prior warning or recognition!!

Also, rather than striking for better pay, why not actually staff your trains properly in the Northwest or develop a system to check tickets at the platform.
So many times I have never had my ticket checked, maybe this is why you aren’t making the money to pay staff fairly. 
Thanks for making late for work!

items.title: Awful every time and I have no choice…
items.review_text:
Awful every time and I have no choice but to do this dreaded trip every few weeks, Manchester to London and return same day.  Overpriced tickets, no point reserving as so many trains are cancelled that they just end up being a ‘free for all’ once on board they are over heated, over crowded and dirty. Staff looked stressed, but I can imagine they get the brunt of everyone’s annoyance. 
When Virgin had it you could pre book at a discount, reserve your seats and there were plenty running so never overcrowded! I just dread the next journey!

items.title: STILL FAILING TO PROVIDE A WORKABLE SERVICE
items.review_text: Tried to book tickets from Crewe to London for Sat 28th Jan. Surprise surprise, the booking system says the timetable has not been confirmed for this date. Why not? and when will it be confirmed! Why can AWC not get their act together and provide a decent rail service. They continue to stumble through with a terrible service, this company needs to be stripped of the franchise. I strongly believe they are failing the public and their customers on a colossal scale. Having a huge impact on peoples lives across the North West, Scotland and the midlands. Surely about time the Government stepped in

items.title: Absolutely horrific company
items.review_text: Absolutely horrific company. Trains are regularly delayed or cancelled at very short notice, the wifi barely works and the shops are never open. The fact I have to pay these people twice, first through my taxes and then through tickets, absolutely sickens me. The worst company I have ever dealt with, they cannot go bust quickly enough.

items.title: I could have give zero
items.review_text: I could have give zero. I had a travulr experience traveling with avanti. The inside weather is too hot that I barely able to breath. I felt too dizzy during and after the journey.

items.title: Expense very much spared on this refurbishment
items.review_text:
My first journey on the newly refurbished pendolino from Manchester to Euston today. Underwhelmed by upholstery that’s already starting to wear and wireless charging pads that don’t work. 

Many features are as poor as they ever were - unusable WiFi, a shop that can only take cash and a seat reservation system unchanged from 2002, which presumably is when it last worked reliably.

Refurbishment welcome, and well overdue, but there is just too much evidence of cost cutting.

items.title: HOPELESS!
items.review_text:
HOPELESS! Just HOPELESS!
Time to replace this train service!

items.title: Absolute nightmare trying to book a…
items.review_text: Absolute nightmare trying to book a ticket to London from Birmingham. No fast trains available to book via website only 2 hours 39 minutes. Unable to make plans or book tickets in advance. Never had this problem with Virgin. BRING BACK ViRGIN !

items.title: DONT DO IT!!!!!!!
items.review_text: Do NOT use this service. If you can drive or if lucky enough get a flight. Cancel trains like 1hr before departure, customer service is non existent and no apology. Please do not plan your activities around this service.

items.title: Horrific
items.review_text: Actually starting to contemplate getting a new job if it means I don’t have to endure this service any longer.

items.title: Left standing …….
items.review_text: One of the most uncomfortable train journeys I’ve ever had from Birmingham to Euston .  The train was overcrowded and we couldn’t even get near our reserved seats , but people were sitting in them anyway as they weren’t marked as reserved . We had to stand . Infuriating when we’d paid a lot for tickets that went on sale very late . No access to refreshments or toilets due to being unable to get past people  . The outward journey from Euston had been better but again seat reservations weren’t shown . WiFi didn’t connect either . Avoid this train operator if you can ! We’ll be complaining and asking for a refund but we hold out little hope .

items.title: The train was on time and the ticket…
items.review_text: The train was on time and the ticket was very reasonably price.. however there was no hot drinks available on the train, no-one check our tickets at all.. the train was extremely dirty, the toilets where so dirty you couldn't use them, people just sat in your reserved seat and when they wouldn't move there was no-one to ask for help.. rather uncomfortable for females travelling alone..

items.title: Relaxing, on time, excellent service
items.review_text: Relaxing, friendly, on time, great service from the start to finish at both Man Piccadilly and Euston, travelled off peak first and was pleasantly surprised. The train definitely did take the strain and we arrived in London on time and relaxed after a well presented and tasty mid morning  breakfast, on the return, the Avanti lounge at Euston was calm and tranquil and well laid out. The return train was on time and service and food excellent. - i had not travelled on the train to London for years, and was pleasantly surprised. Great service and on time.

items.title: Appalling service avoid using this train provider if it is at all possible
items.review_text:
Website shows tickets for trains that are never for sale, despite website saying that tickets will be coming soon.

Outward journey train reservation was not what was requested. Service was overcrowded and delayed. 

Return journey no food or drinks available for whole journey I was on the train which was for over 5 hours. Announcement indicated it was entire service which was from Edinburgh to Plymouth. Train was overcrowded with the entire passageway full of people standing. Toilet was disgusting.

Paid £160 for a ticket, safe to say it did not feel like good value for money. Will never use this train provider again as a result.

items.title: Avanti is too focused on profit
items.review_text: The company is too focused on profit and not on passenger service. Only one train an hour in the mornings from Euston to Manchester. Mad dash for the only coach that isn't booked, with at least 4 coaches worth of people struggling for a seat. Come back Virgin, all is forgiven. It's all your old rolling stock anyway!

items.title: A V(ery) A(ids) N(etwork) T(rain) I(nstitution
items.review_text:
Waiting for the day that trustpilot allows minus scoring. 

Not quite sure how Avanti are still in service; couldn’t organise a p*ss up in a brewery - let alone trying to book a train ticket in advance ! 

Although they do provide a very good game of, ‘Is my train going to run today !?’. Which, if you really don’t care about getting to your destination, or just love the thrill of paying for a full price ticket to then have to get on an oversold ‘sold out’ train one hour later, then it really is a game for you. 

With the amount of delays Avanti have cost me this year I could have probably walked the length of England in half the time. 

I’d give a big gold star to anyone who’s managed to get an Avanti train in the last month that’s run on time and without hiccups. 

At least the staff are sound. Apart from that one loser that made me buy an extra ticket cause I got my days wrong: can’t believe he done his job properly at Avanti ! 

Always loved choo choo trains. Not anymore .

items.title: Where hope goes to die
items.review_text: TrustPilot should introduce negative stars just for this company. On the rare occasions I had phone signal (Avanti are apparently using 1999 dial-up for their WiFi offer), reading others’ experiences made my latest journey on their boiling, late, overcrowded train slightly less awful. I dread work trips to London these days as it means I have to avail myself of their ‘service.’ But hey, no sweat Tories, we’re just northerners after all…

items.title: Hot, uncomfortable and a rip off
items.review_text: I've never hated a train journey so much. Started feeling happy and excited about the weekend. Got off with a headache from the heat on the train and discomfort of the seats. Some seats have no view out the window which made me feel as sick as when I paid an extortionate price for this journey. And there are no charging points at most seats which is a joke if you're traveling from London to Glasgow.

items.title: WORST TRAIN COMPANY IN THE WORLD
items.review_text: This is the worst train company in the world. I travelled when Virgin ran the trains and it was always a good experience. I travelled LNER last week great experience. With Avanti impossible to book tickets as they release them very late, awful or no service on board and then do not offer refunds. Please though do not go back to nationalise it was awful just give it back to Virgin nor LNER!!!!

items.title: Treated my husband to first class from…
items.review_text:
Treated my husband to first class from London to Manchester for his birthday.Train was delayed, then announced no first class and a free for all to even get a seat!
Never should have  got rid of Virgin :-(

items.title: Trains cancelled last minute
items.review_text: Trains cancelled last minute. Overcrowding, limited timetable, links not working on their delay repay site and overly complex.

items.title: If I could give a 0 I would.
items.review_text:
If I could give a 0 I would.
Totally unreliable in every way.
Lovely staff having to excuse the disasterous timetable management and when they are delayed it’s chaos as they state a time and then leave
 early and don’t warn people.
Living in Milton Keynes they charge for first class but there is no service provided and the total inability to run on time or at all is ridiculous.
Many of us were concerned when virgin lost the contract and I can only urge the people who make the decisions on contracts to vaguely consider the customers when you make the decision.
This is an utter disgrace.

items.title: Prepare to lose a lot of time and money
items.review_text:
Extortion and robbery. I use this service nearly twice a month from Euston to newstreet , every time without fail the service is below poor, disruptive and just pretty much useless if I had the time off in my life I would rather cycle the journey than go through the hard ship it is to get on these trains, you pay a disgusting £95 on a Tuesday at around 15:00 for a ONE WAY STANDARD CLASS TICKET that still takes just as long as London a northwestern train for £27 (not all the time) 
I’ve had it with this company virgin rail was bad but they didn’t drop the bar to this standard or raise the price to this level. 
For the price you pay and the service you get you still won’t get a full refund due to a £10 service fee via train line.

items.title: We have been robbed by Avanti
items.review_text:
I would like to put no stars 
Absolutely dreadful 
We spent £180 on two first class tickets one way
There were only 2 others in the carriage who had paid the same 
Everyone else bunked in 
No upgrade paid as the person who upgraded not on that day
But they enjoyed the service and all were allowed to stay for the whole journey taking free drinks etc 
We feel like we paid for their stuff
We were robbed by Avanti
No sign of any money back
Apathetic staff who could not be bothered checking tickets and making sure those who hadn’t paid were sent to their correct seats on the train 
Disgrace 
So unequal

items.title: we need back virgin ASAP
items.review_text: we need back virgin ASAP, every day new delays, cancelled trains and much more trains are slow trains with an overcrowd of passengers the traveling converted from being a pleasure to a horrible bad experience if they dont know how to serve us no matter what the reasons are, a new company needs to manage it

items.title: Coach too hot.
items.review_text:
Coach too hot.
It’s winter. We’ve come out in winter clothes!
Please consider this.

items.title: Price gouging
items.review_text: Price gouging, reduced Off Peak hours & no-one can see what the hours actually are- they don't document them so they can't be held to them. At the same time as service has gone down and become unreliable, Avanti West Coast has removed the "same ticket price at all times" and brought back massively expensive "peak times" tickets and prices of £400 return Manchester-London. While peak times Manchester-London are clearly stated, the off-peak times London-Manchester aren't documented, you have to try every ticket time shown and wait for the booking to fail at the payment step. Virgin Trains had a peak time leaving London after 5PM, it looks like Avanti have changed it to 3:30PM. Awful. I can fly to the USA and back for less than a peak time train ticket. The UK train system is expensive and awful.

items.title: Bring back Virgin Trains
items.review_text:
Absolutely disgusting. Travelled from Wilmslow via Crewe to London Euston 18 Nov . Impossible to book in advance . No seat reservation’s. First train delayed so missed connection . Avanti Guard at Crewe ushered us all onto a train at 5.06 failing to tell us it stopped at 5 stations before Euston . A 90 min journey took 3.5 hours . Now travelling home again via Crewe . Sat in my seat to discover it’s soaked in urine . Train is packed , people standing London - Crewe 3 hours . I’m having to sit on newspapers with urine seeping through. Beverages all stopped as they’ve run out of paper bags . You wouldn’t treat a dog the way Avanti treat their passengers & paid £125 for this !!!!
Train Manager won’t show her face on board

items.title: Totally useless
items.review_text: Totally useless, tickets released last minute, so you can't plan your trip. The train I eventually booked for my return from Manchester was cancelled late the nigth before had to leave early so I could return to London, when booking you have various choices for your seat. I had none of the choices selected. Totally useless. Purely for profit monopoly. Couldn't run a bath let a lone a rail service. Minus 10.

items.title: Wanted to catch a train to London on a…
items.review_text: Wanted to catch a train to London on a Sunday to go to the theatre, gave up trying. Eventually made my way to Reading to catch a GWR train into Paddington. More expensive but worth it. We need Vigin trains back as soon as possible.

items.title: Just crap aren't they
items.review_text: Just crap aren't they. Absolute nightmare getting hold of tickets, released whenever they feel like it, half are unavailable instantly. Trains are overcrwoded and frustratingly diverted/slowed than they used to be.

items.title: Was on the 10:52 from Edinburgh to…
items.review_text: Was on the 10:52 from Edinburgh to Crewe on the 10th of November and payed 169 pound for first class and the conductor catered to Preston with soft drinks and no food by the time a catering crew boarded I had no time to enjoy any food as I had to get off, it’s a disgrace to charge high prices for nothing, either amend the price or make sure the crew are onboard a train from the departing station. utter nightmare Avanti really is, lner is better

items.title: A Truly Awful Company
items.review_text:
Impossible to speak to a person. 
Made a delay repay claim in September. It was approved  and advised that payment would be made via BACS.
 No payment received after a month so made a complaint.  Told that they were sorry, and that payment would be made within 5 days.  No payment received after 10 days so advised them of this and no response after a month.  They have a monopoly on this route and know it so either just don't care or are ridiculously incompetent.

items.title: On my way down to london from Wigan…
items.review_text: On my way down to london from Wigan tonight on 20.15, 17th November. The gentleman serving in the shop was so helpful, kind and efficient. Just like to say a big thank you.

items.title: Avanti's philosophy question
items.review_text: Avanti's philosophy question, is a cow and cow, find out in 3 hours!

items.title: Missed my mums birthday
items.review_text: Missed my mums birthday because 'it was peak time'. No guidance listed online for when peak and off peak times are. From reading trainline it seems to be at the mercy of the ticket collector, who seemed to be in a bad mood today. Have never had this issue before and considering the price of tickets I am very upset.

items.title: Zero stars for this disgrace of a…
items.review_text: Zero stars for this disgrace of a company. Faulty trains, cancellations, over crowded, seat booking chaos, filthy toliets, never a working shop on board. Never ask for your ticket, and never staff presence on the train. Overpriced vile company. Bring back Virgin. In total disbelief this business is still operating

items.title: Very poor service
items.review_text: One of the worst companies I've ever had the misfortune to deal with. My train in July was massively delayed on both outbound and return journey. I raised a compensation claim in August which was upheld. I chose to be reimbursed via cheque rather than train credit, which in itself was inconvenient, I'd have preferred to be reimbursed back to the card I paid for the tickets with. The cheque was issued to me, but my name was misspelled and therefore could not be banked. Despite multiple enquiries about getting the cheque reissued (and waiting for up to an hour to speak to someone) it's now November and I'm still yet to receive the compensation cheque. Very poor service indeed.

items.title: Bring Back Virgin
items.review_text:
Train over an hour Late leaving BLACKPOOL two hours late leaving Preston very crowded all the way thru to London.
 train manager did not walk through the train once.

No catering and to cap it all i sign up to their Automated delay repay service that doesnt work either.
Bring back Virgin.
update 9th Jan 2023 still waiting for full refund......

items.title: AWFUL COMPANY
items.review_text: When Virgin had the London euston to Liverpool lime street service, you could regularly get £12 and book them nicely in advance. Avanti however DO NOT EVEN RELEASE their timetables until the very last minute and when they do, it is at ridiculous prices all which I could cope with if the service actually ran smoothly. Nine times out of ten the train is then cancelled or diverted. IT IS A JOKE.

items.title: Try running on time and doing your job…
items.review_text: Try running on time and doing your job properly before asking for pay rises!!!🤬🤬🤬, we pay for a service and have jobs to go to, and when you 🤬🤬, don’t do your job…..WE CANT!!!!🤬

items.title: Cannot book a return ticket from Manchester
items.review_text: Have been waiting months for them to release tickets for pre booking a return trip from Manchester. Have hotel booked for a Christmas event. Is now three weeks before the event and still not able to book a return journey, this company is a joke.

items.title: DISASTER WAITING TO HAPPEN!
items.review_text:
DISASTER WAITING TO HAPPEN!
The attitude of most staff is deplorable and worryingly unsafe, the company have no strategy or any management skill. The trains, due to a drastic cut in service frequency are seriously overloaded, carriages designed for 70 passengers are loaded to double that with standing passengers. A few years back a Pendolino Train operated by Virgin Trains derailed at Grayrigg the train was praised for its build quality in saving lives, it was also not full, there were empty seats, the staff were happy in there jobs. Now the trains are the same Pendolinos but are packed with double the intended passengers, the staff are disheartened and reduced in numbers. Should there god forbid be another incident involving a derailment especially at speed the outcome is very likely to be far more serious!
It is illegal for a bus or coach to be driven on the road with more passengers than allowed, one person is responsible for ensuring that does not happen and that’s the driver, he also has a legal duty for the care and safety of his passengers, where are the laws for trains? Who is responsible? The train driver sits in a sealed lockable compartment sometimes he has cctv showing the interior of the carriages, the guard or train manager is unable to get through the train due to overcrowding and probably for fear of there own safety, be concerned because no one has any consideration for your safety! The Health and Safety Executive need to take responsibility, the Rail Unions need to take some action to safeguard its members as well but more importantly the whole future of railways, all the ingredients are there for one historic disaster!

items.title: Quick and great customer service!
items.review_text: Had booked tickets to go from Kilmarnock to Liverpool, train was cancelled last minute, so unfortunately had to cancel my full trip, so sent off a refund request a few hours later. Response from Avanti within the hour and refund processed with no hassle. Great customer service. Will use Avanti to book all future rail trips

items.title: Do not give this company your money. Drive, get a coach, literally anything else.
items.review_text: Would give negative stars if I could. Over £400 spent on London to Shrewsbury return first class tickets for 2 adults and a child. Only 2 seat reservations on both legs and seats weren’t together. No catering or shop service on outbound train - couldn’t even get a bottle of water. Train back to London Euston was rammed. Not a spare seat on the whole train, people standing everywhere. People sat in our reserved seats said they had them reserved too. Was carrying my asleep 3 year old toddler. No where to sit. No one offered to give up a seat until an older lady did. I’ll be forever grateful to her. Absolute shambles, will be complaining and claiming every penny back and won’t be using again. Would rather walk.

items.title: What is a timetable?
items.review_text: The sooner these guys are stripped of their franchise the better! substandard, pathetic and the most unreliable service ever. Every single one of the directors should be shown the door, can’t even plan a timetable a week ahead.

items.title: Disgraceful company
items.review_text:
Disgusting the sooner they privatise trains the better. I asked for my tickets to be sent to me in the post. The tickets didn't come in time. Any normal company would have apologised and reprinted a ticket or send me an online code or something like that. Not this pathetic excuse of a company I was Met with aggressive staff asking me why I asked to have the tickets posted and said if I want to get on the train I'll have to pay again.

Scumbags

items.title: Worst train company ever
items.review_text: Terrible. Awful. Shambolic. Dreadful. Dire. Horrendous. Shocking. Just when you thought everything in this country was bad enough, along come Avanti.

items.title: Train got cancelled
items.review_text: Train got cancelled, as always, literally so frequently late, or cancelled last minute, and terrible Customer staff, it's a joke, and unfortunately no other options, so stuck with this company taking my money and not providing a hint of professional service

items.title: Horrible company

Fingers crossed they’ll lose the franchise so it will be run properly. I now try and use London Midland trains which are reliable and much cheaper.

items.title: Shambles

My train was taken out of service had to get another one and I had no seat. I paid for reserve seat not to stand. 
There are always problems with the service. I asked for a refund and filed it correctly and it's been 3 months still nothing.

items.title: Please take the contract from this…
items.review_text: Please take the contract from this company as they are at best a comedy show , would have given zero stars if I could. Travel to London regularly from Glasgow and I can count with one hand how many times the train has been on time . Constant cancellations as there is not enough drivers , Wi-Fi on train is unusable which then means the shop only takes cash. Was on the 9.10am train from Euston to Glasgow yesterday and arrived at Glasgow Central at 5.20pm

Utter utter Poo train operator. Not enough Staff, packed trains, seat allocations a joke and always late.  Ring back virgin. This company is run by imbeciles! 

Utter utter morons.

items.title: I was at Euston and they had an amended…
items.review_text: I was at Euston and they had an amended time table, due to which I missed my train. No apologies from the customer support staff, who had the gall to say that customers are being asked to check the website before travelling, as if the delay was my fault.

items.title: Unreliable - avoid & fly instead!
items.review_text: Unreliable money-grabbers - took my money then announced a strike a couple of hours later which renders the ticket unusable.
