Now I am stranded and my work schedule is all messed up. Lazy, greedy selfish employees and company. AVOID & FLY INSTEAD. This company deserves to go under.

items.title: Horrendous journey
items.review_text: Horrendous journey - Ibook seats for my small son and me during the school holidays to go from London to Glasgow. The seats were triple booked, so we were unable to take our booked seats. The food cart lost power it was a heat wave and they had no cold drinks or any food. The train was packed to overflowing to the point the driver almost refused to take over at Carlial - I made a complaint and was offered 25% discount on my next two train journeys as compensation. This was after a five-hour journey, no booked seat, adults and children sitting in the isles - even first class had ZERO booking and was packed to the brim with people. I refused the discount as they owed us at the very least a free ticket and guess what ZERO reponse - AVOID THEM IF YOU CAN

items.title: Overpriced, Dirty trains, horrendous customer service
items.review_text:
Dirty trains 
Staff are trained to be like nazis or maybe that’s how you naturally become when working for such a company 

Overpriced

items.title: Strip them of the franchise!!
items.review_text:
I cannot even buy tickets for next Monday's service because they're not available yet. Honestly, what kind of company cannot schedule trains even 1 week ahead? They are completely incompetent and need to be stripped of the contract - I've been going up and down to Liverpool for 15 years on this line, it's the worst it has ever been with delays and cancellations.

Imagine using driver shortages as an excuse, didn't they realise they needed drivers when they tendered for contract? Complete and utter shambles

items.title: I wouldn't even give them one star
items.review_text: I wouldn't even give them one star, what a disgraceful service! I hope Avanti West Coast operator soon will be replaced by a reliable operator offering reasonably priced services.

items.title: Terrible service long wait times that…
items.review_text: Terrible service long wait times that have double and random cancellation.

items.title: Bring back Virgin
items.review_text: Why did Avanti get this contract from Virgin? They are absolutely shocking. Despite being ridiculously over priced, these trains are ten times slower and the availability is far reduced to that we used to get with Virgin. Virgin trains did London Euston to Birmingham in 1hr 20mins, with Avanti it’s now taking near on 2 hours. No explanation. They making booking in advance near on impossible and then hike up the prices when they finally do release tickets. They need stripping of this contract immediately. Nobody wants slow, unreliable trains!

items.title: Booked wheelchair assistance
items.review_text: Booked wheelchair assistance, nobody showed up, caught train on platform just in time, but when trying to board doors closed (2 mins before departure), waited 1h for the next, as on crutches let the other passengers board first, still waiting for the other passengers getting inside so I could board the idiot at the platform was shouting „stay clear of the closing doors“, managed to board the train, catch a seat and place an order through their online system. Gave them coach and seat number, order got accepted and money taken but nothing arrived at my table yet.

items.title: Terrible service - will no longer use
items.review_text: Avanti used to be a good, reliable company who i had no hesitation to recommend. In recent months, however, every aspect of the experience with this company has been awful - to the extent that my company now holds meetings online as we cannot rely on Avanti to get us to London. The inability to book more than a few days in advance at weekends, the number of cancellations and horrendous overcrowding of the trains mean that I no longer use the company and will not until the franchise has changed. The customer service is terrible - no aspect of the company is now acceptible. I rarely write negative reviews but my experiences over the last few weeks have left me no choice.

items.title: Sitting on the 10:35 service from Manchester Piccadilly
items.review_text: Sitting on the 10:35 service from Manchester Piccadilly to London Euston in first class.  Prior to departure zero announcements yet 60 seconds after departure we are informed the train is to have several other stops added increasing the journey time.  We are then told that as someone "turned the taps off" there is no running water and consequently no service in any class.  Clearly they would have known this before departure but said nothing.  Now passengers are expected to travel for several hours without even a bottle of water.  Avanti are a joke, service replaced with excuses and they should be ashamed of themselves.  Avoid this company if you can.

items.title: Very nice staff
items.review_text:
Very nice staff 

Agree with the seat avalibility they give people other peoples reserved seats

items.title: Why let people book seats then list the…
items.review_text:
Why let people book seats then list the whole train as available seating? This just course upset and disputes! The train is full not enough places to put bags and luggage. People are annoyed. This is even after not being able to book tickets until two weeks before hand due to the lame excuse of strikes and Covid! 
What a useless provider!

items.title: Bring back Virgin
items.review_text:
Bring back Virgin. We used to travel up and down all the time between Manchester and London on Virgin trains - it was faster, cheaper and more comfortable than driving. Avanti have change that completely! From no trains on weekends and extortionate pricing to filthy trains that are SLOW running - how can that even be???
It is now faster, cheaper and more comfortable to drive!! Which is insane!! When are they going to pull Avanti off and get Virgin back!!! Avoid using Avanti if you have any other options!! TERRIBLE service!

items.title: Bring back Virgin
items.review_text: Yet again can’t book an express train from Euston to Preston 2.10 hrs. We’ve gone backwards to the dark ages could only find 3.30 hr trains outbound and inbound again. What a joke.

items.title: Sardines train
items.review_text: Traveling from Wigan 10:48 am to Liverpool, the travelers were packed like sardines, elderly, disabled people dogs and everybody else. The train had only 3 carriages. Wondering what's next, would they like to see people on trains or between carriages like in Bangladesh or other s..t hole country?

items.title: Only gave it one star as zero not…
items.review_text: Only gave it one star as zero not possible! Slashed a third of their timetable since mid August and half of it for this October half term week and can't even manage to run that! An utter omnishambles!

items.title: Would give zero stars if it was an…
items.review_text: Would give zero stars if it was an option. I pity anyone that has to use this train company to get to work. Wi-Fi has never worked for years, too expensive, trains cancelled with 5 mins notice, journey times double what they used to be. Please bring back Virgin trains - they were expensive but at least you got to London quickly and on time. This is the opposite of levelling up - I’m not going to take a great London job because I can’t face this commute every week.

items.title: I really like avanti west coast because…
items.review_text: I really like avanti west coast because Avanti has fast online free Wi-Fi comfortable seats nice staff clean services I highly recommend going on Avanti west coast.

items.title: I've been waiting for weeks to book…
items.review_text: I've been waiting for weeks to book tickets from London to Manchester this weekend and still they have no trains available on Sunday. What a waste of time.

items.title: There is nothing they could do worse
items.review_text:
There is nothing they could do worse.  
Journeys are more expensive, the trains are always delayed, journey times are considerably longer and fewer, trains are not cleaned properly.  
Disgraceful service that costs a fortune!

items.title: Just awful train company
items.review_text: Just awful train company.  Their trains are dirty and tatty. They're ALWAYS late and usually rated full. They always seem to have many almost empty first class carriages however. I can only assume that this is to remind you that this company dispises you for not being rich enough to travel on their disgustingly expensive upper rate.  This company should have its contract ripped up immediately.....but we all know that this govt won't let that happen.  It'll carry on giving a crappy service but lining the pockets of its shareholders.

items.title: Cancelled half the trains to get to…
items.review_text: Cancelled half the trains to get to Liverpool this morning. Disgrace of a company.

items.title: Could not be worse
items.review_text: Categorically the worst train service I have ever encountered. I have to travel on these services weekly for work and they are consistently terrible. Today's journey from London Euston to Manchester took a little under nine hours, with no food or water available at any point, nor the opportunity to get off the train. Avoid at all costs if you possibly can.

items.title: Unfortunately there is no option for…
items.review_text: Unfortunately there is no option for giving this company 0 stars. I’m currently on a train to Manchester that should have arrived at 14:30 it is now scheduled to arrive at 8pm. There was a problem with the overhead lines which I appreciate is not their fault, however the situation has been handled awfully. The train had been sat in the same spot for two and a half hours before they even decided to dispatch a rescue service. The rescue service then took a further hour to arrive. We were transferred to another service which didn’t move for almost another hour. I am currently missing a once in a lifetime experience for which I have been waiting for almost a decade. Thanks ever so much Avanti!

items.title: Ticket barrier staff at Birmingham New…
items.review_text: Ticket barrier staff at Birmingham New Street were under staffed and taking it out on customers. I was forced to buy a ticket I didn’t need because the woman on the barrier didn’t recognise a Welsh place name. Then her colleague came over to be nosey and started staring at me threateningly, both were incredibly rude, unhelpful and deliberately slowing people down on a day where there are constant delays then when through that barrier the next lot of staff were just as bad. Made my train with seconds to spare when I have a disability and mental health issues. The ticket barrier staff are absolutely useless.

items.title: Completely unreliable.
items.review_text: Completely unreliable.

items.title: Disregarding accessibility needs.
items.review_text: Awful customer service. I had an accesible seat reservation to accommodate medical needs however due to cancellations I could not travel on the original train and had to get the next one. There were no staff at any of the avanti information kiosks at London Euston. The avanti lady at the ticket desk was rude, dismissive and unhelpful. The station staff at the assistance desk were very helpful and arranged an accesible seat. When I boarded the train I was told I couldn’t sit there because the staff were using those seats and was told “why can’t you just sit in one of those seats?” Is this honestly how staff should be treating their customers.

items.title: ARE YOU KIDDING ME
items.review_text: ABSOLUTE JOKE

items.title: If I could give them no stars I could
items.review_text: If I could give them no stars I would: booked a first class ticket from Edinburgh to Preston only to find AWC had let passengers from other train companies (east coast line) to fully occupy the train (west coast line) consequently no seats, tables, food or drinks. After complaining they offered 25% discount of my next rail journey.. absolutely not acceptable. They deserve to lose their franchise and I hope the train regulator reads these reviews because it seems the majority of people have had very poor service.

items.title: I had a wonderful day out at the NEC
items.review_text:
I had a wonderful day out at the Caravan and Camping show at the NEC.   I checked the Train Line
app to see when the next off peak train was to Euston.  On arriving at Euston the tickets were checked and many people were told they had to pay again as their tickets were not valid on Avanti trains.  The staff were brutal!  People were treated like criminals.  It was not our fault.  On inspection In tiny small print my ticket said Wmr and Lnr only.  This meant nothing to me.  The hostility of the money grabbing staff is unforgivable.   I had to cough up another £43.40. 
 This was a genuine mistake and more clarity should have been given.  How about an announcement at  the station.  There were several people being spoken to like criminals, some with small children, 
holiday makers, older people.  Avanti need to get their act together and liaise with the Train Line App. 
Unforgivable!

items.title: Avanti refurbishment replaced seats with bricks
items.review_text:
I can almost forgive bad WiFi and unreliable trains as long as when I'm finally on board I can have a comfy nap in one of the seats, or god forbid, do some work.

Unfortunately Avanti has skimped on their train refurbishment and installed seats that make Ryanair's seats feel like luxury sofas.

items.title: The website is appalling
items.review_text:
The website is appalling. It does not let you see what you are inputting on the password. You have to guess why it doesn't like it.
I have now tried 28 times to reset my password.
The last 5 journeys, I have made, were late in at least one direction. Despite the fact that I booked directly through them, I was not automatically refunded. In fact, you have to register in order to claim a refund for a delayed journey.
One of the passengers on my most recent journey told us that he travels up and down the country by train. He said that every single one of the last 35 journeys were delayed. He said that they were lying about the reasons.
The toilet was blocked, and the computer generated seat bookings incorrect.

items.title: Can't fault the service we had with Avanti West Coast
items.review_text: My husband and myself travelled from Wolverhampton to Euston on Monday 17th Oct returning on the 18th the train on both journeys was on time. We had assisted travel arranged by passenger assist. It was first class from beginning to end. We are both in our eighties my husband is blind  I have walking difficulties and never once did we feel vulnerable or confused everyone was so kind to us. we have never done this before but won't hesitate to do it again.  Thank you once again to everyone who looked after us.

items.title: Ridiculous prices
items.review_text: Ridiculous prices! It's an offense to people. Over 300 pounds for a ticket from London to Manchester? They should be audited. This is immoral.

items.title: Departure time brought forward, but never notified, train missed
items.review_text:
Avanti "helpfully" changed their departure time to 20 minutes earlier, causing me to miss my train from London to Glasgow. They never notified me via email. The cherry on top that I actually went to Euston Station to make sure my bike booking was in order the day before I was due to travel, wasting all of my lunch break queuing, and the Avanti station staff never mentioned the change. They even printed the ticket with the original departure time displayed. It still states that time on the website, in my journeys as well. Despite all the evidence that—short of mind reading—I had no way of knowing that the train was going to leave 20 minute earlier I was denied compensation.

"I regret to inform you however that this is not something that we offer compensation for as the journey had been changed 10 days after the booking had been made and you should have been notified by email, this is an automatic process for any change in timetable. " 

What a joke. This journey already had to be rebooked once due to strike action, and, as their online system insisted on charging me full ticket price when I tried to change my dates, instead of just the difference, I wasted an hour on the phone sorting that out as well. Seriously incompetent service.

Their bike policy in general is ridiculous too, massive long distance trains to Scotland with only 4 spaces in total available, makes life really unnecessarily complicated.

items.title: AWFUL
items.review_text: The worst train line experience I have had. Don't know why I am even bothered writing it as the reviews speak for themselves.  Overpriced, WiFi doesn't work, power sources don't work, to top it off the seats are so hard I need to go home and nurse a back ache.  Won't be using this train service again.  Judging by the empty seats on rush hour trains looks like I am not the only one.  Failing miserably

items.title: I am switching from Avanti to coach travel…
items.review_text:
I wish I could leave zero stars. I am switching from Avanti trains to coach travel because I am so sick of journeys with Avanti. It's not just the reduced services, particularly from Liverpool to London, which is my route. Even when I can find a train, it's always uncomfortable, including trips when I have splashed out on a first class ticket hoping for a bit of comfort (now a complete waste of money). 
The interiors have been reconfigured since Virgin's days, presumably to cram in more seats and get more money per journey. This might be good for shareholders in the short term (probably not long term because of the effect on customer satisfaction) if it has increased turnover, or even profit. But it is, short and long term, horrible for the customers. It is uncomfortable to be always crammed in with too many people in a single compartment, especially when there are quieter carriages. In a pandemic (Covid is still very much an issue), it is unhealthy. The west coast computer booking system needs to be overridden to spread travellers through the train (pandemic or not), instead of shoving all booked customers into as few coaches as possible, while leaving other compartments empty, as was the case on the 11.47am Liverpool-Euston on Monday. On a recent first class ticket trip, I moved into a quieter compartment that was not first class to find more air and space, and to get away from a man sitting close to me and coughing all over me. I consider that to have been a criminal assault on me by Avanti, which is responsible for my health and safety on the journey. On one of my first journeys on Avanti some years ago, the train stopped at Runcorn and disgorged its contents (it was summer...lots of holidaymakers with luggage), leaving all customers on the platform to wait for the next (extremely crowded) train 20 minutes later to get to Lime Street. No explanation was given. I asked the driver and he said the train had to head back to Euston because it was running late for another  journey...never mind the customers on that earlier train. I should have known then that Avanti would always treat its customers with complete contempt. Even the staff don't like the company, judging by the responses I have had from staff members when inquiring about Avanti's policies. I honestly do not know how the staff continue to behave with decency and respect towards customers. It is more than can be said for Avanti's senior staff. Avanti should be stripped of the West Coast contract. It is a disgraceful service. I am really sick of being treated like rubbish by this company. I never thought I would say it, but Avanti is worse than Virgin.

items.title: Worst Railway Company in the UK
items.review_text: Avanti West Coast is by the worst company to offer services in the UK since privatisation. I booked tickets to Bournville from London for the weekend of August 13/14. We were unable to travel because of the rail strike on August 13. I requested a refund. Actually requesting a refund was a tortuous process because of having booked 4 single tickets, I had to make separate applications for refunds. On October 10 (nearly two months after the travel date) I received two emails from Avanti saying I had been refunded. However I only received a refund for one of the tickets. I contacted so called customer service and had a reply from Nasima saying I had been refunded. When I queried this I was told it could take 5-10 days to receive the funds. I in fact had had the refund mentioned in the email the following day. I replied to Nasima asking where the rest of my money was and to date I have not received any further response from Avanti. I have lodged a complaint with Avanti.

items.title: Shocking
items.review_text: How did Avanti get the contract?! Shocking service! They blame the rail strike and there’s not rail strike. Very limited service and can’t book advance; so expensive too. I miss Virgin!

items.title: Train Journey from Hell
items.review_text:
Haven't been on the West Coast line in ages and I'm wondering if it will be the last.  I came back from Ireland via Cairnryan and Glasgow back in August and everything was fine until we got to Scotland's biggest city.

The train was cancelled and people were left relying on the last one for London.  The queues were out of the station and the train was hence late leaving.  There were at least four delays en route, a dubious trackside fire, a person taken ill on the train, on-board computer not working and being held up by late-night freight traffic which meant a diversion into engineering works with a speed limit of 20mph.  In all a perfect example of Murphy's Law.
 
We eventually arrived in Euston 3.5 hours late at 2am only to be greeted by a bunch of muppets lined up in case we ventured into other parts of the station.  The whole journey from Portadown took about 17 hours.  I only went this way as it was said to be slightly quicker than the other routes.

The only good thing about it was I got a full refund, which saved the company from getting 1 star, although that took longer than advertised to be settled.

Talk about a hellish nightmare I thought I was travelling through Kafkaville.

items.title: Worst company going - BRING BACK VIRGIN TRAINS
items.review_text:
Worst company going, thats if they go
Cancelled trains
Waiting months for refunds 
No replies from Customer Service
WHY DO WE HAVE TO EXTEND THE PAIN OF A SIX MONTHS EXTENSION MANCHESTER-LONDON SERVCE....
PLEASE BRIG BACK VIRGIN TRAINS

AVANTI WEST COAST WHAT A DISGRACE

items.title: Please take away their license!
items.review_text:
Please take away their license!
Worst rail provider ever. 
Bring back Virgin.

items.title: Horrid and getting worse
items.review_text: Horrid and getting worse. Cancelled and delayed trains are now the norm! They need to lose their franchise now.

items.title: Worst train operator I've ever experienced
items.review_text: My train to London was clealy overbooked, my seat was taken and I had to sit on the floor. My travel day pass in London did not work, so I had to pay for the tube. Return train was cancelled. What a total shambles and waste of money.

items.title: I would prefer ZERO star review as they…
items.review_text: I would prefer ZERO star review as they do not deserve anything. The Government should interviene as they are not able to run a business. Tried emails and still waiting on their reply to my last email sent 2 months ago. Tried calls and have spent an average of 1 hour holding and no answer. Absolutely disgraceful!

items.title: Hopeless unable to book any weekend…
items.review_text: Hopeless unable to book any weekend trvel from Scotland to London because Avanti have cancelled their timetables - when their website says; "We know it’s not enough just to say sorry and we’re working hard to provide the reliable service you need and should be able to expect" but still do absolutley nothing to improve things you know they deserve less than 1 star

items.title: Absolutely appalling
items.review_text: Absolutely appalling. One train an hour from Manchester to London. Treated like cattle with a train manager dictating to people that they should move their luggage. To where, there is no space for people never mind luggage.TAKE AWAY THEIR CONTRACT AND BRING SOME COMPETENCY BACK……ZERO ZERO ZERO

items.title: London to Glasgow Central 17.09…
items.review_text:
London to Glasgow Central 17.09 12/10/22. Was originally booked on 17.30 service but this train was changed to 17.09 and only found out by chance no notification from Avanti. Asked a couple of Avanti staff if I was booked on 17.09 as train was sold out and told probably. Only 1steward in 1st class where there should have been 3. She done her best and I am not critiscing her as she done a good job
 but that is pathetic Avanti. Are all your first class passengers who didn't receive first class service getting a refund? I am guessing not!

items.title: Absolute disgrace travelling for 4.5…
items.review_text: Absolute disgrace travelling for 4.5 hrs can’t get a drink or a sandwich unless in first class. Absolute joke. Wifi waste of time.

items.title: £500 still not refunded!
items.review_text: Since Avanti reduced their scheduled timetable, I have been battling with them on a daily basis to receive refunds totaling just over £500.  Despite my calls and emails and promises from them, I still have not been refunded. Who can afford in the current climate to be out of pocket for such a sum.  I have provided all the information countless times. If I could rate them minus stars I most certainly would.

items.title: Horrible service
items.review_text: Horrible service. Shame on you

items.title: Totally useless
items.review_text: Totally useless, but they sent a replacement coach

items.title: Absolutely dreadful
items.review_text:
Absolutely dreadful, use to be able to take straight through trains to london, now near on impossible and have one or more changes adding on travelling time. Carriages old and they have reduced number if carriages so overcrowded.
Prices have increased so much it is now more cost effective to drive to london than take a train.
Shoddy service, bring back virgin, also doesn’t help these train unions using the ordinary working man as their political foorball.

items.title: Shameful train service!
items.review_text:
I travel regularly from Manchester to London via train (or used to) to see my family. I am a senior lady and often travel on my own. I like to plan ahead and know I have a reserved seat. This is now impossible. I can’t remember the last time my reserved seat was available, and could not possibly be able to stand for a 2 hours plus journey on theses overcrowded trains. It’s now the norm for the seat reservation system to be down, or train gets declassified due to the regular train cancellations. And we now have to accept that weekend timetables and tickets, are rarely available until days before travel (probably to minimise claims for the all the cancellations)!
This is totally unacceptable. How on earth can you plan a trip and book other activities when you’re not even sure if you’ll get there. And getting back is yet another nightmare!
The government needs to step in and sort out this mess. Avanti are not fit for purpose and for them to be given another 6 months to sort out their mess is so disappointing. That just means another 6 months of anger and frustration for the commuters.

items.title: all round awful experience
items.review_text: travel up to Penrith regularly, never been reliable, awful website. much better when Virgin ran it.

items.title: Utter embarrassment of an organisation
items.review_text: Utter embarrassment of an organisation. Who is in charge? I cannot believe that this Company can be so negligent and get away with it. Disgusting.

items.title: Duck you avanti west coast
items.review_text: Duck you avanti west coast

items.title: Worst train company by far!!
items.review_text: Booked a return ticket from Carlisle to Euston with reserved seating. Both journeys were “cancelled” with trains running 20 minutes before. I suspect they sold tickets for multiple trains and then just cancelled random ones so all the passengers were crammed into one train. We therefore had no seat reservation in the one that actually ran and had to stand most of the way. Their customer service is appalling and I wish I could give a negative rating. Like another reviewer said, I think I’d rather walk than give this company another penny!!

items.title: Canlled train from coventry to…
items.review_text: Canlled train from coventry to Birmingham

items.title: Uneliable service,but they send coaches
items.review_text: Uneliable service,but they send coaches

items.title: I booked a train from Edinburgh to…
items.review_text: I booked a train from Edinburgh to London, the train departed on time, and arrived on time, so that was good. I was just disappointed to learn when on the train that only table seats have a power socket, so I was facing 7 hours without any charge. Surely all seats must have a power socket in this day and age. Luckily as my journey progressed a table became available so I could charge my devices and use my laptop for work. The train was not the cleanest, there was a light fitting in my carriage showing cables hanging out, the announcement speakers were too loud. Use if you must but Liner and Luma are so much better,and much more modern.

items.title: A complete joke
items.review_text: Avanti trains are a genuine embarrassment to the country. I can pretty much guarantee every time i book one it will be cancelled or heavily delayed. This is when they’re already running a reduced service. Giving the London to Manchester route to Avanti has been nothing but a disaster and I hope to see a worthy provider back soon.

items.title: Bought tickets on 26th Sept for travel…
items.review_text: Bought tickets on 26th Sept for travel on 10th Oct. We and rail regulator have been told delays in publishing timetable are to ensure no late cancellations. 10.43 didn’t run  and clearly wasn’t cancelled on the day. No prior contact. Delayed for meeting and crammed on next train which was formed short. Avanti have been abysmal since taking over yet prices and ticketing policy made to their advantage - this company needs to be replaced.

items.title: Consistently disappointing
items.review_text:
Avanti West Coast is the most convenient way for me to travel to see family; unfortunately, I begrudge having to use their service.

Availability of advance tickets seems to be a particular problem. Even in pre-pandemic times, they would release advance tickets very late, however, the situation right now is just awful. Last month, advance tickets for my journey on 24th September only became available on 21st September. I booked my ticket within an hour of receiving the ticket alert yet I had to pay nearly £70 for a journey that would normally cost £35-40.

Trains are generally dirty with smelly toilets, are poorly maintained (noisy brakes, loud bangs when air conditioning switches on/off), seat reservations are often cancelled, wifi is terrible, and trains often run late for no apparent reason (in August, both my outward and return trains were nearly 30 minutes late arriving). I usually travel Standard Premium however the at-seat order service (which Avanti advertise as a perk of Standard Premium) never works.

I've submitted several complaints over the past year relating to on-train experience and problems encountered when booking tickets. On almost every occasion, the customer service advisor failed to read the complaint properly and gave either an incomplete or unrelated response.

Let's see if Avanti can improve their service during this six month extension. Otherwise, I'd be happy to see the back of them.

items.title: Appalling service
items.review_text:
Appalling service. Can’t believe they are still in business. Went first class from Euston to Glasgow Central. Firstly they removed the train we were going on without telling us and the new train was 20 minutes earlier so we could have missed it. No food available and no staff visible on train. 
If they keep their franchise after 16th October I will be disgusted with the government for ignoring the views of the travelling public. 
Whatever you do, avoid like the plague.

items.title: If i could give 0 stars I would
items.review_text: If i could give 0 stars I would, I can't even put into words how terrible a service this is.

items.title: Atrocious service
items.review_text: The service offered by this company is atrocious. Why this franchise was ever taken off Virgin in favour of this I’ll never know. Trains that barely run. Unable to purchase tickets more than a few weeks in advance. Overcrowded trains. If you can avoid using them do so.

items.title: Useless as always
items.review_text: Dear Avanti. There is no point in having a first class lounge in a key station such as Birmingham if it is closed during peak business. Hope that makes sense to you.

items.title: Euston to Manchester Piccadilly train.
items.review_text:
Euston to Manchester Piccadilly train.
Excellent service upgraded to Standard Premium fir £25.00 well worth it!
Delightful conductor who was helpful informative and charming
Person (lady) in buffet car really nice again helpful and charming 
Train on time  and very clean.

items.title: I wish avanti west coast weren’t a…
items.review_text: I wish avanti west coast weren’t a thing. The worst ever Trainline company in this modern century known to man. I’ve never been more infuriated and angry at them , they basically don’t run any direct trains anymore from Manchester or Chester , the government should never of extended their contract. AVANTI WEST COAST MUST GO THE WORST TRAIN SERVICE IN MY LIFE!!!!

items.title: Worst travel company ever
items.review_text: I booked a one way journey to return home to Chester after a trip to London only for this direct service to be cancelled. I therefore decided that as I had to change I would get an earlier train as the email I received stated that I could get the next available Avanti west coast service, I arrived at the station with the intention of getting the 11:10 service and changing at Crewe to then change onward to Chester, I visited the ticket office to check this only to be told I could only get the train before or after my original one which I think is unacceptable as this would mean I would return home later than my original train due to the change despite the fact that I’d paid for a direct service with a reserved seat. Because of this I had no choice but to pay a £33.40 excess in order to board the 11:10 train and that my reserved seat couldn’t be transferred and that many available seats would be available on the train something which was incorrect as when I boarded the train only 5 minutes after the platform was announced on the screen there was only a handful of available seats which were all taken meaning I had no choice but to sit in the doorway of a corridor between carriages. To pay a total of £68.60 and in return have my direct train cancelled, be given incorrect/misleading information, be spoken to rudely by both the information booth and ticket office, have no choice but to sit on the floor for my whole journey, have to change despite paying for a direct service, having to wait 45 minutes for my connecting change, I think this is absolutely unacceptable service and I would advise absolutely any other travel arrangements than using this awful company

items.title: Avanti - about as far removed from Virgin as you could get
items.review_text:
What has happened, post Virgin?
Used to have comfy seats, friendly staff, reliable timetable and wifi.
Today’s 1015 from Manchester was the usual (unacceptable) hourly train service that Avanti cobbles together. ‘Refurbished’ carriages with seats that are like sitting in bricks for 90 minutes. No at seat coffee or tea etc, wifi absolutely useless (you have to login to their wifi to get the at-seat service anyway, poor selection of sandwiches and no GF options other than sweet things. No one bothered to check tickets at all for the entire journey
Pathetic.
The sooner these jokers loose their franchise, the better

items.title: Ticket didn’t work and Help desk at…
items.review_text: Ticket didn’t work and Help desk at Euston very unhelpful

items.title: A disgrace of a company.
items.review_text:
A disgrace of a company.

If you must travel with them, under no circumstances book your ticket with them.   Most other operators deal with refunds timely, especially when it's their own incompetence that causes the issue.  Not Avanti, though.

items.title: Avanti ****show
items.review_text:
Another journey and another  ****show….Delay repay pointless. Hoping these ifools will get me  cab as connections gone for the night. This crappy company should be paying me.

Will somebody get rid.

items.title: Bring back Virgin
items.review_text: Had a reserved seat on the train from Euston to Manchester, and it was cancelled, so this crap excuse of a service say you have to get the next train, so two train loads of people on one train and no reserved seat, so was stood in the doorway until Stockport, I will be getting the coach from now on, or until Virgin get the franchise back.

items.title: Bring back Virgin
items.review_text: Bring back Virgin. Trying to book tickets from Liverpool to Euston return for November 22. No weekend return tickets on Saturday or Sunday. Virgin were a dream compared to this train line.

items.title: Travelled to london from chester…
items.review_text: Travelled to london from chester weekend just gone . Supposed to be with avanti.  When got to Chester station on Friday night train to crewe had been cancelled without notifiying us , so luckily as arrived early managed to get another train to crewe and train from Crewe to London very delayed so got another train. Then supposed to travel back with avanti Monday morning and train cancelled again. Totally unreliable service , train we had to get on Monday morning packed and had no seats reserved on this service , Nightmare . Spoil what should have been a nice weekend. Get your act together please !!

items.title: Unacceptable
items.review_text: All recent experiences involve trains cancelled , strikes, treated very rudely at customer services Euston, unable to book trains for weekends in November, missing important family occasions and events. Totally unreliable and unacceptable service which cannot be relied upon, not good enough for prices charged when the train actually runs.

items.title: All is forgiven Virgin
items.review_text: Booked advance singles two and from London, train down has a config change so lost the reservation as declassified, trqin back up simply vanished from timetable, no notification from Avanti, they simply erased it.  Amazing.  They need their license revoking.

items.title: What a shambles of a company
items.review_text:
What a shambles of a company, received email telling me train I’ve booked for 17 Oct has been cancelled, no explanation no apology.They’ve taken all straight through train from Euston to Holyhead off timetable. My journey is usually less than 3 hours to Colwyn Bay, all trains available are all two changes and journey time increased to 41/2 -5/12 hours and as someone who suffers with a chronic pain condition all of this is too much. Reason for my journey is to visit my mother who is seriously Ill. I submitted a complaint at end of July when they introduced the revised timetable and am still waiting for a reply but they did send a feedback form asking how they’d dealt with complaint and would I recommend them to friend, answer to that is 100% NO!! As others have said I’d give zero stars if I could.
This is only way I have of getting to Colwyn bay as I don’t drive and there are no coaches that stop there.
A lot of the staff working on the trains are the ones that worked for Virgin and I’m not suprised they look miserable at times as I can’t imagine what there working condition are like given the way they treat passengers. SO BAD bring back Virgin.
I notice they don’t reply to their reviews on here either.

items.title: Shocking company planned a trip to…
items.review_text: Shocking company planned a trip to London from Lancaster well in advanced got all the tickets sorted via Trainline seats reserved only to find both journeys were being cancelled managed to get a seat no issue on way down. Whilst in London found that the train coming back was now removed they tried to cram 3 trains on 1, we were there early and got a seat but many didn’t train was seriously overloaded people standing all way to Preston. I used to visit London a lot for work on Virgin never many problems, Avanti need removing ASAP terrible company

items.title: you don't even deserve 1 star!!!
items.review_text: you don't even deserve 1 star!!!! you are frauds and steal money!!!!!!! I have been trying to get my refund from you for almost 3 month!!!!! your service is pathetic, you don't send emails when you say you will and you need to hold for 1hour + when calling the customer resolutions team!!! the worst service ever!!!!!

items.title: Absolutely terrible service
items.review_text:
Absolutely terrible service. My train was cancelled and I was assured I would receive a full refund. I have been refunded half and have still not had any satisfactory answer from customer services.

I have had over 10 email exchanges with some of the most incompetent customer service agents I have ever experienced and over a month has past since my refund was due. 

I wish I could give zero stars.

items.title: Awful awful awful.
items.review_text: Awful awful awful.

items.title: Completely disappointed
items.review_text: Completely disappointed. I wish I read a review before purchasing my tickets!! I don’t travel often, and as foreigner with disabilities I have to say the worst service ever experienced.

items.title: Complete shambles
items.review_text: My husband and I booked seats back in August for return trip from Chester to London this week. I deliberately chose direct trains as we are both elderly and wanted to minimise carrying luggage. A few days before we had an email to say that the timetable had changed and I should make sure this hadn't affected my journey. The outward train now required us to change at Crewe. It made things more difficult as we had to carry our luggage and no longer had seat reservations but we managed. Our return train was cancelled. I went to the ticket office to see if I could reserve seats on the next train. A very rude woman insisted that the train wasn't cancelled but was running as far as Crewe and that I should run (!) to get it right away as it was leaving in 5 minutes. I pointed out that this was not our original train but a Preston train leaving at the same time.   She kept repeating that it was my train and I had to get it because it was the only train on which my ticket was valid. I pointed out that the email from Avanti had said I could get the train before or after if my original train was changed, which it had been, since there was clearly no longer a 16.10 direct train to Chester showing on the board. She talked to me slowly and loudly as though the problem was that I was incapable of understanding - I may be old but I'm not stupid. Eventually she agreed to book me on the next train, which proved to be impossible for reasons unclear to her, so her advice was to go for that one and hope we could get seats. Fortunately we did. I want to stress that the train crews on both journeys were excellent but the Avanti booking system and support were a complete shambles.

items.title: This is far the worst service ever
items.review_text: This is far the worst service ever. They are most unreliable, not trained staff and completely unprofessional. I have the mistake of booking in advance until mid October and the 6.59 very expensive train is daily cancelled. Highly NOT RECOMMENDED. If there was an option of negative stars I would definitely  have given that one.

items.title: Why so expensive?
items.review_text:
£15 for 2 330ml cans of beer and small glass of wine. Pricier than an expensive London pub. 
Ripping off the public like everyone else these days

items.title: Avanti (get rid)
items.review_text: Avanti, the worst train service i have ever used. The website is convoluted and lacks customer focus. Trying to contact the company via other mediums (telephone) almost impossible. I was unsure whether i could be over sensitive, however, a simple internet search produced a plethora of literature (industry, news papers and surveys) confirming the network as one of the worst in the country. If at all possible i would advise anyone travelling via the west coast to make alternative arrangements!!!

items.title: The worst train operator in history...
items.review_text: How an earth this company has been allowed to carry on with the franchise beggars belief. It started out pretty OK, but has quickly wrecked its reputation. Has appalling communication, clearly has no idea of how to ensure its own staff help customers. I use Warrington Bank Quay to Euston and you can't even book tickets at weekends at the moment, and no hope of booking fares in advance. Virgin had the franchise taken away 'for the sake of it' and provided a very good service. It wasn't perfect, but I hardly heard a moan. Avanti are arrogance personified. Just awful. One star is a massive over-rating.

items.title: Awful company - bring back Virgin!
items.review_text:
Awful company.  I travelled from MAN-EUS last week, booked via the Avanti website.  I didn't receive a notification from Avanti to tell me my trains had been cancelled.  When I spoke to Avanti staff at MAN station, all they wanted to do was moan about trainline.com and told me not to book via trainline.com  She was obsessed!  I booked on the avanti website, so she had not excuse for the company not notifying me of the cancellations.  I have a disability so it's a HUGE problem not to have a seat allocation in advance.  
I travel between MAN-EUS often for work and now they won't give me cash refunds for my future bookings - I don't want an e-voucher.  One trip has cost me 180GBP return but it seems they are changing their ticket types to advance to prevent having to provide refunds.  Normally this would be a flexible/refundable ticket at this price.
It seems they don't care about the customer experience and are solely focused on revenue/income protection.  I am so upset with this company, they've left me out of pocket. Avanti - you need to sort this mess out ASAP.  
I just hope the ombudsman helps me.

items.title: Bring back Virgin and Restaurant Cars
items.review_text: Whilst train on time thats where it ended! 7 am ex Wigan to Euston -1st Class - offered a dry bacon roll or porridge or fruit!! No breakfast available ….. tea coffee was in short supply even! Service was like a greasy spoon cafe!  Return journey afternoon snacks ok but no service with a smile and prob with Water supply meant no washing facilities in Wc’s or Tea / coffee! Avanti have won the Franchise and cost cutting! Should be removed and returned to Virgin! On line ticket purchases also a faff!!

items.title: Travelled from Glasgow central station…
items.review_text: Travelled from Glasgow central station group of 9 from wishaw and Jenny and Andy made our journey very special with there out standing politeness and good patter   The 7 45 am train  lovely staff hood conversation  thank you so much for making our journey special

items.title: Poor customer experience and poor response to complaint
items.review_text: Booked my tickets on Trainline and when I queue at the platform, I discovered from the Avanti West staff member that the ticket had been cancelled when he scanned it. It transpired that Trainline had made the error and had cancelled my ticket without notifying me - I discovered this days later and received a full refund. However, in the moment, I was bemused at what was going on and asked the gentlemen to re-check my ticket, to which he responded: "we're a Train company, not a charity". He and his colleague then proceeded to laugh at me. I didn't shout and was not rude, so I did not warrant the response I received.  I wrote to the company to complain and got a pretty poor automated reply. Needless to say, when staff members are striking and you get treated in this manor, you lose sympathy for their cause.

items.title: Avanti booking on non existent train
items.review_text: I'm travelling with Avanti on 30 Sept from London to Manchester.  I'm booked on a train that no longer exists and Avanti don't have any information on how I will get there.  The service is a joke.

items.title: The worse service in 40 years
items.review_text: This business is appalling. Last week they released, late, train times and tickets for services this coming week. I booked a train. Today they claim they have cancelled the service. I can get a refund or spend an extra hour traveling - with three changes and no direct service. They blame their own employees. Frankly, I using the same route than I have for the last forty years and the service has never been so absent. Even during lockdown the service was superior. They must be stripped of the franchise asap. They aren't deserved of the contract. The management are an absolute " shower"

items.title: Terrible Company
items.review_text:
I don't write bad reviews often but Avanti is just terrible. I travel every week and each time there is a cancellation,delay to arrive,issues with electricity and the train stopping until it is fixed,people forced to stand due to less wagons. I keep claiming ticket refunds,it seems impossible to arrive to my destination on time. 

I pay for a direct train from euston to manchester weekly and when it gets cancelled  i have to take the next train hence the seat reservation is lost. It also takes 1 hour extra as it is not direct anymore.

For 200£ return ticket i would expect much better service

items.title: Rude staff and awful company
items.review_text: Train cancelled so I got on another train as my ticket specified, and the horrid female ticket officer at Euston was extremely rude. She actually shouted at me, and my colleagues travelling with me were shocked! Went to another officer who let me on the train. my cancelled ticket was valid for the next available train, the wording of which is not clear: available for my schedule, before or after the one that is cancelled, directly after or what? I got on the 9.15 after my 7.30 train was cancelled. If Avanti cancels (as they seem to always do) at least let us choose the flipping train to catch, and issue new tickets for this like any sensible airline or travel company!

items.title: No customer service!
items.review_text:
Arrived at Euston station on Tuesday (20th Sept) to find out the timetable had changed and my train had left earlier and I HADN'T GOT AN EMAIL. So I arrived at the station and my train had departed. I could get on the next train an hour later but with no seat reservation, so that was a stress! The poor station staff were getting the brunt of the frustration as there were hundreds of people in the same situation, I'm surprised the staff showed up knowing what was coming for them!

I was due to leave this weekend, but the tickets hadn't went on sale, I signed up for a notification of when they'd go on sale and I went on today, 2 days before travel, the tickets were on sale and again I hadn't received an email notification! Even more annoying was there were no cheaper advance tickets available, only regular single tickets! Why should the customer be penalised for their timetabling issues and have to pay higher fares at the weekend? 

ORR PLEASE TAKE THE CONTRACT OFF OF THIS COMPANY - THEY ARE SH.ITE!

items.title: Non existent Customer Service.
items.review_text:
We were awarded complementary tickets due to Avanti`s failings during C19 ,over the last month we asked for a slight extension to these tickets as we were unable to use them for the first six months due to my wifes cancer diagnosis / treatment / recovery, plus recently the pending rail strikes have made it impossible to book anything in advance due to my shiftwork , i was informed today after waiting 90 mins on hold that due to COMPANY POLICY these tickets could not be extended , regardless of circumstances.

What we are asking will not cost AWC a single penny to rectify so what has happened to logic / reason / understanding and actual customer service ?

Absolutely disgusting treatment of a customer when it was AWC fault in the first place that we received these tickets.

items.title: Disgusting service
items.review_text: Disgusting service.  Can never buy a ticket in advance only tickets when they appear are top price.   How are they getting away with this ?  They are encouraging car journeys with their shambles of an approach.  The UK tax payers are subsidising this Italian  company and they are providing us with a non exsistant service!

items.title: As writing this I’m currently waiting…
items.review_text: As writing this I’m currently waiting on the phone still and have been for the last hour and a half. I can’t believe how incompetent this company is and I haven’t even gotten an answer or had a train journey with them yet and its already awful.

items.title: Terrible
items.review_text: Terrible.  Nothing more to say than that really.

items.title: Poor first class service
items.review_text:
My train was cancelled and the train I am on was detoured. We were offered one hot drink on a two and half hour journey.
The train was drafty, I had to wear a coat. The most annoying thing is that the staff sat in the carriage gossiping loudly and did not come round with drinks at all.

items.title: Shambles
items.review_text: Shambles. Rude staff. Delayed train. It would be ok if it was a one off but it's ALL the time.

items.title: Outrageous horrible company.
items.review_text: Outrageous horrible company.. Cancelled train without notice had to change station on next train instead of direct.. Delayed on that one for over an hour..had booked a seat but wasn't reserved on this train. Had to stand from London to Glasgow... SHOCKING SERVICE.. not answering my emails and hanging up when we phone!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

items.title: Unacceptable level of service
items.review_text: Last minute platform change. Train delayed 45 mins (which at least meant that the slower movers amongst us were able to get on!) They haven’t provided the service offered so why can I only claim half my ticket price back? It’s no surprise this train almost empty.

items.title: Poor attitude toward customers….
items.review_text:
Poor attitude toward customers….
My Stafford to London train was late because it was late leaving their depot… When it arrived the conductor was shouting for everyone to hurry up & get on the train - “Come on!! Hurry up we’re running late!!!”
They seemed to forget it wasn’t the customers fault they were running late…!!
And the icing on the cake was finding my reserved seat was already taken…
Thank you Avanti….

items.title: Awful train company
items.review_text: Awful train company. Between cancelled trains, over sensitive train drivers and the ability to cock up every scheduled stop, they really are the worst company in the UK

items.title: Walking is generally faster...
items.review_text: A pathetic rail operator that I have unfortunately had the displeasure of using for more than one occasion. My very first time using them the train I needed to Chester had its route truncated to Crewe, here I had to wait a lovely hour and a half in freezing winter weather in order to continue my journey with a terribly uncomfortable two carriage train. Absolutely no compensation offered and was not in the mood to cause myself additional headaches by trying to contact them for one. If you can reasonably avoid using Avanti for your journey, definitely do so.

items.title: What a shambles of a company
items.review_text: What a shambles of a company. How they ever got a franchise is beyond me. On the train to London we had no staff,  in first class, from Preston onwards. On the return journey there were staff , but no food, from Preston onwards. Considering the inflated prices it is totally unacceptable.

items.title: Shockingly bad
items.review_text:
Shockingly bad, cancelled trains with no communication, over a month to get refunded. Dirty carriages with random socks screwed up in 1st class isle. Toilets stink. 
Order at seat is a joke, out of stock on a latte , £85 for a premium seat and it’s double booked 
Avoid this service

items.title: No tickets or timetable, and such high prices!
items.review_text: 1. Cannot plan ahead from Preston to London - no tickets, or even timetable available, even for a week ahead - why? 2. Had a look just a few days ahead to gauge prices and is £156 for an adult and child from Preston to London. How is this meant to encourage public transport travel? Terrible service and I hope that this terrible company lose the franchise quickly as we need a proper west coast service!

items.title: Compensation amount
items.review_text:
The 15th July was our Golden wedding and we had booked a cruise on the Queen Mary 2 from Southampton. We booked tickets from Carlisle changing at Wolverhampton 1st class all the way and looked forward to being fed and watered in comfort. Imagine our dismay when our train from Carlisle was cancelled resulting in us to reroute our journey through London which we wanted to avoid, going 2nd class as well. 
We therefore thought we must be due compensation, so Imagine our disappointment in only being offered £67.70 take it or leave it. We thought we might have got at least the difference between 1st and 2nd class prices, which was approx. £92. You can imagine our disappointment,  so not very happy with Avanti.

items.title: Absolutley disgraceful customer service…
items.review_text:
Absolutley disgraceful customer service who have been promising me since June that they will resolve my comolaint due to a horrific ordeal I faced due to a delay which left me for hours stranded with medical issues and led to being sexually harrassed by a drunk passenger.. it is now half way through September and still nothing even though they apologised three times that nothings been done and promised to get it resolved asap! 

Communication Related To AWC-CR-1426845.
 
I will now be taking the matter uo with the travel ombudsman!

items.title: It's disgusting expecting me and…
items.review_text: It's disgusting expecting me and fiancee to stand on a train between London Euston and stoke on Trent for two hours on the way there and on the way back because the train was packed and there was no where it sit plus the first train was cancelled on the way back, the train service is an absolute joke and don't get me started on the railway strikes.

items.title: Absolutely awful and despicable…
items.review_text: Absolutely awful and despicable service. Cancelled 2 days after booking and said we could get on another train but with free for all seats. No way with 2 toddlers as thats why we pre booked the seats. Getting refund from trainline and will never travel with avanti again. They need stripping of their franchise as not fit for purpose!!!!

items.title: I agree with all the other 1 star…
items.review_text: I agree with all the other 1 star reviews. I’d give no stars if I could. I booked return journey to London several weeks ago with reserved seats. On arrival at Manchester Piccadilly, both trains had been removed from the schedules. Thankfully I just made it onto an earlier train otherwise I would have been late. It was chaos. Announcer said all seat reservations were invalid. People stood in the aisles unable to sit down, arguing over seats as each seat had duplicate reservations. Exactly the same on the return journey. They should not have been given this franchise. Appalling ‘service’.

items.title: If I could give no stars I would
items.review_text: If I could give no stars I would. Our train to London was cancelled two days ago, removed from the schedule. I had to rebook at further expense  whilst waiting a week for a refund. My original journey was a direct train to London, my new journey has changes. Imagine my surprise win I arrived at the station today my cancelled train was departing from the station. Avanti need to have their contract removed.

items.title: Highly Recommend LNER!
items.review_text:
I travel to London every other week with work. I now travel 75 mins, one way, in the opposite direction to board the LNER service from Leeds to London. 

I no longer want to have to deal with not knowing what time I’ll arrive in London onboard Avanti, or whether I’ll even arrive at all. 

LNER provide a reasonably priced service whereby I’m guaranteed a seat for the entire journey because there seat reservations work. 

I categorically refuse to use the west coast mainline until Avanti are stripped of their franchise.

items.title: Avoid at all costs.
items.review_text: Always late, always crowded, seat reservations cancelled and ridiculously expensive. They get worse by the day, avoid at all costs.

items.title: Contempt for customers !
items.review_text:
Complete contempt for the customer !
Arrived at Euston no train no reservation, this was booked 12 weeks in advance, I can understand the need to alter timetables but they had my email address and they didn’t bother to let me know.
Why is your customer service so incompetent.

items.title: I am absolutely fuming
items.review_text:
I am absolutely fuming. I have a boat party to be at on the 23rd and u decide to be on strike so I can’t get home on the 24th. This is a joke. Do you want me to have a life or not. WHY JUST WHY
You BEST HAD book your ideas up

items.title: I bought two tickets online and…
items.review_text: I bought two tickets online and selected e-ticket. Only one e-ticket downloaded though and the second one did not. The booking system needs improving. The government should take control and develop one booking system for the whole of the UK.

items.title: Refunds not paid
items.review_text: train cancelled due to strikes. Waiting for over a month for refund. Call handler tried to mislead me by saying it hadn't yet been 20 days, pointed out it had been 22 days. Was promised email confirming refund processed same day. Of course no email received. Waited over an hour to have call picked up and have had to give up as got things to do... Absolutely pathetic. No responses to emails.

items.title: Angry
items.review_text:
Reserved seats cancelled two trains cancelled after ours. We were told it would be a free for all to get on the train.
Decided it was best in our circumstances to abort our visit to Liverpool. 
Very upset as this visit was to say our last goodbye to a very dear friend of over fifty years. 
We are absolutely disgusted with this company.

items.title: Daily nightmare!
items.review_text: A one rating is only because I had to rate!  Dreadful absolutely dreadful.  Everything is bad (timetable, customer service, wi-fi).  Worst experience ever and my only choice to London.  Wish we had not lost Virgin this is so so bad.

items.title: Still waiting for a refund after I had…
items.review_text: Still waiting for a refund after I had to abandon my journey due to trains being cancelled due to lack of staff (not industrial action). 40+ days and waiting.

items.title: Completely inadequately staffed and disorganised.
items.review_text:
I use this "service" once a week for my days working in the office. 

On 3rd August they cancelled my train. I am still waiting for the refund for this despite waiting in excess of the 30 days they state it might take.

 Presumably they have inadequate numbers of admin staff. They also have inadequate numbers of train crew - leading to a much publicised reduction in service. 

Since the new timetable has come into effect I have seen many problems where the same seats have apparently been double or treble booked. 

West Midlands Railway/London Northwestern Railway also serve my route so likely I will start booking with them instead rather than paying a premium for a supposedly faster but in reality often delayed service. -  But they also have terrible trust pilot reviews so wish me luck :-(

items.title: Awful trains, awful service
items.review_text:
Third time using them in two weeks.

9 and 11 car trains packed people in like sardines, air conditioning unable to cope with the massive demand placed on it by vast amounts of people. 

Trains dirty and outdated, standard class hasn’t changed since the trains were introduced.

Toilets stink (absolutely awful on Voyagers) and trains dirty.

The once great Virgin Trains seems to have fallen from grace to become Avanti. The best option is for them to lose the franchise. People are suffering whilst their profits presumably grow.

items.title: Trip to see Frozen
items.review_text: I booked from Rugby to Euston for my daughter in law and Granddaughter to travel and see Frozen. The female staff member at the station could not have been more helpful when I picked the tickets up as they had to reschedule due to manpower issues. As the trains were rescheduled it meant the reservations didn't count (no worries) I knew this as helpfully Avanti sends emails to keep you in the loop. So, the only staff member I met who was a jobs worth was at London Euston (on the home journey) who made me produce the printed reservations for a rescheduled train...which was pointless as I knew they were not valid... and irritating as they were buried in my rucksack, and it held up a queue behind me... he informed me they were not valid...so apart from him...excellent service and I would recommend them.

items.title: Today on the Wigan to Penrith line,
items.review_text:
Today on the Wigan to Penrith line,
I met a gentlemen conductor, The man is a hero! I will never know his name.

I had to leave Wigan for Edinburgh in a hurry, unfortunately I did not hold proof of any E-Ticket return (genuine reason).
I explain to the conductor my issue and hand him my phone to make his own decision at his discretion, He did not look at my phone/personal business.

He understood.

Unknown to him, my life was in danger.
 The conductor really saved my life.

I am home now. I am safe.

Who ever he was thanks for showing me sympathy, empathy and dignity.
He is a dying breed of man.

items.title: Overbooked standing room only train…
items.review_text: Overbooked standing room only train London to Manchester.

items.title: Bring back virgin
items.review_text: Bring back virgin. Every single seat was showing as available staff didn’t seem bothered

items.title: All I can plead is bring back Virgin
items.review_text:
All I can plead is bring back Virgin. These guys have destroyed timetables and services, stopped cleaning trains, made getting return tickets much harder.

I travel to London twice a week on this service, but wont anymore. I will be driving. In 10 years never had a train breakdown, but it seems 1 in 3 Avanti trains now apparantley  "breakdown"

items.title: Sort out your WiFi amongst other things...
items.review_text: Unfortunately I get the pleasure of travelling with this horrendous company weekly from Manchester to London. The WiFi on the train is virtually non existent which considering its 2022 and they charge such ridiculous fares is bizarre. The trains are often crowded and booking a seat doesn't guarantee you get a seat, so many occasions where the seat has been double booked. Sort out your WiFi! Positives is the train time between Manchester and London, 2 hours is great, and their train staff are great normally!

items.title: Please avoid!
items.review_text: No seat reservation confirmations on the overhead systems despite booking seat. 45 min delay to London. Generally awful. VIRGIN all is forgiven.

items.title: Avoid… worst company ever
items.review_text: Avoid… worst company ever. Always so damn late!!!!! Virgin had issues too but not this much… please can we get Virgin back???

items.title: I'd recommend looking at ANY other option for travel...
items.review_text:
Since Nov '21 I've been using Avanti West Coast due to working away from home.
During my time using them I don't think I've ever had a journey go according to plan, they're either on strike, or they just kick you off at a random station due to reasons that are never explained.
Reserved seats don't appear to matter, most of my trips the shop on board was closed.
They oversell tickets for a service that's lacking in any reliability. 
If you can, I would look at any other option before traveling with Avanti West Coast.

items.title: Find me a worse train company. I’ll wait
items.review_text: Honestly the worst experience lately. Been waiting over a month for tickets/timetables  to be posted for London to Glasgow and still aren’t. Travel dates are in 4 weeks and still can’t be told when I can purchase tickets. Had to cancel 3 work appointments already and really don’t want to cancel this one as it’s the list important but it’s looking likely :(

items.title: Sorry avanti 1st class is rubbish…
items.review_text: Sorry avanti 1st class is rubbish service is shocking  food not much choice. Virgin so much better than avanti. I hope the railways gets nationalised.just glad I didn't pay full price  just not worth the money

items.title: 0 stars. Epic Fail.
items.review_text:
Expensive fares, delays, frighteningly bumpy, smelly, dirty. Absolutely shocking.

Driving is cheaper despite diesel pushing £2/ltr and to be honest I would pay twice that to avoid this experience.

items.title: Somehow worse than Virgin
items.review_text: Prices have rocketed while the service has become almost unusable. Stop cancelling all the trains back to Liverpool on Sunday nights!

items.title: Would give 0 stars if I could!
items.review_text:
They don't respond to any reviews so this, like the company, will be a waste of time.
Cancelled my train, didn't let me know, had to get an earlier train that was more than double the price, have emailed them to ask to refund the difference. Guess what.....? No reply!
What a waste of time, money and effort.

items.title: Taking the shine out of train travel
items.review_text: Travelling by train should be stress free, enjoyable and better for the environment. Instead, when travelling with Avanti, it is anything but. I had booked online using Avanti's own website and yet when I arrived at Euston I was told my train had been retimetabled 20 minutes earlier(!) I had received no email or text to tell me. Luckily I had arrived with plenty of time so could just make the train, but if I had been elderly or with children I would have missed it, and I'm sure Avanti would blame me. For the return journey, nobody was on hand to open the bike store in the end carriage so I had to bang on the drivers window. The whole process is embarrassing and feels like rail travel has gone back to the 1970s. The trains are smelly and dated and the staff clearly have no pride in their work, they are all very downbeat and seem keen to catch you out or make you feel at fault. I am always somewhat anxious when travelling with Avanti because it seems so many things can (and do) go wrong.

items.title: How do you review a train company that won’t sell you a ticket
items.review_text: Imagine not being able to book a train between the two most important cities in the UK. And then imagine that you get absolutely zero response when contacting their customer support to ask why. The WORST train operator in the country and it’s a very low bar. Take the contract off them and nationalise the lot.

items.title: Shock horror, seats and punctuality.
items.review_text: Issues with seat reservations but train from Edinburgh to Carlisle and return journey both left and arrived on time and we got a seat. The sad thing is that in most other European countries this is the norm, but in this broken country, tends to be an exception. We were obviously lucky on this occasion, as can be seen from the majority of other negative reviews on here, but that was our experience.

items.title: Fantastic help when I accidentally got stuck on the train
items.review_text: While helping my daughter and grandson onto the train at Motherwell, I got stuck on board.  My own bags, including my phone and purse were on the platform at Motherwell, while the train set off for Carlisle.  The train guard quickly got in touch with colleagues at Motherwell who located my bags and kept them safe.  He then found out when was the next train back and arranged my return.  This included ensuring I was met at Carlisle and shown where I needed to catch the train back.  He also checked in on my daughter and grandson later in their journey.  Just excellent!

items.title: CHARGED TWICE
items.review_text:
They charged me twice. No customer service, still waiting also for a refund for a cancellation.

Are you striking? DO YOUR JOB

If I would drive, please don't hesitate. Mad.

items.title: Appalling Service From A Failed Monopoly
items.review_text:
I travel regularly from Manchester to London and the Avanti service just gets worse every time. I never understood how the Government could award a contract that made the service more expensive for the public. Since that award, it has been all down hill in my view. The service is more expensive, less reliable and less customer friendly than Virgin (ie dirty trains, stressed and unhelpful staff, online booking issues, train cancellations, etc.)

Recently, my partner and I needed to book a trip to London, but there were no advance tickets available just 4 weeks before travel. On a whim, I looked at going via Leeds and using the LNER line. What a revelation. LNER had trains available, the online booking process was simple and it was significantly cheaper than Avanti West Coast. Whilst it will take us well over 3 hours via this route, it will be cheaper overall (how should that be possible?!) and, based on LNER reviews, I am hopeful that it will be a pleasant journey. 

To our Government: please do something positive for the people you serve, sack Avanti West Coast and replace it with a competent operator.  Stop blaming drivers for not wanting to use their free time to shore up the company. How many of us would happily work regular weekends to keep a company going, and how would we feel if we decided to spend the weekend with our family or friends and had that labelled as "unofficial strike action"?  Employees are not slaves. Customers are not cash machines. Stop defending a failed monopoly and actually listen to the market that you are allegedly so fond of.

items.title: Prices have gone up 200-400%. Yes, really!
items.review_text:
A few months ago, a Liverpool to Euston advance return ticket was £70-90. Now it costs over £200. There are less trains and many aren’t fit for purpose. Avanti says it’s until 14 September, but tickets after that time are still at these inflated prices. For a service which is worse than ever.

Avanti sent me a discount code for 25%. I really appreciate they’re trying to help. But a 25% discount doesn’t make much difference when the fares are up 200-400%. 

A return with two advance singles Liverpool to Euston is £260 on 13 September. 

I’ve just got a new job working a day a week in London. This hike makes the travel literally unaffordable. I’ve already had to miss a week. I don’t know what’s going to happen.

items.title: Major train operator. No tickets a month in advance
items.review_text:
I want to buy a return ticket from Maidstone to Warrington, travelling  Mid Oct (It is 2nd of Sept now) I am told by the website I can't because the tickets are not yet released! What kind of cowboy travel company does not know when its trains are running a month before they are due to leave.
As far as I can see this tactic allows the operator to put on less trains, for more money (as we are constantly told, to get the best deals, we need to book well in advance) Come on Avanti,
Get your act together!

items.title: AVOID Avanti West Coast
items.review_text: Avanti West Coast don’t even deserve a 1 star rating. I have yet to see one of their trains actually arrive on the time stated on the ticket. There are CONSTANT delays on every single train journey I make. And the cancellations are even worse. Often trips are cancelled with less than an hours notice. Shocking shocking service.

items.title: Appalling company who are not fit for…
items.review_text: Appalling company who are not fit for purpose. Time First Group were sacked from the railway

items.title: I work for them.
items.review_text: I work for them, and it shouldn't be a surprise that my opinion reflects the one of general public. It's a downward spiral since Virgin Trains left the rail scene (although it wasn't perfect). It's a shame as I love my job. :(

items.title: First time I have ever travelled with…
items.review_text: First time I have ever travelled with them. There was a queuing system at Glasgow but the queue was so enormous, winding up and down the station concourse that I didn’t see the sign until after I’d been sitting near the destinations board for 40 mins. I didn’t worry though as I had a seat reservation. But on arriving at my seat I discovered some other passengers had been given the same reservations. This caused chaos as folks were double checking reservation tickets. The driver apologised as soon as we set off so they were obviously aware of the issue. Not an impressive start for me as a passenger new to the company. Don’t offer a reservation system if you can’t ensure it can be run efficiently!!!

items.title: 28th August 2022 Crewe to Dumfries
items.review_text:
28th August, my train was delayed by a total of 40 minutes. 31 minutes late at Crewe and a further 10-15 mins late at Preston due to having to wait for a 'Train Manager' to arrive???? 
This meant I missed the last connection train to Dumfries. I was not provided with any forward journey information and there were no staff available at any point during the 2hr journey to ask. When I initially asked what the situation was when arriving at Carlisle as I was stranded, it was suggested I 'get a bus in town'. I find this quite shocking as a woman in an unfamiliar town and travelling alone at night. 
To the staff members credit, when I questioned this advice they arranged a taxi for me. As if all that wasn't enough, throughout the journey, there was a group of young men causing disruption confronting members of the public throughout the carriages. I've never experienced such a sressful journey.

items.title: Bring back Virgin/Anyone
items.review_text: Wifi never works, at seat order never works. They 'removed seat reservations' on the train meaning I couldn't sit in the £100 seat I booked... honestly, just drive if you can.

items.title: Cancelled scheduled services.
items.review_text:
Cancelled scheduled services stating engineering works. Then you check out planed works and there are none!
Basically cramming the maximum number of passengers on the fewest number of trains.

items.title: Problems with seat reservations and timetables
items.review_text:
I travel from Birmingham to London every few weeks to see my partner, going to London on the Friday and returning on the Sunday. I have been doing this for a while and have never had any real issues until recently.
