The issues started a few months back when the seat reservations frequently wouldn't work. Seats would either not say whether they were reserved or not, or all seats said reserved from Edinburgh which is obviously incorrect. This caused me problems as I would often find someone in my seat and on a few occassions I couldn't get them to move. This may not seem like a huge issue, but I make sure I prebook my seat as I have luggage and want to be able to settle during my journey. When someone is in my reserved seat and I have to find another random seat, it means I sometimes then get asked to move midway through my journey or spend the whole journey not being able to fully relax or concentrate on whatever I'm doing because I'm trying to stay aware in case I am in someone's seat, which isn't ideal especially if I am trying to do some work on the train. My partner also frequently has the same issue with seat reservations.

Last time I travelled, as well as the usual seat reservation issues on the way down, I also had a problem coming back because when I came to travel I realised my booked train was not showing on the board. This was really quite a worry as I needed to get home to be able to go to work the next day and I didn't know what was going on. I did manage to get booked onto another train by going to the ticket desk, but I ended up arriving an hour later than I should have which was not ideal when I needed to be up early the next day and was relying on people to pick me up at the station when I arrived. I was told it was because the timetable had changed, but I had no communication about this whatsoever and had only booked my ticket a week or two in advance.

Today I have tried to book a ticket for the coming weekend, but I can't because the timetable hasn't been confirmed yet. The day I am trying to book for is less than a week away, so I really would expect it to be confirmed by now. I have plans for the weekend so I really need to know what time I will be able to get there (or if I can even get there at all) so that I can confirm these plans. I'm also concerned that the longer I have to wait for the timetable, the more expensive my ticket is likely to be.

Never used to have any issues with Avanti so not sure why things seem to keep going wrong for me lately. Hoping things improve soon.

Oh and the at seat food/drink ordering never works, always just says "not available at the moment"...

items.title: Still waiting for compensation
items.review_text:
Still waiting for compensation for a cancelled train from March of this year.  Avanti claim a cheque was issued on 23/6 but it never arrived. 25/7 I was told they had cancelled the cheque and requested a new one be issued.  Still nothing despite my writing a reminder on 11/8 and 29/8.
Awful customer service, their franchise should be cancelled.

items.title: My son is traveling to Australia today
items.review_text: My son is traveling to Australia today to work there as a doctor for a year, and my wife and I are traveling with him to the airport to say goodbye. At Crewe rail station, however, most trains are cancelled or delayed, including ours. Pathetic service. Update, we are currently on a train to Wilmslow where we have to change for Manchester Airport. Don't know if we will be in time to make our connection. Shocking service! Update, We arrived at Winslow 20 minutes late and just missed the connection to Manchester Airport. The next train is due an hour later! We decided to take a taxi which added £16 to our travel costs, but got us to the airport in 3 minutes. Update, On the return journey, my wife and I caught the train to Wilmslow, only to find that the connection to Crewe had been cancelled due to "insufficient staff." Update, When we finally got on a train, it was completely packed, with no windows, on a red hot day! Avanti and Northern line are incredibly bad and have no concern for their passengers. The whole experience was traumatic and very upsetting, especially on such an important day for our son and for us.

items.title: Cancelled train
items.review_text: Cancelled train, delays to inbound and return journey to Manchester. Avanti, you are shambles. I cannot wait for your contract to end...

items.title: Last minute decision to upgrade! Try it.
items.review_text:
Last minute decision to upgrade. So glad I did!
Thank you Robert for making this an exceptional journey! You looked after me from Euston to Scotland and it was enjoyable all the way. 
If you can afford to travel first class, even once, it's worth it.

items.title: 3 of the same seat booked for 3…
items.review_text: 3 of the same seat booked for 3 different people. People standing and over sold tickets. Angry and stressed people so wasn’t a nice atmosphere.

items.title: My needs are covered
items.review_text: I understand there are areas that need massively improving, but for my needs it’s all been okay, great customer service via Facebook messenger, fast, efficient & informative.

items.title: These utterly useless halfwits can not…
items.review_text: These utterly useless halfwits can not run a train service.  Nothing to do with the crew.  Entirely the management.  Just cancelled my journey two days before travel for no reason given.  It is because they haven't hired the staff to man the trains.  Country is going to the dogs, and Avanti is leading the way.  Couldn't run a model railway.

items.title: Horrendous experience - avoid
items.review_text: Horrendous experience. Cancelled trains booked months in advance - no other direct trains but wouldn’t let me travel via London instead. Refused to refund the hotel which I now cannot get to - left £100s out of pocket. Shocking experience

items.title: Crooks!
items.review_text: Booked advance train to Euston. Train cancelled. Went to the office in Stockport. Told refund would have to be handled by delay repay and takes four weeks. Emailed them direct and explained this was a cancelled train booked directly through them and I should be able to get a refund without waiting. 5 weeks now, still waiting for my money back. Absolutely disgusting service. Come back virgin, all is forgiven! Now left with no option but to go through the ombudsmen.

items.title: Poor experience
items.review_text: Firstly, our outbound train was cancelled which created a whole domino affect on our whole trip. We had to get on an earlier train that was, thankfully, not cancelled and on time. The train journey itself was pleasant with a shop on board, it was quiet and there were outlet ports to charge devices. We were lucky to get an unreserved seat due to the train being fairly busy. I requested for a refund of my return ticket almost 3 weeks ago now and still have heard nothing back from anyone when I paid £60 for these tickets. Today, 3 weeks later, I have had to request another refund and £20 had been taken off my amount as an “admin fee”. I shall not be travelling with this company ever again

items.title: Just dreadful
items.review_text: Just dreadful. Cancellations and delays every step of the way, an hour into the journey before the shop opens and then it's cash only. Group of Avanti employees slouching about doing nothing like bored teenagers, loudly effing and blinding in earshot of passengers at Euston added to the ambience of a company who couldn't care less about the customer. Refurbished seats are very high backed, making the Pendolinos feel even more claustrophobic than they were and the 'wings' on the headrests get very uncomfortable after 30 minutes or so-and which idiot decided to upholster them in a pale gray off white fabric?! Car every time from now-and this is from someone who is a lifelong train enthusiast and who takes environmental issues seriously-fed up of being treated like an animal by the UK rail industry.

items.title: Amazing customer service, poor follow-through.
items.review_text:
EDIT: Originally gave 5 stars but have changed this to one.

After my original train was cancelled, I called their customer service line twice, once two days ago and then again today and both times spoke to charming, on-the-ball representatives who quickly understood my issue and seemed to be doing everything in their power to help. 

However, when I actually arrived at the train station and followed the customer representatives instructions, nothing had been arranged the way I was told it would be. When I went to collect my tickets and new reserved seats for the train I was re-booked on after my train was cancelled, I was given tickets to my old (now non-existent) train in my old reserved seats. This meant that the elderly people I was helping to get seats together ended up being scattered across the trains and carriages (when we had originally had 4 seats together) which made travelling an absolute nightmare. We had no method of proving that we had new reserved seats on the new scheduled train as I was promised by customer service we would. 

This ended up causing a lot of distress, fear and a panic attack among the group of seniors I was accompanying. 

Would not recommend.

items.title: Was supposed to be travelling to…
items.review_text: Was supposed to be travelling to Manchester for the weekend but Avanti kindly cancelled my train with no alternative. They advised I could book the next available train but they held off all their online bookings for that weekend. Tried calling them but I was 64th in the queue. Obviously everyone else had the same frustration. Refunded me quick but it's no consolation because I had to cancel my entire plans.

items.title: Zero stars
items.review_text: Zero stars. Awful service ridden with last minute delays, simply because they won’t employ their staff properly and rely on overtime and working voluntary days off. Lying about the reasons; this is  nothing to do with the strikes & has been happening for at least a year. They are running down a once decent service between the north and London. Meanwhile their boss gets a big fat million quid bonus. Absolute BS.

items.title: Train was over 2 hours late
items.review_text: Train was over 2 hours late, no refunds!

items.title: We want to give a 5* review to your…
items.review_text: We want to give a 5* review to your member of staff Mark!!! We met Mark at the station at Preston, Lancashire. We are on the 4pm (ish) train from Preston to Euston on 19th August. My friend ran down the steps to speak to him and she immediately felt at ease. Mark was very approachable and so helpful when we were confused about what train we could get on with our ticket !! On board the train we sat close to the managers station - from here we could see how knowledgeable he is and how dedicated he is to his job. He looks very smart and is a credit to your organisation. 22 years he has been doing this job and we think he deserves some recognition !! X from Ellen and Jade

items.title: If I could give zero stars I would
items.review_text: If I could give zero stars I would. Train over an hour late. Still waiting for compensation 30 days later. Conflicting advice given by customer service agents who have no ability to actually help they just read info from a screen. Feel helpless. Is there no pride in customer service anymore?

items.title: Horrendous company
items.review_text: Horrendous company. Logged 2 complaints and after beimg on hold for over an hour twice finally managed to speak to manager. No apology from him for the lack of safety of my 5 year old son when travelling. Having to balance him on a suitcase in the coridoor and have him sat next to the door on my lap of a fast moving train all due to over booking and cancellations. No apolgy for this. Asled for a full refund and was promised it had been processed only to find out it hadn't been. No call back even after I asked for 2. I have recorded all conversations and will be taking legal action and taking this to the media. Your lack of concern for the safety of your passengers is disgusting. I will never travel with avanti again and I will do my absolyte best to ensure hundreds of others don't either.

items.title: Dreadful train service
items.review_text: Dreadful train service. Frequently late, always smelly and the website is not user friendly at all. Bring back virgin….

items.title: Bring back British Rail
items.review_text: We booked twice to go from Kendal to Carlisle.  Avanti cancelled three trains.  So we never were able to make the journey.  Very unreliable train company.  The problem with privatisation is that if you are unlucky enough to book Avanti trains you are not allowed to travel on any other company's ones.  It is a complete and utter disaster.  Bring back British Rail so at least there is a more cohesive network and more choice of trains.

items.title: 3rd rate company running a 3rd world train service
items.review_text: Going to old trafford for cricket end of August. 8 of us few days cricket, hotel, etc all booked and Avanti just cancelled train with recommendation to rebook. Unable to find anything on website and been holding 90mins on telephone. Coordinated staff shortages and people not prepared to work overtime is reason. This has completely buggered our weekend. Avanti suggest you need to employ more staff not rely on the goodwill of staff to work overtime. 3rd rate company running a 3rd world train service. Absolute disgrace and whoever gave them the franchise should be held to account. You are taking a massive risk if you travel by train in the current environment, instead knacker the environment and drive.

items.title: The worst of the worst
items.review_text: They cancelled our pre booked seating and let anyone sit in our seats. All without prior notice. I really hope they go out of business and another train service provider turns up. At times like this I wish Virgin Trains was still around.

items.title: Utterly shambolic
items.review_text: Utterly shambolic. Bought an off peak only to be told it was on a specific train so couldn't travel home. Rude staff who misadvised me to get another train that would have left me stranded in Crewe all night. Thankfully, Euston ticketing team put me straight. Unprofessional, disinterested staff who couldn't give a toss.

items.title: Appalling service
items.review_text: Absolutely shocking service from Avanti West Coast today. Have been delayed for three hours in Preston for a train to Glasgow, and have been moved to three different trains in the meantime which have each been delayed and then cancelled. The team manning our train were already working overtime and while the staff at the station at Preston have been very helpful in the horrendous circumstances they have been left to deal with, I am appalled at how this has been communicated by Avanti themselves on the website - disgraceful treatment of your staff and customers.

items.title: Horrible, horrible staff
items.review_text:
Horrible staff. Rude. Racist. Accusatory. F*cked up mindset. Treats customers like animals. Derogatory. Patronising. Did I mention RACIST. Accusatory. 

Most recently a staff who stood there doing nothing didn’t even look at me in the eye and even sighed when I asked if a particular train went a particular place. He did not reply. Just pointed in a general direction with 2 different trains on different platforms… WHAT THE F

Wished Virgin was still operating.

AVANTI is disgusting from its name to its core. Hope it just goes out of business along with its staff. Disdainful.

items.title: Ramshackle
items.review_text:
Travelling for work to Wales today.  Avanti did tell me that my train was cancelled , so I had to leave on an earlier service to get to a meeting 
This meant I was back at the station earlier than my pre booked return train 
Long discussion with train manager who said o had to stick to my return  time , even though her train was near empty 
I sat on the 250 for 50 minutes , but it wasn’t direct like my ticket said and as a result still not yet back in London 
I’ve never met such a unified workforce willing to tell passengers quite freely that things are rubbish , and they plainly are. 
I’ve complained to them , I’ve done delay repay - but judging by how many terrible reviews are on here , they’ve probably rather a mountain to get through 
Just awful !

items.title: Absolute rubbish
items.review_text: Absolute rubbish.  This rail business is a joke. All about cost saving. Nothing  to do with providing an actual service to the people.  Ridiculous ticket prices, RIDICULOUS service, not enough staff. Nationalise the service so that it works for customers rather than lazy shareholders. I would give zero stars if I could. Grant shaps has  no idea, but not surprising given what he represents.

items.title: 5h delay here's £13 :)
items.review_text:
2h delay and the announcer just announced he knows nothing 😂😂😂😂😂😂😂😂😂😂😂😂😂

ended up being a 5h delay and they offered me £13 in compensation for a £99 ticket 🤣🤣🤣😂🤣🤣🤣😂

items.title: Unreliable
items.review_text: One of my legs has been cancelled from Preston to Oxenholme then returning a few days later Penrith to Preston when I have 2 further changes (both ways) to get to my destination so I am frantically trying to make a booking to be able to get to my friends 18th birthday celebrations. I have only discovered by chance as I didn't even get an email confirmation but when I looked to check the details on my phone I noticed the 3rd and 1st legs were just showing cancelled. It is so difficult for me to get there to begin with and I am unable to get there by National Express, Mega bus or Flix Bus.  Looking likely my trip may have to be cancelled.  Even if I can find alternative tickets looking at the next few days which you can book at the moment they are substantially more expensive than my original booking so no doubt my dates will be the same when I can book next week. As a 17 year reliant on public transport this is upsetting and annoyed is not the word!

items.title: Bring back Virgin Rail
items.review_text: Bring back Virgin Rail. They knew how to run a rail service.

items.title: Worst train experience ever.
items.review_text:
Worst train experience ever.
My family and I were traveling from Windermere - Oxenholme - Edinburgh via Avanti. While we were on our way to the Windermere station, we realized we could not find our later train to Edinburgh on any of the time tables. It had been cancelled with no notification or follow up or anything. We managed to find a train from Oxenholme to Edinburgh with a stop in Glasgow. The train was 20 minutes delayed with no explanation. While we were told the train was going to be busy, it was packed beyond belief (if only they hadn't cancelled a bunch of other trains...). Most coaches were entirely full when they arrived at the station and many people had to stand in the aisles for multiple hours. The icing on the cake was it was a heatwave, and we were packed like sardines in a metal tube with little to no airconditioning, suffering for hours straight. 

In short: Avanti likes to cancel trains at the last minute with no notice, even when you do get on a train, it is a hellish experience. I sympathize with all the Avanti workers who are doing their best in these times but I think the higher ups at Avanti need to change their priorities: supporting their workers so they don't need to strike, and running more trains (or at least all the trains they had scheduled).

I'll be avoiding Avanti at all costs in the future.

items.title: Worst train company
items.review_text: They never run a trouble free service from Glasgow to Euston on Sundays because their drivers can't be bothered to work. Their customers are treated abysmally on a regular basis. No apology at the ticket office from company staff for cancellations. Trains are filthy and never on time. Why does this company still have a license to operate? Oh and HVAC system leaking massive amounts of water over everyone - staff member response to wet laptops phones and clothes "nothing we can do I'm afraid" - shouldn't be in customer service with that attitude.

items.title: Shocking and far worse than Virgin were
items.review_text:
Tickets for a 50 minute return off peak journey are over £70 a time even on advanced tickets. For that you get cramped, dirty, late trains, often cancelled at late notice due to lack of staff. Currently on a train with no working a/c on a very hot day. Last week the a/c discharged litres of water over me. 

Bear in mind that while we travellers are suffering from the incompetence of the train operators in the UK, someone somewhere is still making a profit. This is how privatisation works.

Edit: it's now impossible to get a day return from Rugby to London (less than an hour's journey) for the foreseeable future for less than £150 for standard class.

items.title: Appalling cramped
items.review_text: Appalling cramped, overcrowded, no power sockets.  Definitely a run for profit and not for passengers business.

items.title: Apalling website no real trains just…
items.review_text: Apalling website no real trains just cobbling together other companies 8 hrs 4 changes are you mad why cant we get a straight through train anymore like with virgin. Connection missed when going to funeral, put in taxi at 2 am in morning for last stretch. Arrived very late so extra stress. What a joke. How are they getting away with this. Can’t afford to go away anymore. Broken Britain.

items.title: Lovely staff, great trains
items.review_text: Lovely staff, the train are lovely and comfortable to ride on, and the accommodation was amazing. Keep it up avanti!

items.title: Awful Journey
items.review_text: Stopped using trains regulaly years ago  and now travel only when I have to on them. I an Avanti West Coast used one for a return trip to London this week (Aug 8th to 12th 2022). Going out train was overcrowded and air con faulty but coming back was even worse. It was the hottest day of the year (33 degrees) Cramped, NO air con, and this was blamed on it being to hot for it to work properly (Countries like Kuwait cope where it gets far hotter). The wi fi was not working (both ways), Then in the middle of nowhere, it stopped for 35 mins because the tracks ahead were to hot. I was literally covered in sweat and it was very, very, very uncomfortable. Its not cheap ( a standard single costs more than taking a car) but it was an abysmal experience. Forget building all these high speed rail links for the rich and instead spend money on existing services that us average people can enjoy comfortably and get rid of this joke of a company.

items.title: A terrible service and very hot carriage (not in the good way)
items.review_text:
I hate the pre booked seatings in a Avanti no one follows them and not having a pre booked seat is a nightmare . It’s 32 C outside but inside this carriage it’s almost 50 C . May god help me survive this nightmare. 

The seats are dirty and the foldable table is very squeaky. 
At least the crew are nice gave me free water.

items.title: Disgusting
items.review_text: Bought tickets in good faith several weeks ago for a minibreak in London only for them inexplicably cancel my trains there and back due to them suddenly deciding (without explanation) to run a 'reduced service' for the last two weeks in August- can't get tickets for a different train because they are all sold out.  Waiting times for customer service - 30 mins, still holding ... Can't quite believe that a company could offer such a terrible service and still be allowed to opperate.

items.title: Terrible trains.
items.review_text: Terrible trains, my booked train was cancelled due to a fault, then next was delayed by 1hr due to a fault, then broke on the journey (being fixed by being switched off and on again) resulting over an hour of further delays, so got back to London 3hrs 15 later than I'd booked to at 1.45am. Staff were friendly, felt very sorry for them.

items.title: Not to be relied on
items.review_text: a company which doesn't even have a timetable for the current month; why did it get the franchise?

items.title: So bad looks like in stone aged
items.review_text:
So bad looks like in stone aged 
No Ac no water 
No sockets to charged 
Food horrible this service needs to shut down asap

items.title: Greedy Greedy Bar Stewards
items.review_text:
How bad does it have to get before this company are kicked out?
Ripping people off and providing an awful service along the way. 
They're no doubt trying to recoup the dip in profits through Covid before they disappear. 
We're witnessing a live scandal and our Govt are doing absolutely nothing about it. The country is on its backside and there doesn't seem to be anyone capable of steering the train in the right direction.

items.title: Awful
items.review_text: Awful. So many cancellations every day. I'm going to drive to London from now on as the service is unreliable beyond belief.

items.title: Cancelled trains
items.review_text: Cancelled trains, and the service has increased massively in price since Avanti took over from Virgin. How is it more expensive and still worse??

items.title: Appalling First Class service
items.review_text:
Avanti have run the previously excellent Virgin First Class service into the ground, IMO. 

Avanti First Class is a seriously expensive product, yet the amount of accommodation on Pendolinos is often less than half what it was under Virgin. On one occasion, it was nothing more than the few seats next to the kitchen, with the rest of the First Class carriages being classified as Standard Premium (I assume to grab additional on-train revenue from passengers paying an at-seat supplement). 

The last train I caught from Manchester to London was declassified around Macclesfield. Ahead of that, orders were taken in First Class for breakfast - but the breakfast never arrived! Nor did anything else; not even a bottle of water. Incredibly, there was no announcement to say the promised breakfast would not be delivered.

I sat in the carriage next to the kitchen and there was no shortage of staff. There were no passengers standing in First Class, either in the carriages or the vestibules. And, even if the policy is to suspend service when a train is declassified, there can be no excuse at all for not letting passengers know that.

What I experienced, was, by any standard, a shockingly bad way to treat those who bought tickets on the basis that a promised level of service will be provided.

If this wasn't bad enough, it was more or less the same on my return journey. A kitchen full of staff, who didn't deliver any service at all in First Class.

Avanti are running a monopoly rail service from Manchester. I think it's time for the Department of Transport to look at how they are doing that.

items.title: Absolutely awful
items.review_text: Absolutely awful! Filthy carriages, uncomfortable. Covid hotbeds! Trains constantly delayed or cancelled. Avanti blame it on the strikes but it's their own incompetence. They need taking over by a better company.

items.title: I want to give 0. No space for pushchairs, wheelchairs. They expect maybe 5 luggage on 100 customers. No friendly staff, no help, last time travel with this company😵.
items.review_text: I want to give 0. No space for pushchairs, wheelchairs. They expect maybe 5 luggage on 100 customers. No friendly staff, no help, last time travel with this company😵.

items.title: Would have put no stars but not an…
items.review_text: Would have put no stars but not an option. The train was cancelled last minute so we had 5 minutes notice to get on an earlier train. Only by luck we were at Euston station in time. My friend who has severe arthritis i hsd to leave to run to try and get seats as there were not enough for everyone but they wouldnt let anyone sit in first class. The aircon didn't work so it was roasting hot, the staff were completly unhelpful and couldn't care less, some of the toilets on the train were out of order. We ordered food to our seats the app accepted the  order and took payment but nothing came. When i went to investige i was told the app wasnt working or if it was it had probably sent the order to the wrong train and somebody else would be eating it. Not helpful and not the first time this has happened. Bring back Virgin Trains i never had any problems with that francise

items.title: Disappointing experience causing more expenses and time wasting
items.review_text: I am very disappointed with the service Avanti West Coast give. On our 2 weeks holiday un the UK we experienced 3 disruptions to our journeys, which we had planned months in advance. One cancellation on our journey from Cannock to London Euston and on the  way back, and finally on our way to Glasgow from Stafford, which was notified 10 hours in advance (I received an email at 9pm). It basically feels like if you are planning to travel with Avanti and you have an Advanced ticket, you might as well just keep an eye on your phone every 10 min to make sure your train hasn’t been cancelled.

items.title: And so the incompetence continues
items.review_text:
Train departed Euston last evening, late, and managed to get later by the mile, arriving Birmingham at least half an hour late, which meant I missed my connection, arriving home midnight.
The train was for Preston but was cancelled at Wolverhampton, good luck to anyone left stranded.
These things run on rails for goodness sake! Our rail system is broken, and Avanti are not fit for purpose.

items.title: No outline of non refunds even with…
items.review_text: No outline of non refunds even with insurance cover , also bad times won't use again rather get a bus

items.title: Obnoxious customer service
items.review_text: Wife at Crewe, train cancelled, just been told by staff to "get on any F******g" train". Perhaps their Customer services Director would like to reply?

items.title: Up Schitt’s Creek
items.review_text: Have been left stranded in Carlisle on a Sunday night as the train to Edinburgh was cancelled last minute. No alternative transport provided. Announcement said we “may be entitled to refund”, but what about the expense of staying overnight? Awful service.

items.title: What a bunch of clowns trains cancelled…
items.review_text: What a bunch of clowns trains cancelled or always late if you can get there by another means I suggest you do save yourself some grief

items.title: Literally on the train back from London…
items.review_text: Literally on the train back from London now and there is no air con, feels like we're in a sauna! Everyone is melting. There is NO Internet connection on the WiFi? But not before they take all of your personal information to connect! On the way to London we paid for reserved seating and the train was so packed it was a free for all. People were sat in our seats and wouldn't move and then we spent the rest of the journey being asked to move out of people's seats. No point paying for reserved seating Horrendous service.

items.title: Absolutely amazing service …
items.review_text: Absolutely amazing service at Glasgow ticket office. Lady called Monique helped us out to change our tickets and got us on  earlier train. This was our second journey with AWC and it was such a relief after being let down by British airways a couple of times during one long trip.

items.title: One of the worst long distance services in the UK
items.review_text: Cramming passengers into less carriages in order to tempt them into paying for standard premium is a terrible idea - free up your carriages and return to a two fare structure instead of cramming everyone into select carriages

items.title: CAN NOT RELY ON AVIVA. First Worst
items.review_text: Thirty minutes on Carlisle Station and one train cancelled, one over Thirty late and my train over forty-five late. No staff the excuses this time.

items.title: Terrible service
items.review_text: Hour before we were due to travel to london our train is cancelled , refund in 28 days , you cancelled not me and you took the money immediately, you then wanted to charge me one and a half times more than i paid for my original return journey to go one way twenty minutes later , robbing batsrads .

items.title: My train was delayed over 2 hours and I…
items.review_text: My train was delayed over 2 hours, however I got a full refund.

items.title: Terrible service and frustrating experience.
items.review_text: If there was less than one star I’d give it. I’m writing this review as a regular commuter into London Euston and have noticed the stark difference between the ‘service’ offered now compared to about 3 years ago. I agree with many of the other 1* reviews recently posted here. The trains are filthy - I don’t think the toilets or carpets are regularly cleaned. I find this amazing as we are coming out of a pandemic… The cancellations at short notice and long delays are already very frustrating on a daily basis as a commuter, and the fact that the Avanti staff also have no idea what train is coming when is just ridiculous. The price of tickets has risen astronomically for service that’s worse than ever. Their customer service and IT is also not fit for purpose. The app doesn’t work, getting hold of someone to make a complaint or resolve a problem is impossible. Whether or not you like Richard Branson, Virgin Trains West Coast ran an excellent service. It’s long been my opinion that Trenitalia took over to run it into the ground and take off with the profit, no doubt with members of our lovely government pocketing a share. I feel sorry for Avanti staff, who are certainly going to get the worst deal of all.

items.title: Total shambles of a rail company
items.review_text: Been notified train to London on 6 August cancelled and to rebook on earlier or later train Tried to do this only to find all alternative trains SOLD OUT even on Friday night How are people expected to travel on a shambles of a rail service provided by Avanti About time the railways were renationalised instead of most of the money going to foreign companies and shareholders

items.title: Simply Appalling
items.review_text:
As a regular rail traveller to Euston over many years it hard to believe Avanti were approved as a credible option to replace Virgin. The service, staff demeanour, toilets are a disgrace, carriage are barely clean, WI-FI never works, neither do reserved seats, regular delays to the timetable - on every level they are simply appalling. I now look to use other modes of transport wherever possible as it is now just an unpleasant experience- I am talking about Standard Premium and First Class!
If there was an option to highlight less than 1 star I would have.

items.title: Terrible service.
items.review_text:
Terrible service.
1st class train ticket purchased euston to birmingham international to be standing the whole way.
Why take the money when all seats are taken.
(Family of 6 )
No food or hot drinks available either.

items.title: If I could rate it a zero I…
items.review_text: If I could rate it a zero I would,overpacked trains, that smell of poo,people changing there sprogs on the table for everyone to see,they might aswel not have a shop it's that crap and has nothing ,why did avanti bother taking over If there so crap ,bring back virgin trains I say

items.title: Disgusting train operator
items.review_text: I've used Avanti west Coast twice in the same week and both times the train was delayed first time was over 40 minutes the second time was nearly 20 minutes most of the seats had double-booked reservations the coaches are hot and stuffy made me feel sick and when there's no seats they ask you to pay extra to use another coach instead of making all the coaches standard class

items.title: Constant cancellations at short notice
items.review_text: Constant cancellations at short notice. Constant stress with Avanti not knowing whether train is actually going to get you there and back. So many cancellations and such high prices for tickets. How can this be allowed?

items.title: I think Avanti is one of the worst…
items.review_text: I think Avanti is one of the worst service providers - not just trains - in the U.K. Ever since they took over the brilliant Virgin West Coast, approximately 90% of services I’ve travelled on have had cancellations or delays. They shouldn’t be able to either continue to charge the extortionate ticket prices or operate on our train network. Shameful decision and shameful way of providing a service.

items.title: good train operating company
items.review_text:
i've travelled with avanti west coast 3 times! first time was with my mum on 24th october 2020 from london to stoke-on-trent with a return on 27th october 2020. due to restrictions at the time, we were randomly allocated seats based on our preferences. for the journey towards stoke-on-trent, we were allocated a forward facing table but for the train back home, my mum was sat somewhere else while i was sat at a forward facing airline style seat.

second time was on 29th june 2022 from london to birmingham new street on my own in first class. food was great! for the journey towards birmingham, i had "the great british breakfast" which consisted of black pudding, sausage, bacon, egg, mushroom and tomato. for the journey back home to london, i had a ham and cheese toastie in first class.

third time was on 15th july 2022 to birmingham again but in standard class. sadly, the onboard shop was cash only due to the card reader not working. also, no at-seat service is available on the voyagers.

tip: when booking with avanti west coast, you can tell the voyager and pendolino seating layouts apart. standard premium is only available on the pendolinos, alongside the at-seat order. if you can't see any standard premium tickets available then this will mean that standard premium is sold out or the type of train used is a voyager. however, the former is highly unlikely as not everybody is able to afford standard premium or first class. if you are able to, you can upgrade to standard premium onboard the train which can vary between £15 and £30, depending on the duration of your journey

what can i say? everything with avanti west coast went smoothly with no delays! i would definitely recommend avanti west coast again, irrespective of travel class!

items.title: The worst rail company the UK has ever…
items.review_text: The worst rail company the UK has ever had. I travel frequently and delays, cancellations and train overcrowding is their business as usual business model. They also have rubbish customer service and ignore complain emails. Their “delay repay” system doesn’t work and unless your willing to spend a year on the phone hounding them, no refund will come your way.

items.title: Appalling
items.review_text: Appalling, both ways from Manchester to Euston were over booked and seats double booked, no one on board to sort mess out at all discussing, no care for passengers whatsoever

items.title: Friendly staff, very informative
items.review_text: Friendly staff, great commentary and information from train managers given the circumstances of the strikes. We were travelling from Birmingham to Edinburgh return, with two small children. Tickets were seated separately which was frustrating but peoples kindness and understanding helped! The way back was very busy, and baggage areas full, but we expected that. The train was 32 mins late arriving in Edinburgh and Compensation was given and was easy to process - something we have never been offered with any delayed plane!

items.title: I returned my tickets to CREWE Station…
items.review_text: Returned my tickets to CREWE Station because of high temperatures I could not take my disabled daughter to London for 3 days - she would have not coped.  The Staff at the ticket office were very helpful and registered with Avanti - they retained my tickets at the booking office. I did get some obscure email giving me a number reference THEN another email with ANOTHER REFERENCE?  It is impossible to use their phone contact and the website is completely useless  THE CHAT is hopeless!  How do I check if I am going to get a refund?  I want to re-book my daughter is very distressed about the cancellation of our trip to London   I WANT TO REBOOK?

items.title: awful awful awful
items.review_text:
awful awful awful

A very sad company that I wish didn't exist. Railways in this country are a national disgrace compared to France/Germany/Japan. Nationalise the rail and get rid of the torys, they created this company and they created this mess

items.title: Constant cancellations and delays
items.review_text: Week after week they cancel trains whilst you're at the station, no advanced warning. Hour long delays every single week. This is by far the worst railway company I have ever encountered.

items.title: I cannot tell you how bad Avanti West…
items.review_text:
I cannot tell you how bad Avanti West Coast are . The delay compensation website has clearly been designed by a three year old on a fisher price kids computer . Trains cancelled and delayed all day yesterday due to a fatality somewhere between Manchester and London which although is awful , does it really need the trains to be delayed and cancelled ALL day ? 

I spent hours trying to get though to someone to help me with getting compensation for the service but in the end I just gave up  - which is probably what it’s designed to do anyway .

The only good thing was the first class product .

items.title: I traveled on the day after train…
items.review_text: I traveled on the day after train strike but felt I had to recommend commentator on 17.53 from Preston for being cheery and helpful in his announcements and ensuring all knew the best options for them . Thank you in difficult times

items.title: Nappy change on the table in 1st
items.review_text:
Bought two first class tickets only to have them move families with young children in from standard who proceeded to scream and cry nonstop. Moved to another carriage in first only to witness an Arab family change a baby's nappy on the table adjacent to us. The mother then took the dirty nappy and threw it on the floor out by the lavatories 
Use this train as cattle class in any class and beware that you'll probably waste your money buying first as people will be moved from standard as it becomes standing room only.

Will be braving easyJet next time which is cheaper and much faster.

Saw no member of staff at any point. No one checked our ticket. Train was a free-for-all.

items.title: Absolute joke of a service…
items.review_text: Journey up Euston-Glasgow 1st class absolutely shocking! No hot food and the staff abandoned us on the train half way through the journey 🤷‍♂️ Now on the return leg and even worse. Stuck in Preston as apparently “Avanti west regrets to inform you we currently do not have a driver”. Honestly, you couldn’t make this up. Worst service Co in the UK by a mile.

items.title: Stick with booking on thetrainline.com
items.review_text: Impossible to change email address on account settings. Utterly inflexible system whereby once you've created an account and bought a ticket it is in no way possible to change your email address! Unbelievable. Now I have bought train tickets for an email account I can no longer access and according to customer services, the only way to resolve it is is to buy another ticket, and then try and claim a refund for the original ticket, and then set up a new account. I thought in 2022 things were supposed to be easier? Bring back Virgin Trains - we never had these problems before. From now on I will stick with the trainline.com

items.title: Worst train company ever
items.review_text: Worst train company ever. Trains are always running late, they're overcrowded and dirty. Yet they still have cheek to strike

items.title: Company does not even deserve 1 star
items.review_text: Company does not even deserve 1 star! My train got cancelled last minute and i was asked to hop on any train,i was 2 months pregnant travelling with 2 kids (my younger one had just been discharged from the hospital) and an elderly. The train was full and there were no seats..people were sitting outside toilets!there was no staff avaliable for help. The company failed to reply to my complaint until i rang to check and could only offer me 25% discount on next journey instead of paying back my money for the seats which i had booked and never got to travel on! I told them i dont usually travel on trains and discount is no use ..they cancelled the discount and  said they cannot give me my refund

items.title: Process Designed To Ensure you Cannot Get a Refund
items.review_text:
I am trying to claim a refund through the "Avanti Delay Repay".  I booked via the Trainline app.  The train I was booked on never ran - and was apparently never going to run as Avanti had changed their schedule!  So i had to catch a later train, which made me later in London.
I tried using their site, have been unable to register, their "help" is rubbish.  Is it all designed to ensure no one can claim against them?
Virgin was never this bad.

items.title: dont waste money on first class
items.review_text: dont waste money on first class - they never have staff and never food available. They claim its based on availbility. Toilets are very dirty

items.title: Most Reliable Train Operator
items.review_text:
I have to travel frequently for work, and Avanti are the only trainline in the UK I can trust to get me where I am going.

They are consistently picking up the slack for TransPennine Express trains which never seem to run- I'm not convinced they actually exist, I've never seen one despite buying tickets several times!

Even when they have unavoidable delays (due to faults with the track or signals) and overcrowded trains (due to filling in for other train operators) the train managers are always helpful and apologetic.

They are always prepared to make whatever accommodations they can for their passengers, advise them of delay repay schemes and help arrange replacement bookings and seat reservations for cancelled services.

The staff seem knowledgeable and do their best to keep passengers updated with information as soon as they get it.

items.title: Hopeless service
items.review_text: Hopeless service. Just taken 8 hours on packed boiling trains to get from London to Glasgow. Awful. Delays cancellations. No buffet services. No information. Driving trains which are dangerously overcrowded. No care or consideration for their customers. Appalling. Never use if you can avoid it.

items.title: 8 1/2 hours from Euston to Glasgow
items.review_text: 8 1/2 hours from Euston to Glasgow, 3 trains, no announcements.   They should have their licence revoked if they can’t provide a reliable service.

items.title: Shockingly Bad Service.
items.review_text:
Shockingly bad. Travelled from Runcorn to London this morning. Train arrived 15 minutes late.....no explaination.

Now sitting on 14.07 London to Liverpool. Driver not present and train expected to depart about 14.35 with an absurd excuse given.  No food for sale in shop. Staff couldn't care less. Perhaps they will when Avanti loose the franchise.

items.title: what a joke
items.review_text: what a joke. unfortunately i try and avoid getting the train these days because they have become so unreliable.

items.title: Just awful
items.review_text:
Just awful. We haven’t had a smooth run down to Euston from Penrith for a long time now. Usually late, I changed trains 3 times last time. My daughters train has been cancelled from Euston to Penrith for the second weekend running. If you can get past Preston you may be lucky. This is where they change crews , but often not enough for train to continue. The man in the ticket office at Euston said there’s been no new recruitment since the COVID mass exodus. 
My daughter nipped over to Kings X , - LNER trains travel to Edinburgh often 2 an hour leave the station. and are so quick.We drove over to Darlington to collect her. What a difference in trains !!! Two other people I know did the same yesterday.
Avanti more often than not have no food , and no water, really bad as your first class tickets you’ve just bought are astronomical. Don’t even mention WI-FI. 
The trains are dirty , particularly the toilets. LNER on east coast are modern and clean, pity I have to drive 100 miles round trip to pick her up, or get myself down to London.

items.title: An absolute disgrace and shambles
items.review_text: An absolute disgrace and shambles, cancelling not one but two trains and the second one we had no warning of until it was to late,will make sure I don't use you're service's again,I hope you go bust! 🖕

items.title: Avanti is absolutely average
items.review_text:
Average. I'm on the train as I write this. The width of the aisle has increased, so that's good. The carriages are generally OK, but not excellent. The Accessible toilet next to the 'Quiet Zone' was....out of use! Not acceptable. The next toilet along was passable, not the usual urine-soaked stinking nightmare of days gone by. The "free WiFi" is a joke. I can't even play a YouTube video, let alone do any gaming! Although the Quiet Zone was quiet, the signage needs to be stronger, to tell people to basically sit down and shut up. For the very high cost of my ticket, I expect better.
On my return journey, however, the train was notably cleaner, better appointed. The Quiet Zone rules are still not firmly enforced though. I don't know why people can't just sit down and shut up when travelling. The return journey was certainly better, but the cost of the ticket still does not represent value for money.

items.title: I wish i could put zero stars
items.review_text: I wish i could put zero stars. What complete incompetence by the staff and managers. Last minute cancellations and complete chaos after further delays on the next train. A disgrace to all train companies

items.title: I had a problem with my ticket a couple…
items.review_text: I had a problem with my ticket a couple of weeks ago, the lady in the ticket office in Euston did all she could to help. Excellent customer care!

items.title: I bought a ticket
items.review_text:
I bought a ticket, cancelled
Wait 2 hours
I waited for the next one, cancelled
If I wait for the next one, wait two more
I didn’t wait for the last one - it came.

Admin fee of 10 pounds. Why am I paying an admin fee when this Trainline cancels so many times !!!

items.title: Shambles
items.review_text: Company a complete shambles from start to finish.had 3 hours to your journey due to inadequate numbers of trains being put on. And as for the refund policy its a scam. Enter all your details and won't let you press submit, complete frauds

items.title: The most dreadful train journey of my…
items.review_text: The most dreadful train journey of my life. I am a disabled traveller who was forced to travel sitting on my suitcase in a passageway. The guard was rude and dismissive and I was abandoned on platform by the assistance I pre booked and had to struggle onboard myself.

items.title: frequently delay or cancel their…
items.review_text: frequently delay or cancel their Edinburgh service. Not better at all for Glasgow routes either. Good luck if you are using Avanti to Scotland.

items.title: Short notice cancellations
items.review_text: Short notice cancellations, useless customer service for refunds and just in general have been terrible. They don’t care how much they inconvenience anyone.

items.title: Please bring Virgin back
items.review_text: Please bring Virgin back. This operator is a disgrace. Hundreds of trains were cancelled with lame excuses about shortages of staff. What have they been doing to run their business? They have been doing nothing, not looking into the future, the same excuses now for six months so why are they not recruiting.  They cancel trains on a  whim, you cannot book with certainty and now we have excuses about they will revise the timetable to account for hot weather. Its day two of the hot weather, no revised timetable just you take a gamble the train won't be cancelled at the last minute. When of course they do cancel, you have to pay a massive, massive premium because you are not now booking in advance but to get you where you need to be and Avanti bank on this. It is a disgrace. Please bring Virgin back, they knew how to run a business.

items.title: I am so unhappy
items.review_text: Uncomfortable train, reduced food menu in the shop which is annoying when you’re train has been cancelled and you’re journey is now three hours longer. There has never been a time when I have felt any happiness on any avanti train. Nothing is easy. The website, trying to upgrade or trying to get any information is useless. Three trains of people just had to get on to the one train back to London from Preston. They do have those little packets of olives…but they’re squashed… like my dreams of comfortable and timely travel.

items.title: Do not bother
items.review_text: I don't know why they are even allowed to operate! The scam is that you buy a ticket then the train is cancelled so you are told to wait for the next avanti that is usually cancelled or hrs away so you then have to buy another ticket and are delayed. The refund process is a headache.  I got caught twice and boarded another train that was due to arrive at the exact same time as avanti then realised they had switched train companies and gave half the train penalties!! Scam scam scam

items.title: If I could give 0 I would
items.review_text: If I could give 0 I would. The trains are horrifically expensive, always late, either too hot or too cold & always over crowded! I am still waiting for a refund from the June strikes!!!!! Told to complete the online form which looped me back to information about the strikes??? Then was told there was an issue that was being looked into and would take a week - we are now 29 days later and still nothing. The most despicable customer service I have ever had the misfortune of dealing with. Disgusting company.

items.title: Bring Back Virgin Trains ASAP
items.review_text:
I've just got on an overcrowded train, trying to find my reserved seat which apparently has been cancelled. It would have been nice for Avanti to have informed me.
People are standing in the aisle with luggage absolutely horrendous... Bring back Virgin trains ASAP.

items.title: Travelling to London the train was…
items.review_text:
Travelling to London the train was delayed with zero announcements. 
When it got going, the train was declassified, so no food. 
However, by far the worst bit? 
The train is FILTHY! 
With covid cases rising, it’s easy to see why. 
What a disgrace.

items.title: The people on my train playing loud…
items.review_text: The people on my train playing loud music. Don't like it. Make them stop :(

items.title: Useless company
items.review_text: Useless company, Never again! I hope there was another operator running those trains, I will report on them everywhere possible!

items.title: Horrendous
items.review_text:
Outward journey from London Euston to Bangor cancelled last minute due to signal failure, had to use an alternative route which took nearly 2 hours longer. Submitted a claim for refund. The claim was somehow rejected, and the reason given was “did not complete your journey by rail”, which makes no sense at all. Appealed the decision but doesn’t look optimistic.

During the return journey, the 10-carriage train was suddenly halved to 5 carriages at Crewe. The seat I reserved was gone because of this, and the train became extremely crowded. Had to stand for more than 2 hours in a crowded corridor.

Wish I could give zero stars, or even better negative stars. Absolutely horrible experience. It’s a wonder they’re still up and running.

Edit: claim for refund was accepted after review, and received the refund seamlessly… redeemed itself slightly

items.title: I would like to thank all the staff on…
items.review_text: I would like to thank all the staff on Avanti trains. They helped with passenger assistance with the wheelchair user in our group. They made sure we were boarded and seated in time for train to set off. I was really worried about travelling with a wheelchair user but the overall experience was fantastic. Thank you so much.

items.title: Unreliable service
items.review_text: Second time I've travelled to London from Manchester and the return cancelled. The trains that run are overcrowded and they turn the reservation system off so there's always someone else sitting in your reserved seat because the train is full of those that had their train cancelled. Absolute disgraceful 'service' . About time railways were nationalised so the British public don't have to tolerate woeful companies such as this.

items.title: No contact or replies following theft
items.review_text:
Suitcase stolen on train. After reporting to staff, and them telling me they would file a police report, it turned out they never filed such a report. 

After trying to get in touch with them for months to get any information on what happened (especially since there were multiple witnesses and cctv in place), I've had no replies of any kind. 

Shockingly poor customer service

items.title: Missed event because if this bad service
items.review_text: I wouldn't even give this 1 star ,paid £128 for 2 tickets open return as I wanted last train from euston to Wolverhampton as I should have been attending Duran Duran at Hyde Park. On arrival to Euston my last train to wolves was cancelled with no alternative so I had to get on train back home and miss Duran duran event. I am so upset this was a birthday treat and total loss of £350

items.title: Every train should have an Ashley on board!
items.review_text:
We took a train to Manchester yesterday and we were so lucky to get section in section C.  Ashley on the bar was amazing. Every train needs an Ashley.  Professional,  courteous and so knowledgeable and helpful. 
Super impressed!

items.title: And you thought Virgin were bad?!
items.review_text: Every time I’ve traveled Liverpool or Manchester to London, they cancel a train. This affects every service, double booked seats, overcrowded trains with whole families and elderly having to stand. Crew are sympathetic but can do nothing. Unless you’re willing to risk your travel plans being disrupted with minimal notice, avoid booking with them!

items.title: Booked a return journey from London to…
items.review_text:
Booked a return journey from London to Preston two months in advance for £105. 

Outbound journey was delayed by 40 minutes. Received an email saying I could claim 50% of outbound ticket due to delay. Avanti West Coast have made the process as difficult as possible to claim. They have all my details when booking the ticket but ask for every possible detail, including a screenshot of ticket on the app. Stuck with it and eventually got it done but the process has been made as difficult as possible in the hope that most people with give up and forget about it. 

Return journey I had reserved seats. When I got on the train someone was sat in my seat. Politely asked them to move but they said the train had been declassified. Spoke to a member of staff on the train who told me there was nothing they could do, so I had to stand up for the whole journey. Not sure why I am paying so much in advance when my seat isn't guaranteed. Have tried to request a refund but haven't been able to find a way to do this.

All in all an expensive, terrible journey. Welcome to to Britain. It's time to nationalise the train companies and stop these greedy corporate companies.

items.title: Currently travelling First class from…
items.review_text: Currently travelling First class from Preston to Milton Keynes. Train running 40 minutes late due to a problem at Crewe - no explanation. Everyone had to detrain, change platform, dirty train. No Wi-Fi service: no food: just hopeless!! Bring back Virgin!

items.title: Totally USELESS!
items.review_text: Totally useless. Book a return from New St in the morning and the app says the return leg (17:00) is sold out. That is total BS. Eleven coaches sold out in the morning? Not even a 1st class seat available. Try pull the other one Avanti. Hope you lose the franchise so we can get a better service.

items.title: Overcrowded, cancellations, overpriced
items.review_text: Every time I've used Avanti to get somewhere for work the trains are always dirty and very overcrowded due to the sheer volume of cancellations on a daily basis. Tickets and food is overpriced. On board wifi doesn't work so is impossible to do any work on the train. The trains are always delayed getting to a destination, I have never been on time to get my connections.

items.title: I'm sorry to have to give Avanti one…
items.review_text: I'm sorry to have to give Avanti one star- negative stars would be more appropriate....Their train service is hopeless, the last time I booked to travel I got an email the day before to say my train may not be running at the advertised time so I should check the timetables attached to this email. The timetables covered several days and were incredibly  difficult to read. My train was listed as several minutes later than advertised so I was likely to miss my connection. But when I arrived at the station my train was cancelled. I got on a later train which was packed with people standing and I was travelling with three children... I missed my connection. I had extreme difficulty in getting a refund- their website is chaotic, confusing and contradictory. Yesterday, the same chaos when I tried to claim a refund for a cancelled train due to the strike. I took me about 6 goes to claim on my phone- impossible to claim on my laptop. Then my claim was rejected because Avanti replied that I had "booked through a third party retailer" - this is despite the journey and ticket being listed and downloadable from my account on the Avanti website! I responded and threatened contacting my MP- then my refund was successful- after a couple of hours of time and effort... disgraceful!!!!

items.title: Season Pass for First Class is a joke.
items.review_text:
Bought the season pass from Coventry to Birmingham for the month as I commute every day. 

1. The lounge that is included with my first class pass at new street has been closed for the majority of the month. So this is a completely wasted and unused benefit. 

2. The staff on the avanti west coast would oftentimes not come around during my trip. I am entitled to a drink on the trip. On average, only 2-3 times a week did I actually receive. Bare in mind, I used the train to and from work everyday. 

3. Constant travel disruptions. I appreciate this might be out of their hands. But I enquired about some compensation for the canceled trains and they said they couldn't do it. 

These guys are jokers. Season pass is not worth it. I'd rather walk to work.

items.title: No lumbar support on seat, Extreme Uncomfortable, very disappointed, they should be fined for cheap quality seats causing inconvenience pain distress and health problems
items.review_text: No lumbar support on seats or tilt causing Extreme Discomfort and pain very disappointed, they should be fined for cheap quality seats causing inconvenience pain distress and health problems, will never use the trains again, discomfort seats for Lonng and short journeys

items.title: Wifi does not work on train whatsoever-…
items.review_text: Wifi does not work on train whatsoever- false advertisement (Birmingham NS to London Euston). Also very hot

items.title: Absolutely sh1te
items.review_text: Absolutely sh1te. Packed trains, broken air conditioning, seat reservation indicators broken. The final straw is that this operator of the finest cattle wagons charges us more than Virgin ever did.

items.title: As helpful as an ashtray on a motorbike.
items.review_text:
They ask you to put in a claim for a late train even to the point where they tell you what they owe you and then make it so difficult to make a claim so you give up. 
Total wasters in my opinion, run by 1970’s rail workers and moronic office staff who take great pride in F-ing people around. 
How very British

items.title: Terrible service
items.review_text: Terrible service.  Train delayed.  No communication.  Missed my connecting train.

items.title: Absolutely awful experience
items.review_text: Absolutely awful experience. Firstly the train was delayed half an hour, we were greeted by a very aggressive train manager who told us we couldn't sit at our seats we had paid and reserved, never gave us another place to sit or any help and was raising her voice at us for no reason. Eventually after numerous times asking her what to do she says we could drag all our luggage, two young children and pram to our reserved seats which was 2 carriages away and I couldn't leave my valuables. I then says I would be making a complaint. This is the worst bit the manager then came over and took a picture of my daughter lying down and the luggage. I then asked why she was taking a photo and if I could see it. She says she was taking a photo of the luggage to show the manager ( why I don't know) and my child wasn't in the photo. I then asked if I could see the photos and there was my little girl lying there in the photo on the managers phone her name was ‘Marie Claire’. She refused to delete the photo. I have never experienced customer service like this in my life. Made an official complaint and the company doesn't seem to care. Would never use the service again!!!!!!! Stay well clear.

items.title: Bring back Virgin
items.review_text: Awful Experience. Extremely expensive in every aspect and a step backwards from what used to be a great service with Virgin Trains

items.title: Rude & Incompetent
items.review_text:
Sadly I have only had terrible experiences with Avanti West Coast. This is not specifically to do with train delays or cancellations as all train companies in the UK have those, but more to do with their employees.
Whenever I have had to contact them by phone, or help desk in a station, information is always conflicting and the employees have been unjustifiably rude or incompetent. Even when delivering good information they somehow leave you feeling awful. 
I know that there are lovely people who work for Avanti (the staff on the trains in particular), however they are grossly out numbered.

items.title: A packed train so upgraded to ensure a…
items.review_text: A packed train so upgraded to ensure a seat ( next train cancelled) only to find toilet broken Ams then told no food. However trip has costed over £110 one way from euston to Runcorn…

items.title: Avoid Claire-Marie!
items.review_text:
Repeatedly dreadful service.
Avanti is the worst train operator I have ever had to deal with. In the last 4 years, I have travelled on over 200 UK inter-city train services from a multiplicity of providers. Avanti is an absolute rip-off, with the minimum price between MNC-LDN being £60 return with a 16-25 railcard.
The train staff have always been the worst aspect of the journey. Today, the train manager 'Claire-Marie' was extremely rude to me, and when I gave her my ticket, she started scrolling through my phone's screenshots to find the second half of my journey. She could have just asked, and I would have shown it to her. Extremely rude and an unprofessional service. Additionally, she spoke in a very unpleasant and condascending tone, which was wholly unnecessary, as I am just quietly trying to get about my day. 
Trains are filthy and overheated, and the toilets stink. Food is overpriced, and the website and wifi is impossible to use.
And this doesn't even mention the cancellations, which have wreaked havoc on my life time and time again.
The British public and international travelers deserve far better for the extortionate price charged.

items.title: Friendly and efficient service.
items.review_text:
My son and his mother booked reservations for Glasgow Central to London Euston on the 27th June, to travel on the 21st July and return on the 23rd. I booked the same details in person the following day, I was served by a young lady called 'Bex' at the ticket office in Glasgow Central who went over and above what I expected a staff member to do. She was so helpful, and friendly. Although she couldn't get us all sitting together she got me a reservation in the same coach. I would appreciate it if she could be thanked by an Avanti Manager for her service and efficiency.
Yours sincerely Mr. D.Hammond

items.title: Not sure how this company still…
items.review_text: Not sure how this company still operates a franchise. Terrible service nothing works, trains are stinking and card machine and wifi never seem to work when travelling  with them. No wonder train travel is in decline

items.title: Cancelled trains not fully refunded.
items.review_text: Bought 2 return tickets for £209. Couldn't take the return journey as the trains were cancelled, but refund of £60 provided which is less than 50%. Contacted customer service by email several times for explanation however no reply so far after 2 weeks.

items.title: Horrid stench
items.review_text: Travelling from Euston to Runcorn the day after the first rail dispute ( ie 22nd June). Train was about 20 mins late going out, which didn’t bother me too much, There were plenty of spare seats.  What really bothered me was the terrible stench coming from the toilet,  told the train operative it was vile and overpowering, he was aware of it, said an engineer had been notified but it hadn’t been able to be fixed yet. It really was awful .  We moved to a different carriage but I could still smell it ( admittedly not as strongly).  Also wi-fi wasn’t working properly.

items.title: Haunted by my journey!
items.review_text:
Worst train company on planet earth. No communication, no trains, no service. What a disaster last Friday was. 

Every time I come to travel on Avanti trains the service gets worse. Bring back Virgin Trains! At least they cared about their brand and reputation whereas Avanti seem to be running it into the ground.

items.title: The late running train from Glasgow to…
items.review_text:
The late running train from Glasgow to Euston (13.35 left at 14.25, not too bad) on Friday the 17th of June 2022.

We started to slow down after wigan and eventually came to a stop somewhere in the West Midlands and crawled into Rugby. The time we were meant to have to Euston had now passed. There was no information coming through on the tannoy from the guard or the driver or the waiting staff and were just left sitting on the train for 2 hours The food and beverages had eventually run out at about 8.00pm then we were abruptly told that the train was going back to Glasgow and no more services would be running into Euston that day from then. The guard was nowhere to be seen.

lots of families just stranded. Ineptitude of the highest degree from all concerned with Avanti.

items.title: Absolutely vile
items.review_text:
Wifi just doesn’t work so it’s a cheek advertising it. Had to use personal hotspot. 

Trains to Manchester and back were filthy - frightened to touch anything.

Seats cramped and uncomfortable. 

No point booking a seat as when the train gets to Milton Keynes it gets rammed with people in the aisle with bags in your face, coughing over you, unable to move about and use the toilet (perhaps that’s a plus point as it was filthy). 

Makes you so jealous when you see the spacious new trains in other countries - it’s actually shameful to think what people visiting from other countries think of the U.K. if they use this service. 

Hang your heads in shame AWC 😖

items.title: Seats double booked, refund refused, bad CS
items.review_text: The company double booked our seats. I raised the issue to the support team. They refused to refund saying seat booking is free and as long as I got on the train I should be thankful... Customer service was quite bad with the agent asking a lot of unnecessary information, long delays in responding and refusal to escalate.

items.title: Please give virgin trains concession back
items.review_text:
I believe regretting the day they got rid of Virgin.
Trains today are dirty, smelly, wifi not working and air conditioning system looks like heating was left on max.
An absolute disgrace. 
It makes me wonder how good maintenance is kept on.

items.title: Disappointing.
items.review_text:
They state in their website you can make amends to your advance tickets. Well, you can't.
Try to call the customer service, good luck getting through.

Staff was always nice, seats always uncomfortable and badly positioned especially for long journeys, wifi is patchy and slow.

items.title: Rubbish service as usual
items.review_text: Rubbish service as usual. Uninterested staff who don't give a f@#k about service being substandard. Usually travel down East Coast Mainline. Thought I'd try Avanti again. Regret my decision. Back to travelling on the eastcoast next time I head south

items.title: The wi-fi is absolutely rubbish…
items.review_text:
The wi-fi is absolutely rubbish comparing to previous Virgin Trains. Dirty seats,no power on table socket.
The positive one was the staff smiling and friendly.

items.title: Stressful doesn't describe it
items.review_text:
I recently took the train from Codsall to Manchester Airport - here's how my journey went
a) train 1 was late
b) train 2 was late
c) I missed my next connection because of the above
d) I was advised that the next train was in about 50 minutes which, if the day progressed as it had with late trains I was going to be late for check in at an airport when I had been asked to check in early because of problems with staffing levels at the airport.
e) I was misinformed by the Station Manager at Crewe who said go to Wilmslow and catch a bus which only took 10 minutes and ran every 10 minutes. There was no bus available for 50 minutes
f) There were initially no taxis available at Wimslow
g) I was advised the next train to Manchester airport was not going to get me there in time
h) I was carrying quite a large suitcase up and down a ramp trying to determine the best way to get to the airport
h) I eventually took a taxi which added £17.00 to my journey costs
It was an exceedingly stressful journey with Train companies causing this stress. I had prepared well for the journey and allowed sufficient time to arrive but Train companies and train staff repeatedly let me down.
On my return from holiday I asked for my taxi fare to be refunded but was told that as I didn't have a receipt it was not possible.
Who would have asked for a receipt under these circumstances? This was the first time I'd travelled to an airport by train and I will never repeat this - far too STRESSFUL - can do without it at 74 years old!
If I could give this company zero stars I would

items.title: Worst Customer Service - completely useless
items.review_text:
If I could give minus one hundred I would. I thought Virgin was bad Avanti is 100 times worse.
I have been trying to get hold customer Service for months - the website is useless if you have other problem than they have listed and no option for other on chat or phone.
I wanted to set up business account as I buy a lot of tickets for engineers as I want to be able to buy preimer 1st class ticket.  I finally got through to a human on customer service who said it is not my job and you only set up a business account electronically  - I have a creditcard that I pay for tickets but want my engineers to be able to pick the ticket up themselves - do you think I can find this out NO they do not even reply.

items.title: Expensive, crammed, no internet & late!
items.review_text:
Sky-high prices (even advance singles are extortionately priced), awful internet, crammed trains that NEVER arrive at the specified time.
Also, I recommend to stay away from the app and instead use Trainline. Even if it costs £1 more at least it displays the right tickets! 😳

items.title: Worst rail company EVER
items.review_text:
Avanti west coast is just the WORST rail company I’ve ever seen, and I am definitely being fair. Here are the reasons.

1. Before and during the pandemic, we always traveled back from London Euston to north wales with a much more reasonable price (at that time trains were operated by Virgin). You sometimes could get first-class tickets with a very decent price. This has completely changed since those shi-8heads decided to let AWC to replace Virgin. Prices are always ridiculously high, with the same price from London Euston to Manchester, I can fly to most European countries with returned flight tickets.

2. Trains are always either delayed or cancelled and there won’t be any notification until the last minute. Want a refund? Congrats you will need to fill in a 100-page form to claim compensation and even then they might reject your request from time to time. 
3. The train tickets that we used to buy now become unavailable to buy for the next 12 weeks. Only first-class tickets are available and this situation has last for more than a month. Are you telling me that all tickets are sold out for the next rolling 12 weeks???
4. Their customer service line takes forever to call through. Any enquiry? Wait for 40 mins before someone can talk to you.

Honestly I HATE HATE HATE AWC. Please lose your bid and f-off in a few years when your contract finishes.

items.title: From usually good or very good (Virgin) to rubbish (Avanti) ...
items.review_text:
Before the pandemic I used Virgin Trains Stockport to Euston regularly.

They weren't perfect. But compared with Avanti ..! Let me begin;

1. the Avanti website is dreadful; having asked for travel times it doesn't display the range of trains across one's preferred time before it has asked you for other details of your trip; so one can't quickly get an overview of cheaper times to travel; given that the route is over used Avanti thereby do not encourage filling off-peak services; and beyond that it has been organised by amateurs compared with the userfriendliness of Virgin; even the Avanti staff at Stockport admit that everyone complains ot them about the uselessness of the Web site.
2. There is no warning on the Avant website that trains not booked directly with Avanti canNOT be changed at departure station; why not?
3. on the day I travelled, my train was delayed by an hour out of Euston. On the down train in the morning the train from Stockport was filthy. On the way back it was dirty.
4. Today I just wanted to find train times. It wouldn't supply them because it said all trains booked out. This was a lie. Rail strikes are planned on the days conserved. The website didn't say this was the reason. The Trainline website did. This smells of understaffing.

The overall impression is that Avanti just don't care (unlike Virgin). I suspect this is because the government are already scheduling the end of franchising so why should they? 

So what we have is a relatively new replacement for the west coast mainline franchise which knows its going to be replaced and sees no point in improving any aspects of its services which are worse than Virgin. "Another fine mess" of rail reorganisation!

I can suggest nothing to ameliorate this unfortunate situation other than to note the financial involvement of TrenItalia displayed on the front and back of each train and tell the Italian rail company thinking its got a good investment in this W Coast mainline. It hasn't and never will have unless things change dramatically.
