In Italy, I found Trenitalia on the other hand to be good, but that isn't much help other than to indicate that where there's a will there's a way!

Sad very very sad when a good service declines like this.

items.title: Ridiculous
items.review_text: Worst service ever. No need to explain.

items.title: Ripping people off with prices
items.review_text: Ripping people off with prices. Fares seemed to have gone up 50%. How can they just get away with this

items.title: Cancelled a London to Holyhead Train
items.review_text: Cancelled a London to Holyhead Train, missed my ferry to Dublin, had to fork out for flights. Awful company, so angry!!

items.title: THE site to buy train tickets
items.review_text:
I have left a couple of bad reviews on this website so wanted to leave a good one so I do not come across as a total downer!
I now always use Avanti to buy tickets (even when not travelling to Manchester).
Fantastic customer service, particularly through COVID; very strong and easy-to-use app; plus, you collect nectar points!
What's not to love!
As for the trains themselves, meh... But the ticket booking experience is great!

items.title: Frustrating order to seat doesn’t work
items.review_text: Cash only at the kiosk and order at your seat doesn’t work. Not good when you have a thirsty child on a 2 hour journey. Awful service

items.title: Shocking customer service.....
items.review_text: Shocking customer service when travelling with two additional support needs children from Euston to Glasgow. The journey was subjected to an unplanned train change at Preston and we lost our prebooked seats which were selected to assist with our childrens disabilities. Staff on the train couldn't have been less interested and offered no assistance. AWC resolution team were no better. From our experience at least, assisting disabled passangers is not high on the agenda for this company.

items.title: Excellent service from avanti staff member who went above and beyond. To help me sought out my my train line error .service was excellent .very patient and put me at ease .
items.review_text:
I visited Manchester Piccadilly .to day 
To sought an error I had with recent train line tickets .which I had purchased through my app the young lady who worked for avanti  was excellent .she was patient put me at ease and went above and beyond .
Next time I will go direct to the ticket office 
Amazing service. .Thank you

items.title: Avanti are the worse!
items.review_text: Avanti are the worse!! Travelled from Glasgow to London on the 5th June. Earlier trains cancelled meant ours was rammed. Not just crowded but rammed. People standing for hours and sitting on the floor on dirty, dated trains! Just a joyless way to travel. They should be embarrassed but clearly they couldn’t care less!

items.title: There advanced ticket prices have more…
items.review_text: There advanced ticket prices have more than doubled also there service from stafford is very poor only 1 train an hour each direction to London and Liverpool no service to Wales and Scotland even though they pass through stafford regularly so they could easily stop there people don’t want to have to change at Crewe it’s a horrible depressing place

items.title: Reserved Seating Issues
items.review_text:
Have traveled from Birmingham New St to London Euston on a number of occasions.
Have pre booked seats; but when you get onto the train, they have not activated the illuminated seating indicators. 
All show as 'available'
Have had a number of issues, as have others when someone is sitting in your reserved seats and refuse to move.
Sometimes the indicators activate after the train has set off.
Other issues are that when booked via  Train Line; you are not allocated the seating or quiet coach that you request, only to find that once on the train there is seating available.
Poor.

items.title: Just terrible
items.review_text: Had to give a one star review because I couldn't leave a no star review. Of the three trains on their service on different days two have been cancelled, one has been significantly delayed and even the replacements were late. To top it off the trains that do turn up consist of two carriages despite their being easily enough passengers to fill four. Shoddy experience on dated and uncomfortable trains..... If you have to use their service Id advise you to reconsider walking.... You might get there quicker.

items.title: No WiFi
items.review_text: I'm posting this using my data allowance; because despite Avanti supposedly offering free WiFi, it doesn't actually work. Why not just be honest and admit they don't do wifi, rather than go through this charade of a connection that just returns 'no connection ' whenever I try to search on Google etc? My guess is they're being subsidised to provide it,  but the reality of the service isn't checked.

items.title: Not upto standards in any way.
items.review_text: Not upto standards in any way.

items.title: Awful
items.review_text: Awful. Dirty. Terrible Wi-Fi. Fetch a book if you’re going to be on a long journey, along with plenty of antibacterial wipes. Bring back Virgin Trains!

items.title: Avanti 1st and Standard, review.
items.review_text:
I've used Avanti trains frequently between Edinburgh Waverly and Birmingham airports over the last 7 months traveling in first and standard classes. There are a few things that stand out as being sub par. Cleanliness is dreadful. I found no material difference in comfort between standard and first class seats  and the food portions ridiculously small and the quality below the standard offered by rivals (first class). BTW there is no first class lounge for Avanti customers at Waverly, be aware of this. 
 I've had one or two trains cancelled, and they arranged connections,  which happens but what I hate is having to deal with Avanti customer service- 70 + mins left hanging on a phone and they just dropped the line. I  fly now or use the rival service to london, anything to avoid using  them. That says it all really.

items.title: 3 return journeys.
items.review_text: 3 return journeys.. 3 missed connections because of late running trains.. Avanti should be stripped of this franchise... Another point. Why do the guards on these trains leaving London have to make announcements that are so annoyingly long?. Also, is it a fiddle on arrival figures in that a train can get to Preston 20 late but still get to Glasgow on time showing that arrivals look good?.... If uve got any other way of travelling other than avanti-for ur own sanity do so

items.title: Despicable company that hate their customers
items.review_text:
Some absolute jobsworth took great pleasure in closing the gate on us when the train was sat there with the doors open, all because of a ridiculous rule where they close boarding two full minutes before the train goes. Does it say this rule on the ticket or on the board at Euston? Of course not. 

This was on the jubilee bank holiday as well, he could have easily let us on but no, he’d rather mess up our and four other peoples travel plans because they didn’t know about a rule that isn’t advertised anywhere you’d expect it to be. He is pathetic man working for a pathetic company. You could tell he didn’t want to help us or the other passengers there, it was “not his problem”. He said we’d need to buy another ticket, which was also wrong as we had an off peak return, so had a choice of trains, which we found out from the Euston help desk I.e. the only help was from someone not working for Avanti…

If he’d let us on I could be writing a positive review but that would be too easy and obvious for a company and employees as small minded and anti-customer as Avanti. 

Literally hundreds of people a week will get caught by this rule and the only reason I can see for it existing is that it forces customers to buy new train tickets at extortionate prices. Do you know why it isn’t to make the trains leave and arrive on time? Because they almost never do and most other train services don’t do this and run far better.

Finally we get on the next train and the circus of awfulness continues: the carriage smells; overhead storage is about 5 inches tall so you can’t fit anything up there; coffee cup in the net behind the seat (started at Euston so was missed by cleaning); gum in the fabric of the seats; windows are small so feels cramped.

You win Avanti, I’ll tell anyone I ever can to avoid using you and will now drive the route I normally take the train for, to avoid your awful services. 

Screw this company, it cannot shut down soon enough.

items.title: The delay repay website not working
items.review_text: The delay repay website states im owed £10.86,but when i have inputted all the required info it wont allow me to submit my claim. I have asked the rail ombudman to investigate .

items.title: Grubby, smelly, expensive
items.review_text:
The train departed and arrived on time. The conductor was polite. But that's it.
The seat backs were spattered with tea or coffee - not just in my seat, but in most of the rows I looked at. The fabric of the seats themselves looked as though they were never cleaned. There were sticky blobs _ maybe chewing gum or something like it - on a few of the seats. And the toilets, never very good even when these Pendolino trains were new, were pretty stinky even from a distance. For the exhorbitant price of the journey I was disgusted. I've resolved to use West Midlands Trains for the same journey in future. There are more stops and more changes, so it takes twice as long but on the upside it's cheaper and West Midlands do seem to clean their carriages occasionally. At least you don't feel like you need a shower when you get to your destination. Or I could just drive - about the same cost even with diesel at about £2 a litre.

items.title: Train filthy
items.review_text: Train filthy, disorganised, too warm, hardly any staff

items.title: Epic levels of incompetence
items.review_text:
On Sunday 29th May the 10:38 from Liverpool to London Euston was cancelled. I received no email or message via the app to inform me of the cancellation. The next train was due to leave 1.5 hours later and was chronically overcrowded. I decided to take the next train, which was also delayed by 35 minutes due to staff shortages and was also overcrowded. This is the 3rd time this has happened since October/November 2021. Even Virgin weren't this bad.

I tried ringing to complain, but the wait was up to 30-40 minutes. I can't be bothered to try any other avenue for complaint, as I have no doubt it will be ignored after I have been fed some meaningless platitudes.

Avanti west coast are a dreadful company. Their trains from Liverpool Limestreet to London Euston are regularly delayed or cancelled. This is according to station staff at Limestreet. They are also impossible to get hold of on the phone, and their tickets are overpriced compared to virgin. 

Do not take an avanti train on a weekend from Liverpool limestreet to London Euston. Walk if you have to, it would be quicker.

items.title: Inane policies forcing unnecessary waste
items.review_text:
I was on a train to London and wanted a coffee. It was given in a standard difficult-to-recycle coffee cup (that will probably end up in landfill*) with a fully enclosed plastic lid. The salesperson put it in a paper bag. I said I didn't need a paper bag. He said I have to take it. I asked why. He said I might drop it. Umm okay, that's what the lid is for?

There is an environmental crisis going on caused by waste culture and stuff like this just pisses me off. Companies should be reducing unnecessary waste, not increasing it - we are going the wrong way while approaching planetary tipping points with polluted water, soil and air. I should not be forced to take a paper bag that I don't need and serves no purpose whatsoever.

*Guardian: Why Britain’s 2.5 billion paper coffee cups are an eco disaster

items.title: Awful company, avoid at all costs
items.review_text: Awful company. They canceled train same day without any communication, adding 3 hours in changes to a trip already 5.5 hours long (London > Edinburgh). One of the cars’ air conditioning was broken making it stifling. Atrocious customer service with very poor communication and no attempt to rectify their mistake. Avoid at all costs, well worth paying a bit more to avoid this company

items.title: Disgusting treatment of passengers
items.review_text:
Does not deserve even the ONE STAR! 
Cancelled train on the day- Glasgow to Euston. Only option is a train involving three changes arriving in London in the early hours...disgusting treatment- I will never travel with Avanti again.

items.title: Cancelled trains
items.review_text: Book a train-they cancel it on the day and charge you more for different train. Happened last week. Happened this week. Never again.

items.title: Time wasted trying to communicate with Avantiwestcoast…
items.review_text: Summary -Arrived in time with Advanced ticket via Trainline with seat F61 booked on 19th May for the18.03 train to Liverpool. Unfortunately it was cancelled. However, no information on procedures what to do. Went to ticket office - no interest really but informed my ticket would be accepted for 19.07 train. Boarded this train at 19.15 with great difficulty (I am 82 years old, still mobile but not as fast as the customers stampeding to the now 'under capacity' train). There were no seats and unfortunately I had to stand all the way from Euston to Runcorn, when I finally got a seat. (for about 20 minutes I sat on the floor between carriages). The next day I contacted, Trainline, who were clear that as Ticket vendors, they could not help me to either complain or make a modest claim for the inconvenience and discomfort and I should contact the trainline directly. This I did and again found it impossible to penetrate the complexities of registering                     with Avantiwestcoast and even making a complaint. It was as if the procedures were designed to deliberately make one fed-up with wasting time and going down repeated blind alleys, that one would give up. Which of course was what I finally did by diverting to a website that does understand about presenting comments and displeasure.  I am not angry about a claim, nor the cancellation but I am annoyed at not being able to make a criticism directly to a rail service, who have taken payment for a service and have inefficiently not delivered it!  How can one support such a service?

items.title: Train from  Wolverhampton to London…
items.review_text: Train from  Wolverhampton to London Euston cancelled. Have been trying to claim refund. Website atrocious. Just shunted around in circles with no confirmation that claim form has been sent/received. No customer telephone number. Terrible service

items.title: Poor on board first class service
items.review_text:
Poor on board first class service. 
Food has either ran out or limited choice. Twice I've ordered food then none has arrived despite reminding staff. 
Trains rarely on time. 2 trips down to London, both been delayed (in fact one was cancelled). 
Come back Virgin - all is forgiven.

items.title: Amazing staff
items.review_text:
I struggle with tilting trains, they give me very bad motion sickness and there were no forward facing seats other than the reserved for support.
The staff on realising I was unwell from the train manager to the on board shop were amazing with me, allowing me to use one of the support seats to sit facing forward and ensuring I was okay. They went above and beyond the expected and I am truly grateful!

items.title: I travelled to Preston from Edinburgh…
items.review_text: I travelled to Preston from Edinburgh 1100 on 25/05/2022 internal train was cool. and seats seamed cramped .return journey was busy with people sitting with suitcases on laps. my seat direction was wrong. just never felt comfortable

items.title: Filthy trains - zero customer service!
items.review_text:
Travelled from Euston to Warrington a few weeks ago and the train was absolutely filthy. I'm not talking about rubbish being left by previous passengers, but deep ingrained dirt (even on the ceiling!) which shows it hasn't been cleaned in a long time. 

Emailed Avanti with photos, they breached their SLA for responding and fobbed me off with saying the train is cleaned at the end of the line. At the prices they charge, the level of filth was totally unacceptable - clearly no quality checks exist. Virgin was never this bad, just shocking.

items.title: 75 year old stood all the way from Manchester to Euston!
items.review_text:
If it had been possible to select zero stars I definitely would have! My wife and I in our 70’s stood all the way from Manchester to Euston Sunday 8th May. People stood in carriageway’s with luggage. When my wife became Ill, I could not get through to try and reach the train manager. She passed the buck saying that she was unaware of the overwhelming situation until it was painfully obvious even to her that there was a major problem - or maybe this was the norm? I emailed Avanti Customer Services and obviously they never responded even though I ensured the email was courteous.
I don’t ever remember Virgin ever being as bad as Avanti. I will definitely go out of my way to avoid the shambolic Avanti company in the future.

items.title: Train cancelled
items.review_text: Train cancelled, so decided to get train an hour earlier to avoid the busy trains, had to pay more to change the train time even though if I had booked the train at the original time I booked I don’t think would have had to. Actual train we did get ran on time and not very busy so have given two stars.

items.title: Train cancelled with no notification…
items.review_text:
Train cancelled with no notification prior. Next train was overcrowded and seat reservation obviously no longer applicable. Avanti advised that because I took the next train I was not entitled to any compensation for the inconvenience to my journey, even though I arrived to the destination later than planned. Overpriced and poor service. 
Very quick to take money if you try and take another timed train that you didn’t book.

items.title: Awful
items.review_text: Awful. 80 mins late meaning I’d miss my connecting trains. Worse transport company ever!

items.title: Horrid company
items.review_text:
Go else where, train cancelled, incorrectly charged me 20 quid in admin fees and offering a cheque for the rest of my refund. 

The phone system is a good 3 min worth of nonsense before you can start with the options which are numerous.

I will never use this company again, they have no willingness to help you at all.

items.title: Avoid if possible
items.review_text: Absolute joke. Customer service virtually non existent.

items.title: I took the Milton Keynes to Euston…
items.review_text:
I took the Milton Keynes to Euston 20/05/2022 @14:03 with my partner and our reserved seats had people in them. These passagers informed us they were told over the tannoy that anyone could take any seat due to a double booking. The passenger in question was heavily drinking on the train, which I thought staff would have intervened with but I digress. This double booking resulted in an excessive and unsafe number of people, a very Covid unsafe number and a certain health risk. 

Appalling, sickening and the company should be ashamed it put people in this position.

My partner has sciatica which has paralyzed her in the past, and I was standing/walking for 12 hours prior to this journey. My feet had bloody blisters and having to stand only worsened this.

Having recently dealt with a bereavement this is not what I needed, and once again the company completely failed in its service and covenants to the customers. In trying to find a ticket attendant to ensure what the passenger said was true, none could be found, so the trains were poorly staffed on top of everything else.

items.title: Smooth Journey/Anxious Connections
items.review_text: The journey itself was very smooth and efficient. However, both out going and return trains, Preston to Edinburgh, were late and, on the return, I very nearly missed my onward connection to Liverpool...no guards on the platform to advise. The reason I knew which Platform to aim for was that I'd anxiously searched using my mobile phone which was about to die [the only charging sockets are attached to table seating].

items.title: £330 for a return ticket...
items.review_text:
£330 for a return ticket from Manchester to London = No thanks, id rather spend double the time driving at one fifth of the price.

Virgin were so much better at service, price & more frequent trains.

items.title: Email addresses starting with a numeral are invalid!!
items.review_text: Unable to register for an account as Avanti's website keeps telling me my longstanding gmail address, which starts with 0 (zero), is invalid! I couldn't even email Avanti customer services or their complaints department for the same reason. Even a phone call with a human member of Avanti staff resulted in the equivalent of a shrug! Inexplicable and very poor company performance.

items.title: Stressful and upsetting
items.review_text:
Travelled back home to Stockport from London on Sunday 15th May. This was to be a very special day trip home to see my family and see my football club become champions of their division. What a disaster thanks to Avanti. Our early morning train was cancelled and we had a wait of an hour for the next train. The gentleman in the Avanti info booth had no idea our train was even cancelled!! I had planned to spend time with my son and daughter before the game but due to our late arrival that was considerably shortened. We then found our planned evening train home had also been cancelled!! Again, depriving me of Time with family as we left the celebrations earlier than planned so we could make sure we got back to London.
Thank you Avanti for totally ruining what should have been a day spent with My family.

items.title: Pre-booked tickets from Penrith to…
items.review_text: Pre-booked tickets from Penrith to Swansea - on day of departure get an email from Trainline to say Penrith train cancelled but I could book another, as my journey consisted of two changes I couldn't rebook as I didn't know what it would do to my transfers.  Avanti West Coast are ALWAYS cancelling their trains and then they stick everyone on the next available train so there is nowhere to sit - their TV advert is such a lie - they should use a dead tortoise and drag it along on its back to symbolise their dreadful service - shame I can't give them no stars.  Now having to drive to Preston station to catch a train - thanks Avanti West Coast! :(

items.title: Amazing Staff
items.review_text: Train was delayed so missed our connecting train. Bryan (I believe his name was, sorry if I’m wrong) at Carlisle train station was very efficient and had pre-planned onward travel for us to save another delay late at night. Excellent customer service and was very helpful, couldn’t fault him! Kept us updated as to what he had arranged and made sure everyone was sorted. Thank you very much Bryan at Carlisle train station!

items.title: absolutely appalling service
items.review_text: absolutely appalling service, train cancelled on the way down to london, over 80 mins late. the driver told us to go on to the website and claim a refund. the website is shocking and just takes you round and round in circles until you feel like throwing yourself out of a window. i still havent completed the forms as it says something is wrong every time i try. then on the way back up to manchester they had cancelled 2 trains and had to cram hundreds of people on. there were people (including mothers with babies like myself) sat on the floor, in the corridoors. Outrageous considering we spent nearly 200 quid on our tickets!!!! God i hate them. GIVE ME MY REFUND

items.title: First class shambles
items.review_text: Paid first class London to liverpool. 7pm. No food except a stale afternoon tea and 87 calorie salad. Absolute shambles. Get yourself a pret and a normal seat or even premium. No food actually included in ticket

items.title: Time to get rid
items.review_text: Time to get rid! Set off from Birmingham new st. to Preston got half way to first stop (Wolverhampton) and we were told there was no driver for the rest of the journey, HOW? then just abandoned on Wolverhampton station getting more information off Trainline than Avanti staff! I don’t understand how this government can look at this company’s appalling track record and give it such a massive contract! It’s supposed to be public transport not oh we might put out some trains and if your lucky it might even get you where you want to go! Stop playing with peoples valuable time money and either give a reliable service or get lost!

items.title: I went to Manchester on Thursday on…
items.review_text:
I went to Manchester on Thursday on standard first. The ticket is much more expensive than it was on Virgin . The train carriage was frankly dirty . There is nothing pleasant travelling Avanti.
Coming back on Friday afternoon the train halted outside Euston 
Luckily it was only delayed 1/2 hour .
How on earth did this dreadful company manage to get the service is beyond me !
Depressing

items.title: Don't waste your money on a First Class…
items.review_text: Don't waste your money on a First Class ticket. Crowded, limited food, nothing like the service Virgin used to supply. Staff try their best, but let down by management.

items.title: First Class Customer Experience …..you have to be joking Avanti
items.review_text: Today I’ve travelled first class with Avanti from Carlisle to Preston and back. What absolute joke their first class service has become since I last used it earlier in the year. I boarded 10:08am from Edinburgh expecting to have nice breakfast as I have always had in the past as regular customer on this route. To my surprise I was informed there was virtually nothing left except possibly very small portion scrambled eggs and salmon and forget toast etc as that was no go even though Carlisle was next stop after Edinburgh. Customer service team informed me they didn’t have enough food on board. If that wasn’t bad enough on my return journey (15:41) we were served no food at all. Coffee came followed by alcoholic drinks which was red wine served from large plastic soft drink bottle which was unbelievable. Customer server then disappeared into preparation area  which we all thought he was getting menus to ask us what food we would like to order. He was no show for rest of journey. This is clearly not the service I expect when travelling with Avanti. I’ve raised complaint with customer resolution and it will be interesting to see if they take my concern seriously or just ignore it

items.title: Be Careful When Booking on Their Website
items.review_text:
I am hoping that this will get resolved and I can raise my rating...

In searching for travel using the National Rail website, I found that it would be best to purchase a Two Together Railcard for travel from London Euston to Manchester Piccadilly. I proceed to purchase the railcard, then clicked the link taking me to Avanti's site to purchase the tickets.

Despite doing the search with "Railcard" selected, at some point during the purchasing process, this was removed and I ended up paying for tickets that did not use a Railcard (about £48 more!) but did not see this until the final summary was displayed AFTER payment was completed. I should have noticed the larger than expected price, but in getting everything booked and coordinating it with another booking, I missed this assuming that my original selection was still being applied (WARNING TO OTHERS: double check what is selected before paying!)

I would like to get this changed, either by crediting the overcharge, or by refunding and repurchasing, but there was no telephone number I could find to call, and the only contact is through email with a response stating that you will look into it within 28 days! That would be about when the trip was to occur. I was hoping that I would be contacted sooner, but that is not the case.

I'm hoping that someone will get in touch with me, so I don't have to see if this can be dealt with at the station on the day of the trip. I would be willing to accept a free upgrade in exchange for the refund, but we'll see how this goes. Stay tuned!

items.title: Thanks but no thanks!
items.review_text: I purchased a first class ticket from Warrington Bank Quay to Blackburn changing at Preston - cost £14.10. The Warrington to Preston train was 40 minutes late, causing me to miss my connecting train to Blackburn and making me an hour late due to the next train time to Blackburn.  I had to get a taxi to my destination as I then didn’t have time to get there on time walking. Taxi cost £4.50.  Total expenditure £18.60 and a whole lot of hassle.  Delay Repay refunded me £3.53 … yes I’m absolutely delighted.  Thanks for wasting my time and money.  I won’t be back … but I’m sure Avanti won’t care! Bring back Virgin for excellent customer service and care.

items.title: Stole my money
items.review_text: Avanti West Coast said my purchase had been unsuccessful so I tried again twice. It didn't work so I went to a different website. The next day I discovered Avanti had taken the money out of my account 3 times. I referred this to the rail ombudsman who decided that AWC should refund me but 1 year later this has not been done.

items.title: Took money - did not supply ticket
items.review_text: Avanti took the money but did not attach the tickets to the email - on both occasions within a week. Reaching them was difficult on the second occasion. The 'chat function', web form and complaint emails all no use. So I will have to re-purchase the tickets with another company. Maybe I have had bad luck but I suspect it is incompetence and lack of care about their customers.

items.title: Birmingham New street station
items.review_text:
Birmingham New street station, Saturday:-
Most machines to collect tickets out of order, customer services has 12 counters to buy tickets, etc, only. 2 open at around 10.15am!
Journeys to London are very expensive, the old first class carriages are now used as “premier” at extortionate price without any benefits apart from being less crowded; forget about first class or upgrades; only one carriage and price out of most people’s possibilities. It’s a very expensive joke!

items.title: Horrendous - spoiled trip completely
items.review_text:
Horrendous. Worst train journey ever. London to Liverpool - seats are very cramped, no leg room and narrow - I am tall and slim. It was like being strapped in to a fighter jet and going down the runway for 2,5hrs. I was unable to move at all with a person next to me. 
Coming back was even worse - jam packed - the aisles are so narrow I literally had backsides in my face as people tried to board and sit down at stops. A rucksack knocked my glasses off and every time someone passed in the aisle they knocked my arm off the armrest. 
Then to top it all I had some clown ranting at me telling me I was on the wrong train and to get out of his seat. My ticket clearly stated I was in the right seat on the right train - his ticket had slightly different time on it. This went on for about 10mins until he went away as other passengers backed me up.
About £95 each way standard class. Is pure greed to get as many seats in a coach as possible. The people that need to be moaned at are the accountants and CEO's and they will never read this. Yes staff polite but not around when getting ranted at so no use to me. If there was an emergency the narrow aisles would cause multiple deaths, I cannot believe it is legal. Would score zero or negative 9000 if I could. 
By using this company at all you are encouraging an awful operator and service.

items.title: Not helpful at all
items.review_text: Not helpful at all, I understand there's works on the lines but just release the timetable and let people know whether they can travel or not.  Withholding the timetable and leaving people wondering if they have lost all their plans and money or not is a stupid way to run a business and expect people to want to return as a customer

items.title: There are delays quite often…
items.review_text: There are delays quite often unfortunately but at least the personnel is very polite and professional

items.title: Avanti West Coast Cancellers
items.review_text: Cancelled our train to Manchester last minute…. took half of the ticket price to refund ticket….. had to pay full price for a new ticket…. Train home got replaced by much slower bus (3 hours slower)…. Crap service I’d may as well have walked 👍.

items.title: If I could leave half a star I would
items.review_text: If I could leave half a star I would. avant- West Coast have been shocking from start to finish. First of all out train from Crewe to Manchester Piccadilly was cancelled … if that wasn’t bad enough we had to pay £10 admin fees to re- book for a train 15 mins later… of no fault of our own. Them coming home we are now on a bus. The train is cancelled.. our arrival time is 1 hour and a half hours later than planned. . If we get there at the allotted time. Such shocking service. I wont be bothering eith the train again. Disgusting  service. Dont bother with the train people.

items.title: Bring back Virgin
items.review_text: Bring back Virgin! Avanti are terrible in comparison. The App is still not accepting booking tickets and they avoid paying for refunds by using a dodgy email name that goes straight to spam… ‘AWC Builder’. Booking bikes is awkward to say the least. No issues with Virgin over a number of years. Loads with this crew. Difficult to avoid sadly as they have the line!

items.title: £150 Rugby to London delayed on the…
items.review_text:
£150 Rugby to London delayed on the outbound journey (due to a local service) delayed on the return journey due to no driver!!! 

Appalling service at an extortionate price. I normally drive and will do so again in the future!!!

Just had another announcement “we’re sorry but we don’t have a driver to take us anywhere, I’ve tried contacting people and no one is responding!!!” 

Take the contract off them!!

Tried to do feedback on their website but it’s not working!!

items.title: Poor customer service 1st Class
items.review_text: Customer service training seriously needed on Avanti Trains. In 1st class from Sandwell & Dudley to Coventry. Served by Darren who I can only describe as 'robotic'. Arrives with his drinks trolley, doesn't acknowledge your presence, no good morning, proceeds to put the cup and tray in front of you, no eye contact, then says 'tea or coffee mate'. What charm school did he go to, did he miss out on the Avanti customer training day, if there is such a thing. Avanti staff need some serious customer service training urgently

items.title: Avanti are just rubbish
items.review_text: Avanti are just rubbish.  Worst operator. How are they getting away with it.  Surely the Government should take away the contract as Avanti are worse than useless.  With Virgin half of St Pancras used to surge on to the Manchester trains every 20 mins.  Now its empty seats.  How can the Government let them get away with it.  We do not want refurbishment if we cannot afford to travel.  They just loose passengers so loose money so the fares have to go up to compensate.  What were these cowboys thinking they know nothing about running a service, providing value for money.  What did they promise when they got the contract.  Kick em out and bring Virgin.  Who ran a great reasonably priced service.  So many happy faces on the trains.  Not now.  Avanti are scammers.   And they know it too.

items.title: Really poor compared to Virgin.
items.review_text:
Really poor compared to Virgin.
Expensive tickets even when booking advance.
First class is not worth the money, they seem to have a policy of providing the bare minimum and sometimes nothing is available, trains are frequently dirty and the toilets best avoided.
The website is over complicated and refunds appear to be made deliberately difficult.
Despite having the app I'm never informed of cancellations or delays.
As Avanti don't respond on here I presume they don't care.

items.title: Just traveled from haymarket to Wigan…
items.review_text: Just traveled from haymarket to Wigan with avanti very good journey with pleasant staff

items.title: All round awful
items.review_text: Absolutely shocking. They didn't realise tickets until less than a month before the date we were due to travel because they were still deciding the timetable. Then tickets cost over £100 per person to go to Manchester. The trains don't have plug sockets and are really cramped. To top it all off they cancelled trains back to London and we didn't even get an email to tell us about it - the first we knew of it was when we went to the train station to try and catch our now cancelled train. It's unfortunate this train line hasn't been nationalised or isn't open to competition because avanti west cost is very poor.

items.title: Cancellation & Delay
items.review_text: Cancelled train, then delayed train, people standing all the way from Euston to Birmingham International, staff asking for volunteers to get off the train because it was overweight and therefore unsafe. Awful experience, truly degrading

items.title: Awful
items.review_text: Awful, just awful.  How can these clowns have won the franchise from Virgin?  Despite their faults, Virgin mostly ran the trains on time.  The crap that Avanti deliver is worse than BR in their darkest days.

items.title: As a former frontline member of staff…
items.review_text:
As a former frontline member of staff serving 8-10 years having walked away because of the shambles it has become, it is sad to see the deterioration of the West Coast Mainline. The management from top to bottom are massively to blame and morale in the workplace has hit the rock beneath the rock bottom! 

Change was inevitable once Virgin had been taken over but to the extent it has happened and to how they are treating staff is only showing on the paying public. 

The job isn't hard. The customer wants value for money and a reliable service. Everything else is a bonus and comes with positive staff morale. The ship has well and truly sunk and I hope it gets made public how bad it has gone, with focus on the management who cannot run a bath between them.

items.title: Bring back Virgin!!
items.review_text:
Avanti is a terrible operator.  Why were their credentials for taking over from Virgin not investigated properly?  
I travel from Wigan to Edinburgh with Avanti West Coast regularly and the service has deteriorated badly.  The trains are ALWAYS LATE.  They were rarely late with Virgin.
 The Delay Repay scheme for compensation is (deliberately?) difficult to follow.  I have always claimed manually before (with some difficulty) but they are now forcing everyone on to Automated Delay Repay, although it will not accept the same User Name as the email address on my account!!!  This obstruction is typical of everything you try to access on their website
  The train carriages are always red hot.  Our journey last night was particularly uncomfortable.  Virgin controlled carriage heat properly.
  They have done nothing to improve anything since they took over the route.
   When I tried to complain on their website I was told to 'Please enter proper characters'  with no highlighting to indicate any errors (there are no obvious errors in my message) . . . obviously my complaint couldn't be sent because of this . . How convenient!!! 
It is a shame Avanti have a monopoly on this direct route or we would be using another supplier.

items.title: Go premium. Avoid standard and first.
items.review_text:
Essentially there’s are three classes of trave. Standard is third class and as others have mentioned, the cleaning and hygiene standards aren’t good. Standard premium is second class and the best of the three in terms of what you need. 

First class is really bad and getting worse. The service standards are embarrassingly bad and if it was a restaurant you’d walk out. Avoid.

items.title: VERY UNHELPFUL
items.review_text:
VERY UNHELPFUL 
VERY HOT IN TRAIN
very noisy
very smelly
dirty

items.title: Another dismal experience today
items.review_text:
Another terrible experience with Avanti today. Their ticket dispensers generating off peak tickets during peak time. Then being refused entry to the train. Missing my train and waiting 40 mins to the next train. The glee in the faces of the men at the barriers as they closed the barriers on others and refused others entry due to not being there 3 minutes before departure (A new Avanti rule), no empathy or humanity.

Missed putting my son to bed today.

Customers are treated like chattle. The line is more dysfunctional than when Virgin had it and service even worse, that is saying something! Rue the day they won tender. Will write to Grant Shapps.

This sort of experience is everywhere you look nowadays. Western society is lost.

items.title: So bad so sad…
items.review_text: Stale product in our facility...Always out and never enough.  Comes once a week

items.title: Travelled Thursday 14 April
items.review_text: Travelled Thursday 14 April. The 18.57 train I was booked on with reserved seat was cancelled. As it was Easter there was then two trains worth of people packed onto one, as I ran up the platform I managed to get an unreserved seat but alot were not so lucky. I have the Avanti app on my phone but they didn't bother to notify me that my train had been cancelled.  Despite Avanti emailing before the journey to say that they take extra care with cleaning this clearly was not the case, one toilet when I lifted the lid was full, so clearly they had not been through, inspected and cleaned the train. Wifi is hopeless.

items.title: Completely rubbish company
items.review_text: Completely rubbish company, can’t get anything done with them at all. Call and wait for 30mins on hold and then when they answer they are having some sort of meeting/party and I’m left on hold but I can hear the whole office and ended up ending the call. The 29th of May is still not out but every other date is? Completely rubbish. I hate them but have no choice but to use them. Please go bust soon!

items.title: 0621 Runcorn to Euston....
items.review_text: 0621 Runcorn to Euston..... it’s over a month now since I was able to complete an “at seat order” really got my hopes up this morning when I even managed to log on to the website and complete an order as well as receive a text to say it had been accepted ...... only to have my hopes dashed when another text came through 10 mins later to say it was cancelled. Apparently the system was left on by mistake from last night. Staffing issues again. Avanti stop advertising something you can’t deliver.

items.title: No Advantage to Avantis.
items.review_text:
Travelled from Liverpool to Euston Monday 11th April. Standard class with reserved seats. We got our seats OK  but as the journey progressed others were not so fortunate. We overheard several disputes between people and as others have said the staff did not intervene merely telling people over the intercom to sit where they could.
Returned to Liverpool on Thursday 14th April this time travelling first class. This is when we noticed a big difference with previous first class journeys on Virgin. There was nothing special about it unless uou consider the indifferent food. Not worth the huge increase in fare. Others who are regular rail travellers will know better than me but I think the way these contracts are awarded is flawed. Once a company has obtained the contract they can basically  do as they like so there is no competition. These contracts should be shared between several companies and obviously the one who delivers the best service will get the most customers. Surely this is how market competition works otherwise we just continually get British Rail with different names.

items.title: NEVER travel with them
items.review_text: They deserve 1-star for getting me to my destination but that's the best I could say. Travelled from London to Birmingham for a day and didn't expect so much adventure being on the train. On the way there, the train was delayed by 15 mins, which was fine until I realised the reserved seats were taken because they had combined THREE scheduled trains for unknown reason. My partner and I were lucky enough to find empty seats for our 90 mins ride. On the way back, we didn't have as much luck. On a Sunday afternoon, the train was delayed again by 15 mins because the crews were late - the least confusing part, thereby cancelling the scheduled train instead of putting on an extra one to cover their own mistake. If they could be bothered to do their research for 5 mins, they'd realise there was a huge event on in Birmingham. Therefore, putting extra trains for the PAYING customers would make sense. BUT, because providing great services isn't their priority, many of us, including myself, had to be squeezed into the cafe carriage, as there were no seats available, even though I had seats reserved. The mere fact that I got on the train was a miracle because who knows when the next one will come!! Since there were so many of us in the cafe carriage, the cafe worker decided to shut down the cafe, so NOBODY could buy food or drinks on this horrendous ride. We had no choice but to sit on the FLOOR in the cafe carriage as the ride was 90 mins long. I was OVERJOYED when I got off the train as I was feeling motion sick from lack of fresh air and rough ride.

items.title: Appalling service on and off the train
items.review_text:
Appalling service. As a regular Virgin WC traveller, I despair at what’s happened to the railway. I travelled in December and had rubbish service. I travelled first class and paid a ridiculous amount for the privilege (over £200 - which would’ve been more acceptable with Virgin service despite being about 4x as much as I ever paid virgin!), between London and Glasgow I hardly had any service, I was pleased I’d popped in to M&S at the station - not actually expecting to eat any of the food while on the train. I had also travelled during tighter covid restrictions so there is no way that this can be attributed to covid, although I can already feel the excuses being typed. Mind you and sort of communication now would be good since I provided feedback via the email address months ago - it’s now mid April and despite numerous chases I still have had no response from them. Shocking “customer service”. Everything is worse than it was with Virgin - what a disaster!! I will now choose to fly with BA who are cheaper (!!!) than Avanti and have better service (which has also declined over the years so its a very telling choice!). 

Next stop railway ombudsman.

items.title: First Class is a scam
items.review_text:
Travelled from Stafford to London Euston with their first class service after having good experiences pre-pandemic with Virgin running the same trains and route. Like many of the reviews here there was no food or drink service at all - just a bottle of water handed out by a member of staff who announced to us that we should complain to Avanti about the lack of drink or food service.

After my trip I got the same response back from Avanti that everyone else here has - that the food and drink service is "complimentary" so would not issue a refund of the difference between the price of standard and first class. Despite by their own admission they know that the drink and food service is a big part of why people buy first class in the first place!

No food and drink service is happening too often to be just an accident, they very clearly are running a scam to charge top dollar without having to actual provide any of the services they advertise, and knowing they have an effective monopoly on certain routes they think they can get away with it.

Avoid first class entirely and if at all possible consider another provider. It'll be slower but at least they won't blatantly rip you off.

items.title: Appalling refund system
items.review_text: Train arrived 55 minutes late - not Avanti’s fault, but their compensation system is awful - clearly designed to make it as hard as possible so customers give up. After finally managing to set up an account Avanti would only refund one of the four tickets I purchased as their system cannot cope with someone purchasing more than one ticket at a time. I had purchased four tickets as it was a family trip to London - but impossible to obtain refund for more than one. Unfortunately Avanti now has a monopoly on north west main line and it will be 10 years before Virgin (who were willing to refund for actual tickets purchased rather than only one no matter how many tickets you purchased and used) get another shot at this. If you have no option but to use Avanti make sure you only book one ticket at a time - ridiculous administrative hassle but this company likes to make it as hard as possible for you to access reasonable level of service.

items.title: 48 minutes on hold to change my…
items.review_text: 48 minutes on hold to change my reserved seats, the booking system put myself and my partner sat In front of each other not side by side.. why?? so .. tbf easily changed while speaking to the guy on phone, why can’t I do this online? Seat prices rocketed since the good ol ‘ Virgin days, not seeing any benefits and with the reviews I’ve just read.. woeful! Sort it out Avanti

items.title: Staff unhelpful and arrogant
items.review_text:
Staff unhelpful and arrogant, how things have changed since the pandemic, got a train from Preston (Avanti staff here are on a massive ego trip, don't think they like customers, especially asking questions)
Think the executives need to come out and view their appalling staff .. Catch the bus longer but friendlier service

items.title: Regular traveller (1st Class)
items.review_text:
A regular traveller (1st Class) with Avanti between London Euston and Glasgow Central.  Overall a good experience - the First Class coaches are comfortable, the staff polite/efficient and the food/table service is good.

Only downsides for me are the lack of hot meat options on the rest of day food menu and the sluggish uploading of seat reservation information on the onboard screens at the terminal stations.

items.title: No stars - NEVER again!
items.review_text: I would give no stars if that was an option. Delayed train service and cancelled trains. Wasted 2 hours in delays. Waited 1.5 hours to speak to resolution centre, who did not help. The final end of the straw, filed a complaint that was not even addressed and the concerns were completely ignored. They closed the case without dealing with the the request!!!

items.title: Reluctant to give even 1 star.
items.review_text:
Reluctant to give even 1 star.
Absolutely shocking experience travelling to London. The cancellation of trains meant we had to board an overcrowded  train and sit in a corridor for over 2 hours, cheek to jowl with other passengers. I would suggest Avanti remove their posters reminding customers to adhere to social distancing - the irony! We arrived at our destination 2 hours late. 
The return journey was at least roughly on time but the train was overcrowded and filthy.
Last night my son was travelling from London and, because Avanti were running late, missed his connection at Lancaster resulting in a wait of over 2 hours.
I will be reluctant to travel with Avanti again and will drive.

items.title: Over priced first class.
items.review_text: Travelled first class from Euston to Rugby. First class ticket is expensive. Train was crowded and they ran out of food. I raised this with the staff who were not very helpful.

items.title: Firstly no notification through the app…
items.review_text: Firstly no notification through the app but when we arrived at the station our train was cancelled luckily we arrived very early and just managed to get the last train to London. We couldn’t have the seats we booked and despite being 50 minutes delayed didn’t get the automatic refund promised. Return journey filthy train. Our seats had not been booked when we politely spoke to the passengers sat in them and showed them our booking we got a lot of abuse. Vile passengers coughing on us with tissues on the table and staff who just didn’t care. The train was packed so we had no choice to sit and put up with it. Ruined our weekend away.

items.title: Totally awful
items.review_text: Totally awful. Website clunky and slow. Timetables often not available requiring repeat visits. Expensive (any class). 1st class lounge not a patch on what it used to be under Virgin. I often use east coast trains now. Much cleaner,  easier site, cheaper and altogether better experience. This company has been awful on  the west coast from the beginning. I would give it 0  stars if I could. Bring back  Virgin!

items.title: Absolutely disgusted
items.review_text: Absolutely disgusted.  No service from customer support. complained on line (eventually) and reply was possible 4 weeks until query response. can't log in to my account as won't accept the log in even with a new and changed password. Hugely frustrating and just feel i don't want any more to do with Avanti West Coast who clearly need to get their act together.

items.title: Train from Wolverhampton to Crewe…
items.review_text: Train from Wolverhampton to Crewe delayed by 15 minutes so missed our connection to Manchester Airport. Now have to pay a £65 taxi to get us to the airport on time because there isn't another train for an hour! Staff were absolutely s**t, no help at all. When I asked how they planned to get me to the airport on time, the advised me to get a taxi outside. You work for the f***** train company and your advice is 'get a taxi'. Brilliant.

items.title: Awful
items.review_text: Awful. Train over subscribed and all the reservations weren’t working. What is the point of booking a seat ahead if you can’t them actually find a seat as all the reservations are broken? Dirty train too.

items.title: Shocking service from London Euston
items.review_text: Shocking service from London Euston - Manchester last Sunday 27 March. 2 trains cancelled so they allowed so many people on the train there was not a single inch of standing room on the train. two hours standing at £183, they are a total disgrace but they dont care as we as travellers have little choice.

items.title: The trains are terrible
items.review_text:
The trains are terrible, London Northwestern railway class 350 seats are much better than Avanti westcoast. The passenger assist staff for Avanti are rude, and unhelpful, We almost missed our connection at Crewe on 28/03/22 due to the electric to the train being turned off due to a signal fault some 30+ miles away! and the train only some 100yds from the platform. When the train eventually arrived into the platform, the assistance staff could not care less told us there's your connection, run for it, how can we do that when we are disabled and using a walker as we have difficulty with walking. 
This company is C**P, I will never travel with them ever again.

items.title: I despair of Avanti
items.review_text: Last year, after a significant and unexplained delay and after raising a complaint, I finally received some rail vouchers from Avanti that I was entitled to. I also received a letter apologising for the delay and offering me a 25 per cent discount on my next journey. In order to obtain this discount I would need to buy my next ticket over the phone and quote a reference number given in the letter. I tried to phone on a number of occasions but always got recorded messages saying I was in a queue with an expected waiting time of never less than fifteen minutes and frequently of an hour or more. I ended up booking online and paying the full price. This morning, needing to make another journey, I tried again and this time got through surprisingly quickly. A helpful woman told me the reference number I quoted was no longer valid as a new system had been introduced. She went off to consult her manager and I was kept on hold for a while, with constant reassurances from her that the problem was being resolved, until she was able to give me a discount code which she told me I could use at the checkout when booking online. So, I book my ticket online, am about to enter the discount code when I read that they cannot be used in conjunction with a rail card. I’m a Senior Railcard holder. The reduction the card gives is greater than the 25 discount I would receive by using the code. So the whole sorry exercise has been a complete waste of my time and phone bill.

items.title: The costs!!!
items.review_text: The costs!!!! Stratospherically expensive!

items.title: Avanti are a joke
items.review_text:
Avanti are a joke. In January we were returning from Euston to Manchester on a Saturday evening. They started cancelling all of the trains north due to lack of staff. We cancelled our plans and raced to the station as we realised there was only one train home. We got to the barrier to be told we couldn’t board because they didn’t allow you to embark less than 2 minutes prior to departure. A fair enough rule perhaps but it was 4 minutes from departure and didn’t leave for another 8 minutes anyway as the staff weren’t on the train yet. As we were arguing the toss the staff approached and were allowed through. Made no sense. We were a foot from the train, on time, the train was then late, the staff weren’t on it and they knew it was the only train home for us. Needless to say we had a nightmare journey home.

Fast forward to last weekend. We went to Wembley to watch England play. Only two trains available post match one of which was impossible to make if you wanted to see the end. The only train you could make then got cancelled. Had to leave the game early, travel for about 4 hours with various stops. All this cost over £100 each.

The trains are dirty, the staff do nothing about people sat in your pre booked seat and the toilets are an absolute disgrace if they are even open. 

Unfortunately I doubt any of this will change because there isn’t an alternative so it seems there is little motivation for them to improve.

items.title: We had an excellent experience
items.review_text: We had an excellent experience. We booked the ticket from London to Manchester the day before and it was a third of the price of what we would’ve paid when virgin operated the service. The trains run on time, was clean, and the staff are really friendly. I will definitely use them again!

items.title: Bring back Virgin
items.review_text:
Due to Corona, I stopped travelling to London but now things have opened up again it’s back on the trains. For two decades I used Virgin and although things sometimes went wrong it was never ever as consistently or gratuitously as bad as Avanti. 
From the crap booking app to the state of the trains to the delays. 
When a new provider took over from Virgin it should have been like for like, not like to sh*te. 
I hate traveling from Chester to London. Avanti got rid of the direct trains so it’s back to the old change at Crewe routine where it’s a fight for seats or getting people out of your booked ones.
If I could give zero stars I would. 
Not to mention Avanti have hiked the fares for their diabolical service. 
Scandalous.

items.title: Third Class Travel on Avanti
items.review_text: I have made a few trips to London now from the North West with Avanti and it isn’t a pleasant experience.  The trains are far inferior to the Virgin trains that used to run on this line.  For £25 per ticket per journey you can upgrade to ‘premium’ and standard class is very much third class.  Tight on room, dirty and usually overbooked.   I have made three return journeys from Blackpool North in the last few months and have had to travel via Manchester for two of the six journeys.  Last Sunday there were a huge number of cancellations from Euston on all Avanti services due to staff shortages.  They announce this as though it’s an act of God not their own mismanagement.  However, the staff at Euston were very helpful in rearranging our journey.  I know there were reasons why Virgin were denied the continued running of this service but it has resulted in a huge drop in standards for the consumer.

items.title: I haven’t had an issue
items.review_text: Have been using them for the past 6 months for my weekly commute and not had a problem. Might be because I’m on the first train and last train back but have always found a seat, crew are lovely when I’ve spoken to them

items.title: So I've been using Virgin trains Euston…
items.review_text: So I've been using Virgin trains Euston to up North for 5 years, never before this service was as bad as  during my past few journeys and not one way but both ways... First of all there was always enough space to sit for most people both ways with 2 seats for one person, but now they are overcrowded , late 1 hour and go through Birmingham ... Awful.. Virgin was better

items.title: Would give zero stars if I could
items.review_text: Would give zero stars if I could. Train late, then massively overbooked, in both directions. Children, mothers sitting on the floor. Canteen closed due to overcrowding. Questionable what the ticket price is paying for.

items.title: Worst service ever been booked with 3…
items.review_text: Worst service ever been booked with 3 little kids and suitcases on an overtakes train no seats no luggage space standing in the doorway from Scotland to England with 3 little kids utter disgrace of a service will not be using my return ticket back and never use this service again absolute disgusting

items.title: Joke compony
items.review_text:
What a joke this compony is.
I think it is the worst I have ever dealt with.
The service and trains not to bad but it was sent up for them by virgin trains.
Their customer care service is awful I have had to ring them 3 times in the past fortnight and spent a hour each time trying to get through and they still havnt sorted the issue out.
And their vouchers they give out for not used train journeys is a waste of time as they do not give you the option of using them on their app.
Unfortunately their is no other way of me getting up north once a fortnight if there was I would never use this compony.

items.title: Customer Service is a disgrace
items.review_text: Customer Service is a disgrace. They never answer the question asked and/ or send a totally unrelated e mail. I  e mailed to ask why I was no longer able to book mobile tickets even though it is set for these in my account settings. I specifically  asked them to please answer the question. Today I received a totally unrelated e mail about Advance tickets and coronavirus. They are appalling. Ticket prices very high. Service is dreadful. So much worse than Virgin.

items.title: Very unreliable service
items.review_text: In October last year I was emailed after a complaint offering me 2 first class returns valid for 12 months! I opted to be emailed when advance tickets were available for my chosen dates! This morning received email and immediately went online to find nothing yet available for chosen dates! Left couple of hours and tried again, this time dates available but message said 'SOLD OUT!'. Already booked and paid for accommodation and am finding Avanti a very frustrating company to deal with (that is putting it politely!). Looks like another complaint via ombudsman if I do not get a positive response!

items.title: Hi after they gave us a voucher towards…
items.review_text:
Hi after they gave us a voucher towards our new journey beacuse if the mix up with trains  and we had to pay  extra for travel the new tickets never worked over 10 months was always so out . 

Emailed and called with no response and help avoid this train company 
Not even worth to use it for cheap  traveling

items.title: Everything poor from service to having…
items.review_text: Everything poor from service to having to pay extra to use USB port! I mean even megabus has these ports! Of course ticket is overpriced. I travelled Manchester London return for £93. Cheaper to go Leeds London and get better for your money

items.title: We had two journeys on February 13 th …
items.review_text:
We had two journeys on February 13 th  where we paid fir first class both ways and no first class service was available 
Even the train manager to,d us to claim a refund 
I have sent proof of my tickets to get a refund and at least 15 emails 
ABSOLUTELY NO RESPONSE

items.title: Massively overpriced, extremely poor service
items.review_text: Massively overpriced, extremely poor service. £100 for a ticket from London to Stockport and not even a seat. Makes me wish that the railways could be renationalised.

items.title: Amazing customer service today from…
items.review_text: Amazing customer service today from heather and Alison. They were so helpful and friendly. Really appreciated after a long day. They are a credit to you  x

items.title: Depressing.
items.review_text: Expensive ticket .  Dirty smelly overcrowded train . Such a shame . Depressing….

items.title: £100 for a adult return journey on a…
items.review_text:
£100 for a adult return journey on a Sunday from Manchester to Euston that takes 3.5 hours to get there . 

Again, i think I’ll stick to driving there and back to watch my football team! 

Rip off !!

items.title: Avanti 3rd Class officially launched
items.review_text:
Avanti have re-introduced 3rd class or even Cattle Class transport.
Overheated and overcrowded carriages, toilets that don't work and have no clean water for sanitation.
Absolute joke for the price of tickets- no wonder they try to up sell.
Safer not to travel!!
Virgin were 100x better than this. Staff, trains and infrastructure.
Hopefully Avanti loose their franchises soon and the award process is reviewed.

items.title: Poor service as usual
items.review_text: They are not showing any signs of improvement! 18/03/22 10:45 train from Wolverhampton to London Euston. Arrived to the platform, no information about the destination on coach door displays or on the internal displays, no announcements on the move about the destination. The driver was announcing the next stations only. The only faint indication of me being on the right train was that I took it from the platform indicated on station trans display.

items.title: Genuine mistake costs extra
items.review_text: Never normally have any problems with avanti or staff but this time not the case. Paid supplement on my way to Blackpool to sit in standard premium. I never normally do this. Coming back from Blackpool I sat in standard premium again as genuinely did not realise supplements were one way. Apologised and explained that as I never normally upgrade I didn't realise. I was told I'd have to move Down or pay. I was happy to move down but as I'd travelled from Blackpool north and my ticket wasn't checked he charged me anyway. I can understand its a procedure but why say move down or pay then charge me anyway all because of that.

items.title: Appalling customer service.
items.review_text:
Appalling customer service.
Lots of promises but no action
Tried to change dates of travel due to hospital appoint meant -system full of error messages
Tried to ring and gave up after an hour on hold 


Absolutely useless

items.title: Bring back Virgin!
items.review_text:
My oh my, what has happened to this train service?!

When Avanti won the contract from Virgin, they promised great things. Obviously, this was all hot air and lies.  As someone who travels multiple times per week on the service, here are my thoughts:

1) All they have done is put a sticker on the old Virgin trains. So they are running 20 year old trains that badly need replaced.
2) Prices have went up.
3) Service frequency has reduced from my station (Macclesfield) to London.
4) First class lounge at Euston is table service only.  They will say this is because of COVID (which is nonsense). In reality, it's a way to cut cost by sitting you down and ignoring you for half an hour.
5) Food in first class is poor. Options are limited, menu items are not fulfilled and you will be VERY LUCKY to be asked if you want a second drink.

items.title: Absolute Carnage
items.review_text:
I am currently sat in coach D having boarded at Manchester to Euston. 

The reservation system wasn’t downloaded so people with reserved seats were asking people sat in their seat to move and they were refusing as it was busy. 

They have overbooked this train big time and anyone would think covid was over - news flash.. it isn’t! 

My advice to anyone is to board your train as soon as it pulls into the station and sit in your reserved seat even if you have to wait 30 minutes on the platform. 

As a disabled traveller I did just this and sat in my seat - I wouldn’t have been able to stand for over 2 hours… 

The seats in standard are very tiny.. I think I’m going to upgrade my seat coming back - I feel like a sardine..

items.title: Had to queue even though I'd already…
items.review_text:
Had to queue even though I'd already purchased my tickets as all the collection machines were out of order at a main station on the west coast line. .Queue at the ticket office window was 20+ people Despite arriving over 30 mins early for my journey, I made my train to the midlands with less than a minute to spare!
- thanks avanti

but wait....apparently its my fault for not ordering a smart card & loading my tickets onto that.

I don't want a smart card I just want old fashioned tickets - how hard can it be

Whats that - you're very sorry & will send me another complimentary journey code that won't be accepted by your booking system. brilliant customers service

items.title: Worst Ever Travelling Experience
items.review_text: The worst ever train experience I have ever had. To start with, my pre-booked seat in 1st Class was occupied by a European female. I was told by a group of individuals sitting on the opposite side that their train was cancelled and they all had to board this train. They demanded that I sit on another seat. I had no choice as there were no staff present or any means to contact staff. This was the case throughout my journey. There were a number of other instances which I can't seem to forget. It appears that the good days with Virgin Trains are gone now!

items.title: Anti Avanti - going nowhere
items.review_text: What is going on with this business Sunday 13th March 4 out 5 trains from Glasgow to London not running. The one train that was running was 9 cars, not 11 and although declassified was still standing only from Glasgow. The train manager was encouraging people to get off (to a following train) or threatening to terminate the train due to overcrowdning (not helpful) Same issues going northbound from what I can see at Euston. I believe a shortage of drivers is to blame...that has to be the responsibility of Avanti..the on board crew (apart from the train maanger), were brilliant

items.title: They  are always cancelling trains last…
items.review_text: They  are always cancelling trains last minute and the wifi is not working most of the time.expensive and not worth it.

items.title: Never again!
items.review_text:
BHI - Edin 11/03/22
Cramped, uncomfortable, noisy, long journey.
Never again will I ever set foot on an Avanti train.
Despite having booked my seat, no seat was available. We were told to sit anywhere as they hadn’t put enough carriages on!
I found a seat in the “quiet zone” carriage.
Full of loud drunks passing alcohol around. Loud telephone calls being made right left and centre. 
Packed in like sardines.
No staff came anywhere near the carriage on the whole journey.
Eventually I sat on the floor in the corridor to escape the drunkenness and noise.

items.title: Avanti train from Manchester Piccadilly…
items.review_text: Avanti train from Manchester Piccadilly are Filthy. You're likely to get Covid-19 on these trains. Disgraceful and they charge a fortune for the ticket.

items.title: Service down, prices up
items.review_text:
The journey and service isn’t the worst, but there are elements missing that are advertised as included on the website. For instance, I’ve just had my 3rd consecutive journey where at seat service wasn’t included and this journey didn’t have Wi-Fi either. If you pay the extra 25-40 for Standard Premium, you’re literally just paying for additional legroom. It is also more expensive than the previous operator Virgin’s First Class service, which included a lounge stop at major stations and guaranteed cart service to your seat.

I’d advise the company to stop advertising this service as included on the website as it’s false advertising by my experience and looking at the other reviews, they feel the same way. False expectation setting is just going to increase the number of complaints and taint the company’s reputation.

items.title: Extremely poor and inefficient customer service…
items.review_text:
Extremely poor and inefficient customer service.
Take too long to respond to emails. 
Can't speak to anyone on the phone - 45 min 30 sec and no reply.
My contact was due to a delay/repay claim for only £15:59 for a late train on 28/11/21.
Amount awarded based on a late train the previous day (27th).
My uploaded ticket was clearly only valid from the 28th. Their clerical error but no apology for this.
A very time consuming and frustrating experience.Became a matter of principle to claim an entitlement.
The matter has STILL not been fully resolved!
Bring back Virgin Trains.

items.title: No frills…or indeed anything at all
items.review_text: No WiFi, no shop, no promised ‘at seat service’. New ‘standard premium tickets are a con - you don’t get anything extra for your money. Make sure you stock up on food and drink before boarding and use the toilet - the ones on offer are usually out of order. Staff not to blame - the company is. Consider travelling with competitor…oh no wait

items.title: Always late
items.review_text: Always late. Always packed. Journey to penrith often overbooked and late. Claimed for late train 45 minutes and unsuccessful as they decided I could have managed to get back to tunbridge wells 8 mins late. Not sure how when we were 45 mins late into Euston. Travelled on virgin alot and never as bad as avanti ever

items.title: Terrible service, every time.
items.review_text: Horrific. Every single time the trains are either packed full of people having to stand down the aisles, delayed or cancelled. My 30 minute journey costs £40 which I would call a premium price, for an extremely poor service. The worst thing is this review will make no difference to the fat cat who is quite happy just pocketing all of our money.

items.title: Back onboard and Avanti have not…
items.review_text:
Back onboard and Avanti have not disappointed
spent twenty minutes to log on and try to upgrade only to find that although upgraded at a cost of £25 (Not a bad price) but even though I paid none of the upgrades were available)

Have Avanti ever heard of a saying called absolute Trollocks you should be ashamed but we know you aren't. Whilst you are an Italian company and rely on the fact that British People dont complain you would do well to know that people who use the ex much better run Virgin line are hacked off

items.title: Bad experience and appalling customer…
items.review_text: Bad experience and appalling customer (NON) service. Had booked 1st class ticket using their website and a different ticket for outward service using Trainline. Due to severe illness I was unable to travel. Got in touch with Trainline asking to cancel ticket and for a refund. This was 2 days before travel. Got a very compassionate member of staff within a few minutes who did everything he could to help and now received full refund. Avanti however, after been on hold for 50 minutes, while their message told me 15 minute waiting time, a unfriendly woman told me no, you cannot have your money back. This is for a trip 10 days from calling them. She did not care at all and just said that it is their T&C's and what Trainline did was up to them. This is not the first time Avanti service is appalling.... Wish Virgin Trains was still here....shame on you Avanti

items.title: Service or Scam
items.review_text: If you can make your own travel arrangements, you will save yourself being scammed at least half a dozen times on a simple return journey from south to north and back. Share cars, walk, cycle, whatever…just don’t waste your hard earned money and precious time travelling by train.

items.title: Imcompendant company yhey pass you to…
items.review_text: Imcompendant company yhey pass you to pillow to pist you don't get any where with this services I wouldn't travel on there trains shameless services.

items.title: No train!!!!!!
items.review_text: Arrived at Rugby train station for the 8.23 to Euston to take my partner away for his birthday, only to be told the train doesn’t exist. No email to inform me of this or to change trains. No one was interested at all. The guy in customer services must have been off when the course was running because he was so unhelpful. This is no way to treat returning customers, even a free coffee, free upgrade to first class as a gesture of goodwill. The train we did get on was full of football fans drinking, swearing and shouting at 9.23 in the morning. You don’t see an inspector then do you??? Disgraceful service!!!??!

items.title: Worst customer service and employees clearly not trained or attended the training. Deplorable!!
items.review_text: Worst customer service, worst customer assistance. Turkei and his friends are not morale and ethical. They just said one thing and belittled you until they ticket you despite you pay proof!!!! Shocking company and shocking expierence. Never again never again. Also had conflicting messages from employees who when challenged on their "view of what you had done". The conductor, then subsequent Avanti staff really rude, talking over you and then retracting the initial help offered. We even watched someone who hadn't pay walk away whilst they tried to assault her by using physical force before then letting her leave and then charging us £94.00 for a ticket we had booked online but due to a machine error this hadn't printed both. We showed reciept from the machine, from trainline and also our bank transfer. They would rather harass paying customers for more money than actually tackle the issue with people not paying. No humanity, no compassion or empathy and treated like a criminal despite having proof of tickets. Ridiculous company which I'd rather walk than use!! Boycot this shammy company who are represented by absolute clowns!!! The disparity between their website and actual customer service is unreal and again the staff who some struggled with common courtesy left both myself and my wife feeling absolutely scammed by a reputable company. Time to turn the rail back to the state because this company through its rude and inflammatory staff members X 4 have shown that Avanti trains are inept in every fashion and focus on being rude and escalatory rather than genuine customer service. Appalling!!!

items.title: 1st class no food,  standard class train booked directly with avanti  didn't exist.
items.review_text:
Awful.
