First train I booked in January, I booked first class..  No food was available no hot drinks available because of a water issue.  Was told to contact and apply for a refund.  No response from santi to my email. 
From then on I booked premium. Or standard so not to waste money on service not available.
On 28th Feb I booked a train for 5th March from Coventry to euston. I booked through their website directly from a train at 8:11am and reserved a seat with a table as I needed to work. 
I arrived at the station to be informed my train didn't exist, that the 8:11 service hadn't ran since covid and I could take the next train 20 minutes later..  Meaning I was late for my connection and meeting.
I boarded the train to find my seat wasn't reserve and the tables were full .
The ticket man on the train was not interested and dismissive. 
The staff at Coventry were the same. 
Awful service,  no communication. No help,  no compensation, since I can't apply for delay repay on a train that doesn't exist 🙄🙄🙄

items.title: Nothing but problems
items.review_text: Every train journey I've had since September 2021 has been hit with problems. Christmas Eve every train back to Coventry from New Street was cancelled. Had to run to a different station to get a train to Leamington, then get a lift back to Coventry to pick up my car. Train to London over 90mins late, overcrowded and couldn't even get to seats we had booked. Stood all the way and in pain due to medical condition. Return train from London cancelled. Next train cancelled. Ended up having to go to Rugby and again get picked up and taken to retrieve my car. Avanti have refunded a measly £12, having first tried to tell me my return train was not delayed, then telling me its was delayed leaving but arrived on time. This will be the same train that was cancelled... disgusting company, I'll pay the congestion charge and drive in future. Furious

items.title: Train OK, IF you can book.
items.review_text: Train OK, but the booking system is an embarrasing mess - for example giving false information about pricing - according to their website two tickets at £54:00 each amount to £144:90.  I tried to put a screen print here, as I agree it doesn't seem believable -  but this can't accept screen prints apparently.

items.title: Restored my faith in humanity, while delivering outstanding service. Thank you so much!
items.review_text:
I can see a marked improvement in Avanti’s Service. Having travelled first class before a few years back I found it was not a patch on Virgin. But I’ve just had the most remarkable experience today where they not only restored my faith in humanity but totally shone. Having just spent a week in Great Ormond Street hospital in London with my daughter who had two brain surgeries, I was getting stressed in a very busy standard class. Worrying about all the bags above her head and not being able to sit next to her. I decided to upgrade to 1st class, no matter the cost. I was a bit distraught and very worried about the journey ahead (13.37 train to Blackpool, our stop was Wolverhampton) and I think the attendant picked up on this & the obvious head bandage & stitches. They upgraded us to 1st class for free and treated us like a queen & princess, giving us beautiful afternoon tea. It honestly bought tears to my v distressed eyes. 

Stuart and team. Thank you so very much for making our day/week. We were so very grateful. Onwards and upwards Avanti 😍

items.title: Deceitful website sale practices
items.review_text: I booked a ticket from Brighton to London by train. I later found out that the line was not working and was using buses. The time was double the usual. Nowhere in the ticket was the indication that it is a bus service. Cancelled but still charged me 10GBP for the service fee. Note that if you try to call waiting time is 30+ minutes. The online service answered after 2 weeks. What service. A complete waste of money. I won`t be making the mistake again of using them in the future that's for sure.

items.title: Bring back Virgin
items.review_text: Bring back Virgin - this must be the worst service in the world!  Trains cancelled without notice, fees charged to have a seat, and then the temerity to offer a paltry partial refund for the inconvenience and stress caused.  From now on it's back to using the car, at least it's reliable and sets off when I want it to, rather than at some random time

items.title: Tuesday 1st march ,tube strike arrived…
items.review_text:
Tuesday 1st march ,tube strike arrived at Euston one hour late ,after being in a taxi for two hours,usual journey 45 minutes.we had booked disability assistance.when we arrived in a distressed ,state
the staff took over completely with help and assistance .being late we had missed our pre booked slot.within 20 minutes we where seated,on a later train.a very big big. Thanks to all your caring staff .well done.mr Mrs watson.from  BOLTON..

items.title: An ordeal!
items.review_text: My journey was an ordeal. The train I had booked had been cancelled (although I hadn't been notified of that). The alternative train was horrendously overcrowded with many passengers standing from London to Birmingham. The train staff were nowhere to be found. As a result of the overcrowding, it was pretty well impossible to get to the buffet. All in all, the Avanti service is markedly inferior to the previous Virgin offering.

items.title: 0 negative stars
items.review_text: It is the worst company you can find... We traveled standing all the way without the possibility of sitting down, it arrived late, they assigned us different seats and on top of that they were already reserved for other people, there was no staff on the train to organize anything. Everything was an absolute disaster, people unable to move in the corridors and unable to use the bathrooms. I hope that all the complaints reached a higher body so that they could eliminate the company. 0 stars because I can't put them and of course we don't think about buying any more tickets. I hope this company goes away.

items.title: Train back from London to Manchester…
items.review_text: Train back from London to Manchester after the previous train had been cancelled. This 5 star review is for the train manager Michelle, rather than the company itself (the previous train was cancelled due to staffing issues). Michelle was doing about 5 jobs and was very kind and helpful throughout. Shame the company don’t have more staff like this and then they wouldn’t need to cancel trains!

items.title: Do not trust the at seat service!
items.review_text: Do not trust the at seat service! On a train from Euston to Liverpool, I took advantage of the At Seat service and ordered a coffee, paying £2.60 by PayPal. About ten minutes later, I got a message from Avanti saying they couldn't deliver the order, but my PayPal account would not be charged. Didn't think much more about it, till I got my bank statement and saw that I had, indeed, been charged for the invisible drink!  Tried to complain, filled in a huge form, got no response till today, when I got a communication from someone in a far away place, commiserating about my travel delay (??) and explaining how to claim a refund on tickets. Be warned!  Don't try to use the At Seat service, they will just take your money and not refund!

items.title: Awful!
items.review_text:
Awful!! Paid £94 to sit on the floor of an overbooked train, with broken toilets and a broken shop that also happens to be running late, utterly miserable experience! 
Do better

items.title: Avanti cancelled my train to Glasgow
items.review_text: Avanti cancelled my train to Glasgow. Their pathetic website is so useless. They make it as difficult as possible for anyone to reclaim a refund. And the train I had to book as an alternative is of course 50% more expensive. Still haven't been able to claim a refund as the "send" button is greyed out. No indication of why that might be. No red fields, and I accepted the Functional cookie setting as required. And trying to speak to a real person: forget it. Why HM Government has handed then a franchise is beyond comprehension. It certainly shouldn't be renewing it!!

items.title: I dont undertstand how the government…
items.review_text: I dont undertstand how the government havent stepped in! Again issue to high priced ticket. Paid for a ticket 170£ returning at 15:59, got to the station early so asked if my ticket was valid on the earlier service 15:07 they said yes. When im on the train underway the conductor said my ticket wasnt valid as it was non peak and had to pay another 140£. Both Avanti trains, how can 15:59 be non peak yet 15:07 is peak. Really they need to take this away from this company. Never thought id be saying come back Virgin.

items.title: Appalling attitude in First Class service staff
items.review_text: After > 24 hours of travel from Florida and cancellations on other rail services we finally boarded the last leg of our journey from Carlisle to Edinburgh which was several hours late .. We had first class tickets so boarded the first of 2 available carriages and stowed our luggage. We were then confronted by the rudest young lady Avanti employee who basically told us that the carriage was only for her Avanti customers and there would be no service for anyone else . My wife attempted to explain that we were not requiring food , but only a seat and tea if possible . This was rudely ignored and she basically repeated her previous statement and told us and another visiting American couple who had also boarded , to leave. To be clear , we are pensioners , we were cold and exhausted , had first class tickets and there was plenty of room in the carriage and as it was now direct to Edinburgh, noone else would be boarding . I was a Senior Manager when i worked in Financial Services and i travelled a lot on mainly air and rail . This kind of attitude is NEVER allowed in firms who pride themselves in customer service . The Americans were appalled … Avanti need to address this or lose customers.

items.title: Don't Trust The App And Don't Engage With Customer Services - It's Either Non-existent Or Useless!
items.review_text:
I won't bother mentioning the near-constant delays, the daily cancellation of services because of a lack of staff to cover, etc., etc., because they share this ignoble trait with West Midlands Trains who also operate services into Birmingham for the area; instead, I'll focus on the Avanti app and the Customer Service Assistants which sit behind it.

In a word: laughable.  Or it would be if these things didn't waste my time, money and effort.

The Avanti app - which I was told by the aforementioned CSAs, had been re-written for an 18th February re-launch (it wasn't/hadn't at time of writing) in order to iron out "known bugs" - manages the absolute basics reasonably well ... but has some distinct limitations such as the inability to book a ticket from around 15 minutes before the train you require actually arrives (or is scheduled to arrive).

Then there's the fact the app changed (changes?) return train tickets to singles during the booking process if you have to add in a new payment method or reconfirm your password or change it because their systems are 'confused' (a trait that's common between app and staff!).  Having had to re-enter passwords and this code and that several times (because it informed me my password was incorrect - it wasn't) I didn't notice this change in ticket type. 

I'm extremely technically-literate ... so none of this is simple user error, as the CSA's attempted to insinuate!

Ultimately, I gave up with the CSA's as their idea of customer service is to:
i)  Take an inordinate amount of time to respond (after the obsequious and platitudinous auto-response promising faithfully that you are a valued customer - utter rubbish); then 
ii)  Respond as if they've read someone else's eMail correspondence; thirdly, 
iii)  Reply to additional correspondence with the all-too-typical "...that's not our department, you need to contact X, Y, Z..." instead.

Customer service is all about ownership of the problem and, as part of that, actually understanding what the issue is happens to be a rather fundamental part of that process.  These CSA's (quite the misnomer, that, as customer service is clearly not something they are attempting) seemingly don't even have the most basic grasp of the English language either that or - and call me cynical here - Avanti are hoping customers simply give up when faced with such manifest ineptitude.  I know I have!

So, I gave up - after all, it was only a few quid - and decided to write this instead: a far better use of my time than dealing with this bunch of fools.

It's no wonder most companies don't publish a telephone help line (or bother answering it in a timely fashion) because then their customers would actually be able to hold them to account for their poor service then and there, as opposed to all this frustratingly drawn-out to-ing and fro-ing where the supplier is in complete control of the process, not the customer.  

But, then, these suppliers know this ... which is why they can get away with such dire customer service in the first instance.  It's simply too much trouble to go through all the formal channel to remedy service shortfalls.

PS  AWC - please don't bother replying to this correspondence in order to salve your corporate image, your platitudinous rhetoric has wasted far too much of my time already.

items.title: The train staff were really nice but…
items.review_text: The train staff were really nice but the first class food is terrible. This train company is being run into the ground by bad management choices and overall poor customer service. If you want to complain, good luck kk.... you'll be waiting 6 months to get a response

items.title: Rubbish service and company
items.review_text: On 17th February the 11.10 service from London Euston to Glasgow Central was a disgrace. Train cancellation at Preston and the staff lie to the passengers that there is a train to Carlisle followed by a coach to Glasgow Central. We are dumped in Preston with nobody on the platform to help the stranded passengers. Staff do not give a damn and there is no care for the passengers. Tried to get a refund and AWC have no interest in giving a refund. Find all excuses under the sun not to give the refund. One star for AWC is far too generous. They deserve a minus star.

items.title: Always good when I've used them
items.review_text:
Every time I've travelled with them, they have been great actually. They are normally on time or at most 10 minutes late.

The other passengers are disgusting and cough everywhere without masks on, but they can't do much about the disgusting passengers.

items.title: Seat reservation system crash
items.review_text: I booked two tickets to Euston on the Avanti web page. I successfully reserved our preferred seats for the outgoing journey but when I tried to change the default Avanti choice for the return journey the web page crashed - several times, until I gave up trying and accepted the original seats. I then emailed Avanti to report the crash (with diagnostics) and a request to  amend the seat reservation four days before the outward trip. I got a reply ten days after that, and seven days after we'd returned home. It ignored the report of the software fault and suggested it might be better if I got in touch as soon as I could (possibly before I made the reservation?). Hell is truly a place where the Italians run the railways

items.title: Awful experience several times…
items.review_text:
Awful experience several times travelling first class. We had several return trips going from Wolverhampton to London in Nov/Dec. Back in Sept, they relaunched their first class dining service to much fanfare after a hiatus caused by the pandemic. 

On each of the return journeys in Nov/Dec they had 'declassified' the train meaning there is no first class. Not that anybody bothers to tell you that, so you're left wandering, wondering and without any of the promised food, drink and service (and some customers even lost their reserved first class seats to yobs from standard class who told them that declassified means a free-for-all and any seat can be taken by anyone) and dying of thirst as we hadn't bought any drink, and couldn't even access the cafe carriage as it was two connected trains running as one and we were on the dark side.

On one journey, the train manager cheerily tells us it's easy to get a refund as Avanti know that journey was declassified. Yea, try getting a reply via the complaints form. Finally, after one completed form, three emails, two months and dozens of tweets to them, we have received a cheque for the 'first class' part of the ticket. Cashing the thing will cost me yet more time. Don't bother!

All-in-all a horrible experience and I will never go first class with them again - I'll sit in standard with a load of M&S food, it'll make us much happier and relaxed as these experiences ruined the start and end of our weekends away. In fact... I'd rather drive.

Awful, awful AWFUL.

items.title: A lady named tracy was extremely…
items.review_text: A lady named tracy was extremely welcoming and supportive. I had my 2 year old with me and she was just making sure we was as comfortable as possible. She is an asset to the service and i just wanted to say a big thankyou.

items.title: The only things you're guaranteed with Avanti are delays and discomfort.
items.review_text: I have used the Avanti West Coast service to travel to and from Edinburgh, before discovering LNER and never looking back. I have only had negative experiences with Avanti. Every single journey I took with them involved delays which caused missed connections (one time, my girlfriend visited me in Edinburgh, took the last Avanti train back, and ended up having to spend £60 on a hotel overnight in Birmingham because of the delay which caused her to miss her connection). There were never refunds or compensation for this. The trains themselves are cramped, stuffy, and nauseatingly hot, with no guarantee that you'll have access to a plug socket. The Wi-Fi does not work. Considering the sheer discomfort and impracticality of the service, one might expect the prices to be low and affordable, attracting customers, but the prices are the same as LNER services. For the same price, you can take a train which is always on time, spacious, air-conditioned, equipped with chargers at every single seat, and not to mention the gorgeous views of Durham, Newcastle and the coast. LNER all the way.

items.title: Disgraceful- train to no where
items.review_text: Disgraceful service on train for Edinburgh today from Preston. Arrived late, overcrowded then as sitting down informed over radio that can no longer go to Edinburgh as driver hasn't practiced on that section of track so now going to Glasgow. No communication since then from train staff. Uncertain how to get home. In no other country apart from this mess of a place would you get on a train to be told we are going to a completely different city arriving late at night with as of yet no contingency plan for the majority of passengers. Disgusting service disgraceful company. Just bloody walk you'll get there faster

items.title: Criminally poor
items.review_text:
Incredibly poor. Appalling costs, delays in service, changing destination mid journey. Absolutely disgusted. Will never be travelling with them again.

Lock them all up and throw away the keys.

items.title: Over packed train
items.review_text: Over packed train, booked a seat and struggled to get to it people standing in isle on journey. no staff about, slow service. Virgin was much better than this lot. 0 stars if i could.

items.title: Ridiculous prices
items.review_text: Wish I could give 0 stars! I live in London and travel to Birmingham regularly to see my family. The website and app are terrible - it’s hard to book and see cheapest ticket options, and often it doesn’t let you book at all as there are ‘no reservations available’. Last time I checked, you don’t actually need a reservation to get a ticket or travel on a train - so why you can’t just book a ticket online without a seat reservation is beyond me. Even when I book over a month in advance for off peak trains, I’m looking at train fare of around 50 quid each journey. This is ridiculous! It never used to be this expensive, especially when booking in advance. Avanti know they have a monopoly on this line and have inflated prices beyond what is reasonable. If the trains were regular and ran on time I would mind a bit less but there are constant cancellations and delays - and then they try and short change you for delay repay and you have to put in a formal complaint to try and get your money back! Using this train service makes me wish I could drive. The whole thing is a joke - never thought I’d say this but bring back Virgin…

items.title: Extortionate prices even at off peak…
items.review_text:
Extortionate prices even at off peak times! £180 Manchester to London mid afternoon & back on 8pm train! No wonder people drive instead and passenger numbers have declined. Avanti should have their franchise removed! They are an absolute disgrace and their customer service is appalling.
I can no longer travel from my local station due to a reduced timetable, supposedly due to Covid/staff shortages. More like an example of cost cutting and poor customer service. When is someone going to bring them to account!

items.title: Rip off refund admin fee
items.review_text: Their website booking system is not user friendly in fact it’s terrible. I wanted to book 3 off peak returns but as no seats were available to book on the return train I selected it would not accept the booking. It would not accept the booking without selecting a return train even with off peak open tickets. The seat booking system would not allow me to select my own seats - every time I tried this I got a message to say there was a problem and it cancelled the whole booking. After about an hour I eventually made the booking by finding a train that did have seats on a date I didn’t want to travel. Unfortunately I had to cancel the trip due to getting Covid. I was charged a £30 admin fee, £10 per ticket. All the admin required was by me pressing a button on their app. This is a complete rip off £30 for a service I did not even receive. During a pandemic this is not acceptable. ScotRail charge a £10 fee per booking not per ticket. I did get a very efficient response on Twitter about the fee - they were helpful in confirming that yes I did have to pay £30 to cancel my tickets. I agree with others the Virgin service was much better.

items.title: I have seats paid for several months…
items.review_text: I have seats paid for several months ago to travel in 10 days time and they keep changing the date they will provide a timetable to let me know if we are able to travel. Absolute joke

items.title: WORST
items.review_text: WORST! Bring back Virgin! Booking site rubbish, customer service send you in loops intentionally! All round waste

items.title: 0 STARS - REFUSED REFUND EVEN THOUGH TRAIN CANCELLED AND DEATH IN FAMILY
items.review_text: Purchased rail tickets that cost over £150 for me and my wife to go to London. Train got cancelled from Glasgow Central to London Euston. We and other passengers were instructed by Avanti West Coast (AWC) advisor at Glasgow Central (GLC) that no more trains running that day from GLC and that we and other passengers can apply for full refund ANYTIME and we would get full refund regardless of whether we get to London or not. However unfortunately AWC advisor did not alert us that there is 28 day cut-off policy. We were then advised by AWC advisor at GLC that trains were running from Carlisle to London that day. We then drove from just outside Glasgow to Carlisle only to be told that the trains from Carlisle to London are also cancelled all day after paying to get the car booked for 3 days. Also  wasted money for that car parking also. So in the end we never got to London. Made numerous attempts to contact trainline as tickets had been purchased from them. Once we finally got through to correct person at trainline we were told that we had to contact Avanti as just over 28 days period and could not authorise refund without AWC consent. Which at this time found confusing as we were told could apply for refund anytime. Numerous attempts to contact AWC (contact phone number really difficult to find online) and eventually got through to Avanti customer resolution team after nearly 2 hours just to be told that they would pass it on and someone would be in touch. This call lasted about 3 minutes after waiting nearly 2 hours. We explained to AWC advisor reasons for delay in requesting refund over the phone. Not just being misinformed by AWC advisor in Glasgow but that we also had a death in family. My wife's brother died at 47 unexpectedly and that we were dealing with this and my wife was in a really bad way and still is. I also have ADHD (unmedicated) which is a neurological disorder and did not help in dealing with this issue as I have memory problems and trying to remember to deal with the refund was extremely difficult as well as supporting my wife while she was grieving for the loss of her brother. We finally received a really really short email after 4 weeks from AWC advisor by the name of Bacher (not sure why he took so long to get in touch given the poor response) just to tell us that although sympathetic they would not refund us as just over the 28 day policy. Today I contacted AWC and spoke to a Nadimah and asked for Bacher to contact me and also to lodge the complaint as she is a customer relations advisor. Both requests were denied by her and she told me she would not do this and I needed to go online and lodge the complaint this way. After my brother in law passed away me and my wife eventually contacted numerous organisations such as the hotel, theatre, and other event organisers explaining that we did not arrive in London due to cancellation of train but also due to death in family and they all provided a refund without debate or delay.  Really disgusted and appalled by AWC delayed and poor response and lack of care toward their customers.

items.title: Upgraded Seats Great/App UNUSABLE - the rest Not So Much!
items.review_text: I'm torn on this review. We had a very nice trip from London to Liverpool in Premium Economy (or whatever their name is for this option). The seats were great and so for comfort they deserve 5 stars. BUT that's where the praise ends. Once onboard, we were excited to use the promised "in seat ordering" and after waiting an hour for the website ordering to become active, I finally asked when the attendant passed by, and he was genuinely amused that we thought we would be getting that option. Apparently they never have enough staff to provide that promised "perk" for the upgrade. And when we finally did get to the cafe car, they had exactly 1 sandwich left and 1 burger. Everything else that would have been "fresh food" was SOLD OUT! So, dining would get 2 stars, as a hamburger for breakfast was not top of my list. But it's the APP that deserves 1 star because of a HUGE glitch: because I have a US registered Apple account, the Avanti app comes up as "Not available in your country or region". That doesn't happen with all UK based apps I've downloaded and used, so it must be a setting that Avanti has set for their app. And for a train line that most certainly has a great number of tourists on board from various countries, it's absurd to make it a UK available only app. No problem using the National Rail app on my iPhone. No problem using Great Western App on my iPhone. But Avanti? Nope! And the website maybe gets a 1.5 rating.

items.title: Uncomfortable and overbooked trains all…
items.review_text: Uncomfortable and overbooked trains all the time. No attempt to cater properly for cyclists. Cramped train environment with small windows. My joint least favourite operator, along with cross country

items.title: Terrible
items.review_text: Terrible website. Insanely slow like it’s 1999. Despite saying you can change an off peak return for free in My Account this option is not available. There’s a form you have to fill out but the ‘Submit’ button doesn’t work, so basically impossible to actually change the tickets  - how can you not have a functioning website in 2022!?

items.title: Craig Scott - what a legend!
items.review_text:
Whilst I am still yet to experience the WOW FACTOR with Avanti West Coast since they took over from Virgin, I have experienced the Customer Services version. 

I was banging my head against a brick wall, trying to get the attention of Customer Services and a chap called Craig Scott stepped in. 

Craig showed experience, professionalism, care and really got to the bottom of my issues...and resolved them very quickly. 

Craig is an absolute credit to Avanti and, despite the negativity that surrounds their service right now, they need to be retaining amazing people like Craig. 

Please ensure he is given ultimate praise.

items.title: No WiFi = No Service
items.review_text:
- No WiFi
  - Not able to work which is the only reason I got the train and did not drive. 
  - No media available on their app because the WiFi was not working. 
  - Not able to order food or drink because it must be done through an app. 

No member of staff came through the carriage so I was not able to ask for help which resulted in a very painful, boring and long three hour journey.

items.title: Better than anticipated
items.review_text:
EDIT: Response from customer service was forthcoming much sooner than advertised, and issue resolved. There still remains the issue of poor website and lack of clarity regarding problem resolution. Given advertised response time of 4 weeks, I still had two days of complete uncertainty as to how this would resolve and could have wasted money by now. 
ORIGINAL: Website does not offer necessary function. Impossible to reschedule canceled trip via website, forced to use online form with advertised 4 week wait for a reply. Will likely need to re book to secure seats before I receive a refund for my cancelled trip. Extremely poor, costing me and surely other rail users money to mitigate Avanti's inefficiency.

items.title: Avanti must mean joke in Italian
items.review_text: I have travelled with Virgin Trains Many times, booking was simple with an account, and plenty of ticket options. Booked 2 returns to London in late December as had an Avanti account pre COVID for work, and that was hard enough in the Premium Economy section as first class is now extortionate . Just spent an hour trying to book a Weekend trip to Liverpool 1st class from Birmingham International on 25th February out, and 27th back, as our hotel is next to Lime Street for my Wife’s birthday. This should be simple, Scottish train to Crewe and pick up a London-Liverpool train.It’s impossible in 1 booking. Add a journey function, for multiple trains does not work .Trains don’t appear or pricing doesn’t, or if it does, blocks proceeding to book. Even tried 4 separate bookings as we change at Crewe. Avanti web site believes there is no first class on Sunday27th.The Avanti CEO must be a clown as he is running a complete circus. Sack your IT department!!! Public transport should be easy to book. Your whole offering is a shambles from booking to pricing, reliability to satisfaction. How can a company have so little customer satisfaction and survive, moreover how does its management team. End result chose to drive simply because it’s easier than your booking system

items.title: Somehow worse than Virgin!
items.review_text: In the last 5 months, I've had 6-7 return trips between London & Birmingham. On 3 trips there were no seats available; I had a reserved seat but the seat reservation system wasn't working. The train has only arrived on time on 4 occasions. Rarely does the seat reservation system work on the website, and even less frequently on the trains themselves. Scheduled services run less frequently than on Virgin, which leads to more overcrowding and more problems when (sometimes) inevitable delays occur. Mask mandates not enforced. Avanti should be removed from being the franchise provider as soon as possible; at the moment I can't even book a ticket, as the seat reservation system isn't working.

items.title: Terrible, customer-hostile website, don't sell real tickets
items.review_text:
Following Virgin Trains's excellent franchise was going to be hard for anyone.  So far I'm not impressed with Avanti. 

Haven't travelled yet, but alread frustrated with the website:
- Need to create an account, can't book as guest
- Terrible password rules - at least 10 characters, must include special characters, but only allows a very limited number of special characters, eg. # and + are not permitted
- no option to collect tickets from the station or have them mailed - only options are e-tickets or smart card

This is not suitable for me, I'll have to go to the station to buy a proper ticket that doesn't rely on my phone working and my battery lasting.  Absolutely appalling, clearly designed by people who never use trains.

items.title: Poor service
items.review_text: Both out and return journey cancelled.    Not contacted my Avanti. Replacement services massively over subscribed had to stand London to Stoke on Trent !!!

items.title: They are terrible to contact
items.review_text: They are terrible to contact. I made a complaint last October 2021 and eventually got two complimentary reference numbers as free tickets for compensation. I have tried to use the numbers but they do not work. I have tried to get in touch with Avanti but guess what !

items.title: We booked 6 tickets from Preston to…
items.review_text:
We booked 6 tickets from Preston to Edinburgh via trainline for a visit  on 10th December 2021 to the Xmas markets. This was instead of driving, age of the train etc etc.
The train from Preston to Edinburgh was packed and even though we had booked our seats  previously we couldn't move. At Lancaster the train emptied slightly and the staff showed us to our seats. The rest of the journey was pleasant. On return 2 days later we arrived at Waverley station (Edinburgh) to find the train to Preston had been cancelled, no explanation???? The station staff were un helpful. We were told to either wait for two hours for another train (no guarantee of a seat) or take a train from Edinburgh to York - York to leeds - Leeds to Preston passing our home town but our car was at Preston! We took this option, we left Edinburgh at 12.20 and arrived home at 18.30. 6 hours which should have been around 3 hours. We got £40 compensation.......

I won't be using the train again I'll drive!

items.title: Shouted at by angry girl supported by the crew due to technical…
items.review_text:
Shouted at by crew due to technical issues with seat reservation app.  

I was on a train from Manchester to London today, i bored the train with a reserved ticket with my partner. We were not sitting together  so looked for available seats, to rest at.  We found four seat avaiable, sat down started our lunch.  Then came along an angry girl with her mother, shouting at me about the seats.  The guards came along and started reinforcing this claim you need to move. We left protesting because the seats were clearly marked free. Later on the ticket collection round  we tackled the train manager who apologised and confirm the train reservation system had  at fault and provided the wrong reading on the seat status. The irony of all of this was  the carriage was 40% empty and went i got another site. Why are people so ignorant, no empathy just shouting about a stupid seat.

items.title: Website confusing as hell.
items.review_text:
Booked tickets from London Euston to Coventry. I assumed I had booked tickets one day in advance, however I was unwell and unable to travel so I decided to cancel my journey and refund. 

However it turned out the tickets were booked for the day I booked the tickets and therefore not refundable. 

I wasn't aware of this until it was too late, the website is mostly to blame. Most other train companies use the same ticket booking system where the trains are arranged vertically. Avanti on their own planet use a completely different layout and it makes it really difficult to be certain of what you're actually buying. It also forces you into creating an account.

Also last year tried to book tickets to go down to London and the website insisted I reserved seats. Couldn't find any seats for me to reserve, went with Chiltern Railways instead.

Never had a good experience with Avanti. They are a poor replacement for Virgin trains.

items.title: Just a really poor service
items.review_text: Just a really poor service, they box everyone into one carriage and have several free, this is during the pandemic, they didn't keep people safe.

items.title: Avanti Website a waste of time
items.review_text:
For the third time recently I’ve had to give up trying to buy tickets for the Glasgow to London route via the website. Once I ended up going via Lumo/Edinburgh, twice I can only book via National Rail. A friend gave up and booked a flight instead. 
It takes you through the process and at the last step disappears. Extremely frustrating. I miss Virgin. 
No problem with service once actually on the train, but almost impossible to buy a ticket a few weeks in advance.

items.title: They should have some shame,
items.review_text: So you actually gave to pay a lot extra to sit on the first class seat just cause they're 5%less worn out than standard. It's stupid, I get on the train and sit on the nearest seats. End of the day I paid the ticket to even be on the train to begin with. Never had an issue with other train lines with this situation when travelling to Canterbury during uni days. Had my child eating and I was told to get up x2 like get out my face and have some shame. Then when we moved we were told to get up again cause apparently that was standard premium not standard like who cares. Glad an old man kicked off they won't spare nobody. Overpriced and late anyway so what's the point of harrassing people once they're finally on the train?? This was last week Monday 12:38 train to Edinburgh

items.title: My experience with Avanti West Coast…
items.review_text: My experience with Avanti West Coast was very poor. My train with Avanti West Coast whose ticket was purchased of Trainline was cancelled. I paid approx. £165 on another train to get myself home. I was delayed for 1 h 20 mins. I spoke to at least 10 people from different train companies and it took almost 2 months to get a refund for the cancelled train. No chance of speaking to anyone over the phone despite waiting over 1 h 30 mins. I spoke to Hannah over the Facebook who tried to help me, but at first was reluctant to give me a contact detail until I mentioned the difficulty to explain my case over messages. The response via email was extremely slow. The only resolution and quick response was by emailing the managing director's team. Jodie was apologetic and understanding. She sped un my refund claim process and offered me some resolution for the hassle I had to go through. Excellent work Jodie.

items.title: My train was cancelled
items.review_text: My train was cancelled. The following train was also cancelled making the journey pointless as the appointment was missed. I did not travel and claimed for compensation from Avanti. They dismissed my claim saying it was not their fault and were not liable. Wrong! I am entitled to a full refund from my point of purchase, as per section 30 of the National Rail Conditions of Travel . As i bought my ticket from Avanti, and  was unable to travel, it is their responsibility to give me a full refund for my tickets, with no admin fee being charged, as it was the fault of the railways that i was unable to travel. I no longer use Avanti (until i get this sorted)

items.title: Awful advert with that song that…
items.review_text: Awful advert with that song that lingers in your head, even worse is the website 0/10

items.title: Useless bunch of buck-passers
items.review_text: Bought senior railcard from Avanti.  Got order confirmation and railcard number.  Worked once then disappeared in App upgrade.  Now just gives a an error message.  Avanti won't help.  Passed me on to Railcard who won't help either

items.title: Recent return journey
items.review_text: Recent return journey, Glasgow Central to London Euston. Packed coach (covid, anyone?), non-reclining seats, no power points or USB points to charge mobiles, no food or drink items to order to your seat using the onboard "hub" until "after Carlisle" and absolutely no hot drinks on the return journey because "they've all just given up." Not sure if they meant they had just given up or the drinks machine had but the customer service was, quite frankly, non-existent. Which may explain why there was not a single public announcement on the return journey until we were pulling into Central Station. Several times on the outbound journey we had announcements about the possibility of "upgrading your seat" for £30 for which you had more room and charging points at your seat. Even standard timetabled First Bus services in Glasgow have USB points to charge phones and iPads, without the need to pay MORE! If you have an alternative means of travel - do it!

items.title: Absolutely first class customer service…
items.review_text:
Absolutely first class customer service from Avanti personnel at Penrith North Lakes when our 08.47 TransPennine Express to Manchester Airport was cancelled without notice on 24th January.
They couldn't have done more for us which enabled us to get to Heathrow on time for our International connection, which we would have missed had we continued to travel via.Manchester.

items.title: Avanti have an appalling website design…
items.review_text: Avanti have an appalling website design for finding and booking the cheapest available tickets. (1) They purposefully do not show +/-3 day and Monthly View options for their customers to find the cheapest tickets available on their service, dare I say to increase their sales revenue. (2) Their website will describe and label a ticket as 'Cheapest' but in fact cheaper tickets are often available if scrolling arduously through their departure options. (3) There is no way to print a Transaction Receipt from their User Account feature. The list goes on. Why did they not learn and carry over at least some of the positive customer experience lessons learned by Virgin Trains from their many years of running the service? It really is a poor show considering that the franchise award was supposed to offer us all better value and quality.

items.title: Appalling website!
items.review_text: Seat picker doesn't work. Website pages don't scroll so unable to see all the information. Try to report these faults and that page can't be submitted without updating Cookie Preferences. Clicking on the supplied link does - NOTHING.

items.title: Appalling website
items.review_text: Appalling website. Why is it so difficult to book a ticket!

items.title: The most appalling service ever received.
items.review_text:
I was informed I could "upgrade" my ticket on the day for £25. I sat in one of the first 2 carriages (as instructed by a member of Avanti staff on the platform). 

I was then told the upgrade fee of £25 was for "premier economy". An option i'd never even heard of. I informed the conductor it was a mistake and i'd happily make the 10 yard journey to the "Premier" carriage. The conductor refused to allow me to do this and I was charged £97. I complained to Avanti and they responded saying the conductor had acted in accordance with their guidelines.

items.title: Insane pricing for trains
items.review_text:
Insane pricing for trains

Avanti seem determined to throttle the amount of advanced fares being offered on their mainline routes and in almost all cases are making flying/ driving the more economical alternative. This is not what a train company should be doing. 

It is clear that it's Italian overlords are desperate to claw back some money from the franchise but this isn't the way to do it. 

Travel regularly, trains are tired and poor. Would always rather bus over to EDI and use LNER/ Lumo.

items.title: Nightmarish
items.review_text: I’d give zero if I could. Terrible online experience, the website is awful: outdated, illogical, cumbersome - a nightmare. Dreadful train journey experience: filthy, foul smelling carriages. Shoddy or non-existent customer service. I’d rather walk 300 miles.

items.title: Absolutely Appalling
items.review_text: Absolutely Appalling. My fiance (Penelope King), travelled on the 4th of Dec 2021 from Euston To Glasgow. The train terminated without prior notice at Preston - there she had to wait for 2 hours at a platform for her onward journey to Glasgow. She has not received a penny in compensation despite making all efforts to with the non existent online claim facility. Therefore she appealed by email. This legitimate claim has been unsuccessful.

items.title: Terrible unresponsive customer service that does not follow its own complaints policy
items.review_text: For 3 months now I have been chasing a refund for a cancelled service. Many emails asking for a response or update, and two complaints raised via their online process. Despite a second complaint, no manager has contacted me to explain what has gone wrong etc as per their online statement and policy. A refund was finally made 2 weeks ago but for the wrong amount. Three more emails advising and asking for updates, no response to any. How can this be customer service? How can a company handle their complaints this way? I'm exhausted with this.

items.title: After making two complaints to Avanti I…
items.review_text:
After making two complaints to Avanti I have received little in the way of satisfaction. 

The replies have been very curt and in no way I have felt valued as a consumer.  

Communications take weeks to be replied to.

Sadly I will not use Avanti again. 

Bring back Virgin!

items.title: Nearly useless website
items.review_text:
Their Passenger Charter states -" The ability to reserve seats in advance "
I have never been able to do this online without the site crashing with an incomprehensible error message, or it's refusal to continue the transaction for one reason or another. I waited over 30 mins to try to contact anyone on the phone - then was cut off. My third attempt took over an hour, and even then the poor, embarrased employee was also unable to book a journey as described on the website.
Their complaints system refuses to accept any of my e-mail addresses,

items.title: Absolutely awful company
items.review_text: Absolutely awful company! Train price are significantly higher than Virgins ever were plus the website constantly crashes and changes the prices compared to what is found on the national rail website! Bring back Virgin! They actually cared about their customers

items.title: Advert
items.review_text: Great tv advert with the tortoise on roller skates.

items.title: Terrible service, no value for money
items.review_text: Online booking system is terrible. I generally book a journey from London to Chester, which involves a change at Crewe. This simple fact results in 9 out of 10 attempts at booking failing, as it crashes their website. Similarly, I have had issues when attempting to pay with a new credit/debit card. Crashes the site. This all on top of the horrendous experience a couple of years back where they charged me 5 times for the same journey, again due to a fault with their online booking system. It really makes the entire process a miserable, dystopian exercise in frustration. I truly, truly dread the future, as my parents are getting older now and the disgusting price scalping of passengers in the UK coupled with Avanti West Coast's awful service make me dread regular trips to look after my elderly parents 200 miles away. If you are paying £300 for an urgent same day journey you'd expect a Gold Standard of service. If you are paying £100 for an off-peak return you would still expect a Gold Standard of service. I hate Avanti West Coast for making me feel even more fleeced of my hard-earned money than Virgin even managed to.

items.title: There really should be a zero rating
items.review_text:
There really should be a zero rating. 

Customer service shocking, routes and trains cancelled with very little notice, prices are then 20% higher. Food is below virgin trains standard, staff are nowhere near as polite. I could go on and on. Bring virgin back please!!!

items.title: The train service and customer service is appalling
items.review_text: The service is appalling.  Reserved seating is ignored and train officials won't challenge a customer on your behalf if someone is sitting in your seat.  They have told me that rather than confront a passenger, they won't do anything.  Also, apparently, when they think the train is going to be busy, all reserved seats are 'off the table' and it's a free for all.  This is unacceptable.  As a severely sight impaired passenger, this answer is not helpful.  Other train companies tell customers who have unreserved seating to sit in a particular carriage - why can't AWC follow this?  AWC need to take a further look at their policies and procedures and learn from other train companies.  I was given the excuse that the train was probably full due to cancelled prior trainis etc. but this isn't the case as it was the first train out of Birmingham.  Very sad state of affairs.  If I could use another company I would.  Bring back Virgin trains.

items.title: No ticket given, but took my money anyway!
items.review_text: Booked a one-way first class journey to Crewe, took the payment and then said that the booking didn't complete!  So the money has gone out of the account and now I can't get hold of customer services (it cuts you off after 10 minutes) and no reply to message online - what am I to do???

items.title: Disgusting service
items.review_text:
Good god 1st class service is actually 0 class lazy rude staff that couldn't be bothered in any way.
Sitting chatty 90 % of the time with the odd f***** word chucked if for good measure. 
God forbid you ask for anything returned with a deathly stare.
All info available if company wish

items.title: Shockingly bad
items.review_text:
I used to complain about Virgin occastionally, the trains were sometimes late, the ticket prices were high, and the food on the trains was a bit hit and miss. But oh my god, PLEASE bring them back, Avanti are just awful! 

Before the pandemic I travelled from Warrington to London Euston every week, and as it was on business I used the first class service so I could work at my seat and get a bite to eat. I've been working from home for nearly two years now, but a month before Christmas I started to travel to London again.

I then came across Avanti for the first time. Well, I say came across... it was often late so I was more often than not stood around waiting. Then, the first class service is just DIRE - the food is just abysmal (when they have it - twice now I've been told that they have no food left when the train isn't even close to full), drinks are a rarity and of poor quality, and the staff seem distracted and irritated. The carriage isn't cleaned properly, and the booking system is a joke - it crams everyone into one half of one carriage, when you're supposed to be socially distancing. 

Now I could go with this if the cost had been reduced, but it's not, oh no... it's a LOT higher than Virgin too! So I'm paying a premium for a much, much worse service - how can that be right? 

I'm sorry, but this outfit needs stripping of it's franchise, it's an absolute disgrace. The operators have a complete monopoly on these services, so I guess nothing will happen, especially as the government are otherwise distracted. But I won't be travelling down often anymore, perhaps once every month or two, and when I do I won't be going first class - I can't bring myself to pay hundreds of pounds more than standard for a plate of cold pasta. 

One word - avoid.

items.title: Travelled today (11 jan 22) Glasgow…
items.review_text: Travelled today (11 jan 22) Glasgow Central - Lancaster. First class - journey was excellent. Train comfortable, clean and first class service. All for 60 quid. Considering first class from Glasgow to the hole-in-the-earth that is Edinburgh is 20 quid, that is outstanding value. Well done avanti

items.title: Shockingly badly run rail company
items.review_text: If I could give Avanti zero stars I would. I have spent almost two months trying to get a ticket refund for a train that didn't run. I have been sent round in circles and am back where I started. They agree the money should be refunded but they still don't refund it. Their response to my latest refund request via their website (the fourth, if you include the complaint I put in) was met with . . . wait for it . . . a link to the (same) website where I could put in a refund request! It would be funny if it wasn't so dire. And the reason the train didn't run? We still don't know, as they did not exactly cover themselves in glory that day: zero communication, not even between managers and their own staff on duty at the station. In fact, I was informed by one staff member that management had requested staff to stop contacting them for updates. This says it all. These people are clowns: bring back Virgin asap and, in the meantime if you can find any other way to make your journey, I recommend that you do. This is not the first problem I have encountered with Avanti. They couldn't run a bath never mind a railway.

items.title: Just poor advice
items.review_text: Just poor advice - what a shame it's no longer Virgin!  Simple question was put to CS about prices and they responded "Hi, once tickets have been released, they won't get cheaper." - so I booked as I didn't want to miss out on the early booking discount (ha!).  3 weeks later and the prices are near enough half the price.  Terrible.

items.title: The big smoke day trip experience
items.review_text: Lancaster to london and return .   Engaging staff    friendly and professional    return journey upgraded   catering first class.  Shout out to train managers and  staff at euston lounge    we will be back!

items.title: Having left my daughter to travel with…
items.review_text:
Having left my daughter to travel with a large amount of luggage I was very impressed and grateful when a member of staff at Penrith went out of her way and phoned ahead and arranged for her to be meet in Birmingham during change of train for assistance. 
This was appreciated. 

Thank you.

items.title: Travelled on them every week for over a…
items.review_text: Travelled on them every week for over a year and they are awful compared to virgin. No refund for a train THEY cancelled for to bad weather. Filled in delay repay form even though should have received their automatic repayment as per their own policy. Still no refund two months later and can’t call the customer service line as cuts you off. Awful, crooked company that have caused massive stress.

items.title: Such a dreadful experience…
items.review_text: As a party of 3 we booked first class seats from Milton Keynes to Crewe with return tickets 2 days later.  The booking site is dreadful as it shows the direction of the train the wrong way round, so I ended up with all backward facing seats.   My party all needed forward facing seats due to travel sickness.  I spent some considerable time on the phone chasing to get the seats changed.  Managed for the outbound journey though was told I would need to change the return seats on the actual train when we boarded.  There were no forward facing seats available on the return journey.  Perhaps they lied to me on the phone? Very deceitful and misleading. We had to move to a carriage that wasn’t first class and therefore we could not take advantage of the service we had paid for. Avanti are refusing to compensate us.  With the extortionate prices (£560 for 3 people) I expect a much better service and care.  Dreadful customer service. Loved Virgin trains, bring them back.

items.title: Avoid at all costs
items.review_text: Crammed into a cabin with dozens of other people in the middle of a pandemic. Drunken women sharing communal cups and genuine health and safety issues due to the amount of people blocking the exits. An absolute disaster waiting to happen. E mailed about applying for a refund then refused because I didn't have the barcode of the ticket for weeks after the journey!!! Need reporting for health and safety breaches which I will be doing!!!

items.title: Passenger Assistance - fend for yourself
items.review_text: My 85yr old mother booked train to come and see me for Christmas and New Year. I did warn her of my bad experiences. She booked passenger assistance to help her stay safe and move round the stations. Preston did not even arrive to assist her, left her to fend for herself, and get from platform 6 to platform 2 with suitcase. She could have fallen, had an accident, anything could have happened. Avanti West Coast did not care about her at all, and I have asked them if they would treat their own family members in this way. It was a journey to come and see me, spend time with me, as I have advanced cancer, and she wanted to simply spend some time with me. So she booked first class and assistance, only to be left to fend for herself. This potentially has knocked her confidence to ever see me again.

items.title: Absolute rubbish
items.review_text: Absolute rubbish, cancellations and delays trains rarely running on time and extortionate ticket prices, daylight robbery especially in the current climate trains being cancelled at short notice and passengers for 2 or 3 trains being crammed onto 1 train has happened on more then a few occasions in the passed month.

items.title: Terrible customer service
items.review_text: Terrible customer service. I have been trying all day to book tickets. Neither the app or the online system would process the transactions. I rang my bank to see if it was a problem from their end which it wasn't. Messenger on instagram gave me a number to call which was completely pointless. I end the day having failed to purchase the tickets. Bring back Virgin trains.

items.title: A joke of a company
items.review_text: Disgusted with my recent journey from Stafford to Glasgow and return. This was right at the beginning of Omicron, but they blamed the virus for trains being cancelled, running late etc. it was also very Covid unsafe! I was delayed both ways and have been trying to claim compensation ( as advised) This is a complete joke, as they make it as difficult as possible to complete the forms correctly. Never had any problems like this with Virgin.

items.title: No point reserving seats/Social distancing ?
items.review_text:
Liverpool to London return. I do not understand why we get to reserve our seats, then board the train to find people sitting in them.
Booked 2 forward facing seats at a table. A couple and a single chap were all sat at the table when we boarded.
Should we say something and possibly cause an abusive response?
There wasn't anyone to help or refer to.
I tried to say that these were our seats and the single chap just looked around and said, "its not full," and left me to look awkward. The couple that were sat there tried to be invisible. 
Why are strangers being sat at a table during social distancing restrictions anyway ??
An hour into our journey, I needed to charge my phone, but couldn't from the seat I was in.
Single chap was happily on his phone playing games. 😡

items.title: Very poor customer service
items.review_text:
Very poor customer service. I requested a partial refund for tickets I was unable to use.  Avanti cancelled all tickets which forced me to rebook at a higher rate. 
Avanti took over two weeks to respond refusing to refund the additional expense.

items.title: Delay repay - I don't think so !!
items.review_text: Despite a train from Euston being cancelled and the next available train being about 2 hours later, and this  train then arriving an hour and a half late, apparently this does not fulfil the criteria for delay repay! Have sent multiple copies of all tickets booking etc but apparently it's a no from "customer support". Good luck anyone trying to claim via delay repay - it seems to be a scam! SO MUCH worse than when Virgin were running the service

items.title: No information on train cancellation and a mixture of good and worst customer service
items.review_text: When I arrived in the station, the display board was saying the train is on time but didn't mention the platform number though the train is departing in 15 minutes. When I asked the staff, they just told us that they will give an update once they know anything about it. They never came back to me though I have been standing behind them all the time. And after 10 minutes, when I ask them they say the train got cancelled. The only good thing is they said I can catch the next LNER train to London without any charges and even that they said to me only a few minutes before that train leaves. I had to run to catch that train. No announcements of any sort and not even on the display it said cancelled.

items.title: everytime I get on this train the…
items.review_text: everytime I get on this train the atseatorder says it’s not available which means I have to go 6 carriages down from standard premium when your snack/drinks should be atseatorder all the time what’s the point in having a delivery order if it’s never going to be available😂🤷🏻‍♀️

items.title: Delayed, dirty, and overcrowded
items.review_text:
Always delayed meaning you miss your connections constantly. Dirty carriages and constantly over crowded. Also, it would help the country avoid lock downs if large companies took a little more responsibility for social distancing and didn't constantly sell so many tickets that social distancing is impossible. 

In the absence of that, clean trains that run on schedule at least some of the time would be lovely.

items.title: I used Avanti for the first time
items.review_text: I used Avanti for the first time. I booked direct from Preston to Coventry on the 24 December 2021 at 9.19. my train was cancelled. So I got an alternative train or trains (4 to be exact). The train staff was excellent 👍. As soon as I got off one train they got me on another. Untill I reached my destination. They made it so easy for me. I was only 15 minutes late. Well done to AVANTI and the STAFF. They made a nightmare into a relaxing day. Thank you so much . I know a shortage of drivers caused the problem. So well done to you ALL . God bless 🙏❤️ Anthony O'Callaghan

items.title: Avanti are a joke
items.review_text: Avanti are a joke! I have travelled to London and back every two weeks for almost 5 years now. With VIRGIN trains there was always a direct train from Chester to Euston, this was disposed of almost as soon as AVANTI took over the franchise. Now we change at Crewe. There are almost always delays meaning you miss your connection, the carriages are overcrowded, impossible to get a seat, it’s COVID Central, and yet first class is available? Why have 3x 1st class which are empty, when there is massive overcrowding on the other carriages? Now the number of trains on offer are reduced, the travel time to get to Euston have increased massively as have the prices, it’s utterly scandalous. I will be writing to my MP, something has to be done to take this franchise away from this joke company. One has to conclude that they bribed their way to this franchise, we should demand a public enquiry in to how on earth they won this from Virgin who were doing a very effective job. In all my years travelling with Virgin I experiences two delays. I now get that every month! Please, please , please get rid of Avanti!

items.title: Cancellations and delays every single…
items.review_text: Cancellations and delays every single time. Overpriced tickets with a chance of cancelled trains. Even if there is a train running it will have extra stops to make up fir the cancelled one and be delayed, over capacity and refuse service.

items.title: Don't waste your words here. Write to your MP.
items.review_text: I have been suffering poor service on the Manchester to Euston route for some while now. It is patently clear reading through this review site, that there are countless others who have experienced the same. I don't think this company cares two hoots about customer service . I will be writing to my MP and the Department for Transport, about the scandal that this joke of an operator was awarded this economically and strategically  important franchise. I suggest you do the same as they clearly don't care.....

items.title: Shocking service
items.review_text: Shocking service. Absolutely appalling, travelling from euston to birmingham on an overbooked train where many people had to stand up between the aisles. I booked my seat and another customer had to sit next to me because there was nowhere else available, it's not her fault as avanti should ensure there are enough socially distanced seats for ALL customers. Obviously this train company cares more about making as much money as possible than it does about its customers safety and adhering to government guidelines. Will not travel with them again.

items.title: Can’t even purchase a ticket, poor customer service.
items.review_text: Can’t even purchase a ticket. I have a 50% off voucher I haven’t been able to use because every single time either my wife or I try to make a purchase an ‘unexpected error’ occurs. Rang customer service and after 1hr43mins on the phone the best they could advise is to try it again and that it was a ring fence issue. My wife and I tried to purchase 5/6 times and have pending transactions of £123 5/6 times on our accounts. Customer service is unhelpful and were unable to solve my issue. I really really do not want to use this company.  Also, the price?!?! It’s cheaper for me to fly to Manchester and back for the price of a single ticket with this company.

items.title: Would be nice to keep to a timetable
items.review_text: I’ve never caught an Avanti train without it being delayed. Bring back Virgin!! Unfortunately there are limited ways to get to Scotland by train. Not good at giving refunds either.

items.title: Poor rail service
items.review_text: We have used this service several times. On those trips the food service has been cancelled due to water supply issues, our train was cancelled, the train we then got was delayed. Its also quicker to go to tge food service rather than order at the table.

items.title: I have Been on this service countless…
items.review_text: I have Been on this service countless times. Usually barely a conductor on the train. Went to the station yesterday train was instantly cancelled when I arrived , I wasn’t too surprised as it had been like this the last week or so . I eventually walked out as there was a fault on a train in front of us toward Birmingham. No other notifications were announced about how long the delay would be. The only way I knew the service would take hours was because a friend of mine called me from the train before us which had broken down. I cut my losses in the end , which is what I think many people were also doing.   Also no replacement bus service provided , which probably I wouldn’t have minded so much.

items.title: Shocking reliability from this provider…
items.review_text: Shocking reliability from this provider and customer service is hit and miss on board and generally very messy on later trains.  When i asked a conductor why the carriage was so littered to the point I had to stand (it was that bad !) he shrugged and said it had been busy... I asked him if it might be a good idea to clean it all up and he shrugged shoulders and walked off.  Tonight the train was cancelled twice which isnt unsual since these guys started running the service, the third one was showing online and at the platform as on time so i waited in sub zero temperatures for the 21:01 service (its now 20:56)  Then on the tannoy and service announcement "We apologise but the 21:01 has been cancelled due to a untrained member of staff with coronavirus"  literally them words which was baffling but i was more concerned that with only 5 mins before train arrival they notify of cancellation.  Absolutely shocking practice as provider of public transport to say the least, pointless trying to complain as they simply dont respond.  I will be putting my car back on the road as trying to help the climate actually affects my health as the country simply cant function anymore!

items.title: Truly appaling service
items.review_text: Truly appaling service. Turned up at station, doors still open but a jobs worth called Mark wouldn't let me through Rules you see. Well I had a fully flexible first class but won't be travelling with them again. Drive instead. Best thing that could happen is they go bust VT gets it back and they all lose their jobs. No sense of customer service

items.title: More expensive and a far worse and more…
items.review_text:
More expensive and a far worse and more unpleasant service.

Virgin West Coast had things they could improve for sure, but generally the experience was good value and pleasant. Why on earth the DfT awarded the franchise to Avanti instead of Virgin is beyond me.

The new service is far more cramped, the 1st class offer is far poorer, Wi-Fi often doesn't work, the Avanti website is harder to use and worst of all tickets are around 3-4 times the previous prices.

items.title: Shocking service and no support
items.review_text: Shocking service and no support from customer service. I booked a 1st class ticket to treat myself as I had a spa lunch day booked for a special occasion.  There was no 1st class cabin even though they took my money for the train I booked.  Then it was so late with no excuse.  I was late for my lunch.  When contacting Avanti they just didn't want to know I feel I was mis sold my ticket.  I put in a complaint and it has been ignored.

items.title: A Shocker of a Company!
items.review_text: Purchased a 1st-class ticket from Edinburgh to Warrington BQ. With a 0652 departure it was announced on departure that there was no staff on-board to administer any catering. Scammed! Is the person who awarded Avanti this contract doing anything about these complaints.

items.title: Why sell tickets for a cancelled train?
items.review_text: Why sell tickets if you are going to cancel? I booked a ticket on the day of the journey 4hrs b4 departure. The train was cancelled. Pandemic is no reason for unprofessional behaviour.

items.title: How to claim evoucher
items.review_text:
Can't give zero or i would, i booked an advance fare in Premium Class at an extortionate price , to travel to Edinburgh on Dec 22nd. Due to unforseen Covid circumstances, i can't travel. I accept i can't get a refund, but their website clearly states that they will give an e-voucher for travel in the next year.  Upon trying to get this, i couldn't find a form specifically dealing with e-vouchers, so filled in the only refund form.  I got an email today saying i can't get a refund on an advance ticket, which i know, and to apply for an e-voucher. They sent me a link to the same form i have already filled out! I have been over and over this form and My Account and the help pages on Avanti's website, to no avail.
They are obviously making it as difficult as possible to claim so that people will give up. I will never book Avanti again

items.title: 2 cancellations and 90minute delay
items.review_text:
Train cancelled to Birmingham,
90 minute delay to Manchester.

Yesterday , train cancelled for trip to Burnley. 
That’s my last 3 journeys with Avanti.
Unreliable service and slow with refunding.

items.title: Ive never cought my conecting train…
items.review_text: Ive never cought my conecting train when using this service as it is ALWAYS late

items.title: What a shambles first class my ass it’s…
items.review_text: What a shambles first class my ass it’s filthy no one has a clue Wats going on they should be stripped of the franchise

items.title: Appalling customer service
items.review_text:
In these uncertain times,  we all understand that changes are being imposed,  sometimes at short notice  however the abject failure to communicate with station staff is a total failure of management processes.
Website is not updated with delays and cancellations. Avanti customer services tell me to look at national rail because the company Website is so poor. It would be funny except it is true. No live chat facility.  Call centre is off shore and staffed by people who are not kept updated with service alterations.
Frankly it's one star because I can't award zero. 
The management team needs to be removed and replaced by competent individuals.

items.title: Trash train company
items.review_text: Absolutely, trash train company, rude staff on the train without manner I bet he never has parents to teach him how to speak , useless customer service. Thanks for the worst train experience in my life

items.title: Stranded at Euston …
items.review_text: Another train company that would rather pay compensation than run a reliable service. Currently stranded at Euston wondering if/when I’ll get to Birmingham after multiple cancellations due to shortage of train crew. This whole system is broken. The cynicism of these train companies is appalling.

items.title: Poor.
items.review_text:
Unhelpful staff.
Dirty trains.
Delay repay is a joke.
Bring back Virgin.
Please.

items.title: Excellent on board options 10/10
items.review_text: Travelling from Glasgow on 10 December, 2021. Excellent service, great menu choices. My traditional breakfast 10/10. Better than many hotels. Amazed and very pleased.  Hi

items.title: Vicki was extremely helpful to me 😃
items.review_text: It was my first time in Manchester and I was traveling back to London. My train from Manchester Piccadilly was delayed which meant that I could not get to Crewe in time to pick up my connecting train to London. Vicki took me to the ticket office, explained the issue and I was given an authority to travel on the next train to London. The whole process was smooth and so helpful 😃 I was super impressed by the lovely and helpful way in which Vicki helped me, she was an absolute angel!

items.title: Company is a disgrace and need to be stripped of the franchise
items.review_text:
I have travelled Chester to London for a decade. I cannot begin to describe the horror that is Avanti. Any time a refund is required they deliberately do not properly process the request, asking for information that you did provide. What used to be a one click process is now weeks of keeping track of things. Ticket prices are astronomical, there are virtually no saver fares even when booking way ahead and even when they are they are twice the price of Virgin. When there have been serious weather related disruption they have done the absolute minimum in terms of ticket derestriction. 

Avanti is like going back to the 1970’s in terms of product and customer service. It’s so bad I’ve started driving for most of my trips. They really need to lose the franchise, this company is really damaging travel between the North West and London.

items.title: On top of their usually mediocre and…
items.review_text:
On top of their usually mediocre and incredibly expensive service this week their app and website were down. I spent an hour and 20 minutes waiting on hold only to be told that not even Avanti could book tickets on their own train services!
After all this Avanti still charged me 75£ for a ticket that I did not even receive. 
If there were any alternative, I would use it.

items.title: Automatic ADR doesn’t work
items.review_text: Automatic ADR doesn’t work. Customer service email wait for a reply is 4 weeks. Refunds take forever. Delayed on three consecutive journeys by over 70 minutes. Terrible service and customer service.

items.title: Horrendous.
items.review_text: Horrendous.

items.title: I am stuck with Avante
items.review_text: I am stuck with Avante, as I have babysitting duties and have been shocked by the bad service, delays, cancellations, you name it! I am used to Merseyrail, who are spot on and customer focussed. North Western is terrible too!!! They all need to up their game.

items.title: AVOID THESE ROBBERS AT ANY COST!
items.review_text:
The company is a bunch of robbers. My train was cancelled and entire journey was delayed more than 60 mins. I submitted a delay repay in June and it was approved on 30.06.21, but I still haven't received my compensation. They promised to pay it in 28 days and it's been 120 days and still nothing. Every time I contact the company I had to wait for weeks for their responce and each time I was promised different things. 
It is a private company and they are only interested in grabbing people's money. It is impossible to talk to  someone on the phone and customer services seem to be unable to do anything and couldn't care less.

items.title: Charged twice for the same ticket
items.review_text: Charged twice for the same ticket, now, as the moment of my life the extra deducted money was all my remaining cash for this week. disgusting, how will i feed myself until payday?!?!?!

items.title: Disgusted
items.review_text: Disgusted! How can a company just awarded a franchise be so bad. They should be investigated as to minimum service level required - simply transporting me to London and back is NOT enough - I may as well be a box in a goods vehicle rather than a human being having paid an awful lot of hard earned money to travel. NOT HAPPY. But guess what? If I wish to travel by train I have no choice! What a mess train travel in the UK is.

items.title: Absolutely disgusting trains in terms…
items.review_text: Absolutely disgusting trains in terms of cleanliness! Took a west coast Avanti train from London to Carlisle in November 2021 where carpets were almost black with dirt, loos stank and filthy, seats and walls just grubby and dirty! I paid £110 for the pleasure economy class! After having not taken a west coast train since Virgin ran these trains I am disgusted and will never again take an Avanti train….filthy filthy filthy! Cost cutting millionaires I suspect are responsible.

items.title: Bought a £27 off-peak
items.review_text:
Bought a £27 off-peak, open-return ticket from Birmingham New St to London Euston using Trainline.

Trainline has worked perfectly each time. I was on the right train, at the right time, yet the guy scanning my tickets insisted it wasn't valid and charged me £48...

items.title: One star is generous.
items.review_text:
One star is generous.

Hundreds of pounds on tickets for the worst service I have ever received in my whole entire life. How can a company be so sh#t? How can they charge so much for the WORST customer experience? Two weekends in a row we’ve had our trains from Lancaster to London Euston cancelled. 

I CAN’T EXPRESS ENOUGH HOW TERRIBLE AVANTI WEAT COAST ARE.
