If you can avoid please do. They’ll cancel your train and charge you a tenner for the pleasure as well as leaving you high and dry at the last minute. 

Jesus lord, why have you cursed me with avanti west coast? 

This company brings nothing but rage, anger and upset and stress out of me. 

I cannot believe how poorly this company is being run but hey… there’s probably some rich bast@rd sitting on all the profits laughing at us. 

I hate, HATE you avanti west coast.

items.title: Bring back Virgin
items.review_text: Bring back Virgin. Useless website, cancel trains due to staffing (can see why staff have left!), wont refund as per their promises.  Trains are overpriced, not clean and all I can say is avoid if you can.

items.title: Vile staff & company
items.review_text: Train cancelled. Paid extra to go a different route. Get to London Euston and the horrific Avanti staff wouldn't let me use my upgraded ticket as my original ticket was off-peak. Explained that the original train was cancelled to no avail. Took matters to the ticket office at London Euston where I met Christine(?) from Avanti, the single vilest woman I've ever met. She obviously has serious personal issues and has no place working in customer service. Couldn't get a word in edgeways between her repeatedly shouting "yOu CaN't UsE oFf-pEaK tIcKeTS oN a PeAk TrAiN". Apparently the upgraded ticket I paid for at Reading still wasn't enough. Literally said "nOt oUr PrObLeM" and "gO bAcK tO rEaDiNg aNd SpEaK tO tHeM". Had to wait for the next off-peak train and was just shy of 2 hours late, completely ruining both mine and my colleagues' plans. Company culture generally trickles down from the top, so you can only imagine how awful senior management must be. Always opt to drive if you can!

items.title: A return from Preston to London is £378…
items.review_text: A return from Preston to London is £378 - similar to a return flight to Cyprus with meals and taxi! The off peak return is planned to take 1hr 30mins longer - but in fact took 3hrs longer due to issues with the network. Just drive if you can

items.title: Frodo had it easier than we did
items.review_text:
Train cancelled due to lack of drivers, got crammed on another train with not only that days trainload but with the PREVIOUS days train load from yet another cancelled train. Got halfway to Wales before being told all trains to Holyhead were cancelled and we'd have to take a coach the rest of the way leaving us standing in the rain in November out the back of a train station. We unfortunately missed the first coach load only to then be told the next train actually WAS going to Holyhead, which was then subsequently also delayed another 30-40 mins due to a signal failure, we were 2 hours late on what was supposed to be a 3 hour journey.

I still sometimes think about the poor people who got on that first coach, I wonder if they ever made it

items.title: Probably one of the worst services I’ve…
items.review_text: Probably one of the worst services I’ve had the pleasure of using. Terrible customer service, was sat in stationary train for 2 hours and it ended up getting cancelled. Apparently was eligible for refund and applied twice on their site just to be rejected. What a terrible company.

items.title: Impossible to get through online/phone
items.review_text: Online delay replay system in a loop/doesn't work. Hunted down phone number ... same ... then on hold forever with funky music designed to make you mad/ give up.   Train car very hot (they couldn't turn it down).  Nowhere near as good as Virgin.

items.title: We are currently a family of 4 sat on…
items.review_text: We are currently a family of 4 sat on the floor in a train from Euston to Liverpool, they cancelled the earlier train so we are now doubled up. No service, just pathetic apologies all the way home. Our outbound train was also overflowing with vulnerable people made to stand or sit in doorways. It's like a cattle truck. Please avoid this complete shambles of a company. It's just littered with apologies with nothing to back it up, just the carriages looking about as tired as the people made to travel in them ☹️

items.title: The Worst customer Service bar NONE
items.review_text: Need to telephone Avanti to issue a refund; currently waiting 1hr 58mins. Have found two email addresses and have emailed my request, but no response.

items.title: Slower than virgin
items.review_text: Slower than virgin. Don’t why the useless government decided to move away from virgin!

items.title: Yes I’m afraid I am another…
items.review_text:
Yes I’m afraid I am another disappointed customer. Paid over a thousand pounds for 3 x 1st class tickets from Carlisle to London there and back and the hospitality is no where near as good as Virgin. I expect to be offered food and drink throughout the journey and this is now not the case. On the way back they had no hot food to offer, only soggy sandwiches and some cheese and crackers. 
not happy to pay more and receive less than I did before the takeover…

items.title: WiFi never wowkd
items.review_text:
WiFi never wowkd
 Constantly disconnected. My phone always works what's the problem? Can't pay for stuff with a card half the time you have to wait or try 3 times to succeeds. No nectar anymore. No off peek at weekends. Advanced fairs are stop still too high. Yep I'll just keep on driving and adding to the traffic on our roads while thid company tailers to only the richest that can afford such luxury s like I dunno travelling on a train.

It's not even a joke anymore. People can't afford to get to work. Greedy franchise.

items.title: First class travel on Avanti now a joke
items.review_text: First class travel on Avanti is now a complete joke. Several times now I have been crammed into coach K with the kitchen and no table seat and yet prices far higher than with Virgin. A complete absence of advance tickets and often 2 x coaches given over to Standard Premium. I am waiting for this experiment with Standard Premium to end!! Even the on board staff agree that it is now a joke. Hopefully this franchise will never be repeated.

items.title: It is very difficult to book tickets…
items.review_text: It is very difficult to book tickets using the avanti website. I am not able to book tickets for January even though it is just over a month away. I have no idea which trains are available. Bring back virgin trains- they were so much better

items.title: On train from Wigan to London first…
items.review_text:
On train from Wigan to London first class.
Breakfast was told thick cut bacon in granary bread. Got cold bacon in white cold bread that then got last to spoon ketchup on.

Now sat with three Avanti staff behind me chatting away . 

Paid first class to work on the train and comfort.

Can’t concentrate on meeting I have in London as they are talking absolute gibberish.

items.title: if you dont trust me, experience yourself.
items.review_text:
the wifi is abosultely not working...... the seats are super cramped, the train is not cleaned well, 

worst of all is the air conditioning system...... you wont feel warm, it's just like having a bath sauna

there are no charging sockets along the two-sided seats (which is the majority type of seat in this railway) which is annoying. 

please, disinfect the train before others board.

you british rail companies gain such a huge profit from our expensive as hell train tickets, and i dont really expect this kind of service.

items.title: Why are the trains at weekend at…
items.review_text: Why are the trains at weekend at different prices ? At least with Virgin the whole weekend was off peak. All this has led to is cattle trucks during off peak times for the poorer person. Avanti your greedy, and your service ain't all that either !! Especially when your travelling from Manchester to London and people are sat in the aisle.How are customers supposed to stay safe with the ever present COVID-19. Shame on you. Bring back Branson

items.title: Zero customer service.
items.review_text: 30 min minimum hold time for customer service, this is a built in wait time and the music is so so annoying. Tried email but the person misread my request and didn’t respond to my email. Useless. Covid is no longer a good enough excuse. Should essential services be allowed to have next to impossible ways to contact them?

items.title: Well blow me down, it's possible to be worse than virgin!!
items.review_text:
The trains aren't cleaned properly, one I'm on right now has papers etc in seats from previous trip.

The tills onboard in shop seem very intermittent. Often can't pay by card in shop.

The WiFi doesn't work, it's constantly in a state of disconnect.

Apart from that is a wonderful service

items.title: Well done Avanti
items.review_text:
Ist class, 22.30 train from Euston to Rugby. The train departed promptly, was clean. Very cheerful lady checked our tickets. The most charming young man came and took our order for drinks and food. The mixed salad I got came in a proper bowl ( please note, not prepackaged with plastic/wooden cutlery) with lovely stainless steel cutlery. It was absolutely delicious with a huge tumbler of Prosecco. My friend had cheese and biscuits again freshly prepared and beautifully served.
Well done Avanti. You ce train Ly made me feel a privileges passenger!!

items.title: Not good just because my train was at…
items.review_text: Not good just because my train was at 5.11am to London Euston and I caught the 5.05 am the ticket guy said I have to pay 180 pound but I already payed 120 and wth.. Never go with them again rip people off..

items.title: This company is ABSOLUTELY disgusting
items.review_text: This company is ABSOLUTELY disgusting. They advertise delay repay for any delays passed 15 minutes but it is a complete ruse. DO NOT trust them.

items.title: The absolute pits
items.review_text: The absolute pits. Rip off prices. Compare the price of a ticket on LNER or Lumo from Edinburgh instead of Glasgow. It's 4 times the price with Avanti!!! I do find the staff on the trains to be helpful though so don't take out your anger at Avanti on the staff, they probably hate Avanti more than their customers do. Been using this route for years but never again.

items.title: Not an efficient service
items.review_text: Considering they cancelled most of the trains on a Sunday when most people are returning from the COP is appalling, insufficient seats, the Wi-Fi system is crap, not strong enough and furthermore, there weren’t enough seats and a lot of people were standing. Sockets  to charge phones should be a common requirement now considering the age we are in, for a 6 hour journey, there was nowhere to charge a phone, considering the ticket cost £108 return this service is not up-to standard at all, and the ticket staff at Glasgow are extremely rude, all in all, it’s a poor customer service all round.

items.title: Since being taken over from Virgin
items.review_text: Since being taken over from Virgin, the service has been shocking. A tree fell on the track once, there were no communication all day. They had a broken down train on a Sunday, total chaos!! Yet they charge the same as Virgin.

items.title: Overpriced
items.review_text: Overpriced, not affordable,limited ticket options for frequent travellers

items.title: Horrendous - bikers not welcome!!
items.review_text: Confirmed - public transport is useless. Its just not designed for real people who want convenience. Profit making at the expense of user experience and service. Awful. Im trying to embrace being more green, ditched the car and cycle everywhere in London. Needed to get home to see my mum in birmingham, cycled to Euston station, huge queues at the office desk so bought a ticket from the machine, bike in hand. Wasn’t allowed to board the train as apparently there are only four bike slots on the entire train. What world do these guys and gals live in. Firstly why four bike slots for the entire train, I mean how’s that supposed to encourage people to use micro mobility transport, improving city centres by reducing air pollution and traffic. Not to mention a booking system that didn’t mention that effectively if you ride a bike then you aren’t welcome. Absolute load of rubbish. Fortunately I’m in the economic position to buy another car, which sadly remains the only way of ascertaining convenience and flexibility. Feel sorry for all those who are at the mercy of this god awful system.

items.title: Onboard hub working but shows very little content
items.review_text:
Onboard hub not showing any content although WiFi on and working. Tracker not connecting, news papers similarly. Cop26 film works but not tv hub. 
No cash being accepted in buffet. I'm sat in buffet and overheard staff not keeping system switched on as 'getting too busy'. Plus she can't see screens as forgot her glasses. 
Please bring back Virgin.

items.title: We travelled to London from Liverpool
items.review_text: We travelled to London from Liverpool. There was myself, sister and our mother who is 86 years old. We booked railway assist prior to the journey. It was quick easy and the lady on the phone even changed our seats to the disabled section which was brilliant. When we arrived at Euston we were met by a lively gentleman who's name I've forgotten but helped mother and put all our baggage on his cart and took us to the front of the station. He was very pleasant and chatty. On the return journey again the guy who helped us was very friendly and chatty, his name was Robert he helped put our luagge on and helped mother onto the train. Absolutely fantastic service all the staff were helpful. We couldn't have done it without there help. We'll done to all.

items.title: This is the worse customer service…
items.review_text:
This is the worse customer service experience I have ever had. I wanted a refund of tickets bought for a family outing that we had to cancel. I called the call centre on a rip off call centre number 03455280253. Don’t use it as it charges you, I waited for 1hour 21mins and it has cost me £16.65. I never got through. 
I had to email them about the refund.
So I was eventually given a customer resolution no and asked to cut up my cards and take a picture and send to them that was on 1st Nov 21 I am still waiting. This is absolutely the worst service I have ever had.
In essence the webpage and so called customer service and help pages are designed so that you give up. The fact that you have no right to speak with anyone at any point of your issue with them is appalling. I will definitely not travel with them in future. Bring back Virgin, they at least made you feel that they cared. 
AVANTI are a Joke.

items.title: So disappointed when your on the early…
items.review_text: So disappointed when your on the early morning train and you pay first class just on £500 return and they don’t offer you breakfast.  Yes they offer lunch which the menu is awful but not the point. If your on the train before 12am you should be offed breakfast.

items.title: Total rip off
items.review_text: Total rip off , bought a super off peak ticket from the app only to find the restrictions are completely ridiculous .  You kind of assume when buying a train ticket you don’t have to read a ton of terms and conditions to avoid being conned, in effect my ticket had a travel window of less than an hour  Bring back Virgin , not great but not the rip off that Avanti are

items.title: I refuse to travel with Avanti
items.review_text: I have stopped travelling with Avanti because of their outrageous ticket prices.  I used to travel with them once a month from Watford to Glasgow, first class return, but the ticket fare has become astronomical. And I refuse to be held hostage by an operator exploiting its monopoly over a mainline route. I now travel up the East Coast with LNER and change at Edinburgh. I don’t mind spending a bit longer on the train for a much more reasonable fare. However, as great as I think LNER is, I think the West Coast Mainline deserves better, and Avanti should have direct competition on the route to either force down their ticket fares or force them off the rails.

items.title: Very poor customer service experience
items.review_text: They seem to have a problem accepting PayPal payments, you can't find tickets via the app (as it appears to have permanent technical issues) and they don't reply to emails. Avoid, if at all possible.

items.title: If I could give no stars I would
items.review_text:
I recently bought 2 return tickets from London to Manchester (at nearly £200) on the Avanti website.   

I chose to use Paypal so was redirected to the Paypal website and did the necessary and then hit complete payment.  Nothing happened, no redirecting back to Avanti, no booking ref - nothing. 

I went back to the Avanti website and see the 2 tickets still in the basket - same journey, same dates, same seats.  So, thinking the payment has not gone through, I go through the process again.  This time I'm redirected back from Paypal to Avanti website where I see my booking ref. 

Following day I get 2 confirmations from Avanti under different booking refs for exactly the same journey - same dates, same times, same seats.  And my paypal account has been charged twice.  

I tried ringing customer services - after 40 minutes, £12 (its an 0345 number so 30p a minute with my mobile network) and a lot of crappy hold music I hung up.  

I've now had to use the very convoluted process on their website to request a refund - 2 separate requests for 2 tickets.  Their link to their help/refund page doesn't work either.  

The overarching impression I have of Avanti is that their business is purely a money making exercise with little or no regard for the customers that they need to make that money - a typical profits before people scenario.

Their website is not fit for purpose - how can you buy the same seats twice??  I can't be the only one this has happened to.  

So far I have wasted a colossal amount of my time trying to deal with Avanti's incompetence.

items.title: Pricing very expensive staff rude and…
items.review_text: Pricing very expensive staff rude and they try their upmost not to give refunds I am sick of having to travel with them another absolute mess created by this government

items.title: Prior to Covid my wife and I travelled…
items.review_text: Prior to Covid my wife and I travelled frequently to London by Virgin trains to visit our daughters. Holding senior railcards we were able to book first class travel at very reasonable prices. We were dismayed when the franchise was taken away from Virgin as we considered this the best franchise in the UK - frequent and reliable travel at a good price. Having not travelled by train since Covid first hit we felt confident now to book travel to London again. When I tried booking with Avanti I felt sure I was making a mistake in my booking but no, the price has more than doubled!!!  For what? Looking at the reviews on Trustpilot I see 84% of reviews are for just 1 star - shocking. At the price now quoted it is far cheaper for us to travel by car which is what we intend to do. Bring back Virgin and their pricing!

items.title: Quite good
items.review_text: The fleet is clean and the website works well. The staff are also very friendly. It's just that the trains are always late but I get that sometimes that is not Avanti's fault but sometimes the staff should be more helpful giving info. But they are a good operator

items.title: Pro's and Con's
items.review_text:
I am an experienced business traveler. Tickets on this line appear to be very expensive in relation to LNER for example. Even the cheap tickets seen rather expensive. 
I must say however the service is quick and efficient and the breakfast in First Class is the best on the entire network.

items.title: Staff are aggressive and lack empathy or customer service basics
items.review_text:
Normally I’ll only ever write a review if something was incredible or appalling, tofay it is the later. 

Staff of Avanti (particularly Euston) treat customers appallingly bad, I had an issue with staff being aggressive, lacking basic empathy and being out right rude. 

So rude in fact that other staff members and customers come over to apologise on their behalf.

Before the service was avanti I had never ran into any problems with staff. The staff at Euston are rude and lack basic custom service.

items.title: Just terrible from booking to getting off
items.review_text: Really poor customer service. Very expensive tickets and a website that says you can choose your seats when booking, which is a lie. You can 'upgrade' to a big seat in the first class for £25, which is a rip-off. Who would bother? The carriages are not very well designed, with many seats having no window and minimal luggage space. I didn't mind so much with Virgin as prices were good on the whole, and the staff were friendly. Avanti is awful though. Passive-aggressive tannoy announcements warn against sitting in the wrong place, and delight in explaining how little you get in the 'upgraded' seats. They don't seem to be able to operate the aircon either, so you boil or freeze. Trying to select a seat whilst booking online is like playing a really bad and lengthy computer game, once invested in the process, you don't want to stop, but ultimately you can never win....so end up booking on the Trainline instead, happy to pay a booking fee even if you can't choose you seats, as at least you will be seated together.

items.title: Crap service of a company that runs…
items.review_text: Crap service of a company that runs trains no refreshments on a train but they charge you 100s to travel .no wounder ppl thoughts about public transport are right .. next time I fly it's cheaper and I get a drink or able to buy food or drinks on the services they say they offer bit it's clear this company doest.

items.title: Bring back Virgin!
items.review_text: I have tried several times to book journeys on the Avanti website, but each time I am thwarted; examples are because the return date (one week after the outward journey) has not yet been released (I am trying to book a holiday but am prevented from doing so); trying to book a first class seat, the system won't let me book a seat that is shown as available, presumably because I am a single traveller and they want to put me in an aircraft seat, even though I must have a table to work on; because some journeys are outrageously expensive for no good reason; because the system won't let me book the same class in both directions; because the site just emptied my basket for no good reason etc.etc. Booking a rail journey should be simple, whoever designed this website should be ashamed of themselves. I was a regular traveller on Virgin, since the start of lifting of restrictions, I have been unable to book with Avanti

items.title: Absolutely disgraceful train company
items.review_text: If I can rate this train company minus one or even less I would. On the 28th October 2021 their 1657 train from London Euston to Glasgow was cancelled as none of their trains were going from London Euston to Glasgow due to flooding, despite turning to staff at the station for advice and help on how to get home, I was fobbed off and left stranded in London for days, having to make my own alternate route home to Glasgow at my expense. I have since tried relentlessly to get my monies back for the train service they failed to provide and still being fobbed off. Avanti West coast took my money, cancelled a service and have failed to reimburse me the monies for a service they have not provided. If a company fails to provide a service, consumers are entitled to their money back. How can you keep my £79 for a train service you cancelled and fail to make amends by returning customers money. Absolutely disgraceful.

items.title: Scam
items.review_text: Scam, train delayed 4 hours and their website won't let me claim a refund.

items.title: Regular traveller from North Wales to…
items.review_text: Regular traveller from North Wales to London . No comparison to virgin. Very poor service. Unreliable booking service. Numerous changes and reduced direct trains. Bring back Virgin  .

items.title: This train company really is a disaster…
items.review_text: This train company really is a disaster like everyone says... I normally travel first class but I decided to use the Standard Premium service because of the skyrocketing prices, even with a railcard. Also on my last few first class journeys they squished us into the half carriage K while the two standard premium coaches were empty - personally I'd prefer the space over the mediocre first class food. I still paid over £150 for a SP return and, when attempting to order a coffee on their much-advertised at-seat service I was greeted repeatedly with an error message. On querying this, I was told that staff member was sick so no at seat service on this train. I was travelling EUS to GLA so that was 5 hours of schlepping up and down pretty much the entire train to the shop. Then almost £3 for an americano. Honestly dont give these charlatans your money - find the cheapest standard ticket you can and bring your own food.

items.title: Cancelled  trains and no refunds
items.review_text:
Trains were cancelled  October half term due to weather conditions  . I was planning to visit my parents with my son.

In the email  received  from Avanti it stated for advance tickets I could amend my journey or receive e travel voucher. I followed  instructions  in  the email .Web site would not allow me to amend travel dates . I then sent Avanti an email to request a refund I did this before 6pm day before travel to avoid admin fees.

3 days later received email asking for same information  again booking ref and copies of tickets.Heard nothing since from Avanti why having a booking promise and then not honour it.
 
Looks like Avanti are doing everything  to avoid refunding . It's a shame  when train companies are trying to encourage  people to travel with them.
Maybe railway ombudsman  need to be aware of these issues .

items.title: THIEVES
items.review_text: Trains cancelled and now refusing a refund for a service that didn’t operate!

items.title: The very worst there is
items.review_text: Shocking from start to finish but it’s hardly worth leaving a review when they can’t even be bothered to monitor their TrustPilot page and respond to customers, if you can waapis using them please do so at all costs

items.title: It's unfortunate there isn't a zero…
items.review_text: It's unfortunate there isn't a zero star option.  Even though Avanti know they have cancelled all trains between Coventry and Euston, two and a half hours later the worthless incompetents still hadn't arranged a bus replacement service.  The staff are completely clueless.

items.title: Robbed of time and Money
items.review_text:
Such a poor service from start to finish. Must have spent 10 hours trying to get through to resolve my situation caused by Avanti. 
Booked tickets on the 11th of October 2021 from Euston to Liverpool for travel on the 5th of November returning on the 7th. Paid £2 for special delivery with an expected arrival date of 16th. Nothing has come. 
I did receive an e-ticket for a trip from Euston to Glasgow for the 29th of October which made me think some kind of fraud had been committed but online they assured me some kind of error had been made despite getting text updates right up to the time of travel yesterday. Makes me think someone had my tickets and exchanged them. Anyway, twice I’ve been told to hold tight and wate a few more days! Tickets still show on my account, but I can’t get through on the phone and despite doing the pointless live text/msg no one will call me. 
I would happily take an e-ticket or collect from Euston or any other station but apparently this can’t be done. A phone call would be nice or the tickets!! Don’t use Avanti if you can avoid them. They don’t care!

items.title: Not a patch on Virgin Trains and hugely…
items.review_text: Not a patch on Virgin Trains and hugely expensive. The prices have shot up and you cant find any cheap advance tickets anymore. Service was mediocre at least Virgin staff were always cheerful. Something has to be done about these ridiculous fares,how are we ever going to  tackle  global warming when I can fly for less than the train fare and twice as fast. Im a die-hard train user so Im stuck using them as its the only green choice but frankly Avanti are not up to the job. When is the government going to give us regulated fares....bring back Virgin Trains !

items.title: I'd give it less than one star if I…
items.review_text: I'd give it less than one star if I could - the website is appalling - I have been trying to book tickets via it for 2 hours and it sticks on various pages.  I would use another site to book via but I have voucher codes for free tickets because of previous service failure and am now stuck in the 7 cricles of hell.  It's not a one off thing either - has happened every time I try to book.

items.title: Great journey from Glasgow to London…
items.review_text: Great journey from Glasgow to London Euston with Avanti West Coast. On the way back, we were delayed over an hour, therefore receiving 100% of the return journey back. Can't fault the service. Look forward to traveling again.

items.title: Superb menu choices in 1st class
items.review_text: Superb menu choices in 1st class which were very tasty. Excellent service and hosts in 1st class. A little on the warm side for me in the carriage but my family were okay! I found the classic tomato and sausage in my breakfast not quite cooked enough for my liking so I’ll ask for them to be well cooked another  time.

items.title: Expensive
items.review_text: Expensive. My elderly mother has been a regular first class, off peak traveller between Manchester Picc and Milton Keynes for the last 20 years. Since Avanti took over, prices have risen by a third and the so called "advance booking for the cheapest seats" do not exist. I've just tried to book seats over the Xmas period two months in advance and the price is even more expensive than when she came in September and booked only two weeks in advance. Total rip off.

items.title: Rip off merchants
items.review_text: Rip off merchants. Double the price for half the service.

items.title: Avanti ruining UK school holidays!
items.review_text:
Avanti ruining UK school holidays!
The fares are only for millionaires!

Would anyone really pay £570 open return or £380 specified return from Liverpool to London? I think not! So, why even list costs like that? I wanted to take my son to London during the half term. Looked in advance and it was financially impossible! Avanti are a disgrace to this country and should be held accountable for restricting economical travel to the masses in the UK with prices like that! They’re not just ruining school holidays but also the lives of people in this country! To top the lot, the service is awful and the trains are dirty. It was never like this with Virgin. Branson knows how to provide service but expects at least some profit and rightly so but as usual, he was probably screwed by the typical bureaucracy inherent in this country!

items.title: BRING BACK VIRGIN TRAINS!!
items.review_text:
BRING BACK VIRGIN TRAINS!!

Avanti West Coast, an embarrassment to the UK. 

- Rocketed prices 
- Average 2.5 hour wait time for customer services (at best)
- Poor overall customer service 
- Poor CS company and industry knowledge 
- Poor onboard service 
- Poor website 
- Poor booking portal 

Whatever did the loyal train users do to deserve such hellish treatment and service. Please bring back virgin trains!!

items.title: Travelling home from London to…
items.review_text: Travelling home from London to Edinburgh with young family and lots of luggage. The main worry I had was finding space for all our luggage but that became a minor concern when an email arrived announcing the train we were due to travel on had been cancelled. We had to drop everything and cut our last day short. On arriving at the station the Avanti staff were not at all helpful and more or less shrugged us off and sent us to the ticket office to try and scramble on to another service but now with no seats booked. The ticket office (not Avanti staff) was very helpful and we ended up on a direct train to Edinburgh. After racing to the unallocated carriage we managed to find seats together and finally felt able to relax. That was a mistake. As we neared Scotland the tannoy came on to announce that the train was going to finish at Carlisle instead due to staff shortages. Cue another dose of stress and having to get everything off the train and ready for another scramble on to a yet to be confirmed service. Only thanks to LNER were we able to get home on their service which was unusually diverted to Carlisle. I will never travel by Avanti again and likely not by rail to be honest.

items.title: Exorbitant
items.review_text:
Advance tickets never seem to be available like they were with Virgin and where they are they are significantly more expensive. Should never have been given the franchise. 

Liverpool to London can be had with London Northwestern for £12.50 in advance with a change at Crewe. An hour longer but a fraction of the price. These chancers won't be getting any of my money.

items.title: Avanti..... a poor replacement for Virgin
items.review_text:
Used today from Birmingham International to Glasgow. Late, overcrowded, chaotic seat reservation system, limited catering, no "at seat" trolley, inaudible on board announcements and on train staff conspicuous by their absence.
Also, even in revamped form, old Voyager trains not comfortable enough for such a long journey.
Pretty underwhelmed by my first experience of Avanti...

items.title: First off all when I am writing this…
items.review_text:
First off all when I am writing this review it based on my own experience but I taken look at the star rating and not suprised at all . The level of service is some what outrageous and disgusting too .

Please find my attached review 


Formal complaint plus new complaint too .
A
Ant
Dear Mr phil whittingham CEO for Avanti west cost. 

First off all let me apologize for emailing again tonight.

I first want to say I will not be accepting the £25.00 from the last complaint now I am having to wait up to 28 days now . 

Poor communication for company it had to take s customer to point this out 
When Jodie said 14 days it can go to dead lock and I will take the rail ombudsman also . 

Second part of this email new complaint when I came down to London this morning the system that got used to book seats wasn't working and the train manager was saying it been broken for flew days which would mean Avanti CEO team would of really understand this and then wouldn't booked me a seat for this evening train .

To add because of my medication and makes me tried I have had to pay out £50.00 £25.00 each way to make sure I can rest etc .

The fact that Jodie new about this but wouldn't help me on Friday worrying too this going in to my new complaint also . 

Avanti train system is extremely outrageous and extremely poor in customer service and over the phone system .

Also to add the booking tickets  system online isn't working taken evdence of this too 

To add the train coming down from stockport to London today this morning the toliet was pool at the back of seat and paying £25.00 for this level of service extremely shocking and outrageous also . 

Over all I would even give this company 1 point for over all services extremely disappointed and I will be putting this online .

The fact the company don't take people health condition seriously worrying anyway. 

Please will you have some senior to look at the over all  

Plus call me back please

Kind regards

Anthony

To add for CEO the kind service is what you expect for train service ? 


Ant
to ceo.office

This email for senior management and will be placing this online for over people to see what this company like .

Action speak loud than words .

items.title: Fed up of being forced to use this…
items.review_text:
Fed up of being forced to use this terrible service as it’s the only option to travel between Manchester and London. The trains are constantly broken- the amount of times the reservations simply don’t work is ridiculous! This means people always sit in my reserved seats and sometimes refuse to move. It makes the whole journey awkward when it shouldn’t even be an issue in the first place.
Secondly- the prices are too high. As a regular user of this service for the past five years I have seen the prices rise constantly and yet have only received  worse service in return. 
The introduction of standard premium is simply a joke. There is no way it is worth paying £25 more to be able to access a table seat. First class tickets used to be reasonably priced for off peak journeys but now they are ridiculously high and there is no option for a relatively cheap on board upgrade. Disappointing all round. 
Finally, despite demand being seemingly high (lack of tickets available and trains always busier than they used to be) Avanti are still running a reduced COVID service.

items.title: Please please come back Virgin!!
items.review_text:
Please please come back Virgin!!

As a regular first class traveller (twice per week) with Virgin between London and Manchester and now with Avanti. I feel that I am in a good position to leave valid feedback.

The service levels have dropped significantly since Avanti have taken over the franchise from Virgin. Some of the friendly staff have remained and transferred to Avanti, however the staff I have encountered recently were very abrupt.

No longer do they provide two rounds of drink service, only one, this isn't just purely covid because they could offer two drinks on one walk through. The standard of food has dropped in quality and they are still using the old Virgin carriages. Where are the new trains that were promised? 

I won't pay their increased prices for first anymore either, quicker and much better to fly with BA Club europe.

Just taken a trip in standard class. Card machine not working in the shop and the 'at seat' service via their app wouldn't allow me to order food and drink. Very disappointed.

Seat reservation system not working on both trips so always having to ask other passengers to vacate your seat.

items.title: Rubbish First Class Service on Avanti
items.review_text:
I travelled from London Euston to Manchester this morning on  635am, first class as I wanted to have breakfast. 
A big drop in service standards since Virgin.
All First passengers are now squeezed into a few rows of seats in Coach K which is smelly due to proximity to kitchen and claustrophobic due to its unpleasant layout. 
The breakfast was pretty poor in comparison to Virgin's offer and given all First Class passengers are squeezed into one small space you have to eat it bunched up with a load of strangers whilst the two Standard Premier carriages are completely empty.

items.title: Pathetic
items.review_text: Non existent WiFI, plugs don's work, smells like a toilet. On Board team ok. Management clearly don't care. Benefit of going on a train is the fact you could possibly do some work. Not with this mob.  Will fly from now on. Pathetic

items.title: Shameful
items.review_text:
They send regular emails about how clean and Covid safe their trains are. On my morning Avanti journey yesterday the toilet had no water (this happens all the time with Avanti) and on my journey back the carriage smelled of vomit and there were bits of vomit on my floor. Once I was home my partner advised that I smelled of vomit. My bag smelled of vomit. 

So to Avanti: cleaning trains means actually they don't clean the train, and giving us Covid safe trains means giving you a toilet with no way to wash your hands.

items.title: No distancing no masks 50000 cases a…
items.review_text: No distancing no masks 50000 cases a day no wonder UK is worst in Europe with irresponsible companies like this.

items.title: Refund process utterly obstructive
items.review_text: Trying to claim a refund after a 3 hour plus delay. The process is deliberately obstructive. Utter, utter c***s.

items.title: Avanti claim to offer refunds for…
items.review_text: Avanti claim to offer refunds for delayed journeys but actually their process is so (deliberately) difficult you have to spend literally hours on it. Also I booked a complex journey of 2 legs with them- the Avanti train from Stockport to Milton Keynes was so delayed I missed the connection yet they transferred my claim to Southern - who I hadn’t even travelled with. I had to appeal - that was turned down and then threaten to take my experience to my MP before they agreed to pay. I would never travel with them again if I had a choice but I don’t because they have a monopoly on the Manchester to London line. Just recently I had to book with them again- again a complex journey with 3 children and they failed to email me my e- tickets- there is no contact number on their website and no chat function. I had to find my account through Google- again no link to my account on their website and try to download my tickets manually- which was extremely difficult as their site kept downloading the same ticket instead of the others. On the journey with 3 kids although I had reserved seats I was told the booking system wasn’t working at the start of the journey so people were sitting anywhere I had to ask people to move so that I could sit near the children to look after them. This service is a absolute disgrace and a shambles yet ticket prices have gone up! They deserve a negative rating - yet I have to give them one star to review them.

items.title: If I could give 0 stars I would
items.review_text:
If I could give 0 stars I would. Travelled on a late train (20:48) from Liverpool to London, it was delayed twice, for 2 separate reasons (drunk person on the track that they couldn’t locate, and later some problem with the tracks.) we were delayed by 2.5 hours in the end meaning we’d missed all the last trains to get home therefore having to pay for an expensive Uber.
Then when I tried to apply for a refund it was unsuccessful as I apparently didn’t show the price of the ticket (which I’m pretty sure I did) and it would only allow you to upload one image which wasn’t enough to show the receipt, ticket and booking confirmation in one. Then I missed the appeal timeframe because It still wouldn’t let me upload more than one document to support my case.
Really appalling service which is much worse than when I used to travel this route with Virgin.
Unbelievable.

items.title: If I could give zero
items.review_text:
If I could give zero, I actually would!

I used to travel frequently via Virgin from New Street to Euston and used to pay no more than £60 for return first class. Since these bunch of charlatans took over the prices have more than doubled yet the service has declined.

It used to take 1 hr 15 the journey now it takes 1 hr 30! The food offering with Virgin was great these guys are clueless! Just looking to rip customers off at every turn! Advance tickets never released on time like they were with Virgin!

I paid £118 for a single first class return ticket, on the return I asked to change it to an earlier train on the Sunday (Instead of returning at 1.20pm I returned at 11.52) and was charged an extra £29!!! that's only after me arguing with the Staff at Euston as they wanted to charge an extra £10 admin fee!

The Directors at this Company should be pulled in by the DFT as they have destroyed what was once a great service and offer very little back! 

Bring back Virgin save us from these profiteering charlatans!

items.title: As bad as it can get
items.review_text:
Shocking “first class” service
Euston Lounge no hand soap in bathrooms - service slow and staff more focused on their social life than customers.
On train Wi-fi seldom works - avanti media never works.
Lucky if they have half the menu - always running out of food.
Weekend first even worse - no service at all.
What a complete and utter shambles.

items.title: Appalling customer service in first class
items.review_text: Appalling customer service in first class…I won’t raise the name on here but I have made a complaint…..which will take up to 4 weeks for a response…!!! I will not be returning to Avanti when my monthly season ticket expires in November. Virgin were much better and I will now move to Cross Country as I am a daily user.

items.title: Bought Standard Premium tickets
items.review_text: Bought Standard Premium tickets which were fine on the outward journey.Return journey not good Train is mobbed,not very clean and not any more room than on a standard seat.Not any social distancing and not a mask to be seen apart from my husband and I.

items.title: Amazing service from Hannah
items.review_text: I had to make a last minute change to my tickets and had the great fortune of speaking to Hannah through Facebook messenger. She resolved my issue within 5 minutes and was really responsive to my request. Would give 6 stars if I could, thank you so much.

items.title: New interior seats very uncomfortable
items.review_text: New interior seats very uncomfortable, glad I was only on for 2 hours. Only positive was carpet was clean for my dog to lie on. All seats very expensive website seat picker not working no reply from Avanti how to fix

items.title: Terrible for bike users
items.review_text:
Cons: Staff seem like they forget about bikes. Very unhelpful when getting on or off! However some staff members act better than the other. 
On the other hand, they expect you to book a reservation for a bike, but hardly anyone answers when you call. Expect 30mins waiting time when calling for any service!
West Midlands Railways is better in my opinion when traveling with your bike.

Pros: Fast trains arrive quickly and bikes are secured in place.

items.title: Awful experience
items.review_text:
Awful experience
Very rude employees, overcrowded trian despite covid restrictions.. No way for social distancing.
Very un clean and old train

items.title: Beyond useless.
items.review_text:
Beyond useless.

Website continually crashes when trying to book a ticket.  

Its not a one off - this issue been happening over a year now - they have had time to iron out starting up issues.

Really pathetic.

I always liked Virgin Trains, did a good job.  Appreciate them even more now.

items.title: Woeful website, expensive tickets & pathetic customer service
items.review_text:
Bring back Virgin Trains - they were a customer focused business that listened to their customers and offered a brilliant service.  They made mistakes but did their best to put things right.   

I recently had the misfortune to try and book Standard Premium tickets - a service not worth the money charged - but the website failed and despite there being plenty of availability I was presented with error messages galore.  I used the Trainline instead - effortless, took under five minutes, just like buying tickets with Virgin Trains in the past.

I complained about my experience and can confirm their Customer Relations department is dreadful, completely pathetic.  Their agent failed to understand my complaint twice so I escalated it to a manager.  A "Duty Manager" responded and clearly didn't understand either.  It has now go to the Ombudsman for review.  

The point of my complaint was to actually help them improve their website.  I was trying to be helpful - I gave them evidence of the issue and outlined why it was a bad experience for me a customer.  They were not interested.  Instead they happily told me multiple times how much they valued the feedback and how it would be shared with their Web Support Team and Technical Team - teams that operate behind frosted glass and that don't possess technology like phones or computers that allow them to communicate with either the customer or their Customer Relations department.  They are not allowed to interact with customers or Customer Relations - what a strange approach.  

However, I was repeatedly assured that all the failings I presented to them - of which there were many - would be passed to those teams so they could improve the website experience for customers.

Well I hope they do and I hope that customers benefit.  As for me I'll no longer use them for journeys between Scotland and England.  I will seek out Lumo Trains - a new business that seem passionate about providing a good service - or will use LNER (an excellent business) by using a different route to the one I enjoyed frequently with Virgin Trains.  Additionally, I'll consider flying as the cost of doing so is considerably cheaper than the tickets I have purchased from Avanti West Coast.

It is such a shame as I used to enjoy travelling on the West Coast Mainline when Virgin Trains, a professional, customer facing business, used to hold the franchise.

My advice is look for all alternatives before using Avanti West Coast.  You will save money and be happier.

items.title: Bring back virgin trains
items.review_text:
Bring back virgin trains. Wifi never works and i travel back and further to london peak and off peak. One time i was the only passenger in the carraige and the wifi still didnt work. 

The only reason i gave 1 star is because i couldnt give them known. SHOCKING!!!

MANAGEMENT, invest more in wifi. You charge enough for tickets. What use is there providing wifi to order at your seat food and beverage when the wifi never works. Surely it makes sense to invest and improve wifi. In turn your shops on the trains will make more money. Ripple effect.

P.s. on the train so cant even submit review till i get off the flippen train

items.title: Appalling service, Unsafe travel on overfilled trains, wont respond
items.review_text: Sent 4 emails complaining about a recent journey and booking, First 2 got replies back about the booking/website, Indicating website and app work try refreshing everything and should have no problems. Garbage, Next 2 emails were complaining about the return journey being packed; and what appeared to be more passengers than seats and travellers in my compartment without seat reservations. Brought It to their attention that surely that is not safe, and In particular you MUST have a seat reservation prior to travelling on their trains. Had 1 email back to say that sometimes this happens, no reply back yet from the other email, emphasising that surely this is not safe but possibly dangerous in the event of anything happening, been waiting for replies since July

items.title: Bring back Virgin
items.review_text:
Bring back Virgin! Avanti - You have destroyed what was a good west coast train service from North Wales to Euston. Prices are horrendous, (over £1000 for a family of 4 to return travel to London over a weekend) service is appalling, train cleanliness is shocking - If Avanti are the “future of rail travel” as your marketing claim, there is no hope for us at all.  

Just look at all the reviews since you took over in 2019, it really is bad.
I drove my family to London from Wales last weekend for a theatre show, £80 in fuel and the congestion charge vs your overpriced options and shocking service.

items.title: With less than six weeks to go before…
items.review_text:
With less than six weeks to go before my travel date, there are still no tickets on sale for the last 2 weekends in November on the whole of the west coast mainline.
Other train operating companies released their tickets for the same journey weeks ago.

items.title: I have looked at a first class return…
items.review_text:
I have looked at a first class return Penrith to Euston on Saturday 6th November. The price quoted is over £350!

Darlington to Kings Cross on the same day, first class, is £102.

Flying Newcastle - Heathrow and back comes in under £100.

Avanti have just lost a potential customer.

items.title: Appalling web site slow and grossly…
items.review_text: Appalling web site slow and grossly over complicated. Tip book on the clear and easy to view Network Rail site this will ultimately connect you to the Avanti site to complete.

items.title: Overpriced!!!! Poorly Run!!!!
items.review_text: Overpriced!!!!! Almost £100 for a return London to Warrington. To add insult to injury the train is overloaded. Bring back Virgin!!

items.title: Travelled from London Euston to Crewe…
items.review_text:
Travelled from London Euston to Crewe and this was my first experience with Avanti and the first class experience was shocking , no food or drinks served unlike virgin trains in the past.  

Overpriced tickets and first class is pointless in my view as shows no difference than standard ticket.
Bring back Virgin Trains

items.title: Train in need of servicing. Sort it out.
items.review_text:
London to Manchester train coach c 09/10/2021 12:40.
- seat reservations not working.
- no hot drinks available.
- no card payments, cash only.
- power socket at table not working.
- no wifi working.

This is what you get for a £95 return ticket.

items.title: If you travel 1st class from Euston to…
items.review_text:
If you travel 1st class from Euston to Glasgow the service stops at Preston then it’s pot luck to Glasgow.
Bring back virgin they new how to look after there passengers and server food you could eat

items.title: Now there are only two direct trains a…
items.review_text: Now there are only two direct trains a day to where I need to travel to. There is one at 9:10 am and then the only other one is  at 6 pm with- no Off peak fares for travel on those trains, so at a ticket price of £310. Virgin scheduled direct trains every hour so that was quite a few a day and they were with Off peak fare tickets - a lot less than £310! Can Avanti improve its service and ticket prices?

items.title: Impossible
items.review_text: They do not respond to an email and they do not answer the phone.  They let you go through a series of options and then say they have too many people in the queue and cut the call.  Really frustrating.

items.title: One of the worst transport companies…
items.review_text: One of the worst transport companies out there. Over an hour delay on their trains, then they terminated it early. Over the intercom they promised refunds if you went to their website. These were of course denied. I sent a customer complaint through and of course received an unhelpful automated response. Greedy, money grabbing and incompetent. Disgusting behaviour from a company.

items.title: Wow this company 100% DO NOT CARE ABOUT…
items.review_text: Wow this company 100% DO NOT CARE ABOUT THEIR CUSTOMERS.  Not one little bit.  We have no choice but to use their service if we happen to live on the line that they service. I have simply tried to switch an advance ticket to an evoucher, because my reason for travelling was cancelled, their links do not work on their website and they have not taken the time to check it or test it properly, otherwise that would not be the case.  I have been on hold with them (because I can't use the website), now for an hour and 10mins, thinking surely they will answer soon, but I think they will not.  There is not need to be this bad at customer service.  It has to be because they truly do not care!

items.title: Cheaper to fly to Spain than economy…
items.review_text:
Cheaper to fly to Spain than economy train to Manchester. 
After Virgin, the prices have sky-rocketed and the service is appalling. The trains are now dirty, food is terrible, schedule is shocking and the customer service is non-existent. How are they allowed to operate? Bring back Virgin

items.title: Terrible customer service and constant…
items.review_text:
Terrible customer service and constant travel problems 
I have to travel from Coventry to Gravesend on a regular basis and I’m trying to remember a single journey in the last year that was not problematic.
Most recently were two incidents perhaps the worst examples of terrible customer service yet. After purchasing my tickets on line I arrived at the station to collect the tickets from the machine but though it recognised the code and journey, would not print. The customer service rep also tried, and failed to print the tickets. Their answer was ether buy another ticket or try and talk my way through without a ticket , which in my case would have been 5 different trains and two tube rides. That would be 14 automated ticket barriers and at least two tickets inspectors. All that with one email from Avanti that had had in big red letters “This is not a ticket “
I am trying to contact Avanti by phone but 45 minutes into the call I’m still on hold!
I could go on by constant delays, cancellations the hopeless app and worse web site, the impossibility of booking chosen seats etc etc but I guess anyone trying to travel by Avanti West coast probably knows that.
Is this the worst Train company going. They have my vote

items.title: After years of Virgin prices up and schedule worse!
items.review_text:
After years of Virgin, prices have risen by 50-100%. Timetable looks like it did when there were previously track upgrades going on eg patchy at best. Getting returns to the same stations tricky so you need to work hard to understand the schedules.
First Class deals for advance tickets eg a pair of pensioners like us has gone from £180 - £370 for an advance ticket with a 30% off railcard.
Those are some of the downsides.
The upside is that your cheese and biscuits now come on a plate instead of in a box (cost of that £190 apparently!).

items.title: The website is soooo buggy
items.review_text: The website is soooo buggy. Click on "later trains" and it shows you earlier trains (and vice versa), and you can't book the last train out of Manchester. Tickets don't get replicated to the App properly. Come on guys - this is basic stuff.

items.title: RIP OFF!!!
items.review_text: This review is not about a train journey simply because I can no longer afford to take one with this rip off company! I'm trying to get my head around why the government awarded this company the west coast franchise, their service, according to the reviews,  are appalling,  appalling customer services and now, extortionate prices! On their website they boast unbeatable prices, ofcourse they are unbeatable there's no other company available to compete, they have a monopoly and are screwing the passenger for every penny they can extort out of them, DISGUSTING,  SHAME ON YOU! Come back Virgin all is forgiven

items.title: The toilets were disgusting and as our…
items.review_text: The toilets were disgusting and as our seats were next to these when we sat on a train from London to Carlisle we had a smell of sewage all the way . Obviously the sewage tanks are not emptied for days . The tables were dirty and overall a poor experience in these times of heightened cleanliness due to Covid .

items.title: TWO months on and STILL no refund!?! Avoid Avanti like the plague!!
items.review_text:
TWO months on, and STILL no refund!?!
I was due to travel from London Euston to Birmingham New Street at the beginning of August 2021. End of July, Avanti notify me that the time table had been changed, and my train cancelled as a result. 
The other trains were either fully booked, poor times, or too expensive, and I would need to pay the remaining balance, which was an awful lot more compared to the original advance tickets. 
Included within the notification email was an option to request a full refund if I chose not to travel that day, or purchase a new ticket. I chose the full refund option, and TWO MONTHS later, I'm STILL waiting. 
Despite dealing with FIVE different members of staff via their facebook inbox (all fob you off with the regular - this is not my problem/department, but someone will contact you within 48 hours blah blah). I'm still waiting for someone to contact me and that's been going on for almost a month. 
I've also tried THREE separate times via their customer resolutions department, and each occasion they've asked me to explain the full circumstances AGAIN, and AGAIN, and AGAIN...IS ANYONE BORED YET!?! Me too!!
AVOID AVANTI WEST COAST LIKE THE PLAGUE! Their customer service is utterly abysmal, and should you ever find yourself in need of a refund, prepare to be fobbed off at every corner. 
They provide fake names, empty assurances of a call / email back, they simply want to mug you off in every possible way. 
What a shame, as it used to be a favourite of mine, but rest assured I will never use them again. 
Thanks for rewarding a loyal customer like this Avanti. 
It's time to use your rival/s.

items.title: Awful
items.review_text: Paid for two tickets single and return to Edinburgh. Fine on way there, however way back all carriages absolutely packed and couldn’t get a seat which we had paid for. Had to stand for over two hours and a half with two suitcases. So many people sat with bags on the next chairs etc however wasn’t generous enough to let passengers sit down. First class empty however still had to stand the whole 2 hours 30 minute journey. Cleaner came past and was very rude towards people stood in the corridors, witnessed her pointing at us as she spoke to other passengers on the train. Won’t be using again.

items.title: Trains are over priced and always late…
items.review_text: Trains are over priced and always late or cancelled.

items.title: Over priced
items.review_text: Over priced! I used to travel London to Chester regularly to see family and friends. It’s now too expensive!

items.title: Overcrowded 1ST Class
items.review_text: We travelled from Lichfield to Euston and back. Lovely staff, lovely food but we were all squashed into one coach. Not too bad outward early morning but the evening return was pretty full and in these covid times I did not feel safe. It used to be spaced out - another coach would have made all the difference.

items.title: Avanti seemed to have opted out of the…
items.review_text: Avanti seemed to have opted out of the cheap ticket scheme.  Before the pandemic, I could always find cheap tickets for my regular journey.  Now, I NEVER can.  They advertise that they do them, ask you to sign up to their alerts etc, but then I hear nothing and the tickets are more expensive than ever.  It's absolutely disgusting that they're allowed to get away with ripping people off on the back of a pandemic.  Sadly it's much cheaper to drive.

items.title: Shocking service, high prices - why have they been given the contract to run the line?
items.review_text:
They don't deserve a star but looks like you need to leave at least one.

Booking tickets - shocking. Wanted to visit a friend in Stockport, and booked eight weeks in advance. They don't offer any return tickets for that weekend - turns out having looked at a few other weekends, it's a similar pattern. Avanti doesn't seem to offer return tickets, which I always thought was a pretty standard thing for a train company to offer. 

Prices - the price has increased significantly since Avanti took over the line from Virgin. That increase in price hasn't translated into better service.

Customer service - awful. Waited over an hour to speak to a customer service agent with no luck. Again, if the prices are increasing, surely that should translate into better service, not worse.

Avanti is so bad it leaves you wondering how they won the contract from the government? Clearly, the reason wasn't because of Avanti increasing prices and offering terrible service, so why are they still maintaining the line?

The positives - the only good thing about Avanti is that the service is so shocking it works as an argument for nationalising the railways, so on that front Avanti is doing a magnificent job.

items.title: What an abysmal service
items.review_text: What an abysmal service. Either wait 4 weeks to get a response via a contact form or spend 30 minutes on hold on a paid 0345 number to speak to a human.

items.title: Pay through the nose for tickers to…
items.review_text: Pay through the nose for tickers to Manchester. Been on the train 40 minutes and the shop is still not open. Was announced as not ready at 745. No further announcements.  I hate having to use this firm. Useless at everything

items.title: Just awful
items.review_text: Just awful. Been trying to buy a ticket for 3 days on the mobile app. Technical issue apparently. Please bring back Virgin!!!

items.title: prices have multiplied
items.review_text:
i wrote prviously that the new first class offering was good - turns out we were lucky having booked tickets in advance of the fare chages . now ther are no upgrades at weekends, no advance 1st class fares and standard premium is more expensive than 1st was under Virgin . 
carriages jam packed one end empty other . i used Virgin for years 4 times a month between london and glasgow - but now have to fly as its so much cheaper. they need to sort out their pricing quickly

items.title: Bring back Virgin Trains!
items.review_text:
I never realised just how good Virgin Trains were, that was until Avanti took over.

For years I've commuted between the North West and Euston with minimal problems or delays. Now every train I have taken since Avanti has taken over has been late, delayed, or cancelled. Not exaggerating.

items.title: Appalling service!
items.review_text:
This review is from an Angry Customer not a Happy Customer as the title says. For some reason it defaults to Happy Customer!!
I want to book seat reservations for a journey with 2 friends but the Avanti West system won't let me. I want to speak to Avanti about it but I've been trying to get through on the phone for 3 days. I've tried in the morning, afternoon and late evening and have been on hold for over an hour each time. I've had to give up in the end. I don't believe that they are soooooo busy at every minute of the day that someone from Avanti can't pick up a phone. I don't actually believe that they have any staff to answer the   phones. As other people have said bring back Virgin! They were sooo much better.

items.title: Disappointed
items.review_text: I’ve traveled with Virgin Trains for over 20 years with no problems. I am extremely disappointed with Avanti. The fares have increased over the last few months and the advanced cheap tickets no longer exist! I recently traveled on 2 extremely overcrowded trains between Wolverhampton and Euston. Avanti booked so many customers on the train.  Passengers were standing in the aisles. No regard for customer safety or social distancing considering Covid is still with us. I felt very uncomfortable. I booked a table seat and it was apparent the table had not been cleaned, fortunately I had wet wipes with me. Expensive fares for a poor service. I will have to find an alternative route to the Midlands in the future. My health is more important and I do not feel valued as a customer.

items.title: Untrained staff- Appalling service
items.review_text:
Untrained staff - appalling service 

Had booked the new Avanti class standard premium with a reserved seat.

 On board crew said ticket not valid for the reserved seat and made me stay in Standard class.

After I protested they moved me to the disabled area of standard class ( I am disabled).

Absolutely appalling.

I arrived in London stressed, full of aches due to my condition  and hungry.

items.title: terrible website
items.review_text: I don’t understand why this company doesn’t fix its website it literally does not work on iPhones. I’ve tried booking a train tonight and it’s been buffering for the last 10 minutes. It’s ridiculous.

items.title: Awful
items.review_text: Awful. Used to go to London quite regularly when Virgin ran the service as affordable. Now price is double and fares from Manchester always £85+. They truly need to lose this franchise.

items.title: First Class is very poor value
items.review_text: First Class is very poor value. Recently made 2 return journeys and found the old first class has been reduced to 1.5 carriages with 2 reserved for their new premium class. Premium has the same seats as 1st but no food. Upshot was that 1st was crammed and premium much more spacious. In view of Avanti’s eye watering off peak and anytime 1st class fares (off peak is much higher than Virgin) it’s a no brainer to travel premium for an extra £25. I can only assume this is Avanti’s way of abolishing 1st class on its trains.

items.title: Standard premium = 80% of the train…
items.review_text: Standard premium = 80% of the train empty, the rest jam packed. Avanti introduced standard premium which means 3rd class is now packed and most of the other carriages almost empty. Long live COVID

items.title: I book a family fixed return journey…
items.review_text: I book a family fixed return journey every Christmas from Manchester-London but this year Avanti is not offering these tickets and are only offering general return tickets at more than double the price!! This company have take over from Virgin Trains who we always enjoyed brilliant service. We will have to cancel out trip now and the kids will be gutted!

items.title: refund balck hole
items.review_text: I booked a ticket for travel on 30th September but trip was cancelled so returned to the app to either cancel or amend the booking. Couldn't be refunded on line so had to submit a refund form and wait 28 days for a reply - 28 days later nothing. tried to call first call dropped after 2 hours 2nd call dropped after 90 minutes. Managed to tweet and get a response but would not talk to me as my wife booked the tickets and she does not have a twitter account so they suggested I wait on the phone again. I raised a complaint on the website and was told I have to wait another 28 days minimum for any response. Very poor serivice

items.title: Thank you - you are amazing!
items.review_text:
We had a really bad day and ended up missing our train in the stress of everything and the staff were so kind.

The Avanti west coast staff helped us get sorted with another train and getting home (Edinburgh-Wolverhampton).

They were really nice to us and super kind people and I think really highly of all of the people we interacted with today and we are really thankful for them helping us get home for no extra!!

Thank you so much!

items.title: Constant train cancellations leading to…
items.review_text: Constant train cancellations leading to busy trains and general annoyance. Really need to get their act together. Very poor

items.title: I have used the West Coast service…
items.review_text: I have used the West Coast service consistently for business travel for some 15 years now and the service since Avanti has taken over the route has hit rock bottom. Rude staff (ticket refunded after complaint), awful website and app and currently appear to be refusing to sell off-peak tickets in line with the basic usage ts and cs. Rail services in the UK need far better regulation and these cowboys need their contract cancelling.

items.title: So after booking my tickets online and…
items.review_text: So after booking my tickets online and laying for them for a return trip to London from Glasgow central I arrived at the station. With my collection code to be told by an unhelpful member of Avanti staff that there was a “ problem “ with my booking which meant he couldn’t print my tickets , this was 25 mi utes before my train departure , he seemed unconcerned and extremely unhelpful and was happy to send me away with no ticket and unable to travel , when I pushed him for a solution he said I would have to buy new tickets from him over the counter and claim a refund for the tickets I bought online . This is what I did and it caused me undue stress and inconvenience.  Three months later I have received a refund for my online tickets minus an admin fee of £10, what a blooming cheek!!! No explanation or apology , through no fault of my own I was refused the issue of my online tickets for a reason that has never been explained to me , Avanti did not address my complaint at all and decided to keep £10 for themselves , I was expecting a full refund and perhaps some small compensation for the stress they caused me , but what I got feels like a slap in the face .

items.title: Avanti - worse than easyjet
items.review_text: I booked a ticket for travel tomorrow via the Avanti app. Rather stupidly I got the date wrong so returned to the app to either cancel or amend the booking. I was surprised to find that my ticket type (an open single!) couldn't be refunded straight away. Instead I have had to submit a form and I've had a response that they'll get back in 28 days. Even low cost airlines appreciate that sometimes we can enter the wrong date and have a system to make changes. I did try calling Avanti but after 45 minutes I gave up. Very poor service and a very unimpressive ap

items.title: £100 for a return with no plug sockets
items.review_text: I'm already paying nearly £100 for a return journey which is close to 4 hours each way and there are no plugs available on either journey. I've not been on a long train journey without plugs as standard for years. Apparently they offer "standard premium" for £15-30 extra per journey now to get a plug. When I've already paid loads for my tickets. Its the most rip off thing I've come across for a while.

items.title: Website is a disaster
items.review_text: Their website is a disaster. You cant just buy a ticket - you have to register. Each time I go back to book again the website wont recognise my username and/or password. Ive changed the password several times but it never gives me access. The parking website is equally bad and, unlike Virgin they wont sell you a ticket without registering. Ive managed to buy three tickets so far using three different user names but now I have run out of email addresses. The parking site is equally bad.  If you have to travel with these people (Lord help you) then allow several days to get a ticket off the web or go to the station and buy it there.

items.title: Atrocious customer service
items.review_text:
I had booked a train London -> Coventry leaving at 23:24.
Only one hour and fifteen minutes before departure, I received an email stating that the train was cancelled. So was the one before leaving around 10:20pm so basically no more trains for Coventry until the next day.

First of all, you cancelled a train with nowhere near enough time to spare. Moreover it being the last train and de facto leaving me stranded in London for the night, the least you could have done would have been to enquire about customers without accommodation and if you could help in any way???? What good is it to me getting my ticket refunded when I have to pay a hotel in London??
I am paying for a service i.e. getting from point A to point B if you cannot deliver that service you need to find solutions for people.

Second of all, you’d sent me an email saying that since my train was cancelled, I could jump on the next available AVANTI train (so next morning). 
I wanted to “change” my ticket using the app but it only directed me to the search function where basically I could pay for a ticket the next morning (which I shouldn’t have had to do since my train was cancelled). 

So I arrived at the train station with the email, I went to the platform where the train from Coventry was departing and explained to the controllers what had happened. 
They wanted to see the original ticket which had disappeared since it was supposedly passed (even though the train never actually departed because cancelled), I could only show them the itinerary and the cancellation email.
Even though I showed them the email where it was written in black on white that my train was cancelled and “your ticket is valid to travel on the next available Avanti West Coast stopping at Coventry” they didn’t even bother to look at what I was showing them and said to go to the ticket office (that was written NOWHERE in the email). I was literally begging them because the train was about to leave and I had all the proof possible (when YOU had cancelled the train making me spend the night in London and YOU had not provisioned for the case where the next train is the following day, and YOU had not made it possible to simply rebook without a fee the following train). They were actually quite rude saying that they didn’t know of any cancellation and it wasn’t their problem (great customer service).

I had to run to the ticket office where the person I spoke to said that I just had to show the Avanti controllers my cancellation email………………………. 
They ended up giving me a ticket to get the next train because obviously mine had left by then (mind you, I had to get to work in Coventry so not only did you cancel my train making me spend the night in London but you also made me late for work this morning). 
When I confronted the controller again saying what the ticket office had said he said that again it wasn’t his problem. I informed him that I was going to make a complaint but he didn’t care either.

I have never experienced such an atrocious customer service, and I travel a lot, this is shameful.

items.title: Absolutely awful customer service !
items.review_text: Absolutely awful customer service !! On the phone for over an hour trying to get through so give up , sent 3 emails still no response !! Will be using an ad alternative going forward !!

items.title: Absolutely appalling
items.review_text: We booked trains to and from London at least 3 months ago. Our outgoing train was due to leave our local station at 11.56. We arrived in plenty of time and sat waiting……and waiting….nothing. We checked the timetable we had been given and it definitely said 11.56. There was no mention of this train on the departure boards, and when checking with the ticket office, the train had already left at 11.36!!! The staff were friendly but could only say that Avanti had changed their TT a year ago!! We ended up waiting for an hour altogether for the next train. It completely ruined our plans as we had arranged to meet with relatives. My daughter messaged them on Friday to complain, but has received no reply. We will never ever travel with this company again. They are appalling. 😡

items.title: Do not use 1st Class
items.review_text:
Do not use 1st Class. This is a total waste of money! Staff refused to service our 1st Class carriage. 
Recommend East coast services or fly!

items.title: My grandmother has been trying to get…
items.review_text:
My grandmother has been trying to get in touch with Avanti since Monday 13 September via phone to get a refund on a ticket. She has Covid therefore cannot attend the event she bought the ticket for.
She has spent literally hours waiting on the phone, and no one has bothered to respond.
I have tried to get her refund online, but seem to be going around in loops, their website is not user-friendly at all.
Additionally, when she went into their Euston Ticket Office, she received the worst customer service, the staff were very unfriendly and unhelpful and disinterested. 
Such a contrast to when Virgin was running this franchise. She (and I) is totally frustrated and disgusted and is worried that she may not get her refund as she has to now physically go to their ticket office, having had no luck on their website or via telephone.  Do not book your travel with this company!!!

items.title: Very poor service at Stafford
