items.review_text: Very poor service at Stafford only 1 train an hour to London and Liverpool only 1 train a day to Blackpool no service to Scotland and Wales although the trains do pass through Stafford they could easily call them at Stafford without affecting timetable much

items.title: Poor website with confusing purchase…
items.review_text: Poor website with confusing purchase options which led to me ending up with the wrong ticket.  That's when the fun started.  You can spend hours going round in circles online fruitlessly searching for a solution and nowhere will you find a number to call. I eventually found their number via Google and then spent over an hour waiting for someone to pick up.  They never did. I was able to get a reply after sending a message but this was far too late.  One of the worst customer services experiences I have ever had.  I would never try and use them again. You have been warned.  All these reviews don't lie.

items.title: awful journey for such an expensive ticket
items.review_text: awful journey, absolutely no air conditioning, treated like livestock. poor conditions for an expensive train ticket, would rather get a coach than sit a few hours on this train. Please avoid!!!!!

items.title: BRING BACK VIRGIN
items.review_text: I’ve yet to book my ticket but so far I’m disappointed. I want to book in advance and I can’t, the website won’t let me. Also, why so expensive! BRING BACK VIRGIN!

items.title: Booked ticket
items.review_text: Booked ticket, train cancelled, been waiting for delay repay for over 2 months.  Was told that the train did go ahead.  Suggest that people just go the rail ombudsman as this company cannot get a simple time or date correct even when given the information.

items.title: Awful Avanti
items.review_text:
Difficult to navigate fare finder using my phone which came up no tickets which I didn’t think was accurate. I did a search via the timetable & found a single ticket at a good price so bought this & started again for another, the reason I didn’t carry on with booking was due to being in my phone & some of the script wasn’t showing. I get to booking page with second ticket & just as I paid it took me back to farefinder! I then logged into my account to see if the ticket had booked & nothing there so I did it again & soon after found 3 tickets in my inbox. Unable to get refund as advance tickets, completed refund form & reply will be in 4-6 weeks but as my journey is 18/09/21 I call customer service who tell me:

They can raise a form & I will be contacted in 7 or 20 days -not 7-20 but 7 or 20 as they are very busy.

They advise I can have a refund (note I can’t) so I ask if they are sure & find they are not & yes refund is changed to ‘wait & see’ 

So now I’m out extra money & they no longer go direct to Glasgow so get to wait in Preston for an hour!

items.title: Poor customer service, tired trains
items.review_text:
This is the second time I’ve had to use the Avanti West Coast mainline service and each time it has been poor.

Firstly, their system to change reservations made online is non existent. You are led to a form (that seems to relate more to refunds) and are expected to wait for someone to contact you - but they never do. Considering you are supposed to be able to change reservations up to 24 hours before with an appropriate ticket this is shocking.

When you get on the train the reservation system also doesn’t seem to work. The first time I used their service, people were double booked on seats and this time no reservations were downloaded onto the train. 

On the table I was on none of the power sockets were working. In addition, the buffet car announced that once again the card machine wasn’t working and they could only accept cash.

What is going on with this company? Virgin had its faults, but it was never this bad.

items.title: Avoid Avanti if you can
items.review_text:
I need refund of a return ticket, as I am unable to use the ticket on the dates I booked. I tried to contact phone number on the ticket. but was told it would take 30 minutes to answer. After 45 minutes I had no answer.
I then tried to get a refund on the website following the procedure outlined there. But the link it says to click, does not exist.

So I then filled out a form to contact Avanti about this. After I sent it, I received a message saying it could take them 4 weeks to reply.

I will write to the Minister of Transport suggesting their franchise is not renenewed

items.title: Shockingly bad
items.review_text:
On the phone for 2hrs now trying to get through to rearrange a train journey. No way of rearranging it online/via email. I did use their online form twice over 2 weeks ago and never heard back. This is my third call, twice cut off as no
Operators available. I may end up losing my money as the date of travel if fast approaching. Shocking shocking system and experience. Never had a problem with Virgin after travelling with them
for decades. Plus the overall ticket price and upgrade options have got more expensive, more limited and have less service available. Utterly abysmal. Should have the ombudsmen after them

items.title: Avanti have been consistently…
items.review_text: Avanti have been consistently atrocious. A faulty system for booking bikes. Terrible customer service, both in the station and online. And now, when I have to change my ticket, I've been on the phone to them for 90 minutes and still have not got through.

items.title: Excellent first class service
items.review_text:
First day of the new first class offering and it was extreemly good . Staff excellent and improved menu choices made the 16.40 glasgow to euston a very pleasurable experience .
Plant based options have improved which is a good thing also

items.title: Appalling service
items.review_text:
Appalling service. Not received my tickets by post and cannot contact via phone as too busy so simply cut off. No live-link so completed on-line form but travel in 2 days time.

Avoid booking with Avanti West Coast

items.title: Poor service
items.review_text:
Celebration weekend in London. Trains cancelled, then put on a later very overcrowded train, had to stand from Birmingham to Euston on first class tickets (after staff told us there would be seats), no refreshments available and no WIFI. Complained, eventually got £15 back after a lot of hassle and without an apology.
In general tickets are now much more expensive than Virgin and it is hard to buy cheaper advance tickets on their website. Poor.

items.title: Avanti continues to get worse Trust pilot please can you offer a zero…
items.review_text: Trust pilot please can you offer a zero stars option - boarded Sunday and the guard announced no catering staff until half way into journey and seemed proud to announce they no longer do weekend upgrades so economy is packed and First  empty - I can only imagine they paid the treasury more to take this franchise away from virgin who provided an excellent service

items.title: Worst customer service I have ever seen
items.review_text: Nothing wrong with the train but the conductor on the 12.40 from Euston to Edinburgh is the single rudest human being I have ever had the misfortune to meet. Not only did he stand back and watch a mum travelling alone struggle with a 3 year old, bags, suitcases and a dog, he also saw fit to publicly humiliate her into moving one of her bags that she had no choice but to leave near the door because of an overcrowded train. I then watched him punch the back of a woman's chair who was travelling alone and clearly quite startled to wake her up to check her ticket, despite the fact she had been on the train for 3 hours already and had her ticket checked at Euston. You'd think paying £150 for a train ticket would at least get you some basic customer service but apparently not on Avanti.

items.title: Awful customer service been forced to…
items.review_text:
Awful customer service been forced to sit on the floor as the 10:50 service from MKC - Stockport rammed with Football hooligans if this is how you treat disabled customers absolutely disgraceful tweeted customer service no help what so ever was advised “coach C will have plenty of seats” and to “buy a ticket at the station” as their website stated the train was booked went to coach c all taken up but hardly anyone in first class but still charge people to have something that is a god given right will be writing a official complaint to get a refund

Update 14/10/21 

Yesterday I received a prompt reply with a gesture of goodwill where Avanti offered 2 return first class tickets which I think justifies the compensation amount for the above issue

Update 28/10/21

Cannot even use the vouchers supplied “train fully booked” seems the usual excuse for these clowns

items.title: The refund for tickets not working on…
items.review_text: The refund for tickets not working on the website through my booking. There is simply no way you can apply for refund on their website despite purchasing tickets online via their website. Helpline completely useless with no reply even after 30 minutes. Such a terrible service, will never use their website again.

items.title: 12 Weeks to reply…
items.review_text:
In June train from Blackburn to Euston was cancelled. Sent an e-mail to claim refund, was advised their aim to get back was 28 days. So 12 weeks later after chasing several times got a reply saying ticket not purchased through them. So why does it say Avanti West Coast ??
Have looked through other post and Avanti dont reply on Trustpilot - what a surprise

items.title: Absolutely terrible
items.review_text:
Anyone who thinks this company is better than Virgin is just lying their nether regions off. Had to wait until 3 weeks before my trip to book a ticket because "they were not sure sure which trains would run" then the price was triple what Virgin would have charges. Today has some upsetting news, trying to get a refund or even just switch my booking which it clearly states on the website I can via "my booking portal" 
, using the web doesnt work, I cant use their website to send an email because it keeps saying I haven't used the cookie preferences, which I have because it accepted my complaint ! I've tried calling them, 30 mins wait is actually an hour and 20 minutes at the moment. If this horrid excuse for a train line didn't have a monopoly on the Service to Euston I would never use them again. Bring back Virgin. Never had 1 issue with them !

items.title: Kept waiting
items.review_text: I have so far been on the Avanti Westcoast query phone number for one hour twenty one minutes and counting and have had no response so far. I tried to get an immediate response to a booking that had an error on it. I completed a form and response answer was that they would contact within 28 days which is not appropriate for urgent queries. When the phone was answered electronically I was advised it would take a half hour before I would receive a response. I am certainly not impressed with their customer service at all. I only got their contact phone number which is supposed to enable you to talk to someone by ringing National rail enquiries who answered promptly. I would only use Avanti West Coast if no other means was possible to get to my destination. It is now an hour and a half and still no answer. After a further ten minutes I gave up.

items.title: Awful company.
items.review_text: Please please can someone bring Virgin back !!!!  From appalling booking website to extortionate pricing I have totally given up.  Was so looking forward to my usual half dozen return trips to London once the lockdowns were over  prices are ridiculous.

items.title: Very long wait but great result at the end
items.review_text: Wanted to change a ticket.  Was warned that there would be a delay of over 30 minutes.  It was 110 minutes. However, once connected, the customer service was remarkably swift and effective.  I had a refund voucher within 1 minute and rebooked with it straight away.

items.title: It appears that I can't book a space…
items.review_text: It appears that I can't book a space for bikes on a particular service to Scotland without first buying a train ticket.  So what happens if there are no cycle spaces on the service that I have booked?   The National Rail website states that we can telephone your sales team but there are NO phone numbers on your website.  How did this company ever get to provide a railway services when you can't contact them?

items.title: Really rude employee at euston station
items.review_text: Really rude employee at euston station. Told some fellow customers to f*** off in front of me and then gestured rudely at them. Not on

items.title: DO NOT TRAVEL WITH AVANTI first class…
items.review_text: DO NOT TRAVEL WITH AVANTI first class it’s not worth the money. I have been travelling to London from Wigan for more than 10 years with Virgin although not since Avanti took over and of course COVID. Never having gone first class I thought I would treat myself what a shock I was in for total waste of money. Firstly someone was in my seat but the passenger couldn’t move because her backpack was very large no room in luggage rack which was very small. I was advised to sit in the single seat which was empty actually the one I would’ve traveled home in. The seat was so cramped I could barely move even though I’m a small slim person. The food was disgusting and only 2 choices, tea cold so only had water. Carriage extremely hot so much so I felt sick and lightheaded so had to move to the corridor outside toilets. Apparently Avanti use the same trains as Virgin  but on this occasion was definitely not. My return journey didn’t happen with Avanti as I couldn’t face it.Bring back Virgin. The only good part staff very helpful along with another passenger.

items.title: Avanti is dreadful
items.review_text: We travel regularly on the train from Runcorn to London, but not any more.  We travelled First with Virgin for years and the service was superb.  Then Avanti took over and it is abysmal.  No lounge at Runcorn any more (and I have heard from employees that is permanent despite Avanti telling me it is due to staff shortages).  Food onboard for first class mid week was a yoghurt pot of sickly sweet yoghurt.  Prices have pretty much doubled since Virgin ran it.  Back to driving for us, Avanti is a disgrace.

items.title: NOT FIRST CLASS: Avanti West Coast are SO POOR
items.review_text: Avanti have hollowed out First Class and offer terrible service: first time since lockdown travelling with them. Breakfast second rate. “dinner” was three small pieces of cheese with second rate wine no spirits. Please do not shell out on this “service”. NOT FIRST CLASS.

items.title: Shocking experience on the train
items.review_text:
Shocking experience on the train where COVID protocols not used by staff putting travellers at risk and spreading infection. 
No route to make complaint as online form does not auto reply or acknowledge.
No way to contact them on telephone line as it cuts off.
Disgraceful treatment of customers.

items.title: Very busy Sunday train carriages…
items.review_text: Very busy Sunday train carriages reduced from 11 to 9 but no staff could give a reason why. People not reminded they are advised to wear face coverings in crowded  places and we were packed in like sardines. Horrible experience I spent the whole 3 hour journey in the corridor.

items.title: Rubbish service
items.review_text: Rubbish service, buggy frustrating app and a delay of 50 minutes at 6:30am in the morning???

items.title: Get a Megabus instead
items.review_text: Absolutely shocking service. Prices are completely taking advantage of the public and tickets are released too late to make plans. The trains are dirty, if they turn up on time it's a miracle. Bring back Virgin Trains.

items.title: Our train to Edinburgh was cancelled…
items.review_text:
Our train to Edinburgh was cancelled last week so we arrived over an hour late via a later train. I put a claim in for compensation for my husband and myself and uploaded both tickets via their online form. 

I have just received an email approving the compensation that we are due but just for the one ticket! What about the other one? I have now had to spend another half hour resubmitting the form and E tickets again. Nightmare

items.title: Absolutely Dreadful
items.review_text:
Who exactly has been f**king who to allow Avanti to take over and run this service?

Hands down one of the worst train services in Europe.

Massively overpriced. Like MASSIVELY overpriced. The fares have essentially doubled in price since they have taken over from Virgin.

Permanently rammed carriages, removed the weekend first upgrade, in seat service NEVER works, website is useless, app is even worse and when I needed a refund on one service they didn't refund my card, they posted me a voucher that you cannot use online!

I've always enjoyed train travel, I've never had a car but, this train company is making me wish I had one.  When researching a trip London to Manchester, it was actually cheaper to fly. I thought we were trying to get people off the roads and planes and onto public transport?  I contacted them about wen the cheaper advance tickets would go on sale for a particular journey for a timetable that hadn't been published and I checked every day for them to appear - they never did - they don't appear to exist anymore

I'm not a regular reviewer but it’s so bad, I've had to.

Who the hell do I have to lobby at government? They need to be replaced.

It’ truly truly truly awful.

items.title: Appalling treatment
items.review_text:
Booked 2 x advance First Class Return tickets from Wolverhampton to Edinburgh with reserved seats around two weeks before travelling.
(£336 = no small sum)  
The return train was 'declassified' without warning.  
Upon boarding, we found our RESERVED seats had been occupied by passengers joining from a cancelled train, who smugly told us that the reservations had been withdrawn.  
We were left bewildered in the walkway and commenced looking for adjacent seats.
In my view, these joining passengers should have been told NOT to sit in reserved seats but this was clearly not the case.  
Declassifying the train was bad enough but not to honour reserved seats was inexcusable, in my view.  
My wife and I ended up finding two seats together but facing backwards; not our preference. 
The Train Manager eventually warned on the Public Address system that it would become very busy and any passenger not 'feeling comfortable' could get off and board another train.  
Oh what a lovely gesture but no thank you!
There was no consideration for social distancing (despite this was in effect when the seats were allocated with a 1-seat separation at the time of booking) or any attempt to enforce the mandatory requirement to wear masks on the Scottish leg of journey.  
Refreshments were not offered until shortly before our journey was complete.
4 weeks of emails to their Customer Relations Team eventualy produced a poor response; not addressing many of the issues I raised in my initial complaint and requested copies of the tickets.  These were duly supplied but time ran on with no further communication.
Eventually I wrote to the CEO's Office and I have now been told I will be compensated by a cheque in the post, for just the difference between the First and Standard Class ticket price.  
No additional goodwill gesture for the upset caused to my wife and I and no real appreciation of how poor the treatment of customers on the train really was.
I will NEVER travel with this outfit again unless my life depends on it.
The awful Trustpilot review rating clearly shows that I am not alone in my feelings towards Avanti West Coast.  Come back Virgin Trains.  We miss you.

items.title: Bike spaces - very helpful staff on early morning…
items.review_text: Very helpful staff on early morning train from Edinburgh to Carlisle 26/8/2021, bike spaces good and staff on hand to help.  Much appreciated.

items.title: Dreadful experience trying to get…
items.review_text: Dreadful experience trying to get weekend tickets to London. Timetable delayed and couldn’t book early to try to get cheaper tickets.  Had to book a Friday departure instead but so much more expensive than virgin. And they booked a party of four on seats apart from each other. We used to go four / five times a year Liverpool to Euston but no longer -   Bring back virgin!

items.title: Awful customer service
items.review_text: Terrible customer service. The customer service agents don't know the company's own rules in regard to refunds, ticket amends etc. I had to fight for hours just to get them to apply the rules stated on their own website. Hard to get in touch with them. Confusing, useless website. Manc to London more expensive than it used to be even booking far in advance.

items.title: Absolute awful service
items.review_text: Absolute awful service.  Train manager rude and unhelpful.  4 toilets out of order . The cost of these tickets have virtually doubled. Bring back virgin please.  Will fly from now on rather than give these charlatans a penny

items.title: Cancelled trains, no communication
items.review_text:
Booked ticket several weeks in advance using their timetable to help me decide which train to choose. It involves a connection and I needed to plan my on going bus journey from the second trains arrival point and time. Arrived at my home station, the first train was not listed according to the time avanti gave me on the email confirmation (the same time that I had booked the train for). I queried this at the station only to be told avanti changed the times of the trains since I booked it. They offered to put me on the next train, but I would miss my connection and end up further north than I intended. So I had to cancel my accomodation and rearrange a new place to stay (it was non refundable). This was back in May 2021. I didn't post this review then because covid is affecting everyone and maybe avanti too. Although it would have been simple for them to just contact me to tell me the train I had booked was no longer running.

I'm afraid to say this happened again two weeks ago. The only difference this time is that the later train they put me on went to the destination I had planned, just a few hours later. But this meant the last bus had already left, so I had to pay for an expensive cab fare. I would not have planned and booked my journey had I known that was the outcome. Also, the second time, I was not the only one in that position. There was a  family/group of 4 who were also at the CS kiosk at the station who were in the same position.  

All Avanti had to do was email their clients to update them on the rearranged train times. National rail had still listed the old train times a day before, on both occassions when I had checked. 
I have checked my inbox, junk mail and text messages, no contact from Avanti with regards to not running the train journeys I had booked.

items.title: Bring back Virgin Trains please
items.review_text:
My train was cancelled yesterday, the 1825 from Euston to Manchester. Staff at the station not very helpful to help me find alternatives. Had to pay much more money to figure out a way to get home. An absolute joke of a company. How did they win this contract? From what I hear and also have witnessed, there are now much more cancellations than Virgin, service much worse, prices much higher.
BRING BACK VIRGIN Trains PLEASE!!!

items.title: Train Manager Candice saved my life
items.review_text: Train Manager Candice saved my life. The 15.10 London to Crewe 11th of August 2021. Thank you, Candice for going above and beyond the call of duty at a time when I needed it most. You will never know how much your efficiency saved my life.    Thank you a million times over.

items.title: Terrible
items.review_text: Terrible. Booked first class and the train was ‘declassified’ that day. So the normally quiet, fist class carriages were crowded. How is anyone supposed to feel safe and use public transport more? Now over a month ago and they still haven’t resolved my complaint.

items.title: Top Marks for Coventry Avanti Customer Services
items.review_text: I just want to show some appreciation for your customer service people in Coventry. I traveled through there on Sunday evening and as a disabled person I have mixed experiences with rail travel. But Coventry get absolutely top marks: they simply could not have been more kind and helpful. I would give them 6 stars if I could!! If only it was always this good

items.title: I received an email from you asking me…
items.review_text: I received an email from you asking me to reset my password.  The link had expired by the time I saw the email. I could not use password reset because it was not working for me.  To resolve this issue will take over 48 hours which is unacceptable when you are operating a digital first business model.

items.title: Travel with someone else
items.review_text: I booked a train in advance and it got canceled. This was frustrating and cost me an important event,  However, what made it worse was no useful alternative was offered, the staff were far from useful and I have not had my money back. They paid me £25 compensation for a £110 ticket I never used. The process was purposefully difficult and no one talks to you.  These are a bad outfit.  Book with others.

items.title: After suffering a huge delay on train…
items.review_text: After suffering a huge delay on train to Edinburgh was made to wait hours in baking heat for a coach. After paying for a taxi to actually make it there only 4 hours late compensation claim from Avanti has taken ages. It was rejected. Then argued then ignored. Two months later I am still waiting. Why doesnt the Ombudsman do something. Is Avanti better than Virgin? We know the answer dont we?

items.title: BRING BACK VIRGIN TRAINS
items.review_text: Trains are more expensive than virgin. Service is diabolical in comparison to virgin. trains are now often late. First class is no longer worth your money. no longer able to collect frequent use points. No longer able to select exactly what seat you like. seat preferences are never honoured despite there being loads of available seat when you get on the train. BRING BACK BRANSON (who is the devil but at least he knows how to run a train company)

items.title: Wigan to Euston first class return…
items.review_text: Wigan to Euston first class return friday-monday.carriage clean,staff pleasant.just didnt see them.one cup of tea,famous cheese spread and crackers and a glass of wine late on.got the tickets cheap 50 quid so i cant complain.wouldnt be happy paying full whack.euston first class lounge was quiet for once,staff nice again.

items.title: Dog hair everywhere - unhygienic
items.review_text:
Dog hair everywhere - not a great travel experience for an allergic person & not hygienic, given there is a pandemic.
Avanti needs to manage the carriages so that you have a dog free & a dog friendly carriage. These need to be separated so that allergic people don’t have dangerous reactions.

items.title: Disappointing
items.review_text:
Poor service, missing Virgin.Paid £25 to upgrade to Standard premium on journey London to Liverpool.Clean comfortable had a table seat but the At Seat Order service which was the USP was non existent. On line message was that the shop was closed but you could use the at seat order service by connecting to on board wi fi which I did. I stayed connected to the on board WiFi using it for other sites but not for at seat order which wouldn’t connect
Other passengers had the same issue and one went to the shop returning with soft drinks and advising that the shop IS open, he was told there was no on board wi fi so payment  had to be cash. BUT the tickets had been checked on board and payment for upgrades taken by card reader so there must have been wi fi.Feels like the service from Virgin was better. At seat service doesn’t sound important but it’s a great idea if you are travelling alone and disappointing when it doesn’t exist, better not to have suggested it. Virgin did come through the train with trolley service. Avanti dont.

items.title: Car for me now.
items.review_text: They have literally doubled the prices I need over Virgins prices a couple of years ago. The service is worse, the first class food is worse, what a scandal. Profiteering scumbags. Country is a disgrace. Want people to get out of their cars ... Joke!

items.title: Food choice disgusting on Avanti…
items.review_text: I recently went on a trip to London from Liverpool. On my outward journey I was offered either chicken wrap or cheese and biscuits. I went for the cheese and biscuits. When I opened the packet it wasn’t even cheese. It was cheese spread... It tasted disgusting! On my return journey I was offered a chicken wrap as the waitress said that’s all they had! I was so shocked. When you pay for a 1st class ticket you expect a choice of decent meals. It really spoilt my journey both ways. If Avanti want to keep customers they need to stop penny pinching and offer people paying top prices some decent food!

items.title: Bring back Virgin!!!!
items.review_text:
Bring back Virgin!!!!
Someone in the government must have received a huge backhander to have given the contract to this rip off company.
Huge price increase and the London/Manchester service is .... well .... not a service.
Half now have additional stops via a longer route whilst the other half are not direct.
Have just made the first leg of my journey back to London on a Welsh cattle train to Crew, only for the connecting Avanti train to  arrive packed and with all seat reservations cancelled. Whilst the extended journey out had no refreshments. 
You are having a laugh at our expense Avanti.

items.title: Terrible food. Uncomfortable. Bad wi fi
items.review_text: Having paid for a first class service I have to say I was very disappointed.  Morning menu reheated bacon roll or porridge. Evening menu cheese and biscuits or chicken wrap. Really bad. Cold carriage. Uncomfortable seats. Wi-Fi was terrible.  Lounge options for food and drink same whatever time if day so if you don't like Blueberry muffin or a bag of crisps forget it. @ over 300 pounds for a return ticket its definitely not worth the money.

items.title: Not much different from Virgin!
items.review_text:
I was absolutely dreading this trip after reading the terrible reviews but I can't say I noticed much difference in the trip from Manchester to London Euston from when it was Virgin.
The only niggle I had was that the first class lounge was shut at Manchester and we had to wait around having got there early purposely to go in there.
First class lounge at Euston is table service and capacity is more limited than before but still practically the same offerings as Virgin.
Both trains left bang on time, the staff were friendly and polite, food and drink service not much different from Virgin. The train was clean. I really cannot find any fault with them.

items.title: Avanti are so much more expensive than Virgin
items.review_text:
Avanti are so much more expensive, (double the price) than Virgin when trying to book a ticket three months in advance. 

Bring back Virgin. I won't be using Avanti until you can become more reasonable and looking through the reviews it looks like the trains are less reliable, dirty and the seat availability system doesn't work. It's a disgrace.

items.title: Not realy worth 1 star but can't give…
items.review_text:
Not realy worth 1 star but can't give 0.
Problem after problem since December 2019 when Avanti took over from Virgin.
We finally get restrictions lifted on 19th July ,so naturally people want to travel so we will cut our timetable down for 3 or 4 weeks and 1 train an hour from Birmingham to London on a Saturday.Emailing customers of there cancellations the night before so they don't have time to re-book a seat on another train, but make it sound like they doing you a favour by letting you travel on the train before or after or totally ruin your weekend and have a refund.Who wants a refund at 6pm the night before? Do you think I'm just going for a train ride or would it be for a reason .And surprise surprise the train before and after mine where full so couldn't book me a seat so had to fight for the unreserved seating. Every journey pre-covid and now is cancelled, delayed ,overcrowded and not once arrived on time even though the journey time is 15 to 20 minutes longer on Avanti than it was on Virgin (same trains, same line) and still get in late .Last journey coming up Saturday which will no doubt be the same ,ailes full ,doorways full and even though I have seat reservations won't use the buffet car as its like such an effort to fight your way through. Its a shame that I will now be using from Saturday a different rail route as I can no longer look forward to my trips to London knowing that something will go wrong and wondering how much time I will loose of my day out waiting at Watford junction .Bring back Virgin all because of a minimal share of ownership we get stuck with Avanti .

items.title: I returned from my holiday today 13.41…
items.review_text:
I returned from my holiday today 13.41 from Coventry to carlisle .
The fist class just as bad .
Staff lovely once again menu the same supposedly mouth watering tiki chicken wrap or cheese and biscuits exactly the same as menu coming down 
Absolutely terrible menu. 
Not worth spending on first class .
Very poor .
Sharon

items.title: On the 11:43 to Birmingham New Street…
items.review_text:
On the 11:43 to Birmingham New Street from London Euston. I sat in unreserved seating and settled in ready for my journey. Soon after departure I was rudely told to get out of my seat because it was reserved by husband and wife. Suddenly confronted by very condesending and rude behaviour from a woman who after my showing her that no reservation was on the electronic seat numbers insisted and then presented her tickets and shoved them in my face to see. I think the woman expecting a performance of guilt, apology or subservience but of course I had done nothing wrong!! There was no indication that these seats were reserved!! In fact I had gone out of my way to check the seats were NOT reserved as per signs! Yet I was the one made to shuffle off as though I was causing an issue. The louder she raised her voice the more people tutted as though I had caused the problem.

To give you further context, given I have colleagues that work around Diversity & Inclusion, I was experiencing micro aggressions and stereotyping which was embarrassing. The woman was patronising. Of course I wouldn't have been viewed as the vulnerable one as the lone traveller even though I was experiencing the micro aggression and stereotyping due to Unconscious Bias! I asked her to calm down. This an embarrassing episode that could have been prevented and saved exeryone distress and embarrassment!! 

Sort it out Avanti! 

If people have their seats reserved please make sure it's indicated on the electronic panels. Save lone passengers experiencing the rude micro aggressions of irate customers projecting their anxiety on to you. The journey had barely started and my journey for which I paid good money was spoilt!

Sort it out.

items.title: Avanti West Coast are truly the worst…
items.review_text: Avanti West Coast are truly the worst rail company. I’ve been travelling on the Wilmslow to London Euston route for years and never had any problems with Virgin that was such a fantastic service. Booked a £64.30 ticket get a cab to the station and they cancel the train with 15 minutes notice. You know your timetable earlier than that why do you let people book & pay for tickets when you plan on cancelling them with zero notice. It’s not a one off occurrence either it happens time and time again. Complete disregard for customers. Everyone I know has an Avanti story! Such a shame

items.title: The website doesn’t even work!!!!
items.review_text: The website doesn’t even work!!!!

items.title: Seat confusion, no organisation
items.review_text: Seats are absolutely ridiculously handed out, often you have to fight for a seat on a train. Very poor.

items.title: You are crammed on like sardines
items.review_text:
You are crammed on like sardines. No recharge facility for your mobile. No tables. The carriage stank of food and was dirty.
Horrible experience.

items.title: First class for £8
items.review_text: Traveled first class from Motherwell to Coventry, cost difference between first and standard was around £8. The on train staff were great, seats were comfortable on both the pendelino and voyager trains, food and drink was plentiful and very tasty, WiFi worked well.

items.title: Truly awful website
items.review_text: Truly awful website. Does not allow for tickets to actually be purchased. How this company continues is beyond me. Oh yes, we subsidise it. They need a change of approach, personnel and management.  Shocking.

items.title: Worst train journey ever & rubbish customer service
items.review_text:
Booked Wigan to Euston early July & emailed same day about our family of 5 being split up due to the socially distance rule, they couldn’t/wouldn’t help by changing the booking & sitting us together, then the rules changed & again I emailed but again same result, I emailed another few times & then asked the guard on arrival who told us the carriage would still be socially distanced & we would find seats together no problem!
Then when we got on the train all our seats had been taken the carriage was full & our family had to then move through a number of full carriages to find seats.
I’ve tried the Customer services dept again but just get back very unhelpful messages like “I should have contacted them at the time of booking” hang on I did on the day of booking & numerous times between then & travel. Absolute shambles from start to finish & I could go on & on & will think twice before using Avanti again.

items.title: Travelled First Class from Glasgow to…
items.review_text:
Travelled First Class from Glasgow to Euston on the 12th of August.

The service from Avanti was extremely poor and the quality of the food and drink offer was pathetic. No proper range of drinks, no ice, no proper range of food - BUT BOY THEY KNOW HOW TO CHARGE. Next time I will fly and I suspect more and more customers will either drive or fly.

Avanti will run themselves into the ground and they will probably only last another 12 months or so, unless they change their service and approach massively - Feels like another crisis for the West Coast line approaching.

What a way to run a railroad!

items.title: Overbooked and terrible service
items.review_text: I recently travelled from London Euston to Manchester Piccadilly on an Avanti west coast train and the experience was bad from start to finish. The train was unnaturally busy and it soon turned out that several seats had been double booked forcing passengers to sit in other seats. This undoubtedly caused chaos when the other passengers boarded and demanded their seats. On top of this there was another train doing the same journey scheduled for an hour later. This train was cancelled last minute and the ticket holders were told to board hours meaning the train was overcapacity with several people having to stand. There was next to no staff presence on the train. Obviously the overbooking of the train was no fault of theirs however it seemed they could have done more, if something to calm the situation. Terribly poor service and will not travel with them again if I can help it.

items.title: Dreadful Avanti misrepresenting their 1st class
items.review_text: Avanti are misrepresenting their 1st class service.  They have not notified travellers the 1st class service is not available. I paid £200  to be served with a luke warm cup of tea, quarter of orange juice and a watery pot of porridge.  It's absolutely outrageous this company is allowed to get away with this service.  I told it's a "limited service because we don't know how many people are travelling" so that provides Avanti the right to not provide a 1st class service. Please do not use unless you call and know for certain. Please see my pictures attached.

items.title: First class customer service
items.review_text: My husband and I had recently booked a train journey with Avanti West Coast. Unfortunately, my husband was suddenly admitted to hospital. The ticket we had purchased was a non refundable one but when I explained the situation to Avanti they said just get a medical note and we will refund you. This they did within 4 days. Excellent service

items.title: Dont take the train, take your car instead...
items.review_text: I haven't traveled on Avanti West Coast because the ticket prices wont allow me to. I was planning on travelling to the Lake District from London using the Avanti West Coast service. An off-peak return was £112! That's right £112. For four of us that would have been £448....seriously what incentive is there for people to use the trains? The equivalent trip in the car is going to cost me £80 in fuel. Why on earth would people ever consider using this service...what has gone so wrong with the franchising system that it's cheaper to fly my family to Spain than it is to take them to the Lake District on Avanti West Coast. Don't take the trains, take your car instead!!!!

items.title: I am appalled by the lack of service…
items.review_text: I am appalled by the lack of service that Avanti provide to their customers.  Their website is shambolic (showing trains that are no longer on their timetable), there is no way to actually speak to someone in Customer Service and they cancel trains at short notice.  I travel between London and Manchester all the time and I rue the day that Virgin lost the franchise.

items.title: Rip off
items.review_text: When virgin train lost the contract, many people were happy. Now they will feel the difference with avanti. First of all the trains themselves dont look good with the avanti colour, rebranding. Virgin trains were much more attractive. The staff are like non existent on the trains, no smile, no happiness, no soul. Ticket prices are a rip off even when booked in advance. What can i say well done so far!

items.title: 400% price inflation - UNFAIR
items.review_text: I am a regular Watford Junction to Liverpool Lime Street traveller and have been for over 20 years. I can no longer afford the journey to visit my Mother - Avanti you are a disgrace - sort the prices out!

items.title: I would just like to thank the two…
items.review_text:
I would just like to thank the two wonderful Ladies who served us breakfast and tea/coffee. They were lovely. We got on at Preston train station at 9:53 and travelled to Edinburgh for our Honeymoon. 
Please pass on our thanks to the Lovely two Ladies.
Great tea/coffee and lovely bacon barm 

Dawn & Richard Grice

items.title: They should rename this company Avanit-grad
items.review_text:
Come on Avanti, and experience the staff who have all the charm and charisma of a guard from a Soviet era Gulag.

They won't let you sit down in the seats next to the food carriage because of Covid but are quite happy to have people packed in like sardines in the corridor.

I am guessing a lot of the people working at this company use to work for the council, just guessing.

items.title: A case study in how not to run a train co.
items.review_text: Wow, a train company who doesn’t have accurate timetables. Thomas the Tank would do a better job. And when I mean accurate, I’m talking booked trains not even existing. So you can book a train online to show up and it not exist. Staff are uninterested or as confused as customers. And no better onboard. Website experience to order food is as effective as sending out smoke signals.

items.title: Disabled assistance impossible to access
items.review_text:
Update, now trying to reserve a seat for my return journey through their disabled assistance line. Been on hold for 55 minutes and still waiting. Never waited more than 10 minutes to speak to Virgin Assist. Have to come back in a few weeks and will definitely be flying.
Phone disconnected me after 1 hour 2 minutes, still no seat reservation.

items.title: Sneaky and 50% slower
items.review_text: Absolute rubbish, increased prices and then made trains on Sunday 50% slower from 2.15hr to >3.15hr (the train that the average person uses). Sneaky dirty tricks for their main customers.

items.title: Is Avanti Italian for awful?
items.review_text: Awful, awful, awful. Worst ever return trip to London by train I can remember. Filthy trains both ways, especially food waste on seats and floors. Having copious signs telling travellers to socially distance when we’re crammed into tight spaces with strangers is a sick joke. As were the two non-responses from Avanti customer services to my seat reservation request.

items.title: Total lack of confidence in Avanti West Coast
items.review_text:
Avanti West Coast are putting it politely, unreliable.
Their service levels are appalling, you cannot make travel plans with any confidence because they don't have the skills or resources to manage their business. The West Coast franchise should be taken from them.The only viable option for travel from the NW to the Mids and SE is by car.

items.title: Liverpool Lime Str to Euston cancelled…
items.review_text: Liverpool Lime Str to Euston cancelled again!! Pathetic, unreliable service. Avoid if you can

items.title: Despite my many complaints ( with no…
items.review_text:
Despite my many complaints ( with no response ) :
1. I am still unable to add railcards
2. Couldn't book a seat in carriage H ( first class ) - 'computer says' not with my ticket type - despite the new standard premium not starting until Sept ! Now in crowded coach K with no social distancing.
3. Last week my train simply didn't turn up and there were no announcements whatsoever or notices on screens.
4. They say I am covered by automatic refund but 'computer says ' in small print only if you register first. You have to register a different account for this even if you have an Avanti account and they have ALL your details - another ploy to prevent or make it so difficult to get a refund ?
5. No attempt to assist with social distancing - was put in a seat in a crowded area despite other seats being available - of course I moved after an elderly woman directly opposite with no mask started coughing... and coughing.
6. Despite putting a family railcard in ( only works on the app - myself and two children ) no family fixed price family ticket offered. This is three times now ! What a money spinner this must be!

Whole process from trying to book, the journey itself and arriving ( on time if you are lucky) is appalling. This company make the entire process of travelling in first class frustrating and distressing. I dread to think what customers in standard are having to put up with.

items.title: Who makes the decisions on train…
items.review_text: Who makes the decisions on train operators?  I bought an off peak return ticket to London from Prestatyn yesterday for my wife.  No stress - cards in hand - no worry of queues or phone running out of charge.  On train she was told that the return was valid for a month but the outward should have been yesterday.  When Virgin ran the franchise I believe there would have been a sense of fairness and flexibility.  I base this on experience.  Come on Avanti you can do better than this.

items.title: Toilet one word for this company paid a…
items.review_text:
Toilet one word for this company paid a fortune for 1st class. What a joke don’t waste your money booking with this outfit 

Bring back virgin

items.title: 100% increase on average fares by Avanti over Virgin
items.review_text: They have took all the advanced ticket options away. Virgin should never have lost this franchise. I have travelled to london weekly for 5 years from chester and now i cant afford to. Government talks about equalising the north & south but allows this to happen.

items.title: Can’t book advanced tickets for 3…
items.review_text: Can’t book advanced tickets for 3 passengers in October for Birmingham to Euston. Prices shown were ridiculous. I will now drive into London. Haven’t done that for 20 years. Virgin were so much better.

items.title: Treating Disabled Passenger…
items.review_text: Treating Disabled Passenger Appallingly. This company double charged me for a ticket deliberately and are delaying refunding me. Its been almost a month and they are aware that I am a disabled passenger. Completely ignored me after advising me to buy another ticket and the previous one would be refunded. Disgusting

items.title: Why oh why did Virgin lose this…
items.review_text: Why oh why did Virgin lose this franchise. Avanti is a disgrace, no advanced ticket rates and the so called “price guarantee” is just a total lie. I mistakenly purchased a 1st class ticket on their website (which is awful) and having confirmed checked the price in Trainline 70quid cheaper. No way to cancel my ticket (even though website says you can). Have been e-mailing Avanti for weeks now to get my overpayment back, got one auto response after 24hrs and nothing since despite dozens of follow ups. For my own amusement I have randomly looked at more than 20 so called price guaranteed tickets and every single one is more expensive than the Trainline (same avanti train). I might be forced to use their trains sometimes but won’t ever book with them and won’t be using first class anymore as the service is not worth it. Did I say bring back Virgin.

items.title: Terrible company
items.review_text: Terrible company, stay away. Absolutely impossible to get any customer support. The closest I got was sending a message on twitter to which I got a response and finally an update on my ticket after 6 weeks just asking me another question which I responded too and again no reply since. The phone number is useless and after waiting an hour was never able to get through to anyone.

items.title: Very Disappointing !!
items.review_text:
I have taken two rail journeys with Avanti on the 2/8/21 and 3/8/21, both First Class(orange) head rest covers.
The “order at seat “wasn’t functioning and I managed to persuade a steward to get me a tea!!!
The service levels are appalling and the refreshments non existent ? Why when the ticket price is astronomical.
Very disappointing.
M Aldridge

items.title: No Refund Received
items.review_text: Two bookings I made on 1 June failed to go through properly, but Avanti West Coast still charged my card. I immediately received two emails from them saying "we have refunded you via your chosen payment method" and now (two months later) I'm still waiting for a refund. Have tried calling but it's impossible to get through. CS staff on twitter can't help. Opened a complaint case on the website, which they then closed saying "you should have received your refund" with no further explanation or opportunity to reply. £90 down. Horrendous customer service.

items.title: Not received refund
items.review_text: In June had to alter my travel plans for July so applied on website for refund on my tickets..got quick response asking for photo of cut up tickets..did this & despite several emails to them I have heard nothing more & never received my refund.

items.title: Twitter topic rail ombudsman 1413412323
items.review_text:
railombudsman website and go to making a complaint

they blocked me on Facebook for complaining about basics things, please reply here to rail @railombudsman on twitter, please reply to 117654018 lets get this company sorted

Also boss of Avanti is on LinkedIn phil-whittingham so think should message him the problems with service

Also asking BBC watchdog to investigate

items.title: What has happened to first class
items.review_text: What has happened to first class? Travelled from Euston to Stockport recently, freezing cold air conditioning, covid seems to be the excuse for choice of one sandwich, or cheese and biscuits pre packed and disgusting plastic cartons of revolting cheese spread, no spirits, no ice, miserable waitress service, everything in cardboard or plastic....bring back British rail!!... £350 ticket price if bought on the day, no wonder train was virtually empty!!

items.title: Covid danger due to seating allocations.
items.review_text: Disastrous.Under Covid Avanti reserved first class seats for families booking together but  allocated seats far apart.Then when rules relaxed after July 19th ( even though Journey began in Scotland) they filled up surrounding seats with other household bubbles . Consequently on à full train you are forced into close prolonged contact with 2,3, 4, or more households wearing no masks as they are being served food.Your own household meanwhile is seated halfway down the carriage in close contact with more households .A recipe for à disastrous contagion and not what you are reserving à seat for.LNER did not make this dangerous mistake and seated booked together households together . Be wary as this situation could happen again.

items.title: Poor customer service.  Refused to pay Delay Repay through 'loophole' even though their train was delayed
items.review_text:
I should have checked Trustpilot before booking... look at that rating! :(

My train was over 15 minutes late which distrupted my plans, but because my journey didn't end with Avanti, they wouldn't pay Delay Repay and claimed I should have still had enough time to get to my end destination on time via other train services.  They ignored the fact that I had actually chosen to travel with Avanti because of the time it arrived into London.  Just because there was theoretically enough time for me to race to my end destination via other train connections without the rest break in London I had planned, this doesn't mean it's OK that Avanti turned up late.  To imply 'Yeah, we were late but other train companies' services made up for it so it's fine' is against the principle of Delay Repay.  I tried twice to claim and even raised it as a complaint with a detailed explanation, but was still shut down. No sense of responsibility or empathy.  I won't be travelling with them again if I can help it.

items.title: Thank you to Jay and Dhaval in Euston
items.review_text:
After a mishap with the ticket machine both Jay and Dhaval were great with communication and safely sorting out the situation.
Got me on my way to Birmingham and happy to have them resolve the issue.

items.title: Can’t change ticket/still waiting for refund
items.review_text:
No way of changing my current ticket to London either online or via phone. 
Still waiting for a refund for a previously bought ticket. 
How can a company be so awful at customer service?!

items.title: Non-existence customer service!
items.review_text: I am still waiting for refund (or travel vouchers) for journeys I could not take (due to COVID) in October 2020!  After several emails, phone calls and even a registered letter to head office I finally contacted the Ombudsman!  Avanti finally acknowledged that I was owed refunds!  However this was for just one of my journeys (as it happens the cheapest) SO I AM STILL WAITING FOR MY VOUCHERS!  Absolute rubbish customer service!   I NEVER had any complaints with Virgin,

items.title: Beware the 3pm peak change
items.review_text: Beware the 3pm peak change. Travelling from Euston (already paying almost double what virgin used to charge) I was informed at the gate that boarding the 3.10 put me in "peak time" (despite train being almost empty) and charged a ridiculous £174 to get home. How do they justify this? Peak time used to be after 4pm

items.title: There is no point leaving a review or…
items.review_text: There is no point leaving a review or contacting their customer service, they never reply or if you speak to them never offer a solution. The fact that they do not respond to any 1* review tells you all you need to know about Avanti.

items.title: I booked a family ticket for a journey…
items.review_text: I booked a family ticket for a journey when social distancing was still in place which meant despite it being for 2 children and 2 adults the seats were spread across the carriage. I asked if it would be a problem when social distanced ended to put the seats together and was told it would not be a problem. Turns out it was a massive problem and there was no solution to my 3 year old sitting with a stranger other than me re booking at a vastly higher price. Been doing the same journey for 20 years with virgin and no problems, first attempt with avanti and its been a disaster and I've had to just cancel the trip to avoid the possible stress of needing to argue with people over seats in from of my children.

items.title: Disgusting Price Increases
items.review_text:
Crazy, insane price increase. 450%. Avanti claim tickets go on sale but i've checked repeatedly and NOT ONCE have they been on sale. 

Who gave them the franchise? And why? Is it another government benefit for friends? 

Outrageous ticket increase. Dreadful company. I'm disgusted with them.

items.title: Why the hell did they give the franchise to Avanti?!
items.review_text:
1 star because I can't give anything less. Since Avanti have taken over from Virgin you cannot get advance tickets. I regularly travel up north to see family in Wigan and Manchester. They say there are advance tickets to purchase, but I have yet to see any evidence of any. Every time I try to buy tickets (last time 2 months in advance), they just suggest an open return, which is £10 more than Virgin used to be - £94.50. I have bought an open return for this Friday to travel to Wigan. It says that you can change an open return free of charge, but you have to call them at the call centre. You can't get hold of anyone. I have called three times. I just was on hold for one hour, then got cut off. It is very, very poor customer service. I got in touch with someone on Facebook and someone replied - said they couldn't help me change my ticket, but gave me an email address. I just emailed and the response I got was - they aim to contact me in 28 days! Perfectly useless, when my journey is booked for Friday. Heaven knows how I am going to change my ticket......

Update: 28/07/2021
So after waiting 1.5 hours I finally got through to an operator, who was very rude and condescending. I changed my ticket, but have not received a confirmation email or the new e-tickets. I looked in the app, and my amended journey is in there, but when I click on it, it goes to my old tickets and old reservation dates and times. I hope that I don't have to call them back to get a confirmation email and e-tickets. The operator had to ask for my email address, when he should have it since I gave him my booking reference. Such inefficiency is ridiculous. When I have amended journeys in the past with Virgin, they have sent me a confirmation email and new tickets before I have even hung up.

items.title: Tried to book 2 seats together in first class…
items.review_text:
Tried to book 2 seats in first class together with my wife ( via Trainline) came back with 2 seats in separate carriages! Phoned AWC - took 50 minutes to get through. Eventually got 2 seats in same carriage if not beside each other. Got on train to discover only 2 other people in entire carriage (K) Counted only 24 people in 4 first class carriages out of about 145 seats yet we couldn’t get 2 seats together!!! Eventually just sat together!
Journey was from Glasgow to Preston going down (17/3) returning (22/3) in First Class. Journey itself was pretty much on time. Seats ( eventually) were great! Very comfortable and clean. Toilets spotless. Food and drinks both ways were plentiful ( honestly thought I was going to be on a third world train reading some of the comments beforehand) Staff were excellent both ways but especially on the return train (11.41) - couldn’t have been better. Think AWC will be happy when‘Covid booking’ is over as they haven’t updated their website to cope with that! If you are with your partner you can sit together-it doesn’t tell you that! Bit of work for AWC to do overall to match Virgin IMO

items.title: NON- existent customer service - AWFUL
items.review_text:
Trying to get a refund from Avanti is like getting blood from a stone. First-class was declassified, the train was delayed and then we had to board another train mid-journey due to faults.

The website is completely useless, the phone lines are never answered and customer service is NON- existent. 

The only next step is to go to the Ombudsman and complain about this complete lack of customer care.

Avanti I am absolutely sick of spending my time and resources trying to get through to you and would appreciate a response before I take this further.

items.title: Thank you Julie.
items.review_text:
My first train journey in over 18 months was into London and then out again from Euston. Many thanks to Julie, in Euston, of Avanti West Coast (whom I was travelling with) who recognised that I was struggling with breathing and very anxious. Julie reassured me, escorted me to the ladies, looked after my luggage while I sorted myself out and then walked me not just to my platform but to my seat. Julie made sure I was OK before she left me. Julie -  I cannot thank you enough for turning an anxious time into a relaxing journey.
Also good to see Avanti embracing the rainbow by allowing Mx in their drop down boxes. I will travel with you again.

items.title: Ticket price?
items.review_text:
The site no longer shows the best prices and tickets appear to cost a third more. 
In April 2021 I paid just over £40 with railcard for a 1st class advance return Stafford to Euston, now Standard class costs over £47. You now have to hunt around for better prices with different prices shown on the app and website. It appears now advance tickets are not available, lowest 1st clas ticket I can find is now over £70 so £30 increase in 3 months. After years traveling on Virgin, Avanti have shown their true colours. Total rip off.

items.title: Terrible
items.review_text: Terrible website, ridiculous prices. Cannot book cheaper in advance like we could with Virgin Trains. If you you can find an alternative, I'd suggest you do that.

items.title: Random act of kindest from amazing staff
items.review_text: Arrived at Piccadilly station must of been about 30 degrees and running late with many bags and a puppy i  missed my train and the doors shut i was obviously stressed from this and upset two lovely ladys gemma and i forgot her name asked if i was okay and brought me 2 bottles of water for the puppy to cool down and myself just going that extra mile and extra service was really appricated thankyou so much ladies for your act of kindest avanti should be proud to have staff like yourselfs

items.title: Pricing structure is a joke
items.review_text: Pricing structure is a joke. No advance purchase tickets Manchester to London for less than £95 return. Virgin always had plenty of advance purchase availability on this route often for £45 return or less. I have raised a complaint today about the ludicrously high fares. I refuse to travel with them until the advance purchase fares are reduced.

items.title: The most dimwitted website ever
items.review_text:
The most dimwitted website ever. Insists you reserve a seat, refuses to allow you to reserve a seat, then cancels purchase because no seat reserved.
Total F wits.

items.title: Avanti service is awful
items.review_text: I had a Birmingham - Glasgow train booked, I arrived at the station and no one informed us train was cancelled.  Made alternative arrangement at counter to go via Crewe and on the train I noticed trains were still cancelled.  Yet no one informed us of the cancellations.  In the end we got a coach to Glasgow arriving at 12.30am with 2 young children.  The service is awful compared to Virgin, no one tells anything about cancellations and onus is made on passengers to keep checking National Rail website for cancellations.

items.title: As a regular first class traveller on…
items.review_text:
As a regular first class traveller on MAN -EUS I have to say the difference between Virgin and Avanti is night and day. Virgin bring day. On Monday this week, not food loaded at EUS  for thec13.20. Offered a bacon roll or muesli left over from breakfast. No biscuit or crisps. Warm rancid coffee and, since there is no spirits any more, rough red wine. No nibbles any more either. Or cake. Or newspaper.

It is the little things that make a difference. They no longer exist. Everything done on the cheap.

Just awful compared to Virgin. 

Don't even consider using their booking service. Incomprehensible. Use LNER as I do.

Less staff on trains too and No chat. 

Really poor experience.

items.title: Having had the misfortune to need to be…
items.review_text:
Having had the misfortune to need to be in London throughout the week for the past 8 or so weeks, I have needed to commute via the Avanti service. Mainly the staff are ok, they get on with things and do their job. Sometimes however they are rude, unhelpful, pedantic and scruffy. Costs remain the same as under virgin but the standard of trains seems to be deteriorating. Broken air con, dirty, broken seating, Low stocked shops, terrible toilets and failed power supplies are all too familiar on the majority of services. 
It’s all just so poor…… and they’ve had the best part of £1600 out of me for the privilege of using their service.

items.title: Train was late so I missed my…
items.review_text: Train was late so I missed my connecting train because there was another train over 2 hours later I was told to wait in the dark with no food or drink I'm disabled and needed my medication I had to pay for a taxi I would of given it no stars if I could of

items.title: No one reply on the refund
items.review_text: I have requested a refund since beginning of June and expecting a reply within 28 days, I still didn't get anything until now, impossible to reach to the customer service.

items.title: What a nightmare!!!
items.review_text: What a nightmare!!!! This is absolutely the worst booking experience of my life. Customer service is a joke, bugs on the website are insane. I still waiting for a refund and there’s no way to speak with someone. So frustrating!!!! I’d travel by bus rather than use Avanti again.

items.title: Tried to contact their Customer Contact…
items.review_text: Tried to contact their Customer Contact centre to change my ticket; the experience was truly awful. The message at the beginning said the call waiting time was 30 mins, after being on the line for over 1 hour no one had picked up, there was no indication of what number I was in the queue. The recorded message kept directing back to the website which only offers a refund of the whole ticket refunded in 28 days.

items.title: Truly dreadful
items.review_text: Truly dreadful. Travelled from Liverpool to London on “freedom day” (19 July 2021) and chose to go first class. What a huge mistake. A warmish bacon roll was available and yea or coffee. No cold drinks, no alcohol, fruit, biscuits or chocolate. Zilch. The tea and coffee service was available for one serving only. Paid £260 return for off-peak ticket and complete waste of money.

items.title: No working aircon
items.review_text: Traveled today “first class” from Birmingham to Preston. Hot day - aircon not working. Train virtually empty but allocated a seat in a carriage with no aircon. What ever made these people think they could run carriages with no opening windows?

items.title: Absolutely diabolical service
items.review_text:
Absolutely diabolical service! Virgin offered ‘advanced fares’ around 8 weeks prior to date of travel from London Euston to Lime Street Liverpool at £36 per person with a rail card. Avanti’s price £62! That’s booking two together with rail cards! 

BRING BACK VIRGIN, these lot are robbing us blind!

items.title: awful company…
items.review_text: If I could only give this awful company no star, I would. Their website is inefficient and actually getting to the payment stage is very tricky as they dont seem to make seats available until I dont know when. Buying a ticket was nearly impossible and took me many tries and wasted time. Also impossible to contact their customer service. The trains are fine but these are same stock from when virgin ran this line which they did very, very well.

items.title: Virgin we miss you! Avanti is miles away from the benchmark
items.review_text:
Customer service and phone support is non existent. Waited for 45 minutes x 4 = 180 minutes to resolve a simple issue.

Tech issues are not resolved for days. Refund emails won’t arrive. 

Absolutely poor service with no empathy.

items.title: Couldn’t care less about customers
items.review_text:
First experience of Avanti. Absolutely rubbish. I was travelling with my 10 month old and had pre booked a first class ticket from Manchester to Euston a few weeks prior. 
The day of travel coincided with the Euro finals. Avanti’s website says don’t travel without a reservation. When we got to the station we were told we couldn’t board the train we had paid for a first class ticket, with seat reservation as it was full - and,  quote “ You have no rights as you’ve only got an off peak ticket”.
It transpires Avanti couldn’t care less if you’ve got a reservation - and just allowed as many chancing football fans, who hadn’t reserved seats or tickets, to board the train, taking the seats of ore booked customers. They couldn’t care less about the many, many customers who had booked the train and were now told they’d have to use another service - and that wait could be a very long time! 
Return journey I’d upgraded to first class but was only in standard premium. Train manager was rude and advised those around me to move to first class but did not advise me my ticket was also valid. WiFi was rubbish. 
Appears lots of their trains are regularly cancelled, prices have also definitely gone up, but service is appalling. I’m thankful I don’t need to travel by train much now - Virgin are sadly missed

items.title: I’m sorry, how do you speak to people!!
items.review_text:
There are a lot of bad reviews for Avanti but they appear harsh. The train ran fine and was clean but I have an issue with the customer service. 

Arriving early (due to finishing work early) to be told you have an off peak ticket and it’s £80 for an upgrade is crazy. It doesn’t help the lady could not have been more RUDE. No explanation just a go away or pay up. 

The other option is to wait until after 09:00, so that’s what I did. However the 09:15 train it turns out is also not an option but I only found this out when returning to the platform. This time Marie was equally rude and basically told me to F off (not her exact words but had the same impact) for another 30 minutes. 

It turns out that anything north of Lancashire your off peak is 09:30 but in the south it’s only 09:00. Nice to see the rich and poor aren’t separated! What is also shocking is that the early trains were half empty and mine was packed due to the football, solid planning for a transport company during a pandemic. 

Why not just give people like me the option to upgrade on the platform for £10, fill up and empty train and sort your customer services out as speaking to people like that after a 14 hour night shift is shocking.

items.title: Bring back virgin trains
items.review_text: Bring back virgin trains. Words, p**s up, brewery come to mind. They’ve absolutely destroyed the west coast lines, trains always being cancelled, late, unclean and they’re communication procedures leave a lot to be desired.

items.title: Where do we start...
items.review_text: Where do we start? The website is very buggy and at one point tried to charge me over £700 for two seats from Manchester to London. When they finally stopped displaying at a price I'd expect for a transatlantic flight, several days later, I booked. You then discover you have to go to the station to print them off. No app like Virgin, no option to print at home. Are they in the 1990's or even 1890s? Then the day before we are due to travel we get an email saying our train might be canceled. I check National Rain enquiries. The train is canceled. They state on the email we can transfer to the train before or after, these trains are fully booked as they have cancelled every other train on their service for the rest of the day. If all of their passengers are told to cram onto other trains (that are by their own admission full) then their social distancing promises are clearly out the window. Tried to call them to get some clarity, I waited an hour on hold with no indication of progress before giving up. I have booked via Crewe with different operators now for less than half the price. I would advise everyone else to do the same until this sub standard 'company' has its franchise removed. Depending on who they are mates with in the Govt, of course.

items.title: Profits over customer care should be this company’s strapline.
items.review_text:
Sadly this company is not unusual in putting profits before customer care. My elderly mother is booked on a train home tomorrow, but we received a notification today to say that he train has been cancelled.  Told to check the website for alternatives, but no indication of how to book on to a new seat. Only an option to buy a new ticket - but first class as no second class available. 
My Mum has severely restricted mobility so can’t change trains. So I searched for customer services number on the Avanti website. There isn’t one. Finally Googled it and called through. Minimum wait is 30 mins. After 45 mins, with no indication of where I am in the queue, I give up and try the mobility helpline. Same thing - so I give up after nearly 15 mins. 
Don’t know what to do now, so will have to turn up at the station in the hope that they can get her on to an earlier train. That an hour away on public transport for someone who can barely walk. 
Very sad how looking after customers’ needs simply isn’t important any more.

items.title: Shocking service on first class
items.review_text:
Shocking service on first class. Millions of miles away from Virgin. 

Onboard food. Cheap. Instant coffee. No hot food options. It's basic at best. Food is better in the standard on-board shop.

Also website, my god. I had to enter my debit card details 8 times before payment worked. Kept getting errors. Had to pay via PayPal in the end.

items.title: Awful service, buggy website, useless support team, no refund on PayPal.
items.review_text:
The most frustrating experience from a train company by now. All I needed - to book a advance return ticket from London to Oxenholme with a bicycle reservation. How hard can it be?

I tried to book the ticket 3 times using their web site. All 3 times I received an email "All done" and the next second an email "Failure. We couldn't connect to the delivery service". Not sure which delivery service they meant as I was choosing "collect from train station". 

In my attempts I used 3 different payment options - Amex, MasterCard and PayPal. Amex refunds came through. MasterCard payment wasn't accepted at all (they probably knew something). PayPal refund hasn't arrived after more than a month. Support team was useless. They couldn't explain the reason of the failures and kept repeating that the refund was issued. I submitted a complain on their web site and never received any response from that team. Obviously, they are very busy.

Finally I managed to book a ticket via their buggy mobile app, but without a bicycle reservation. Mobile app was just unable to add a bicycle reservation without any explanation. So, I ended up calling Avanti and after an hour of waiting, asked them to add a bicycle reservation manually. I was explained that there are no free bicycle reservations for that train. If only mobile app could tell that earlier... I agreed to re-book a ticket to the next train an hour later. After that I received a "booking code", which I'm now supposed to TELL someone on the train because in the mobile application I still see my old booking without the reservation. 
I feel, I'll need to buy a travel insurance for that journey...

Special note for Avanti team, in case you ever read this message: my support request IDs are - AWC-WEB-0489651, AWC-WEB-0493127, AWC-WEB-0499630, AWC-WEB-1005767, AWC-CR-1005790.

items.title: They booked the wrong train. Terrible Customer Service + No refund
items.review_text: Over 30-days I booked a ticket via their customer service as their website was having issues. After a very long wait, and a very long call - the tickets came through and had been booked for the wrong dates (despite a very clear phone call). Its been over 30-days now and despite their Customer Service email promise, I have not heard back or received a refund.

items.title: Avoid Avanti
items.review_text:
I travelled with Avanti on the 14.07 London to Manchester service on 4 July.

I felt fairly comfortable about travelling on one of their trains after receiving an email from them a day prior to travelling, stating that they are respecting social distancing on all trains and to sit on the seat that one has been allocated.

When I boarded the train I found it to be extremely busy. The train manager asked passengers to wear masks and to not occupy aisle seats. This was clearly impossible because Avanti had sold so many tickets for this service.

I found that someone was occupying my seat and as the train was so busy I walked the entire length of the standard class carriages before finding a seat I was comfortable with.

While trying to find a seat I was surprised to see the three rows of seats next to the train manager’s cabin each had a sign saying ‘For your safety, this seat is not in use’. Well done Avanti for protecting your staff, it is a shame you can’t afford the same courtesy to your paying customers.

If you are still concerned about travelling during this pandemic, I would say DEFINITELY avoid Avanti and disregard any emails the company may send you about the part they’re playing in making travelling by train safer. The fact is they’re doing very little.

Pitiful.

items.title: Appalling journey from
items.review_text:
Appalling journey from 
Preston to Euston on 2nd July. Train was 54 minutes late into Euston. The first class service (if it can be called that) was abysmal. Not even a tea or coffee offered! I was given a semi thawed stale scone though and we were advised that was all we would be getting. Apparently, the catering crew had to get off so they could get a train home as the service was late. When I pointed out to the guard that the standard was unacceptably low he appeared surprised that customers expected a basic standard when they have paid significant amounts of money for First Class. Surely a company this size has contingency plans In place for trains running late so customers aren’t abandoned. Bring back Virgin!

items.title: Dangerous unsafe practice for passengers and staff
items.review_text: I travelled on Train ID: 1S72 on Friday 2nd July. On the approach to Preston station the announcer informed the company had cancelled a train mid journey (not for the first time this week I later learned) and the passengers would be joining our train.
