He also advised that social distancing would clearly not be possible, as it was likely to be standing room only, and if any passengers were not happy with this they should exit the train (with no alternative offered). I complained to the guard (first I had seen throughout the journey) who advised this had happened on an earlier day of the same week. On arrival at my destination another guard confirmed these practices. I highly recommend that anyone should find another method of travel due to these completely routine unsafe practices which may even be a case in law due to their breech in passenger safety. I have underlying health conditions and would not have purchased a ticket if I had known this company regularly makes a mockery of their purported social distancing. It was so over crowded that I'd have felt much safer on a plane which I had avoided as Avanti had boasted social distancing. Fortunately, I had extra masks and was able to layer up masks. Hopefully, my health will not be adversely compromised but will not feel safe until the Covid incubation period passes (I obtained a Negative PCR for the journey). Never again!!!!

items.title: Trains are constantly cancelled with no…
items.review_text: Trains are constantly cancelled with no notification to even let you know in advance.

items.title: Avanti not enforcing mask wearing for your safety
items.review_text:
2 July 2021. Having a horrible trip, Liverpool to London. A disregard for mask wearing, guard not enforcing it nor following the Avanti guidelines, with a number of passengers complaining and concerned.

If you are at risk or not yet comfortable with travel,  Avanti did not ensure passengers wear masks for your safety. Given the likelihood that mask wearing may be required for a good while yet, be careful about travelling on Avanti.

items.title: Grim...
items.review_text:
Grim...
1st class is a joke.
Grim food and poor service.Travelled Glasgow  to London and the staff just sat on backsides  and chatted!Had to request refreshments!
Nearly 90 mins late.
Return journey even worse.
Do not bother with this  train company. 
Bring back Virgin!

items.title: Abysmal service at Glasgow Lounge
items.review_text: I was at Glasgow Central today to catch the 11:33 to London. I had an important conference call to make at 10:30, so at 10:00 asked if I could go into the lounge early to prepare. The lady in there just met me with attitude and sneered that I couldn't as entry was only allowed an hour before travel. I tried again at 10:25 but this time didn't get as far as the lounge door before getting turned away as the lounge was busy. I can appreciate the lounge being full, but whats unacceptable is the sneering attitude I was met with by the staff who simply had no customer empathy. In the end I held the call in the station in the noise which was not good.

items.title: What an absolute Joke the prices are to…
items.review_text:
What an absolute Joke the prices are to travel with Avanti! The prices seem to keep rising and the service is terrible. I travel around regularly and Avanti always seem to have a problem and delays due to their trains. 

Avanti how can you charge close to £100 for a return ticket in off peak to the midlands? Do you know how many seats you have on your train it is just pure greed!

items.title: Absolutely outrageous behaviour from…
items.review_text: Absolutely outrageous behaviour from Avanti. I tried 3 times unsuccessfully to book a ticket on their app. It came up with an error message every time. But when I checked my bank account they took a total of £300 from my credit and debit cards. No indication on the app that they had done this, they made out that the card payment had been declined. This is the last straw. On top of everything else - the delays, terrible customer service waiting for hours to speak to someone, everything - Avanti need to be heavily fined and put out of business. I'm referring this to the Ombudsman. Bring back Virgin.

items.title: First Class? Really?
items.review_text: Currently on the 11:47 train from Liverpool Lime Street to Euston and the First Class train manager is a pig-ignorant idiot. I sat in my designated seat and coach K and he aggressively asked me if I had booked a seat. He suggested I moved to Coach H, which I did. He has been around once with drinks, I asked for a wine AND a cola...it was like I was asking for the world. The food options are poor and standard class is a better option. The service I got on Sunday from London to Liverpool was by far superior to this pile of rubbish!!!

items.title: Excellent Customer Service
items.review_text: e-mailed Customer Service with a query on Trains from Euston to Manchester on the 15th August as their website said no trains. Reply came back the next day which was very helpful

items.title: Bring back Virgin!
items.review_text: Appalling food in first class - there is no vegan option and vegetarians get an ultra-processed cheese spread with tasteless biscuits. No fresh fruit- just crisps and poor-quality sugary chocolate. The fares have gone up exponentially too. Bring back Virgin!

items.title: On hold for customer service 1hr 11…
items.review_text: On hold for customer service 1hr 11 mins - Dreadful service. Appears to be very badly managed. Staff appear to be very nice as with previous company (probably same staff). How did this company get to replace VT. Website & pricing can be confusing if travelling with additional service providers and can be cheaper if booked separately. Why can't this country have better public transport!?

items.title: Poor service filthy train sewage smell…
items.review_text: Poor service filthy train sewage smell from carriage rude nasty staff abs disgrace of a service will not use again

items.title: So expensive now
items.review_text: So expensive now.  Virgin used to have occasional extremely cheap advance tickets, or reasonable advance ticket prices or even £40 return from Manchester on a Saturday.  Now the minimum I seem to find is £95!

items.title: Come Back Virgin Trains. All Is Forgiven
items.review_text:
I used Avanti for the first time this month travelling from Preston to Euston return. I decided to pay extra to travel in first class. 

However, the on-board catering in first class was just appalling. The only choice was between a soggy BLT sandwich and an inedible “mush” described as Macaroni Cheese which had to be spat out on one mouthful. The food and drink choice in the buffet car was equally as limited in addition to being over-priced and cheap in quality. And, the first class carriage I sat in was untidy and dirty.

I wrote an email of complaint to Avanti thereafter and have just received a fob off response in which no meaningful apology or explanation was offered. So, I was extremely disappointed with the first class “experience” on Avanti West Coast and will certainly never fork out the extra cash to pay for first class again. 

Oh, and having to pay £4 for a small (.33cl) bottle of beer at the first class “lounge” at Euston was a further rip off.

items.title: Return journey from Shrewsbury to…
items.review_text: Return journey from Shrewsbury to Euston on a Sat/Sun. Outbound leg had no hot food for the first hour of a 2hr40 journey and anyway, the new at seat catering delivery service (mandatory as shop was otherwise closed) didn’t work for the first 15 and last 50 minutes. WiFi on both journeys was poor, either slow or occasionally just didn’t work. They’ve removed the weekend upgrade to First Class as they’ve introduced a new Standard Premium class where you can upgrade for the previous prices of a first upgrade but without the service. Not a bad idea but as Voyagers don’t have SP, you can’t upgrade at all. On the other hand, prices seem cheaper than VT.

items.title: Very poor service experienced on 1st…
items.review_text: Very poor service experienced on 1st class journey from Glasgow (Central) to London Euston. Biscuits almost thrown at me with disinterested staff on Glasgow to Carlisle element of trip. Train manager was almost unintelligible over PA on this leg of my journey. Everything seemed to improve from Carlisle to destination, with cheerful and professional staff providing something more akin to that expected from a 1st Class service. LNER seem to know how to do it 'right' on the East coast..why can't Avanti on the West coast?

items.title: I am trying to book for a group booking…
items.review_text: I am trying to book for a group booking (family of 7 adults and 1 child and 3 infants ) and delays in emails and no one on phone bookings and booking online not working . this company is a joke as some else said bring back virgin trains as i used these a number of time and was faultless .

items.title: Absolutely rubbish customer service…
items.review_text: Absolutely rubbish customer service quiet happy to answer you on twitter and FB but not able to answer the phone or emails

items.title: Awful customer service
items.review_text: Awful customer service. Spent 35 minutes on hold. Truly a waste of time and wish I had another option I could use. DM’d them and filled out the form so still waiting to hear back.

items.title: Ticket prices off the scale - bring back Virgin
items.review_text: I have not had one good experience with this company.  After having not seen my mum since the start of the pandemic I decided to book tickets from London to Blackpool mid-August to coincide having immunity from my second jab.  They do not look to do the cheaper advance tickets anymore, the price has more than doubled since the last time I used this service.  Decided to get the coach instead, although much longer journey, much more reasonably priced and they seem to be fairing much better on Trustpilot with the reviews they are receiving.   Avanti is a total rip off.

items.title: Would give minus 10 if I could
items.review_text: Would give minus 10 if I could. Website awful, no refunds, no upgrades to 1st class, food inedible! I could go on but getting bored. Come back Virgin!!

items.title: Impossible to change ticket dates
items.review_text: I am trying to change my ticket dates (due to Covid isolation) and it is IMPOSSIBLE. You cannot change your booking on the website. I have contacted through the help form on the website, received a message telling me to change my ticket via the website, responded asking how do I do this.. no reply. Tweeted them today and found out they've removed the option to change your booking on the website, you have to call. I have been on hold for over an hour.. told their Twitter team this and they pointed me towards the original form I filled out to get the email telling me to change the booking online.. which you can't do anymore. Absolute nightmare and of course the tickets are non-refundable, no matter what, despite there being a global pandemic and people having to change plans at short notice through no fault of their own e.g. having to isolate. The system is broken, no one is answering my calls and I don't know what to do... useless

items.title: Poor customer service
items.review_text:
Poor customer service, held up on the phone for 3 hours wanting to speak to someone. At the end of the day, I ended the call after 4 hours of wait, Little help available on the website. 
Booked 2 first class  tickets from Whitehaven to Peterborough, 4 days before travel day, had a change in plan and wanted to go instead to London. Tried forever to speak to someone to get some advice on what to do. The website was also not very helpful in terms of clear instru tons on whether I needed to re-book again and ask for a refund.

items.title: The Government must cancel their franchise.
items.review_text: The worst service I have had in my life. How on earth AVANTI managed to get the franchise to run a train service is beyond belief. Sky-high fares, appalling customer service. Prices have absolutely skyrocketed with this company, I wish I had other options to use. The prices for advanced first-class tickets to Manchester are have gone up from £30 (Virgin) to £66 (Avanti), an absolutely shocking company. I have just checked flight prices and I can fly from Heathrow to Manchester for £70. Why won't the govt cancel their franchise?

items.title: Expensive, mean, service
items.review_text: Due to Covid not used Avanti west coast much since it won the franchise from Virgin. Oh dear! It’s abysmal. I normally travel 1st class for work and would eat something on the evening train from Euston. I’m not sure that a cheap version of 2 small cartons of Dairylea spread plus 4 biscuits count as a meal. How this could be called ‘ cheese’ ( as stated on the box) defies trade description. Everything is so mean. Shall travel 2nd in future as it’s really not worth it. Train was also delayed due to lack of electricity. And the internet is less than useless. A truly depressing service.

items.title: Avanti's website and customer service is simple awful
items.review_text: Avanti's website is simple awful! It is such hard work to book a ticket, its like they don't actually want your £300. Try to book a ticket, shows availability, try to book, no seats available. now... how does that work? I spoke with Pete in customer services, who couldn't care less and just told me that was the way the website was set up!! A website set-up to NOT allow the purchase of tickets. Awful customer service from a joke of a company!! bring back Virgin!!!

items.title: Avanti website is worse than terrible!!
items.review_text: Avanti website is terrible. Bring back virgin or avanti why don’t you buy the virgin website and use it I have resorted to driving to the booking office to buy tickets as your website is apalling.. can t give no stars so you have only 1 but you don’t deserve any!

items.title: The prices on theses ticket omg 175…
items.review_text: The prices on theses ticket omg 175 pound from London to Wigan when with virgin it was 90 pound same time I think we need to take this to the papers or something because that is terrible

items.title: No Masks in sight and no accountability from Avanti
items.review_text: I travelled from Manchester to London on Thursday evening, the carriage was not too busy but we were seated every two rows at least, I counted one other person who bothered with a mask. Woman in front sat with it under her chin chatting on phone the whole journey, whole family got on without a mask in sight, and person sat opposite me got on train with a mask then proceeded to take it off. The ticket inspector find not say a peep and intact had a little chat with the woman with mask under her chin. I felt like I was in the twilight zone.

items.title: Bring back the weekend upgrade
items.review_text: Amazing how they've stopped the £25 weekend upgrade to 1st and instead for that amount you get Standard Premium ie same seats as 1st class but without the service you would normally receive. Can't even get an upgrade on seat frog like you used to. Bring back Virgin!!

items.title: I can't use their website
items.review_text:
I can't use their website. The dates overlap when trying to enter selection, and will not apply changes when you try to edit.
The prices, when you can access them, are THROUGH THE ROOF!
Bring back Nationalisation.

items.title: Enjoy travelling on Avanti West Coast
items.review_text: Enjoy travelling on Avanti West Coast. Brilliant service and keep with the time. Especially the train staff. Very helpful.

items.title: No more cheap advanced tickets!
items.review_text:
It didn’t take long for Avanti to find their feet. After taking over Virgin, they started off well. Cheaper advanced tickets from as little as £36 one way. 
But hold on! You can no longer buy cheaper tickets advanced or otherwise. Avanti shouldn’t be allowed to get away with this price hiking, especially during COVID. I travel regularly to and from London - Manchester. Was able to book up to six weeks in advance for cheap tickets. Now all the tickets are £66 one way wether you buy now or in advance. I did a search for random tickets up to six weeks and all resulted in £66.  If this is the direction Avanti are taking, then the government needs to look into their tactics. And passengers should seriously be looking elsewhere to travel. Avanti, now is your opportunity to explain what exactly is going on with your ticket pricing? Where are the advance cheap tickets? When will they be reinstated, if ever? Why are you charging full fares regardless of advance notice?

items.title: I agree
items.review_text: I agree! Virgin were way better! Cheaper and faster. Bring back virgin. I can’t stand this incompetent backsliding

items.title: Recently bought a ticket to travel from…London to Manchester
items.review_text:
Recently bought a ticket to travel from London to Manchester next week - more than £80. However, seeing the government guidelines that people should avoid the north-west as much as possible due to the Delta variant of Covid, I decided to cancel my ticket, thinking it would be easy enough to get a refund.

How wrong I was!

Looking at their website, it appears that I will not be eligible for a refund (though I have filled out an online form making the request, anyway). This is simply because they have a policy that they do not issue refunds. What other company is allowed to keep money for services not received?! How is this even legal?!

You buy an item of clothing and provided it hasn't been worn, you are usually allowed to return it within a few weeks. There is a cooling-off period with things like buying a house or taking out a contract with a utility company. Why is Avanti allowed to keep people's money when travel plans change all the time?! Just because they put it in the terms & conditions and I should have read the small print? Does that make it fairer?!

When I need to travel up there in future, I will make every effort to find a way that doesn't involve Avanti.

items.title: Would give zero if I could
items.review_text: Would give zero if I could, spent over an hour  trying to book a ticket on Google and then downloading the app to boot. Shocking web site.. very difficult to navigate especially on phone.. one of the worst site I've come across.. complete rubbish

items.title: I used to enjoy travelling with Virgin
items.review_text:
I used to enjoy travelling with Virgin, tickets were much cheaper and sometimes a cheeky first class bargain!

I have a complicated problem to sort with my ticket, needing to add another passenger who is disabled and needs to sit next to me, plus go on to a further stop.

NO WAY to contact customer service. Website, unhelpful. LIVE chat, dead.Phone line, unanswered. This is an urgent query and there is no way of resolving it. I am angry and upset

Their contact page on line forces you to select a category then points you back to their useless website.

items.title: No gluten free breakfast options in…
items.review_text:
No gluten free breakfast options in first class.

I miss Virgin’s gluten free bacon roll

items.title: Not very Covid safe
items.review_text: No attempt to remind people about face covering rule on my return journey (no announcements) and so people just take these off as soon as they sit down or masks are round their chins. No staff to check my ticket with whom I could raise this. I didn't feel safe at all (and I am lucky enough to have been in a position to book first class as a one off for the extra space between people). Wearing a face covering on public transport is written into law with associated penalties, unless someone is understandably exempt. Not everybody has had two vaccines, and there's a more vaccine resistant variant about even if you have.

items.title: Absolute disgrace
items.review_text: Absolute disgrace, fair hikes and an abysmal service. Whoever has taken the back hander to allow Avanti to take over from Virgin needs to use the Avanti service instead of a chauffeur driven limousin. Congratulations Boris.

items.title: Absolutely shocking service
items.review_text:
Absolutely shocking service. Whole weekend was disrupted due to train cancellation one week followed by more cancellations the following week, net loss over £600 when taken into account the hotel and other bookings we could not make due to their lack of service.

They offered 50% refund, my challenge to this was declined by a bot...... Do not book with avanti, hire a car and suffer the roads instead. I will never travel with these scam artist again. Bring back virgin or nationalise. 

Worst customer service I've even experienced.

items.title: I want to select zero stars
items.review_text: I want to select zero stars, but unfortunately this isn't available to select. Abject experience trying to book train tickets yesterday and today, the website is shockingly bad, keeps crashing, full of bugs, not user friendly, unclear, pure waste of time. I am dreading having to go on that train with my kids now that I've booked (after spending over 5 hours trying to book), as I've now read the other reviews too... Bring Back Virgin Trains please, or take that Avanti company to account, they must be contracted to some kind of SLAs on service quality as a supplier, SURELY??

items.title: I'm in the train now penrith to London…
items.review_text:
I'm in the train now penrith to London Euston.
Paid high prices for advanced tickets but during that covid 19 time that train have is very low hygiene quality.
Train is very dirty and seats are full of hair's. 
I'm travelling with my 6 years old kid and she asked me why that train is dirty. If 6 year old baby can see that then why management cannot see it.
They put my self in danger today for that journey. 
Very disappointed about this bad hygiene standards especially during that covid 19 period.

items.title: Booked a return journey from London to…
items.review_text: Booked a return journey from London to Manchester over the bank holiday weekend. Website was easy to use and allowed us to select our seats, we collected our tickets at Euston with no problem. Service ran on time on both journeys, carriages were clean and we all made use of the free Wifi on board, although the Wifi was slow at times.

items.title: Travelled first class Birmingham New…
items.review_text:
Travelled first class Birmingham New Street to Euston. The first class lounge at New Street had as much atmosphere as a morgue. The train was dirty and the food was horrendous plus the staff member  who served me was very rude. 

#bringbackvrgintrains

items.title: The prices on Advanced tickets have…
items.review_text:
The prices on Advanced tickets have risen steeply since Avanti Westcoast took over from Virgin Trains, I remember two years ago it wasn't unusual to get a ticket for around £20 if you booked in advance from Manchester to London, now you're looking at closer to £30. As my wage hasn't increased by a third, it does seem quite a rise.

On a separate point, if you compare prices of advanced tickets on LNER Leeds to London (similar journey time), they are significantly cheaper, sometimes working out cheaper for me to travel via Leeds to get to London

items.title: Stiff upper-lip
items.review_text: AvantiWestCoast have increased the price of journeys on standard carriages (which reek of toilet chemicals and urine). There are more or an equal number of 1st Class carriages for individuals too shallow to acknowledge that they’re sharing a planet with other people (the extortionate tickets here allow you access to a plug socket at a table). The trains are even slower than they were under that rapacious, blond, grinning psychopath, Richard Branson, who will never fill the void where his soul should be whether grasping at trips to near-earth orbit or clumps of NHS flesh. Privatisation is obviously, to all but the most pathetic, desperate, obsequious sadomasochists, a con. Just when I thought it couldn’t get any worse, along come Avanti and even higher fares. As a suggestion- don’t bother spending any money on marketing. You have the politicians and you have the monopoly. There’s nothing that a nation of angry, servile zombies will do about it. Instead, give the money to charity, or your underpaid staff, and if that is too abhorrent to your withered and twisted sensibilities, paint all your standard carriages black (including the windows) and write “POORS” and “SCUM” on them. It will make zero difference to a population that consistently gets fooled by a flag. But, it would at least be honest. Rott in hell, you heartless, money-grabbing c**ts.

items.title: Rude staff
items.review_text: Rude staff. Train too late to make my connection. No apology or reason given by on board staff about the late running of my train. Given the prices charged for tickets, they should do better.

items.title: Reviews so bad I am preferring to drive
items.review_text: Having looked at the costs and the bad reviews on here, I have decided it is cheaper to drive Chester to London. We are all supposed to be using eco friendly transport, and yet we have a company providing a prohibitively expensive and seemingly shockingly low level service.

items.title: Avanti are a terrible company knowingly…
items.review_text: Avanti are a terrible company knowingly sell 1st class tickets with no chance of reservations. Proved to be untruthful. Be very wary of using this company appears to be motivated by grabbing money and not delivering quality. A poor successor to Virgin 3

items.title: Take your own food!
items.review_text: Catering is very poor. Tried to use the atseatservice. Spent a good half an hour trying to connect to the WiFi as required but the network couldn’t cope. Finally got in, very very poor and limited selection of food. Literally a BLT or porridge. Placed my order which was long and arduous. Made the payment only for it to be accepted, rejected and later told the sandwich is out of stock. So looks like it’s porridge or porridge at 7pm. Must make it very clear that this is no reflection on the staff, the lady that then came to tell me the sandwich was out of stock was nice and very polite. But seriously, you need to offer more than three things and you need to make sure your supply chains and tech are up to the job. Essentially avanti is paying someone to man a cafe with no food and has made sure this customer and everyone I tell never dares board a train without bringing your own food beforehand because they aren’t up to the job. One very hangry customer.

items.title: 1 Star is 1 too many
items.review_text: Holding on the phone for 2hrs and 21 minutes so far today at time of writing this and clock is still ticking trying to resolve confusion over previously booked tickets and seats. Also have two unanswered logged requests and a complaint online. I do not believe that they have anyone answering telephones today. No wonder 82% of people are giving them bad reviews. Useless!

items.title: TERRIBLE SERVICE FOR DISABLED
items.review_text:
I have rated a one this is because there is no zero.
I amdisabled I need to travel with my carer. I have tried to book train tickets with my carer and her daughter.
Can't make top nor tail of web site, just keeps sending you around in circles.
Ended up just booking as I kept loosing tickets and times. Then tired to contact customer services over now four days, on line in total well over two hours 45 mins, ending up having to hang up anyway SO FRUSTRATING! They want to put two in another carriage one on thier own. NO WAY is a six year old going on her own, secondly that is noo good to me if i need assistance on route. Keep being informed go to our website for all latest information and help. NO already been ther done that, hence trying to contact you. Covid just an excuse for less than poor service. BRING BACK VIRGIN TRAINS.

items.title: Worst integration with trainline ever
items.review_text:
Terrible service and can't wait for rails to be nationalised. 

Had booked a ticket with trainline for a friend and the barcode was slightly clipped off so could not be scanned. Even though just underneath was all the journey details straight from the trainline app they forced my friend to buy another ticket. Surely his system should be able to see that the ticket and seat was booked with trainline for the route in question?

Not possible apparently. 

Okay no problem, surely they will refund when we show them that we were forced to purchase two tickets for the same route when we call up?

Nope, no help at all

items.title: Manchester to Surbiton via London Euston May 21
items.review_text:
Travelling on my own from Manchester to London Euston May 21 . Passengers not wearing masks. Not one member of staff checking. Announcement from manchester completely inaudible. passengers moving seats and crowding together. No service to seats as promised. It was scary.
Train stopped at Milton Keynes due to signalling problems. I do not know how others continued their journeys. I took an uber that cost a fortune to Euston as there was no indication as to how I would get to Surbiton
On my return and trying to obtain confirmation for possible insurance refund waited 25 minutes on line before giving up. phone no on website is non functional. No place for general help.
There was one piece of better news. On my return journey all passengers in my carriage wearing masks. Members of staff were seen and food was served as stated to your seat

items.title: ON HOLD FOR HOURS. No chat or call-back options. No wait time estimates. Horrible company.
items.review_text: I am just trying to amend one side of a return booking that has a bike reservation attached, as it's complex I cannot use the eForm, but I can never reach any agent. I have been trying for days, each time I am on hold for hours, until I give up. There is no call-back option. There is no live chat option. Each time that I give up I attempt to use their eForm and I am given an answer that is not answering my question. This is futile and pointless. It's LDN-MAN, such an expensive ticket, and I have no other options. They don't even tell me where I am in the queue, or how long this wait will take. I really hate how disrespectful this company is being to me as they are making me sit here for hours with no resolution in sight.

items.title: No customer support
items.review_text: Fruitless results from FAQs/helpdesk. Automatic phone service cuts off after telling me to go to the live chat function.... which is currently disabled - genius. Result? No help.

items.title: Incompetent
items.review_text: It looks like a competent bookings website but isn’t. I’ve tried every way possible to book seats for me and my family (three of us including a toddler) but the website won’t let us choose seats - instead it randomly allocates seats and every time it does it it spreads all three of us out in window seats in separate rows and opposite sides of the train. The old Virgin website worked - this one doesn’t.  I’ve given up, we can’t book train tickets when the train company won’t allocate us seats next to our three year old daughter.

items.title: So far I've spent over 2 hours trying…
items.review_text:
So far I've spent over 2 hours trying to contact your telephone support team in trying to reserve 1st class seats for my season ticket, sent over 8 emails of which i've had 2 replies. 1 telling me the timetables had not been released despite the fact I could book individual tickets, the second telling me to book online, a service that is not yet available.  
You tell us that we must book a seat but yet we cannot actually book seats.

items.title: Avanti = Awful Experience
items.review_text:
I've wasted 8 hours of my life trying to book train tickets for one journey. I've bought tickets and had them refunded twice. I've been made promises and had staff 'give me their word' that the tickets I have been trying to book for 3 weeks would be available only to be told after taking money off my credit card for the second time that the tickets aren't actually available. I've been given SIX different prices for the same journey ranging from £165 to £800. 
To quote the Transport Secretary, the 'dysfunctional and chaotic' franchise system could not come to end soon enough.
Avanti your staff are working with a pricing structure and ticketing system that's not fit for purpose.
I am still waiting for a member of staff to call me back to apologies.

items.title: Scammers! No way to get a refund!
items.review_text:
We booked out tickets from Euston to Glasgow Central on May 21 an return on May 23, a total of 150 pounds. Due to some power surge the trains got delayed/cancelled.  There were long queues and hundreds of people inside the station with no clear info when the issue will be fixed, it was a covid-19 hotspot. We also did not find any convenient alternate routes. Seeing the situation we decided to cancel our trip. We lost our money for the hotel and the trip we booked but we felt assured that we will get our train tickets refunded. 

But alas! we were absolutely wrong! We emailed Avanti,  called them and even went to the station to get our money back but to no avail. The customer rep never picks up the phone and the rep at the train counter said you can only do the refund online. There is no option for a refund on its website you either call or email. Why should we suffer all these hassle when it was fault at ur end. Such pathetic customer service. I am so angry at this point. You want to cheat and scam your customers. You want to make you customers sooo frustrated that they forget about the refund!!! I wish I could report you to the highest authority and cancel your service and save people from this harassment!!! I will definitely tweet about this. Such a terrible experience with no possibility of refund in sight! Guys please beware of these frauds who will loot you with their expensive tickets but offer you the worst service!

items.title: So grateful to Avanti
items.review_text:
So grateful to Avanti. 
I travelled up to Crewe and back, from London earlier this week with another train company. On the return leg, we ran into an issue to do with a fatality. We were all told to alight, without an option of what to do going forward. 30 mins later we were told that the company had an agreement in place with Avanti, and they were heading to the same station in London. Avanti felt like the miracle that I was wishing for and when I boarded the carriage, I have to say what a much better train it was. More comfortable, with fast chargers and toilets. I’m so impressed that in future I’m going to book up with them rather than the cheaper train company that let me down. Thanks Avanti!

items.title: worse than virgin, and that's saying something
items.review_text: website awful to use, they are not honest about delays, long waits via the phone, rude & misleading staff, nightmare to get a refund

items.title: Dreadful booking experience
items.review_text: Impossible to book tickets on their website, just a mess. Took many hours to book a simple return ticket. In this day and age, I just couldn't believe how bad the experience was...

items.title: Poor service
items.review_text: Poor service. I have been trying to book tickets for 3 days. When i get to the payment screen it takes me back to the first page. I am trying to ring customer service and have been on hold for 45 minutes!!!!.

items.title: A train company with no timetable
items.review_text:
I want to book/make a reurn journey starting in 4 days, but "the tickets/timetimetable have not been released".

It gets better:
"The timetable/possibility to book will only be available the day *after* your journey starts."

Utter awful chaos.

items.title: On Wednesday 19th May 2021 travelled on…
items.review_text:
On Wednesday 19th May 2021 travelled on the 1210 Avanti train from Euston to Glasgow Central joining at Crewe and alighting at Lancaster. At Preston the train crew changed over, and on leaving Preston the female Scottish train manager made a very aggressive announcement warning passengers of the dire consequences if they did not obey the rules. To cap it all at the end of this she announced would be checking tickets and was wearing a body camera .
If there are any legal eagles out there what would be the legal position for using such a device?
Needless to say I will not be using Avanti trains again.

items.title: doors close TWO minutes before... apparently
items.review_text: I was stopped boarding the train because it was TWO minutes before boarding time. The gate staff decided that was the deadline now. Be aware that you may be stopped boarding unless you are there three minutes before? Whats the official timing now? Who knows - because it's not on the website. Or the ticket. Or visible from the station platform. Inform customers of your regulations maybe? Or be reasonable? What happened to that? Not sure. Or make them miss their train and then pay for a new ticket, or have to pay for an overnight stay. Sensible & safe. Excellent service.

items.title: Where is the ZERO star option
items.review_text: Where is the ZERO star option? Utterly shambolic. The first trip made I was fortunate because the App allowed me to book. However, the first class “service” comprised a thimble half full of processed cheese and two (broken) “crackers” the size of a large first class stamp, no butter, and half full plastic tea. So the next time I went for “standard”. This time I wasn’t so lucky. The App wouldn’t allow me to book so I had to pay more and use trainline. A dwarf wouldn’t have had leg room, no one wore masks, no staff member in sight and to cap it all, the most rude and lazy RPO Mohdi at the Euston barrier caused me to miss my return train. Refused to deal with me despite having my ticket ready whilst his colleague dealt with another customer. And then, after waiting for 3 minutes, smirked whilst telling me the barriers shut two minutes before departure so I missed my train and my evening engagement on the first night of lifted Covid restrictions 17 May. Complaint made to Avanti but no response.  The two worst train experiences I’ve have ever had, and that includes travelling by train in the US. I have discovered that I can fly from Manchester to London business class for LESS. Sod the planet, British Airways here I come.

items.title: Coming Out Of Lockdown,(So You Don't Have That Excuse Anymore) AV Customer Service And Telesales Still As Shambolic As Ever! Avanti Now Don't Deserve The Customer Service Contact Anymor More Mr Shapps
items.review_text: Many Disappointing Letdowns Due To Avanti Trains Very Poor Customer Telesales Department Overpriced Rail Tickets And Still Far Too Few Even Advance Tickets Availability!

items.title: essential journeys only
items.review_text: just received a e-mail from avanti,essential journeys on the 17th may,is going to the races at carlisle essential enough,plus the website is a disgrace takes you an hour to book.

items.title: 'Amateurish' would be an insult to amateurs.
items.review_text:
A dreadful service from a notorious company at an extortionate price. £230 paid for two first-class return tickets Birmingham-London, plus £30 for the 'Two Together' card which gave us access to this discounted price, bought online weeks in advance. It turned out that we could have had the same for over sixty pounds less by buying standard tickets on the day and upgrading with no need for the 'Two Together' card.

As it happens the 'First Class' benefits were precisely nil. Do not invest in this with Avanti. The First Class lounge at Birmingham is shut at weekends; at Euston it is a waiting area with no facilities beyond the toilet and a TV, with a toddlers' party-style goodie bag to take away. In the First Class carriages there are a few snacks and soft drinks available, but these were actually served up to the whole train on the way down. 

The First-class carriage itself (the only one on the return journey) is used by the staff as a social area. In ours, four staff chatted loudly and relentlessly for 90 minutes without looking around the rest of the train, making rest, reading or work impossible. The only other passenger in First Class eventually turned on a film playing at full volume and no member of staff intervened.

At no point on the outward journey were our tickets checked - not in the station at either end, nor on the train. There's a good chance you can travel into London for free, so don't bother buying those expensive advance tickets. They were checked on the return journey, but we saw no sign of the staff checking the rest of the train, and our discount card was not requested.

The trains did not follow the advertised times in either direction. The outward one was announced at the station to take 30 minutes longer than still advertised on the app; the one going back was cancelled and replaced by a slightly earlier one (again not notified on the app, and which anyone using the app would therefore have missed) which nonetheless arrived ten minutes later than the advertised one.

This is the most we've ever paid for this trip in years of making the journey, and it was without doubt the worst value for money. Remarks from several staff confirmed that Avanti is having its finances secured by the government and doesn't care about passenger experience, staff conditions or passenger revenue if it means paying staff to check tickets. Don't buy First Class; don't buy in advance; and if possible, don't use Avanti.

items.title: If could award zero would...appalling…
items.review_text: If could award zero would...appalling customer service, email not recognised when i have an account...20 min wait to speak to someone...how did they end up with franchaise?

items.title: BEWARE! Payment taken but no tickets given.
items.review_text:
Website took payment but received no ticket. Chased CS as wanted a cheap advance ticket. 
Now days after they have contacted me and said the money will be returned in 10 days and i should book another ticket at x3 the original price i paid.
I am still debating whether they are incompetent or if they are scamming.

Trustpilot states they haven't responded to a negative in over 12 months...speaks volumes about how they deal with unhappy customers..

items.title: Never mind the train journeys
items.review_text: Never mind the train journeys, the app on the iPad is completely useless! I make lots of long distances trips in the UK and have given up trying to book via their app. Does anyone vet this stuff?

items.title: Poor online experience
items.review_text: Poor online experience - cannot book seat reservations / cannot book train without them

items.title: Awful
items.review_text:
Awful - can’t believe they got rid of Virgin who offered such a reliable and good service and replaced them with Avanti who are totally inept. 

Avanti are dreadful. 3 weeks out from the bank holiday and you can’t buy tickets because they are allegedly/already sold out.

Absolute rip off.

items.title: £300 for a return standard fare from…
items.review_text: £300 for a return standard fare from Manchester to London in September. Absolute disgrace.

items.title: Shameful service
items.review_text: I have been travelling between London to Birmingham for the last three and half years. I have seen the steep decline in service as the service moved from Virgin Trains to the Avanti West Coast. The booking system has now become totally chaotic, the refund system hardly non-existent and extremely complicated and the ticket price have utterly sky rocketed in the last few months. What else to say? One star only. I have been travelling with other service in the last month as totally unaffordable. Totally shameful.

items.title: The worst service I have had in my…
items.review_text: Given 1 star only because that is the minimum to get the review published! The worst service I have had in my life. How on earth AVANTI managed to get the franchise to run a train service is beyond belief! Sky high fares, appalling customer service. You pay hard cash, but they refund you vouchers which can only be used at the ticket counters. For some reason you can never get online fares from the ticket counters; they are more expensive than the already high online fares! why won't the govt cancel their franchise?

items.title: Price increase for lockdown easing is a…
items.review_text: Price increase for lockdown easing is a joke. Sitting on a virtually empty train from Liverpool to London and I'm paying almost double the price of a ticket compared to when there was no travel restrictions.

items.title: About to book Euston to London for the…
items.review_text: About to book Euston to London for the first time since March 2020 having been a regular commuter prior to lock down. Looked at the time table and 20 minutes has been added to the journey time! Did depart at 7.30, now 7.10 which means will be impossible to guarantee getting  there in time via public transport.

items.title: Scam
items.review_text: I need to book a return journey and Avanti won't even let me do it. Ridiculous. It's a scam to get people to book singles and pay more. Bring back Virgin and get these con-artists out!

items.title: Prices have absolutely sky rocketed…
items.review_text: Prices have absolutely sky rocketed with this company, I wish I had other options to use. The price usually pay for an advanced first class ticket has gone up from £66 to £124 on a late train absolutely shocking company. I  have just checked flight prices and  I can fly business class from Heathrow to Manchester for £104. I wish i had checked this first

items.title: Matt Sherratt Retail Support Agent
items.review_text: Matt Sherratt Retail Support Agent - thank you Matt for sorting out my issues with my login and the tickets that I booked this morning.  You were kind, considerate, understanding, patient and professional, a delight to talk with you.

items.title: Would rate 0 if I could
items.review_text: Would rate 0 if I could, disgusting staff

items.title: Avanti App
items.review_text:
Avanti App

Shockingly bad. Rejects valid emails claiming they are not valid. Is unable to reserve seats and implies it’s a user issue. 

Never thought I’d say this but bring back Virgin.

items.title: Very disappointed with Avanti Westcoast…
items.review_text:
Very disappointed with Avanti Westcoast Train service.

I had my bike, I went to get a permit from Manchester Piccadilly ticket office 6 minutes before my train. She refuses to issue me a permit because I need to be there 10 minutes before. When the day before I arrived at the same time with the same lady who served me but it wasn't an issue yesterday. 
Bare in mind it takes literally 30 secs to walk to the platform and 10 secs to open the door.
Her and her colleagues saying "it isn't fair on the guys on the train" 

The way she spoke to me about it was rude. Ever since they took over Virgin there has been issues with lateness and unprofessionalism throughout.

Avoid.

items.title: Poor assistance
items.review_text: The bike wracks were not accessible; no assistance when needed; the door didn't open so I missed my stop.

items.title: Avoid First Class - Total Waste of Money
items.review_text: Avanti have already destroyed the hard work of Virgin on this route ( London/Liverpool) in record time. They are expensive and the first class offering is the poorest I’ve ever seen. A dry minutare stale croissant and a yoghurt ( that’s breakfast menu) and a scone and cup of tea ( that’s the entirety of the lunch menu) now on the way  back. I am just about to walk the length of train from front to back to go to the buffet car. I need at least a sandwich. They haven’t even given people a bottle of water and despite all the fridges are empty. Really, really poor.  Saving grace is the one train crew member I’ve seen is professional and sympathetic. Real shame as Virgin had it spot on. Economy always for me with these people from now on - I’d rather spend the extra £64 in the buffet!!

items.title: Onboard staff noise levels
items.review_text: Had the misfortune of being allocated a seat in Coach C (with the shop,cleaners and Train Manager). Three different crews between Glasgow and Euston, all of whom were very loud and disrupt full. There are way too many staff on these trains and not enough work, hence they congregate in this one area. Hire car for me next time.

items.title: Really dreadful booking process
items.review_text: Really dreadful booking process. It shows you all the train options but when you try to book it says there are no tickets. When you finally find a journey, via a very circuitous route, the booking is not saved in your account and the confirmation email, yes I was lucky enough to get one it... seems others didn't even get that, is very short on information. No details on my connections, how many changes etc. I was going to modify my booking to an earlier departure but quite frankly I cannot bear to go through the hassle. I will try collecti v my ticket well in advance because I am really not confident it will go smoothly. Pretty bloody grim all round.

items.title: Dreadful
items.review_text:
Dreadful, dreadful service. Over priced, staffed by rude incompetents, and reeking of urine.
I never thought I'd say this, but "come back Virgin, all is forgiven".

items.title: Absolute rip off....
items.review_text:
Absolute rip off..... expensive fares - cheaper hiring a car for the day!

Money grabbers who certainly won’t be getting my hard earned cash in future.

items.title: Fahad at Marylebone station
items.review_text:
Fahad at Marylebone station: what a star! 

True gent, very polite and patient after I accidentally threw away outward ticket before getting on final connection to Rickmansworth. 

Sorted it out in v timely fashion so I could carry on. A great example of fair and excellent customer service 

🙂

items.title: Website is misleading.
items.review_text:
Website is misleading.

The option for Print at Station isn't visible on the website only if you click a small print "more options" at the bottom of the webpage.

I was denied boarding after they refused to print my E-Ticket in station.

items.title: you're not actually that bad...my only…
items.review_text: you're not actually that bad...my only issue is that you should have charging sockets for phones and laptops on the seats which have no tables. If you could sort that out especially before I travel by rail again I'd be more than happy to recommend your services to friends and families

items.title: Only interested in London
items.review_text: Replacing 20 class 221 trains with 23 new trains in 2022. Not much room for growth and new services. They want to extend the wrexham service to Gobowen which is totally a random place with a few houses. Yet north Wales still gets a limited service.

items.title: The worst customer service I have ever…
items.review_text: The worst customer service I have ever had. No idea how Virgin lost to these guys! The staff have no idea what they’re doing. They can’t access their own systems. I am still trying to get a refund from when trains were cancelled over Christmas. I made a complaint and nothing was done, no emails back from emailing customer service. No refund despite receiving an email saying a refund was being processed over two weeks ago. Outrageously bad. Think I’m going to stop using them altogether!

items.title: Poor customer service, company is unable to function and coordinate a simple refund request
items.review_text: I’ve been waiting on a refund due to the lockdown for 3+ months now. Customer Service is poor and I am tired of being asked to wait a month for a cheque to turn up before contacting again only to find nothing arrives. The service this company provides is poor and needs improvement.

items.title: A journey back in time.
items.review_text: I wonder how on earth they won the contract from Virgin. I booked a train to London with the idea of working on my 2-hour journey but as there are no tables this was not possible. I am now attempting to send my expense receipts into work but they don't even issue a receipt - I have to take a screenshot of a confirmation email. Is this 2021 or am living in an episode of Life on Mars? Am I Sam Tyler?

items.title: Shocking customer service
items.review_text:
Shocking customer service. Can't believe a company still gets away with such lousy standards in the 21st century! 
Their website is dysfunctional (other than to purchase tickets I guess). Had to spend 20 mins looking for a phone number, of which most options don't even work!
Naming and shaming I hope will get them to finally wake up and take note.
I arrived home 4 1/2 hours late (4 am Saturday night!) after numerous delays, and eventually being bussed to our destination...only for buses to break down mid journey!
I applied for a refund as they proudly gloat 'delay repay', but was declined.
Bring back Virgin any day...

items.title: Far too expensive
items.review_text: Far too expensive. Avoid if possible until they lower their prices

items.title: I go back and fourth to London and…
items.review_text: I go back and fourth to London and Liverpool every 2 weeks for work,1st off the WiFi doesn’t work literally can’t do nothing in it, needs to be sorted ASAP, even in the FIRST CLASS, the experience is only a train ride nothing more for the expensive  price you pay

items.title: Absolutely unbelievably expensive but…
items.review_text: Absolutely unbelievably expensive but no other choice having to go to london, how can you book two seats together bring back virgin. Terrible service

items.title: 0 stars - appalling customer service.
items.review_text: If I was able to leave a no star feedback I would. Absolutely disgraceful post sale customer service. I have been given 3 dates to expect a refund for a journey that was cancelled in advance. So many excuses, lied to by customer service department and still not rectified after emailing the Managing Director Phil Whittingham. Joke, absolute Joke. On 3rd Feb I received an email saying my refund would take up to 5 days to be paid. It’s now 15th March and I’m still waiting. Technical glitches, they “lost” my refund and a whole host of excuses later and still waiting..... never ever again.

items.title: Great experience
items.review_text: Great experience with a decent enough long distance retailer, still riding on the Virgin brand but nothing to criticise so far.

items.title: Birmingham to London Euston train on…
items.review_text: Birmingham to London Euston train on 14th March 2021. Racist abuse by Asian/Pakistani train manager. He literally threw me out of  the train for an honest mistake. I had just come from funeral meeting and was mentally confused. I entered into the wrong train and he aggressively/verbally abused me with racist undertones.  A wonderful train attendant at the station where I was kicked out from saw everything that happened and helped me find the right train. He noticed what his colleague did was wrong but sadly nobody stood up for me. I hope Avanti will take my concern into action. This man is terrible For your brand. I wish I took a video of the words he uttered to me. I was mentally drained to even defend myself.

items.title: After I had my Midlands train to…
items.review_text: After I had my Midlands train to Nottingham  cancelled without notice, and being told my ticket was not valid for other carriers,  I was able to book via app the next avanti train to Birmingham.  Once onboard I decided to de stress with a coffee and told my story of woe to the guy behind the buffet who apologised for my experience on the railway system today and offered me a complimentary coffee. Total class fella 👏👌👍well done Avanti

items.title: The refund policy of this company is an…
items.review_text:
The refund policy of this company is an absolute disgrace. Bought an annual season pass from Birmingham New Street (no indication it was Avanti West Coast) for a West Midlands zone. Was unable to use the ticket due to loosing my job and being in the Covid lockdown. Very difficult circumstances stances as I was (and still am) very vulnerable at the time.

They have refused to give any kind of refund even though the ticket was not used for 8 months worth of ticket. I’m now very much out of pocket and am in a very difficult situation. 

I will say now the two staff I contacted via email were very professional and informative so no complaints there. Just with the refund policy which is dreadful and is jot treating customer fairly. Make sure you don’t buy any tickets with them. I don’t what to do now. Very very concerned.

items.title: Never travel with AWC trains please
items.review_text: please if you can avoid it don't please please please please don't travel with awc trains the staff insult you there is no question of customer service that is a word they don't understand if you complain to head office you might has we'll talk to the wall nothing is wrong and nothing gets done about it there is no customer service no goodwill I had a medical appointment one stop on train told to wear mask why am I exsanpt I was wearing a badge then told to wear a visor then told shouldn't be out and not to make myself cosy to come and find train manager reply from customer service was staff have to inforce rules and a lot of excuses never ever use this company

items.title: Disgusting Customer Service
items.review_text:
I contacted Avanti West Coast after being advised by their staff to get on the wrong train, not one but by two of their staff. I was ticketed on the train and told my ticket was invalid. I had to pay an extra £45 pounds additionally on top of my original ticket. After contacting their customer service and stating that this was through no fault of my own. They responded by failing to issue a refund and blaming me stating that it was my fault. Their customer service is disgusting. And as for the staff at their stations i am appalled that they find it acceptable for staff to have no knowledge of the trains whatsoever. 
I strongly do not recommend this service.

items.title: Disgusting company that does not allow…
items.review_text: Disgusting company that does not allow you to contact them. Expensive as f*** for no service whatsoever

items.title: Criminal negligence or EXTREME incompetence?
items.review_text:
I note Avanti no longer bother to check their reviews here (wonder why) but as a warning to others I'll write one anyhow.
I was recently forced to use AWC as I found there was no other operator doing a direct route to where I needed to go. It was an already stressful emergency dash to aid my widowed mum when my very elderly gran collapsed.
To go into the horror and incompetence would take too long. Suffice to say a direct 4+ hr journey became 12+ hours incompetence fest even though in the end I prematurely abandoned my train journey for a taxi.
I got my auto refund and after complaining and asking for an explanation and being fobbed off first with a 25% discount on a future ticket which upped to 50 then 100 when I kept rejecting it in favour of an explanation - I finally gave in.
Then my gran died and I;'ve been forced - once again - as a non car owner - to put myself at the mercy of AVW. The comp ticket does not exist. I spent Friday messaging AWC - then on the phone with an AWC ticket sales guy who didn't seem to know how his company worked - promised to ring me back with a resolution but of course did not.
They excuse their incompetence by just saying covid covid covid - but they were crap before. They are just much much worse now at a time when people need basic competence and reliability more than ever. As well as the awful stress - I've been led a merry dance - ok - lets not be polite - I was just tricked, lied to and had more and more of my time wasted.
Honestly - if there is a donkey cart available DO NOT TRAVEL WITH THIS COMPANY

items.title: staff happy to wind you up now
items.review_text: staff happy to wind you up now, while not wearing any mask. Very rude generally. Timetables changing at all time. No warning. No advertisements at the stations.  Not enjoyable. Customer service gone down the drain since the lockdown, March 2020. Treated like cattle.

items.title: Beacon of light, on my journey of woes.
items.review_text:
I don,t do train journeys very often, and after my recent experience of one from Alexandria to Plymouth including several changes, I wont be rushing to travel long distance by train in the very foreseeable future. The journey was a nightmare from start to finish, with delays, cancellations, and very poor information over the PA system on the train. To cap it all, the train started traveling backwards at one point. I can only imagine what the uproar may have been, had the carriages been full. (only 5 passengers in my carriage). 
However, and no pun intended. There was one beacon of light at the end of the tunnel. 
I know that I am not supposed to name personnel, but I cannot praise highly enough, Mark, who took over as train manager at Crewe.  At least I think that it was Crewe, I was starting to lose the plot slightly by this time.  He is a credit to his employers. I think that he managed to speak personally to every passenger on the train, to keep us up to speed with what was happening and constantly apologizing to everyone for the delays etc. He also did his best for me and another couple of passengers to try and help us make our next scheduled train on time. Well done Mark, and thank you for all your efforts.

items.title: Virgin Trains took 1h15m to birmingham…
items.review_text: Virgin Trains took 1h15m to birmingham to London. Now Avanti takes 1h50m.

items.title: Terrible - no response to providing my refund a month later
items.review_text:
Terrible - no response to providing my refund a month later

Received email confirmation 23rd Dec 2020 of my refund request being received. I have had no follow up since and it has been over 20 working days since I received the initial email.

I have entered my reference into your website which returns that it does not recognise the reference.

I have called your helpline 03455280253 which in the case of ‘refund’ options only provides automated response and does not allow option to speak with an operator. The helpline sends me to your website’s live chat.

Over the past 3 weeks I have attempted to use your live chat – which once my details are filled in, will simply not load. Have tried multiple browsers and multipe laptops.

Making me chase shadows to get my £80 refund.

items.title: Terrible - no response to providing my refund a month later
items.review_text:
Terrible - no response to providing my refund a month later

Received email confirmation 23rd Dec 2020 of my refund request being received. I have had no follow up since and it has been over 20 working days since I received the initial email.

I have entered my reference into your website which returns that it does not recognise the reference.

Making me chase shadows to get my £80 refund.

items.title: I want to thank jahmal on helping me…
items.review_text: I want to thank jahmal on helping me get on the train today as I was on crutches while trying to carry a suitcase and bag pack at the same time! Service was 100%... sorry for you getting you stuck on the train for helping me out!

items.title: Great train
items.review_text: I have never been on Avanti west coast I been on virgin trains I like the virgin trains I liked the class 390

items.title: Very disappointed
items.review_text: Very disappointed! They are always late and no proper support on the platforms if you beed information! Virgin was way better and more professional! Shame on you for having high prices but providing such a low service...

items.title: Shockingly bad
items.review_text: Shockingly bad.  used them about 8 times in the last 2 months due to work. Every single trip from glasgow to london or vice versa has been bad.  Delays, AC not working and sitting in sweltering heat   shop closed for no reason, staff ignoring covid rules, and today train delayed by atleast 4 hours. Bus replacement service we were packed in like sardines during covid.

items.title: Rude workers!
items.review_text: Rude workers!

items.title: No effort is made for Travelling with a…
items.review_text:
No effort is made for Travelling with a bike. Avanti West coast should Take example of European train systems where it is very common to travel with a bike 🚲 for commuting to work or for any other reason and where there is plenty of space for bikes, baby strollers etc. 
Your trains are most of the time empty. Maybe that’s the reason. You don’t listen your customer’s needs.

items.title: Free First Class Upgrade
items.review_text: i was travelling to manchester for work, on a sunday afternoon. And due to the train being so quiet, the lovely train manager insisted i sit in first class so i could be extra comfortable. Made my day. i travel a lot with Avanti West Coast and highly recommend them. :)

items.title: Absolutely terrible service
items.review_text: Absolutely terrible service - purchased and sold a ticket for a train that did not exist, after waiting for 2 hrs I got the next train which was also delayed. on attempting to request refund I was pushed pillar to post, asked for numbers that dont exist, 5 different people claimed they couldnt handle my request and on it went. Terrible service and set up - Avoid at all cost

items.title: Avoid Dishonest
items.review_text:
Avoid Dishonest
Agreed refund but have failed to give and now disputing with credit card provider
They have remove option to see old tickets so makes harder for evidence for credit card provider

Their trains are still as dirty as when virgin had they pretend to ay they clean them and covid safe 
They are not!

items.title: Thank you
items.review_text: Massive credit to the guards & ticket inspectors for platform 5 at Euston for the 0950 train on Sunday 20 December. I’m en route to see my vulnerable elderly parents with whom I share a support bubble. I cannot thank the Avanti staff enough for allowing me to board the train with less than 30 seconds spare. So refreshing to see pragmatism and courtesy preside over jobsworthiness. Merry Christmas and God bless you all.

items.title: I write this in a state of astonishment…
items.review_text:
I write this in a state of astonishment at the dreadful customer service from AWC. I am not going to go into detail (unless someone asks) but what is clearly stated in the AWC sales pitch is empty and cynical. I apply for a refund, they lose the tickets I sent them at a cost of £6.70 and it is my fault and they won't pay; I am told I qualify for the delay repay on another trip, they lose all knowledge of it. It is clear that they have major IT issues but are cynically sending me round in circles and trying to make me seem the guilty party and making me do all the leg work. 
From reading other complaints, I am not alone. And this is on top of cancelling a recent train and putting me on a different service that required I change at Preston, waiting for over an hour in a tier 3 COVID area and then putting me on a train with no seat reservation in a carriage that didn't look as if it had seen a cleaner in months. It is probably my fault that I am 62, have suffered pneumonia and have been trying to be responsible during this crisis by protecting myself and others.
I think these issues, replicated so often, need to brought to higher level of awareness.

items.title: Appalling experience booking tickets
items.review_text: Appalling experience booking tickets. Attempted to buy tickets for family emergency - purchase progressed 3 times but journey booking not completed and tickets still in basket. Credit cards are showing payments made for all 3 attempts. Never had this poor an experience with Virgin - I need my money back and I'll book my train tickets elsewhere!

items.title: Bring back Virgin
items.review_text: Wanted to book a ticket from Milton Keynes to London Zone 1/2. E-ticket said only MK to Euston. Phoned, promised a call back before 10pm. No call of course and I travel first thing in the morning. Terrible service, the website is a joke. Bring back Virgin - this lot are terrible.

items.title: DO NOT BOOK TRAIN TICKETS ONLINE! I TRIED SIX TIMES WITH NO CONFIRMATION AND THEY DECIDED TO CHARGE ME!!!!!
items.review_text:
I too tried SIX times to book tickets online via Avanti West Coast, only to encounter an error message at the payment stage.

No acknowledgments or tickets were received.

I've just checked my banking details and I have SIX TRANSACTIONS LEAVING MY ACCOUNT WITH NO BOOKING CONFIRMATION!!!!

I NEED MY MONEY BACK ASAP.

I booked my tickets through Trainline instead. This company is an absolute joke.

items.title: The level of service has dropped…
items.review_text:
The level of service has dropped significantly on the London Euston to Glasgow Central Service since Avanti West Coast took over the route from Virgin. 

I have experienced a significant price increase to only find an increase in delays and much dirtier trains.

items.title: Online booking system: 'Known Problem'
items.review_text:
I tried several times to book tickets online via Avanti West Coast, only to encounter an error message at the payment stage. No acknowledgements or tickets were received. 
However, the next working day I received notification from my bank that the transactions I had attempted had appeared in the pending payments in my bank account, and as a result I was overdrawn. As a result, I was unable to use my bank account, and any attempts to use my debit card were declined. 
I spoke to Avanti West Coast on the telephone, who advised me that this was a 'known problem'. However, only Avanti West Coast know about it, and the customer is not informed by Avanti at any stage during the online booking process. Avanti advised me that they would credit the money in 3-5 working days. I spoke to my bank who very kindly credited most of the deductions themselves, so that I could use my account again. All in all a very stressful few hours.  
I eventually booked train tickets in person at Euston station, thereby avoiding the Avanti West Coast online booking system altogether.

items.title: Rude Train Manager by the name Bobby…
items.review_text:
Rude Train Manager by the name Bobby (young, slim, Indian-looking lady, 20’s or early 30’s maybe) with a Bob-hair style, who travels through Wolverhampton and Birmingham early mornings on Thursdays most likely. Shouts across the train platform to check if you have a train ticket ready, assuming you’ll be a passenger on her train, when all you could be is just a passer-by on the platform. I have come across her on numerous train journeys inside the train, conducting ticket checks. Proper jobs-worth but what bothers me is her rudeness and the way she approaches her ticket-check task. Clearly no people-skills in the way she talks and comes across. She shouted across the platform checking if I had a ticket but I ignored her, as I wanted her to get the message that it isn’t ok for her to do that. As I carried on walking to the bench, she shouted again saying excuse me, but being rude and abrupt. 

If Avanti want to save their fast-dropping reputation, they would help themselves a great deal of loss of reputation by sacking this rude job’s worth of a lady who clearly talks down on people. This personal experience of mine isn’t the first time I noticed her being rude. A passenger who sat on the opposite side of the train isle, casually once spoke to me saying she’s rude, so there you go Avanti. Bloody do something about her before I keep escalating and escalating as I don’t tolerate rude people like her getting away.

items.title: Absolutely abysmal
items.review_text: Absolutely abysmal replacement to the Virgin service, pricing has shot up with increase in on-peak and removal of offers for early booking. Train is unclean inside and windows so dirty I thought it was raining. Who made the decision to remove this franchise from Virgin and why are they not being held accountable?

items.title: adding pending payments to peoples bank…
items.review_text:
adding pending payments to peoples bank accounts and not issuing tickets, then saying its ok the pending payment will fall off the bank account in a few day!
No its not ok! shocking service especially when told on the phone they aware of the problem. If aware of the problem why not take the booking element of the site down?

items.title: Broken site, awful service, double charged.
items.review_text:
Broken website charged me twice with no confirmation e-mails. From these review we can see this has been a known problem for over a week.

Called, couldn't get through. Complained on social media, told me to call and they would be able to refund within 1-2 working days and is a problem they are aware of. Managed to get through on phones, was told they can't refund as over £100. Was told they would call me back in one hour after looking into it more as it was a problem they know about. That was 10 hours ago (was reassured on social media someone would get back to me if they said they would) . 

Receive e-mail from a separate complaint ticket saying as if I've had no confirmation of tickets I will receive a refund within 3-5 days. I have no faith that I will receive this in this time after my current experience and not happy being an extra £109 out of pocket while I wait.
Just been told to call and book another ticket while I wait for a refund but I don't have another spare £109 sitting around a few week before Christmas. Shocking train operator.

items.title: Why are there not thousands of complaints…
items.review_text:
Why are there not thousands of complaints?  Avanti West Coast new site does not work - had to re register more than once.  My account has no history of my bookings and so on.  Told to contact another number e-mail address to sort problems.
A complete disgrace.

items.title: If I could give O stars I would!!
items.review_text: If I could give O stars I would!!! What an experience (Still on going too). I wanted to cancel my tickets and requested a refund. Was told to collect my tickets and post them without any mention of registering my post. Avant say they haven't received my mail 'First class' stamp a week ago??! I've been put on calls from one person to another and sent emails with no one bothering to reply. What a sad state of affairs Avanti West Coast.

items.title: Awful customer service from Shireesa
items.review_text: Awful customer service from Shireesa, Jason, And Abbie. Ordered 2 months ago for a ticket in December and was advised they were changing websites. I receive an email to say my train is cancelled so I need to book seats on a different train. I email them (with email given to me) to do this and get passed between 6 different emails all telling me they cannot deal with it or they cannot find my tickets. I have now been told that reservations are not possible until the day (complete lie) however I’ve now booked another ticket on a third party websites and been given a reservation straight away. Worst customer service I’ve ever received and they lie to say this is due to pandemic and they’ve taken over Virgin when clearly it’s just the staffs incompetence (I ordered months after they took over Virgin) DO NOT ORDER FROM THEIR WEBISTE, ALWAYS USE THIRD PARTY WEBSITES

items.title: New website disaster. Head for their old one if you have problems.
items.review_text:
Where do I begin??? Spent ages on their new website. Tried multiple times. Each time says error incomplete, took my payment with no corresponding email/booking reference. Tried online chat...timed out before being connected! Then spoke to an agent on the phone after getting their number from Google,  Agent was polite, but ultimately unable to do anything given the circumstances of bad systems, he couldn't even process via their telephone payment method. And to be fair sounded like a new recruit maybe to deal with current high demand. Read an earlier review here (thank you) - headed for their old website (still working), booked no problem, but doesn't allow you to choose seats. 

New website and payments set up a complete disaster!! Chap I spoke to said my 5 payments totaling £350 will be refunded within 2 days.

Never had any problems with Virgin!!! Please come back (if only to run their bookings!).

An hour and half later... farewell. Happy Christmas!

items.title: Bad new website 02-Dec-2020
items.review_text:
02-Dec-2020. Avanti west coast old website wasn't perfect but it was working fine to get train tickets. Lot of problems with new website: Accounts were not transfered: I had to create a new password to access my account, yet when I managed to log on the old website (which I still had in browser history, and it's still on) I logged in using my old password meaning the accounts were not transfered. between both website they changed the acceptance rules for passwords so lot of people will have the same issue.
The new website crashes everytitime when you reach the step where you chose how to get your ticket (print, digital, post) and doesn't allow you to proceed with ticket purchasing. Also despite warnings saying you need a reservation to travel Liverpool to London it doesn't give you any option to reserve a seat. No way I could get a ticket on the new website, good thing the old one is still on.If you have the same issue with the new website use the old one at:
https://www.
buytickets.avantiwestcoast.co.uk
/buytickets
/advancedsearch.aspx

items.title: Avanti fraud
items.review_text: Avanti took my money. No booking reference given, my account says I have no bookings, no email confirming my tickets and no etickets sent. Downright fraud.

items.title: Easy booking process I booked on Cross…
items.review_text: Easy booking process I booked on Cross country and connected on Avanti New Street to London Euston the service was on time , very safe during these challenging times and excellent service to supersede Virgin trains at at similar fare journey level ,Well Done the Avanti team cheers Shaun .

items.title: Just awful booking process
items.review_text: Just awful booking process. Worst website i've used. So non user friendly. Tells you that your proposed journey has 2 changes but when you click on the 2 changes highlighted you are taken to a new screen which says... 2 changes!!!  Also if you finally find a ticket you want you find out you can't choose your seat - even though I have been choosing my seat for over 10 years with Virgin. Oh if only we could have Virgin back!

items.title: Awful company
items.review_text: Awful company, complicated processes, rude staff, incorrect information given and passed from pillar to post just terrible

items.title: They have my money, I have no tickets
items.review_text:
Took my money but didn't give me a booking reference. they say this is "A known issue", told me to ring a number, who put me on hold, told me to ring another number who put me on hold then told me to ring the first number again. Round and round I went until I was told they couldn't help me.
They have my money. I have no tickets.
They told me to try the website again. I declined.
They can't even get the basics right, don't trust them with your journey

items.title: New website-complicated,No Advance…
items.review_text: New website-complicated,No Advance Fares-Bring back Virgin Trains please!

items.title: Fraud…
