items.review_text: The website took my payment twice but failed to provide me with a booking confirmation - getting hold of anyone  to resolve the problem is impossible - they have committed fraud by taking my money twice and not giving me the tickets - bring back virgin

items.title: The staff are unhelpful
items.review_text: The staff are unhelpful, they seem more interested in talking to their mates than actually helping you. I travel regularly for work between Liverpool and London and this is not just a one off occurrence. I also have noted a distinct lack of the cheaper tickets when booking in advance, which were always available underVirgin. Their ticket machines at both a Liverpool and Euston are regularly not working so you have to go from one machine to another. Frankly I feel they are not up to scratch.

items.title: Seat reservations
items.review_text:
After contacting avanti and getting through to numerous Indian call centres who could not understand my complaint. I was told because I had advance tickets I could not obtain a refund but would have to accept vouchers. Also told I should be grateful because I was not being charged £10 administration fee also the trains were still running. I have now received an email to say my reserved seats are no longer available and to look for seats when I board the train.
Not happy with their customer service.

items.title: We travelled Dec 2019 with Avanti…
items.review_text:
We travelled Dec 2019 with Avanti advance tickets first class return Glasgow/London and the service was attrocious on both journeys. Complained and was offered a 75% reduction off our next journey...which if we’d taken it up was three times more than we paid for the journey we were complaining about! Eventually flew to London at a fraction of the price. The reason for this review after such a delay is because today I decided maybe try out Avanti again thinking surely they must have improved. However I’ve just read the reviews in this site and thank you to all in helping me decide to never use Avanti again ( worst service we ever had, dirty trains, bad food, rude staff) compared to Virgin  whom we used for years. 
A final thought if this is customer service I have concerns over the unseen maintenance and engineering issues with regard to the rolling stock!

items.title: Plug sockets not on
items.review_text: Plug sockets where not on I asked the train manager or who ever it is walking up and down he said twice he would switch them on but did not, needed my battery for working reasons, will not travel with them again

items.title: Worst service ever the train manager…
items.review_text:
Worst service ever the train manager was so rude and happy to hear my issue about not being able to print my tickets  and he then printed off my tickets even Though in his own words I would not be able to use the ticket on the underground to get to my connecting train and complete my journey effectively leaving me stranded 
What made it worse was he was rude and seemed more bothered about him not getting a break earlier as the train was delayed 
He mentioned not getting a break 3/4 times and just said it’s not my problem when I asked what I could do about the rest of my journey. How this guy is a train manager is beyond me as all he seems to care about is his break not looking forward to  being stranded so thanks avanti I will be taking this further
Service was 13:30 fromNew street to Euston on 10/11/20

items.title: terrible customer service
items.review_text: terrible customer service,  manager or supervisor called Turk in london Euston is the most unprofessional supervisor i ever came across , he literally threatened me and stated that if i'm not happy with the service i can wait for him at 12am when he finishes work,  i couldnt believe my ears,  even the security at the station advised me to take further actions against him , he is known to be unprofessional with customers

items.title: Keeping carriages empty and moving people into crowded coaches during COVID?!
items.review_text: Despite current COVID guidelines recommending that we all stay as far away as possible from fellow travellers I was forced to move seats half way through my journey at Preston from a nearly empty coach C into a crowed adjacent coach with no explanation apart from ‘some train managers prefer to keep coach C empty’. How on earth are Avanti West Coast justifying keeping a coach on their trains empty at this time?!

items.title: Daylight robbery
items.review_text: I have just had to change the dates of my return journey  because of Covid and was charged over 50 % of the total cost. Not as bad as the 100% charged to a previous reviewer but still disgusting. The person I dealt with was garbled and difficult to understand. I haven’t actually travelled yet but judging by the comments below I have little to look foreword to.

items.title: Bring Back Virgin!
items.review_text:
Bring Back Virgin!

What an expensive way to travel in a dirty old carriage with no facilities and aggressive staff. I stopped using my car for essential travel to Manchester in favour of a splendid service provided by Virgin Trains but back on the road I'm afraid. The DfT has a lot to answer for by sacking Virgin and putting this bunch of cowboys in!

items.title: An appalling service
items.review_text:
Now here’s a thing
We had booked in the 19.57 from London Euston to Stockport on the 25/10
On the Mir big of the 25/10 our neighbour informed us that unfortunately our house alarm had gone off and it looks like we’ve been burgled
Taking this into account we couldn’t enjoy the stay and decided to switch to the 16.37
At London Euston my partner spoke to an Avanti rep at the ticket office. He told him the rake and the rep said yes you can book a new journey and all you have to do, to get a refund on your original journey is to phone Avanti (not true)
My partner pays a £107 for the me tickets and then phones Avanti to ge told this/
Sorry as you bought your new tickets at the station there is no refund, not acceptable
Let’s roll back, partner at Euston Avanti ticket offie, this is good customer service:
I see you bought these tickets on line, unfortunately I can’t change them for you but I can phone the number for you so we can get it sorted, this is not what happened
So now we have paid twice for tickets from London to Stockport and this can’t be right
Avanti whether on live in the phone or in person are the same company so this is bad customer service 
The trains are empty due to current environment so they should be trying harder not less
You need to put your customer service in order and now

items.title: I write this for the other travellers…
items.review_text: I write this for the other travellers to back them up, what a disgraceful company Avanti are,  Avanti wont read this and will not care a hoot . They have employed and I use the  term loosely 'customer service representatives ' , actually poorly paid people in far off lands with a directive to give the customers absolutely nothing, take you round in circles, waste your life away . It is a third party company I asked the operative would not tell me the name, I asked to speak to the supervisor , busy ...apparently I will wait I said , hes very busy. They are there to save Avanti a fortune in refunds and its working well for them . Bring back Branson/Stagecoach

items.title: Worst customer service EVER
items.review_text: I booked with Avanti as their prices were very cheap in comparison with other major train companies, now I really wish I had just paid the extra money. I had booked to travel somewhere but my trip was cancelled (not by Avanti) so I rung up customer services - who don't have a clue what they're doing, both calls I had were extremely painful. I first asked to get a refund, which wasn't possible but I was offered an amendment which allowed me to change the date and time of my tickets up to 6 months later. I ended the call to check with my partner when he would like to change our trip for and rung back up. I was on the phone for 50 minutes in total, I told the agent the new date I wanted to travel but was told I couldn't book anything later than 6 weeks of todays date. I then asked to book something 6 weeks from today and was told I couldn't as the new price was £1 less than my original. After about 15 minutes we found a date of the exact same price so I asked to change the tickets but I was asked for my bank details to book a new pair, as I would then be refunded my original transaction BUT I would be charged £10 per ticket per person for admin fee which was the price of my tickets! I asked to speak to a manager, the agent went to get one and 10 minutes later said someone would call me back. The day of my travel went and I am no longer entitled to change my tickets. No one has called me back and it's been over a week. Save yourself the hassle and pain and just pay a bit extra with another provider.

items.title: Vile company profiteering from the…
items.review_text:
Vile company profiteering from the pandemic which is resulting thousands of deaths.
Refusing to give refunds or even credit note for journeys that can no longer be taken through no fault of the customer due to government tier lockdowns so basically they say to ignore the advice of government and continue your journey spreading the virus or we will keep your money as you have to provide a new date for travel, how can that be done when we don’t know when the ban will be lifted and their customer service team states these are the rules that they’ve been given by the government, find it hard to believe that the government have told them to profiteer from this ghastly virus but they have no morals or integrity as that’s what they’re doing. As it happens I’ll not be travelling due to the advice of government but I truly hope something is done with this company for using the pandemic for financial gain. Needless to say, I won’t be using these again and I’ll be writing to the ombudsman to make a complaint.

items.title: Took the train from Glasgow to London…
items.review_text:
Took the train from Glasgow to London Euston at 11:37 on a Tuesday in September. Train left on time, arrived 4 minutes after scheduled arrival time. Not a bad 'delay' for a journey over 400 miles.

Due to COVID restrictions, I had a table for 4 to myself. Power worked, wifi worked (although not able to stream) and was next to luggage rack as requested.

It was a very pleasant journey and staff were friendly. Not sure why all the other reviews are so bad. I was in standard class and it was fine. Would definitely travel again.

items.title: COVID-19 not safety
items.review_text: I travelled on the 12.10 from London Euston to Glasgow on 8/10/20. I sat in a reserved seat in coach F. A woman in the same coach, who sat 2 rows behind me in seat 24 was wearing a face mask when she boarded the train, but removed it on sitting in her seat, and continued not to wear any form of face covering or mask for the duration of her journey. Instead the face covering she had been wearing when boarding was blatantly on the table in front of her. I raise the issue with the Train Manager who said he couldn’t do anything about the situation other than make announcements about it wearing face coverings!!! I am very much anti- confrontation, but feel polite face to face reminders may go along way. The Train Manager refused to remind the offender about the legal requirement to wear a face covering!!! Beyond belief!!! What is the point of employing Train Managers if they cannot even try and enforce the law for the safety of all your passengers. Some of your staff appear to choose to have total disregard for current laws and the safety of your passengers. Very worrying in these times. If we all chose to defy the law your company would not be operating. 🤔

items.title: Avoid at all cost.
items.review_text:
Avoid at all cost.
All the 1* reviews that people bothered to produce are real.
I regret that I wasted time to deal with them as well as the Ombudsmen, as it looks like it is the same people.

I have emailed and called Avanti, for 4 months  trying to get the refund (£88) for the unused ticket, which proved impossible.
Then tried to get help from the Rail Ombudsmen, who is probably employed by Avanti!

Although, I had all the evidence required, the replacement ticket,  as well as payment confirmation for both unused and the new ticket my request never finalised.

items.title: Refused to honour their own advice!
items.review_text:
After 3 trains got cancelled, we have been advised to take a taxi and claim the fare to not miss our flight. 

When trying to claim the taxi fare, same customer service that told us to take it, refused to pay stating they are not liable. 

Horrible Customer Service!

items.title: Outdated trains, ridiculous procedures for tickets purchased as a guest
items.review_text:
TL;DR All the gripes you had with Virgin trains are still present. Best to set up an online account first and purchase your tickets through your account. If you purchase as a guest, later changes must be handled by their unbearably inefficient call centre.

Avanti took over Virgin's west coast service. Same old trains that we've had for the last 20 years. Same horrendous prices which, being fair, is true for all UK train companies. 

Same cramped conditions. If you're six foot or taller, you're better off booking in first class; standard class will be hell on your knees unless you get a table seat with no passenger sitting opposite.

If you're in the unfortunate case of having to use their service, I strongly suggest signing up for an online account. It makes things so much easier and quicker to process refunds and amendments to your ticket.

If you purchase a ticket online as a guest, you have to call them. No option online to change things. 

Poorly trained call centre staff, tiresome barrage of information which is better handled by having online. If you're pushed for time (and patience), it's a nightmare. 

Whilst the waiting time in a queue was mercifully short, the call with their operator took 25 minutes. The person I spoke with didn't know the procedure for processing refunds and had to check with a colleague. 

You have to start the booking process again - what carriage do you prefer, what seat facing do you prefer, etc. - and then my operator advised of the procedure in full.

It's unacceptable for a large company to be unable to handle routine transactions (refunds and ticket amendments) online unless: 1. you set up an online account in the first instance; and 2. you book the ticket(s) via your account in the first instance. 

If you buy your ticket as a guest and then need to make changes later on, it's absurd that you have to contact their call centre.

This would be understandable 20 years ago. In 2020, regardless of COVID-19, it's unforgivable.

EDIT: Surprise, surprise. The call centre operator said I'd get the new ticket by email. I didn't.

items.title: Dodgy tactics
items.review_text: Based on their delay and repay compensation scheme .2 single tickets qualified for 100% refund due to 2 hour delay . Submitted form but only 1 refunded . resubmit again but refused . resubmit on 4 occasions all denied .How can 1 ticket qualify but another on same booking be refused .Twitter team great as they confirmed in minutes both tickets should of been refunded and organised a call back .Finally agreed on refund .my point is the delay compensation team had 4 attempts to do a simple ticket check based on screen shot of tickets and receipt and 4 times rejected my claim .can only assume it's a deliberate attempt to make customer's give up .It took me about 2 hours in emails and calls to get the correct outcome which  should of been done in the first instance ...IF YOU QUALIFY FOR COMPENSATION DUE TO DELAY DONT GET FOBBED OFF.

items.title: PENDO GO NYOOOOOOM
items.review_text: Amazing company, no flaws. Had no issues so far!!

items.title: Excellent service and staff were all so polite and welcoming!
items.review_text: We travelled from Wigan to Edinburgh on 28th September 2020 and the service was excellent. The staff were all so polite, especially Tom the train manager who was lovely. He gave us great advice about our little trip to the Scottish capital. Very comfortable, the train left and arrived on time, all social distancing measures were in place, etc. I travel frequently on Virgin to London, but I found Avanti a much more enjoyable experience!

items.title: What is Avanti’s problem with bikes
items.review_text: What is Avanti’s problem with bikes. A really efficient way to travel in this gridlocked country bike/train and Avanti is making it difficult. Any other train try’s to help if possible.

items.title: Booked 2 seats and allocated 2 window…
items.review_text:
Booked 2 seats and allocated 2 window seats at 2 separate tables from Euston to Liverpool.  Arrived to find 2 strangers (from a company of 3 people) on 1 table and the 3rd person plus 1 on the other table, so that social distancing for us was impossible and it went against Avanti' rules on COVID, but the electronic sign said 'vacant'. 
No staff anywhere checking, no yellow bands on seats to motivate social distancing.  Then the 2 people opposite ate throughout the journey but didn't put masks on between bites - a dripping apple that the woman wiped off her hands with the same tissue that she blew her nose on several times and stuffed up her sleeve.  No hand cleaning between times. Yeuk - I wonder how COVID spreads?!!
Also the train arrived 25 minutes late.

items.title: The trains stink
items.review_text: The trains stink. Second time I have travelled in a week and both times the stench has been utterly disgusting even with a facemask on.

items.title: Ticket Prices have doubled!!
items.review_text: I used to travel from London to Glasgow once a month pre-Covid on a Thursday night to a Sunday morning for work on a Friday in London and then a weekend stay in London. Return ticket costs have doubled for the journey, particularly for the Sunday morning (8.47am) return to Glasgow. Every time I booked with Virgin (and initially with Avanti) I used to be able to book a Thursday evening train down for probably £33 and then the return to Glasgow for Sunday morning for £33-£45. However now the ticket back to Glasgow every month on a Sunday morning that I look for is £105, this is the slower 5hr 18 mins service. No sign of an advance ticket at all no matter how early or late I look to book my tickets. Now I travel home on Sunday with LNER to Edinburgh and get Scot Rail from Edinburgh to Glasgow. Not much difference in travel time and I get to stretch my legs at Edinburgh before I jump on Scot Rail trip. Ticket is still half the price of Avanti and that is for an LNER and a Scot Rail ticket. What is going on Avanti as there is no logic to this nearly triple increase in price for an early Sunday morning train. You have lost me as a customer as the LNER trains are nicer, better view out the window on East Coast and still get home to Glasgow at the same time. I will only travel with you now on the late weekday services down to London as that seems to be the only services you still have maintained a reasonable price.

items.title: Pre Covid
items.review_text:
Pre Covid - Carriages in a state of disrepair. No Staff present, late often. when they took over 80% of my ticket fairs were refunded through delay repay. The repay system, was also terrible.

Post-covid I don't understand why they still exist. Makes travelling by rail for business impossible. Drive up and down the country, cycle, scooter or do anything to avoid the absolute joke of a company.

It's not suprising that they run this way. Avanti hired the same senior management from Virgin. Its all apps, advertisement and no investment in actual services and trains. 

Avanti West Coast are the new Nothern Rail.

items.title: Horrible horrible company
items.review_text: Horrible horrible company.  First few times with dealing the company no problems but their latest stint has but a bad taste in my mouth.  Basically I was due to travel from London to Liverpool in October for my dad's Birthday.  Liverpool are now going  into lock down due to covid so travelling to Liverpool should be for essential journeys Only.  Now the problem is the outward journey is an advance ticket so under normal circumstance I get it that you can not get a refund but you can change.  These are not normal circumstances as going to liverpool next month would be classed as a none essential journey and I do not know when to rebook as I do not know when liverpool will come out of it.  Tried to explain this in a nice way to Avanti and kindly ask for a refund on this occasion.  Blunt answer NO as it per t and c blah blah.  And according to them they are following the government guide lines when they are not as they as they say I can still go in October but I pointed out I am unable to do so as it is not an essential journey and unable to stay at my mothers house as that would be breaking the law.  Looks like avanti are behind with the law and the Gov advice.  I am upset as it is not seeing my dad for his birthday as he has dementia and do not know how long he has left.  But Avanti do not care about that.  All they care is about Money Money Money.

items.title: Very expensive fares
items.review_text: Very expensive fares. Had to book 6 days in advance to travel to London £50.00 return (2 x off peak advance singles) Off peak return is £54.00. They are supposed to be encouraging people to book in advance and travel off peak but £50.00 is extortionate. In the Virgin Trains days you could always find a cheap train to travel on if you were flexible.

items.title: Great COVID consideration
items.review_text: I am immunocompromised and the staff made a special effort on the 11:23 Euston> Birmingham to find me a quiet seat away from other passengers (who were not all wearing masks). They also gave me wipes to clean the table down and were very reassuring.

items.title: All staff and this company need to go…
items.review_text: All staff and this company need to go into exile and be taken over by the Japanese who are more prone to decent customer service. Its a chav scully franchise with the most unfriendly staff etc etc. Everything about it represents a bus stop full of thugs drinking monster or red Bull

items.title: Robbery company
items.review_text: Got on an Avanti train by mistake (I bought a ticket under another operator), but the staff was extremely rude and forced me to pay for their ticket - I said that I can get off the train at the next station but was refused. The price I was charged was higher than it should be but staff refused to explain and threatened that he can make me pay more. This was a robbery. Worst train company ever.

items.title: Cancelled and delayed trains
items.review_text:
Normally I have no issues with train services but one travelled with Avanti twice now in the past month and both times there’s been an inconvenience. 

The first time I travelled with 2 friends from Tamworth-Crewe (no problem) but as soon as we were on that train, we got an email through saying our train from Crewe-liverpool had been cancelled!! Luckily there was another train 45 minutes later but that’s no excuse! 

Another trip is today that is awful!! The train from Liverpool-Crewe was 20 minutes late!! Which means I’m now missing my train at Crewe and I’ve now got to wait an hour AGAIN! This is very inconvenient for me because my lift at tamworth can no longer pick me up so I’m going to have to get a taxi which means even more money. 

I’m not happy about this at all. Trains should not be 20 minutes late or even cancelled when there’s hardly anyone on the bloody things! Very disappointed

items.title: Didn’t really want to put this on but…
items.review_text: Didn’t really want to put this on but felt I must do , I traveled 1st class from Glasgow central to Euston on Friday afternoon  4th sept last wk left at 12 30pm the first part of the journey i went to use the toilet in the 1st class carriage I waited out side as it was occupied I heard the toilet flush and the waiter who brings along the food trolley came straight out , what I’m getting at I do no for a fact he didn’t wash his hands no sound of any water or hand drying noise which is very noisy in the toilet , I was horrified 😩 wer all sitting on the train with masks on using hand sanitizer and some one dealing with food clearly can’t even wash there hands of course later when he came along with his trolley we said pass ☹️

items.title: Overpriced, Inconvinient.
items.review_text:
Virgin was far from perfect, Avanti is somehow worse.

I have to make a trip from Milton Keynes to Chester & back once a month. Previously on Virgin, I could book a direct return for around £40-45, which isn’t awful. Expensive, but not terribly so.

However, Avanti have decided to run fewer services, and also break their trains up, so my journey now consists of an Avanti service to Crewe, a 30 minute layover, and then either a Trains for Wales service (rarely) or a replacement bus (1hr) from Crewe to Chester. This brings my journey from Virgin’s 1hr30m at £40-45, to Avanti’s 3hr20m journey with the pleasant and unpredictable price range of anywhere between £55-100.

Train fares follow the GDP inflation rate, and as of this year went up 2%. What do Avanti have to show for it? A slow, broken up and unreliable experience which profiteers off of a privatised monopoly.

You might as well drive for the amount of time and cost of fuel, rather than use the train. Flights between Luton & Manchester international are also a cost-friendly option.

items.title: Rude and obnoxious staff
items.review_text: Just got on a train from Euston to Birmingham. Such rude and unhelpful member of Avanti staff. Absolute joke that they provide any kind of customer service.

items.title: Scope to improve; but not as bad as reviews here suggest
items.review_text:
Travelled 1st class return between London and Manchester in September 2020. 

I've made this trip previously with Virgin and, initially, was so alarmed by Avanti's increased prices that I started looking at flights. Booking via Trainline turned up slightly better value tickets, costing £126 two weeks in advance.

Despite the high prices and virtually empty trains, service is much diminished due to Covid 19 restrictions. While staff were, on the whole, pleasant and helpful, the food and refreshments expected in first class were either absent to not up to standard. My cooked breakfast, for instance, was stuffed clumsily into a small cardboard box, a centimetre deep in liquid. 

Most other meals are reduced to pre-packed snacks, and staff seem reluctant to make more than one attempt to offer refreshments. Given that on my trip (before 9 a.m. on a weekday) there were only four passengers in the entirety of first class, I have to assume that staff spent much of the two hour journey at rest.

While allowances must be made for current extraordinary circumstances, it is difficult to excuse a company that appears to want to charge more for less, or to excuse such indifferent service.

items.title: Don't Trust the Food Cart
items.review_text:
I used to travel from London to Glasgow regularly, I wondered why the price seems to have doubled. Seems the trains have been taken over by Avanti.

I miss Virgin trains.

The wifi on Avanti is so slow that I can barely get a webpage to load, the plug  points are only partly functioning, and the food carriage was sold out of every single sandwich 10 minutes after they left London and they don't restock.

How prices can increase while service is worse is beyond me. I'll be flying from now on, which is a shame because when Virgin were in control I used to love train journeys.

Can't wait to go into Glasgow so I can eat something. I'm so hungry my stomach is cramping.

items.title: Beyond a joke
items.review_text: £95 for an off-peak return from London to Manchester? You guys must be having a laugh? That is criminally expensive. How can people be expected to use public transport more frequently, when it's run by corporate scum who take every opportunity to rob you blind? What an utter shambles the rail industry has become.

items.title: Exorbitant prices
items.review_text: I was a regular traveller for work when Virgin ran the service and could book off peak first class seats for about £120 return.  Similar tickets now are over £400?  Ticket prices have gone up exorbitantly since this company took over. How can this be allowed to happen?

items.title: Truly atrocious
items.review_text:
Truly atrocious. I mean truly atrocious. I have been travelling regularly (4 times a month) up and down the West Coast mainline between Liverpool and London since the late 1990's, so I would like to think I am in a position to offer informed feedback.
Firstly, the OBSCENE PRICE INCREASES this company has implemented since taking over are a DISGRACE. I could regularly book Virgin return tickets in advance for less than £60 if travelling off peak. The cheapest this thieving corporate outfit offer is over £90. And that's booking over two months in advance.
Secondly, I don't know what training they have given to their staff, but I have never come across such RUDE and damn right HOSTILE staff as what this outfit has working for them, I think they would prefer to travel with no passengers.
Thirdly, NOTHING HAS IMPROVED SINCE AVANTI TOOK OVER, IT'S A LOT WORSE. The same repugnant smell in certain carriages!!!!!!
I, with regret moaned a little about Virgin Trains in the past, but after experiencing ten journeys with Avanti, Virgin Trains were miles better, at least the average person could afford to travel on them.
It is a scandal that people who have to travel to and from London on a regular basis are being HELD TO RANSOM, and having to endure WORSENING STANDARDS in the process.
£90 for a return journey that could be bought for less than £60 under the previous franchise is an outright SCANDAL!!!!!!!!!
I STRONGLY advise people to find alternative transport if you are able to, whether that be car, plane or bus. 
However if you are ok with being RIPPED OFF, treated with contempt on a train that regularly smells of rotten eggs, or have no other option then go ahead and book your tickets with Avanti West Coast, CORPORATE THIEVING OUTFIT.
Is it really too much to ask for a train service priced reasonably with good offers for advanced off peak booking, with carriages that did not smell rancid (especially in the heat), and staff who actually valued their passengers. Is that really too much to expect?
Despite their faults, Virgin were so much better.

items.title: £30 for 2 return tickets from milton…
items.review_text: £30 for 2 return tickets from milton keynes to london, trains ontime and was in london within 35 mins,plenty of seats to choose from 10/10

items.title: Exorbitant pricing.
items.review_text: No understanding from staff having made an honest mistake, boarding with a ticket apparently excluding Avanti services (not obvious on the mobile ticket at all). Charged me an insane price just to get off at the next station.

items.title: Trying to book but fares outrageous
items.review_text: Trying to book but fares outrageous, surely the government should be looking at this, £105.00 for an advance ticket!! LNER have equivalent journey London Edinburgh for half this price. Going to fly now as it is cheaper though not a great fan of planes but will not let myself be mugged by a National railway company. Shame on Avanti!!!!!

items.title: Truly can't stand this company
items.review_text: Truly can't stand this company , blood sucking money grabbing leaches. And there trains always stink like gotten rotten garbage because that's what they are.

items.title: Criminally expensive
items.review_text:
Criminally expensive. You're forcing people to fly when they would far rather take a train.
Virgin service was far more affordable.
A terrible decision to let Avanti run this service.

items.title: SOOO Expensive!!
items.review_text:
SOOO Expensive!!! Shame on you and all your executives. 

It's ridiculous, cheapest ticket in the next 6 months 64 pounds one way from Manchester to London. You deserve bankruptcy as soon as possible and all your owners in jail. Fu, You Avanti. The bus is 2 POUNDS!! 2 ffing pounds. I don't care it takes 2 extra hours the train at anytime is 30 TIMES MORE EXPENSIVE. THIS IS A CALL FOR ALL TO AVOID AVANTI UNTIL THEY GO BANKRUPT. YOU DESERVE NOTHING LESS.

items.title: A regular commuter on this service,
items.review_text:
A regular commuter on this service,
Avanti never fail to offer a consistently poor service! 
I'm used to the late running trains and unkept carriages but it's the rude staff I struggle to get used too.

items.title: Refund problems
items.review_text: We booked tickets in April for a journey from Preston to Manchester Airport but as our holiday was cancelled we could not travel.  Avanti has refused a refund or a credit note to allow us to travel later in the year......Tried to complain but they said they didn't understand why we were complaining....they did say if we had booked the tickets a month earlier (in March)we could have had a refund..terrible customer service please don't book with these scammers!

items.title: Bought tickets in April for a holiday…
items.review_text: Bought tickets in April for a holiday in August...didn’t know at the time whether my holiday would go ahead or not and needed to book tickets to ensure I could get to the airport. I bought advance tickets as they are the cheapest...single parent etc etc and as my holiday is now cancelled I asked for a refund or a credit for me to use when I rebook my holiday only to be told I wasn’t eligible for anything because I bought non refundable tickets. If I had booked in March I would get my money back. I needed to plan ahead in a uncontrollable and unpredictable situation and now I’m out 6 train fares, whilst companies like Avanti are up! Totally unfair.

items.title: Ticket got more expensive
items.review_text: Ticket are ridiculously expensive. Virgin trains were cheaper. Return 2 people Coventry - Birmingham New Street 12 pounds (cheapest), when was 8 pounds with Virgin trains

items.title: I travel to Birmingham regularly and…
items.review_text: I travel to Birmingham regularly and always got tickets at 17 pounds or just over. Now there seems to be hardly any cheaper tickets even though the trains are pretty empty. Ive looked way in advance on the dates I wanted too. Why is it now over 50 pounds return? Guess its back to Chiltern now.

items.title: Terrible hot oven.
items.review_text: Terrible hot oven.

items.title: Terrible
items.review_text: Terrible. Uncomfortable sits, little space, no air con, hot like sauna. Ryanair among the trains. Avoid when You can.

items.title: Travelled first class London to…
items.review_text:
Travelled first class London to Glasgow, 4 people, (me and three children), on 22 July. We were sent an e mail message the evening before announcing that we would not be served any kind of food or refreshments due to COVID. This is to help STOP the spread of the disease. Instead we could walk the full length of the train to coach C to stand in a line and collect complimentary crisps and chocolate from the shop. I wonder how can this be safer than serving anyone at their seat. Its not. I also wonder why I paid the full cost of first class tickets for something that is clearly not first class. While I'm wondering, I wonder why restaurants, cafes and pubs have and had, at that point, reopened and managing to serve food/drinks. At the point of booking the website still advertised the usual service in first class. I would not have booked it otherwise. I raised this during an online discussion with 'Customer Service'. The person there let me know that I was paying for the many other perks - leg room, as far as I could gather. I was with 3 children, leg room is not an issue. Traipsing to the opposite end of the train with 3 children behind you to collect 'complimentary' crisps and chocolate because we've only just been informed the night before an early train that food won't be an option, on such a long journey, most definitely is.
I basically paid well over £100 more for complimentary crisps and chocolate. Avanti, you need to take a look at your ticket price and make adjustments. Its probably worth adding that the online adviser gave me an email address to complain to and request a refund, I asked how likely is it that I will get some kind of refund. He told me that because of the type of ticket I have I will not be given a refund. That's not customer service Avanti, that's just annoying people.

items.title: AVANTI ARE USING COVID TO DEFRAUD…
items.review_text:
AVANTI ARE USING COVID TO DEFRAUD CUSTOMERS!

Paid for first class and was told that there would be no food or drink service for 'safety reasons'. So apparently it is more safe to make customers walk through 6 carriages of people from the top of the train to get a chocolate bar? The 'first-class' toilet had no toilet roll, the train was grubby and staff arrogant. The toilets were vomit-inducing in terms of smells that my partner was actually sick. Why are they charging full whack for first class when the only benefit is a bigger seat and access to a table? They do not have to pay for staff, supplies and or loo roll by the looks of things. There was also no first-class wifi. 

I have been in touch and been given a similar response to the other complaints - 'I regret to inform you that we cannot offer any recompense'....

I am so infuriated that I am actually considering reporting them to the rail ombudsman as communicating with them is like trying to get blood through a stone. I would encourage others who feel defrauded to do the same.

items.title: Seriously went downhill from Virgin
items.review_text: Seriously went downhill from Virgin. 1. Trains are much more expensive. 2.Customer service is absolutely appalling, it comes across that staff do not know what good customer service is. Not worth the price!!

items.title: I paid to travel 1st Class to…
items.review_text:
I paid to travel 1st Class to Birmingham and back on the 31/07/20. The service was appalling. No announcements regarding no drinks served to table or that complimentary drinks were available in coach C. This being on the hottest day of the year so far. There was no air conditioning in carriage J where my ticket was booked for or in the next carriage K. It was stifling and unbearable to say the least and the temperature was in excess of +30 degrees. Again no announcement about the problem. Delayed by over 20 minutes as well with no apology. I travel to Birmingham a lot and never had these issues when Virgin were operating the service. I received a derisory response from them fobbing me off. AVOID THESE COWBOYS AT ALL COSTS.

Firstly, I am sorry to hear of the delay you experienced when travelling from Birmingham New Street to London Euston. I wanted to let you know that you may be eligible for Delay Repay compensation if you were delayed by 15 minutes or more. To submit a claim for this, just head here.
We won't be able to consider any Delay Repay compensation from here in the Customer Resolutions Centre, as claims can only be processed by our dedicated Delay Repay team at the above link. But of course we are here to help with your other comments or concerns.
Please note, Delay Repay claims must be submitted within 28 days of the affected journey and the quickest way to receive any compensation you may be due is by completing the form as above.
I'm sorry to hear there were problems with the air conditioning during your journey. I understand this must've been uncomfortable.
There is equipment onboard to monitor and regulate air temperature. When faults occur, the Train Manager will always do what they can to make the journey comfortable for everyone onboard.
We'll pass on your comments to the Customer Experience Manager for your route. I have checked our records for services running that day and I cannot locate a report of a fault with the air conditioning on the service that you had travelled on so I will also report the air conditioning problem to our Fleet teams to get it fixed. They look after the maintenance of all our trains.
I understand that you are also unhappy at the lack of a catering service onboard. As a response to Covid-19 we have temporarily suspended our at seat service to minimise possible spread of the virus, and this information is available on our website for information before travel. Whilst catering services are suspended, I can see you did enjoy the other perks of First Class travel such as extended legroom, a table at your seat and power sockets at ever seat. On the basis of this, on this occasion we cannot offer a refund as a response to your complaint. I do apologise for any disappointment caused.
Thanks for getting in touch again. I appreciate that my response may not have been the one that you were hoping for, but I hope that my email has explained our position.

items.title: Impossible to book first class tickets…
items.review_text: Impossible to book first class tickets a month in advance. Even when booked for a near date, cop-out clause saying trains may be cancelled or changed. Also said first class passengers would have to queue for refreshments in cafe carriage. Wrote to them to say am severely disabled and can’t stand for more than a few seconds so can’t queue. Received glib reply four days later which basically said ‘can’t do anything about it, ask for help.’ Thanks for nothing.

items.title: They simply do not care
items.review_text:
If it would be possible to offer NO stars I would!
The service is diabolical.
The government imposed a 14 day isolation period requirement for people travelling from Spain and as such, seeing as I was travelling from Spain, I was unable to travel.
I cancelled my flights, hire car and hotel without any hassle at all. Then I made every effort to obtain a refund to my train ticket. It is absolutely impossible a) to get a refund and b) to speak to anyone other than in an offshore call centre on live chat... who simply are no use at all.

Their telephone lines are not operating 'due to covid' yet everyone should return to work.

The emails and booking information refer me to 'my account' where my refund can be processed, yet it does not work and does not allow a refund.

The live chat simply give stock answers and are not taking into account Covid.

I do not sign up to social media but I think I will to provoke a response from this uncaring organisation as well as reporting to the rail ombudsman. I would urge others to do the same

items.title: Agressive
items.review_text: Agressive, deliberately unhelpful,  and rude counter staff at euston. Never again.

items.title: Rude staff
items.review_text: Rude staff, who are unhelpful and if they can make it possible for you to not board their train they will. Next time I’ll just walk from Lichfield to London. Would be quicker, nicer and with less aggro than having to deal with their train hosts..... AVOID AVOID AVOID

items.title: Defrauded by Avanti
items.review_text: I purchased a first class ticket and the only refreshments offered by Avanti were water. Friday is a weekday service and alcohol and food are supposed to be included in the price of the ticket. I feel that Avanti are using the covid situation to exploit customers, disgusting.

items.title: AVOID AT ALL COSTS
items.review_text:
I came back from south Africa on the day of lockdown. I had tickets booked for london in April which were refunded. Excellent. To support Avanti i booked my partners 40th birthday train tickets to London. Unfortunately everything started to cancel. Concerts, theatre, hotels and restaurants. 
All avanti could do is hide behind terms and conditions. Good job my NHS partner didnt stick to terms and conditions at her place of work. 
Worst customer service i have ever dealt with. NO REFUND!!!

items.title: Thankyou for refunding my tickets for 3…
items.review_text: Thankyou for refunding my tickets for 3 of us to London which was for a weekend break. I did not want to travel in July due to Covid but even though the government allowed travel you still gave a refund. Amazing service I will definitely rebook with you.

items.title: I used to travel from Wigan to London…
items.review_text: I used to travel from Wigan to London and it has cost me £60-£70.....now its £97 cheapest......disgusting.

items.title: Used to travel with Virgin all the time…
items.review_text: Used to travel with Virgin all the time to visit my daughter could book a first class ticket in advance for about £60   As I am a pensioner this was great for me. Now even with a rail card it is £244 enough to stop my visits. They say I can book  12 weeks in advanced Or 24 weeks for weekday but the prices are still the same. PLEASE BRING VIRGIN BACK.

items.title: No checks Covid fest
items.review_text:
On the train 03 July, during covid-19 where rules are meant to be upheld.

No one is checking that the rules are being met. 

Someone has been placed right infront of me reserved. 

Why is no one checking I've asked them to move and they refuse. 

But there is no one to complain to. 

If you want to catch covid then go ahead and take it.

items.title: Having previously written a bad review
items.review_text:
Having previously written a bad review 

Booked same journey in first class this morning for only £10 more return

Excellent experience- no stampede - less irate passengers- passengers all adhering to social distancing 

Now will always book first class 

Excellent experience on behalf of Avanti west coast

items.title: Avanti Website: same household can  sit together.
items.review_text:
Hi.  The Avanti  website  makes it clear that people from the same household  can  sit together. A member of staff  at the local  station  said  it would be a good thing,  to  save space. So,  when attempting  to  reserve  two  seats,  next to  each other (the other person  has to  sit with me for medical reasons)  I  was told:
1.    We cannot  do  that  -  despite  what the website says.   Then, I  provided  written  evidence:  that was ignored.   I  have to  say that the two  female  staff members  were  wonderful,  but  couldn't resolve the situation;  the  male  member  of staff  was  quite rude.  He  was caught  out  when I  showed him  what the website  said  -  no  apology  from him,  after his  disgruntled response.  
2.    I  was told  I needed to  be under two  weeks before  the date of travel  -  we are  under  two  weeks  easily.  I  pointed out the  obvious x3  -  I was ignored.   
3.    The  reservation  of the seats  is apparently  essential,  yet  I  have spent two  days on this.  Nothing.  I  sent an  email  to the  Avanti  support team,  as a matter of urgency.  No  proper  reply  -  just  an acknowledgement.  No  action.  No  resolution.   
 
The trip  is put at risk  -  losing them  over  £200  at least.   They can't use  Covid-19  as an  excuse:  it's a basic transaction  -   not  remotely  difficult  to  set  up.  So  much for 'high-tech  blah  blah...
Not happy.

items.title: My first journey with Avanti was the…
items.review_text:
My first journey with Avanti was the last one I will make with that outfit. I'd have given it no stars at all but that didn't work to write the review. A comedy of errors, e.g.
"Sorry (again) about the delay, we're just waiting to see if we have a driver". This train (London bound) will terminate at Preston. Ongoing passengers please leave the train and another one will arrive for you... passengers leave the train, then - "Sorry, that train is now cancelled. Nil stars

items.title: Very bad customer service
items.review_text: I made a mistake on the ticket, called customer service they said they don’t give help on the phone I should go to the ticket office at the station. I went to the ticket office and met a lady by the name Debbie at Euston Station, she was very unhelpful and rude, she didn’t want to hear my problem and showed me a very bad attitude

items.title: Price jump
items.review_text: Does anyone else find the ticket prices are twice the amount of what Virgin used to offer? And for a poorer service. I thought the idea was to double the frequency of services, not the price. Plus if I try to reserve a seat online half the time it will say 'reservation not possible'.

items.title: Absolutely awful customer service
items.review_text: Absolutely awful customer service! They are an embarrassment to the industry as a whole. The team is rude and does not care, simply passing you round in circles from pillar to post. This pandemic is showing the company's true colours, and I hope this one loses their franchise and DfT continue to run it for the future. An absolute disgrace! Avoid at all costs!

items.title: Avanti refusing to refund cancelled tickets
items.review_text: Just got an email from Avanti West Coast saying they will not refund my ticket for a cancelled journey to Manchester. I was directed to their website to proceed with the cancellation, which I did. This was on the 25 March, when everything was being cancelled due to Covid-19 and customer services were overwhelmed with claims. There was no phone support and their website pleaded costumers to cancel online and only contact them in emergencies. I did so, I waited for almost 2 months for the refund, and now I emailed them. They are now saying that the refund period (30 days) has expired and that I should have emailed them before. It seems that their website could not cope with the amount of cancellations that were being processed that week, and mine did not register. Back then they asked for clients understanding and flexibility, not they are pointing at their T&Cs. Shame on them!

items.title: Avanti Customer Service Is Appalling.
items.review_text: On the 23rd March 2020 the Government announced steps to help Rail Companies during coronavirus outbreak.  The Governments Emergency Measures Agreement with the Rail Companies included measures to provide fee-free refunds on all advanced tickets.  This means the tax payer is footing the bill. I repeatedly attempted to claim my refund on-line, as I have an account with Avanti. The on-line systems would not permit me to claim.  I wrote to the CEO as the customer service is based overseas and the operators have poor English. Eventually, I received an email from Avanti confirming they owe me £143.80 and requested payment details.  Then they change their mind, I need to send a photograph of the tickets, before they pay me. I send a photograph to Avanti but it was not good enough, so for clarity I sent a pdf copy to the CEO and heard nothing. I am not surprised, because it is the same CEO and Customer Service Operators that worked for Virgin West Coast which was not very impressive or efficient.  Avanti have failed to comply with their complaints procedure by failing to contact me. Don't blame COVID-19 for your failings

items.title: good company to deal with
items.review_text: good company to deal with , simple and easy

items.title: BRING VIRGIN BACK PLEASE!!!
items.review_text:
BRING VIRGIN BACK PLEASE!!!! Travelled from London to Liverpool and back again same day prior to lockdown. 
On the journey back my colleague and I’s train was delayed by 2 hours and 15mins. I followed the refund process and got a knock back three weeks later telling me the tickets I sent were not valid 🤬🤬🤬, when I had time I wrote back to them with the same tickets sent previously and I was told my application time had elapsed so no refund. I tell you what, this is the second time this has happened and Avanti won’t be walking away with this Scott free. I am putting it through the small claims court. Dealing with Virgin was far more straightforward and honest.

items.title: I am travelling on the train from…
items.review_text:
I am travelling on the train from Glasgow to London - I am a key worker and have been working for 48 hours .  
On my second trip to the coffee shop on board the member of staff named Aaron told me to get out the shop and he didn’t want me anywhere near him while he made my coffee - I am utterly gob snacked that you employ such rude people . 
Now I have to sit until my journey ends with no water .  

This behaviour is utterly disgusting .

items.title: Much more expensive than Virgin
items.review_text: I have been travelling from London to the North West for years using Virgin trains. With an advanced booking, I could get a service that took around 2 hours for about £15~£20. Since Avanti have take over the same tickets are now £65-£130!!! This is just greed and they should have the contract taken off them. Bring back Virgin!

items.title: Should never have changed from Virgin Trains
items.review_text:
I am absolutely shocked! Ever since First Trainitalia took over the west coast Virgin Trains, the timekeeping has been absolutely herrendous. They are at least 20 minutes behind on every service. When the trains arrived they were packed dangerously with people and it certainly was not worth £9.50 return that my dad paid for me to go to Birmingham 5 days of the week
I will much rather travel with LNWR next time because they know what they are doing 
Avanti should go bust because they seriously cannot compromise customer safety like my experience

items.title: Very understanding
items.review_text: Not been able to travel on one of their trains yet because of the situation we found ourselves in but did have two trips to London brought and paid for.  They were advance non-refundable tickets so felt I was just out of luck.  However, contacted the company when restrictions were first put in place, realising I’d have to be patient, and have now received full refunds for both trips.  Can’t say fairer than that and am really grateful for the concession the company has made in these exceptional circumstances.  Stay safe!

items.title: Was late 8 hours, workers can not give the right info snout the service.
items.review_text:
Was late 8 hours,bad service rude workers, the company send  me email tell me the payment was send to my via cheque never show up in my post box + the company don't have customer care live chat don't work well I could go on and on. BAD is the word for.

AWC-0991-091-128 Approved claim .

items.title: My journey to London on March 10th was…
items.review_text:
My journey to London on March 10th was delayed for over 4 hours mid journey then cancelled due to  signal failures.  I have so far been refused a refund    But I am in mid second appeal fingers crossed they will see sense and refund my £167 
Looking at the other reviews here I am not surprised given my personal experience. 
Please bring back Virgin!

items.title: I bought advance tickets to Manchester…
items.review_text:
I bought advance tickets to Manchester for travel on 7 April (my wife on 8 April) and returning on 9 April. 

On the Government’s advice I did not travel. My hotel contacted me and advised me that I could have a refund which I did. 

I did not find out until nearly the day I was due to travel (from a friend) that Avanti were also offering refunds for advanced travel. At this time my wife was very unwell and ended up at hospital potentially, but fortunately not, with Covid 19 and I am also dealing with my elderly parents. 

I found time to “speak” to someone online at Avanti who gave me a link to how to get a refund but, despite knowing my dates of travel did not (deliberately it seems) mention that I had to do this that day as I had to do it before a train (which I could have been fined for getting on) had left. 

They refused my refund. I complained and set out the details of my complaint. They replied, deliberately ignoring the points I had made. Again they refused my refund. 

When we are back to normal do not use this company if you have the option. This was effectively a “pretend” offer of refund. Kind

items.title: Slow refund and likes red tape
items.review_text:
Eventually got refund after 4 weeks. Had an argument over email addresses and refused first one as I put the wrong email address on the form (even though it was an online form) Had to resubmit. 

Eventually got refund but very slow

items.title: I wouldn't even give 1 star if the…
items.review_text:
I wouldn't even give 1 star if the option was there. Refusing to give me a refund for a journey I chose not to make following COVID-19 government advice not to travel. They clearly thinking about their own pockets hence giving me rubbish excuse about date passing

UPDATE - I have finally had a reply after constantly chasing to say they have issued me a refund. May have been because I asked for a deadlock letter as the refund response was to that message. I had sent a couple of messages through. Worth asking them for this. If still no joy, take to Railway Ombudsman!

I'm never booking a ticket with them again. Agree with other reviews in that if it was Virgin still operating, wouldn't have had to fight for my refund and confident would have got it without any issues.

items.title: Inequality: Delay Repay
items.review_text:
Have been appealing a refund now since January. I put the exact same details as the person I travelled with who got refunded. Avanti is continuing to argue I shouldn't be refunded. Where is the equality? Never had an issue with Virgin when going through their delay repay process. 

Does this route need to be taken off them?

items.title: Feb 19th traveled Avanti West Coast
items.review_text:
Feb 19th traveled Avanti West Coast, 1st class Wigan to Birmingham and return. Staff shortages outbound and no kitchen car return, meant poor or no food both directions.Train Manager advised customers to complain and gave details how to do so over public address, so I did.

1st response from Avanti - no compensation as we had food - strictly true as we had cheese and biscuits on return journey.

Complained again.
2nd response from Avanti - no compensation as food is 'complimentary' and we enjoyed the use of wider seats.

Complained again (well ranted really) that food is recognised as part of the First Class package. 
3rd response from Avanti - Acknowledged that food is heavily advertised as part of the First Class ticket and offered a refund of the difference between 1st and 2nd class tickets. 

Well done Avanti, but why did it take three complaints and a lot of annoyance to get to this point?
I was very sympathetic to the operating problems that meant you couldn't offer proper food - these things happen, but you need to be more forthcoming with compensation. If it had been offered at first complaint, I would have been delight to have received some travel vouchers for future travel.

Moral don't give up complaining. Don't be fobbed off with first or second response 
.... and Avanti - you've gone from 1 star to 2 stars in my assessment. Now you need to think what you have to do to get to 3 stars!

items.title: Useless!
items.review_text: I would have given no stars if I could!  I have had a reply to my refund request and have been told that without a booking ref. he was not able to locate my booking even though I had given him all the information on the tickets.  I explained that as I had paid for the tickets to be posted to me there was no need to hold onto the email confirmation!  I took a picture of the actual tickets and the credit card receipt and emailed them.  The reply was "can't find the booking now".  Seriously?!  What more do they need?  I've already provided a picture of the actual tickets and the receipt.  I'm not sure what else they need to process a refund.  Hopeless and useless customer service!!!

items.title: I would give no stars if this was…
items.review_text: I would give no stars if this was possible as it’s the worst service I’ve ever had on a train journey and their customer service isn’t fit for purpose . How has this company managed to get the contract to run the west coast service? Bring back Virgin Rail who were efficient and had great customer service. We were delayed on a day return from Manchester to London so by the time we arrived we’d missed half the day . We were told but the train announcer that we were entitled to a refund of a percentage of our fares for both journeys as coming back the metro had finished for the night as the train was so late and we had to get a taxi from Manchester to Bury . We have filled in all the pit paperwork and sent copies of our tickets and they keep replying invalid claim and they aren’t taking any telephone calls and their online chat service isn’t running . I’m contacting my credit card company to do a chargeback . Avanti are a disgrace . Do not use them .

items.title: So dissatisfied with this company
items.review_text: So dissatisfied with this company and their nonexistent customer service. I had planned a trip from the US to London for a year for late March but, of course, it was canceled with the global pandemic! I had bought round trip  First Class train tickets for a day trip from London to Liverpool. I have tried many times with back and forth messages to get a refund or credit ... I started doing so well before the day we were to take the train trip to no avail and my last correspondence with them today said my message was BLOCKED! There was not an option to rebook the tickets as no one knows when it will be safe to travel again and their online calendar does not extend out that far for a possible fall travel date!!! I was able to get credit for everything else I had booked without the difficulty this company has shown. I do hope to be able to reschedule the trip for later in the fall and would still like to be able to go to Liverpool, I just wish there was some other sensible means of getting there from London for a day trip than having to deal with this company! I certainly won’t be foolish enough to buy First Class tickets again!

items.title: They Pretent To Support Stranded Flybe Passengers But Don't Deliver
items.review_text:
I was stranded in Ireland by the Flybe collapse and had to fly with a different airline to Gatwick rather than Manchester. I therefore had to take a train between the two points. So as not to be stranded or pay last minute prices, I booked immediately after the collapse. Avanti, along with other carriers, then came out with a kind offer of free travel for affected passengers for a period. I acknowledge that Avanti allegedly offered this until 11th March however multiple travel websites confirmed they were doing it until either the 12th or 15th. To their credit, railway staff at Gatwick, Victoria and Euston allowed me to board the train for free on the strength of my Flybe confirmation. This was on 12th March, the original date I was meant to fly. Had I not been proactive and booked a ticked in a crisis situation, I would have been allowed to travel on a complimentary basis. Frontline staff were very kind and helpful.

In view of not needing to use the ticket purchased in an emergency situation, I applied to Avanti to refund it as it had not been used or otherwise stamped. They insisted that the gesture had expired on 11th March and refused to offer either a refund or a travel voucher. This was unbelievably narrow minded and confirmed an empty gesture to stranded passengers. I appealed and was again declined and Avanti refused to escalate the matter. I managed to identify the personal e mail address of Philip Whittingham, the Managing Director of Avanti, and I appealed to him for a few to be taken, on compassionate grounds if nothing else. I received a reply from one of Mr Whittingham's staff, declining to help and insisting that the alleged expiration date of the rescue offer was being rigidly enforced, regardless of reputable travel websites stating otherwise. So much for the attempt by Avanti to claim positive publicity by reaching out to stranded passengers.

Unbeknown to Mr Whittingham I am a professional assessor and reviewer in the hospitality and travel industry, as well as being a travel planner to a personal portfolio of clients. I publish widely and advertise on an international level. The closed minded view of Avanti and the Managing Director's Office has resulted in extremely negative feedback and the removal of Avanti from all recommendations. This action will likely cost the company significantly more than the positive consequences of them acting with honour.

items.title: Agree with all other comments.
items.review_text:
Agree with all other comments.
Trainline have an online refund for Advance tickets to credit card as do other train operators - although not all!
Several meetings in London have been cancelled and I am out of pocket by several hundred pounds.
Pointless offering to waive the "admin fee" to change date of travel when I have no idea when I will be able to travel again.
At least they could offer a credit voucher in the crisis to show good will.
BRING BACK VIRGIN!!

items.title: Refund policy abomination!
items.review_text: arrived with a none existing clear customer service. I booked a train last month and as I was not be able to make it I wrote to them to ask them for a refund as the ticket was not going to be used. No refund and no answer whatsoever. What sort of refund policy is this? What a joke! After they asked me in a contact form to provide every detail in the book, almost two months and no answer from them. This is beyond disgusting for a replacement train company that by the looks of it is going to be even worse than its precedessor. Dont use them! and specially dont wait for either a reply from them or a full refund. It seems they too charge a stupid administration fee to deal with your refund. They are to blame but whoever allowed this disgrace is even more to blame. Trading standards and Which? should investigate this. Train companies cannot be allowed not to issue a full refund for ticket which are cancelled way in advance fom the departure date, NOT MATTER WHAT!

items.title: No refund from Avanti amidst a pendemic??!!
items.review_text: Appalled to find out that we won't be able to get a refund for our tickets from Manchester to London because they are single tickets each way! It is shameful that amidst the current crisis Avanti is behaving like this and hope that the operator will be penalised - actually nationalised should be the best option.

items.title: Avanti West Coast
items.review_text: No customer service whatsoever I had bought a Virgin advance ticket .got no help at new street face to face before lockdown, no phone lines open for customers service and only advice on Twitter use our website witch is as useful as a chocolate tea pot as I have a VIRGIN ticket.

items.title: Abysmal customer service during the…
items.review_text: Abysmal customer service during the Pandemic. Owed money and yet they will not alter their website tools to enable online refunds of Advance Tickets. Creating hurdles to hold onto money we are now entitled to. I will think twice before booking First Class tickets with them again.

items.title: Avanti West Coast Refund Policy
items.review_text:
Echo the sentiments of other reviewers and very disappointed that Avanti won’t refund my advance tickets.
How can I rebook in the present climate and why would I pay the increased prices. You have to pay upfront and then send your tickets to Avanti to get your refund.
Should be mass protest against this clear discrimination to advance ticket purchasers.

items.title: I hate avanti west coast
items.review_text: I think its a bit 70s and is ugly the virgin train where  super stars but at least it takes you around the west coast main line congrats to virgin train serving for 22 years good luck to be back in bussnies virgin team should be proud well done to all of you enjoy your 2020 and be carful  about the coronavirus good luck

items.title: Irresponsible scumbags
items.review_text: Avanti have been a disaster and the franchise should be stripped from them immediately. I travel a lot by train and have never once been on an Avanti service that has been on time. Their refusal to refund advance tickets at a time of international crisis because of Coronavirus is utterly inexcusable. Complain to the Rail ombudsman and demand they lose their franchise. Thieving irresponsible scumbags is the only way I can describe Avanti trains.

items.title: Profiteering on the back of the Coronavirus outbreak
items.review_text:
If it was possible to award 'zero stars' to this company I would. This is an organisation who, despite government advice against non-essential travel, coupled together with the cancellation of all shows, concerts, conferences and exhibitions due to Coronavirus, REFUSE to temporarily amend their terms and conditions regarding refunds on Advanced tickets. 

Instead, they are forcing customers like myself to either lose their money or re-book a journey for a future date, thus forcing you to pay any difference in ticket prices. Most people don't want to travel on an alternative date, or if they do, have no idea whether government restrictions will allow them to at this moment in time.

However, they refuse to budge on this and the responses I have seen on Twitter from their customer service team are simply  unhelpful and verging on rudeness in many cases.

Many other companies, for example Premier inn, LNER and Hilton are temporarily relaxing their T&Cs to allow refunds or credit vouchers on normally non refundable bookings. This is the honourable thing to do and will be respected by their customers in the coming year or so as things return to normal.

Avanti should simply hang their head in shame at making money out of customers in these times of exceptional circumstances. Customers have good memories and I suspect this refusal to move on their position will cost them dearly in the future. 

I now have to decide whether to pay more to book tickets for an unwanted journey or simply lose my money completely through no fault of my own. As someone on a low-ish income who is classed as a key worker in this current outbreak, it sickens me to the stomach.

items.title: No refund
items.review_text: We are told not to travel unless necessary yet Avanti won't refund an return advance train ticket to London just offer a change  of date. What is the point of that when I don't know when I will ever be able to travel to London again at the moment  and when I look at alternative dated additional charges are incurred . Robbery - come back Mr Branson !! just going to loss my money

items.title: Very bad website
items.review_text: Very bad website; very bad in dealing and very bad service.

items.title: I would give 0 stars if possible
items.review_text: I would give 0 stars if possible. Horrible service, staff are rude, refusing to give refunds when people are unable to travel. Had problems with them since they took over Virgin Trains and I’m a frequent user of their service, will be taking the national express coach in future - would rather the 6 hour journey than give them any more money!

items.title: Can only repeat other reviews
items.review_text: Refusing me a refund on an advanced ticket for 2 weeks time despite what's going on.  Banks and shops can all make an exception.  Not this company.  They're a disgrace.   Won't be booking tickets with them again.

items.title: Appalling Attitude To Refunds In Coronavirus Times
items.review_text:
Their refusal to refund or credit advance tickets in the current Coronavirus situation is scandalous. 

The government are saying only essential travel is allowed yet Avanti take it upon themselves to be above the law.

They have waived admin fees but you have to book and pay again before getting a refund. When people say they have no idea when they will be able to travel their “copy and paste” reply is keep booking,pay again and refund until you know when you can travel. It’s a joke.

Their twitter feed is just like Groundhog Day with hundreds of complaints daily about their atrocious approach to the refund situation followed by “Copy and Paste” replies of their procedures.

Surely someone at Avanti will eventually take notice.

I have contacted my local MP. Suggest everyone does.

Since they took over the seat reservation system is a joke. Groups including children randomly allocated in the Quiet carriage. It is impossible to get the seat you want without the aggravation of trying to contact them.

I would never use them out of choice but they have the monopoly on fast west coast trains.

items.title: Extremely disappointed with this…covid 19 no refunds
items.review_text: Extremely disappointed with this company in light of Covid 19. As advised against unnecessary travel by the government on the 16th March I attempted to contact via trl and customer chat to no avail to cancel travel to Glasgow as my flights gad been cancelled to Poland I eventually srnt an email. Response as it was an advanced ticket was that I could book a further ticket at a later date and they would refund the original and waive the £10 fee but they wanted me to purchase another how unethical this is in such circumstances.

items.title: Terrible unethical response to Corona virus
items.review_text: Refusing to alter their cancellation policy in light of Corona virus situation. Poor service through online chat, social media, call centre, and dark UX on their website which keeps you away from finding the numbers you need.

items.title: Avanti has reduced quality of service
items.review_text:
Being a relatively regular user over the past few years of the London Euston to Glasgow service, I was intrigued to hear that Virgin had lost out to a new service, Avanti, on the new franchise.

However within a few trips with Avanti, I can confidently say that there has been a significant deterioration in both service and value for money. 

I typically travel in 1st class to use the wifi, which somehow seems to have gotten less reliable, and it has become very clear that there have been cost cutting measures. The food service seems to have been reduced to essentially a sandwich, and the few remaining hot options have significantly reduced in quality. I thought perhaps this might have just been a bad journey initially, but after a few repeated experiences, I can say that the food is now poor to inedible. I'd advise bringing your own which somewhat defeats the point of buying a 1st class ticket. It is no longer a premium service.

In terms of onboard service, I'm not sure if it is just training or standards control, but there seems to be less emphasis put on customer care. This was always a highlight of Virgin, their onboard teams were consistently very helpful and went out of their way, even in difficult circumstances, to provide great service. By contrast, onboard staff with Avanti seem uninterested in customers and much less proactive. This has been the case on multiple trips now so I think it is a consistent feature of the Avanti model.

Finally on value for money, alongside the issues mentioned above which seem to suggest cost cutting measures, the prices seem to have dramatically increased partly due to much reduced chance of a potential discount from purchasing in advance. With Virgin, if you were able to plan your trip a few weeks in advance then you were usually able to get a return for £150 or less, often sub £100. With Avanti, you seem to get "On the day" prices, even when looking months in advance. I once paid less with Virgin "on the day" than I did with Avanti 3 weeks ahead of my trip. For the first time in 4 years, I regularly consider flights now when making this journey as I cannot justify the cost to myself with the poor quality service on Avanti trains. 

The best I can hope is that these are teething issues that will be resolved over the length of the contract, however they have the hallmarks of cost cutting measures which does not bode well. Firstgroup has a reputation in Scotland for cost cutting instead of competing on quality and it is a shame to see that extended to this route. The contrast with Virgin could not be more clear and I hope they take customer satisfaction into account in the future when considering the awarding of franchises as often the "cheapest" option comes back to bite you with additional cost down the line. In this case with less people choosing to travel this route due to the operator.

items.title: Firstly I upgraded to First Class on a…
items.review_text:
Firstly I upgraded to First Class on a trip from Wigan to London Euston. I had a designated seat and it was taken. Avanti don't seem to designate seats as Reserved. On the return Journey from London Euston to Liverpool the first class was full of very foul mouthed supporters coming back from a match in London. Unfortunately the train manager did nothing. I lodged a complaint with somebody else at the end of the journey and emailed in to Avanti and received a response just under a month later. They were telling me that they had provided a meal and drinks (Well they didn't actually because the coffee machine was broken) and that they hadn't received any complaints. Well they did!!
I shall NEVER travel with Avanti again. Virgin would have offered some recompense.
I WILL TRAVEL NEXT TIME WITH WEST MIDLAND RAILWAYS- Great service- highly recommended

items.title: Jason Thomas at Birmingham International
items.review_text: I'd just like to thank Jason Thomas at Birmingham International station , absolute hero . Left my laptop on the train , didn't realise until train had passed the next station , so winging it's way to Euston ::(. Went into complete melt down . He took ownership , kept me informed and managed to get hold of somebody on the train to try and find it . When they did he arranged for them to bring it back to International, and looked after it  so I could pick up later . He was cheerful throughout and really put me at ease. The relief was immense. Really does deserve some employee recognition . Restored my faith in our railway network which hasn't always been easy over the last year or so. Thank you Jason and hope you see this !!

items.title: Just put in a claim for a missed…
items.review_text: Just put in a claim for a missed connection, they email back saying I was only one minute late, this is despite my own personal lived experience of actually having arrived one hour and fifteen minutes late, their staff, it would appear, are incapable of reading a train timetable and seeing where a missed connection resulted. I have yet to travel on an avanti train that was on time, no doubt their onboard staff will give out commemorative badges to mark the occasion.

items.title: Joke company bring back VIRGIN
items.review_text:
Had train cancelled at Stockport on 9th March at 11:23.Told to get 11:43 not a problem,arrived at macclesfield .Train not going because of overhead cable set on fire near Stoke.Taken to Wilmslow on bus,Train waiting in station all ok arrived Euston at 15:35 instead of 13:23.2 
2Tickets purchased as return ticket next day.Total cost £73.90.Had an email from Avanti for delay repay for £19.80 only one ticket ,tried to ring passed from pillar to post .No sign of this refund. The return was even worse,just received a reply for payment of £17.15 again only 1 ticket.

items.title: 07-03-2020 Cancelled trains to London…
items.review_text: 07-03-2020 Cancelled trains to London from Preston and I am being told my journey to London would be refunded but not my return trip...What a Joke.

items.title: non-existent customer service
