items.review_text: non-existent customer service - they have no common sense when it comes at adjusting T&Cs during a global pandemic.

items.title: Customer Service is very poor
items.review_text: Customer Service is very poor - having been delayed Avanti confirmed I was entitled to delay repay. I have been waiting 2 months for the money which they say they had to post to me as they were unable to provide electronically. Having chased this up numerous times, they struggled to understand my issue. I told me to wait for 28days then recontact them. I did that and they said sorry we will reissue the check please wait 28days for it. I have asked for my file and a deadlock letter but they simply ignore the request and say my complaint has been escalated.

items.title: Much more expensive than virgin trains.
items.review_text: Much more expensive than virgin trains. Richard Branson please come back.

items.title: Horrendous...
items.review_text: Horrendous.... ZERO stars, the fares have gone through the roof, for the 1st time in over 7 years I have gone by car to London, I understand a small increase, but fares that have gone from on average of £110 return to £277 return is ludicrous. I travelled 1st Class twice in last 4 weeks and both times the service has gone down the pan. not the staff fault, although they all see negative and unhelpful, but the lack of food and service is just totally unacceptable.

items.title: Julie deserves a big thank you
items.review_text:
After getting turfed off the Caledonian Sleeper at Wigan (on 13th March 2020, around 0800) due to the train braking down (see my other review), Avanti took us on to our destination. I am giving them 5 stars only because of Julie in the catering coach gave me and my wife a free cuppa.

The train manager however; I think she was having a bad day!

items.title: On the 6th of march I was in hospital…
items.review_text:
On the 6th of march I was in hospital having surgery.  Nothing overly serious but incredibly painful.  After the surgery I had a first class seat booked on avanti westcoast from euston to birmingham newstreet at 20:03.  As the train approaches rugby were are turfed of the train with no info and abandoned.

I totally understand that things happen that are beyond the control of the train operating company but this is what they delay repay scheme os for right?? 

Well Avanti rejected my application saying that the ticket I submitted wasnt valid for the journey I was on. 

The  you try appealing..  good luck with the computer system.  So I call them but they never answer and after 13 mins they just cut you off 

I think I'll contact network rail and see if they can help but honestly I'd rather drive to london from birmingham as it's less stress and probably cheaper.

An awful customer service and an extremely dishonest train operating company.

items.title: Appalling behaviour
items.review_text: Appalling behaviour. We have an advance ticket from Euston to Manchester. The event we should have been attending in London was cancelled due to Covid 19. We requested some flexibility in our train ticket and asked to board the earlier train if there was availability. Was told they would not charge the £5 admin fee but would charge in excess of £200 to change tickets. In a unique time for the country, not offering flexibility, only if there was availability on an earlier train, is shocking behaviour. I’m sure Virgin and Richard Branson would have been flexible.

items.title: Had bad train journey 2 weeks ago from…
items.review_text: Had bad train journey 2 weeks ago from euston to Coventry in first class no.hot drink offered reduced staff dirty toilets not worth ticket price travelled again with them yesterday Coventry to Birmingham in first class much better offered hot drink and food staff very friendly much improved no complaints

items.title: Absolutely shocking
items.review_text: Absolutely shocking! Waited for an advisor for 30 minutes to be booted off the system. Waited on hold for 10 minutes to come through to a blank call with no one on the other end, waited for another 30 minutes to speak to an advisor who just gave me a link to another online chat and now waiting in that queue. Complete waste of time!!!

items.title: One word
items.review_text: One word. Joke

items.title: Manchester to Euston today - I doubt I will use Avanti again.
items.review_text: Manchester to Euston today . Utterly awful !! First class - really !! It was horrible . Got to Crewe and somehow we were put onto the wrong track , sat around for 40 mins and then got reversed into the station to start again. The train manager announcement declared that he had found it really funny that we had to be reversed into the station - Great sense of humour train manager Arun !!! Food just inedible , how can you ruin a cheese toastie to the point of destruction. Thrown at each passenger by a very surly, rude server. Why on earth have Avanti been given this contract over Virgin beggars belief . Please oh please bring back Virgin as these people will never encourage more train travel.

items.title: Constant loud interruptions and…
items.review_text: Constant loud interruptions and announcements over the intercom. Don't get a moment of peace

items.title: No option to pick zero.
items.review_text:
No option to pick zero.
Carriage temperature set to the tropics level why!.
Constant delays since you took over.
Ticket prices rocketed.
Overcrowded
And the toilets have stopped talking.
Bring back Branson

items.title: I had been delayed by 50 mins as the…
items.review_text: I had been delayed by 50 mins as the train was late and missed my connecting train and was stranded in piccadilly station at midnight then I had to pay more then the train ticket to get home with avanti saying no compensation without giving me a reason will not be using this service again customer service is very bad they just want to take your money and give you crap service would never use this joker service again

items.title: Booked first class Stockport to London…
items.review_text: Booked first class Stockport to London as have done many times with Virgin.  Bitterly disappointed with the experience.  Train understaffed and some of the staff very arrogant and unfriendly. Hot and stuffy in the carriage.  Reading through the other reviews on here and it's all the same theme.  Unless something changes this is disaster of a decision.

items.title: And you thought Virgin were poor
items.review_text:
And you thought Virgin were poor, just wait until you try this lot. Where do I start? Trains cancelled without notice, ( come on it's really not difficult if you have the app now is it?)
Crazy fare increases over virgin.
Continually late trains (now you know it takes you more than 2hrs and 5 mins from Manchester to London so why continue to advertise this...late 10 out of 10 times)
Crazy app which is really only half an app suitable for taking money and little else.
Crazy booking system where staff "cannot" sell you that ticket it's only available online (so walk away from the desk and do it on the phone, saves you £80:00!!!!)
Unscheduled stops which make your already delayed train even worse.
Now I travel from Manchester to London every week and have do so for the last 12months and I ever thought I would say bring back Virgin, this crowd cannot even spell customer service!!!!!

items.title: A large proportion of trains delayed
items.review_text:
A large proportion of trains delayed, Avanti do not calculate delay repay correctly.
In addition, you can't even choose the seat to book which virgin allowed. Taking away this feature makes no sense at all.

items.title: Zero stars to be honest.
items.review_text:
Zero stars to be honest.
Decided not to travel for a short break in Edinburgh - we are both in our 60s and trying to act like responsible citizens with all the advice on risk and unnecessary travel due to coronavirus. The hotel have cancelled the booking - no charge. The tour bookings have extended booking to when we next visit. All decent customer service.
Avanti will not refund my ticket cost but they would amend to another date, but wouldn't to an unknown date.
Customer service is clearly missing. They say they understand and are sorry - but they clearly don't understand. And their sorrow is of no interest. We will be going to Edinburgh again - but I'll drive or fly - I certainly wouldn't hand more money over to these uncaring clowns. I hope they go bust or get their franchise removed and please bring back Virgin

items.title: I tried to give them a chance but just avoid Avanti
items.review_text:
I travel every week between London Euston and Stoke on Trent. When Avanti took over the line in December I was determined to give them some bedding in time before making any conclusions to their service.
Now that. We are in March I think that it is now fair to advise the service is so far worse than virgin was (virgin was by now way perfect).
The booking process is far worse, obtaining a delay refund is hardly worth the effort, no means to choose the seat you want, Wi-Fi non existent service inconsistent and virtually impossible to talk to their customer service team. On top of all of this they are more expensive than Virgin!!

I have started using London North West services which are slower and often crowded, but still a better experience than the Avanti shambles.

I can only hope that Avanti improves, but I very much doubt it.

If you have the choice avoid Avanti at all costs.

items.title: 22 degrees is too hot.
items.review_text:
22 degrees is too hot.

Please set the trains to a suitable temperature.

items.title: Unacceptable Lack of Information & Failure of Responsibility
items.review_text: On Sunday 8 March 2020, trains from Manchester Piccadilly to London Euston terminated at Milton Keynes due to some fault between Milton Keynes and London. An announcement at Manchester Piccadilly clearly stated that passengers for the 19.56 train should disembark at Milton Keynes and take a replacement bus service to Euston. The replacement bus service can accurately be described as falling between inadequate and non-existent. Rail Network said they had not been informed about any replacement service and that Avanti are not contactable on Sundays. This is astounding; if you are responsible for a major rail connection, how is it even conceivable that you are out of contact on any day of the week? Avanti should be prepared to take a substantial hit in terms of fully reimbursing customers for poor service and a lack of transparency. It is unacceptable for passengers to be left stranded on a platform in Milton Keynes at midnight on a Sunday with no travel information.

items.title: What a shocking experience
items.review_text: What a shocking experience! 3 hours to get from CMK to Euston because of a power line failure- I understand that problem but then to wait a further hour just outside of Watford junction and reverse for another line to become available and then to be told to leave the train (at Watters) get on another and then be told to get off that one and then get back on again- unbelievable! Now trying to get back home and already delayed with a technical fault ....still, have a lovely view of the surrounding rural idyll so can always watch the grass grow.

items.title: Complete amateurs (or mercenaries - you decide)
items.review_text:
I'm hoping I never have the misfortune of travelling with these clowns again but I've got a feeling I may have no choice.  However, I will exhaust all other avenues before I do.    

My train was cancelled from Euston (a common occurrence apparently).  After receiving no information whatsoever from their app or website, and joining a lengthy queue of people asking for information at Euston I discovered I could catch a different train to Birmingham and then catch an onward train from there to Stoke. 

Fine, I got the train to Birmingham (standing all the way as there were two trains of people on one train), but then the next few trains to Stoke were cancelled with no guarantee that any trains would be going to Stoke that night.  Eventually I got a taxi from Birmingham to Stoke (£80).   Arrived in Stoke around 6 hours late.  OK, I'll get my train fare back though, so I thought.  Ha! Avanti offered me 50% of my fare back, saying my train was less than an hour late (my train was cancelled so didn't even leave the station).   I had to go through an appeals process to get my whole fare back.  

I'd rather sit on the motorway for a few hours than get involved with this bunch of jokers again.

items.title: Please bring back Virgin
items.review_text: Please bring back Virgin! Avanti tickets are way more expensive on the Manchester to London route. The timing of Advance ticket release is all over the place, despite the protestations on their website that they are released 12 weeks in advance. Avanti - you need to get your act together to get any more business from me.

items.title: Disgusting!
items.review_text:
Using Avanti from Preston to Birmingham New Street - everytime I've found the seats to be disgustingly filthy! 

As yet I've not managed to sit in a carriage with electrical sockets, and the Wi-Fi is the slowest I've experienced on the train network. 

I've given 2 stars because the services usually run pretty much on time. 

I'm not an everyday commuter but several times a year I have to go from Exeter to Preston and back for business.

On this route, I have to take a Cross-country service Exeter - Birmingham, then an Avanti service for the Birmingham - Preston part. Virgin trains, yeah they weren't perfect, but they were leaps and bounds better than Avanti!

This review was made possible by CrossCountry's Wi-Fi - sorry Avanti, theirs actually works!!!

items.title: poor service. Filthy
items.review_text: Train cancelled directed to next train platform 6 then changed to 7 train waiting. Reservation on first but obviously not 2nd so looked for available seat found sat down only to be told by angry passenger I was in her seat. Explained seat unreserved only to find reservations changed. Surely easy task to put correct reservations on prior to letting passengers on !!  Seats very very dirty considering issues with Coronavirus disgusting

items.title: Amateur firm not professional try to avoid
items.review_text:
* No option to book your seat on some routes (could do on virgin) Good luck if you have a big bag, ruck sack and no seat. Even if you book in advance!

* Confusing online booking system (easy to make a mistake and get it wrong) Pricey mistakes! 

* Get it wrong and the grumpy inspector won't let you off (luckly not me but the person next to me and behind me paid an extra £47 on top of a £90 ticket) No mercy. 

* Electric sockets were turned on after one and a half hours into the journey (what's the point). No peace of mind that you can work on the journey.

* Seat reservations haven't worked a number of times so you need to convince people sitting in your seat that it is yours! Horrible. 

Also the announcement system wasn't working and cutting out so the driver sounds like he's using Morse code and no one can understand. Can't someone tell him? 

What a joke  This firm is like a time travel to the eighties bad customer service, cancellations, dated website platform, grumpy inspector, nothing works! 

Stephenson's rocket would do better.

items.title: Joke of a company
items.review_text: What a rubbish company - don't book allocated seats or quiet area seats as you will rarely get either of them. What a joke!

items.title: Nice staff. Rubbish first class service
items.review_text:
Nice staff.
Terrible first class experience. Dirty seats. Limited on food and drink, bad selections and quality. 
I've Never been on a first class service in the world where you're told you can only have 2 drinks over a 4 1/2 hour journey.
Avoid at all costs as totally not worth the money.
Bring back Virgin!

items.title: I upgraded to 1st class and trains were…
items.review_text: I upgraded to 1st class and trains were changed so I paid extra for nothing trying to get refunded but Avanti is blaming Seatfrog and seat frog is blaming Avanti train staff didn’t have a clue either oh and train was 25 mins late

items.title: Awful service
items.review_text: Awful service. I complained to the customer resolutions centre about a particularly awful experience I had had regarding a train from London, inevitably the response was one of that additional staff training may be required. I did not find this an acceptable response, I emailed back to ask how to escalate the complaint but did not receive a reply, I have since sent 4 emails to ask further how to escalate the complaint but they just don’t reply. What a joke of a company.

items.title: F-ing shitheads
items.review_text: F-ing shitheads, may the modern plague find you

items.title: Ideally no stars
items.review_text: Ideally no stars based on how dirty their old virgin trains are. Staff didn’t say good morning as I arrived at 6:30am it was as if was invisible. They didn’t both to wipe table as we departed the train at Lancaster

items.title: Disgraceful
items.review_text:
Since Avanti took over the prices have rocketed with no explanation from the 'customer service team' (more like revenue protection squad). 

Euston to Coventry 17:03
Virgin train cost £19.00
Avanti West Cost cost £62.00

An no, before you ask there's no other service they offer that even comes close to the price so it's not a case of just picking another time unless you want to get home in the middle of the night.

The morning services are only slightly better with prices only doubling so there's a bonus.

So the question has to be "What was the criteria for winning the Tender" Did anybody without a vested interest get to see the winning bid or was this just swept under the table because delivering value for money couldn't have been a factor

items.title: Terrible Service From Avanti
items.review_text: Booked first class seats from Manchester to London on a Friday night less than a week after Avanti took over the line.  Announced when we were moving that due to staff shortages there would be no hot food.  When the trolley came round my husband and I asked for cheese and biscuits but they only had one pack.  When I complained to their customer service department I was told me the food was complementary.  Took them nearly a month to respond.  When you book first class apparently you pay for the comfortable seats.  Who knew??  Not impressed with Avanti.  Bring back Virgin.

items.title: Thought I’d travel to Edinburgh by train....
items.review_text:
Thought I’d travel to Edinburgh this time by train - usually fly (5 times this year) - won’t be doing it again. 12:15 from Birmingham - coach F - too hot - WiFi useless (@1.7mbps) - overcrowded - and train is late - shop closed due to being ‘overstocked!’
No way to voice concerns to train manager - haven’t seen him!
I think folk in this country are so used to mediocrity that they just ‘accept’ it!
Please please voice your complaints otherwise nothing changes !

items.title: Disgraceful - so much worse than Curgin
items.review_text:
Disgraceful - first class from Birmingham to London, and not offered so much as a cup of tea, let alone anything to eat. Didn’t see a single member of staff for the entire trip, and the few announcements were inaudible. WiFi terrible too!
To cap it all, when contacted their twitter account, I was told to ‘go and look for someone on the train’ - zero response to my suggestion that they could/should sort this.

items.title: Worse than Virgin
items.review_text: Worse than Virgin! Train electrics failed on route to London, maintain your trains for goodness sake! I paid £240 for the journey to Euston, other passengers would have paid similar amounts for peak travel. What even worse is their terrible customer service. The delay repay service should have a human answering the call not 100% automated options! We had it better with Virgin!

items.title: Staff sit in the first class cabins and…
items.review_text: Staff sit in the first class cabins and talk loudly to each other. Coventry to London train, 28 Feb, 11:31am. I had to move seats because of this. Absolute disgrace.

items.title: Good
items.review_text: Having read all the other reviews I was dreading my journey from Warrington Bank Quay to Edinburgh. I actually found it to be very pleasant and was offered food and drink in first class by a polite man who was only too happy to help. I admit it is not a patch on the first class service provided by LNER on the East coast but it was just as good as Virgin used to be. Well done and thank you!

items.title: Why am I not surprised
items.review_text:
Why am I not surprised, another trip to Liverpool in 1st class with no breakfast available. This is every single journey since Avanti took over from Virgin.

I look back on Virgin and realise I took for granted that they would provide a cooked breakfast with toast and coffee every journey as promised. I'd actually look forward to my journey but now I dread it, I have to make sure I have eaten before I board and if the upgrade was any more than the £20 it is I would not pay it.  I now travel standard home because its £90 more and the 1st class service is no longer there.

Avanti, if breakfast is not part of your 1st class stop saying it is!

items.title: Disgusting pricing by Avanti West…
items.review_text:
Disgusting pricing by Avanti West Coast. Prices vary for the exact same Avanti West Coast journey according to how ticket is purchased. Cheaper price offered by Trainline even when taking into account the booking fee. Price difference was enormous, i.e., £57.30 on Avanti's official web versus £18.50 on the trainline website. Absolutely outrageous. How can Avanti justify this rip off action. You think by booking directly with the train company, you would be given the cheaper rate. Within a couple of hours of researching the prices, the price went up again on the Avanti website. Suggest choosing a cheaper option rather than feed the pockets of this rip off company!!!
If possible I would award a minus rating for this shoddy train company!!,

items.title: Not even a star
items.review_text: Appalling.The worst company I have ever traveled with. Trains are delayed every day.

items.title: 3x the price I paid on routes from…
items.review_text: 3x the price I paid on routes from London to Manchester!!!! What a joke. No tickets below £230 one way!?!?!?!?! Joke. Joke. Joke.

items.title: I hate this Company!!
items.review_text: I hate this Company!!! Because when I got to London Euston I spoke to the man why the train is so dirty but he just ignored me!! I when got on the train to Liverpool the train is so hot, dirty, and bumpy! And when the food came, it taste like poo!!! I have no idea why they do this just to avoid people!! Some people put excellent reviews but mine is terrible! Bring back Virgin right now!!!!!!!

items.title: Yes you cannot make a claim against us
items.review_text:
We traveled Glasgow to Milton Keynes 3 hours late. Have tried to claim 3 times including the "chat line". Unsuccessful.
Return journey no train going north. Tried to claim three times with "help" from the "chat line". Unsuccessful.
No scope to claim for car hire. No responsible human/voice.
Brian Anderson

items.title: I'm recommending Avanti West Coast.
items.review_text: I travel alot with my job and this means alot of rail journeys. I am able to compare Avanti West Coast with Virgin because of my experience. So far, so good with Avanti. Their app is easy to use and to buy a ticket. The staff are brilliant...I've not bumped into anyone of them who has a poor attitude. Yes, a lot of their trains run late however, this was the same for Virgin. What I feel is a vast improvement is Avanti's compensation process...a lot slicker. Overall...pleased with the service.

items.title: Disgusting attitude from staff member
items.review_text:
Disgusting attitude from staff members. In particular Vandana at London Euston she made an abusive comment as I was walking away and when I questioned her she responded "you heard" 

Avanti Supervisor refused to speak to me

Absolute disgrace

items.title: I would like to praise Tim who sits at…
items.review_text: I would like to praise Tim who sits at London Euston ticketing office. He was very polite helpful and went out of the way to solve my problem. I had an off peak ticket, which I was advised could be used to travel from Euston to Liverpool till 15.49. I was misinformed when I booked the ticket over the phone, it was then rectified by Tim at the ticketing office at London Euston and did not take long. He apologised for the inconvenience plus was very pleasant to speak to as well.

items.title: Bring back Virgin!
items.review_text:
They have increased the price of a trip I make regularly and their website has less functionality. I can't even book my own seat. 

If the journey itself isn't any better, why have you increased the cost?!

items.title: Awful
items.review_text: The service is awful and when you complain it falls on deaf ears.

items.title: Bring back Virgin Trains
items.review_text: Bring back Virgin Trains!  Not impressed at all.  We were four people travelling from Glasgow to Preston, we requested a table seat so we would be sat together and they sat us on two separate airline seats, one facing forward the other backwards, it was impossible to chat as a group.  I cannot believe there wasn't a table seat when we booked over 10 weeks ago. On Virgin Trains website you could choose your seats, I would even pay extra to book preferred seats if necessary.  We had spent a lovely weekend away together and seating us separately did dampen our spirits.

items.title: THE WORST COMPANY I HAVE EVER USED
items.review_text:
THE WORST COMPANY I HAVE EVER USED - BRING BACK VIRGIN

Originally booked for 2 weekend's ago however due to circumstances this was changed to 22-23 Feb 20 (well in advance may I also add). Having Paid £160 for first class tickets and then an extra £40 to change dates once on the Train realised the re-issued tickets where in fact standard. Having complained to the train manager this was quickly resolved and we relaxed into the journey.

On our return the next day we desperately tried to change our advance tickets to an earlier train as a family member was rushed to hospital however we was met with the most unhelpful and patronising staff at EUSTON station I have EVER come across. Yes I understand these can't usually be changed and in order to do this we needed to pay a substantial fee however we simply didn't have £100 extra to spend on more tickets. Just to make it home we was actually quite happy to be sat in Standard in order to just get home but quite frankly Avanti doesn't have ANY staff members with compassion or a heart and are like robots using the line "You will need to speak to customer relations" but yet when you ring the number provided states it re-opens MONDAY - WHAT USE IS THIS????

To make matters worse and really add the cherry on the top, once sat in our empty first class carriage, the train manager, who I explained our ticket situation to and showed all email correspondence etc with proof of first class purchase etc still demanded we paid an extra £50 to stay in the carriage. His words simply ahh well it looks like they've upgraded you to standard so you need to pay. HOW CAN YOU UPGRADE TO STANDARD IF IN FIRST CLASS????? The best phrase to come out of his mouth however "I can't just let you sit here as all these people have paid" - This is after us showing him the £200 we have paid to sit in first to simply be issued the wrong tickets.

So Avanti, Euston Avanti Staff and train manager on the 20.25 from EUSTON - PRESTON - I hope you feel much better on your high horses and I really hope for the sake of other passengers you learn some human decency - Please bring Virgin back to this line.

items.title: This isn't service at all
items.review_text:
This isn't service at all, pay for first class & get cheese & biscuits?  
I stress this is not the staffs fault, one chap serving all who was immensely cheerful & very good at his job, as usual its the fault of the company who have cut staff & services in order to make a profit.

I much preferred Virgin & fail to see why they lost the contract that was awarded to these "Jokers".....my advice would be don't bother paying for first class there really is no point!

Raise your game Avanti, it wasn't pleasant travelling with you.

items.title: First Class carriages always smell and not cleaned.
items.review_text:
First Class always smells of toilet. 
Seats are always dirty . Needs disinfecting . I wish I could post the picture of the dirt and crumbs  between the table and window! Everything needs a clean .

items.title: Travelling From Euston to Manchester
items.review_text:
Travelling on the very busy Euston to Manchester train 16:57 with my wife and 2 suitcases. Major crowds behind us, showed Craig from Avanti our tickets, he could clearly see we had the cases and didn’t have free hands, but before letting us through asked to see our 2together card, which caused delays for us and the people behind us. After struggling to get the ticket I asked Craig did he really need to see the ticket, simply told to read Avanti terms and conditions. Did he really need to see it, shouldn’t Craig have taken into consideration the many people behind us trying to catch the train, surly it would make sense to check it on the train, as it always has been in the past? 

Think it would be helpful for Avanti to reconsider this process, might just give a better customer experience

items.title: Delayed!
items.review_text: Delayed!! More trains 🤡 Bring back Virgin!!

items.title: Due to the floods last week
items.review_text:
Due to the floods last week, travelling glasgow to preston.
Avanti came down the carriages offering bacon buts and sausage buts, plus free tea,coffee and water.
Well done avanti made a long journey better and information was flowing

items.title: Absolute faeces
items.review_text: Absolute faeces service absolutely terrible. Need to go asap if this is the show they are putting on after only 2 months

items.title: 3 times the train was cancelled!
items.review_text: 3 times the train was cancelled!! It's not acceptable since I have to travel to work

items.title: Surely British rail transportation has…
items.review_text: Surely British rail transportation has something better than this to offer? Nothing about this service reflects the price paid, 6 weeks in a row I was late to my destination.

items.title: A bit of balance
items.review_text: I was a regular user of Virgin and recently took my first trip on Avanti.  Having read the reviews on here I was not really looking foward to it but actually the experience was as good as Virgin.  Trip was Penrith to Euston in first class down one afternoon returning the following.  Once on train the staff were there quickly to get me a drink, yes, and offer of cold food but opted to wait for the hot post Preston.  The fish pie and cheese were both good though portion size a little smaller than Virgin. Staff were friendly the whole way down and back the following day.  Both trains were delayed due to the bad weather but we were kept fully up to date and as we were late into London on way down there was an extra stop at Watford for those passengers for whom this was more convenient.  There have clearly been a lot of bad experiences but mine was good.

items.title: Below Zero
items.review_text: Oh Lordy. I’ve travelled the west coast line for 3 years, twice a week from top to toe; I use Southern, Northern and GWR regularly but I have never thought that they were better services than Virgin. However, with the advent of Avanti taking over, in Dec19, I have drastically reappraised that consideration. Your ticket app - although just a hijack of Virgin doesn’t work (I have to buy my tickets using the Northern app and they have been sequestered from their franchise ). Your delay repay process reminds me of that experienced by the old lady in the film The Invincibles. Your trains, in my experience, are always late and you haven’t updated your films since December. The final straw is that you have stopped trains, the through train to London, picking up passengers at OXN at the weekend and we have to go via Birmingham. This adds an hour onto the journey- and yes I can go via Preston but this also adds an hour to my journey. I look forward to when the franchise is taken off you and returned to a competent rail operator. God, it can’t be too soon. Best wishes have a pleasant journey- while it last.

items.title: Not a great start!
items.review_text: Not, great! Pre-booked tickets for a trip to London from Wolverhampton, fully expecting seats to be reserved as per my reservation but they weren’t. All the way through the journeys both there and back seats were showing as available. Also both trains didn’t run on time, you could also smell the toilets in the carriage, which I never experienced under Virgin. Only staff member I saw on the train also was the girl serving in the buffet carriage, train manager made their announcements but didn’t even bother to come and check tickets So all in all first journey on Avanti (ridiculous name) wasn’t great, you have very big shoes to fill! Please bring back Virgin Trains if this is the future of the West Coast service!

items.title: Over one hour delay on a Rugby Euston…
items.review_text: Over one hour delay on a Rugby Euston Service 20th Feb.  Excuses beyond ridiculous and crass, constant updates citing ' delays, reason unknown' why bombard drenched and angry travellers with this non-information,, it only adds to the scene of Dante's Hell where Network Rail meet Avanti. Station filthy , more akin to a detention centre..

items.title: Bring back Virgin!
items.review_text: Bring back Virgin! - and its website too! God help us all on the West Coast line from now on.......

items.title: Shocking
items.review_text: My God. Where did they dredge the Birmingham New Street staff from. Their attitude is below poor. A daily traveller into Birmingham and the staff, well. I won't use the language that I'd like to. You got one star Avanti. That's only because I couldn't score a zero. Training required in how to treat people who are paying customers. Working as you do is not a right, it's a privilege 🙄

items.title: Do not book as even in first class you…
items.review_text:
Do not book as even in first class you can not pick the seat you want
you get one the computer picks , plus all the fares have increased by around 30%. We will be driving to Liverpool until Avanti improves its booking so we can pick our seats.

items.title: Absolutely useless
items.review_text: Absolutely useless. Worse than Virgin. More delays and cancellations.

items.title: Terrible service
items.review_text: Terrible service. Late. WiFi is from the stone age. Train ticket £90 to go to London and back from Manchester. I can fly return to Barcelona for less.

items.title: RIP Virgin Trains
items.review_text: It was always going to be a real struggle for any operator to follow in the footsteps of Virgin trains who had basically revolutionised British rail travel on the west coast mainline. Virgin was a forward looking, progressive company with a refreshing outlook and focus on customer service. Gone are the reasonably priced advance tickets along with the cheery staff and excellent first class service. Avant west coast has somehow managed to reverse the last 20+ years of progression and almost taken us back to the dark old gloomy days of British Rail. The staff seem lost as to what they are doing, the trains look dirty inside and neglected. The WiFi doesn’t work and no one can be bothered to fix it. Travelling in first class used to be a great experience, it’s now an overcrowded sham with third class service. Then there is the dreary branding that shows a total lack of imagination. RIP Virgin trains. Let’s hope that we see you rise again through HS2 one day...

items.title: Why has the price suddenly shot up now…
items.review_text: Why has the price suddenly shot up now Avanti has taken over from Virgin? Even travelling during the day, off peak, there were decent priced seats. Not anymore. If only we could get Virgin back!

items.title: After an error with my ticket from…
items.review_text: After an error with my ticket from Wigan to Southbury I could not get the train I wished to catch so Debbie at Wigan North Western stepped in and sorted everything out ,I took a later train and for my problems I was given a completely 1st class seat to London which  was brilliant, my journey was flawless, "Thanks for all your help Debbie ".

items.title: outstanding!
items.review_text: So impressed with Avanti, I’ve been travelling via Virgin Trains on the London Euston line for over a year every other weekend and the way they have dealt with the refunds since taking over is nothing short of outstanding. Extremely responsive when contacting them for a refund. Very impressed!

items.title: Avanti not a patch on Virgin!
items.review_text:
I have travelled regularly first class from Stockport to London Euston for the last 8 years and my most recent journey was in February with the service provided by Avanti and I have to say it was the worst journey ever. The first choice of food 'ran out', the seats were dirty with no headrest on the back of the seat, the table still had crumbs and spillages on from the previous journey and the loo was filthy. Apparently there is going to be a three tier seating system - an excuse to charge more!
Bring back Virgin.

items.title: 7th January 20 Birmingham New St (10.10pm) to Southampton Central Booking and Reality
items.review_text:
On the 7th of January I travelled from Birmingham New Street on the 10.10pm train to Euston. My ticket was for Birmingham New Street to Southampton Central. The ticket inspector/train manager acknowledged that i was travelling on to Waterloo because he told me that the ticket could be used on the underground.

However, the train pulled into Euston late. I fretted and walked down to the front of the train..no staff were on hand as they were about to finish their shift (in fact they were ALL sat in the 1st class section together). 

I attempted to catch the only Underground train that connected to Waterloo but missed it!! My heart sank and I had a full on panic attack when I realised I was stuck in London overnight. No staff member helped me - and I am disabled so this made matters worse.

In the morning (04.30am) I was at Waterloo station as it opened...and had to pay a further £30 odd pound to get another ticket. When I sent an online complaint to Avanti West Coast it took them ages to respond...only to say they had contacted Cross Country Trains because I purchased my tickets via their site.

Avanti West Coast please get your act together...the above should not have happened. I am a 63 yr old woman with disabilities and kept being approached in London for money overnight...this was so scary....I am taking this as far as I can because Avanti West Coast need to acknowledge that if their trains are late and passengers cannot make their connection they should deal with it instead of making excuses and fobbling people off!!!!

items.title: Avanti has ruined this service
items.review_text:
Avanti has ruined this service. Virgin used to be fantastic for years - in-train service was always great & automatic delay repay went straight to your account within a week without any additional effort. 

Avanti first class has very little of the old menu available at the weekend, just a prepackaged sandwich in a box and tea/coffee. Most of the soft drinks and fruit juices / fruit / snacks has disappeared or has "run out".

Avanti makes it very hard to get delay repay. You need a second account for just the "delay repay" area of their site, then to manually "Opt-in". It is not automatic repayment, it's more of an automatic "notification" which forgets about multiple tickets for a journey, so it only offers refund of one of the multiple tickets you buy for a journey. 

I had to perform the manual process of entering all the ticket details, find all the reference numbers, upload them all in one image. Even after giving them all this information they still ask you to find the journey with dates and times and changes etc. Perhaps the icing on the cake (though Avanti cakes probably wouldn't have icing) is in the email confirmation of your claim "We will respond to your claim within 20 working days" - yawn.

It certainly feels like they have made it so difficult that most people will just give-up, either getting confused by the multiple-accounts, unable to use the software, or simply by trying not to waste any more of their time.

Unbelievable the amount of effort required to get your repayment now, especially considering only a few months ago it would happen automatically with zero effort on Virgin. What a shame to see a fantastic public transport route go down the drain.

items.title: Travelled with Avanti 1st class end of…
items.review_text:
Travelled with Avanti 1st class end of Jan, what a shock !
Complete loss of service offered by Virgin, inedible cheese roll for evening meal, really awful.
Sadly no option for another train which gets you to London fast!
Bring back Virgin, didn’t realise how bad it could become and so rapidly after a take over !

items.title: It was awful from start to finish
items.review_text: It was awful from start to finish! The journey was from Euston to Preston (Glasgow service) on 13th of feb at 9:30am; it was announce the platform 8min before departure; so you needed to quaintly run for the train and service was 25min delay and was very late for my meeting. Unreliable and missed the Virgin already!

items.title: Both trains absolutely filthy
items.review_text: Both trains absolutely filthy. I couldn't see out of the window on my 4hrs journey to glasgow it was that bad. They smell and are really dirty. Used virgin for many many years and sadly have no choice but to use a avanti now. Prices also more expensive than virgin. A real shame I don't have a choice.

items.title: Horrified
items.review_text:
Horrified! Treated my partner and I to first class from Birmingham to Euston on the 10/2/2020. When the hot food trolley finally arrived we were informed they had ran out of hot food and the only available item was an apple. On the return journey, first class service was suspended entirely, so not even a hot beverage was on offer and the train was absolutely filthy!
Bring back Virgin!

items.title: How Do They Keep The Franchise?
items.review_text: How can a newly awarded franchisee be allowed to retain it when it has destroyed what little service quality remained on Virgin. I am sure their bid did not mention severely downgrading the (already mediocre) first class offering, allowing the transferred staff to become even more complacent and rude etc etc. It is the same staff and also the same senior leadership team - the collapse can only be cost saving to make more profit. 28 days for customer service response?Why were they not made to commit to 48 hours to win the bid????

items.title: Everything about Avanti is worse than…
items.review_text: Everything about Avanti is worse than it was under Virgin. The price, the food in 1st, the software they use, can't pick a seat in 1st, no automatic delay repay, reduced delay repay amounts, the cleanliness. Pretty much everything. What an amazing job done by Virgin by comparison. Whomever allowed this to happen needs investigated.

items.title: Shocking
items.review_text: Wow! What a decline from Virgin, Avanti have ruined this service in such a short time. I paid for an upgrade to first class as a treat so that myself & my son could have breakfast. The difference hit me as soon as I walked onto the train. The carriage was filthy, thick with dust & dirt all over the seats. Then the announcement came that due to delivery problems (in other words cost cutting) there would be limited food options. As a vegetarian I couldn't have the bacon or sausage roll so opted for porridge. It was inedible, like wallpaper paste. The staff are also a completely different standard than Virgin. Poor customer service skills verging on rude. What a shocking service this certainly isn't progress.

items.title: The BEST train service and staff
items.review_text:
The BEST train service and staff
If i could give higher stars I would - given Storm Ciara and all the disruptions the staff went above and beyond to keep us up to date and once on the train our journey was comfortable and pleasant!

items.title: Have finally received a less than…
items.review_text: Have finally received a less than satisfactory reply from Avanti. 28 days it has taken to get to this stage. Pathetic. I will not give up trying to get a full refund from Avanti for such appalling service!!!!

items.title: Train from Euston to Manchester on…
items.review_text: Train from Euston to Manchester on Saturday 8/2 at 19.00 hours. The train was filthy. The seats were full of food and there was rubbish on the floors. The toilets were disgusting. What happened to Virgin Trains. They were always clean. The staff were rude

items.title: On a train from Manchester to Euston…
items.review_text: On a train from Manchester to Euston 10.40 Sunday morning. No strong winds, no rain , no storm and we still have a 50mph speed restrictions. Why why why, it's madness, the trees aren't even moving. It's utter madness .

items.title: FILTH
items.review_text: FILTH. Travelled Manchester to Euston 1st class. Toilet flooded with urine and soiled toilet paper. Refused alcoholic drink, told none on board but I could walk from carriage J to carriage c and purchase drink from  the buffet bar. Brunch served. Dry bread, coffee I presume from the toilet floor. This is not 1st class. It is a poor joke. Travel with them at your peril. Fighting through their complaints system. It’s as bad as their train service.

items.title: I am trying to buy a ticket online
items.review_text: I am trying to buy a ticket online, I do not know if I have been successful and whether I can travel today as the website is not working. Not only are the trains AWFUL but the service is. After today I will not use Avanti again after happily using this line to commute between London and Crewe for over a year prior to them taking it over. Please bring back Virgin, this lot are simply embarassing. No wonder the rail network is so utterly useless.

items.title: Arrogant and entitled staff
items.review_text: Arrogant and entitled staff think they can touch your phone and take it to look at your e-tickets without asking - the women at Liverpool are particularly bad for this. Removed the seat selector which means you get a random seat. Use a different company.

items.title: First trip since Virgin.....i’d rather walk
items.review_text:
First trip since Virgin lost the franchise. I should have stayed at home. No choice of seat and when I complained, the complete imbecile at Avanti said he was delighted to confirm he had allocated me seat F01 on both outbound and return....strange that...I had booked Standard out and First Class back. Not sure how I could have the same seat. 
On the return journey the train was cancelled and no First Class service on the train I had to catch 20 mins later. The miserable train staff said...you can claim via the website......really???????......try it! So far so have been reimbursed £12.63 on. £50.50 ticket .....for a train cancellation, no First and Standard class was £20.00. 
Avanti.....you don’t even deserve one star. 
Get your act together!!!!!!!!!!!!

items.title: When is Avanti going to take the…
items.review_text: When is Avanti going to take the passenger feedback onboard?! Surely it’s simple enough to at least allow to book a preferred seat instead of allocating a random one and splitting people travelling together, especially with kids. Where is the quiet coach? The trains are dirty and smelly and Avanti has no shame to charge more than Virgin for train tickets. Customer service is very poor as well. I travel regularly between London and the North and had to start considering other modes of transport as Avanti is appaling.

items.title: Come back Virgin Tains
items.review_text: Took the train from London to Manchester and back same day First Class. Dirty train. Indifferent staff . Poor food. Bacon roll inedible. Felt we had to beg for a drink. Train late leaving Manchester. Staff rush round trying to clean train and set up for return journey as the trains have virtually no time to turn round. Compared to Virgin which we have used first class for years Avanti is totally rubbish.  Won't use them again. COME BACK VIRGIN !!!

items.title: Every single member of Avanti staff we…
items.review_text: Every single member of Avanti staff we came across on my last trip was friendly and helpful.  We missed our train from Glasgow Central to Birmingham due to the Rest and be Thankful road closure.  At Central Station we were helped on to the next train free of charge even though our tickets were only valid for the missed train.  On board staff were friendly and helpful.  The toilet did not make irritating quips!  thank you :)

items.title: Staff are fab. Let's save the planet
items.review_text:
Hi
Happy with train. Staff are ace... but looking forward to more green initiatives. Please can we have a water fountain? What about wooden cutlery? And there must be a better way to hand out milk than in plastic sachets?
Overall, everything about your service is pretty much excellent but please listen to your (fabulous) staff who want to move things forward with environmental issues.
Thanks 
Brian 
Ps my work for the museum involves a lot of travel down to London from Scotland. I refuse to fly so am a " captive customer"... I'm being a bit critical but look forward to seeing how Avanti are going to move forward on environmental issues

items.title: Worst Class
items.review_text: A train manager who lied about when they could serve food and drink in First class with a passive aggressive insulting comment as he turned on his heels. The fact that he lied verified by live chat. First Class to Worst Class.

items.title: Appalling Customer Service.
items.review_text: If you need evidence of a start-up that is sure of offering appalling customer service chat agents who are defensive and disconnects the chat because they do not like you pointing out flaws in the app, please contact avantiwestcoast trains. If the customer service is any indication, my train journey will be interesting......

items.title: Tried to claim compensation for delayed…
items.review_text: Tried to claim compensation for delayed train but rejected because some information was missing. Resubmitted but because of problems with internet had to post details to the only address I could find in Birmingham on 14/1/20. Heard nothing and have tried several times to ring the customer service only to be told we are not taking calls at the moment even though it was supposed to be their opening times. I am also unable to contact the resolution team on the internet so yesterday sent an Email to their information address. Still waiting. What happens if you're not on the internet. Terrible service.

items.title: cancel a ticket
items.review_text: cancel a ticket, they charge me £10 admin fee + I have to send back the ticket for them to be fully refunded. I should have looked at the website first

items.title: Customer service needs work
items.review_text: Bought tickets for a school group of adults and children from Wigan to London. Some of the adults (not the ones supervising the pupils) asked me if they could travel from Warrington which is the next stop along. Thought I’d check with avanti but I couldn’t see any issues. However, they’re insisting that the tickets won’t be valid unless we all travel together. Apparently they’re fixed family tickets which come with terms and conditions (I didn’t purposely request this sort of ticket, it’s just what came up when I purchased online). I really don’t see what harm it could possibly do if some of the adults were to get on one stop later. I now realise I made a mistake in the sort of ticket I booked but a little bit of flexibility on Avanti’s part would have made life a lot simpler for all concerned. They didn’t even try and come up with a solution.

items.title: Train Manager refuses to speak to customers!
items.review_text:
No food on first class. No apology, Service manager and train manager just ignored my very polite request for a discussion about this. Response from Avanti was that train manager has 'safety critical' task to perform. Walked past me twice checking tickets - revenue protection is hardly safety critical is it?

We now know who and what Avanti prioritises.

items.title: £110 for what???
items.review_text: Such a bad service. Late, Last minute changes to Bus, no food. Same as usual.

items.title: I have been trying to get a refund for…
items.review_text: I have been trying to get a refund for a lost parking ticket charge of £36 , long story but I hadn’t had any ticket to lose. It was dismissed out of hand, even tho this was the advice given to me by the station staff at the time. After reading these appalling reviews I suspect it would be a waste of my time to keep trying. I am a pensioner £36 is a great deal of money to me. Thanks for your reviews of this terrible company, it’s nice to know I’m not alone.

items.title: Regular 1st Class Glasgow to London Traveller..
items.review_text:
Have travelled Avanti regularly twice weekly since their take over in December.

Their service in the week is spot on, and very comparable to Virgin Trains. 

Their 1st Class service at the weekend is slightly worse than Virgin, with less, and no hot food options available. However the ticket price is lower generally at the weekend, so it’s hardly unreasonable for the same options as in the week.

As a regular traveller between Glasgow and London, the high speed direct service remains more reliable than flying, and in terms of cost still leaves you between off after factoring travel to the airport. 

Have had one major delay of 90 minutes, which the full ticket price was automatically refunded within a week. 

Other than this it’s practically the same as Virgin. For long distance travel between Caledonia and the South it’s the best option for doing so in 4 hours and 30 minutes. Comparing to a drive of around 8 hours with a couple of rest stops. 

I feel a lot of the bad reviews are down to customers expecting the Orient Express, especially for trips in their own time. - Be realistic. 

For those that need to travel down the WCML for work and to get home, Avanti do the job.

My only hate is the lack to choose where to sit when booking online. Please bring that back!!

Services I generally travel on; 
19:30 to GLC on Friday night
13:38 to EUS on Sunday Afternoon

items.title: Pathetic service
items.review_text: Travelled on Avanti yesterday to Liverpool.  The train was late arriving into Liverpool (6mins) and the return journey was even worse (26 mins late getting back to Euston).  Bearing in mind that virtually every time I travelled with Virgin Trains the service was on time or a few minutes early, the performance of Avanti is abysmal (and they've only had the service for just under two months).  The onboard service is mostly non-existent and booking seats is now a lot more difficult as they have removed the ability to select your own seat.  Ridiculous how in a very short space of time they have taken what was a great service run by Virgin Trains and turned it into a shambles.  But not a surprise, seeing as they have to cut costs massively in order to meet the pension liability commitments they have given.  Pathetic really.

items.title: Disgusting. Unbelievably so.
items.review_text:
Do I have to give a star? I can't believe how quickly this 'company' have undone all the good work by Virgin on the North West rail network.

Paid over £100 to travel first class with my 9 year old daughter to Glasgow. Upon boarding, the first class carriage was occupied with standing, standard class passengers because the train was full. I can accept this. It shouldn't happen but sometimes situations occur. What I can't accept is drunken leering males and hungover young ladies swearing and shouting suggestive lewd comments across the carriage at 11am in the morning. 11am! And continuing to drink from cans served on the train! The reason I chose first class was to try to avoid subjecting a child to this behaviour. Sadly there were other, slightly older children on the carriage. I'm not prudish. But I do have decorum around other passengers. Especially children. 

This could have - and should have - been prevented by employing sufficient staff. Perhaps employ them on a train to greater effect than serving already drunken individuals. Didn't appreciate the comments from those involved that anyone paying first class must be fools (words to that effect) given the poor state of the carriage. And that they had managed to go first class without having to pay which made the rest of us mugs (again words to that effect). Sadly they had a point.

Alas I didn't see any staff in over an hour. Didn't get any food or even a beverage. My daughter - who had been looking forward to the journey - was visibly uncomfortable and upset throughout. Oh and the train was late.

This isn't the first time I've used Avanti since they took over from Virgin. The previous occasion was almost comparable. Thankfully I wasn't with a 9 year old. I put it down to teething troubles. More fool me. 

The carriage was scruffy & filthy inside. Battered paintwork & generally unclean. Wouldn't have liked to envisage standard class given the state of first class. They are supposedly upgrading the carriages. Please don't charge ridiculous prices until you do. 

Avoid. Or at least think twice. Especially if you have children.

items.title: No service until Carlisle
items.review_text: Boarded the train to get the ubiquitous excuse of a late train meaning there were no catering facilities on board. Annoying but food and drinks did arrive after Penrith. The roll needed a bit more time to defrost. The staff were very nice and friendly. That's  why I'm  giving 3 stars instead of 2.

items.title: As a fequent 1st class traveller to…
items.review_text: As a fequent 1st class traveller to London sadly the new Avanti service is poorer than the previous train company (Virgin)  less food choices, awful bad tasting tea (noticed by several other passengers). Dismissive catering staff member (not English).  I am doubtful things not improve under Avanti or maybe even get worse - a very disappointing first journey under the flagship of 'Avanti' trains.

items.title: Travelled first class from Euston to…
items.review_text:
Travelled first class from Euston to New St yesterday.

This is an awful train service. Quite a national disgrace. Rude, miserable staff who have no pride in their work. Dirty compartments. The food? Third world standard. Tried a cheese and pastrami bap. Inedible. I would not throw it in the pig bin!

Does anyone from Avanti read these reviews? Very much doubt it. Never thought I would say this but return the franchise to Virgin Rail...quickly. Failing this, sack those who decided that Avanti could deliver a decent service.

items.title: Dreadful customer service!
items.review_text: First time using Avanti first class since they took over from Virgin. Started off badly in the lounge where no hot drinks were available for reasons unknown. Oh well, I took a cookie and decided I would have it with a tea on the journey home after a 2 hour journey to get to Euston. Train staff then announced abruptly that there would be no hot drinks in first class today due to staffing levels. Train staff with resting betch faces then rush through asking abruptly "Cold drink?" (Not "would you like a cold drink?" etc). Decided on a glass of wine and - as I couldn't have the tea I wanted yet again - I asked if I could have a second wine in the spare glass on the table next to me. "Not til we've served everyone else sorry" was the reply and she then took the spare glass away! I can't bare customer service that makes you feel like you're an inconvenience to the people providing it. This has totally gone downhill since Avanti took over. Glad I'm not the only one to notice this!

items.title: Even worse than virgin trains.
items.review_text: I didn't think it was possible to be worse than Virgin. I was clearly wrong. The prices are now ridiculous with barely any worthwhile discounts even if you try to book weeks and weeks in advance. As standard class was so expensive, it wasn't much more to pay for first class, so I thought I'd treat myself. I shouldn't have bothered. They had no hot or running water, no ice, no hot food available and they ran out of sandwiches and cold options by the time they reached my table as I was sat so far from the kitchen. And it's often now £60 - £100 cheaper to fly to London during peak times than it is to get the train from Manchester. That is a ridiculous state of affairs.

items.title: Great Experience and lovely food and drinks
items.review_text: Just travelled on the Avanti Train service from Wolverhampton to Euston and I was very impressed - we booked the tickets early and travelled 1st class at 5.24am (£77 return)    . The train was very clean, it ran on time and the cooked breakfast and several coffees were all very nice - I especially enjoyed a glass of Sparkling Wenlock Spring Water with ice and a slice along with a superb sandwich on the return journey. Well done Avanti, see you next month!

items.title: Terrible.
items.review_text:
Delayed service from Edinburgh to Crewe in January, driver taken Ill which is understandable! Whilst at Lancaster train manager asks if there are any off duty train drivers travelling on board and that we would be untitled to delayed refund because it was over 30mins...when I applied on avanti website the case came back unsuccessful?! How?!? even the avanti train manager said to do it.

Joke of a company.

items.title: Not a great experience
items.review_text:
Not a great experience. Booking requests ignored making for a really inconvenient journey to london. I requested forward facing travel with a plug and table. I got no table no plug and I am travelling backwards. 

Should have drove - waste of £209.

items.title: Streaky bacon rolls at 7 a.m
items.review_text: Streaky bacon rolls at 7 a.m. Today almost inedible. Train from Preston to Glasgow. £3.60 per roll absolute rip-off.

items.title: first class - literally
items.review_text:
Within 2 minutes of boarding there was freshly brewed tea and coffee served piping hot. Shortly behind that came fresh orange juice and then a choice of croissants or toast.

I ordered the “full English” which was a perfect size and really tasty.

Pleasant crew, comfortable and clean carriage and all round very impressed.

items.title: Avanti West Coast First Class - Appalling!
items.review_text: I travelled 1st class return from Preston to London, on the return journey there was no hot food or drink despite my ticket costing £315 off peak! I was offered a pack of crisps and a chocolate bar by a surly member of staff. I sent a written complaint - their response 'sorry'! also 'food in first class is 'complimentary' and if they are short of staff tough'! If you are considering using this service I suggest you think very carefully about alternatives.

items.title: It didn’t take long for the Service to decline
items.review_text:
Well it didn’t take very long for standards to slip from what was an very good service run by Virgin Trains.  As a frequent traveller on the west coast route it’s apparent to see the decline in; the quality of service, cleanliness and first class service/lounges. Not to mention the amount of delays now! and all for the same price...

A lot needs to be done to bring it back up to Virgin Standards! 

Advanti more like Indietro.

items.title: I travelled 1st class from Liverpool to…
items.review_text:
I travelled 1st class from Liverpool to Euston and return using my senior rail card. The service in both directions was equal to Virgin in all areas. Trains were on time and the service, food and drink was to a good standard. I had a humorous conversation with staff and enjoyed the journey which was totally stress free.

I wonder if the negative comments are unique to particular routes.

I will be travelling with Avanti in future.

items.title: Staff just can't be bothered
items.review_text: Staff just can't be bothered. Service is poor and they are unfriendly. Too busy chatting amongst themselves to acknowledge the customer - I hate that. Talk about your private life at home. A smile would not go amiss. Like you might just care.

items.title: Not as good as Virgin
items.review_text: I had great hopes for Avanti West Coast. The staff seem happy enough...until the honeymoon period is over I’m thinking. The service isn’t as good as Virgin. There’s no real attention to detail. I’ve had two trains delayed since January 1st. Not great, I understand these things happen. I claimed for one 25% refund and Avanti argued and argued and argued a third time, refusing a refund because according to them the train arrived 14 minutes late even though the station clock read otherwise. They are intransigent, not customer friendly and I really wish Virgin could get the franchise back after being stitched up to lose it. I’m not alone in my dislike of the new company. They need to do a Hell of a lot more to win the commuters round...and you know, I don’t think they care. If there was another way to get to London from Manchester by train, I’d use it.

items.title: Very Disappointing Start
items.review_text:
I've been travelling first class from the North West to London on the West Coast mainline for many years. For the past few years Virgin were generally doing a decent enough job of running the service.
Last week I went to book as usual and found that various useful options which used to exist were no longer available on the website. In particular the possibility of choosing individual seats. The default preferences – direction of travel, window etc were still there but the ability to specifically change the suggestions on the website and choose a particular seat from a diagram had gone.
I called the number provided to help with bookings and was told that it wasn't possible and the call centre employee was absolutely wrongly adamant that it had never been possible, wouldn't be possible and that no train firm in England had ever offered such a feature. Since it's something I had been using myself regularly for some years I knew she was completely wrong and totally ill informed but clearly pointless discussion to pursue so I asked for the relevant customer service number.
I called the customer service number listened to various messages pressed the options etc only to end up at a recorded message stating that "we are not accepting phone calls at this time" – 11 AM!
Reduced functionality, hopeless booking assistance and customer services not accepting calls. A very disappointing start.

items.title: Misleading ticket booking information.
items.review_text:
Tried to book a first class trip to London with a seat reservation.
Tried different times but could not book the seat - kept coming back "sit in vacant seat"..... started to think sounds very busy, don't want to stand for two hours .... take a risk and book or just drive down?
Finally booked a standard ticket which allowed seat reservation. Site showed "only 7 left" and "low availability" - really busy??
Boarded train - plenty of (unreserved) seats! 
What is it with Avanti / Trainline? 
Do they want to put passengers off?
Tried to speak to customer services to feedback some of the concern, for their benefit - not a chance, customer service is as difficult to sort as the train tickets - don't answer, options go around constantly, then cut off.

items.title: Appalling service
items.review_text: Travelled from Euston to Wolverhampton on the 1629 on Sunday 26th Jan.  Despite having pre booked seats for our party of 3 the reservation updates had not been fed into the coaches for ANY reservations, not just ours.  The result was just absolute chaos.  Frustrated families with children and elderly couples who had all booked seats were left in an awful position of trying to find their seats and the inevitable confrontations with people who were in seats that were shown as available but were in fact booked.  No train staff were on hand to help and in fact we saw none for the whole journey.  Utterly appalling state of affairs altogether.  This was a good lesson in how to really upset your customers and how to aggravate that situation by not being on hand to sort it out when it went wrong.  Shameful, utterly shameful service!

items.title: Another substandard rail company
items.review_text:
First class service is like standard class when virgin run the line.

This company should not be allowed to run trains, another incompetent train company, who will shaft customers by any means.

I only ever travel first class on occasions and when it is affordable. Having a cheap sandwich is not my idea of first class food. 

The lounge at Euston was busy, not really such a big deal, but the place was filthy, tables sticky and nobody cleaned the tables within an hour and half of arriving. 

I genuinely hope Avanti read these messages and listen to there customers rather than be so money driven and greedy.

items.title: I'd give them 0 stars if I could
items.review_text:
I'd give them 0 stars if I could. Got on their 11.23am train yesterday from Rugby to Euston with 2 all day off peak return bought the day before from trainline.com. Turns out they don't accept tickets from trainline. Got threatened by their staff with police action until I paid 92 QUID. Not allowed off the train either. That's a lot of money to a person holding what they genuinely believe is a valid ticket.

Massive scam. I hope bad things happen to the shareholders.

items.title: Avanti.. No Idea how to run a train service or provide service to 1st class Passengers
items.review_text:
Avanti have distroyed what was a reasonble Virgin West Coast service...I travel 1st class twice a week to and from Euston (and onto Heathrow) and to date I have had one train arrive on time. The food and service is terrible, I have been lucky to get 1 cup of tea in 1hr and 20mins...fresh fruit salad (which I take for breakfast)  is 99% Pineapple and Kiwi Fruit, 1 or 2 blueberries and sprinkle of pomegranate, 1 spoon of yoghurt. I dont want my yoghurt on my fruit salad I want it with the honey separate. Atleast virgin gave you a pot of yoghurt. And many of the journeys I have been faced with just a bacon roll that I have refused. The beam content hasnt changed since they took over...I am questioning why I buy a 1st class ticket, I could save the difference and buy myself someting reasonable.
Some of the staff who serve the food are unkempt and shabby and serving OJ from cans and exected to drink from the can, no cups is unhygenic, the service is thrown at you..so I guess the staff can sit down for the rest of the journey.  For the late trains I have tried the claim/repay service, having to register ANOTHER account to do so that isnt connected to the one I use for booking and the form asks for info not useful in a claim and is long (intentionally I suspect)...train manager says train is 27mins late...repay claim says rejected as their info says 12 mins late... I could go on and on its that bad...save your money and take the west midlands trains with Avanti constant late arrivals it takes the same time :)
Strikes me their strategy is to charge more and give less to pay for their promises, which I certainly have seen no evidence of...
Avanti get your house in order or give the franchise to someone who knows what they are doing as you clearly dont!

items.title: Quiet Carriage for 1st Class
items.review_text:
Same Trains, Same Staff, decent enough service in First Class as always. 
They need to reintroduce a 'Quiet Carriage' in 1st Class where people with mobiles don't make fake business calls the whole journey. 
Apart from that, business as usual.

items.title: Travelled 1st class Glasgow Central to…
items.review_text: Travelled 1st class Glasgow Central to London Euston on 22nd January - train left spot on time and arrived spot on time - staff were brilliant - plenty to eat and drink - coaches and toilets clean and tidy - all for £68 - I usually drive but will use Avanti more if this level of service continues - well done!

items.title: in decline
items.review_text: I didn’t think it would be possible for the Virgin West Coast service to decline further but Avanti are proving me wrong. Cleanliness, price, seat section and Wi-fi are just four areas that are lacking and that’s before we talk about the awful menu in first class that they sell you for in excess of £300 from Macclesfield to London. The response I got from the customer service team was also very disappointing, they need to raise their game and quick!

items.title: Late running unlike Virgin
items.review_text: So far I have taken Avanti 3x from London to Stockport and it had been late every time causing me to miss my connection. This never happened with Virgin.... coincidence?

items.title: Terrible, terrible delays.
items.review_text: Absolutely terrible timing. I am writing this review as I have once again had my train be delayed. Unfortunately I do not get a choice of which trains I can use as there is only one train line running. Never have I ever been on a train that hadn’t been delayed by some absurd amount of time, pretty much every time. AWC is an absolute joke with their train schedules and they should consider putting the times on their train tickets about 20-40minutes later as that would be more accurate.

items.title: Using Avanti? Look out, they tell lies!
items.review_text:
I am travelling on an Avanti Train from Preston to Edinburgh Waverley tomorrow, I have booked First Class and read that LNER have a First Class Lounge at Waverley. I contacted Avanti via Live Chat as you cannot Ring them at all, which is absolute rubbish in itself. I asked the guy if I can use the Lounge, he asked what type of Ticket it was so I told him it is "First Class Advance" he then said I have access to the Lounge for an Hour! 
From experience I thought I'd be best to Contact LNER as it is their Lounge after all, I found a number and got to speak to an actual person!! He was very helpful and told me that actually what Avanti told me was a complete lie and the Lounge is only available for LNER ticket holders and I cannot access it at all. He also told me that a number of Avanti Customers have been told the same but they didn't check like me, they got to the Lounge and were thrown out! 
It's infuriated me that Avanti are lying through their teeth and putting customers in awkward situations in the already stressful time of travelling! 
Disgusting from them and no surprise they have such a bad rating after such a small amount of time!

items.title: Having read the very bad reviews on…
items.review_text: Having read the very bad reviews on Avanti West Coast trains, I am very pleased to say that we travelled Stafford to Euston in first class. in both directions on the 21st Jan and the 22nd Jan and in both cases the train was on time, the carriages clean, staff pleasant, and food as good as you can expect on a train journey, all in all a very pleasant and effecient service. Well done Avasnti.

items.title: Was travelling home from London with my…
items.review_text: Was travelling home from London with my partner between the Christmas period and my booking had not sent me a confirmation. I explained to the customer service at Euston Station, I was spoken down to, no advice given and was humiliated in front of the rest of the staff. The other staff were shaking their head at the conduct of the supposed manager. I have raised a compliant and feel like I have been given a generic email response after waiting 3 weeks. I am actually disgusted with the level of customer service at the front end and now with the complaints team, to the point I have business in London next weekend I am driving.

items.title: After taking over I can honestly say how poor
items.review_text:
After taking over I can honestly say that the Avnati first class menu is of poor quality lots of cheese rolls and cheese toastie. Or Bacon roll or a beef burger this is 2020 people I can get better at Greggs 


The lovely Vegan food seem have disappeared but you can have soup or fresh fruit perfectly tasty I am sure

items.title: Terrible service in 1st, don't bother
items.review_text: Paid for 1st class in order to use WiFi to join conference calls but it's only good for sending emails! Couldn't join Skype calls. Got missed out by the food trolley so had to find the service lady who offered no compensation for the fact they'd run out of the things I wanted and no alcohol is served! Don't bother with 1st class, it's not worth it.

items.title: Rent a car if you're visiting UK!
items.review_text: Well getting to the destination safely and on time. Yes they did that...but failed absolutely every other dept. What a nightmare, I'd rather be on a bus.

items.title: Inconsistant pricing
items.review_text: When searching for train times that suited me, I was quoted £58 for a ticket, after having went away from the website and back a few times the price went up to about £70.  I opened up an incognito browser window and was able to book it for £58!

items.title: First class return liverpool to london
items.review_text: First class return liverpool to london, heard a lot of bad reports on social media about the new train operator Avanti. But rest assured no issues what so ever, coffee was tasty and hot got a soup and a role was again good quality plus orange juice topped up several times. Staff were friendly, toilets were clean so a good return journey well worth the money spent.

items.title: Couldn’t give a damn!!
items.review_text:
Simply couldn’t give a damn!!
Is it me or have Avanti ruined the West Coast Mainline.. Zero customer service, no concept of loyalty, simply another money grabbing train firm that accidentally won a contract & have no clue what the hell they’re doing..
For the first time in 4 years I lost a train ticket, clearly had the booking evidence & use this train four times a week minimum to the tune of tens of thousands (£) a year.  Would they replace the ticket, hell no.. Lady simply couldn’t give a damn & seemed quite pleased with herself that I’d have to pay almost £100 for a replacement!! Fuming!!

items.title: Far worse than Virgin
items.review_text:
Far worse than Virgin

I had some rum journeys (and high train fares) on Virgin, but this is as nothing to Avanti West Cost (sic). Have they snuck on even more First Class carriages, and reduced standard class? Looks like it. The train was nearly an hour late getting to London; on the way back in the evening (7pm onwards off-peak!!) it kept stopping and slowing mysteriously between stations (not signals). I'm retiring, and grateful that I won't have to make the journey down to London too much in the future. Added to that the trains seem even sadder than when they belonged to Virgin.
