I didn't even dare use the shop. For the first time ever I've claimed compensation - in the past I couldn't be bothered.

Come back Virgin!

items.title: Poor service! Bring Virgin Trains back!!!
items.review_text:
So appalled with the service being offered between Birmingham and London.

When i chose seat preferences on Virgin i always got my preferred choice. Now it seems Avanti just ask this information for the sake of asking. I requested a forward facing table seat so i could work and they gave me a backward facing window seat without the table. Luckily the table nearby was unreserved so i sat there instead.

The lack of flexibility on train tickets - you either book a £184 Anytime Return or you are bound to specified trains. Virgin offered the opportunity to travel on various trains within the peak trains time window.

Finally, the service from the personnel overall is extremely poor.

Avanti now make my weekly work journey to London very frustrating.

items.title: Price of tickets in First Class…
items.review_text: Price of tickets in First Class deplorable, over £600 for the wife and I to travel from Euston to Oxenholme ,and thats with our Senior Railcards taken into account, who do Avanti think we are, DISGUSTING.

items.title: First Class Rip Off - what are you up to Avanti?
items.review_text:
What has happened to this service since Avanti took over? 
I've been travelling from London to Manchester for over 20 years for work and never had a problem with VT. 
First Class is now a rip off joke - there is no FC service any more.
The trains are dirty with mess left on the tables, glasses are grubby and that's if you can find one, the loos are filthy, the staff have been changed for the worse, their customer service is simply appalling. 
A truly dreadful experience since this company took over, and note that I travel twice a week and have done so for 20 odd years. 
They've only been going a month and I hate them already.
I'm going to start driving as I can't give this shower another penny.
I wish I could give them zero stars

items.title: Bring back Virgin
items.review_text: Travelled twice with AvantiWestCoast first time tickets booked via Virgin this was the train from Edinburgh December 14th 2019!this was Avanti train I was delayed for two hours cannot get any help from either both blaming each other Virgin say claim from Avanti who then email and say it’s virgin I sat in the  first class carriage for two hours during this time double or treble the amount of passengers boarded the train My second journey a delay from another station Avanti have compensated for this trip, ring customer services wait forever then a message to say not taking anymore calls, travelled regularly with Virgin trains hardly ever delayed not happy with Avanti

items.title: What on earth is going on!
items.review_text: What on earth is going on!! Been to London for the weekend and the train journey was bumpy it was like travelling on an bad surfaced road. Will be finding alternative from now on !

items.title: Travelled with Virgin numerous times…
items.review_text: Travelled with Virgin numerous times without issues. Having read all the negative reviews about Avanti West Coast, I was dreading my recent trips from Manchester to London. There was no need to worry and I honestly didn't notice any difference in Standard Class. We could reserve seats for each journey and there wasn't a problem. The trains were on time, carriages were clean and staff were fine. A lot of the seating is looking worn and tired which is the reason for 4 stars and not 5.

items.title: Not that good
items.review_text: First time with Avanti but was disappointed.  One star for train being on time and one star for a warm carriage.  However, coffee dreadful and food less than dreary, standards have definitely slipped.  Other reviews have said first class not worth it.....I agree!!

items.title: Avanti - Demise of the West Coast Line
items.review_text:
Second trip with Avanti - wish it was the last. What a comedown in service after Virgin. Don’t bother with first class at the weekend as it’s waste of money. Lack of staff and a miserable stale croissant on offer for breakfast but  you can buy a hot bacon roll in the shop - another rip off. Wonder which government minister benefited from selecting Avanti as it certainly isn’t the travelling public.
Bring back Virgin

items.title: Terrible Mistake Dropping Virgin - Avanti is Awful
items.review_text:
I travel regularly between Liverpool and London. Never had a problem with Virgin, apart from the odd delay.

The drop in service levels on Avanti is astounding; in just a couple of months they've taken all the joy out of the journey. 

Trains are never fully staffed; those that do work are very mixed, with some making the best of it and others not bothering at all.

First class is pointless. Never any service or food, just a standard announcement directing you to the onboard shop.

Virgin had a 90% approval rating. The DfT should have thought about customers before dropping it.

items.title: Good first experience.
items.review_text: My first journeys with Avanti today and a bit worried given all the negative reviews. I can only speak as I find after using 4 separate trains on my two way trip. All trains were more or less on time, clean and I would say at least as good as Virgin used to be. Very pleased not to have the stupidly annoying messages in the toilet. Just need to ditch the 'see it, say it, sorted' nonsense as well but I know that is national and not just Avanti. Only reason for dropping a star is inability to reserve specific seats but this can still be done by booking through another website like Trainsplit rather than direct with Avanti.

items.title: CHECK YOUR EMAIL FOR TICKETS
items.review_text:
CHECK YOUR EMAIL FOR TICKETS

I needed to travel from crewe to manchester at 7:10am to get to work, and bought an avanti e-ticket. I received the confirmation but no ticket and had to pay ANOTHER £10.60 for another ticket because Avanti failed to send me the ticket i ordered. Then i thought “well alright, ill just ask for a reund” but NO. Avanti said its against policy for me to get a refund because i didn’t chase up the ticket. They say it’s MY fault because THEY failed to send me a ticket and WON’T refund me for the first one i purchased. Glad to say i’m never using Avanti again and the staff on live chat was incredibly unhelpful. I asked him to provide me with a number or anything so i can escalate this issue as they’ve basically stolen £10.60 from me but he kept beating around he bush and saying “every staff member will say the same thing”, horrible service, stick to Virgin folks.

items.title: Improved service ????
items.review_text:
I’ve travelled regularly with Virgin first class Crewe to London , always able to view and choose seats .This is important to me as an elderly person , to be able to get in and out of seats easily and not be stuck in a window seat at a table of 4 unable to stretch my arthritic legs. 
Avanti have removed this choice element and when I questioned if there was the possibility to chose the seat I was sent a generic response about a refund which made it obvious that the “ customer service” member had not read the question.
I’ve now got to hope that the more accessible seats have not been taken up when the train gets in to me but unlikely as Crewe is last stop before London .
So the improved service that was promised when they took over the franchise has fallen at the first hurdle as far as I’m concerned.

items.title: I was travelling a long way from…
items.review_text: I was travelling a long way from Glasgow to London. Had expected a comfortable journey but found the corner seat very uncomfortable and the coat hanger just above the food table. The glass had a bad stink so decided to drink directly from the bottle. I believe the staff were too busy doing something that they never noticed the food plate for 45 min until I asked one of them to clear the table. The response was very poor. On my way back preferred the standard class and missed nothing.

items.title: Travel daily between Stoke on Trent and…
items.review_text:
Travel daily between Stoke on Trent and Manchester and had very few issues with VIRGIN in 18 months before AVANTI took over the West Coast Service.

They took over the de-branded Virgin fleet, staff and timetable so in essence they should have had it ready made for them.

My main issue is seat booking, i pay to go home on this service as opposed to the much cheaper local service because i wanted to travel to choose my seat.

Virgin had seat picker which allowed you to select an actual seat prior to final payment - AVANTI have removed this!

So falling back on the basic seat picker (which direction, aisle or window and which coach) i thought id be OK....NOT SO!!!!

Yes their site does say they can't always accommodate choices but i rarely get my choices (forward, window, quiet coach) and today i thought i would remove some tickets before final purchase as i didn't like them then try and again and YOU GUESSED i got my choices, so why no the first time.

Before this i ignored by booked seat and went into quiet and YOU GUESSED there were available seats, so why was allocated backward, aisle regular coaches.

I did email customer services re seat allocation but got standard, not really interested response.

The seat allocation system was already there, their website is identical to Virgin and even has references to virgin on it still so probably is same website (re-branded) so why take away something that worked!

Thinking AVANTI will ruin the previously good Virgin Service and just expect us to take it.

OH, and they hiked the prices far more than the January 2.7% average so paying more for worse service!

items.title: A massive drop in service from day one.
items.review_text: I travel daily from Rugby to Euston on the 6:32am and back on the 5:03pm two trains on time in the past 5 weeks, delays ranging from between 3-35 mins, same route, same rolling stock, mostly the same staff, how is this possible! Carriages are disgusting also,  No reply to emails and the delay repay system is joke, 3 out of 3 claims declined because I didn't have a ticket for the journey, not sure what a £8340 annual season ticket valid on any route is. Let's hope somebody steps in to sort this mess out or virgin rangle the franchise back.

items.title: Stop paying for 1st class.
items.review_text: Wow! How hard can it be so difficult to just take over somebody else's hard work and keep it going? Dont bother with first class.. rarely have any food or drink. I've been on twice now where they have announced after departure that 1st class service is cancelled... have complained and ask for a reduction in ticket price... still waiting to hear back after a month. It's going to take time for this to get anywhere near back to virgin standard if at all. Well done whoever ... selling out to the cheapest bidder and throwing what's best for the traveller out the window .

items.title: Lucky to get one star
items.review_text: Lucky to get one star. Had family staying over Christmas and booked the train tickets for them as a gift, return travel from Blackpool North to London. Return journey direct service from Euston to Blackpool North on the 27th December at 10:36 was cancelled without any warning or notification.Reserved tickets now useless and advised to board the 10:30 to Glasgow and change at Preston. Two carriages available for those with reservations on the 10:36. Boarded both carriages with parents and unable to even find standing room. Disgraceful treatment of customers many elderly like my travelling parents. Carriages busy than underground rush hour, people standing and sitting on the floor. Decided to cut losses  leave the train and look at alternatives, advised to board the Manchester Piccadilly service, quieter granted and able to find seats then change for the Blackpool North service of course they didn't let on that 70/80% of the Northern connecting trains were cancelled that day. There was a reason I booked the direct service so one senior railcard traveler and one disabled railcard traveler could at least travel in comfort without the worry of several changes. Overall a huge let down and disgraceful treatment of cattle (sorry customers). eventually the 70 year old's made it home albeit closer to the grave than on departure, still recovering. I wouldn't recommend Avanti West Coast as a responsible service option for anybody.

items.title: Booking process a nightmare
items.review_text:
I have not travelled yet with Avanti but just completed a nightmare 1.5hr booking process which usually took 10 mins. 

Numerous issues:

1) Booking process - no longer slick and easy. Website cumbersome and clunky and “server busy” message kept flashing up. 

2) Seat selection - no longer able to choose exact seat online. With Virgin, you were able to “virtually” view a diagram of the carriage and all the seats, highlight a seat and reselect as you wish. Now seat is selected automatically for you after submitting whether you prefer aisle/table/forward facing. 

3) Seat particulars -  on Windows PC there is no option to select “near luggage rack” which is an important factor for a disabled person. So instead I downloaded the Avanti app on my iPhone where there was the “near luggage rack” option, but unfortunately you could only select e ticket type using the app! This is useless if you’re booking for your elderly disabled relative who needs a paper ticket!! 

4) Train Journey time increased - most importantly fault - I was shocked that the duration of the journey from Glasgow-Warrington has lengthened. Usually the journey took 2hrs 39 mins or 2hrs 48 mins with Virgin however now the journey can last up to 3hrs 15 minutes calling at stops that Virgin did not. 

5) Less Trains - as a consequence of journeys taking longer, there are less trains to choose from and this less ticket choice. 

6) Ridiculous ticket options - Glasgow to Warrington is a direct train so why would I step off train in Carlisle, wait on platform for 15 mins then take the next Avanti train to Glasgow! 

7) Ticket removed from basket - I had a return ticket in my online basket (it was last one of this type) and I was in payment details when it suddenly said it couldn’t process payment as there was no ticket in the basket. When I searched again, the ticket was completely gone so obviously, even although the ticket was in my basket, it was not reserved for a period of time.

items.title: A recent journey from Edinburgh
items.review_text: I recently travelled with Avanti first class from Edinburgh.  The service was excellent from start to finish.  I enjoyed my cooked breakfast and I must say the general cleanliness has improved.  I have moaned enough in the past about this service, so it's important to acknowledge that things appear to be improving.

items.title: Great journey on 1st class carriages
items.review_text:
My journeys, December 29th, from EUS to Nuneaton, and also Birmingham New Street to EUS were both on time.
Polite and friendly staff. I was asleep when trolley came, but the staff came back again later and kindly asked me about food and drinks.
No problem with menu, food and drinks.
First class lounge in EUS was very clean and comfy.

items.title: 1st class Avanti west coast
items.review_text:
Don’t travel 1st class .service has gone down since being taken over from Virgin.
Rubbish customer service.

items.title: Filthy trains, no coffee
items.review_text: Travelled from London to Glasgow return for New Year. The early morning train to Glasgow had no coffee. Both trains were absolutely filthy, food all over the floor, crumbs on seats and tables. I'm sure this is where I caught the gastro entiritis bug I'm now recovering from.

items.title: Superb customer service
items.review_text:
I attempted to do a day trip from MK to Stirling to surprise my daughter on her birthday.  Unfortunately due to late arrival into Glasgow and all trains between Glasgow and Stirling being cancelled I only made it as far as Glasgow.  Thus was due to high winds and floods.
Avanti staff member was really friendly and helpful to me. He sorted out a return train for me for which I was really grateful. I was feeling pretty down as had just done a 5 an half hour journey without seeing my daughter and had the same to return.  A day trip probably wasn't the best of ideas but a big thank you to Avanti for their help and understanding.

items.title: First class is not a patch on when it…
items.review_text: First class is not a patch on when it was Virgin. In fact there’s little point in the upgrade to be honest. All show and no go. Bring back Virgin Trains.

items.title: Since Virgin poor service (no food 1st…
items.review_text: Since Virgin poor service (no food 1st class on several occasions), Customer Services slow to respond, you can no longer move an Advance e-ticket (could with Virgin), delay rolling out Traveller programme (without any stopgap of accepting Virgin cards)...... Need I say more. Given most Virgin staff would have transferred across what is going wrong. Bring back Virgin!!

items.title: Train Late, Terrible Claims Process & Bad Customer Service
items.review_text:
Travelled Northampton to Preston with connection at Rugby. Boarded Avanti service that was on time at Rugby. Arrived Preston 20 mins Late. Avanti refused delay repay claim blaming it on London West Midlands Trains!!!
Claim rejected, appeal rejected, rejected in live chat and told to resubmit.
How on earth did this company got to take over from Virgin Trains with this appalling service!

items.title: Appalling!!!
items.review_text:
Appalling!!!
Price rise from £11 to 26.50 thats a near 150% increase in price on a train from glasgow to hellifield.
Been catching 6.30 train for years and now all of a sudden its  gone up more than double
And all overnight!
How dare u take advantage of the public like this!!!

items.title: Rubbish replacement for Virgin Trains
items.review_text:
Rubbish.  Should never have been awarded the West Coast Mainline franchise.  Things went downhill on day one when the new website removed the ability to select a specific seat.  Hundreds of people are complaining on Twitter, but all they say (after more than a month) is “we are looking into reintroducing the seat picker”.

Bring back @VirginTrains - they were 100 times better than Avanti West Coast, a name used to conceal the appalling @FirstGroup who also run the appalling Great Western franchise.

items.title: Shocking refund process
items.review_text: Shocking refund process.  My train from London Euston to Liverpool Lime Street was delayed over an hour.  We were told that we would be entitled to a full refund.  Avanti’s refund system is ridiculously over engineered in comparison to Virgin.  I thought I had provided all the correct information but was then told that my claim had been declined because some details were missing.   However Avanti didn’t explain what was missing.  It just seems they have over complicated the process to deter passengers from claiming.  Shame on you Avanti.  Bring back Virgin who were much more customer friendly!

items.title: Rip off train line Avanti
items.review_text: There are literally no cheap fares on the website - maybe one per week. I tried to book 2 months in advance North Wales to Euston thinking I could get some cheap fares as per Virgin.....no I'm afraid not.... £100 return £200 for 2 of us return - I may as well drive - its cheaper. These rip off train operators are driving us off the trains with their costs and onto the road - so much for global warming - bring back Virgin - they were half the price and great. Richard Branson please come back....

items.title: Bring back Virgin
items.review_text: Bring back Virgin. 20% price increase for a ticket Manchester - Macclesfield and the trains are dirty. What a joke !!!

items.title: Superb train manager
items.review_text:
Travelled from Manchester to Watford Junction on 5th January. The 8.01 train was massively delayed through no fault of AvantiWestCoast. The train manager was beyond excellent. Clear, helpful friendly and really keen to make our delayed journey as comfortable as possible. Kept the passengers fully informed as we sat in a delay at Stafford for nearly an hour and a quarter. 
Passengers prefer to be kept updated and this was done regularly, even to the extent that the driver gave us a briefing.
Well done AvantiWestCoast !

items.title: Wowzers this is rubbish!!! :(
items.review_text: I've been dreading the change from Virgin to Avanti as I've been a regular train traveller London-Birmingham for many many years & Virgin had great prices for off-peak travel etc. Now, the tickets cost about 2 thirds more than they used to & no option to choose off-peak return on many of the 1hr 20min trains after 0930 & also no details on website of off-peak/super off peak times to & from London (Virgin had very clear ticket pricing).  It's such a shame Virgin contract didn't get renewed. Doubtful I'll use Avanti trains any more as it's a rip off! I'd rather get the National Express coach.

items.title: Awful Avanti!!!
items.review_text: We regularly travel from Euston to Liverpool. We can’t believe the increase in  price of 1st Class tickets. It’s cheaper to fly to Spain! There were also no refreshments on our last journey. Like other users we thought we’d booked 1st class only to find they were standard class sand so paid £25 each for an upgrade!! Who did award the franchise to Avanti? Atrocious decision! I just wish there was a flight to Liverpool and we’d ditch this train service.

items.title: Poor standards overall but especially the staff
items.review_text:
I have travelled in first class on the Euston to Holyhead route for years. The change to Avanti is very disappointing. 
The first class carriages are dark and dingy and there are fewer single seats. The lavatories smell.  
The biggest change is the staff. Virgin staff were polite, chatty, friendly and helpful.
 The Avanti staff grudgingly dish out coffee without a word other than ‘coffee?’  
I had scrambled eggs and smoked salmon for breakfast. When I asked for some toast,I was told ‘no toast on this service’. Somewhat flummoxed to be served just the eggs I finally extracted the fact that there was a dry bread roll. Further questioning elicited the fact that there was also butter. 
Send this sorry lot on a hospitality training course immediately!

items.title: Very poor service and ignorant staff
items.review_text: Very poor service and ignorant staff. They bed a course in customer service training.  Virgin were light years ahead.

items.title: Bring back Virgin
items.review_text: Bring back Virgin. Have been travelling between Birmingham and London for years with reasonable service in first class. AvantiWestCoast in comparison is shockingly bad...which clown awarded them this contract???!!!

items.title: Tried to book tickets to london
items.review_text: Tried to book tickets to london. Prices have increased majorly since avanti took over alongside an impossible array of tickets, no idea what I needed to book. In the end had to give up and have decided never to go to London again by train while this company has the franchise. Missing virgin !! Went to london a couple of times a year,  not now by the looks of avanti's high prices !! ABSOLUTE RUBBISH, BRiNG BACK VIRGIN PLEASE

items.title: bring back virgin trains very poor…
items.review_text: bring back virgin trains very poor service

items.title: Dirty hot train never book with them…
items.review_text: Dirty hot train never book with them again. What's the point of offering 1st class without anything for it?

items.title: OAP spends 5 hours freezing in first class
items.review_text: 5 hours on a train to Edinburgh, no heating in first class. couldnt move as train was packed. complained several times nothing happened. Wrote to the complaints team whose reply was for future journeys speak to a member of staff who will adjust the heating or move you to another seat......DID THEY NOT READ MY COMPLAINT !!!!!!! what a shambles....Bring back Virgin

items.title: Who on earth awarded this lot the Franchise
items.review_text:
Who on earth awarded this lot the Franchise
I have travelled very regularly with Virgin on the London to Liverpool route, since they were awarded the Franchise years ago.  It was without exception a pleasure, booking the tickets was fast and uncomplicated , contacting their customer service straightforward, clean carriages and toilets, the 1st Class Lounges were operated efficiently, In fact I looked forward to my train journeys.  Whereas Avanti are already proving to be incompetent. For the first time ever my recent journey was delayed for over 60 mins, and despite completing  the required forms I'm told I'm not entitled to delay repay.  I've been unable to make contact with them despite using a variety of methods. The phones are constantly engaged. The booking system wasn't working. The app. doesn't work.  The web site is shabby. For passengers to loose the services of a company like Virgin and to now have this shambles imposed on us, when there is so much already wrong with our transport system, is criminally inept.

items.title: Disgusting furnace
items.review_text: This train was dangerously hot for my baby. We had 3.5 hours of hell. After stripping her off to her vest we sat on the filthy floors by the doors just to get a tiny bit of cool air. These trains are a health hazard. We also had to change her on the floor as there werent any baby changes. Terrible, disgusting trains. I feel robbed.

items.title: Unhappy 1st class traveller with Avanti
items.review_text:
Travelled 1st class from Euston to Glasgow before xmas. What an absolute disgrace to charge passengers a first class fare for third class standards. Dirty, shabby carriage, you could smell the toilet before you saw it. The staff delivering the drinks and food were miserable and unhelpful. There was no vegetarian option either...awful. 
How can Avanti justify the prices charged? 
Loved travelling with Virgin....the staff were amazing and a pleasure travelling with them. Virgin is sorely missed.

items.title: Travelled 1st class from Milton Keynes…
items.review_text: Travelled 1st class from Milton Keynes to Liverpool. No refreshments servered yet passengers from Euston were already eating when we joined train. No sign of staff anywhere to request something. Have travelled for years with Virgin with great service this company are appalling.

items.title: Absolute shambles
items.review_text: Absolute shambles. Extremely rude staff at Stoke station more intent on shouting over you rather than listening and trying to help. Physically removed from a train despite offering to show a valid ticket, confirmation of payment and even the seat I had booked. Train disgusting, looked like it hadn’t been cleaned for a week. Bring back Virgin.

items.title: Simply disgusting
items.review_text:
The trains were overheated and disgustingly unclean, which made me feel uncomfortable and physically sick for both journeys. 

 This was clearly not a case of the cleaning team happening to be unable to complete a turn-around between my journey and the one previous. The carriages smelled of sewage and had clearly not been properly cleaned for weeks, not just days. The floors, windows, seats, toilets were filthy and covered in food, grease and loose dirt. My folding tray at my seat had various spilled food and drink on it. The lights above my seat failed to work. The hand drier in the toilet failed to work. On my return journey the seating information for reservations throughout the train was out-of-order which caused discomfort and confusion for all of the passengers. 

This was a appalling service. At a ticket cost of £147 which was booked 4 months in advance, I expect better standards. Basic cleanliness and functioning facilities should not be for First Class passengers only.

items.title: Could do better!!!
items.review_text: Have booked through Virgin Trains for many years without problem.  I gave up on Avanti site after hours of failure and booked through Trainline even though I had to reluctantly pay a booking fee.  The trains I normally travel on have 11 coaches but strangely, all my December journeys have been crammed, 9 coaches.   Could do better Avanti, 1 out of 10 so far!!!

items.title: Like a cattle truck
items.review_text: I've been travelling on the North Wales to London Euston route for 12 years with Virgin Trains and always been perfectly happy with my experience. Avanti West Coast take over and never have I experienced anything as bad as what I expencied last week. Only a 5 car train, all the way from Holyhead (where the ferries to/from Dublin arrive), completely jam packed, no seat reservations, and barely even space to breathe. I had to stand up the entire 3 hour journey, crammed in an aisle outside a stinking toilet, no air conditioning and the heating blasting away. Possibly the worst and most unpleasant experience I have ever had on a train...anywhere in the world. From my experience I can only imagine what being on a cattle truck is like. I emailed Avanti to complain (as I can't believe I even had to pay for the 'priviledge' of being on this train) and no response whatsoever. I'm very disappointed at both Avanti's complete disregard for its customers, and the British Government for allowing them to win the bid for the West Coast mainline - bring back Virgin!

items.title: I agree with all these previous…
items.review_text: I agree with all these previous reviews. Travelled 1st class. Avanti should be ashamed of the service it is providing. It was abysmal. Will not travel 1st class with this company again.

items.title: Well I was a frequent traveller with…
items.review_text:
Well I was a frequent traveller with Virgin and I always used their website to book.  I have just tried to make a booking with Avanti West Coast.  No longer able to pick my own seat so I looked at the website that suggested I email seat seat.reservations.  The email was rejected!  I tried to contact via chat but gave up after 10 minutes.

There is NO competition on this route Stockport to Euston.  I hope this can only get better.

items.title: Bring back Virgin
items.review_text: I’d give zero stars if possible! what’s the point in booking seats then making them available to everyone else. defeats the purpose! shop not open as under staffed. people made to stand from preston to london. Bring back Virgin

items.title: Worse than Virgin
items.review_text: Disappointing service from Avanti on the West Coast line: power points at seats not working on one leg of the journey; cash payments only at the onboard shop because of a technical fault; wifi is slower than your phone's connection or doesn't work at all; food in First Class is notably bad

items.title: Understaffed, poor service
items.review_text:
Understaffed, no information, on stations or on board, seat reservations not done or enforced, trying to skin passengers who were directed to this service with fines.

A horrible profiteering company, I hope they lose every penny.

items.title: Crap service even there own staff no…
items.review_text: Crap service even there own staff no clue on this company... New company took ova from virgin but still same management.. Still unless customer service. Every train delayed what a joke.. Refund plz cause ya trains never run on time... What a joke...

items.title: A joke!
items.review_text:
When booking a journey from Liverpool to Euston - a three and a half hour trip -  it should be made clear that some trains without wifi, plugs food options even a tray seat etc i.e crappy local trains.
Was also kicked off halfway through journey at Birmingham as there weren’t any train staff waiting at Birmingham to complete the journey!!!??

items.title: Preston to Euston return in 1st class
items.review_text: Preston to Euston return in 1st class.  Train filthy dirty but trolley service at table ok.  On the return leg, just given a dry turkey curry sandwich and no free booze coz there is no table service until 2 Jan although this was not advertised.   Now, toilets blocked.  Worse than travelling cattle class.  Virgin was much better than this.

items.title: My first journey was over an hour late …
items.review_text:
My first journey was over an hour late  and they have refused to refund me. There is nobody to speak to. They dont answer the phone. They don't reply to emails.
I now have to wait weeks and go through the rail ombudsman.
Complete and utter garbage,

items.title: Absolutely useless
items.review_text:
Absolutely useless. 

The booking process is terrible, customer service non existent, and services constantly delayed.

items.title: First time I have travelled with Avanti…
items.review_text: First time I have travelled with Avanti since Virgin lost the franchise to them and it is a terrible service. The booking is as complicated as you can make it, the trains dirty and late. How on earth can they have won the franchise. I travelled many times over many years with Virgin and never ever complained.  You need to raise your game Avanti to be worthy of offering the same service and standards as Virgin !

items.title: I’d give no stars if possible
items.review_text: I’d give no stars if possible! Travelling first class to Glasgow. The train is dirty, no cups or plates, not offered any breakfast from the extensive menu advertised- just given a sausage or bacon roll wrapped in paper with a plastic cup for coffee. Not what I expect from first class, come on Avanti, get your act together, this is appalling service which you are charging top money for! Come back Virgin, you knew how to treat customers.....

items.title: Booking a seat meant nothing and so…
items.review_text: Booking a seat meant nothing and so many tickets were sold many people were left standing on the platform after the train left.

items.title: Absymal service from both the operator…
items.review_text:
Absymal service from both the operator and staff.

Bring back Virgin!

items.title: Awful service and awful staff
items.review_text: Awful service and awful staff, so unpleasant and rude. Paid for first class and cannot believe the incompetence and behaviour of the staff.

items.title: Train ran 30 minutes late
items.review_text:
Train ran 30 minutes late, and they ran out of food in first class basically after the first carriage - no apologies or any attempt to find a solution for it. Massively inferior to the Virgin service.

Everything good about the service - e.g. trains, WiFi, entertainment service - they inherited from Virgin.

items.title: Avoid if possible
items.review_text:
Late train.
Went first class and for the price I paid I would have expected it to be clean, it was dirty, no customer service and false advertising. 
Wrote to customer services and they can't even be bothered to respond.

items.title: Backwards Ticketing System
items.review_text: Just booked tickets to find that 1) I couldn't choose my seat and have to stick with the allocation they gave me, whereas Virgin let you change the seat, and 2) I have to get a paper ticket from a machine, whereas with Virgin I just used the code on the app so didn't have to worry about carrying a ticket. Avanti West Coast have gone backwards and I've not even tried a train, yet.

items.title: Awful
items.review_text: Couldnt book a seat online so ended up having to move seats twice in my journey. Packed train, had heating blasting making it very uncomfortable journey. A few other people in the coach alongside me made requests for the heating to be turned down but nope.

items.title: Dirty train no service in first class…
items.review_text: Dirty train no service in first class no food or drinks not even a glass , this is not first class bring back virgin

items.title: If you thought virgin west coast were…
items.review_text: If you thought virgin west coast were bad, these people take bad to a new level! Given a monopoly you CANNOT book a seat! I am travelling with a baby with no seat, and with Cross country part of the monopoly you also can't book a seat. As a new monopoly they don't care!

items.title: Worst Train Company and Extremely Overpriced
items.review_text:
Had my first experience travelling from Liverpool to London. I had an issue with my railcard, and they wanted me to pay the difference which was fair enough until they quoted me the sum of £88. A one-way train journey for £88.

So I refused and decided to get a cheaper journey, but due to time constraints, I decided to suck it up and go back and pay the fee, but their machine was not working. In front of me was a lady; also a student from the looks of it, who had the same issue and they let her go through with a warning. When it came to me, they were adamant about getting the ticket machine working until the last minute before the train departed. They couldn't manage so they escorted me to the train and informed the train manager to make me pay the difference.

This unfair, biased and discriminatory treatment based on gender (or race?) is unacceptable. Treat everyone the same.

There was also no onboard shop to get anything or services for anyone who doesn't hold a first-class ticket. I travelled on many trains across the country, and this is by far the most expensive and worst experience I have ever had.

items.title: Not good
items.review_text: Not good - no hot food or drinks due to H&S - at least say what that means, or are you embarrassed. Wooden knife ridiculous and everything mega packaged and impossible to open. Staff couldn’t either. Train late. Virgin made you feel better. Avanti needs to think quickly.

items.title: Delayed by 20 mins
items.review_text: Delayed by 20 mins. No apology, no update on delay, nothing.. Just it seems normal for TrainItalia and Avanti to be late ...

items.title: Currently on the train from Liverpool… Poor Customer Service
items.review_text:
Currently on the train from Liverpool to London. Apparently purchasing a ticket does not guarantee you a seat on the train! 
Also they do not have any coffee unless of course you are a first class passenger. You can purchase a coffee but only if you upgrade to yes you’ve got it ..... first class at a charge. 
Why is it our Customer Service is still so poor in Britain.  Why not allow customers to purchase a coffee from first class if the machine is broken, or at the very least purchase a jar of instant coffee as a backup. Poor planning at its worst! 
Britain’s customer service at it’s best .. unfortunately!

items.title: Same as virgin late train and no card…
items.review_text: Same as virgin late train and no card payments or reservations working on board
